Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Winemaker Vailia Esh's commitment to “give new verve to old songs” shines on this bottling from a cool-climate vineyard, which shows aromas of flint, grapefruit pith and wet stone on the nose. The tightly wound palate starts with flavors of fresh rubber and grapefruit peel before opening toward lime zest and wet concrete.
Name: Desparada 2017 Presqu'ile Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A richer style of Sauvignon Blanc, this bottling is a darker yellow in the glass and offers honeyed aromas of almond, orange, dried apple and pineapple brioche. It's soft, supple and slightly oily on the unctuous palate, where salted apple, petrol and light vanilla flavors converge into a white wine with power.
Name: Dragonette 2016 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp aromas of lime and underripe orange meet guava and wet concrete on the nose of this bottling, which was fermented in large barrels. There is great tension on the palate, where lime peel, lemon juice and chalky flavors reign.
Name: Desparada 2017 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: With a persistence of lively acidity, this crisp white is fresh and floral, with textured waves of integrated flavor. The fruit consists of green apple, grapefruit and lime, a memorable medley of refreshment.
Name: Glenwood Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This vibrant, sappy and delicious wine is another example of why Sauvignon Blanc seems to be a missed opportunity in Oregon. It offers flavors of lime, grapefruit, apple and melon, with a lightly buttery mouthfeel that's buttressed by juicy acidity.
Name: Trathen Hall 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Straightforward Sauvignon Blanc aromas of apple skins, pear rinds, grass and wet stone show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate starts tart with lime and then evolves into a creamier midpalate, offering flavors of lemon wedge and guava skin.
Name: Dragonette 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light on the nose at first, the refreshing bottling offers subtle aromas of springtime flowers and delicate grass, proving quite appealing and even sexy. The subtleties continue on the palate, where rounded Asian pear flesh meets with a honeysuckle sweetness.
Name: Ojai 2017 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Floral on the nose, this white is lively in acidity and stony in texture—a nice combination that gives it breadth and depth. Peach, apricot and Key lime flavors define the palate, with a lingering taste of melon. There is 5% Gewürztraminer blended in.
Name: Outlot 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a new producer in the appellation, this is a refreshing, light-bodied wine that displays flavors of peach and Meyer lemon. The bright acidity quenches from start to finish.
Name: ZO Wines 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: A classic Sauvignon Blanc at a fair price, this bottling starts with fresh and inviting aromas of apple blossom and red apple on the nose. Crisp and clean on the palate, it's tightly woven structure reveals lemon wedge and sliced Granny Smith apple flavors.
Name: Morgan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a compact texture of firm acidity and tone. Subtle aromatics lead the way to defined flavors of melon and peach that have a density that persists on the long finish.
Name: Redwood Hill 2017 Hopkins River Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of lime blossom and chalk lead into ripe pear flesh on the nose of this bottling by a winery based in Texas. There is good zip to the sip and a compelling texture, delivering flavors of Gravenstein apple and pear
Name: Heath Vineyards 2017 Captivating Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: It's not flashy or superfruity, but this light-bodied wine has good, clean citrus flavors, crisp balance and a nicely brisk texture. It is nicely dry, appetizing and straightforward.
Name: Heron 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Appealing and refreshing, this medium-bodied wine combines bright and fresh citrus and apple aromas with crisp, fairly ripe fruit flavors and lively acidity for good balance.
Name: Pomelo 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Pale straw in the glass, this wine has a nose of pink grapefruit and just-cut grass. Flavors of soft peach, green apple and white peppercorn wash across the palate before heading into a light pear-scented finish.
Name: Recanati 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This crisp white is grassy and herbal in pea shoots, with fresh fleshy layers of lemon peel that refresh the palate. Light in style and approach, it's well made and good value.
Name: Starmont 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and lively, this wine offers plenty of fruit flavors and refreshing acidity. It has citrus and green-apple flavors, a crisp mouthfeel and clean finish.
Name: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of citrus tang, dried mango and cooked nuts. It's broad and ripe on the palate with apple-juice and lime-zest flavors.
Name: Puma Road 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an intriguing and atypical streak of sour grass and earthy herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate displays a compelling grip, carrying flavors of chive, kaffir lime, lemongrass and fresh spring herbs.
Name: F2 Wines 2016 Ghibellini Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Description: Full bodied in thickness and concentration, this is a heavy grippy white. Floral on the nose, it offers well-defined flavors of lemon and melon that linger on the finish.
Name: Toybox Wine Cellars 2017 Cadden Family Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a light, crisp wine offering up subtle tones of citrus, apple and stone fruit. It's juicy and bright, making it a refreshing choice for a hot day.
Name: D'Arenberg 2017 The Stump Jump Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has a slightly earthy reductive aroma followed by green-apple and white-pepper flavors. Good acidity gives it a sense of vibrancy.
Name: Josh Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: Pure herbal Sauvignon Blanc, this is a crisp wine. Full of citrus and with touches of spice, the wine has plenty of attractive acidity and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Grand Bateau 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is an easy-going sipper that's lemony, floral and a touch herbal, with prickly acidity and a chalky texture. It's light in body and finishes with a citrusy zing.
Name: Tempus Two 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)

Description: This bright, tangy and fruity wine comes from the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux. With crisp acidity, an herbal touch and plenty of citrus fruits, this fresh wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Tour de Goupin 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Lemon, stone fruit, florals and a grassy note in this wine lead to a palate that is textured and a bit weighty from partial fermentation in aged French oak for a few weeks. The acidity, however, is searing and all that texture isn't enough to balance it.
Name: D'Arenberg 2017 The Broken Fishplate Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: This creamy and fruity wine has a light herbal touch and citrus acidity. The elements give a ripe, crisp wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Les Portes de Bordeaux 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A simple nose of lemon sets the scene for flavors of grapefruit, lemon and white flowers. This wine offers a pleasant mouthfeel and a soft floral finish.
Name: Tabor 2017 Adama Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This wine features aromas of pear and vanilla. It is light in the mouth, with flavors of Gala apple, pineapple and mint that lead to a cooling finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2017 Gilgal Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This wine shows subtle notes of stone fruit and lemon, along with some herbal tones. There's crisp acidity on the palate but the fruit is a little sour, particularly on the finish.
Name: Oxford Landing 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sour lime and sour guava aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent grip to the palate, although the flavors are a bit muddled, with apple and lemon most prominent.
Name: Heath Vineyards 2016 Captivating Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Onion and garlic aromas mostly blow off after a few minutes and let this medium-bodied wine turn more fruity and concentrated on the palate.
Name: Ironstone 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: This medium-bodied wine emphasizes earthy and lightly herbal flavors and has a moderately rich mouthfeel to go with them. Subtle flint and mineral notes outweigh any fruitiness.
Name: Kate Arnold 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Prickly aromas of pine, green herbs and seashell are low on fruit. This Sauvignon Blanc is plump and basic in feel, with apricot and peach flavors that turn peppery and bitter on a simple finish.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: Ripe tropical and citrus fruit sit heavily on the dry palate. It's sliced through with biting acidity and a lemony finish.
Name: Yellow Tail NV Sauvignon Blanc (Australia-New Zealand)

Description: Deep gold to the eye, this wine has a nose of citrus, baking bread and vanilla. It is astringent on the palate, with flavors of tart apple, lemon and toast with a slightly sour finish.
Name: David's Land 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This light-straw-colored wine has a bouquet of clementine and spearmint. It lacks complexity, with flavors of quince and green apple that wind down to a eucalyptus finish.
Name: Dalton 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: The nose is almost closed but here and there a flicker of passion fruit appears tantalizingly. The palate is just as tight and taut, but the gloriously aromatic passion fruit shines and shimmers. Purest lemon sets a silvery, zesty accent, but all about this bids you to be patient. This will blossom in all its freshness with a little bottle age. It holds all of Styria's dewy freshness. Drink 2022–2032
Name: Wohlmuth 2016 Ried Edelschuh Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: On the nose the merest whiff of lemon suggests the fruit that broods underneath. The palate has a plump, limpid, glowing ripeness at its core, framed by leafy, crushed grassiness and vivid, pure lemon. There is something soft and creamy around the edges, too. This needs time to reveal its undoubted splendor. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Wohlmuth 2016 Ried Hochsteinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This is a barrel-fermented white that impresses from start to finish, with 4% Sémillon added to the mix. A sublime white-peach flavor is layered and well-integrated within a stony texture. Offering length and breadth, this is defined by an exotic spice note that lingers.
Name: Aperture 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Description: Gentle, almost emollient notes of passion fruit hover on the nose. The palate comes in with richer juiciness, adding hints of baked apricot and lovely lemon freshness. This is pure and serene and will be ready with a little bottle age. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2017 Ried Rossberg Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: Always impressive, this is a fleshy, boldly structured white wine, offering a tremendous palate of exotic flavor. Lemon rind, wet stone, peach and a grittiness of background oak mingle effortlessly within a moderate richness of balanced complexity.
Name: Lail 2017 Blueprint Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense aromas of Sauvignon Blanc dominate this bottling, including sharp lawn cuttings, lemongrass, argan oil and even cut garden hose, yet there's a slight hint of peach as well. The dynamic experience continues on the sip, which is both lush in mouthfeel yet very grassy and herbal in flavor with green pepper, basil and lime leaf.
Name: Dragonette 2016 Grassini Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: With lasting tension and a good build-up of fresh acidity, this is a well-made white that offers fruity notes of white peach and apple. It has enough creaminess to be pleasurable on the palate, but ultimately is well built and balanced.
Name: Heritance 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This has 14% Sémillon. Together, the white grapes form a fleshy, floral core of bold full-bodied flavor and lemony oak, the structure impressively complex and lasting in texture.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2015 Fumé Blanc (Oakville)

Description: This is a complex, impressive white with a creamy lush entry that evolves on the palate to offer crisp fleshy elements of white peach and lime. The midpalate is balanced in richness, leading the way to a bold herbal grassy finish.
Name: Captûre 2017 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: This is a successful, small-production white that's bright, textured and memorable in swathes of well-heeled grapefruit and Meyer lemon. A grassy undertone of pea shoots plays well against the crisp fruit.
Name: Concannon 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A perennially popular and well-made wine, this vintage is no exception, shining in concentrated, layers of rich, bold flavor. A sweetness of peach and vanilla complement a more exotic element of rose petal and black licorice.
Name: Merry Edwards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Aged entirely in stainless steel, this pretty, appropriately named white is floral and herbal, tasting strongly of grapefruit pith and lemon peel. The flavors lead to accompanying textures of light-bodied weight and refreshment.
Name: Flint & Steel 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Blended with nearly 18% Sauvignon Musque, this is fermented in both stainless steel and oak. Dried herb, lemon peel and peach shine along a thread of stony minerality and texture, the body balanced and impressively robust.
Name: Oberon 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Green plum, gooseberry, lime pith and fresh sweet grass all unfold on the nose of this varietally correct wine. Lightweight, fresh and vibrant, it boasts lime-like acidity and pleasantly tart, not mouthpuckering, green melon and plum flavors. Superfresh and vibrant, this is well balanced and easy to like.
Name: Paul Cluver 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: This small, family-run producer makes a solid, salt-tinged Sauvignon Blanc from the estate vineyards close to the sea in the cooler Wairau Valley subregion of Marlborough. This wine is a relatively quiet mix of lemon zest, apple peel, sea spray and jalapeño, accompanied by prickly, mouthwatering acidity, a chalky texture and a citrusy finish.
Name: Glover Family 2017 Zephyr Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From a selection of vineyards in Oak Knoll, Yountville and St. Helena, this crisp white is floral and lemony, with moderate weight and breadth. It's made in a steely, straightforward style with an intensity that lingers on the finish.
Name: Amici 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a grassy, herbal and refreshing white, from vines that date back decades in some cases. Lemongrass, lime and Meyer lemon flavors dominate the palate, accentuating a tart, acid-driven proposition of ample texture.
Name: Kunde 2017 Magnolia Lane Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Blended with 12% Sémillon, this white is steel and floral, with a lemony core that's more balanced and elegant than fruit forward. Wet stone and jasmine accent it well.
Name: Markham 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This single-vineyard wine shows all of the cool climate, maritime influence of the Awatere Valley, a subregion of Marlborough. It's an aromatic and balanced mix of green bell pepper, tomato leaf, grapefruit and lemon zest. The whole package is backed by crisp, crunchy acidity, a slippery texture and a long, lemony finish.
Name: Yealands 2018 Estate Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of pink grapefruit, tropical fruit and herb lead to broad feeling, ever so slight spritzy fruit flavors. A tart, lingering finish caps it off.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, pineapple, pink grapefruit, licorice and clove aromas are at the fore. Taut fig and tropical fruit flavors follow, with tart acidity keeping the interest high.
Name: Seven Hills 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Light and bright in well-defined flavors of white peach and apricot, this is a fulsome, balanced white, quiet and subtle in flavor with crisp, focused acidity.
Name: Decoy 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grassy, herbal and strongly full bodied, this white is textured and tannic, with an ongoing grittiness of wet stone. The fruit is a mix of peach and pineapple.
Name: Frei Brothers 2017 Sonoma Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Aromas of fresh sweet grass, green melon rind, lime peel, underripe mango and fig form the nose of this fresh and tart wine. It's lightweight and easy to drink, with subtle fruit flavors and medium acidity. It's not an overly complex pour, but it's tasty enough, with a touch of earthy, herbal bitterness on the end.
Name: Thelema 2017 Sutherland Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: There's not a ton of aromatic intensity here, with some delicate hints of white melon rind, fresh thyme, mint and lemon pith in the bouquet. It's lightweight and easy to enjoy, with good acidity and touches of sweet orange and pineapple flavors on the back of the palate. Drink now.
Name: Downes Family 2016 Sanctuary Peak Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: On the riper end of the spectrum, heady aromas of peach, pineapple, ripe grapefruit and a touch of honey and herb are at the fore. Light bodied with a slightly chalky texture and crisp—but not searing—acidity. There's a touch of fruit sweetness here, but overall it's a dry and refreshing drop.
Name: Greyrock 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of wet slate, kiwi, pineapple and herb are out front. Broad feeling tropical fruit flavors follow and carry through the kiwi-filled finish, with mouthwatering acidity backing it up. There's a lot to like.
Name: Mercer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: In a difficult and complicated vintage, this succeeds in showcasing Marlborough Sauvignon in the light so many have come to recognize and enjoy. Heady, exotic aromas like passion fruit, grapefruit rind, guava and tomato leaf lead into a palate that is light but with some texture to balance zingy acidity. Finishes on an herbal, leafy note.
Name: Toi Toi 2018 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Floral and herbal, this has high-toned acidity and a grassy element that's earthy and within the wine's style. Stony texture adds complexity to the stone fruit and lemon.
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2017 Silver Spur Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a fruit-forward and balanced white, crisp and fleshy in bold layers of pear and apple. The acidity is nicely integrated.
Name: Precision Wine 2017 Fly By Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Blended with 15% Sémillon, this white is bright in lemon, stone and anise, yet full-bodied in weight and breadth. It has a grip on the palate that emphasizes its ultimate power and concentration of fruit.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2017 Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Peach, pineapple, guava, tomato leaf and dried herb aromas lead the way for a crisp, zesty palate that shows a little fruit weight and a juicy, citrusy finish. It's not overly complicated, but a balanced example of this style.
Name: Waxing Moon 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: An appealing nose bursting with ripe lemon, pineapple, peach and florals leads to a palate that veers close to the medium-bodied neighborhood. There's bright, tingly, mouthwatering acidity and a long, citrus finish.
Name: Hay Maker 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine starts a touch reductive but quickly blows off in the glass, revealing subtle notes of grapefruit, peach, pineapple, snow pea and bell peppers. Crisp acidity and an almost chalky texture add lift and character beside the fruit weight. The citrus and veg notes continue to work together to create a balanced, zippy drop.
Name: Taonga 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A closed nose opens up to reveal aromas of citrus, tropical fruit, snow pea and tomato leaf, and, because it's seen some time in barrel, a touch of toasty oak. The medium-bodied palate is all at once grainy and creamy in feel, yet with searing acidity coming in on the midpalate. There's nice fruit weight and a long lemony finish.
Name: Giesen 2017 The Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is from an estate-grown block at 300-feet in elevation. It is an intense take on the variety that's crisp and refreshing in flinty petrol, lemon and melon.
Name: Kunde 2017 Block 4SB20 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This wine starts off with aromas of bell pepper and nettle that are followed closely by lemon, grapefruit and flowers. The palate is a little mean and green, with enamel-stripping acidity and heaps of crisp vegetal and citrus flavors. But there's also a mouthwatering lemony finish, which hints at wet stone minerality.
Name: Yealands 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Starting on the quiet, muted side, this eventually opens after some swirling in glass, revealing notes of snow pea, tomato leaf, jalapeño and tropical fruit. The acidity is tingly but feels a touch underripe, and there's some residual sugar seemingly to try to counteract this, which it achieves to some degree, closing on a ripe fruity tone.
Name: The Crossings 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Starting reductive and oniony, this wine takes its time to open, eventually revealing notes of dried herbs, nettles and green beans, with grapefruit and pineapple tones in the background. There's more fruit on the palate, which wraps around enamel-stripping acidity that's resolved by a soft texture on the finish.
Name: Vavasour 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: This is a bright, aromatic wine, with generous amounts of tropical fruit, ripe lemon, nettle, honey and a little oyster shell. The palate is light, crisp and slippery textured with a lemony finish.
Name: Misty Cove 2017 Reef Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Light citrus aromas come with a note of freshly cut grass. A healthy palate with citrusy acidity is lightweight and easy to process. Green-apple and citrus flavors don't break down on a finish with edgy energy.
Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2018 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Grassy and herbal, this white is made in an austere style, with little to no perceptible oak. Light and bright, it has a vegetal element offset well by a linger of lemon.
Name: Delaney Blue Vineyards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: This is a highly aromatic wine. Concentrated pineapple and guava aromas rush out of the glass, followed by some snow pea and green bell pepper characters. The palate is equally fruity, and a little residual sugar and fruit weight balance the racy acidity.
Name: Fault Line 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This ticks all the Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc boxes, with upfront aromas of passion fruit, guava, bell pepper and tomato leaf. The palate is lightweight, with crispy, crunchy acidity and a slightly slippery texture. It finishes on an herbal note. Drink now.
Name: Toi Toi 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: White-citrus aromas are fresh and pointy. Punchy citric acidity and a lean body make this a racy Sauvignon Blanc with little depth. Simple grapefruit, orange and celery flavors continue on a bright finish.
Name: Wapisa 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Río Negro Valley)

Description: Exotic in fig and guava flavors, this is a ripe full-bodied white that's fleshy and concentrated in richness.
Name: Saddleback 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)

Description: This is an easy-going, lightweight sipper with pineapple rind, stone fruit and snow pea aromas. On the palate, mouthwatering, prickly acidity balances tropical fruit, making it easy to take another sip.
Name: Sea Pearl 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This charges out of the gate with heady aromas of lychee, pineapple and mango. There are hints of nettle and tomato leaf, but this is a fruit-led, crisp and chalky-textured wine.
Name: Baron Edmond de Rothschild 2017 Rimapere Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Like this producer's other wines, this starts reductively with an oniony aroma that struggles to blow off. Citrus and tropical fruit and snow pea characters lie underneath but are pretty well hidden. The palate improves a bit, with a slippery texture and prickly, if slightly underripe, acidity, although the fruit still feels a little lost.
Name: Te Pa 2018 Pa Road Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Sharp acidity girds a steely, austere expression of the variety, stony in lemon peel, grapefruit and jasmine.
Name: Houdini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine starts out with aromas of onions and cabbage. This blows off a bit with time in the glass, revealing notes of guava, grapefruit, grass and bell pepper. The palate offers a slippery texture, with biting acidity that gives a sharp edge to this wine.
Name: Te Pa 2018 Koha Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine starts off somewhat reductively and with the variety's typical honeyed tropical and passion fruit aromas. The palate feels a touch disjointed, with searing acidity cutting through a touch of residual sugar and fruit weight.
Name: Fire Road 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Herbal and grassy, this offers aromas of pea shoots and lemon rind, with a thickness on the palate that persists in a mix of stone fruit and lemongrass.
Name: Longwood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This shows confected peach, pineapple and banana on the nose, with a hint of bell pepper. On the palate, the acid feels sharp and it isn't backed by a whole lot of fruit or texture.
Name: Locations NV NZ7 Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)

Description: This white is disjointed, a bit dull on the palate with dizzying flavors of green apple and olive.
Name: Reynoso 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: So pale in color it could be mistaken for water, this perfumed wine smells like bananas, ripe peaches and flowers. The palate is clunky and disjointed, with sweet-and-sour flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Cook Strait 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This top-tier Sauvignon Blanc is crisp, clear, clean and tangy, with just enough grass and gooseberry characters that are balanced by grapefruit. This should drink well over the next five years, into the mid-2020s.
Name: Andrew Rich 2017 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a hearty, acid-driven white, with a white peach flavor and a lush, creamy palate. Hints of jasmine and apple blossom meld with a touch of lemon zest on the lingering finish.
Name: Kenzo Estate 2017 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Tones of creamy citrus and vanilla wafer dominate the palate of this layered, complex white. Additional flavors of green apple and tangerine emphasize the underlying acidity that's both juicy and crisp.
Name: Whitehall Lane 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very lively aromas of lemongrass, kaffir lime, rainy cement and a hint of greenish orange show on the nose of this block-designated bottling. The texture is very crunchy and grippy with lime skins, springtime herbs and a touch of passion fruit. It is fresh yet complex.
Name: Grassini 2017 Block 14 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very fresh and very vibrant, this light-bodied and well-balanced wine is aromatic, crisp and refreshing. It promises green apples, garden herbs and citrus in the aroma and delivers juicy tangy apple and grapefruit on the palate.
Name: Pennyroyal Farm 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sizzling acidity greets the palate immediately in this medium-bodied white that makes a good first impression and supports it with well-defined flavors of lemon, lime and green apple. The finish teases further in white peach.
Name: Ektimo Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Boushey Vineyard makes up the 70% majority of this wine, with the rest coming from Red Willow. Barrel fermented with native yeast, the aromas are light on first pour, with notes of lemon verbena, lemon oil and herb. The flavors are tart, racy and acid driven, with a long, drawn out finish. It's elegant and subtle, with pleasing complexities to be had. Give it some additional time in bottle to see it at its best.
Name: Avennia 2017 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Mike Landt makes an amazingly deep, ripe Sauvignon Blanc, especially given his cool-climate location. It is rich and textural, with dense fruit flavors of melon, grapefruit and kiwi and a lush and creamy mouthfeel.
Name: River's Edge 2017 Vintage Farm Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Elkton Oregon)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a fruity white that is balanced by buoyant acidity. Fermented mostly in stainless steel, it offers defined flavors of lemon, melon and lime.
Name: Cannonball 2017 Eleven Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Spice aromas lead to a wine that shows touches of new French-oak aging that adds to the richness of the ripe green plums and acidity. A lightly structured wine from hillside vines bordering the Gironde Estuary, it will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Haut Grelot 2017 Sélection  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wet stone, crushed rocks and a touch of funky grass aromas show on the nose of this bottling, the first for young vintner Gina Hildebrand. The palate is all about minerality, reminiscent of wet sidewalks on a rainy day, along with touches of lime skin, grapefruit pith and ash.
Name: Lady of the Sunshine 2017 Coquelicot Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fresh, focused and herbal, this robustly ripe white has strong flavors of apricot, green apple and pineapple. The fruit is sourced from the family's Shop Block Vineyard, planted to the Mosque clone, as well as from the Mrs. George Vineyard near its Home Ranch. It develops fleshy elements of tropical splendor as it opens in the glass.
Name: Dutton Estate 2017 Kylie's Cuvée Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of candied lemon rind, lime leaf, Granny Smith apple and crushed granite show on the nose of this bottling by the Gallo family. The palate is smooth in feel, with flavors of apple skin, grapefruit and squeezed lime.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Winemaker Series Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: Floral in musque-like aromatics, this is a well-integrated and fruity white, crisply showing its stainless-steel fermentation. Apple, lime and peach play well with each other to offer bold, memorable flavors.
Name: Girard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Sweet peach and apricot flavors are given a touch of richness from a jolt of vanilla. Medium bodied and fleshy, it finishes bright and fresh.
Name: Herencia 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: High-toned acidity supports bright fresh flavors of peach, apricot and green apple in this well-made lightly bodied white. Floral aromas of jasmine and apple blossom complement the fruit.
Name: Quivira 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This reserve bottling aims for richness, offering aromas of rounded apple, pear, smoked nuts and crushed chalk. The palate wraps a smoky touch around the dried grass and yellow-pear flavors.
Name: Grassini 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of hay and lawn clippings meet with wet river stone on the nose of this fresh and vibrant bottling. It's zippy on the palate, with flavors of lemon, lime and grapefruit rind.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: Refreshing and crisp, this light-bodied, elegant wine offers very clean appley aromas and good lean Bosc pear and mineral flavors backed by appetizing acidity.
Name: Imagery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a meaty white, layered in dried herb and white peach. The texture is youthful and still evolving.
Name: Quivira 2017 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of this wine are light, with notes of herb, grass, citrus and lemon balm. The palate is more giving, with sleek but textured lemony flavors.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from from Quintessence Vineyard, this wine offers aromas of toast, fig, lemon balm and herb. These tones echo on the full-bodied palate but dip a little in concentration.
Name: Henry Earl 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: A nose of baked apple with a touch of bell pepper leads to flavors of Seville orange, Meyer lemon and juniper berry. This wine is fresh and bright on the palate, wrapping up in a zesty finish.
Name: Sula 2017 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Nashik)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is Sauvignon Blanc with a tropical twist. As well as acidity, it brings out pineapple ripeness as well as kiwi and rich lime flavors. Ripe and fruity, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Maison Neuve 2017 Sauvignon  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Herbal with some richness, this wine has a warm but crisp feel. Acidity sustains the ripe green-plum and white-currant fruits. Drink now.
Name: François Lurton 2017 Domaine les Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This wine has a touch of spice as well as hints of almond. Those flavors add to the rich yellow fruits to give weight, texture and final concentration. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2017 Grande Cuvée Sauvignon Blanc  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Fermented and aged in new oak barrels, this soft wine has a gentle, rounded texture that brings out citrus and melon flavors. An attractive, fruity wine from old vines, it is ready to drink.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2017 Château Haut Bertinerie Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This perfumed wine is crisp with citrus while also ripe with yellow fruits and a touch of honey. It is already attractive, ripe and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Château Berthenon 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Floral and citrus aromas get this wine off to a start before crisp grapefruit and herb flavors kick in on the palate. It is light in weight and has a fresh, tangy texture, giving it a good, crisp finish.
Name: Dark Horse 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Thickly built, spritzy in acidity and brightly citrus-driven in lemon zest, grapefruit and apricot, this is the fourth vintage of this wine from the longtime Napa Valley producer. It delivers flavor and texture within integrated oak, within which just a portion is fermented.
Name: Rombauer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a nice layering of white peach and pea shoot and retains a light-hearted texture and body weight on the palate. It finishes grainy with a nutty element.
Name: Quivira 2017 Alder Grove Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine shows the rather pungent, herbaceous aspect of the grape variety from the first whiff of wet earth and chives to flavors that are tart and lean.
Name: Sera Fina 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This straw-colored Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of orange blossom, guava and lemon zest. In the mouth there are flavors of lemon, mandarin orange and mango. The finish is crisp.
Name: Cramele Recas 2016 Dreamfish Sauvignon Blanc (Romania)

Description: This defiantly herbal wine has grassy aromas and gooseberry flavors. Its tangy character and taut texture are those of a young, fruity wine. It is ready to drink.
Name: Quinta do Casal Branco 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: Aromas of orange, mango and citrus blossom lead to flavors of tangerine, passion fruit and mango. The finish is crisp and clean.
Name: I Am 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Romania)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This light and crisp wine has a snap-pea aroma, tangy herb and citrus flavors and a touch of veggies on the finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2017 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Soft and soapy, suggesting high pH, this wine is light in style, with easygoing citrus flavors. The palate is soft and lacking in an acidic lift.
Name: Schmidt 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Beautifully interwoven acidity gives this wine a lift of freshness and viscosity in this lovely, 100% varietal white, sourced from several sites, including Stagecoach on Atlas Peak, Hyde Vineyards in Carneros and the Spottswoode Estate. Fresh peach, apricot and wild vanilla are met by textured richness that's balanced and measured in approach.
Name: Spottswoode 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Description: This is a lovely, barrel-fermented white that sources widely from Stagecoach Vineyard, a mountainous site that provides structure and balanced power in this case. Strong varietal aromas of pineapple, peach and anise ride a fleshy midpalate that refreshes in complex layers of lasting flavor.
Name: Arrow & Branch 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This extremely energetic and zippy bottling offers grassy elements on the nose that are balanced by hints of passion fruit, wet stone and lime rind. The palate is extremely textural and grippy, delivering pear and apple flavors along with pink-grapefruit pith and a chalky finish.
Name: Margerum 2017 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This blend of fruit from the McGinley and Grassini vineyards is fermented in cigar barrels, and shows rounded aromas of passion fruit and nectarine on the nose alongside lime, grass and chalk. There is a smoky quality to the smoke, with red pear, chalk and grass flavors wrapped in a creamy texture.
Name: Margerum 2017 D Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Aromatic but not bombastic, this shows grapefruit, apple and lemon aromas on the nose that are followed by herbal notes of tomato leaf, mint and grass. There's a focused line of acidity on the palate that cuts through the fruit and rounded texture but doesn't jut out. Drink now–2023.
Name: Giesen 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine erupts with ripe mango, pineapple and grapefruit, backed by some grass and nettle notes. There's fruit weight on the palate, threaded with wet stone and bright acidity, with a long, slightly savory, green-herbed finish.
Name: Kim Crawford 2017 Signature Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This enticing wine is savory on the nose, displaying light herb, fig and mineral aromas. Rich melon and crushed rock flavors yield a creamy texture.
Name: Encanto 2017 Encanto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this is a floral and balanced wine that displays great tension and texture. Fleshy in flavors of peach, lime zest and wet stone, it delivers a rounded feel that lingers on the palate.
Name: Peju 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: It's not usual to age Sauvignon Blanc, but this late release and the companion Mariah Vineyard bottling are nicely concentrated wines. In the buttery oaky spectrum, this medium-bodied and nuanced wine smells lightly buttery, tastes rich, feels mouth-filling and lasts long on the finish.
Name: Bee Hunter 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: This wine gushes in tones of lime popsicle and guava flecked with honey. The juicy fruit continues on the palate, where tangy, bouncy acidity sits easily alongside a creamy texture. There's a long peach and lime finish.
Name: Fern Ridge 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Guava, pineapple rind, red apple skins and green herbs lead the nose. The grapefruit-tinged palate is threaded together with prickly, mouthwatering acidity, chalky wet-stone minerality and a long, juicy and spicy finish.
Name: Framingham 2017 Nobody's Hero Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a fruity sparkler made in the Charmat method. The nose is a mix of honeyed nuts, yeasty apples, green tea and orange zest while the palate shows a touch of sweetness, which enhances the tangy fruit and honey flavors without completely taking over.
Name: Hillersden 2017 Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fleshy, full-bodied and floral, this wine is generously proportioned in stone fruit and Meyer lemon tones. These tones complement the palate well, giving a sense of substance and style.
Name: Flora Springs 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a 100% stainless-steel white that offers spritzy acidity and grainy texture around a midweight body as peach and vanilla flavors wrap around that light refreshing core of pure fruit. This is a new wine from one of the oldest wineries in the state, brought back to life by the great-great-grandson of original founder Charles Kohler.
Name: Kohler & Frohling 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Brisk and tangy all the way through, this light and refreshing wine was fermented in large oak vats and aged on the lees for four months. It features citrus aromas, lively citrus and crisp apple flavors and a nicely tart texture that livens the palate.
Name: Navarro 2017 Cuvée 128 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This late-release wine has an attractive buttery aroma, baked apple flavors and a nicely rich texture. It expands into canteloupe and light fig on the midpalate and those flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Bee Hunter 2015 Mariah Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of lime and apple lead into a more supple tone of honeydew on the nose of this widely available wine. There is a compelling grip to the palate, where a chalky texture carries flavors of Anjou pear and lime pith.
Name: Gnarly Head 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: Fermented and aged in neutral oak, this wine offers pretty aromas of lemon and apple blossom. The firm palate brings peach and apple flavors that are balanced by tense acidity.
Name: Resign 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Aromas of orange, lemon peel, fresh greens and the ocean are clear, clean and in harmony. A tangy, crisp palate is braced by a shot of blazing acidity, while this tastes mostly of lime and salt from the nearby Pacific Ocean. A steady finish is showing the slightest bit of yeasty breakdown, so drink as soon as possible.
Name: Amayna 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This wine shows a strong line of green herb, tomato leaf and nettle characters, with tropical fruit in the background. Some oak fermentation, lees work and partial skin contact make for a more textural style, with lifted acidity and a slight flinty quality neatly round things out.
Name: Catalina Sounds 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Chalky aromas and flavors distinguish this bone-dry, refreshing and different wine. It's light in body, light on ripe fruit flavors but brings out the mineral, saline and citrus flavors that many wine drinkers love.
Name: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of wet cement, grapefruit rind, grass and smoke show on the nose of this bottling from the Jack McGinley Vineyard. There is compelling grip to the palate, where lemongrass, lime leaf and rounded apple flavors make for a mellow sipping experience.
Name: Point & Line 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Showing the restraint of the vintage, this wine offers notes of guava, lemon verbena and white spice. Prickly acidity weaves into a chalky wet-stone note on the palate, finishing long, citrusy and mouthwatering.
Name: Sunday Mountain 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A salty character leads the nose and palate, followed closely by notes of peach, pineapple and orange. Creamy textured, with mouthwatering acidity, those tangy fruit flavors follow all the way through to the finish.
Name: Kia Ora 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine is shy at first, whispering notes of lemon, grapefruit, tomato leaf and jalapeño. It is chalky in texture, with those grapefruit and green notes running through to a finish that shows a bit of bitterness.
Name: Lexicon 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Buttery, nutty notes are the fore of this oak-aged wine, along with grilled peaches, orange peels and ginger. It's creamy and slippery in texture, but the laser-sharp acidity brings it into focus. While the style is a little flashy and the oak a little too in the fore, it's nevertheless fun to see a different expression outside the well-worn model.
Name: Te Pa 2016 Oke Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This canned wine offers a convenient means of enjoying crisp white wine, starting with aromas of dried hay, steel and lime leaf. The palate offers sour apple, tart limes and very strong cut-grass flavors.
Name: Al 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: A lightly vegetal nose with fruitier bolts of mango and melon leads to a juicy palate with bright, banging acidity. This outdoes many Rueda Sauvignon Blancs via spicy green fruit and melon flavors and clean and proper balance. Drink now.
Name: Cuatro Rayas 2017 Cuarenta Vendimias Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: This wine is all about subtle stone fruit, white spice and floral characters. The acidity is a little on the harsh side, but it's just barely kept in check by a chalky yet mouthwatering palate.
Name: Decibel 2016 Crownthorpe Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: This is a delicate, dainty Sauvignon that glides onto the scene with lime, red apple peel and blossoms. Texturally, it's a little chalky, with an apple-focused tang, balanced acidity and a mouthwatering finish.
Name: It's a Headsnapper 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine is bright and aromatic, with notes of guava, pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of grass. The palate is slippery in feel, with crunchy acidity and a long guava finish. Lovers of this style will find this a solid choice.
Name: Tiki 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Attractive, lifted notes of lemon, lime, nettle and green herbs follow from the nose to the palate. A touch of ripeness balances the zingy acidity, providing a slippery texture and feeling of ripe, juicy fruit. The finish is long and lemony.
Name: Tiki Sound 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromas of snow pea, tomato leaf, passionfruit and lemon rind are followed by a crisp, citrusy palate of mouthwatering acidity and a slippery texture.
Name: Tohu 2017 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of dewy springtime grass, lime zest, pomelo rind and wet cement make for a pungent entry to this bottling. The palate is stony in flavor, with touches of pink lemonade, cut grass and lime rind.
Name: Firestone 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County-Napa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Remarkably fragrant in jasmine, this wine is light, balanced and well-integrated—a larger production offering that doesn't shirk on flavor or style, offering plenty of pretty bang for the buck.
Name: Franciscan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County-Napa County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine balances a tangy citrus side against a rich texture and riper flavors of pear and apple that come out on the palate and linger on the finish.
Name: Lava Cap 2017 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Description: Perfumed in jasmine, this is a fleshy expression of the variety that's ripe, resolved and moderately structured. The fruit is a mix of fresh peach and green apple.
Name: St. Supéry 2017 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Combining light herb and mineral aromas with somewhat richer pear and fig flavors, this medium-bodied wine is fruity, smooth and shows some savory complexity too.
Name: Tobias 2017 Lexi's Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Grassy aromas met with cut limes on the easy nose of this bottling from the historic winery on Alamo Pintado Road. Granny Smith apple flavors consumer the sip, which is smooth and refreshing.
Name: Buttonwood 2017 Musque Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Description: This is an aromatic wine with ripe pineapple, peach and ginger spice notes. The palate also has a richness about it, in the form of a creamy texture and plenty of fruit concentration, but there's a good lick of all-important acidity to freshen things up and make the fruit seem tangy rather than sweet.
Name: Grove Mill 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Meyer lemon pith and orange flesh show on the very light and easy nose of this bottling from the region's pioneer winery. The palate is much more intriguing, with a chalky, tense frame delivering lemon-lime flavors.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: There's a juicy lemon-lime popsicle quality to this wine that's hard not to like. The slight floral character helps, too. It's crisp yet slightly viscous in texture, with lemon and lime notes on the finish that make it a fruity and fun little number.
Name: Smythe & Renfield 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Prickly citrus and grassy scents are pungent. A plump, slightly heavy palate is only modest in acidity, while this tastes of bell pepper, white pepper and passion fruit. A mellow finish is just fresh enough, with lasting green notes.
Name: Koyle 2018 Costa La Flor Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: This is a well-integrated and smoothly soft white, balanced and light bodied with a lasting imprint of peach, apricot and green apple.
Name: St. Supéry 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This zingy wine starts off with lime, grapefruit, tomato leaf and white pepper. There's a slight chalkiness and slipperiness to the texture, with bright acidity and a lifted, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Wakefield Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Attractive aromas of lemon verbena, white pepper, tomato leaf and grapefruit are followed by a tangy, citrusy palate. This is an easy-going, refreshing wine that won't dent the wallet.
Name: 13 Celsius 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A charred onion and nuts offer a reductive quality that presides at first sniff. Underneath it are more typical characters: grapefruit, lime and pineapple. The texture is slippery, finishing on a salty note.
Name: Cottesbrook 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The aromas of this wine are delicate and pleasing, giving way to apple, passionfruit, guava and flowers. There's a satiny texture and a good lick of acidity on the palate. It's nothing too complicated but is nevertheless thirst quenching
Name: Echo Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromas of vanilla bean, lemon custard and green apple are found in this Czech Sauvignon Blanc. In the mouth there are flavors of apple pie, flan and caramelized orange peel. The finish is crisp and clean.
Name: Krásná Hora 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Moravia)

Description: Heady aromas of peach, pineapple, white pepper and jalapeño pepper lead the way in this wine. It leads into a slippy-textured palate that displays lots of fruit concentration and a long, pineapple finish.
Name: Wairau River 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A perfumed wine from the small region west of Chablis, this is a tropical-fruit-flavored wine. Its light texture and freshness give it a lively, crisp character. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Chenevières 2017 Ica-Onna  (Saint-Bris)

Description: This is a vegetal style from the bottom of New Zealand's South Island. Snow pea and bell pepper notes lead the way, with passionfruit in the background. The palate is creamy in feel, but it's balanced by lifted acidity and more fruit-driven flavors.
Name: Palliser Estate 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: In the warmer climes of Hawke's Bay on the North Island, much of New Zealand's (a k a Marlborough's) classic green vegetal notes are gone. The wines exhibits more tropical fruit characters, displaying ripe mango, peach, and lychee notes that are balanced by lifted acidity.
Name: Rod McDonald Wines 2017 Mister Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Pineapple, guava and grapefruit lead the way in this refreshing wine. There's a good lick of acidity that's balanced by ripe fruit flavors.
Name: Greyrock 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Refreshing aromas of fresh grapefruit and lemon are tempered by lime pith and wet stone. The palate echoes the nose, showing more bright citrus fruit and river rock tones alongside tangy lime-juice acidity. The finish brings fresh squeezed lemon juice laced with white pepper.
Name: Llano Estacado 2017 Monte Stella Sauvignon Blanc (Texas)

Description: This small enclave of Sauvignon Blanc in the north of Burgundy has much, tastewise, to do with Sancerre. This wine offers crisp acidity and white-currant flavors cut with lemon juice and filled out with hints of white fruits. Drink the wine now.
Name: Bailly-Lapierre 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Saint-Bris)

Description: Medium gold in color, this wine is a luscious wine that offers aromas of lemon balm, guava, nettle and bruised apple. It's creamy and slippery in texture, but a good lick of acidity to holds things in place.
Name: Smoke Stack 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)

Description: This soft wine conveys pineapple and ripe white-currant fruitiness along with citrus acidity. Warm, open and rounded, it is ready to be drunk now.
Name: Château Rouquette 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Honey-dipped pineapple and guava, with a touch of fig give this wine a fruity midpalate. This has a moderate structure and a lingering note of anise.
Name: K Squared Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: This wine is initially a bit reductive. It veers towards the green spectrum, showing notes of bell pepper, tomato leaf and grapefruit. There's a biting, slightly underripe quality to the acidity and that is ultimately balanced out by a slightly rounded texture. It finishes on a citrusy tang.
Name: Matua 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fruity but not bombastically so, notes of apple, guava and peach lead into a palate that is creamy-textured thanks to some time spent on lees. The palate is back by enough acidity to remain refreshing yet the finish is abrupt.
Name: Monowai 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: This wine balances loads of peach and pineapple tones with a touch of green bell pepper. The palate is a bit disjointed, with the ripe fruit and bright acidity not quite gelling.
Name: Paddy Borthwick 2017 Paper Road Sauvignon Blanc (Wairarapa)

Description: From the relatively cooler maritime climes of the Awatere Valley in Marlborough, this Sauvignon leads with green vegetal notes of snow pea and green bell pepper, backed up by lemon-lime and grapefruit. The palate slippery with some fruit sweetness and rather searing acid. Stylistically it feels a little forced.
Name: Clifford Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A bit more subtle than some of its more bombastic counterparts, this wine shows notes of grapefruit, guava and citrus. It's crisp in feel, but balanced by plenty of ripe fruit flavors on the palate. A zippy grapefruity note rings on the finish.
Name: Tiki 2016 Maui Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A multi-national collaboration between Winemaker James Foster and Pat Monahan, lead singer of the band Train, the duo's Sauvignon Blanc is a straightforward expression of the variety. The typical grapefruit, guava, pineapple and tomato leaf notes are all there. The palate is crisp and zippy, with a touch of creaminess due to time on lees.
Name: Drops of Jupiter 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Passionfruit, pineapple and mango rind dominate this wine from the bottom of New Zealand's north island. There's a touch of residual sugar on the palate, yet bright acidity balances all the ripe fruit.
Name: Paddy Borthwick 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Wairarapa)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cut grass and pungent green-apple slices make for a familiar entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with Granny Smith apple and nectarine flavors, but they are short-lived and the texture is flat.
Name: Esser 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: Neutral aromas are largely clean and barely suggest white peach. This boxed SB is plump and citrusy on the palate, with citric flavors that turn a bit green and grassy on the back side.
Name: Black Box 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Description: Aromas of lemon oil and citrus blossom are wrapped in an herbal haze on the nose of this Sauvignon Blanc that's blended with 23% Chenin Blanc and 1% each of Marsanne and Viognier. The palate is dry and astringent, with spry lemon-lime acidity and flavors of ripe apple, blossoms and a whisper of salinity.
Name: Llano Estacado 2017 Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Texas)

Description: Floral and herbal, this wine offers bright, persistent acidity around a full-bodied embrace of ripe peach and pineapple.
Name: Maxville 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This light-bodied wine is grassy in aroma, has lean veggie and lemon flavors and a fairly crisp mouthfeel.
Name: LangeTwins 2017 Estate Grown Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Piquant aromas of green fruits are feline in nature. This SB from Rueda feels chunky, with soft edges to the palate. Briny, lightly vegetal flavors of citrus fruit and bell pepper finish with just enough acid to make this worthwhile.
Name: Palma Real 2017 MontePalma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: There seems to a rubbery onion character here that's somewhat masking the guava, passionfruit and pineapple characters. The palate is rich but crisp at the same time, with tongue-tingling acidity.
Name: Totara 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly darker shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling shows dried apple, wet hay and orange touches on the nose. The palate offers apple, pear and lime flavors, but without much texture or energy.
Name: Ballard Lane 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: A reductive onion note initially masks this wine. Eventually, as the wine aerates it shows citrus fruit, dried green herbs and tomato leaf. Things improve a bit on the palate where a citrus tone plays alongside juicy acidity, but overall this is an austere and simple style.
Name: Konrad 2017 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromas of bell pepper and asparagus would rate as lightly vegetal in most books. A chunky, full palate is low on acidic verve, while a highly pyrazinic flavor profile means this tastes of green citrus and veggies. Mild bitterness and a note of citrus skins lead a plump, chunky finish.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2017 Pequeñas Producciones Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This needs time in glass to aerate and to show its passionfruit, pineapple, grapefruit and green herbed characters. Even then, the acidity is a little searing, just barely kept in check by some fruit weight.
Name: Crowded House 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Light in color and flavor, this wine smells tangy and citrus-like, and tastes lean and low in fruit and acidity. It's clean and simple in character.
Name: Fetzer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This wine is viscous and sweetly ripe in baked apple and honey flavors, with a thickness that persists.
Name: Hailstone Vineyards 2017 32 Degrees Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A softly herbal wine, this offers crisp citrus flavors as well as riper white fruits. Plenty of acidity maintains freshness. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Univitis 2017 Grand Théatre Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Prickly lime and pine needle aromas set up a lean palate with sharp acidity. Tart, punchy citrus and passion fruit flavors finish with lasting tang and grip from green tannins.
Name: Vistamar 2018 Brisa Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This is a fairly typical Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc nose, veering more down the citrus and green vegetal lane than the tropical one. Notes of grapefruit, nettles, lime, green bell pepper and ground white pepper are slightly overpowered on the palate by searing acidity that's only barely balanced by some textural roundness.
Name: Chimney Creek 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Unmistakably Marlborough, this wine is an extroverted mélange of guava, pineapple and peach, with some characteristic grassiness in the background. Overall there's plenty of refreshment to be had here.
Name: Rakiura Bay 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's bit of a rubbery cabbage quality to this wine that's overwhelming the fruit characters. When you do find the lemon and pineapple notes, they're lacking some freshness and come with a lot of acidity on the palate. Overall, the disjointed nature of this wine is hard to shake.
Name: Pikorua 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A fat style of Sauvignon Blanc, this offers rounded yellow and white fruits cut with just enough acidity. A rich wine, it is ready to drink.
Designation: L'Heritage du Marquis de Greyssac Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Univitis 2017 L'Heritage du Marquis de Greyssac Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A pinched, briny nose is punchy and includes aromas of citrus peel. A narrow palate is tight but low on depth, while this tastes peppery and green, with little fruit character. On the finish, bitter green flavors are once again lacking in fruit.
Name: Errazuriz 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

Description: A yeasty nose is less than fresh and indicates a wine in decline. A grabby palate with the feel of grape skins tastes wheaty, grassy and fruitless. Low acidity on the finish confirms that this is fading.
Name: Fitz Roy 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Light aromas of tropical fruit and herb carry a slight metallic note. The flavor concentration is quite light, making this simple and straightforward.
Name: Original House Wine 2017 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (America)

Description: This wine is offers pungent aromas of banana, gooseberry and gummy bears. The palate brings more of that intense banana along with Macintosh apple and pineapple. Zippy lime acidity flows through out ending on a grapefruit pith and green banana note.
Name: Messina Hof 2017 Dry Cuvée Sauvignon Blanc (Texas)

Description: The allure of caramel and smoke hits first, after which a cloud of the purest apricot essence reaches the senses. The viscous palate tingles with disarmingly sharp acidity, balanced by incredibly luscious sweetness. Layer upon layer of apricot, passion fruit and candied lemon unleashes itself in this clean, precise TBA. It offers marvel concentration and purity. Drink until 2040.
Name: Sattlerhof 2013 Trockenbeerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Luminous lemon freshness dominates the nose of passion fruit on this tropical Auslese. Sauvignon Blanc's varietal greenness—think tomato leaf and grass—edge and shape the wonderfully luscious midpalate, while spiky, sharp freshness delivers satisfying thrill. What lovely, flavor-bursting passion fruit tension. This crackles with life.
Name: Weixelbaum 2016 Wahre Werte Wechselberg Himmel Auslese Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Description: Named after Alphonse Edmond, the father of present owner of Alphonse Mellot, this is the top wine from an always-impressive estate. Richness and concentration almost overwhelm the wine at this young stage, showing that it is set for aging. The acidity and biodynamically grown fruit of this powerful wine need to open up. Drink from 2020.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Edmond  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from a densely planted vineyard, with nearly 7,000 vines per acre. Low yields and superripe fruit have yielded a concentrated wine, intense with white fruits and acidity. Age this wine until 2019, to let its richness mature.
Name: Château de Tracy 2015 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Serge Dagueneau works with his three daughters at this family property, celebrating their heritage in this wine. Made from late-harvest grapes with some noble rot, it is extra rich while remaining completely dry. Flavors of yellow fruits and peppered apples show strongly against the powerful acidity and final touch of honey. Drink this delicious wine from 2019.
Name: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 Les Filles  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Almost tropical in its fruitiness, this wine, with one year in bottle, is generous, rich and open. Yes, it still shows a hint of minerality and herbal tanginess. But it is now a full wine packed with citrus and apricot flavors. Drink now.
Name: Jonathan Didier Pabiot 2016 Eurythmie  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A single-vineyard wine from one of the highest points in Sancerre, this is concentrated and dense, full of taut fruit and rich acidity. Apple flavors are cut with tangy, spicy citrus lifted by the taut aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2016 La Demoiselle  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine is richly endowed with ripe yellow and quince flavors, tightly textured and concentrated. The fruit dominates although there is also room for the tight texture that will soften. Drink this rich wine from 2019.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Le Paradis  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a new cuvée from Alphonse Mellot, derived from old vines in Chavignol. Like with all the Mellot wines, the fruit is ripe, organically grown and very pure. The structure and concentration will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Satellite  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from vines on the edge of the village of Chavignol, one of the top sites in Sancerre. Balanced and mineral driven, it is structured with acidity and tangy, tight texture. The wine also offers apricot and white stone-fruit flavors finishing with concentrated acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2016 La Comtesse  (Sancerre)

Description: Etienne Henri Bourgeois pioneered oak aging in Sancerre. Made in exceptional years, this wine is aged in oak, giving it a smooth texture and an attractive touch of spice. It is just reaching maturity, with the white fruits and toast beautifully integrated. Drink now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Cuvée Etienne Henri  (Sancerre)

Description: This is an exotic, 100% varietal wine given impressive time to mature before release. It's worth the wait. Flinty, it offers plenty of body around a wealth of well-developed pineapple, grapefruit and lemon-squeeze flavors, finishing in balance and with lingering complexity.
Name: Animo 2016 Heritage Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Opulent and rich, this wine offers intense, ripe yellow-fruit flavors and crisp citrus acidity that are enhanced by the concentrated texture. It is just now ready to drink but will age further, at least until 2022. Its name refers to the Romans who came to Sancerre.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling, which includes 12% Sémillion, starts with fresh and snappy aromas of wet grass, ripe passion fruit and cold rain—a stunning aromatic combo. The palate is extremely zippy, with powerful acid slicing through flavors of lemongrass, lime and wet stone.
Name: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2017 Piocho Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Using wild yeasts and biodynamically grown grapes, this wine is intense and impressive. The richness is restrained by taut minerality and acidity, cutting through the ripe white and citrus fruits to give balance and the potential for further aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jonathan Didier Pabiot 2016 Prédilection  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This wine celebrates the 19 generations (mostly called Alphonse) that have run this top Sancerre estate since the 17th century. The wine offers ripe fruit, bold quince and spice flavors, with hints of apricot. Structured and concentrated, it is a wine to savor, but not before 2019.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Génération Dix-Neuf  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from a steep, southeast-facing vineyard close to the castle of Beaujeu. Particularly rich, it offers tropical fruits that show strongly through the acidity. There is an urgency to the texture, taut and still young. The wine proves the aging ability of fine Sancerre. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Brochard 2016 Le Cul de Beaujeu  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from a small walled vineyard next to a townhouse with little towers, called locally in jest Château Paladi. Ripe with apple and lime fruits, the wine is crisply textured and balanced, with a flinty character. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2015 Clos du Château Paladi  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Named after the shells that are the basis of the chalk soil of Sancerre, this wine is ripe and full. The aging in large wooden barrels has softened the shock of Sauvignon Blanc, resulting in a citrus and apple-flavored wine that is now ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2016 Ammonites  (Sancerre)

Description: Lightly and judiciously wood aged, this wine is smooth, rounded with a poised balance between its acidity and generous yellow fruits. The period of wood and then bottle aging has softened and filled out the fruit, giving the wine a ripe character. Drink now.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2015 La Grande Châtelaine  (Sancerre)

Description: As the name suggests, this wine is made using natural yeasts. It comes from a parcel in the small village of Tracy, close to the Loire river. The wine is ripe and full of fruit, with a tangy, orange-zest aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Indigène  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Named after grandmother Léontine, this wine is made to be aged. It is still maturing, hinting at fullness to come. Spice and generous apple flavors are cut with acidity and a rich texture. As the develops further, it will fill out and become more powerful. Drink from 2019.
Name: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 La Léontine  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This steep slope of vines dominates the village of Chavignol, home to the Bourgeois family. An aromatic wine, it is crisp, textured and full of citrus and gooseberry flavors. This beautiful wine is still young, so wait to drink until 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2017 La Côte des Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: From a southern-exposure, 3.7-acre vineyard, this presents a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc. It has all the minerality the chalk soil can give, at the same time offering ripe citrus and zesty acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Clos du Roy  (Sancerre)

Description: Based in the notable wine village of Bué, this producer has made a rich wine, partially aged in wood. Intensely juicy with tropical fruits cut with citrus and hints of toast, the wine is full, ripe and already delicious. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2016 Grand Cuvée  (Sancerre)

Description: From the oldest vines in the estate, this is an intense, rich and still-young wine. Its currant and citrus acidity are concentrated and show great depth. Juicy acidity blends into the mineral character of the wine. Let it mature and drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2016 Le Grand Rochoy  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine has great richness. It is produced using natural yeasts from selected parcels. Ripe and full of concentrated white fruits and tense acidity, it needs aging to soften the intensity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Sauvage  (Sancerre)

Description: Like all Alphonse Mellot wines, this is produced from biodynamically grown grapes. That enhances the pure and dense fruit texture, the minerality and extreme richness. It needs to age, and will be best from 2020.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Les Herses  (Sancerre)

Description: Set on one of the majestic, steep slopes in Sancerre, this vineyard produces strongly mineral wines. This bottling is maturing well, softening the intense texture while leaving a tangy character. Rich white fruits are fully integrated with the acidity to give an ample wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Brochard 2016 Côte des Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine, produced like all Laporte wines from organically grown grapes, is impressive in its ripe fruit and minerality from the flinty soil. Still young, it has a tight texture but its style and balance already shine. With powerful citrus, orange zest and lime juice flavors, the wine needs to age and fully integrate. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2017 Le Rochoy Terre de Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: One of a series of single-vineyard wines from this producer, this wine's name is a reminder that the Romans were here. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine offers pure, strong acidity as well as intense white fruits. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: Based in Pouilly-sur-Loire, this producer has crafted a full, rich wine. With its touch of toastiness and a smoky edge, the wine is full of ripe citrus fruit that is cut with zesty acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2017 Les Angelots  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This wine comes from possibly the most famous vineyard in Sancerre with an impossibly steep slope. Tight, textured and rich, it is still young and firm, with a strong mineral character. It needs to age, so wait for this rich, spicy wine until 2020.
Name: Domaine Roger & Christophe Moreux 2017 Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: Densely textured, this ripe wine still has plenty of freshness. Although it rich and packed with citrus and white fruits, it also has a strong mineral character that needs to soften. Age this wine until 2019.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)
