Description: Harvested from a small parcel, less than four acres, this wine is in perfect condition. It is balanced, with white fruit and citrus coming together, led by the acidity. It is developing into a full, ripe wine. Wait until 2019.
Name: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 Clos des Chaudoux  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This producer, now in its 10th generation, sources the grapes for this wine from a seven-acre vineyard on clay and chalk soils. Made from biodynamically grown grapes, this rich wine is full of generous apple and apricot flavors that are now mature enough to drink. The wine could also age, so drink now or until 2022.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Le Clos de Bannon  (Sancerre)

Description: Based in Les Loges, one of the small settlements around Pouilly-sur-Loire, this father-and-son team has made a rich, intense wine that shows the aging potential of Pouilly Fumé. It has power, ripe white fruits and concentrated acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jonathan Didier Pabiot 2016 Aubaine  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Named after the Pierre Etienne Mellot, founder of the dynasty in 1513, this wine comes from flinty soil. Its strongly mineral character has been tamed by wood aging. The result is a rich, peppery, balanced wine that is intense, generous and ready to drink now and until 2022.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2015 Cuvée Pierre Etienne  (Sancerre)

Description: This soft, smooth wine offers ripe fruit and an attractive edge of spice as well as freshness. White stone fruits are cut with tight minerality, leaving a beautiful wine that needs to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Patrice Moreux 2017 La Loge aux Moines  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Even after two years, this wine is still young, serving as a reminder that great Sancerre needs time. For now, the tight apple and citrus fruits are intense and need to soften. Drink this wine from 2019 and the richness and beautiful fruit will be shining.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: This is called “premier” because the grapes in this wine were the first to ripen in 2016. It has a perfumed character with good acidity to balance the tangy, herbal fruits. The texture and the fruit are now fully integrated and this wine is ready to drink.
Name: Bouchié-Chatellier 2016 Premier Millésimé  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This wine has a good balance between rich apple flavors and tight acidity and minerality, reveling in the warm 2017 vintage. The texture is taut, but the young wine will soften in a few months to offer smoothness and roundness. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2017  Sancerre

Description: The extra richness of a Pouilly Fumé is very apparent in this wine. Its ripe white fruits are tense, tangy while also full bodied and, even after three years, still very young. That bold fruitiness needs to soften further, so drink from 2019.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Grande Cuvée  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Intense, fruity and now ready to drink, this wine comes from some of the old parcels of the Bourgeois estate. It is rich while remaining crisp, with a flinty edge that gives it a good texture.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

Description: A grip of reduction on the nose in tones of flint and matchstick is consistent for the producer's style. On the palate are light-bodied layers of green olive, pineapple, peach and lemon, a contrasting set of fruit and savory elements that work seamlessly together.
Name: Grgich Hills 2016 Fumé Blanc Estate Grown Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a well-integrated white wine, made in an unabashedly full-bodied manner that displays ample fruit. Fig, vanilla and a thread of lemon zest give it plenty of flavor and crowd-pleasing personality.
Name: Black Stallion 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This rich, tropical-fruit-flavored wine is generous and full of delicious apricot, mango and pineapple flavors. As a contrast, a strong mineral edge comes from the limestone soil. This is still a young, deliciously fruity wine, but it will be better from 2019.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2017 La Terre des Anges  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine is all about fresh, tangy and grassy fruit. With a distinct texture and strong minerality, it is tight and needs to age. It comes from one of the top vineyards in Sancerre. Drink from 2020.
Name: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: An intensely aromatic, invigorating wine with notes of freshly cut grass, lime zest and smoke. The palate is fresh and pristine, offering loads of cutting gooseberry and lime flavors. Offers all the vibrant fruit of New World Sauvignon Blanc but is more sprightly and mineral in character.
Name: Pflüger 2017 Quarzit Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Pfalz)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from the extremely coastal Jespersen Ranch shows what a truly cool climate can do for Sauvignon Blanc. It's tightly woven but approachable on the nose, with aromas of honeydew, kiwi and wet stone. The palate is incredibly zippy, offering chalky flavors of apple and pear. A lime rind tartness holds the finish.
Name: Niner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: This rich wine has not lost its acidity or mineral-driven white fruits. With a touch of pepper on the palate from the alcohol, the wine is full, dense and will be better from 2019.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2017 Clos Paradis  (Sancerre)

Description: With an edge of tangy fruit, this wine is ripe, concentrated and intensely textured. Its strong citrus fruits, great acidity, concentrated minerality and zesty freshness are still developing. It needs time to round out and become even richer. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2017 Les Grandmontains  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean, crisp and reminiscent of springtime on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of lime blossom, wet cement, scratched pomelo skin and cut grass. The palate is extremely energetic and makes the mouth tingle while delivering flavors of lemongrass and lime.
Name: Gainey 2017 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: The heavier, clay soil that is found in parts of Sancerre is the origin of this rich wine. It is one of a pair of wines (the other highlighting chalk soil) and shows how terroir-driven Sancerre's Sauvignon Blanc wines can be. Ripe white fruits are cut with acidity, still youthful and needing to soften. Drink from 2019.
Name: Michel Vattan 2017 Cuvée Argile  (Sancerre)

Description: As its name indicates, this wine comes from chalk soil. Crisp minerality is the order of the day, with intense acidity, layers of citrus and a zesty, bright texture. There is a herbal element that will soften. Drink from 2019.
Name: Michel Vattan 2017 Cuvée Calcaire  (Sancerre)

Description: From one of the top vineyards in Bué, this wine has pure, rounded and rich apple and green-plum flavors. It is a powerful concentrated wine from a vineyard that produces ripe fruit. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Le Chêne Marchand  (Sancerre)

Description: A warm wine rich in white fruits and with open acidity, this instantly attractive wine will also age. Like all wines from this producer, it is made with natural yeasts, while the old vines add natural concentration. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Description: A rounded wine, this offers a good balance between acidity and ripe white fruits. A nervy edge adds a youthful texture that gives shape to the wine. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2017 Thauvenay  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine is a selection from vines grown on limestone. After a year in bottle, it has developed stature and richness, offering ripe white fruit as well as delicious final acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Paul Thomas 2016 Les Comtesses  (Sancerre)

Description: Packed with ripe white and yellow fruits, this entry-level wine in the Vacheron range is impressive in its own right. Its richness comes from the intense fruit that contrasts with the final mineral texture. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2017  Sancerre

Description: Named after the chapel once part of an Augustinian monastery, this single-vineyard wine is rich with intense green gooseberries and minerality from the flinty soil. The wine is still young, rich but and needing to develop. Drink from 2020.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Chapelle des Augustins  (Sancerre)

Description: This smooth, ripe wine is full of creamed apple and spicy pear flavors. It comes from an organic vineyard on chalky, stony soil. Apart from its generous character, the wine also has a young, mineral texture that will soften soon. Drink from 2019.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2017 Domaine des Emois  (Sancerre)

Description: This ripe wine full of white fruits as well as citrus comes from silex flint soil, which gives minerality to the fruit. The wine is tense and edgy, lined with final acidity. It will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Le Roi des Pierres 2017  Sancerre

Description: Now aged three years, this wine is ripe and generous. It has lost its initial taut character and filled out with tropical fruits over rich acidity and just the lightest mineral texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Gibault 2015 Le Graal Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine Chenonceaux)

Description: This wine has the weight to be expected in a Pouily Fumé as well as the flinty texture that comes with the terroir. Just ready, this wine will be even better from 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Demoiselle de Bourgeois  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This medium-bodied white brings a stony mineral texture, with fleshy flavors of guava and mango. It offers complexity and nuance against a full embrace of ripeness.
Name: Ziata 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine may still be young, but it already offers rich fruits, creamed pear and hints of peach. These are cut by acidity and the a flinty texture typical of Pouilly Fumé. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Bouchié-Chatellier 2017 Le Renardière  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: From a small parcel of vines next to the producer's cellar, this ripe wine is full of rich white fruits that are cut with acidity. It is well balanced and really crisp. Drink now.
Name: Daniel Reverdy & Fils 2016 Le Clos de Chaudenay  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine with an attractive bite is still young, with a tight texture and plenty of ripe fruit. Lemon and spice flavors are shot through with acidity and a strongly zesty character. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Bel Air 2017 Cuvée Riquette  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This 37-acre estate managed by Annick Tinel-Blondelet has produced a juicy wine with open white fruits and good acidity. Called after the original name for the Sauvignon Blanc grape, it has great fruitiness, a taut texture and is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Tinel-Blondelet 2017 Génétin  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is an extra-rich wine, concentrated with ripe fruits. It is still young with no holds barred in its power and intensity. With its dense texture and upfront fruit, it needs to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2016 Grande Cuvée  (Sancerre)

Description: From old vines, this rich wine is beautifully concentrated and fruity. Apples and crisp green plums go with citrus to give a wine that has delicious potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Francis Blanchet 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very easy-to-like aromas of lemon rind, lime pith and light apple blossom make for a refreshing and pleasurable entry to this bottling. There is great grip to the sip, where wet cement minerality meets with grapefruit-juice flavors.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: Big in luscious flavor and ample body and ripeness, this white shines in pear, honeysuckle and vanilla cream, fermented and aged in neutral French oak barrels. It is fleshy and well integrated, with a moderate streak of supportive acidity.
Name: Crosby Roamann 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: Fresh yellow peach and apple flavors are accented with cashew, green plum and lime zest in this dry but intensely fruity Sauvignon Blanc. It's a full-bodied yet zesty wine marked by a fresh, lingering finish.
Name: Schnaitmann 2013 Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Württemberg)

Description: Made with the addition of 9% Viognier grown in Bennett Valley, this is a pleasing white layered in lushness and strong flavors of pineapple and mango. The tropical nature doesn't preclude brightness and balance, ending in a flourish of white flowers.
Name: Blue Rock 2017 Baby Blue Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Named after a legendary oak tree, this wine is full of ripe tropical and spice flavors. Its rich character is balanced with sophisticated acidity. Densely textured, the wine could do with a few more months, so drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Anthony Girard 2018 Le Chène Fourchu  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Well integrated with a subtle fist of power, this wine is fleshy and fruit forward in apple and lime with a stony mineral edge. A twinge of fresh grapefruit flavor brightens the glass and adds to the overall complexity.
Name: Illumination 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Description: This wine comes from a four-acre parcel of stony soil. Closed and tight as is typical of young Pouilly Fumé, it promises rich white fruits for the future. Ripe and well structured, it will be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Caillottes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A ripe wine, full of apple and tropical fruit, this is a rich style of Sancerre. Still young with its mineral texture intact, it has delicious fruit, finely balanced acidity and an opulent character. Drink from 2019.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2017 Les Belles Côtes  (Sancerre)

Description: This is the home domaine of what has become a large negociant house. The wine is all about fruit, crisp and full of citrus and white stone-fruit flavors, with intense acidity. Drink now.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2017 Domaine de la Perrière  (Sancerre)

Description: This young wine is still full of crisp fresh fruits. The texture is tight, mineral from the flint soil and nervy. Drink from 2020.
Name: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Silex  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This wine comes from old vines planted on flinty soil. The terroir gives a strongly mineral edge to the crisp, ripe white fruits. It has a rich character, the creamed-apple flavors edged with a touch of apricot. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Roland Tissier et Fils 2016 Etincelle  (Sancerre)

Description: This tense, dense wine is still young. Its pure line in acidity is emphasized by the concentration and strong minerality. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Francis Blanchet 2017 Silice  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This half-stainless- and half-neutral-oak-fermented wine takes a gentle approach to this variety. The natural acidity and herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc is softened here with 10 g/L of residual sugar. The wine is round and fruity, with a mix of preserved lemon, white peach and pineapple. Drink slightly chilled.
Name: Huett 2017 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Crisp, herbal and apple flavored, this perfumed wine is ripe, full in the mouth and still young. It has great acidity and a tight mineral texture. The wine comes from 25-year-old vines that add concentration to the fruits. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gueneau 2017 Les Terres Blanches  (Sancerre)

Description: Named after the Roman villa that once existed in Pouilly-sur-Loire (and which gave its name to Pouilly), this wine comes from old vines giving concentrated citrus and green-fruit flavors. Bright, crisp and tangy, the wine could do with some aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2017 Villa Paulus  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This wine comes from a parcel of vines planted on flint soil close to the Loire river. It is tense and mineral, with swathes of rich citrus, lively acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Paul Thomas 2017 Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: One of a series of wines that the producers calls Les Parcellaires, single-vineyard wines, this is an impressively perfumed wine, exotic in character. It is rich with just the lightest hints of purer acidity. Drink the wine now.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2016 Les Chasseignes  (Sancerre)

Description: A ripe wine, full of delicious fruit flavors and acidity, this has a chalky texture as well as rich white fruits tightly cut with acidity. It is ready to drink.
Name: Vincent Grall 2016 Le Manoir  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine is rich and full of apple flavors along with warm acidity. Like many wines from this appellation, it is still young after a year and needs to open up its ripe fruits. Drink from 2019.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2017  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: The Favray estate is one parcel of 39 acres, producing a taut, mineral and citrus-fruit-driven wine. Still young, his potentially rich wine has intense acidity that needs to soften. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Favray 2017  Pouilly-Fumé

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Vibrant aromas of grapefruit spray, papaya and tomato leaf carry to the textured, light-bodied palate. This is immensely crisp and refreshing in feel, with crunchy green pear and citrus ringing on the finish.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: This wine needs aging. Its tight texture, although rich, is also taut and mineral. With herbal acidity and a tangy aftertaste, it shows excellent potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2017 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Description: This small appellation west of Sancerre produces a style of wine that is softer and cooler than its big-name neighbor. That makes for a wine, like this, that is charming and smooth when young, with its attractive citrus character rounded out. Drink now.
Name: Bougrier 2017 Domaine des Brangers  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: Ripe apple and pear fruit are comfortably blended with more citric flavors in this structured wine. It has good fruitiness, a tight mineral structure and the potential for aging. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Domaine Roger & Christophe Moreux 2017 Les Bouffants  (Sancerre)

Description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, like all the wines from this producer, this open wine provides a good introduction to the company's impressive range. Citrus fruits are laced with ripe apples and crisp pears cut with minerality. Drink now.
Name: Jonathan Didier Pabiot 2017 Florilège  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Named after the small limestone pebbles widely found in Sancerre, this wine has a young, mineral texture and is full of green fruits. It is crisp and herbal, with bright acidity that gives a delicious final zing. Drink now.
Name: Cave des Vins de Sancerre 2017 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from a plateau of chalk exposed south. That location gives the wine its soft texture and creamed-apple and lime flavors. It has a light feel, with poise and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Chasseignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Pascal Gibault has a great ability to produce ripe Sauvignon Blanc, profiting from south-facing slope vines. This wine, still young, is rich, perfumed and full bodied. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gibault 2015 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine Chenonceaux)

Description: A perfumed, herbal aroma leads to a crisply textured, tangy wine. With a strongly grassy character, this wine is taut and and right up front. It needs a few months to calm down; drink from 2019.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Côte de Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This producer's entry-level Sancerre offers a fresh balance of apple and citrus flavors, with hints of almonds and lively acidity. An immediately attractive wine, it is ready to drink.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: From a vineyard that has a mix of chalk and stones, this wine is rounded, smoothly textured with ripe white fruits. This gentle character is cut by more tangy acidity to give a textured, tight finish. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2017 Marnes et Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From an estate vineyard and aged in both stainless steel and foudre, this wine has strong elements of peach and lychee, with underlying floral components of white flower and jasmine. Medium bodied and balanced, it's fresh and fruity.
Name: Mauritson 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This soft, full wine has ripe apple flavors. Acidity and rich fruitiness give an intense wine that is both refreshing and steely textured. Drink from early 2019.
Designation: Domaine de la Rablais Cuvée St-Georges
Name: Paris-Simoneau 2017 Domaine de la Rablais Cuvée St-Georges Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: Light, bright and still fresh, this is a fruity wine. Its acidity, green fruits and light texture push it forward and lead to a refreshing, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Sur le Fort  (Sancerre)

Description: Under the same ownership as Domaine Tinel-Blondelet, this estate has made a crisply textured wine, intense with acidity and still very young. Its freshness and brightness need to soften, so drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine La Croix Canat 2017 Chantepleure  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Malmbray is the home village of the Roblin winery. The Kimmeridgian chalk soil gives intensely crisp wines, like this, that are full of taut citrus and herbal flavors. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2017 Enclos de Malmbray  (Sancerre)

Description: This remains one of the best wine values on the planet: a Loire-style, stainless-steel fermented beauty that the winery has been making for 46 years. Guava, peach and apricot surround buzzy acidity in a crowd-pleasing quaff of undeniable quality and freshness.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: All about ripe, tropical fruits and freshness, this is an immediately attractive wine. It is open, easy and developing quickly. Already the bright fruits and tangy acidity are forward and refreshing. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2017 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

Description: This small vineyard region on the banks of the Cher river is devoted exclusively to Sauvignon Blanc. The producer, one of the top names in the area, has made a ripe, juicy and fruity wine. Richness balances the crisp citrus flavors and delicious tight acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2017  Quincy

Description: A blend from three vineyards, this rounded wine is rich in apple and green-plum flavors, with an edge of spiciness. It is rich enough to be ready to drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2017  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: From a densely planted vineyard, this soft wine has ripe pink-grapefruit and taut lime flavors, with a strongly mineral texture. It is very much up front, and needs time to settle. Drink from 2019.
Name: Roger Champault & Fils 2017 Les Pierris  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh lime and wet stone meet with reductive grassy aromas and a touch of pear on the nose of this bottling. It's very tangy on the palate, showing citrus and apple cider elements.
Name: Stolpman 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Ballard Canyon)

Description: This white has a Muscat-like quality, a sweetness of peach, fig and apricot that's exotic and pronounced. Jasmine plays expertly on the nose.
Name: Theorize 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This fruity wine is attractively textured and crisp, with a strong mineral edge that gives a bit of bite. Full of red-currant flavors and with final acidity, it will be better from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2017  Sancerre

Description: Produced by the Millet family, this ripe wine with touches of minerality is about rich fruits and balanced acidity. Hints of apricots and pineapple balance the citrus thread that goes through the wine. Drink now.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2017 French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a crisp, clear and freshly focused wine, direct in its lemon freshness and strong flavors of grapefruit, green apple and tenacious acidity.
Name: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This soft, ripe wine has attractive layers of apricot fruitiness as well as crisper citrus acidity. Together these two flavors give the wine delicious freshiness and zesty acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Bougrier 2017 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: A smoothly textured wine, this is soft and full of ripe white fruits. Its acidity and grassy character are controlled by the wine's richness. Balanced and finishing with crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Bel Air 2017  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: This bottling shows a full, fat style of Sauvignon Blanc, although the wine hasn't lost all its freshness and has kept some citrus flavors. Its richness reflects the warm vintage, ripe and full in the mouth. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2017 Les Godons  (Sancerre)

Description: There are plenty of cailloux (stones) in Pouilly Fumé and this wine shows the steel and minerality that results from this soil. Very crisp while also with a richer element, this wine needs to age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe tones of banana and melon meld with an underscore of chalk dust on the nose. This shows some textural weight on the palate, broadened out by juicy tropical fruit on the midpalate and elongated by a zesty line of acidity.
Name: Hosmer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Cayuga Lake)

Description: The flint soil of this wine's vineyard has given it a tight minerality. It also offers plenty of crisp citrus and apple fruits, with a herbal hint. The wine is made to drink young and is ready now.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2017 La Chatellenie  (Sancerre)

Description: This well-balanced wine has both structure and freshness. It has a crisp edge to the ripe white fruits and zesty aftertaste. This wine is ready to drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2017  Sancerre

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty aromas of lemon rind, white flowers and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite broad, ranging from nectarine to citrus, which will please a wide variety of tastes.
Name: Westerly 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This young wine is already attractive with its fruitiness and ripe acidity. A touch of tangy acidity as well as the taut texture suggests it will age for another few months. The name of the wine refers to the number of people needed each day to work the parcel of vines. Drink from 2019.
Name: Cherrier Frères 2017 Les 7 Hommes  (Sancerre)

Description: This fruity wine is packed with tangy orange and grapefruit. Its acidity is emphasized by the youth of the wine, which will soften over the next few months. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Tinel-Blondelet 2017 Arrêt Buffate  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Based in the small village of Les Berthiers, this wine family has produced a classic wine. It has acidity, with a tense and mineral texture that's balanced with bright white fruits and citrus. Drink now.
Name: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2017 Tradition  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Lively acidity and crisp fruits mark out this attractive wine. It conveys citrus and bright lemon fruitiness, with a fresh aftertaste. Drink this lightly textured wine now.
Name: Vincent Grall 2017  Sancerre

Description: This crisp and fruity wine is lightly herbal. It also offers lemon and gooseberry flavors along with considerable acidity. The aftertaste reveals a richer side that shows concentration. Drink now.
Designation: Domaine des Brosses Sécrets des Tronbochards
Name: Alain Girard et Fils 2017 Domaine des Brosses Sécrets des Tronbochards  (Sancerre)

Description: Young and alive with herbal as well as fruit textures, this wine from one of the top Sancerre vineyards is right up front. The citrus fruits, mineral texture and considerable acidity will come together to give the wine good potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Anthony & David Girard 2017 Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: A pure, crisp texture and herbal flavors shine from this wine. Its acidity and still-young citrus flavors are right up front and need a few months to soften. It will be a delicious wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2017 Origine  (Sancerre)

Description: Crisp, fruity and with a strongly herbal character, this wine has a rich texture from the lees aging before bottling. Hints of riper white fruits will develop as it ages for another few months. Drink from 2019.
Name: Les Celliers de Pauline 2017 Cuvée Eric Louis  (Sancerre)

Description: This ripe and fruity wine is softly textured, with only a hint of minerality. Broad white fruits are freshly cut by citrus to give a lifted character to the fullness of the wine. Drink now.
Name: Roland Tissier et Fils 2017 Tradition  (Sancerre)

Description: This easygoing, fruity wine has a soft texture and plenty of acidity. It is balanced between the crisp citrus fruit and ripe apples while the mineral texture shows in the background. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Brochard 2017 Tradition  (Sancerre)

Description: Open, ripe and soft, this lightly yeasty wine is developing quickly. Tangy citrus and apple flavors are balanced by a touch of spice as well as a zesty aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Patrice Moreux 2017  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: This bright, fruity wine offers lively acidity and an almost chalky texture. It is taut and crisp, a classic Sauvignon Blanc from the village of Verdigny. Drink now.
Name: Daniel Reverdy & Fils 2017  Sancerre

Description: This wine has layers of citrus and crisp fruits under ripe apricot and sweet apple flavors. A tangy texture gives shape to this attractive wine, although it is really all about fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Patureaux 2017  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Named after the cherry trees that once grew where the vineyard is now, this wine is textured, crisp and full of layered citrus fruit and acidity. Still young, it will be better from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gueneau 2017 Les Griottes  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine is definitely on the tropical-fruit spectrum of Sauvignon Blanc flavors. So apricot and white-nectarine flavors are right up front in this ripe wine. It's all fruit, with a tangy edge of citrus to give freshness. Drink now.
Name: Encosta do Sobral 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: A wholly owned Mellot walled vineyard in this small region west of Sancerre is the source of this crisp wine. It is light and bright with mineral texture while not losing fruitiness. Drink this refreshing wine now.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2017 Clos du Pressoir  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: Fleshy and full-bodied, this 100% varietal white offers notions of sweet peach, baked pineapple, biscuit and honeycomb. The texture is thick and viscous.
Name: Mathew Bruno 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp, clear and moderate in structure, this wine offers a medium-bodied take on ripeness and body structure, allowing for fleshy flavors of guava and fig to present themselves with ease.
Name: Burnside Road 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: A soft wine with quince and ripe red-apple flavors, this is open and packed with fruit. The acidity is there, adding freshness and finishing this rounded wine with a crisp lift. Drink now.
Name: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2017 La Reine Blanche  (Sancerre)

Description: This open, ripe wine conveys a warm, rich character. Tropical fruits dominate, with just a touch of spice and minerality, plus acidity in the background. The wine is young, but is ready to drink although it will be even better from 2019.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2017 Le Troncsec  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: The style of Sancerre's smaller neighbor is less intense when young and, like this wine, readily drinkable in the year after harvest. A crisp texture is nicely integrated into ripe apple and yellow-fruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Loriot 2017  Menetou-Salon

Description: Les Loges is one of the focal points of fine Pouilly Fumé. This wine has some of the richness associated with the area while at the same time being easy and accessible. White fruits dominate and the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Pierre Marchand & Fils 2017 Les Loges  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This rich wine is smoothly textured. After an extra year, the wine has lost its brightness and has spread out into mature fruits, almonds and a touch of yeast. Drink now.
Name: Patrice Moreux 2016  Sancerre

Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling offers light citrus, burned toast and wet cement aromas. Sour Granny Smith apple flavors show on the palate, which offers a touch of tension.
Name: Bianchi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Description: A blend of wines from across Sancerre, this wine is soft, with rich yellow fruits as well as citrus. It offers warm fruitiness, fully integrated acidity and texture that is lightly mineral at the end. Drink now.
Name: Cave des Vins de Sancerre 2017 Les Marennes  (Sancerre)

Description: With a light touch, bright acidity and layers of mineral acidity, this wine is packed with fruitiness that contrasts with the tight texture. Drink this pure, crisp wine now.
Name: Domaine Armand Gaston 2017  Menetou-Salon

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fruit for this wine comes mainly from Touraine. In the hands of a master from Sancerre, the naturally herbal character of Touraine Sauvignon is tamed and given richness. Fruit and minerality come through strongly. Drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Attitude by Pascal Jolivet Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: A skin-fermented, 100% Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is dark and brooding with a slightly oxidative character that won't appeal to everybody. Concentrated and oaky, it tastes of honey and baked apple with a viscosity that lingers.
Name: Crosby Roamann 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is herbal and crisp, with a tight edge of minerality. Juicy currants and freshly sliced green fruits dominate this lightly textured wine. Drink now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2017 Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A sharp nose of crushed limestone, tomato leaf and citrus zest makes for a bracing start. The palate is equally stony and tense in feel, with a plethora of tart citrus flavors.
Name: Fulkerson 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: This softly textured, fruity wine has crisp apple flavors and an herbal edge. Citrus zestiness combines with tense acidity and a clean, deliciously fruity character. Drink the wine now.
Name: Paris-Simoneau 2017 Antoine Simoneau Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Vineyards close to the Atlantic Ocean are the source of this bright, herbal wine. It has hints of tropical fruit although the main fruitiness comes from lime and pink-grapefruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Cortes de Cima 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

Description: This aromatic, fruity wine offers good acidity with a lightly herbal touch. Fresh apple and pear flavors are cut with tangy acidity. Drink this crisp, clean wine now.
Name: Paris-Simoneau 2017 Antoine Simoneau Cuvée AS Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This has all the classic Sauvignon Blanc characteristics—fresh-cut grass, green gooseberry, lime leaf and peppery fynbos—in an effervescent, lean and bright package, with high acidity and lively carbonation. Drink now.
Name: Steenberg NV Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: This fresh, light and creamy wine is bright with citrus flavors. Its herbal nature is still young but is attractive for its upfront, fruity character. Drink this wine now.
Designation: Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Bougrier 2017 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This soft, ripe wine is made to be instantly drinkable. The texture hints at minerality while it is also full of rich white fruits, a rounded texture and balanced acidity. Drink now.
Name: Cave des Vins de Sancerre 2017 Les Ruettes  (Sancerre)

Description: Very herbal and crisp, this currant-flavored wine is all fruit and acidity. It has hints of more tropical flavors as well as an attractive perfume. Drink the wine now.
Name: Thierry Delaunay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Aromas of milky white flowers and savory white beans carry to the light-bodied palate and join broader flavors of melon and lemon. There's a pleasing roundness to the midpalate, yet disjointed acidity takes hold on the finish.
Name: Raphael 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (New York)

Description: For a Touraine Sauvignon, this is rich and ripe with tropical fruits as well as the necessary acidity. It is fruity, with a lightly zesty texture and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Paul Buisse 2017 Domaine Paul Buisse Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This light, fruity and herbal wine shows a good balance between citrus and gooseberry fruits and a bright, fresh character. Drink this simple wine now.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: A grassy wine with green fruits and gooseberry flavors, this is light and bright. It has instant freshness and is ready to drink.
Name: Xavier Frissant 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Simple citrus fruits and a strong herbal character are the main elements of this wine that is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc from across the Loire Valley. Light and crisp, it is ready to drink.
Name: Bougrier 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This soft wine is rather indistinct. Its fruit is lightly crisp but out of focus, giving a gentle wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Caves Velhas 2017 Cabeça de Toiro Edicão Limitada Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas don't seem entirely settled at present, showing some reductive notes. The palate is light, tart and tangy. It doesn't stand up on its own but might have a place at the dinner table, though the listed alcohol seems a bit high for that as well.
Name: Maryhill 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Savory elements of canned white beans ride over a fresher core of citrus and lemongrass. While there is some weight and breadth to the palate, it's carried by an astringent lemon peel flavor and a lightly grainy texture.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Tangy, herbal and crisp, this textured wine is very intense and still young. It has plenty of acidity along with gooseberry and underripe lemon flavors. Drink now.
Name: Les Frères Couillaud 2017 Bernier Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This is a fat wine, missing out on the crispness that should come out of Sauvignon Blanc. It is as heavy as the bottle in which it comes.
Name: Vincent Grall 2017 Le Grall  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a taut and bracing wine, with aromas of grapefruit and lime and flavors of lemon and jicama. It's rather light in bodied, but has such a refreshing, almost electric character that it still makes a big impression.
Name: Peltier 2017 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: A whole-cluster pressed white aged in both French oak and stainless steel, this wine is richly woven in lemon verbena, pineapple, quince and grapefruit, its structure complex, lengthy and moderate in acidity.
Name: Jayson 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh spring grass, lemongrass, grapefruit, pear blossom and a hint of flint show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is framed by a compelling texture that's both fleshy with stone fruit and racy with sharper lime rinds, providing great depth.
Name: Daou 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaida District)

Description: This is bright in acidity and nicely textured, with an underlying lushness to the weight of the body. Peach and dried herb show most prominently on the palate, with a smoothness of stony mineral and lentil.
Name: Galerie 2017 Equitem Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is exceptionally smooth and polished, showing a gentle but not too-soft texture that carries fresh apple and lime flavors and subtle oak accents like nutmeg and vanilla. With medium to full body, it feels like a barrel-fermented wine but without obvious oakiness, and shows good layering and concentration.
Name: Pine & Brown 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)

Description: This vineyard-designated white is impressively layered and complex, with integrated acidity and texture to its light-bodied character. Lime, cantaloupe and wet stone give it a fruity complexion met by a note of salty brine.
Name: Gamble Family Vineyards 2017 Gamble Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)

Description: This white has a creamy, lush texture that is complemented by a bright enduring freshness of grapefruit and lime. The full-bodied midpalate fruit profile is defined in tropical guava, apricot and almond paste.
Name: Knights Bridge 2016 Pont de Chevalier Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from Lonesome Springs Ranch Vineyard and was fermented and aged in stainless steel, with rocks from the vineyard included in the tanks. After starting out just a touch reduced, it opens to reveal aromas of kiwi, white grapefruit, mineral and herb. The palate is sleek in style with electric acidity. It's a racy acid white at a terrific price. Pair it with ceviche.
Name: Lobo Hills 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of pear, Pink Lady and Granny Smith apples show on the fresh nose of this wine. The flavors are fresh and vibrant, offering hints of crisp Anjou pear and wild lime.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2017 Flood Family Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Fermented in an egg-shaped clay amphora, this ripe, full wine is a fascinating exercise in bringing old and modern together. Now mature, with a toasty character as well as opulent, ripe tropical fruit, the wine is rich and intense. Drink now.
Name: Vins et Vignobles Castaing 2015 Optimum de Moulin-Pouzy Sauvignon Blanc (Bergerac Sec)

Description: From the producer's grand estate atop Spring Mountain, this is a memorable white, exuberant in apple, stone fruit and lemon peel, with a tease of guava. The acidity is integrated well and complementary to its contoured texture and hint of minerality.
Name: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Aged in French puncheons and concrete, this is an herbal, bright and buzzy white that's medium bodied and complex. Apricot dominates alongside hints of ginger and lemongrass.
Name: Galerie 2017 Naissance Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very grassy aromas of lawn cuttings, juniper and pine oil show on the pungent nose of this zesty bottling. It's intriguing and lively on the sip, with green-fruit skins and more pine-needle tea flavors that keep one coming back for more on a hot day.
Name: Bernardus 2017 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Savory aromas and flavors like fennel bulb, snap pea and cucumber make this medium-bodied wine stand out. It has a good, crisp dash of acidity for balance and excellent fruit concentration that unfolds on the palate.
Name: Bodkin 2017 Musqué Clone Sandy Bend Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Freshly cut lawn, wet cement, sour lime rinds, jalapeno and kelp combine for a very unique and compelling nose on this bottling. The roasted jalapeño note extends to the palate, where white pepper and crushed white-rock flavors make for a memorable sip.
Name: Ex 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Description: With 10% Sémillon, the white aged in neutral barrels, this is a rich, interwoven wine with spicy acidity and bold tropical flavors at its core. A dash or two of ginger and white pepper memorably finishes things out.
Name: Anderson Conn Valley 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a light-bodied, refreshing white, succulent and fruity in pear, apple and fuzzy peach. A thread of minerality plays out as wet stone and lemon peel.
Name: Côte West 2017 Gianquinto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from Boushey Vineyard, this wine was aged in a combination of large format oak and concrete. Aromas of gooseberry, kiwi, pink grapefruit, lemon rind, tropical fruit and herb lead to creamy-feeling fruit flavors supported by well-balanced acidity. A lingering finish caps it off. It's a richer styled interpretation of the variety.
Name: Matthews 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Thick and relatively rich, with a nutty underbelly, this white offers peach and pineapple flavors up front before making room for brighter aspects of lemon peel and grapefruit.
Name: Cosa Obra 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Grassy, herbaceous aromas and tangy citrus flavors give a lively, extroverted personality to this medium-bodied wine. It has good crisp acidity that will make it refreshing on a warm day and especially good with simply prepared seafood and fresh-style cheeses.
Name: Briceland 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a nicely concentrated dry wine that blends fruity and savory aspects and has a good framework of crisp acidity and medium body. Aromas of apple skin and flavors of apple and cucumber are accented by light earthy touches.
Name: Easton 2017 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Apple blossoms, zesty lime sorbet and a flash of honey show on the nose of this bottling. There is just enough grip to the sip, where honey, lemon rind and yellow-apple flavors arise.
Name: Kessler-Haak 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Inviting in floral and lemon peel, this large-production white is textured and balanced in acidity, with a depth of tangerine and apple blossom.
Name: Simi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine was vinified in a mixture of new 300-liter French oak barrels (50%) and stainless steel, with all of the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek Vineyard. Appealing aromas of kiwi, whole pineapple and spice are followed by full-bodied, textured tropical-fruit flavors that lead to a warm finish. The concentration doesn't seem all there, but it is still quite enjoyable.
Name: Tenor 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Time in barrel has softened this wine's intensity and broadened the feel. It boasts flavors of tropical fruit, spice and toast. This wine is well balanced between fruit and oak aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2017 Barrel Selection Branco Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Well-concentrated but still lively and fresh, this medium-bodied wine is just what many people look for. It smells grassy and grapefruity, tastes more ripe and full like honeydew melon, and has a pleasant richness on the palate.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Flinty wet-stone aromas and subtle mineral and fig flavors mark this wine. It tastes clean and crisp, boasting a well-balanced, medium body.
Name: Nola Grace 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Trinchero-made bottling shows lemon sorbet and Pink Lady apple on the clean and easy nose. It's easy and likable on the palate, offering lime sorbet with tangy lemon-rind flavors.
Name: SeaGlass 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Charming aromas of white peach nectar and Mandarin orange mingle with honeysuckle and honeydew. The slick palate feels fresh in zippy flavors of pink grapefruit and lime.
Name: Turdo 2017 Turis Sauvignon Blanc

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wet cement and cut grass make for a very fresh nose on this bottling. The palate is quite grippy in texture, offering lime pith, red pear and more damp sidewalk flavors.
Name: Velvet Bee 2016 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site on Woolsey Road in the appellation, this is a sulfurous, lemony white, aged in both neutral French oak and stainless drums. Textured, it offers powerful concentration, rich tropical flavors and body weight.
Name: Davis Bynum 2017 Jane's Vineyard Virginia's Block Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A bright gold color and assertive oak aromas and flavors make this an unusual example of the variety, but it is appealing nonetheless. The aroma is quite buttery and the flavors resemble toasted almonds and grilled pears while the body is full and viscous.
Name: Waits-Mast 2017 Mariah Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is an abundance of tropical fruit, sweet pear and orange Popsicle aromas on the nose of this bottling. It dries up considerably on the sip, where bright and tight flavors of apple flesh are framed by fairly ripping acidity.
Name: Koehler 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 13% Sémillon, the aromas are quite light, with notes of herb and citrus. The palate is medium bodied with a lingering finish. It's pleasant but comes off as quite lightly flavored.
Name: Matthews 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A fresh scent of peony lies atop fruity notes of peach, pineapple and mango on the nose and mouth of this refreshing bottling. It's lightweight, smooth and easy to drink, with a touch of herbal, grassy interest on the back of the close.
Name: Recital 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Tart, thick and woody, this white presents as full bodied and richly thick on the palate, before slowly unfurling brighter, crisper notes of lemon verbena.
Name: G & C Lurton 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: One of a range of white varietal wines from this large estate, this is rich, intense with spice and honey as well as the more classic Sauvignon Blanc herbal character. Its tangy texture and good acidity are already balanced. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This is an especially aromatic wine in a particularly aromatic varietal category. Aromas like cut grass, grapefruit and snap peas rush out of the glass, leading to equally vivid veggie flavors and a nice, crisp texture.
Name: Husch 2017 La Ribera Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: Rich and creamy in texture, this wine offers lasting freshness from start to finish. The palate is dotted in bold flavors of fig and green apple.
Name: The Vice 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A blend from grapes mainly across the Loire regions, this fruit, crisp and herbal wine is a pleasing homage to Sauvignon Blanc. It has all the citrus and gooseberry flavors as well as hints of tropical fruits. Drink this easy-going wine now.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2017 Le Bouquet Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Shy aromas of cut grass and yellow-apple rinds show on the nose of this bottling. There is a sweet flash of ripe apple on the palate, but it's cut with a fresh lime juice kick.
Name: Falkner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Description: A solid sense of concentration and fresh floral and citrus flavors make this wine attractive. It has a lively but smooth texture, with good acidity backed by a soft, ripe and fruity core.
Name: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine offers light aromas of citrus peel, underripe mango and peach skin that show a bit more intensity on the medium-weight palate, where they marry with additional notes of banana and lemon curd. It's well balanced and easy to like, with ample acidity and moderate length on the finish.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2017 La Petite Perriere Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: There's a soft chalky, floral tone to the bouquet of this wine, alongside notes of citrus peel and melon rind. It's light and easy on the palate, with a faint pithy texture that carries through to the close.
Name: Café du Midi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This wine, with its crisp, herbal character, has intense acidity and a grassy texture. It is cool, full of citrus acidity and zest. Tyto Alba is the name for the barn owls that live at this estate and are part of the natural park's eco-system. Drink the wine now.
Designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2017 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: Thick, rich and moderate in acidity, this full-bodied white is fleshy and robust in lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors.
Name: Clark-Claudon 2017 Wild Iris Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Pleasant green plum and gooseberry tones are front and center on the nose of this wine, with additional hints of underripe tropical fruit, pineapple core and fresh grass. It's lightweight and easy to drink, with a brisk, clean and mouthwatering finish.
Name: Voiturette 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas leap up, with notes of pink grapefruit, herb and kiwi. The flavors are full in feel, providing enjoyment.
Name: Waterbrook 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Fresh-cut sweet grass, lime peel, green mango and underripe banana unfold on the nose of this solidly vibrant wine. The lightweight palate offers more of the same, with pleasant freshness and citrusy lift through the fresh finish.
Name: François Lurton 2017 Les Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: The nose displays a some what odd combination of candied orange, pineapple, asparagus and white flower. The palate is on the softer side, showing mildly concentrated flavors of peach, grapefruit, sweet grass and juicy lemon-lime acidity. The finish is astringent and lemony, leaving a fairly dull impression.
Name: Grande River 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Grand Valley)

Description: This is a fruity and fresh-tasting wine that's light to medium in body, very aromatic and has flavors like a fruit salad of apples, melons and peaches with a dash of lemon juice. All that fruitiness verges on sweetness, so dry-wine stalwarts beware.
Name: Sean Minor 2017 4B Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine presents vibrant citrus-zest aromas and clean, fruity, almost-sweet flavors on a rich texture. It has more thickness and mouthfeel than many renditions of the grape, and feels low in acidity.
Name: Castle Rock 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Underripe banana, green plum and lime set the stage of this fresh and inviting Sauvy. The palate offers more of the same, with ample acidity and additional hints of tart lychee and green apple that hang around on the medium-length finish.
Name: Le Val 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is light bodied, very fresh in aroma and reasonably crisp in texture, showing green-apple flavors and subtle herb and citrus notes. It is very clean, well balanced and should be perfect for a crowd.
Name: Two Angels 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: Thick, concentrated and rich, this is a 100% stainless-steel fermented white that tangles in tart flavors of lemon and grapefruit.
Name: Round Pond 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Côtes du Tarn, Southwest France, France
Description: A ripe, tropical-fruit style of Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is perfumed with pineapple balancing the pink-grapefruit flavors. A crisp, zingy texture makes the wine refreshing and deliciously fruity. Drink now.
Name: Domaine D'en Ségur 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Tarn)

Appellation: Outer Coastal Plain, New Jersey, US
Description: The nose seems a bit disconnected from the palate, showing aromas of overripe lemons and stinky steamed vegetables. While the palate shocks with searing acidity, fresh squeezed lemon and lime and a pervasive grassy note, ending on a tangy lemon note.
Name: Hawk Haven 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Outer Coastal Plain)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather tropical on the nose, this bottling shows pear, plumeria and ripe apple aromas on the nose. It's a bit viscous on the palate but with some energy, carrying flavors of apple soda, honeydew and candied pears.
Name: Joullian 2017 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Dried herb aromas and lemon-lime flavors highlight this medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has considerable richness in the mouthfeel and tastes soft in terms of acidity.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Crisp and grassy although with some hints of tropical fruit, this wine is all about fruitiness. Acidity, citrus and a refreshing character are all part of this attractive wine. Drink now.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: All herbs, citrus and crisp white-peach flavors, this wine bursts with cool fruitiness. Its acidity, light texture and touch of minerality are bright and juicy. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Joÿ 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Floral and characterized by bold stone-fruit flavors, this wine is spritzy in acidity, with a nutty herbal imprint of anise.
Name: Foley Johnson 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: There's a roundness to the nose and mouth of this wine, formed through abundant waves of ripe green melon, peach flesh and white cherry. Ample acidity keeps the medium-weight mouthfeel in check, with final flavors of green banana, citrus oil and melon rind.
Name: Le Jardin d'Eolie 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has an earthy, smoky aroma followed by tangy lemon flavors and figgy, earthy accents. It has a crisp mouth-cleansing texture.
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Description: A flinty aroma and smoky, white-peppery flavors give this medium-bodied wine a savory rather than fruity profile. Hints of earthiness join subtle lemon flavors on the palate.
Name: CK Mondavi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This attractively soft and creamy wine has lively fruits and plenty of acidity. Green-plum and lemon-juice flavors are right up front, giving a bright wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: A rather round nose offers heady aromas of honey, dried apricot and hazelnut. The palate has some weight, but is well balanced by acidity and shows notes of apple juice, baking spice and more hazelnuts.
Name: Sutcliffe 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Colorado)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Lightly tropical as well as herbal, this wine is crisp and bright. Its acidity and fresh kiwi and gooseberry flavors are balanced by a touch of pineapple and topped with intense, young acidity. Drink the wine now.
Name: Biscaye Baie 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: The nose on this Sauvignon Blanc is very green, offering up eucalyptus, fresh garden herbs and lemon peel. The palate is astringent in feel, leaning on lemon and lime pith with lots of grassiness straight through the finish.
Name: Chaddsford 2016 CFW Sauvignon Blanc (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: There's a pleasant grassy overlay to the lime leaf, citrus peel and melon rind aromas and flavors in this zippy wine. Mouthwatering and puckering, it's quite zippy and zesty in feel, with a fresh finish of lime and green apple flavors.
Name: Grand Sud 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Subtle hints of sweet grass and lemon verbena mingle with the green melon, lime and underripe mango core of this wine. It's medium in weight, with a flatness to the midpalate that countered by a bitter pithiness on the finish.
Name: Kiwi Cuvée 2017 Bin 88 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Lime leaf, green gooseberry and plum lead the nose of this fresh and easy white, with a soft flintiness in the background. It's prickly and vibrant on the palate, with a final bitter-melon flavor.
Name: Louis de Camponac 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: It seems odd to make a Sauvignon Blanc in the same region as Vinho Verde's great whites, but this fat wine is the result. It has richness and touches of tropical fruit, but lacks acidity. Drink the wine now.
Designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Papoilac
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2017 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Papoilac Sauvignon Blanc (Minho)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Tart plum and green gooseberry immediately greet the nose on this bottling. Nervy and taut, it's light and zippy on the palate, with an abundant lime flavor and mouth-puckering lift on the close.
Name: Liberation de Paris 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This is a thickly constructed white that tastes sweet in vanilla and mango, a big expression of the variety that opts for richness over freshness.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2017 Proprietor's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Peach candies and pineapple slices form the nose of this ripe wine, though with only moderate intensity. The lean palate shows more restraint, with tart plum and lime flavors that finish zippy and mouth-puckering.
Name: Bouquet 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: From a single vineyard, this white is given six months to chill in stainless steel. It tastes concentrated and full, with an overt tartness to the underlying acidity.
Name: Pestoni Family 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Floral tones of verbena and jasmine are oddly pronounced on the nose of this wine, dominating the green apple and melon rind fruit. The round mouthfeel shows a bit of flatness on the midpalate, echoed by a final note of citrus oil that lacks some needed verve.
Name: Florent Descombe NV Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Tart gooseberry and grapefruit aromas are soft and reserved on the nose of this wine, though they carry through to the palate with a but more intensity. There's a thinness to the midpalate, while just enough lemon-lime acidity graces the finish.
Name: Les Domaines Auriol 2016 La Ligne Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extreme aromas of garlic and onions lead to crisp lemon and garlic flavors that push the envelope of acceptability, but may suit some people's taste buds.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Floral and stony, this impressively complex and memorable white has a thirst-quenching grasp of gravelly minerality, a core element built around bold, beautiful flavors of fig, Meyer lemon and tangerine.
Name: Massican 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: These vines, planted in 1990, are the oldest for this variety in the Willamette Valley. At first the wine shows a textbook style, with vivid acidity and a luxurious mix of citrus fruits, with an emphasis on Key lime and grapefruit. But it continues to expand with hours of breathing time, adding flesh and detail, until finally it most resembles a dry Sauternes, complete with a lovely streak of honeysuckle.
Name: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Estate Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This blends three different cuvées—one in stainless steel, one in acacia barrel, and one in concrete egg. It's a deft bit of finessing the grape, adding layers of texture and minerality without diluting the varietal character. Herb and citrus components are perfectly balanced, and the wine has exceptional length.
Name: J. Christopher 2016 Croft Vineyard Über-Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Barrel-fermented with 19% Sémillon, this white impresses in light flavors of peach, apricot and lime. Citrus-driven acidity and a tease of wet stone creates a buoyant feel to the fleshy palate. It's complex and undeniably delicious.
Name: Groth 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas here are vivid, with notes of pear, pineapple, citrus, melon and herb. The palate explodes with kiwi, papaya and passion fruit flavors that carry on the finish. It's flat-out delicious, showing a captivating sense of richness and texture as well as a lingering finish.
Name: Alleromb 2017 La Gran Flor Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Shy at first on the nose, this wine develops to reveal a voluptuous style of fleshy, rounded grapefruit, pineapple, cantaloupe and Meyer lemon. It remains complex and exotic through a lengthy midpalate and textured finish, with persistent acidity.
Name: Acumen 2017 Mountainside Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp, bright and balanced, this white is floral in jasmine with a persistence of peach and pear flavor. Given time in neutral oak, it offers body and richness without heaviness, remaining fresh on the finish.
Name: Mill Creek 2017 Vera's Block Heritage Series Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Grassy aromas of cut lawn and green apple meet with wet sidewalk and dried lime rinds on the crisp, almost austere, nose of this bottling. There is extreme zip to the sip, with more grass and lime-rind flavors, proving quite bright.
Name: Grassini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Partial oak aging has resulted in a soft style of Sauvignon Blanc. The intense herbal character has been filled out with spice and a judicious touch of toastiness. It is an elegant wine, ready to drink now.
Name: Romana Vini 2015 Página Sauvignon Blanc (Lisboa)

Description: Made from Oak Knoll District grapes, including 20% Sauvignon Musqué, this wine spends time in both stainless steel and French oak. Fleshy in white peach, apricot and melon, it offers balanced acidity and layers of texture.
Name: Ladera 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The inaugural release of this wine was fermented and aged sur lie for 18 months in a concrete egg. Aromas of pineapple, kiwi, citrus, lees, straw and herb are followed by lighter-styled but still creamy-feeling fruit flavors that lead to a warm fruit-filled finish.
Name: Upchurch 2016 Southwest Facing Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear, grass, fig, toast and lemon-peel aromas are followed by medium-bodied, textured fig, melon and barrel-spice flavors that persist on the finish. The Sémillon blended in (22%) gives the palate extra weight and depth.
Name: Januik 2017 Sagemoor Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Fragrant in white flowers, this wine offers sizzling freshness and stony backbone. Melon, lemon, lime and tangerine all play a part in contribution to its fruit-forward complexity and long-lasting appeal. Small amounts of Sémillon and Viognier are added.
Name: Cade 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pretty in peach skin, jasmine and vanilla bean, this robust white is rich and layered, with supportive acidity that makes it seem fresh and lively.
Name: Mill Creek 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine offers lively acidity broadened by flavors of fig, peach and green apple. Stainless-steel fermented, it remains crisp and focused in the glass, finishing in lemongrass, Meyer lemon and a hint of ginger.
Name: Cuvaison 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Los Carneros)

Description: Grassy with lengthy acidity, this is a robustly fresh, focused and fruity white, with highlights of kumquat, fig and apricot. The midpalate and finish veer into creamier, buttery flavors that provide a welcome lushness of mouthfeel.
Name: Eric Kent 2017 Cuvée Renee Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The winery makes a pair of Sauv Blancs, and this one is high in acidity with fruit flavors of green apples and pink grapefruit. It finishes clean, with an interesting herbal note.
Name: J. Christopher 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh, clean and crisp aromas of Granny Smith apple peels, cut grass and lime rinds show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and tangy with grapefruit pith and more cut-grass flavors, proving almost puckering and proving very tightly woven.
Name: Eden Rift 2017 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp aromas of honeysuckle, Anjou pear and green apple lead into more layers of grass, nectarine and wet stone on this bottling, which evolves quickly in the glass. There is strong tension to the palate, where floral flavors meet with honeydew and lemon zest.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very mineral-driven on the nose, with aromas of chalk and wet gravel, this bottling also shows scents of lime and pear rind. The palate is very tangy, with pomelo-pith flavors, but there is also a more rounded touch of cut pear and orange rind.
Name: Star Lane Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made with 12% Sémillon, this wine is a blend of fruit from Summit View, Seven Hills and Les Collines vineyards. The aromas start out subdued, opening to reveal notes of tropical fruit, citrus peel and herb. In contrast, the palate is sleek but flavorful, loaded with papaya and kiwi flavors, with a citrus and tropical-fruit-filled finish.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2017 Estate Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This oak-aged wine is rich, ripe with bold tropical fruits and a lightly mineral texture. Spice and toastiness balance with the up-front fruitiness and the crisp acidity at the end. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Fiuza 2017 Reserva Premium Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: This wine starts citrus-driven and bright in acidity before evolving in the glass to take on more power and richness, a mix of stone fruit and melon.
Name: Covenant 2017 Red C Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: This barrel-fermented wine is toasty and ready to drink. The wood has suppressed the more herbal flavors of the Sauvignon Blanc, instead introducing more spice and apricot fruit along with intense acidity. Drink this rich wine now.
Name: João Teodosio Matos Barbosa 2015 Ninfa Escolha Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: Bright and focused, this wine is full of gravelly minerality and wet stone grit, with vibrant shakes of lemon peel and grapefruit. The freshness hides a robust weight and full-figured ripeness.
Name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite light, with notes of melon, lees, lemon, vanilla, herb and pear, with the palate bringing more of the same. There are good things going on but the concentration seems a bit light.
Name: Novelty Hill 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Intense aromas of freshly scooped honeydew melon, flowers and herbs. The rounded palate brings plenty of appeal with its tropical fruit flavor. Enjoy now for its straightforward nature.
Name: Palencia 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has juicy apple, lemon and lime flavors with a touch of tangerine-laden acidity that helps keep the balance in check. Moderately structured, it's an enjoyable wine with texture and length.
Name: Riley's Rows 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: From the coastal Colchagua subzone of Paredones, this SB opens with a mix of tropical-fruit aromas and cool-climate green bean. A tangy, zesty palate is fueled by citric acid, while flavors of tangerine, lemon and green herbs finish with smacking acidity.
Name: Estampa 2017 Del Viento Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Aromas of citrus fruits and canned vegetables carry this wine. It's round and plump in feel, with balancing acidity, while lime and herbaceous green flavors flatten out on the finish.
Name: San Pedro 2017 1865 Selected Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter-styled aromas of herb, lemon zest and fig are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. A melon note lingers on the finish.
Name: Three Rivers 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With 5% Sémillon and 1% Muscat, this is no shy white, offering instead full-bodied, lush and fleshy flavors of peach, mango and vanilla. It lingers in a finish of freshly cut grass.
Name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of honeydew melon, Asian pear and herb lead to tart, spritzy, lighter-styled fruit flavors. The concentration seems light, but what's there is good.
Name: Vino La Monarcha 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fleshy and gravelly, this white is blended with 14% Sémillon. It leans into a sweetness of stone fruit and vanilla, with a lasting lushness on the finish.
Name: Roth 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: The wine is called a curiosity because it comes from the only Sauvignon Blanc appellation in Burgundy. Saint-Bris in the Yonne valley produces ripe Sauvignon, creamy and gently textured with attractive acidity and ripe apple flavors. The wine is young, intense and will be calmer from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gueguen 2017 Curiosité de Bourgogne  (Saint-Bris)

Description: Blended with 18% Sémillon, this is a lush wine richly discreet in guava, melon and fig, with moderate acidity holding it together with grace and concentration. A note of oak boosts the tropical profile.
Name: Duckhorn 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Grassy in pea shoots, this is an easygoing, quaffable white with buzzy acidity and a lasting taste of fig and melon.
Name: Mason Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Briny melon and mild mineral carry this straightforward wine. A zesty, acidic palate holds flavors of lime, lettuce and generic bitterness. The finish is bright.
Name: Matetic 2017 EQ Coastal Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of green-melon rind, crushed stone and white blossoms carry the nose. The palate is light in feel, with flavors of tart kiwi and spicy greens ending on a powdered chalk note.
Name: Rivera 2017 Terre Al Monte Sauvignon Blanc (Castel del Monte)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though pungent with crisp varietal grassy notes, this does not push that herbaceous character too far over the edge, as one-quarter was fermented and left on the lees in French oak barrels. The fruit flavors run to bruised apple and melon, which contrast with the herbal side.
