Name: King Estate 2016 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Starting out reduced, light aromas of herb, citrus zest, kiwi and other tropical fruits lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors. There are good things going on but the concentration seems light.
Name: Hedges 2017 CMS Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Rounded in nondescript aspects of apple and crushed stone, this lightly ripe white is floral in jasmine and honeysuckle and is easily quaffable.
Name: Liparita 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: Chunky tropical and vegetal aromas are just fruity enough. This wine feels plump and solid, with good acidity. Like the nose, this tastes of mango and melon but also canned veggies, while a briny finish strongly suggests bell pepper.
Name: Polkura 2017 Aylin Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A herbal wine, crisp and green, is laden with acidity as well as gooseberry fruits. It has a cool character while also having some density and ripeness. Drink the wine now.
Name: João Teodosio Matos Barbosa 2016 Ninfa Colheita Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: Gritty citrus aromas are equally vegetal. This wine is lean and a bit watery in feel. Briny flavors retain a strong sense of greenness on a tangy, citrusy finish that runs heavy on phenolics.
Name: Aresti 2017 Trisquel Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Grassy and herbal, this white is tart and tight in acidity, with a low level of ripeness that keeps it crisp and clean. Lemongrass and lime round out the finish.
Name: Charles Krug 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of melon rind, lemon zest and toast lead to lighter-styled tropical-fruit flavors. The concentration seems quite light. Pink-grapefruit notes linger on the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2016 H3 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Starting out a bit reduced, the aromas open to reveal notes of citrus zest and herb. The palate is quite light in style, not holding together on the finish.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2017 Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Strong flavors and aromas of pea shoots, peach and sweet vanilla give this wine a richness and full-bodied, fleshy personality.
Name: Belden Barns 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: Pea shoots, lemon and wet stone contribute graceful flavors to this wine, which has a metallic edge to its medium-bodied texture.
Name: Tamber Bey 2017 Lizzy's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Apple flesh and watery lemon aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's flat on the palate, offering lime zest and more sliced-apple flavors.
Name: Ballard Lane 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a jalapeño spiciness on the nose that intensifies into the lush, round palate of buttery cream that accentuates the unctuous ripeness overall.
Name: Pezzi King 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine has a slight metallic edge to it, a twist that muddles the heartiness of its tropical fruit and creamy texture.
Name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Wildwood Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: Aromas of haystack and grass lead to a prickly palate with tangy acidity but not much body. Slightly bitter flavors of green herbs and grass lack fruitiness. The finish is chunky.
Name: Finca Patagonia 2017 Expedicion Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Aromas of apple juice and melon are light on the nose. A texture of grape skins and citrus peel drives the palate, while a stone-fruit flavor dominates.
Name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Mild aromas of citrus appear on the nose. The palate is soft in feel, with slightly mealy tropical-fruit flavors. A quiet vegetal tone marks the finish.
Name: Calyptra 2016 Vivendo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Vegetal aromas suggest canned beans and peas. A round, pulpy palate delivers mostly pyrazine-driven flavors of bell pepper and string beans. On the finish, this tastes of veggies and grape skins.
Name: Viña Chocalan 2017 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Very faint aromas of lime zest show a bit more definition on the palate. The acidity is abrasive and high, leading to a long, tart finish.
Name: James Charles 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a harsh fuzziness to the texture and a strong aroma of grass and canned pea.
Name: Merriam 2017 Danielle Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Tropical and overripe on the nose with aromas of papaya, honeydew and geranium, this Sauvignon Blanc is equally tropical on the palate. Full in body and warm, this feels thick and coating and has a finish lingers on an overripe papaya note.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: Heavily vegetal aromas are stale and offputting. This wine is holding onto its acidity, but underripe flavors of green vegetables outweigh a lemony character. It ends bitter and pyrazinic.
Name: Viña Chocalan 2016 Gran Reserva Origen Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Barrel-fermented in acacia wood, this wine is reduced and quite harsh. It lacks in fruit tones.
Name: DeLorimier 2017 Spectrum Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: Elegantly structured and savory, this estate's Sauvignon is always one of the best in the denomination. Restrained and loaded with finesse, it opens with enticing, delicate aromas of dried herbs, mature yellow stone fruit and a whiff of grapefruit. Reflecting the nose, the delicious, balanced palate offers apricot, crushed sage and citrus alongside fresh acidity. A delicate mineral note lifts the finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Radiant and savory, this compelling white boasts enticing scents of elderflower, ripe citrus, crushed Alpine herb, tomato leaf and a whiff of tropical fruit. The delicious elegantly structured palate delivers juicy grapefruit, mature white peach, honeydew melon and mineral accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Elena Walch 2016 Vigna Castel Ringberg Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: All of the aromatic expression here is still shrouded by reductive notes of flint and struck match. Underneath, it's a wonderfully fresh, vivid and creamy wine with grass, lemon and summer blossom notions. The palate shows concentration and depth despite its dry lightness. Elegance and harmony are apparent from the first sip. This deserves some bottle age. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Tement 2016 Ried Grassnitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Pressed wild flower, ripe orchard fruit and citrus aromas mingle with a whiff of crushed stone on this savory white. Full bodied but linear, the elegant structured palate delivers red grapefruit, tangerine zest, white peach and crushed herb alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Gennen Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: A touch of flinty reduction still clings to the nose of this wine. On the palate, zesty, lemon-scented drive and concentration belys the fluid expressiveness and light body. This is lovely now but will come into its own with a little more bottle age. Drink 2019–2022.
Name: Tement 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This lovely white has a bright, floral nose and is fresh in flavor. Well-textured, it offers a wealth of delicious peach skin, Meyer lemon and grapefruit pith, the tang and juiciness of the fruit flavors melded together in impressive harmony.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2017 Cunat Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)

Description: Aromas of bell pepper, tomato leaf and citrus jump out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the linear full-bodied palate doles out juicy grapefruit, white peach and dried sage alongside crisp acidity. A saline note gives it a savory finish.
Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Mantele Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Crushed tomato vine, bell pepper and grapefruit aromas follow through to the full-bodied savory palate along with tropical-fruit notes. Fresh acidity gives it balance while hints of tangerine zest and white pepper mark the close.
Name: Girlan 2016 Indra Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Made from certified organic grapes, this wine offers a strong uplift of acidity and refreshing layers of tangerine, white peach and Meyer lemon. With just enough grip and body it has complexity amid the freshness.
Name: Heitz 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Restrained and refined, this wine offers delicate aromas of grapefruit, white spring flower and crushed herb. The enticing scents carry over to elegantly structured palate along with apple, exotic fruit and tangerine zest. Fresh acidity provides balance while a flinty mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Muzic 2016 Pàjze Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: A touch of creaminess lends fluidity and ease to the nose of this wine. It also accentuates the sunny stone fruit notes that pervade the dry, concentrated but light palate. Varietal expression is true but subtle here; it promises to be even better with some bottle age. Drink now–2025.
Name: Strauss 2017 Gamlitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: The wet nettle, green grass and lemon notes on the nose of this wine are utterly appetizing. The palate reprises these aromas in a precise, enticing and clean fashion. Expressive, fresh, light and dry, it gives the impression of deliciously understated confidence.
Name: Erwin Sabathi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Concentration and depth are the hallmarks of this fresh, flavorful, bracing wine made from organic grapes. It matches bright citrus and grassy aromas with deep, layered melon, fig and prosciutto flavors that seem to expand on the palate.
Name: Saracina 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: This wine's fresh nettle and bergamot aromas create a subtle, fresh nose. The light palate surprises with its concentration and verve. Citrusy freshness runs through this like a faultline—it lifts and illuminates everything. This is light but expressive, subtle but completely convincing.
Name: Wohlmuth 2017 Ried Steinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: Bartho Eksteen. This screams Sauvy from start to finish, with pronounced aromas of fresh grass, grapefruit peel, lime pith and tart gooseberry on the nose and mouth. The lightweight palate is fresh and zippy, with more vibrant green-fruit flavors that show good cut and precision. Hints of citrus and singed straw grace the finish, the only hints at the wooded element of this harmonious and well-integrated wine.
Name: Bartho Eksteen 2017 Cape Winemakers Guild Vloekskoot Wooded Sauvignon Blanc (Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley)

Description: This wine's green apple, dewy grass and bright lemon notes create an appetizingly fresh nose. The palate brims with ease and lightness and that pervasive, lemony freshness. This is harmonious, aromatic and wonderfully fluid.
Name: Lackner Tinnacher 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Subtle in stone fruit aromas and a waxy apple tease, this vineyard-specific white is bright, fresh and layered with texture. Light in ripeness, it'll do well as an aperitif or companion to the table and a wide variety of fare.
Name: St. Francis 2017 Wild Oak Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Aromas of citrus, wild herb, crushed tomato leaf and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose. On the medium-bodied savory palate, tangy acidity lifts ripe grapefruit, juicy lemon drop and white peach, while a flinty mineral note backs up the finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Tropical fruit, tomato vine, grilled herb and toasted aromas lead the nose. Tangy and savory, the medium-bodied palate offers pink grapefruit, kiwi and a note of bitter almond. A mineral note wraps up the salty finish.
Name: Castelfeder 2015 Burgum Novum Riserva Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Named after this producer's home winery, this wine is ripe and full of crystal-clear fruit. Zesty acidity is comfortably surrounded by full-flavored fruitiness. It could do with some aging, so drink this rich wine from 2019.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2016 La Moynerie  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, crushed thyme and a whiff of tomato leaf take shape on this medium-bodied structured white. The elegant palate doles out dried apricot, mature yellow peach, crushed oyster shell and citrus zest alongside tangy acidity. A hint of toasted hazelnut lingers on the close.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2013 Riserva Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This is an intensely perfumed wine, full with apricot, kiwi and tight apple flavors. Still young, this rich, full-bodied wine is concentrated and ripe, demanding time to mature. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Anthony Girard 2016 Le Chêne Fourchu  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lime, kiwi and grass aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is tremendous zip and a stony, chalky texture to the medium-bodied palate, which is full of grass and lime peel flavors.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2017 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Floral and brimming in citrus-laden acidity, this is a creamy, lush example of the variety, with a strong peachy flavor and aromas of apple blossom.
Name: V. Sattui 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Based in Pouilly-sur-Loire, this producer also makes wines from across the river in Sancerre. Ripe and rich, this wine is as much bringing out apple and citrus as more herbal flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2016 Les Tuilières  (Sancerre)

Description: Mouthwatering and crisp, this medium-bodied wine has bright aromas of kiwi and citrus. It's fresh and vibrant in character, backed by a tangy underscore.
Name: Oak Farm 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Intense varietal aromas of tropical fruit, tomato vine, aromatic herb and citrus jump out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the expressive, mouthwatering palate doles out juicy grapefruit, honeydew melon and grilled sage alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Castelfeder 2017 Raif Sauvignon (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Elderflower, tomato leaf and citrus aromas delicately float out of the glass on this fragrant white. On the elegant linear palate, bright acidity accompanies juicy grapefruit, white peach and honeydew melon alongside a hint of wild herb. A tangy mineral note signals the close.
Name: Cantina Tramin 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas evoking grapefruit, tropical fruit and tomato leaf flow over to the full-bodied enveloping palate along with green melon and steely mineral. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This full-bodied wine is delicious, layered, complex and well balanced. It is compelling from the first whiff of melon and fig to the rich, concentrated palate.
Name: Joel Gott 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of yellow peach, lemon pith and a kiss of wood show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe yet restrained enough, offering nectarine and lemon flavors, set against a tight structure and zesty acid.
Name: Roblar 2017 Estate Fumé Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This wine's green pear scent has an earthy tang. The palate has gentle grass- and lemon-scented freshness. It's light in body and unobtrusive, with a dry, subtly aromatic finish.
Name: Sattlerhof 2017 Gamlitz Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Gritty lemon and salty wet stone give this wine a welcome complexity and texture, amid a tart precision of citrus zest and grapefruit. Lithe, blended acidity keeps it fresh and focused in the glass.
Name: MacLaren 2017 Lee's Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, aromatic herb and a whiff of grilled bell pepper leap from the glass. On the tangy palate, fresh acidity accompanies juicy grapefruit, pineapple, white peach and stony mineral.
Name: St. Pauls 2017 Gfill Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Tropical fruit, crushed herb, red bell pepper and fragrant white flower are just some of the aromas you'll find on this expressive white. On the juicy palate, fresh acidity brightens white peach and grapefruit while a note of white pepper lifts the finish.
Name: Colmello di Grotta 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This is an intense, tightly structured wine. Very mineral in character, it is as much about texture as about fruit. It needs some aging to fill out the fruitiness. Drink this complex wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine des Côtes Blanches 2017  Sancerre

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has classic rosemary and pine aromas and fresh, lively citrus flavors. Supportive acidity and a concentrated palate helps extend the finish. It's all about savory flavors and a nice tart character.
Name: Emerald Hare 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit, Alpine herb and a whiff of crushed tomato leaf lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the tangy linear palate along with a steely mineral note that gives a refreshing close.
Name: Kössler 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Fresh and fragrant, this has classic varietal aromas of crushed tomato vine, bell pepper, elderflower and citrus. The aromas carry over to the linear palate along with grapefruit before a fresh clean finish.
Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is exceptionally fresh and vibrant in mouthfeel, driven by great acidity and modestly flavored with crisp apple and lemon notes. It is light bodied and lean, in a good way, and seems perfect to pair with shellfish or goat cheese.
Name: City Winery Chicago 2017 Morgan Station Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Maturity has broadened this wine out and given it tropical flavors of mango and pineapple. It is a ripe wine, smoothly textured and with good intensity. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Rochette 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine Chenonceaux)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of white spring flower, tomato leaf and citrus practically leap out of the glass. On the crisp quenching palate, tangy acidity frames juicy grapefruit, white peach and Alpine herb.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Crushed tomato vine, elderflower and a hint of thyme emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers grapefruit, yellow peach and a hazelnut note alongside fresh acidity. Enjoy soon.
Name: Attems 2017 Sauvignon (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Alpine herb, elderflower, grapefruit and graphite aromas follow through to the structured linear palate along with ripe yellow peach and wild mint. Fresh acidity accompanies the juicy flavors.
Name: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2016 Mock Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This is a ripe, rich style of Sauvignon Blanc. It has as much tropical fruit as crisp acidity, giving a warm, full wine, zesty but intensely fruity. The wine is full in the mouth and will benefit from a few more months. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Anthony Girard 2016 La Clef du Récit  (Sancerre)

Description: Crushed tomato vine, citrus and thyme aromas jump out of the glass. The palate offers yellow peach, green melon and grapefruit alongside fresh acidity. It closes on a note of dried sage.
Name: Schiopetto 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pleasing combination of riper passion fruit and reductive grassy notes show on the nose of this bottling, which also offers green grapefruit rinds and kiwi aromas. The palate is zingy with acidity as advertised, carrying lemongrass and wild lime flavors.
Name: Buttonwood Farm 2017 Zingy Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Description: This opens with delicate scents of tropical fruit, citrus and a whiff of pressed acacia. On the palate, a light toasted note accompanies dried peach and grapefruit. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Livon 2016 Valbuins Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This has aromas of cedar, vanilla and pineapple that carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with ripe grapefruit. Notes of toasted hazelnut and grilled sage mark the close.
Name: Attems 2016 Cicinis Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Lightly herbal and softly fruity, this ripe wine has refreshing acidity to balance. Its crisp zingy texture has a tight, mineral side from the chalk soil of the vineyard. Drink this refreshing wine now.
Name: Domaine Beauséjour 2017 Les Grenettes Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This is a bright, fresh and layered white at a spectacular price that offers just enough heft and body weight to keep it lively and deliciously pair-worthy with a range of foods.
Name: Kenwood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: The nose of this wine is shy, just hinting at passion fruit and citrus foliage. The palate is juicy yet imprecise, finishing dry, light, clean and refreshing.
Name: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Strong grassy, herbal, piney aromas and flavors light up this medium-bodied wine. It has lively acidity, plenty of personality and good balance, so it fills the bill very nicely.
Name: Longboard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: This wine is soft, with a warm, tropical-fruit character. With crisp acidity to back up the ripe fruit, it is a well-balanced wine, both crisp and generous. Drink now.
Name: Thierry Véron 2016 Cave de la Bouquette  (Sancerre)

Description: This oak-aged Sauvignon opens with aromas of crushed tomato vine, tropical fruit, and oak-driven spice. The aromas carry over to the firm palate along with grapefruit, powdered sage and toasted nut. A salty note marks the close.
Name: Colterenzio 2016 Lafòa Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and crushed tomato leaf leap from the glass. It's fresh and juicy, offering pineapple, grapefruit and honeydew melon alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Fantinel 2016 Tenuta Sant'Helena Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Intense varietal aromas of grapefruit and crushed tomato leaf leap out of the glass. The aromas follow through to the fresh linear palate along with pineapple and a crushed sage note.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2016 Stern Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine finds a nice balance between herb, citrus and mineral elements in the context of medium body, lively acidity and good concentration. It will be perfect for lunch or as a pre-dinner drink.
Name: Shooting Star 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This medium- to full-bodied wine offers nice depth and richness along with the tangy, herbaceous personality that draws people to the variety. It has assertive snap pea and garlic aromas, fresh lemon and herb flavors and a crisp, snappy texture.
Name: The Crusher 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is relatively full bodied and has a light oak touch, so it's more than simple refreshment. Aromas of vanilla and fennel lead to a soft, smooth palate, with a subtle apple-pie flavor.
Name: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine combines rich ripe melon aromas with tangy citrus flavors for a refreshing but satisfying impression. A lightly sweet baking-spice element expands on the finish.
Name: Andis 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Description: This wine, with its soft, ripe fruit, is typical of its appellation. The herbal green-fruit character of Sauvignon Blanc is replaced by warmer, ripe tastes of yellow fruits and quince. The acidity is just right and in balance. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Anthony Girard 2016 La Clef du Récit  (Menetou-Salon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded and light aromas of apple and pear lean more sweet than grassy on the nose of this bottling. There is compelling texture on the palate, with approachable flavors of red apple, ripe pears and a flash of bubblegum.
Name: Kitá 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a petrol kick to the nose of this bottling, along with aromas of dried grass and hay. It's tightly wound on the palate, with a citrusy freshness as well as wet grass flavors.
Name: Jamie Slone Wines 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a petrol kick to the nose of this bottling, along with aromas of dried grass and hay. It's tightly wound on the palate, with a citrusy freshness as well as wet grass flavors.
Name: Jamie Slone Wines 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This is a lively thirst-quenching style of wine, like adult lemonade, that blends good acidity with a sense of ripeness or sweetness and relatively full body. It has a firm but smooth texture and appealing, subtle melon and fig flavors.
Name: Boatique 2017 Sauvignon Blanc

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost petrol-like on the nose, this bottling shows dried grass, hay, flint and a strong jalapeño aromas. That green-pepper element also shows strongly on the sip, which is clean, crisp and rather intriguing, finishing with a rounded apple warmth.
Name: J. Lohr 2017 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Stony and plush on the nose, this offers aromas of ripe nectarine, lime, green herbs and chive. There is a rocky texture to the palate with decent acidity framing flavors of key lime and lemongrass.
Name: Verde 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Description: Notions of dewy grass and gentle lemon make for a refreshing, aromatic nose in this wine. The very light palate majors on lemon and grassy overtones, finishing with a dry, refreshing zing.
Name: Winzerkeller Andau 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: This is an easygoing, enjoyable white, tropical in papaya and juicy stone fruit. Floral aromatics of jasmine give it a lift of invitation around a pleasant midpalate of juicy flavor.
Name: St. Francis 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied lime and cut grass aromas show on the nose of this single-clone bottling from the Paragon Vineyard. Dried lime rinds, pear flesh and apples show on the palate, which is fresh yet not overly acidic.
Name: Tangent 2016 Clone 530 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: While it has plenty of herbal aromas, this wine is mineral, textured and fruity. It is not rich, but the intensity of the lemon flavors give the wine potential for aging over the next few months. Drink from late 2018 or, better from 2019.
Name: Château Haut Dambert 2017  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grassy, herbal and with a slight gamy, meaty note of charcuterie, this is a thick, medium-bodied white from one site. Lush on the palate, its texture is gritty, with lasting tangy elements of lemon peel and grapefruit.
Name: Kenwood 2016 Ricioli Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Medium straw in color, this wine has lemon and petrol aromas. It fills the palate with lemon, tart apple, lemongrass and bitter almond flavors, culminating in a slightly salty finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2016 Yarden Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A bit reduced on first pour, this opens to offer dried apple, underripe pineapple, herb and lemon curd aromas. The palate brings sleek fruit flavors backed by a big blast of acid.
Name: Maryhill 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine sourced from Destiny Ridge Vineyard offers vibrant cantaloupe, yellow apple and pear aormas and dry, broad fruit flavors with a lemony finish. It provides enjoyment but little varietal character.
Name: Trinity Vineyards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Aromas of bell pepper, hay, medicinal herb and vegetal notes lead the nose. The linear bright palate offers grapefruit, passion fruit and a hint of vanilla alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2016 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine's honeydew melon and white flower aromas pave the way for white peach, lemon-lime, honeysuckle and vanilla flavors. It's bright on the palate, with a soft, floral finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2016 Gilgal Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of crushed herb and grapefruit. The aromas carry over to the muffled, somewhat subdued palate along with a hint of dill.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2016 Quintessenz Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this opens with aromas of grapefruit, hay and crushed tomato vine. The flavors carry over to the tangy linear palate along with lemon and a hint of saline.
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2017 Kaid Sauvignon (Sicilia)

Description: Dry, fresh and crisp, this is a light-bodied, unoaked, mouthcleansing wine with light fig, herb and citrus flavors and good acidity. It has 5 g/L of residual sugar and was aged on the lees for five months.
Name: Trentadue 2017 OPR Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Citrus peel and medicinal aromas lead the nose and carry over to the firm racy palate along with grapefruit pith and dried sage. It has crisp acidity and a brisk, steely finish.
Name: Borgo Conventi 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This wine balances crisply herbal fruit with a riper creamy texture. That mix creates delicious, refreshing tension and lively acidity along with warmer red-apple and quince flavors. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine du Vieil Orme 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This 91-acre estate has produced an immediately attractive, fruity wine. Lightly herbal it offers white and citrus fruits with a refreshing and tangy texture. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine de la Rochette 2017 Famille Leclair Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This 91-acre estate has produced an immediately attractive, fruity wine. Lightly herbal it offers white and citrus fruits with a refreshing and tangy texture. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine de la Rochette 2017 Famille Leclair Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This medium-bodied wine pushes the envelope of flavors, offering herb and veggie aromas alongside an earthy, mushroom flavor. It certainly has personality but might not make all the guests at a party happy.
Name: Sand Point 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Grassy and herbal, this ripe full-bodied wine traffics in pea shoots and an underlying sweetness that contrasts against a backdrop of bristling acidity.
Name: Kelleher 2016 Block 21 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a subtle wine that shows fig and subdued melon flavors on a smooth, non-tart texture. It is full bodied, light in terms of concentration but the rich mouthfeel will suit many palates.
Name: Raymond 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grassy, this presents an herbal component of pea shoots and sharp up-front acidity, the midpalate midweight in body and ripeness. It lingers in a strong taste of lemon peel.
Name: Benziger 2017 Frank Johnson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas evoking pressed wild flower and mature grapefruit. On the lean, evolved palate, you'll find notes suggesting bitter almond, salt and lemon peel. Drink soon to catch the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: La Rajade 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a light-bodied refreshing wine that smells herbaceous, tastes lemony with a touch of sweetness and has a texture between crisp and soft.
Name: Josh Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: You'll need a couple of swirls of the glass to release the aromas, but you'll finally find whiffs of tropical fruit and a hint of tomato leaf. The robust palate isn't very expressive either, offering suggestions of mature grape fruit and a note of bitter yellow skin. Drink now to capture the meaning fruit and freshness.
Name: La Ponca 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: The grape variety of this light-bodied lean-textured wine is instantly recognizable from the herb and veggie aromas and flavors. However, the obvious fresh herb, snap pea and onion flavors will be too extreme for some drinkers.
Name: Line 39 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Citrus- and pyrazine-based aromas of lime and bell pepper introduce this Navarran Sauvignon Blanc. It's simple and fresh, with bitter pepper and lime flavors.
Name: Inurrieta 2017 Orchidea Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)

Description: This is a soft, simple wine with remnants of crisp herbal flavors. The rounded texture and soft perfumes indicate a wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Loire Proprietés 2016 Vallée des Rois Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This white is somewhat muted aromatically and dull on the palate, with a juicy succulence that presents as sweet and thick.
Name: Andretti 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Atlas Peak)

Description: Invigorating notes of freshly cut grass, lime and green pepper abound in this crisp yet concentrated Sauvignon Blanc. It's ripe, silky and textural in mouthfeel yet balanced by zesty hits of lime and lemon acidity. Enjoy now through 2022.
Name: Schnaitmann 2016 Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Württemberg)

Description: Ripe luscious grapefruit and gooseberry flavors pulsate from the core of this dry medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. While pristinely fruity, it's a nuanced wine marked by invigorating hits of lime, bell pepper and crushed stone. The finish is lean and revitalizing. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Von Buhl 2016 Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: This well-made wine is crisp and structured, layered in Meyer lemon, mandarin orange and a steely core of effusive acidity. Light bodied, it shows depth and texture enough to match a meal and find companionship at the table.
Name: Benziger 2017 Estate Paradiso de Maria Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: From one of a handful of Oregon wineries working with Sauvignon Blanc, this wine focuses on the natural, herbaceous pungency of the grape. The palate is ripe in pineapple, apple and melon flavors, giving an appealing, round feel. Touches of hibiscus and honey trail on the finish.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Oregon)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% stainless-steel white, this is quenching and substantial in weight, with a grainy texture that shows complexity and layering of flavor. The fruit is a pleasing mix of Meyer lemon and kiwi.
Name: Pech Merle 2017 Valhall Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: With an exotic nose of gardenia and jasmine, this is an inviting light-bodied white that is bright in sizzling acidity, with a strong taste of peach and melon.
Name: Schug 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This fresh and zesty bottling smells of springtime, with lily and light sweetgrass aromas as well as riper flashes of peach, pear and apple flesh. There's zip and grip to the sip, with candied grapefruit rind and passion-fruit flavors.
Name: Stolo 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: This new vintage is a great stride for Willamette Valley Sauvignon Blanc. It conjures up the intense grassiness of a Loire Valley wine, with crisply defined, tart apple fruit and fresh green herb notes that bring chervil to mind. It softens a bit on the finish, suggesting that at least some partial malolactic fermentation took place.
Name: Carlton Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from the Mirabelle and Jewell Ranch vineyards, the grapes Musque clone, this is a delightfully delicious and impressively made white. Floral, herbal and steely, it shows a wealth of crisp green apple and melon flavor with just a touch of neutral oak influence.
Name: MacRostie 2017 Clockwise Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light and clean on the nose, this bottling, which is overseen by proprietor Kirk Wiles and winemaker Doug Margerum, shows citrus blossoms and apple flesh on the nose. There is lots of zippy structure to the palate, which zings deep into the finish with green-apple flavors.
Name: Paradise Springs 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Mike Landt has added Sauvignon Blanc to his stable of cool climate wines, making it in a superripe, almost candied style. This is nothing like a Loire Valley version but is nonetheless well structured. Leesy and creamy, it has a lightly buttery finish. Taken on its own, it's remarkably tasty and rather unique.
Name: River's Edge 2016 Vintage Farm Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Elkton Oregon)

Description: This white is beautifully lush and delicious—a light bright explosion of fresh peach and grapefruit dipped in Tahitian vanilla.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This lean and refreshing wine smells minerally and tastes bright and citrusy, backed by crisp acidity and a light body. Lemon and lime merge with light herb and mineral flavors that stay lively with each sip.
Name: Michael Pozzan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Pungent in grassy, herbal tones, this is lemony tart in key lime and stone fruit, with a sublime texture and straightforward freshly layered finish.
Name: Quivira 2016 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine is relatively big and broad for the variety, combining mineral and lanolin aromas with generous crisp apple and gooseberry flavors. Firm acidity keeps it lively and refreshing, and there is enough concentration for a lingering finish.
Name: Château Souverain 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Aromas like wet stones and smoked ham meet flavors that are also slightly earthy, along with good lemon and crisp apple notes. The wine is medium bodied, nicely tart and not at all bland.
Name: Pech Merle 2017 Loasa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc

Description: A new, fresh and vibrant wine from the powerhouse Languedoc producer, this boasts abundant aromas of green plum, gooseberry, orange rind and garrigue herbs. The lightweight palate is clean and refreshing, with a mouthwatering citrus verve to the close.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2017 Perles de Sauvignon Blanc (Pays d'Oc)

Description: Notes of lemongrass, lime zest and green apple lead the way for flavors of peach and Granny Smith apple. This well-balanced wine is dry on the palate, with a delightful touch of ripe fruit on the finish.
Name: Giocato 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Primorska)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This has a pretty nose and a meaty quality to the body and texture, and a medium-bodied core highlighted in melon, peach and apricot flavors. The finish revisits the floral.
Name: Quivira 2016 Wine Creek Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Herb and spice aromas compete for attention in this dual-personality medium-bodied wine. At first sniff it has a vanilla character that stands apart from the strong grassy flavors but with time in the glass they merge nicely.
Name: Mabera 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Flinty aromas meet with apple peels, lime rinds and pear flesh on the nose of this bottling. That flinty character just shows briefly on the palate, which warms up toward dried limes, yellow apples and a touch of grass.
Name: San Simeon 2017 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This sharp, steely, grassy bottling pays respect to the innate herbaceousness of the grape. Gooseberry, lemon and grapefruit flavors spotlight the sharp acidity. It was principally fermented in stainless steel, with a small amount in neutral barrels.
Name: 2Hawk 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Good concentration and a lively texture highlight this full-bodied and refreshing wine. It has mineral, melon and citrus aromas, and crisp fruit flavors sprinkled with fresh herbs like mint and thyme.
Name: Amador Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Given time in both stainless steel and neutral oak, this is a steely floral expression of the grape—dry and balanced in green-apple and melon flavors with a freshly focused finish of lasting acidity.
Name: Picayune 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound and yet very grassy on the nose, this is a Kiwi-style take on the grape, with aromas of wet cement and apple flesh. The palate is tangy with lime and more grass, yet there is ripeness of pome fruit in the midpalate.
Name: Rusack 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly woven, somewhat sour aromas of apple and sweetgrass meet with wet gravel on the nose of this bottling. Clean lime flesh and more wet stone show on the palate.
Name: Comartin 2017 Zabala Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of dried grass, apples and a hint of nectarine show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely light, with lime and grassy tones, although a bit watery.
Name: Clos La Chance 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied white is dry and slightly metallic in texture, with highlights of apricot, lemongrass and dried herb.
Name: Uptick Vineyards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine is incredibly floral upfront, with intense aromas of rose and jasmine that sit atop the tropical fruit core. The palate offers more of those ripe fruit tones that are complemented by pineapple acidity and a sweet grass accent. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2016 Les Mariés Sauvignon Blanc (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of Gala apple rinds and a hint of lime blossom make for a subtle and easy entry to this bottling. The palate shows green apple peels, lime skins, wet river stone and a hint of sweetgrass.
Name: Hungry Hawk 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (San Diego County)

Description: Green apple and fresh gooseberry aromas lead to a palate of star fruit, apple and peach. The finish is pleasantly sweet.
Name: Casic 2015 100% Organic 100% Unforgettable Sauvignon (Croatia)

Description: Musty, earthy and taut on the palate, this white is intensely verbose in lemon peel and melon, with a steely character that makes it seem lean.
Name: Gibbs 2017 Centa Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: Ripe pear and wet river rocks show on the clean nose of this bottling, which invites with the fruit and then intrigues with the minerality. It's a bit ripe on the palate, with poached pear flavors.
Name: Noble Vines 2017 242 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Description: Faint scents of yellow apple, lemon verbena and lime pith tease the nose of this light, easygoing wine. The palate offers good acidic lift, while notes of bitter melon rind, mâche and white peach linger on the pithy close. Drink now.
Name: La Forge Estate 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Languedoc)

Description: This is a good middle-of-the-road wine with sufficient fruit flavors and fairly crisp acidity that will make it quite food-friendly. It's light to medium in body, and has light lemon and herb flavors.
Name: Leese-Fitch 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This is a friendly, easy-drinking white that offers light aromas and flavors of green plum, orange peel and melon rind. Ample acidity keeps it brisk and clean through the close. Drink up.
Name: Arrogant Frog 2016 Savvy Sauvignon Blanc (Pays d'Oc)

Description: Spice and herb flavors dominate this light-bodied, crisp and dry wine. White-pepper, fennel bulb and lemon flavors make an interesting mix and the mouthfeel is respectably tangy.
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This leads with vegetal aromas recalling celery and lime. The palate is standard, with citrusy acidity and pyrazinic flavors of green bell pepper and peppercorn. Those flavors echo on the finish, losing intensity rather quickly.
Name: Siegel 2017 Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine has straightforward herb and apple aromas joined by an earthy streak in the flavor. It's rather light in terms of concentration.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2016 The Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: This wine's sharp tropical fruit, citrus and generic green aromas scream Chilean Sauvignon Blanc. Its lean, citric palate is more hollow than substantive, with sour tangerine and lemon notes and a tart, pointy finish.
Name: Albamar 2017 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This offers mild citrus, green apple and melony aromas. The palate is soft, flat and marked by low intensity. Its tropical fruit and green herb flavors finish mildly bitter, with fleshy weight and little sizzle.
Name: Carmen 2017 Wave Series Left Wave Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Willow Creek, North Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling smells a bit more like Chardonnay than Sauvignon Blanc, with lemon rinds and a hint of butter, but a lime and dried apple touch that is varietally familiar. Poached apples show on the palate.
Name: Heath Vineyards 2014 Captivating Sauvignon Blanc (Willow Creek)

Description: This wine's celery and arugula aromas include a touch of citrus. Low acidity creates a flabby mouthfeel, where its vegetal, green bell pepper flavors stagnate. The finish is briny and vapid.
Name: Root:1 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Bell pepper and sweat aromas introduce this lean, high-acid Sauvignon Blanc with sour citrus flavors and vegetal notes. The finish is tangy, sharp and slightly bitter.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2017 La Poda Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: This wine's gritty aromas of sulfur, match stick and stalky fruit devolve into nothing. The palate is lifeless, marked by dull, oxidized flavors with little fruit and a yeasty-tasting finish.
Name: Finca Patagonia 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Creamy and fragrant, this elegant white offers tomato vine, exotic fruit, wild mint and citrus zest aromas. The mineral-driven palate doles out flint, grapefruit and lemon drop flavors alongside tangy acidity. A savory, almost salty note graces the lingering finish.
Name: Terlan 2015 Quartz Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of hay, tomato leaf, grapefruit, Alpine herb and wet stone lead the nose of this racy, mountain Sauvignon. Bright and elegant, it delivers citrus, pineapple, apricot and flinty mineral flavors while a fennel note backs up the finish. Vibrant acidity lends balance.
Name: Terlan 2016 Winkl Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of hay, tomato leaf, grapefruit, Alpine herb and wet stone lead the nose of this racy, mountain Sauvignon. Bright and elegant, it delivers citrus, pineapple, apricot and flinty mineral flavors while a fennel note backs up the finish. Vibrant acidity lends balance.
Name: Terlan 2016 Winkl Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Crushed tomato vine, hay, gooseberry, tropical fruit and a whiff of yellow stone fruit jump out of the glass. The delicious, tangy palate doles out juicy grapefruit, creamy peach and pineapple while crisp acidity brightens the rich flavors. A mineral note lends energy to the finish.
Name: Andriano 2016 Andrius Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Chief winemaker Helen Masters has produced a Sauvignon Blanc full of delicacy and restraint. Enchanting aromas of apple peel, lime blossom, wild mint and ginger glide seamlessly into a bright, shimmery palate that prickles with a juicy, copper-penny tang and just a touch of textural weight, all ensconced in a long, salty, pithy finish. Delicious on its own, this would be glorious with a wide range of east and southeast Asian dishes.
Name: Ata Rangi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This barrel-fermented white is made from three stellar vineyard sites: Crocker, Farella and Rewa, the latter two in Coombsville. Philippe Melka makes the wine. Smooth, soft and floral, it has citrus-driven acidity that keeps it fresh in the glass against a backdrop of stunning complexity and lush texture.
Name: Lail 2016 Blueprint Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Pressed spring flower, citrus zest and dried herb aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the savory, elegant palate, a salty mineral vein underscores juicy grapefruit, honeydew melon and white peach flavors. Fresh acidity lends lift. Drink now for the bright fruit flavors or hold a few years for more complexity.
Name: Venica & Venica 2016 Ronco delle Mele Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Bel Echo is the most fruit-forward of the three Sauvignon Blanc offerings from this top-notch organic producer. Limpid notes of waxy lemons and limes, bruised apples, passionfruit, and honeyed nuts flow into a medium-bodied palate that's taut, focused and chalky in texture. Flavors of citrus, ginger and apple skins lead into a satisfying salty, nutty finish. Drink now–2024.
Name: Clos Henri 2016 Bel Echo Terroir Broadbridge Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This sweet wine, whose name means flower fountain, is decadent and rich yet wonderfully balanced and harmonious. Lush aromas of sweet grass, juicy peach, apricot, candied orange peel and orange blossom carry through to the full, slightly sticky palate, which is countered by vibrant acidity that lends nerve to the texture and a bright flourish to the enduring finish. Notes of honey-roasted almond, orange oil and dried peach linger long on the close.
Name: Keermont 2015 Fleurfontein Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A tropical touch of passion fruit hovers above grassy freshness on the nose. The palate is zesty and light, bright with passion fruit and mandarin, playing out its vivid fruitiness on the light, dry and expressive palate. The flavors persist and leave you in no doubt that you are in the presence of a great wine.
Name: H.& C. Nittnaus 2017 Obere Wies Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Hay, tomato vine, citrus and flint aromas merge together in this elegant, full-bodied white. On the bright, structured palate, a savory mineral vein accents juicy grapefruit, creamy white peach and chopped mint flavors, alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This is a stunning wine, showing an abundance of character yet still with potential to evolve. It opens with notes of crisp apple flesh, white peach and lime that are hit by herbal accents of fresh fynbos, thyme and just-dried grass. The medium-weight palate is bright, yet amply concentrated and satisfying, as subtle hay and honeydew accents are kept in balance by bright, mouthwatering acidity and are followed by a pithy, textured, citrusy close. Drink now–2020.
Name: Reyneke 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A subdued nose holds hints of bright lemon. The palate has the same, vigorous freshness but balances it with a textured vibe that combines wet pebble, riper peach and zesty citrus. This is expressive, light, but utterly and lip-smackingly fresh, echoing long after the dry finish.
Name: Wohlmuth 2017 Kitzeck-Sausal Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: There's a pleasant herbal edge that's reminiscent of fresh-cut grass, white asparagus and lemon verbena on the nose of this wine, backed by notes of yellow plum and preserved lemon. The medium-weight mouth offers superb concentration of citrus, pepper and minty fynbos characteristics that are countered by ample acidity and a slight astringent, textured pithiness to the lingering finish. It's hard to resist now, but should continue to hold well through 2021.
Name: Tokara 2017 Reserve Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: This is a live wire of a wine from a new family winery. It has arresting aromas of white pepper and lemon zest, and vivid and focused citrus and mineral flavors that are well supported by good acidity.
Name: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of delicate citrus, wet stone, honey and flint can be coaxed from the glass of this entry-level bottling, sourced from all three of Clos Henri's estate soil types. This wine is all about mouthfeel, richness and roundness, along with a spicy and buttery character from several months of lees stirring. It finishes on a strong mineral note of wet river stone.
Name: Clos Henri 2016 Petit Clos Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From the slightly cooler climes of the Awatere Valley, this wine is a lovely example of both regionality and an increasing penchant for Sauvignon Blancs with added texture and complexity. Aromas of grapefruit, herbal spice and roasted green peppers are framed by a distinct smoky, flinty quality which continues through to the palate. Medium-bodied, this may be slippery in texture but it's also taut and focused in a grapefruit tang and a salty, if slightly oaky finish.
Name: Giesen 2016 The Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Savory, vibrant and fragrant, this has classic Sauvignon aromas of tomato vine, elderflower, grapefruit and crushed herb. The dry, linear palate boasts an intriguing blend of flavor and restraint, offering white peach, citrus and cantaloupe notes alongside bright acidity.
Name: Jermann 2016 Sauvignon (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 16% Sémillon, pleasing aromas of kiwi, lemongrass, candle wax, citrus, lees and poached pear lead to the full-bodied, textured palate. It shows an exquisite sense of balance along with a fig-filled finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2016 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine opens, interestingly, with aspects of charcuterie, nuts and oak. Robust on the palate in body and texture, it offers a wealth of supportive acidity and a brightness of grapefruit peel.
Name: Frostwatch 2016 Kismet Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Description: The latest Petit Clos release from this French-owned and operated organic winery is bursting with tropical and citrus fruits enveloped in a wreath of flint, salt and nuts. Solidly medium in body, the Clos Henri stamp of taut acidity, textural weight and stoney minerality are all there, concluding with a long, salty finish. Drink now–2023.
Name: Clos Henri 2017 Petit Clos Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From one of the founding wineries in the Waipara region on the east coast of the south island, this is an enticing wine that's as focused on herbs and minerals as it is on fruit. Aromas of stalks, nettles, stones and wet hay mingle with ripe tropical fruit and apples. The medium-bodied palate is tightly wound, with focused acidity and a slightly chalky texture flowing into a long, salty citrus tang.
Name: Waipara Springs 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara Valley)

Description: Slate and stone provide a mineral character to this white wine, fermented in both concrete egg and oak. Mouthfilling and youthful, it offers strong flavors of green apple amidst a steely, complex body of light-bodied weight.
Name: RouteStock 2016 Route 29 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This structured, full-bodied white opens with delicate toasted oak and grilled herb aromas. On the firm palate, tangy acidity lifts dried apricot, fennel, toasted nut and grapefruit hints. It closes on a saline note.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Clean and lively, this dazzles with fresh aromas of green melon, plum and lemon curd that are accented by herbal notes of fresh-cut grass and sweet pea. The palate is prickly and nervy, with oodles of bright, mouthwatering citrus flavors and a touch of underripe peach. Drink now through 2019 to best enjoy its vibrancy.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2017 Bayten Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: Light gold in color, this is a luscious wine for those who like their Sauvignon Blanc with body and texture. Aromas of lemon rind and green apple skins mingle with tomato leaf, wet stone and a matchstick flintiness. The palate is incredibly mouthfilling and plump, but there is just enough acidity to keep it afloat.
Name: Mt. Beautiful 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Canterbury)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe lemon and nettle mingle on the nose. The palate remains resolutely light and is bright with lemon freshness, with a dry finish that closes on a herbal tisane note.
Name: Sattlerhof 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: From the east coast of the south island, this is a tangy, medium- to full-bodied wine with lots to offer outside the more predictable characters. The nose is an intriguing combo of stone fruit, citrus and lime with buttered green beans, wet wool, hay and a copper penny tang. A little oily in texture, there's a salty, wet-stone flecked acidity to brighten things up.
Name: Sherwood Estate 2016 Sherwood Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara Valley)

Description: This wine flexes its muscles in a totally lovable way, offering up a heady mélange of pineapple, grapefruit, fresh bell peppers, grass and some salty sea air. The acidity is crisp and zingy, balanced by a slightly slippery texture and finishing on a pleasing grapefruit note.
Name: Saint Clair 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tomato leaf, elder flower, grilled sage and crushed stone aromas lead the nose of this wine. The savory, full-bodied palate offers grapefruit, lemon drop and crushed mint flavors alongside tangy acidity and a salty note.
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2016 Turmhof Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Green apples, freshly cut grass and slightly sweet white flowers invite the nose into this bottling, one of the best white wines for the money in the state. A strong grip grabs hold of the palate immediately, demanding attention for the ripe green-pear and tangy citrus flavors, all framed by powerful acidity.
Name: Gainey 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This is a fruity, opulent Sauvignon Blanc, bursting with peaches, pineapples, lychees, apple blossoms and just a hint of green leafiness. Oily-textured, with mouthwatering acidity and a long tomato leaf spice on the finish, this is one to satisfy both crisp, fruity white wine lovers and those who crave more body in their whites.
Name: Jules Taylor 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The relatively cooler temps of the 2017 vintage are obvious on this Sauvignon Blanc, where aromas of green beans and jalapeño peppers mix with guava and grapefruit rind, followed closely by a solid whiff of salty sea air. The palate is equally saline, with a lovely satiny texture and lemony acidity. A wine for oysters if there ever was one.
Name: Nautilus 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Brisk notes of lemon, pineapple rind and peach kick off this zesty, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. Round in feel, the palate is plump in tropical fruit and melon tones, with a persistent line of grapefruit acidity maintaining focus. The finish lingers on a light, chalky note.
Name: Paumanok 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Quintessential varietal aromas of tomato leaf, green pepper and tropical fruit take center stage in this wine. On the palate, tangy acidity balances creamy white peach and juicy grapefruit notes while dill and thyme accents provide backup.
Name: Erste Neue 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine, sourced from organically grown grapes and made by German ex-pats, shows plenty of waxy lemon, pineapple rind and green bean characters, with white pepper and mint aromas adding complexity. The palate is downright opulent—textural weight is balanced by tingly acidity with a salty finish.
Name: Konrad 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy lime, lemongrass and green grass met with chalky minerality on the nose of this bottling. It's crisp and taut on the palate, but allows slightly riper Gravenstein apple flavors and approachable grassy tones to round out the midpalate.
Name: La Honda Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: This attractive and well-balanced white leads with enticing notes of pressed lemon verbena, just-dried grass and fynbos that are framed by a fruity spine of Meyer lemon, melon rind and white nectarine. Orange-like, citrusy acidity weaves throughout the medium-weight palate, ending with verve and vibrancy. Drink now–2020.
Name: Southern Right 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Description: Wild yeast, lees stirring and oak aging come together in this rich, full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc, with heady notes of brioche, coconut, salted cashews, lime, pineapple and baked apples. The acidity is bright and bouncy enough to keep things balanced, while oak flavors build on the finish.
Name: Greywacke 2015 Wild Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Stone fruit characteristics of white peach and underripe apricot lead the nose of this attractive Sauvy. They're complemented and balanced by bright citrus tones on the nose and mouth, as well as a tart gooseberry flavor that carries through to the mouthwatering finish. Lively, bright and well-balanced, enjoy now–2019.
Name: Hartenberg 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Relatively quiet yet persistent aromas of tropical and stone fruit, banana, a speck of honey and just a touch of green bean introduce a slippery-textured palate of waxy lemon and grapefruit. The acidity is there, but unlike other examples of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, it's not searing or green.
Name: Neudorf 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Notes of freshly dried grass, thyme, orange peel, green plum and melon rind unfold on the nose and mouth of this clean, attractive wine. It's medium in weight, though cut by ample acidity that rides through to the mouthwatering close. Drink now.
Name: Simonsig 2017 Sunbird Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: From one of New Zealand's pioneer winemakers, Allan Scott, who planted Marlborough's first vineyards, this is a crowd-pleasing, affordable sipper full of passionfruit, grapefruit and herbs, with a vegetal tinge and a salty edge. Slightly slippery in texture with zippy acidity and a long, salty citrus finish, this wine will hold its own against a wide array of summery seaside cuisine.
Name: Allan Scott 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There is a good dose of both vegetal and mineral tones in this single-vineyard wine. Expressing the typical characters of Marlborough's Awatere Valley, with green beans, asparagus, grass and a lemon-lime zing, there's another layer of complexity on the palate, where flint and wet-stone characters mingle with citrus and vegetal notes.
Name: Barker's Marque 2017 Three Brooms Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From a tremendous site planted with older vines, this white is delicious in green apple, melon and rocky stone, its texture creamy and somewhat lush. The acidity is high pitched and intense yet supportive.
Name: Clouds Rest 2014 Dutton Shop Block Forbidden Sauvignon Blanc (Green Valley)

Description: Earth and lemon unite on the nose. The palate comes in with immense freshness that is expressive and vivid despite its translucent lightness. Bright lemon is a constant feature from first whiff to dry finish.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: This vibrant white offers elderflower, citrus zest and crushed stone aromas. The linear palate shows white grapefruit and thyme notes set against bright acidity, with a crisp finish.
Name: Kurtatsch 2016 Kofl Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Passionfruit, chamomile, grapefruit, green pepper and canteloupe show on the nose and palate. A lovely minerality in the form of wet stone is present as well. The acidity is commanding without overpowering and lends itself to a long and fresh finish.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: The salty, herbal qualities of the Awatere Valley shine here, where sea shells and seaweed both come into play, dancing with delicate lime and snow pea aromas. The palate shows taut, zippy acidity and a slightly slippery texture, making for a Sauvignon Blanc that walks on the serious side and could be enjoyed with seafood.
Name: Eradus 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Subtle lemon, pineapple and tomato leaf notes can be detected under an oniony aroma. The palate is medium in weight, with a slightly oily texture, mouthwatering acidity and highlights of lemon and green leaf. A small portion of this wine was fermented with native yeast in old barrels.
Name: Lawson's Dry Hills 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Herbal, piney aromas and vivid lively grapefruit and pineapple flavors give this medium-bodied wine lots to enjoy. It is smooth and rich in texture and has a lingering finish.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc

Description: Ripe lemon zest and grass constitute the fragrant nose. The palate is zesty and fresh and has invigorating brightness on a very light body. The grassy notes linger on the dry finish.
Name: Wohlmuth 2017 Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Oasis, Gamache and Olsen vineyards and was aged half in stainless steel with the rest in neutral barrels. It's a bit reduced out of the gate, opening up to reveal kiwi, citrus, pineapple and herb aromas. The bountiful tropical fruit flavors delight.
Name: Sparkman 2017 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Yellow plum is boosted by bright ripe notes of Amalfi lemon alongside some grassy hints. The palate has a similarly bright, fruity and expressive outlook. Zesty citrus dominates the light dry body and leads onto a dry finish.
Name: Strauss 2017 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: This wine's delicate varietal aromas of elderflower, crushed tomato leaf and citrus lift out of the glass. On the palate, crisp acidity underscores white grapefruit, pineapple and steely mineral notes.
Name: Andriano 2016 Floreado Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine is a lovely melting pot of fruit, vegetal, herb and mineral notes. Citrus and pineapple aromas and flavors are layered in stalks, dried green herbs, flint and wet stones. Slightly viscous in texture, it finishes with a long, lemony tang.
Name: Cardigan Bay 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: While Central Otago is far better known for its Pinot Noir than its Sauvignon Blanc, this is a satisfying expression, showing notes of snow pea, tomato leaf, guava and grapefruit, with intriguing dried green herbal notes of oregano and thyme. The acidity is crispy and crunchy, balanced by just a bit of textural weight and a herbal finish.
Name: Peregrine 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Otago)

Description: This is a ripe, fragrant style of Sauvignon Blanc, with a pretty nose of peach, pineapple, apple skins and a hint of grass. Full-bodied and lush in texture—but with balanced acidity—tropical and citrus fruits shine on the palate which, wraps up with a long, pineapple finish.
Name: Forefathers 2017 Wax Eye Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This bottling is very pungent and sharp on the nose with fresh lime-skin aromas and hints of green papaya and wet cement. The bright tightly woven palate contains cut grass, lemongrass and more wet stone flavors.
Name: Alma de Cattleya 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: There's a spicy, toasty quality to this wine, amidst waxy lemon, apple blossoms and the classic tomato leaf and grass characters. There's nice textural weight on the palate, with balanced acidity, shy fruit tones and a grassy finish.
Name: Brancott 2016 Letter Series B Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Grapefruit, guava, lemon, green bell pepper and pea shoot aromas emerge with time in the glass. The chalky textured palate is what brings things up a notch—it's tightly wound and focused, with mouthwatering acidity. This is a tidy wine that manages a great balance of fruit and herbal tones.
Name: Dashwood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Punchy, vibrant aromas  of grapefruit and pineapple juice meet a mild, floral hop note on the nose. There's a round feel to the  palate which displays lots of tropical fruit rinds and floral, grapefruit flavors. Perfect for a hot summer's day.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: This Sauvy offers a nicely balanced experience, starting with fresh scents of lime leaf, thyme, citrus peel and pineapple core. The citrusy tones carry through to the refreshing palate alongside medium acidity. The lime-pith-flavored finish boasts a subtle astringent texture that lends some length to the close.
Name: Merwida 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Flinty with an aroma of matchstick, this wine is ultimately fresh and fruity in honeydew melon and peach, with an ebullience on the palate. Lightweight, it adds highlights of grapefruit and lemon on the finish.
Name: Rodney Strong 2017 Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc (Northern Sonoma)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Subdued aromas of grapefruit, banana and papaya carry to the juicy, medium-bodied palate. This offers a round, textural mouthfeel, with a brisk, chalky finish.
Name: Macari 2016 Lifeforce Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A heady mélange of peach, melon, citrus, apple blossoms and snow pea lead into a sea-salt palate with more stone and citrus fruit flavors, focused acidity and just the slightest textural weight.
Name: Mount Fishtail 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Bright, light and easygoing, with aromas of lemon, pear juice, melon, peach and a touch of green beans. The texture is slippery but nicely balanced by refreshing acidity, finishing on a herbal note. Drink now.
Name: Fern Ridge 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This fresh and well-balanced white opens with notes of sweet pea, fresh grass, orange blossom and lemon leaf. It's a refined and delicate pour, with refreshing acidity and clean flavors of white melon rind and citrus rind that lend a pleasant pithiness to the fresh finish. Drink now–2019.
Designation: Two Dogs, A Peacock & A Horse
Name: Black Elephant 2017 Two Dogs, A Peacock & A Horse Sauvignon Blanc (Franschhoek)

Description: This wine offers lemon, grapefruit, chamomile and a soft, green mossiness on the nose. Pea shoots, citrus and crushed minerals dance on the tongue with vibrant acidity. It finishes zippy and crisp, and would be perfect with oysters.
Name: Boxwood 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Middleburg)

Description: This Yarra Valley based Australian brand delivers a solid and unmistakably Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. It's a heady blend of stone and tropical fruits, blossoms, snow peas and jalapeño pepper. There's some fruit weight on the palate and a touch of oiliness, but the sunny acidity keeps everything bright and bouncy.
Name: Innocent Bystander 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Using slightly less new oak than the Reserve, this Sauvignon Blanc is bright and energetic. Aromas and flavors of passionfruit, grapefruit, honeysuckle and grass carry this wine. The acidity is racy and works well to combat the full, creamy weight. It finishes long and smooth. Pair with rich, creamy cheese.
Name: Stone Tower 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: Slender and taut, the nose is pretty and perfumed with bright passionfruit, pineapple, nettles, grass and tomato leaf, with a touch of honey. There's tongue-tingling acidity on the palate to go with a slippery smooth texture and a good lick of citrus and tropical fruit.
Name: Ten Sisters 2017 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a pretty, delicate wine with notes of honey, blossoms, peaches and lychees and tomato leaf. There's a lovely chalky texture, with mouthwatering acidity and a ripe fruit character adding to the wine's charm.
Name: Tiki Sound 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Sweet grass, peony, sweet pea and fynbos aromas lead the nose of this floral white. They're grounded by tones of white peach, Meyer lemon and white melon rind, though the fruity core seems secondary to the abundant herbal tones. Medium acidity lends enough cut to keep the mouthfeel vibrant and the finish fresh. Drink now.
Name: Le Bonheur 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Earthy and floral, this is not your average Sauvignon Blanc. This displays lots of floral, lemon balm, melon and warm spice notes on the palate. A delicate line of tannins from 18 hours of whole-cluster skin contact offers balance to the weighty juicy fruit.
Name: Paumanok 2015 Minimalist Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens in a wave of bright fresh flavor that evolves to present more creamy and substantive body and richness. The highlights are dipped in peach, apricot and melon, with a pronounced finish of vanilla and cinnamon.
Name: Dutton Estate 2016 Kylie's Cuvée Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This reserve Sauvignon Blanc is fresh in profile, with tropical fruit tones and lively acidity alongside secondary components of marzipan, marmalade and wild ginger that have evoloved with age. The texture is both energetic and creamy, with a long, leesy finish.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: This reserve Sauvignon Blanc is fresh in profile, with tropical fruit tones and lively acidity alongside secondary components of marzipan, marmalade and wild ginger that have evoloved with age. The texture is both energetic and creamy, with a long, leesy finish.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc offers up peach and pear juice, tropical fruit, tomato leaf and green bell pepper on the nose. It's silky and slippery, with an approachable, easygoing vibe about it.
Name: Mud House 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pale gold in color, ripe tropical and stone fruits, along with bruised apple and guava, white pepper and a smattering of snow peas can be coaxed from the glass after some swirling. The palate is medium bodied and oily in texture, but there is enough acid—along with lemon and herbal flavors—to keep things bright.
Name: Rubus 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara Valley)

Description: It introduces itself with a hint of passion fruit, a touch of grass. While the nose just teases, the palate gives bright lemon freshness and juicy yellow plum. This is bright, light, dry, fruit-driven and refreshing.
Name: Zantho 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop, with notes of green flower, bountiful citrus peel, fresh herb, kiwi and scooped honeydew melon. The broad feeling but lighter styled kiwi flavors bring appeal, with a pink-grapefruit snap on the finish.
Name: Airfield Estates 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This offers classic, intense aromas of guava, fig, lychee, grass and jalapeño, plus a hint of white pepper. There's a welcome textural weight on the palate, balancing crisp acidity and more green vegetal and grass flavors, wrapping up with a long, melon rind finish.
Name: Toi Toi 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The bouquet of this wine is enticing in tones of grapefruit, flint, Pink Lady apples and pilsner. It manifests on the palate in such a way that is buoyant and lush, with texture from the lees. It feels silky and alive at the same time and finishes long and full of complexity.
Name: Veritas 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of papaya, lemongrass and tart candies are brimming with vibrancy on the nose. There's a solid fruit presence on the rounded palate, with a line of crisp acidity providing adequate tension.
Name: Wölffer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Long Island)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This light-colored and medium-bodied wine has fresh citrus aromas, lemon, apple and vanilla flavors and a rounded texture that give it a full mouthfeel. It's well made and well-balanced.
Name: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
