Description: Small amounts of Sauvignon Musque and Sauvignon Gris are blended within this substantive, lushly built wine, which is thick and rich in flavors of peach and vanilla. The finish brightens with aromas of jasmine.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Notes of pollen, lemon and plastic carry the nose, with a bit of melon showing on the light-bodied palate. There's mild concentration to the flavors and a pleasing roundness to the feel, balanced by a gentle vein of acidity.
Designation: Shared Table Farm Long White Cloud
Name: Anthony Nappa 2016 Shared Table Farm Long White Cloud Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A yeasty aroma is at the forefront on this wine, although there's also plenty of this style's characteristic citrus, pineapple, snow pea and green bell pepper as well. The palate is extra fruity, bright, zippy and crisp, making for an easygoing porch pounder.
Name: Barker's Marque 2017 Arona Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This offers grilled herb, citrus rind and exotic fruit scents. The ripe, forward palate shows grapefruit, baked apple and mature peach flavors.
Name: Baron di Pauli 2016 Kinesis Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of ripe stone fruit, lemon curd and green beans are backed by appealing secondary characters of melon rind and dried herbs. The palate feels a little more forced and lacks the pretty fruit found on the nose, but there's pleasing textural weight, crisp acidity, and an interesting salty, melon rind finish.
Name: Black Cottage 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine's honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the fresh, linear palate, a mineral hint accompanies grapefruit, pineapple and tomato leaf notes.
Name: Castel Sallegg 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine smells at first like toasted garlic and dried herbs, but it develops complexity and good fruit flavors after airing in the glass and then it deepens with each sip. It's supported by a very lively crisp texture.
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: There's a chalky, carnation-like character upfront on the bouquet of this wine, countered by ripe yellow melon and peach tones that lend an interesting juxtaposition. The palate boasts a slightly rounded feel, with a soft creaminess thanks to the ripe melon and stone-fruit flavors. Just enough acidity manages to lend balance to the fruity weight and keeps the finish in check.
Name: Spier 2017 Vintage Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Typical aromas of grapefruit, passionfruit, lemon and snow peas are layered with some salty and herbal notes. There's a touch of residual sugar on the palate balancing a lot of crisp acidity in this clean example of a classic style.
Name: Spy Valley 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's a clean, refreshing tropical-fruit character to this zippy wine, showcased in waves of pineapple, peach and underripe mango that combine with notes of sweet grass, lime peel and green plum. Ample acidity keeps the palate fresh and zippy, while a pithy character lends astringent grip to the close. Drink now.
Name: Steenberg 2017 Klein Steenberg Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This starts shy, but after a good amount of swirling in glass it reveals a medley of ripe tropical and citrus fruits with white pepper and a green herbal tinge. There's a flintiness on the palate, wrapped in a smooth, chalky mouthfeel and a long, tangy finish.
Name: Sunday Mountain 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine's honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the fresh, linear palate, a mineral hint accompanies grapefruit, pineapple and tomato leaf notes.
Name: Castel Sallegg 2017 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Light aromas of dried grass, savory herbs and lime leaf mingle with fruity notes of green melon and white peach on the nose of this wine. The palate follows suit with more lime and tart melon tones, lifted by ample acidity and finishing slightly bitter and tangy. Drink now–2019.
Name: De Grendel 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: This wine has enticing aromas of lemon, white peach and aloe which translate onto the palate. The acidity is crisp but could stand a little more to hold up to the body. The lovely flavors hang on until the very end of a long finish.
Name: Glen Manor 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: This wine has all the extroverted qualities of New Zealand's most famous wine style—brash aromas of guava, grapefruit, passionfruit, grass, tomato leaf and fresh green beans. It has zippy acidity and just a hint of creamy texture, with tons of citrusy zing.
Name: Governor's Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: For pure, young Sauvignon Blanc, this is a soft, rounded wine. It is attractive to drink immediately, with quince, apple and lemon flavors. The final taste is packed with fruit.
Designation: Les Hauts de la Gaffelière Sélection d'Excellence
Name: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2017 Les Hauts de la Gaffelière Sélection d'Excellence  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Notes of stone fruit, watermelon and passionfruit carry a slightly green tinge. There's a ripeness to the feel, but a nice line of acidity helps maintain balance. Overall, a solid and straightforward buy.
Name: Marlborough Estate Reserve 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Dried grass, lemon peel and tart gooseberry set the stage on the nose of this bright wine and carry through to the tart-flavored palate. The mouthfeel is surprisingly rounded in texture, though it's lifted by ample acidity that helps to enliven the finish. Drink now.
Name: Neethlingshof 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Soft aromas of grapefruit, lemon, wet stone and moss set the tone for this Sauvignon Blanc. Not in your face in any way, the aromas and flavors are classic yet demure. This is light and bright, with zippy acidity that leaves a tingle on the long finish.
Name: Sunset Hills 2016 50 W Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: This could be a poster child for Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, offering all the hallmarks of the style: white grapefruit, pineapple, passionfruit and peach skins with, of course, a lick of grassiness. Its racy acidity and slightly chalky texture make for an easygoing summer sipper.
Name: Opawa 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a solidly made, wallet-friendly Sauvignon Blanc that offers heady, fresh aromas and flavors of lemon zest, oregano and snow pea, with a slightly creamy texture to balance all that zingy acidity. Drink now.
Name: Staete Landt 2017 Map Maker Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is fairly typical in style, focused more on passionfruit and citrus flavors than on the herbal and grassy flavors. Along with all the lemon, passionfruit and stone fruit characters, there's a lick of zingy acidity and a slightly creamy texture, making for an easy-drinking summer sipper.
Name: Tora Bay 2017 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This wine is concentrated on the nose with canteloupe, mango, flint and yeast. Equally tropical and intese on the palate, there are playful bursts of necterine and marzipan. It feels creamy and smooth despite its lively acidity. The finish is long and flavorful.
Name: Boxwood 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Middleburg)

Description: A floral character that leads the way on the nose of this lively wine, expressed in notes of lemon verbena, clover and baby's breath. Behind are fruity tones of white melon, peach and lime that provide a solid core to the lightweight mouthfeel. The lime pith-flavored finish is tart and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2017 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: A veritable tropical fruit bowl of aromas—with just the slightest whisper of grass—slides smoothly into a light- to medium-bodied palate of zingy acidity, slippery texture and plenty more ripe pineapple and guava fruit.
Name: Chasing Venus 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's an attractive floral element upfront on the nose of this wine, supported by ripe notes of guava, pineapple and mango. The medium-weight palate offers enough cut to counter the fruity richness, while brisk, refreshing citrus flavors carry the close. Drink now.
Name: Fairvalley 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Grapefruit, white peach, cantaloupe and pilsner aromas follow through to the palate. Bright acidity is matched with a textural creaminess. The finish is demure, with a zip of acidity straight down the middle of the tongue.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: Flint and savory herbs are the stars of this wine, with citrus playing a supporting role. In both aroma and flavor, fennel and bell pepper stand out with grapefruit and a smoky, stoniness on the midpalate. The finish is long and zippy in herbacious tones.
Name: Breaux 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: This wine is lively in tropical and floral aromas. Lychee, passion fruit and geranium are concentrated on the nose, as well as prevalent on the palate. There is a striking salinity that gives this wine a savory line. There's a lot of power in the wine.
Name: Veritas 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)

Description: Showing a brilliant light-gold color and mineral and citrus aromas, this light-bodied wine reveals flavors of apple and pear accented by vanilla. It's quite smooth and polished in texture and leans toward the soft side in terms of balance.
Name: Wise Villa 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: While this wine starts with an oniony aroma, it blows off fairly quickly, displaying aromas of honey, peach, guava, lemon and dried herbs taking its place. The palate shows a whisper of sweetness, balanced by tropical fruit flavors and a herbal finish.
Name: Jade Cove 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Soft scents of baby's breath, lemongrass and minty herbs dance on the nose of this delicate white, with hints of lemon-lime citrus at the core. It's lightweight and direct in feel, with clean acidity and a slightly pithy citrus character on the close. Enjoy this dainty gem now.
Name: Riebeek Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Swartland)

Description: This reserve Sauvignon Blanc is teeming with scents of candied peach and lemon, with geranium and honeydew. Full in body, this is a white that could stand up to a heartier meal. The creaminess and roundness stick around on the long finish.
Name: Stone Tower 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Pleasantly tropical in tones of pineapple rind, citrus and banana, this is a well-balanced offering that begs to be enjoyed seaside. There's a pleasing roundness to the light-bodied palate, with a refreshing sweet-tart finish.
Name: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Sauvignon Blanc (New York)

Description: While this wine starts with an oniony aroma, it blows off fairly quickly, displaying aromas of honey, peach, guava, lemon and dried herbs taking its place. The palate shows a whisper of sweetness, balanced by tropical fruit flavors and a herbal finish.
Name: Jade Cove 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromas of passionfruit, lime, grapefruit and peach notes are backed by tomato leaves and stones. The palate is taut and focused, with zingy, lime acidity and a green leafy finish.
Name: Staete Landt 2017 Annabel Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this white is fruity and fresh, with a nutty character that rides alongside ripe apricot and melon. There's a robust intensity to the finish.
Name: Taft Street 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: While this delivers in many regards, the style seems more muted and angular than in vintages past. After vigorous swirling in glass it finally displays guava, grapefruit, lime and snow pea characters. It's a crisp style with mouthpuckering acidity and a no-frills disposition.
Name: Kim Crawford 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Stone-fruit flavors and jasmine aromatics define the core of this light-bodied wine, which is stony in mineral texture with an intense lemony aspect that meets crisp green apple.
Name: Kokomo 2017 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Ripe citrus and melon along with a touch of lychee and tomato leaf aromas are a bit dull but can be coaxed from the glass. The palate offers a grapefruit and citrus tang with balanced acidity. Simple yet enjoyable. Drink now.
Name: Komaru 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is light and easy to like, with soft notes of sweet grass, lemon peel and white melon rind on the nose and mouth. It shows light acidity on the palate, though the pithy finish is clean and bright. Drink now.
Name: KWV 2017 Classic Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of tart candies, grapefruits and soapy florals make for a heady nose. This is light in feel, with a palate that transitions from lemon to red apple and finally grapefruit pith on the finish.
Name: Benmarl 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and dried herbs meet flavors that are earthy and herbal in this medium-bodied lively assertive wine.
Name: Berryhill 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: This has subtle aromas suggesting white spring flowers and citrus zest. The bright, simple palate evokes grapefruit, sage and a hint of beeswax.
Name: Ca' Ronesca 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This wine starts off a little shy and rubbery, but it blows off some with time in glass, revealing guava, passionfruit and grass. There's a good lick of acidity on the palate, that's kept relatively in check by the ripe fruit flavors. While its sharp edges lack some finesse, the citrus and guava element is enough to please many a Sauvignon Blanc lover.
Name: Glazebrook 2017 041°S-174°E Regional Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The nose on this Sauvignon Blanc is oddly overripe. Most of the aromas of canteloupe, mango, lychee and geranium are pleasing, but they are overpowered by a waft of ginko nut. All of these flavors carry to the palate, where bright acidity doesn't quite stand up to the full body.
Name: Linden 2016 Avenius Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: This is a simple expression, showing some of the typicity of the cooler Awatere Valley as well as the cooler, wetter vintage. Citrus, tomato leaf and jalapeño pepper tones shine on a palate full of zesty but in-check acidity. There is a slightly slippery texture with a leafy, grassy finish.
Name: The Crossings 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Medium-intense aromas of freshly dried grass, orange peel and tart melon rind dance on the nose of this attractive white. The palate shows a bit of roundness that's kept in check by ample acidity and a slightly astringent citrus-pith character. Drink now.
Name: Warwick 2017 The First Lady Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This wine shows grass, melon rind, citrus, guava, and green bell pepper. The palate puts forth just a smidgeon of citrus fruit, but mostly it's green and lean, with a whisper of textural weight that increase its interest slightly.
Name: Yealands 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's a struck-match flinty quality to the first sniff of this wine, and then come the lemon skins and dried Granny Smith apples. It's much cleaner on the palate, full of tangy lime and pome fruits.
Name: Bianchi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A straightforward nose of lemon, grapefruit and a touch of plastic make for an easy, yet enjoyable wine. Light in body, with a mildly round texture, the palate brings a crisp vein of gooseberry and green apple flavor.
Name: Billsboro 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is very light with subtle apple and pear aromas. The palate is somewhat flat, with touches of apple, grass and wet stones.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Ripe tropical fruits, bruised apples and blossoms are encased in a distinctive canned green-bean aroma. The apple-tinged palate shows some textural weight, but it's not quite enough to balance the acidity which feels a tad lean and forced.
Name: Pounamu 2016 Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Ripe, almost confected, peach and tropical fruit notes lead the way in this wine, where grassy green characters take a big back seat. Nevertheless, it's bright and cheerful, with zippy acidity and an easygoing nature.
Name: Toi Toi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromas of mango, passion fruit, gooseberry and geranium show on the nose. The tropical notes follow through to the palate, but are muted by a briny salinity. This would be a nice wine to sip outside while eating soft shelled crab.
Name: Delfosse 2016 Mountain and Vine Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)

Description: Although it has little of the grassy and green vegetal characters of many Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs, this wine still ticks many stylistic boxes. It's aromatic and outgoing—a heaping fruit bowl of pineapple, passionfruit, guava and grapefruit. There's a slight oiliness to the palate, which makes for some welcome texture amidst prickly acidity and plenty more exotic fruit flavors.
Name: Fire Road 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc has a tropical nose, full of overripe melon, passionfruit, fresh grapefruit and button mushroom. The flavors are similar and there is also a nice salinity to the palate. Easy drinking from ample acidity, this would be a great summer salad accompaniment.
Name: Glen Manor 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: There is a strong onion aroma here that blows off, allowing aromas of grapefruit, guava, snow pea and tomato leaf come to the fore. Texturally, it's a little lean and mean with mouthpuckering acidity. There's a nice herbal edge on the palate but its lacking in fruit.
Name: Goldwater 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Thanks perhaps to a wetter, cooler vintage, this is tightly wound, showing vegetal aromas of canned beans and white pepper, along with zesty lemon, grapefruit and canned pineapples. The acidity on the palate is piercing and shrill, overpowering the tropical and citric fruit flavors.
Name: Barker's Marque 2017 The Loop Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tangy and fresh, this light-bodied wine has a vague citrus aroma, crisp lemony flavors and a rather light brisk texture, all of which will be appealing on a warm evening.
Name: Tom Gore 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Lemon, grapefruit, peach and pear aromas dominate on the nose, which comes with faint green notes and the expected zing of acidity on the palate. A tart, taut style that is very nearly lean and mean but is held togther by just a touch of textural weight.
Name: Winc 2017 Outer Sounds Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very ripe fruit flavors give this wine a sense of depth to go with its almost viscous texture. It's full bodied and feels soft in terms of acidity.
Name: Bella Grace 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Description: Aged for a few months in tank before bottling, this wine captures the herbal and ripe green-fruit character of Bordeaux Sauvignon Blanc. Its light acidity, fruitiness and crisp aftertaste all come together well. Drink now.
Name: Schröder & Schÿler 2017 Chartron la Fleur  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Shy notes of citrus peel and grass carry the nose and palate. This is straightforward, light-bodied and crisp, making it an easy wine to enjoy by itself.
Name: Bedell 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Shy at first, emitting quiet notes of lemon and stone fruit, this wine opens with some swirling in glass reavelaing more confected aromas of candied pineapples and other tropical fruits. The palate is more demur with the acidity on the lean and mean side, emphasizing tart lemon flavors.
Name: Barker's Marque 2017 Ranga Ranga Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A ripe, semiconfected nose of pineapple, peach and lemon drop candy is made a bit more interesting by mint and stalky notes on the back palate. There's noticeable residual sugar on the palate and the acidity surrounding it feels forced, but the leafy, citrusy flavors are tasty, as is the pineapple  finish.
Name: The Seeker 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Grapefruit, grass, jalapeño pepper and some sea salt aromas are a bit muted but poke their heads out. The acidity is searing but there's just enough of an oily texture to keep things in check.
Name: Twin Islands 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Vegetal aromas like canned beans and grass come to the fore with time to air. There's a little citrus and guava fruit at the back but it's subtle. The palate comes with a touch of residual sugar that's not as balanced as it could be. There's an appealing chalky texture amidst prominent acidity, and plenty more herbal characters.
Name: Kennedy Point 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's a strong green, herbal edge to the nose of this refreshing white, expressed in waves of lime peel, peppery herbs and green bean. The lightweight and direct palate offers pithy citrus tones that lend a pleasant astringency to the tart finish. Enjoy now.
Name: Excelsior 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Description: Considering its astonishing low price, this Sauvignon Blanc is perfectly quaffable. There's the predictably clean citrus, guava, grass and green bell pepper notes along with a little texture on the ripe palate.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2017 Ti Point Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Gooseberry and citrus aromas meld with tomato-leaf aromas in this light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. The palate and brisk in feel, with an astringent lemon-rind finish.
Name: Fjord 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This ripe, lightly sweet style of Sauvignon Blanc is fresh and crisp, with an herbal edge. Drink this attractive, fruity wine now.
Name: Le Hameau 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: A simple Sauvignon Blanc, the nose is very closed, but with plenty of time to air citrusy, grapefruit aromas emerge with a touch of grassiness. Cheek-biting acidity and a lemony tang follow on the palate.
Name: Rata 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sharp gooseberry, lemongrass and canned white-bean aromas carry to a light-bodied palate of puckering green tones and flower water. This is delicate in feel, with crisp acidity.
Name: Rooster Hill 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc sees time in barrel, giving it rather simple oaky aromas like vanilla, brioche and honey. There's a smidgeon of pineapple and citrus but otherwise the fruit characters are masked by the oak influence. The palate offers the style's characteristic tongue-tingling acidity, but unfortunately it's not integrated with the creamy, vanillin woodiness.
Name: Spy Valley 2016 Easy Tiger Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: In what was generally a wetter, cooler vintage, the 2017 of this wine doesn't quite succeed. The aromas are quite muted, although guava, peach and bell pepper do eventually squeeze their way out. Residual sugar on the palate is unbalanced, overpowering the citrus and tropical fruit flavors.
Name: Invivo 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe melon and citrus tones are blousy and a bit overblown. The palate shows a decent concentration of citrus flavors, but ultimately overripe fruit tones win out.
Name: Damiani 2016 Little Lotus Flower Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Direct and straightforward, this offers faint notes of citrus, white apple flesh and melon rind on the nose and mouth, with just-enough acidity and a short but clean finish. Drink now.
Name: Two Oceans 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Citrus fruits on the nose are are masked by a slightly eggy aroma, along with onions on this wine. There's not much fruit weight to balance the searing acidity on the palate. Nevertheless, those after a simple, crisp wine the price is right.
Name: Coastal Cove 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Part of a new brigade of lighter calorie wines, this offers pungent aromas of buttered beans, wet grass alongside underripe guava and melons. The palate underwhelms, showing an off-kilter spritz amidst searing acidity.
Name: Brancott 2017 Flight Song Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Odd aromas of savory cannellini beans and plastic ride over a mild lemongrass note in this wine. The palate is light in feel and mild in concentration, with a sweet floral note on the close.
Name: Fulkerson 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: This canned wine has a light touch of carbonation, almost neutral aromas and rustic but drinkable flavors of grapefruit and herbs.
Name: Essentially Geared NV Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This pretty wine is floral and beguiling on the nose. It was blended with 11% Sauvignon Gris and 6% Sauvignon Musqué, with the whole barrel fermented and aged in both French oak and stainless steel drums. Creamy and lush on the palate, the medium body is integrated and complex in highlights of apricot, lime and peach.
Name: Chalk Hill 2016 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged in concrete, this 'wow' of a wine is nuanced in nutty almond, Meyer lemon and crisp grapefruit. Sleek and smooth, it features bright focused acidity that complements the complex savory fruit and hints of lemongrass and ginger.
Name: Sidebar Cellars 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Very light in the glass, this blend of McGinley and Grassini vineyards, much of which spent time in cigar-shaped barrels, shows reserved aromas of wet stone, soft peach blossom, subtle apple and crushed chalk on the nose. The palate is vibrant with crisp clean pure flavors of citrus, cherimoya and poached pear, with a unique touch of green tea and scallions toward the finish.
Name: Margerum 2016 D Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an oily petrol kick to the nose of this Bordeaux-like single vineyard expression, atop a base of apple syrup and grapefruit pith. The oily nature extends to the palate, where wafts of smoke envelop pithy flavors of citrus skin and a compelling texture. It's an unctuous, compelling take on the grape for a region usually focused on freshness.
Name: Dragonette 2015 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Dark gold in color, this is an inviting white wine, light and fresh with highlights of peach Melba and honeysuckle. Tahitian vanilla adds a note of balanced richness that rewards the palate with substance and grace.
Name: Textbook 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine yields ripe citrus, melon and vanilla aromas, along with waxy minerally notes that add delicious complexity. It's technically light-bodied in terms of alcohol but fills out the palate nicely and lingers on the finish, echoing oak spice and mineral tones.
Name: Vie Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Lively fruit flavors and a little richness in the texture make a good combination for this full-bodied wine that tastes lightly oaky while balanced by a flood of grapefruit and lime. Made with 15% new oak and 8% Verdelho grapes, It is mouth filling and refreshing at the same time, which is a great combination.
Name: Blue Victorian Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Stainless steel-aged, this delightful white shows high-toned floral characteristics of apricot and green apple, with a medium-bodied oomph of creamy lushness on the finish. It'll do well with food or on its own.
Name: Senders 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)

Description: This wine offers a lovely balance of dry, oaky substance on a well-framed, light body. The palate is fresh and fruity, with an exotic core of papaya, lemon and butter that's bolstered by succulent freshness and a lush backbone.
Name: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Fumé Blanc Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel and aged on the lees for a month, this leads with compelling aromas of sweet herb, melon, citrus, and tropical fruit. The sleek palate bursts with fruit flavors, framed by lively acidity.
Name: Sightglass 2017 Artz Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: This is a bright fresh white that shows a nice complement of dried herb and lemongrass with juicier, more concentrated flavors of white peach and melon. Elegantly crafted, it has a lushness to the palate that's lengthy and complex.
Name: Black Stallion 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This well-balanced wine from high-elevation Lake County has everything in the right proportions: fresh herb and citrus aromas, lip-smacking, crisp fruit flavors, a generous texture and lingering finish.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc from coastal Leyda Valley boasts crisp, pure citrus and oceanic aromas. It's tight and firm on the palate, with citrus, sea salt and green herb flavors that finish smooth and round despite bold acidity.
Name: Viña Leyda 2017 Single Vineyard Garuma Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is made in an especially leesy, mineral-drenched style, which sets it apart from the vast majority of new world Sauvignon Blancs. Its immaculate lime skin, grapefruit, pineapple and fresh herb flavors combine in a most refreshing way.
Name: Viola 2016 Allegre Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe apples, lime skin, chalk and Asian pear aromas slowly come to the fore on the nose of this subtle bottling. It lands very cleanly on the palate, offering yellow apples, hints of chalk and chiseled marble and then a slightly tropical swing toward mango on the finish.
Name: Foxen 7200 2016 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Smooth and flavorful, this wine has plenty of pear and light herb aromas. Light spice, mineral and melon flavors offer a good sense of layering on the palate, all leading to a generous mouthfeel and lingering finish.
Name: Vigilance 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark in color, this is a pretty wine, intensely aromatic in jasmine, anise and fresh flavors of white peach and green apple. Medium bodied, it has some oomph to the palate but is balanced.
Name: Hawley 2017 Hopkins River Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh herb and melon aromas lead to a fairly rich mouthfeel and a combination of tangy, fruity and mineral-like flavors that add up to a well-rounded and well-made wine.
Name: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this fresh bottling shows aromas of lime rinds, Anjou pear skins and rainy cement but also riper touches of passion fruit and gooseberry. There is a strong citrus tang to the sip, a ripe apple flavor and a crushed seashell minerality.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine's fresh lime and grapefruit aromas are simple but lively. Crisp acidity and tang define its lean, racy palate. Orange, lime and green herb flavors linger on the finish, with a note of thyme.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel
Name: Concha y Toro 2017 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pomelo skin, grapefruit zest, chalk and a bit of reductive petrol and smoke aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers tremendous textural grip with tangy lime and underripe Pink Lady apple flavors.
Name: Dragonette 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's juicy citrus flavors are amplified by varietally appropriate notes of cut grass and melon. There's a touch of celery, plenty of supporting acidity and an overall freshness that calls for drinking over the next year or two.
Name: Agate Ridge 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Southern Oregon)

Description: This blends 92% Sauvignon Blanc and 8% Sémillon, the two barrel-fermented for richness and layering. Lemongrass, wet stone and apricot mingle well together around supportive acidity that's bright and substantial. Creamy and lush, it finishes clean.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2016 Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: An attractive perfume of white grapefruit, lemon and white pepper carries the nose. The palate brings bright acidity rounded out by a slippery texture and a citrusy tang. A worthy summer sipper.
Name: Zonte's Footstep 2016 Excalibur Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine is quite dry and refreshing with lean fruit flavors and a good crisp texture. It's low in alcohol, too, and will be a crowd-pleaser, especially in hot weather.
Name: Dancing Crow 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This wine offers notes of lime blossom, grapefruit, white pepper and citrus rind. There's a lovely, chalky, warm stone quality to the palate, with crisp, citrusy acidity. This would be tasty with fresh summery fare.
Name: Thomas Goss 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This cheery wine has a lot of vibrant fruit flavors including lemon, grapefruit and crisp apple that refresh the palate, along with light spice notes of vanilla and ginger and perhaps a touch of sweetness.
Name: Foursight 2016 Charles Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Description: Freshness is this Sauvignon Blanc's virtue. Its clear color and sharp citrus peel and sweat aromas lead to a fresh and punchy yet slick palate. With its salty lime and persimmon flavors, it finishes tight and lean, with limited weight and volume.
Name: Casas del Toqui 2017 Coastal Series Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This wine's intense nose smells oily, as though starting to break down. Its lean palate deals standard Chilean Sauvignon Blanc flavors of citrus and green herbs but also latent bitterness. Peppery bitterness remains on the finish.
Name: Valdivieso 2016 Valley Selection Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This plump, above average Sauvignon Blanc has ripe, dusty melon aromas and bold green fruit and lettuce flavors. It finishes round and a bit flat, so drink immediately for maximum freshness.
Name: Siegel 2017 Crucero Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This screw cap wine has a strong earthy scent at first whiff, but mellows into fresh herbs, grapefruit and white pepper after a little airing . It has great acidity, medium body and the refreshing qualities most people look for in a Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Steelhead Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows pear flesh, apple blossoms and the slightest tinge of cut grass on the fruity, easygoing nose. Though it lacks a bit in texture, the palate shows fleshy apple and pear flavors as well as a touch of tropical guava.
Name: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Private Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Description: Incredibly aromatic tones of gooseberry, grape, passionfruit, grass and snow peas erupt from the glass. The palate is tangy and zippy, with mouthwatering acidity and a citrusy, grassy finish. A bold style many will love.
Name: Sidewood 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly richer expression of the grape, this bottling shows ripe Asian pear, blanched almonds, baked apples and a slightly alkaline touch. The palate starts slightly sweet, with lemon-laced apple-pie flavors and finishes the same.
Name: Esser 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: This wine's clean, minerally nose contains whiffs of lime and grass. It's firm but balanced, with a medium body and bracing acidity. Its lime and fruit salad flavors finish under control.
Name: Palena 2017 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit and lemongrass prepare the palate for flavors of lemon, passion fruit and orange blossom. This wine is round on the palate and offers a zesty finish.
Name: Tabor 2016 Adama Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong flinty aroma that kicks off the nose of this bottling, giving intrigue to the squeezed lime and citrus skin scents. The palate starts with an apple cider-like flavor that's lifted by pine oil and a touch of wood smoke, all of which become more cohesive as the bottle opens up.
Name: Tangent 2016 Paragon Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: This wine's mild citrus aromas are a touch green and pyrazinic. Its round, soft palate is pleasant, with mild acidity and green melon, herb and bell pepper flavors that end a bit flat. Drink right away.
Name: Ventisquero 2017 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's bright melon, citrus zest and herb aromas lead to tart, rounded fruit flavors. Lemon pith notes linger on the finish. It brings a lot of quality and value.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of ripe nectarine and Anjou pear skins meet with lime pith, cut grass and cement on the nose of this bottling from the San Diego area. An impressive texture grabs hold of the palate immediately, then gives way to baked apple and dried pear flavors that go down easy.
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (South Coast)

Description: Ripe but slightly flat orange, apricot and squash aromas are supported on the palate by adequate acidity. Tangerine and white grapefruit flavors finish short.
Name: Chilensis 2017 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This wine offers delicate lime, floral, white pepper and nettle aromas. The palate carries ripe fruit and prickly acidity that feel a tad disjointed from one another, but the chalky texture brings things back into focus.
Name: D'Arenberg 2016 The Broken Fishplate Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: This wine has subdued vegetal aromas and melon and honey scents that provide sweetness. It's fresh, firm and lean on the palate, with quick-hitting acidity. Short on fruit flavors, it's heavier on the green stuff, with lasting vegetal notes and a salty finish.
Name: Casas del Toqui 2017 Coastal Mist Terroir Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This wine offers fragrant aromas of ripe pear, melon, tropical fruit and flowers. A rather lean and mean palate of mouth-puckering acidity is almost balanced by a textural oiliness.
Name: Penny's Hill 2016 The Agreement Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a simple and fruity wine with dilute, generic flavors and little varietal character. Its citrus and apple notes finish with a bitter, phenolic bite.
Name: Season 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Southern Oregon)

Description: This wine's pineapple and canned citrus aromas lead to a standard palate with acidity but not a lot of body. Spicy citrus and green banana flavors finish with a peppery pop of pyrazine.
Name: Veramonte 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Exotic in a nose of lemongrass and papaya, this medium-bodied white becomes slightly sweet on the palate, showing an overripe succulence accented in spritzy acidity and freshly cut grass.
Name: Chalk Hill 2016 Windy Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Chalk Hill)

Description: This is a light, bright and 100% stainless steel fermented and aged white, grassy and herbal in lemongrass and fresh peas. The acidity is focused and spritzy.
Name: Y3 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This opens with a neutral nose. Its tangy palate with lean, salty citrus fruit and zesty acidity finishes short and punchy.
Name: Manos Andinas 2017 Reserva Hand Harvested Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Totally herbal, this crisp wine is all about richly flavored Sauvignon Blanc. It has weight despite its low alcohol, and is full of green and citrus fruits. The cut-grass aroma sings of a summer's day and this makes a great aperitif to drink right then.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is simple and slightly sweet in perception, with heavy flavors of melon, hazelnut and almond paste.
Name: Girard 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc is stony in character, with a floral, minerally nose. It's tight in feel as it delivers briny citrus and cidery flavors. Saltiness emerges on the racy but fruitless finish.
Name: Junta 2017 Momentos Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Duras, Southwest France, France
Description: This fruity, lightly herbal and perfumed wine comes from a small region south of Bergerac and east of Bordeaux. It is crisp, hinting at gooseberry as well as citrus fruits. Drink immediately.
Name: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Sécret de Berticot Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Duras)

Description: This fully ripe, robust white shows a mix of briny olive, green peas and peach and is concentrated in richness that becomes slightly cloying.
Name: Kenwood 2016 Six Ridges Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Pointy, punchy aromas recalling citrus and pine resin lead the nose of this wine. It's flat and sticky on the palate, with bitter, green flavors and little fruit. The finish is dull.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2017 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Rather light in body and savory in flavor, this wine has earthy aromas, mild fruit flavors and a brothy component. It's smooth on the palate.
Name: CK Mondavi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This wine's vegetal aromas suggest canned peas. It has a plump, creamy palate but lacks pop. Its green pea and bell pepper flavors are slightly bitter; those same flavors linger on the finish. It hails from the northern Atacama Desert and seems a bit underripe.
Name: Ventisquero 2016 Grey Glacier Single Block Sauvignon Blanc (Atacama Valley)

Description: This offers lean, spicy citrus aromas. It's won and flat on the palate, with peppery flavors of celery, lettuce and underripe citrus.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2017 Cefiro Cool Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Gritty, oily, off-putting aromas announce a wine that's not holding up. Its wide palate lacks precision, tasting as burnt and bitter as it smells. From a rainy vintage, it's no longer in prime form.
Name: Ritual 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Sharp pine and citrus aromas introduce this wine. The palate offers little more than tart, green citrus flavors with bitter bell pepper and pickle brine flavors.
Name: Calcu 2017 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged in stainless and new French oak, this wine is woody and muted on the nose, revealing a pungent barrel element that's hard to define. The fruit flavors are sour.
Name: Integrity 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine's punchy, citrusy nose leads to a palate that's all about acidity. Its pickled citrus peel and green melon flavors are salty and a bit skunky on the finish.
Name: Odfjell 2017 Armador Estate Selection Organic Wine Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: This wine smells sweaty and raw. The palate is lean and sharp, with sour, bitter flavors.
Name: Garzón 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Uruguay)

Description: This wine's oddly sweet bath soap and tropical fruit aromas are followed by a shapeless palate holding a mix of tropical, banana-like flavors and bitterness. It turns even more bitter on the finish.
Name: Sombras del Sol 2017 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This wine's wayward melon and briny sea water aromas lead to a dilute palate without much grip. Its salty, vegetal flavors are more or less fruitless—an impression that carries into the finish.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2017 Los Vascos Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This dessert wine was made from a block of the Musqué clone at the producer's Meredith Estate, picked when they were raisined then fermented and aged in 60% new French oak. A briny green-olive tone dots the nose before the sweetness of caramel, honeycomb, gingersnap and vanilla weighs in on the palate. This is concentrated, lush and creamy, with a bright citrus flourish on the finish.
Name: Merry Edwards 2014 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes and aged for 12 months on lees, this is a concentrated wine. It has rich apple and quince fruit and a layers of strong mineral texture. All these elements combine into a dense wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2015 Sauvage  (Sancerre)

Description: The flinty soil of this vineyard has given a wine that is intense, steely and mineral in texture. Crisp citrus and gooseberry flavors are enmeshed in this spicy and taut wine. Partial aging in big barrels has added a touch of vanilla while also offering breadth to the palate. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2015 Le Roc  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from a 2.4-acre parcel of chalky limestone soil that gives great intensity: tense, mineral and with a tight texture. A year on lees has added to the wine's concentration with touches of spice and pepper. This wine is taut and will age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2015 La Côte  (Sancerre)

Description: From the oldest vines in the Jolivet holdings in this vineyard, this wine is rich with melon and apricot, and crisp with citrus. Combined, the two elements have created an intense wine that hints at a herbal character but is richer, honeyed and wonderfully ripe. Drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2015 Le Grand Chemarin  (Sancerre)

Description: One of a series of single-parcel wines, this comes from the village of Maimbray. Aged in old wooden barrels, it has spice as well as a rich, smooth texture. It is crisp at the moment, full of herbal Sauvignon flavors. But with the wood aging, these will soften to give a generous wine with a lightly toasty character. Drink from 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Le Cotelin  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from one of the top vineyards in Sancerre, overlooking the village of Bué. It has both richness and a tight, herbal character that gives a mineral texture. Fermented using wild yeasts, the wine is elegant, ripe and generous. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Le Chêne Marchand  (Sancerre)

Description: In the village of Saint-Satur on the road out of Sancerre to the Loire, this walled vineyard has produced a rich, structured and dense wine. It is ripe, full of yellow fruits as well as good acidity, layering rich fruitiness with minerality and an edgy texture. This wine could age further before drinking, so wait until 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Les Ruchons  (Sancerre)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a remote vineyard located on red soils in the middle of nowhere, this is a very bright bottling that offers aromas of honeysuckle, crisp yellow apples, pear skins and tangy kumquat rinds. There is extreme energy to the sip, where Asian pear, lime peel and more crisp apple flavors converge. It's a property to watch.
Name: Lieff 2016 Alamo Creek Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Fermented three-quarters in oak and the rest in stainless steel, this wine is fleshy, tart and delicious. Acid-driven and picked to retain an innate lightness, it shines in grapefruit and lemongrass flavors, steeled by a grainy, complex texture.
Name: Gamble Family Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)

Description: Loveblock is the label of Erica and Kim Crawford, former owners of one of New Zealand's most famous brands. Their latest Sauvignon Blanc from organically grown fruit displays subtlety and complexity. The nose is a soft synthesis of peach, cantaloupe, lemon-lime, watermelon rind and warm stone minerality, while the palate is all about texture. It's tight, structured and chalky, with prickly acidity and a long citrus and mineral finish. Drink now with an array of seafood and salad dishes.
Name: Loveblock 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Vines in the village of Vinon have produce this balanced, crisp wine, one of the single-vineyard releases from this producer. With its mineral edge, spice and intense acidity, it is tight and racy. It's a rich wine, but with a zesty character. Drink now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Les Côtes aux Valets  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a flinty, medium to full-bodied wine, bursting with notes of white grapefruit, lime, fresh green beans, matchstick and toasted nut aromas. The palate is focused and tightly wound, with more flinty, nutty, limey and grassy goodness. Drink now–2023.
Name: Yealands 2017 S1 Single Block Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Produced from old vines on the Bourgeois estate, this is a concentrated, rich wine. With its strong herbal character, it is intense, mineral, zesty and packed with gooseberry and lemon fruits. This flinty, textured wine is still developing. Drink from 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

Description: This is an estate-grown wine that's refreshing and memorable, with screaming yet well-integrated acidity that provides a high-pitched vibrancy along the palate of lemon zest, grapefruit and melon flavors.
Name: Kunde 2016 Magnolia Lane Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Lightly herbal on the nose, with ripe green-fruit tones, this wine shows concentration and richness. The palate is packed with more crisp, clean tones, hinting at even riper notions of apricot and tropical fruit.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: This straw colored Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of white flowers, green apples and freshly sliced pineapple. On the palate there are flavors of apple pie, honeydew melon and fresh lychee. It is well balanced and has a crisp and clean finish.
Name: Bulgariana 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Description: Fleshy and lightly ripe, this wine embraces fresh flavors of nectarine, quince and melon, with slight teases of lemongrass and honeysuckle. Bright, persistent acidity supports just the right amount of body and breadth.
Name: Cannonball 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel and then given time in neutral French oak to age, this is a fleshy, oaky white with some heft to it, but never a sense of weightiness. The midpalate is lengthy and well integrated, offering a wealth of pear, melon and fig flavor.
Name: Côte West 2016 Gianquinto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Fermented in a concrete egg, this wine retains and offers plenty of texture. It is a fleshy medium-weight white with the body to stand up to food and a graininess that presents as wet stone minerality. The little bit of oak used in aging gives it a touch of spice.
Name: Reynoso 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: This wine is flinty and slightly smoky, with notes of white peach, celery salt and wet stone minerality. The palate is slippery in texture, boasting focused acidity and a long flinty, salty finish. Portions of this wine are fermented in oak, which serves to enhance texture and complexity.
Name: Catalina Sounds 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A wallflower when compared to other, more aggressively aromatic Kiwi Sauvignon Blancs, this wine offers hints of citrus, stone fruit, flowers and grass on the nose. The palate is of most interest here: It's linear and chalky yet slippery in feel, with a fair lick of acidity that's just barely balanced by fruit and florals.
Name: Greywacke 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a wine of considerable weight and concentration, voluptuous on the palate, with undeniable ripeness and meaty heft. Exotic in fennel, licorice and oak spice, it impresses with aspects of coconut and mango.
Name: John Anthony 2016 Church Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Carneros)

Description: Grassy, fleshy and piercing in freshness, this wine is made from fruit grown in both Chalk Hill and Dry Creek Valley. Persistent acidity supports fresh flavors of kiwi, grapefruit and peach, while a medium-bodied palate provides balanced weight.
Name: Roth 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: This is a versatile wine with a lot going on. The nose is brooding in notes of toasted nuts, warm stones and a slightly smoky, mineral quality. There's also a delicacy that comes into play after airing: blossoms, stone fruit and a whiff of herbaceousness to remind you this is Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc after all. It's slippery in feel and flinty on the palate with a good lick of acidity.
Name: Ten Sisters 2016 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Stainless-steel aging retains a welcome crispness in this wine, which evolves in the glass into a medium-bodied, fleshy expression of peach, melon and butter. It's well integrated and approachable.
Name: Napa Cellars 2016 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a pungent and tangy Sauvignon Blanc with aromas of heavy lawn cuttings and a slightly nutty quality in the background. The grassy element extends to the palate, where lime skins, grapefruit pith and hints of tropical fruit round out the sizzling acid-driven texture.
Name: Dragonette 2015 Grassini Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: From a small, prestigious, 3.7-acre vineyard, this wine is still young, with a yeasty edge that will blow away as it matures. It has great fruit though, with apples, rich lime, lemon and a tight, tangy texture. The wine needs some time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Clos du Roy  (Sancerre)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine is fruity, crisp and with a rounded, ripe character. Its acidity and mineral texture are surrounded by rich apple, citrus and quince flavors. With its great fruitiness, the wine is well balanced and ready to drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Description: Sourced from a single 16-acre vineyard, this wine is closed, still firm and young. Grassy and herbal, this classic cool-climate Sauvignon Blanc is rich and needs to develop further. This wine with great potential will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Terres Blanches  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is a medium-bodied wine that's calling out for a ginger-based stir fry. Tropical and and stone fruit tones combine with grapefruit, ginger and just a hint of green bell pepper for a classic Marlborough nose. The palate carries some weight and creaminess that is nicely balanced by lifted acidity and pretty fruit and spice.
Name: Mohua 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a rich wine, full of ripe green plums with a hint of honey. Its vineyard name is a reminder that the Romans came this way. With its rich texture, tangy lemon aftertaste and and touch of chalky minerality, the wine will age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Loire Proprietés 2016 La Vigne de Rome  (Sancerre)

Description: The acidity is rather searing on this youthful wine, but the slippery texture and fruit weight come to its rescue. There's nevertheless a lot to like about this wine, from its ripe, almost honeyed tropical fruit, peach and green apple notes to its characteristic snow pea aromas and juicy pineapple finish.
Name: Craggy Range 2017 Te Muna Road Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: As with so many fine wines from Pouilly Fumé, this is rich, densely textured and full of white and green fruit. Herbal and grassy, it is still young although likely to be ready to drink soon. So drink this spicy wine from late 2018.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 La Demoiselle de Bourgeois  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A heady nose of lychee, rose water, honey and pineapple is intensely appealing, if not a little forced. The medium-bodied palate is creamy in texture, with cheek-biting acidity. It's on the clunky and chunky side but there's no denying its mass appeal.
Name: Kim Crawford 2017 Spitfire Small Parcels Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Containing all the brininess you would expect from a coastal vineyard in New Zealand, there are also plenty more predictable aromas here too: tropical fruits, florals, grass and green beans. The palate is bone dry, with tongue-tingling acidity and just enough fruit to support it.
Name: Yealands 2017 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: This wine is a veritable fruit salad of aromas and flavors: pineapple, stone fruit and red apple skin tones are backed by ginger, blossoms and green bell pepper. The crisp, mouthwatering acidity is well balanced by plenty of fruit. This is one to crack open on a sweaty summer's day.
Name: The Better Half 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine shows soft lime and stone fruit characters that mingle with snow pea, jalapeño and a little wet stone minerality. On the palate it's focused and texturally interesting, with balanced acidity, lime zest and a salty edge.
Name: Frenzy 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Quincy is to the west of Sancerre on the Cher river. This bottling shows the ripe, soft side of the village's wines, herbal, warm, with white fruits and citrus and developing quickly. The wine is light, poised and ready to drink.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Haute Victoire  (Quincy)

Description: With the weight and ageability that comes with Pouilly Fumé, just across the Loire from Sancerre, this is a full, rich wine. It doesn't lose sight of the steely, herbal character of the Sauvignon Blanc while also giving good depth of flavors. Drink from early 2019.
Name: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire 2016 Le Pré Vaujour  (Pouilly-Fumé)
Winery: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire

Description: From an estate that has been in the same family since the 1790s, this wine is fruity, with crisp acidity. A strong herbal character gives a tang and a mineral edge. Drink this bright wine now.
Name: Paris-Simoneau 2016 La Prée Vinette Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Young and racy, this crisp wine is full of white fruits, acidity and herbal flavors, with a bright, light mineral texture. This is textbook Sancerre, lively, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016  Sancerre

Description: Brilliant gold in the glass, this wine has aromas of lemon grass, lychee and gooseberry. On the mouth there are flavors of green apple, lemon pith and white peach.
Name: Purcari 2016 1827 Sauvignon Blanc (Moldova)

Description: Slightly honeyed aromas of peach, melon, grapefruit rind, citrus and ginger lead into a palate that's equally perfumed and tightly wound. There's a wealth of acidity and a slight austerity that's asking for a bit more fruit weight.
Name: Barker's Marque 2016 The Loop Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a quiet wine that shows well-woven notes of flint, toast, salt and blossom. The palate is a little watery, with punchy acidity and a subtle minerality but not much in the way of fruit.
Name: Discovery Point 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine is a blend from all the major separate areas of Pouilly Fumé. It has ripe fruit and a structure that is typical of the appellation. Lemon fruit and a tangy, mineral texture ensure a bright, crisp wine that also has some weight. Drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: A nose based mostly on pine resin and pine needle aromas is odd, but clean and focused. This wine has a medium body but maintains clarity across the palate. Spunky gooseberry and lime flavors finish with juicy acidity and modest citrus notes.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: This wine starts reductive and on the stinky side, but with some time in glass, it blows off revealing notes of green bean, ginger and tropical fruit. The acidity is mouthpuckering but would feel softer when enjoyed with food.
Name: Hunter's 2016 Jane Hunter Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a brash but likable wine, with heady aromas of pineapple, guava and mango rind, along with grass, jalapeño and snow pea tones. The palate boasts zippy acidity, with tropical fruit and snow pea flavors that round out the feel.
Name: Brancott 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a strongly herbal wine, crisp with lemon flavors and grassy aromas. It is tight, mineral with a flinty character that will soften shortly. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire 2016 Le Pré Vaujour  (Sancerre)
Winery: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire

Description: Highly perfumed on the nose, there are pretty aromas of lychee, mango and florals in this wine. There's a feeling of slight sweetness on the palate, with plenty of fruitiness and balanced acidity.
Name: Lagoon Hill 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is the epitome of crisp, herbal Loire Sauvignon Blanc. Along with its lively acidity, green and citrus fruits and tangy, zesty texture, it is light and fruity, ready to drink now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Attitude Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This wine is all about the green vegetal notes, with pungent aromas of canned green beans, green bell peppers and peas, backed by citrus and melon. The acidity runs high but remains in check with some textural weight and yet more green vegetables on the finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2016 Single Vineyard Taylors Pass Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine brings passion fruit, lime and gooseberry tones to the fore, with tongue-tingling acidity that keeps the palate fresh. A classic style that put New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc on the map.
Name: Esk Valley 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a straightforward and quite typical style of Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc, with tropical fruits—pineapple and guava—along with peach, lime and green bell pepper. The palate is crisp, fruity and well suited to summer sipping.
Name: Oyster Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is ultraripe and aromatic in style, with tones of perfume and air freshener. Pungent flavors of flowers, limes, stone fruits and bell peppers are followed by searing acidity and a biting finish.
Name: Cottesbrook 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The raw, crisp nose is peppery, while this wine feels lean, with grapefruit-like acidity. Flavors of white grapefruit and fennel are quick through the finish. The wine features a colorful label by Brazilian pop artist Romero Britto.
Name: Bodega Norton 2017 Britto Barrel Select Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: This is a pungent, herbaceous wine in notes of tomato leaf, cabbage and limey citrus. The searing acidity on the palate is overwhelming. Without the fruit weight to back it up, it can be a challenge to drink unless you're a die hard acid hound.
Name: Amisfield 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Otago)

Description: The nose starts out promising, if austere, with notes of grapefruit, waxy lemon, melon rind, grass and celery stalk, all wrapped in a flinty, matchstick blanket. The palate brings searing acidity, with some odd residual sugar and just barely enough citrus and tropical fruit weight to keep it afloat.
Name: Little Beauty 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a simple yet slippery-textured wine, with an attractive, perfumed nose of lime blossom, tropical and stone fruit. The fruit weight on the palate hints at a feeling of sweetness, but there's just enough acidity to keep things in balance.
Name: Nick Goldschmidt 2017 Boulder Bank Fitzroy Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Intensely fruity, this wine is crisp, herbal Sauvignon Blanc, with a light tropical edge that comes from the ripe vintage. It is ready to drink for its fruitiness but will be better after a few more months aging, so wait until the end of 2018.
Name: Château Tour de Goupin 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged on lees in stainless steel, this wine presents as reduced and somewhat closed, with a green bean and jalapeño component that distracts.
Name: Hanna 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of herb and citrus while the flavors seem dilute. It doesn't all come together by the finish.
Name: Apex 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Tropical fruit, mild citrus and mineral aromas are weak. It seems more like fruit juice than wine, without much structure. Citrus, melon and mango flavors show minimal snap through the finish.
Name: Wapisa 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Río Negro Valley)

Description: Punchy aromas are lean, low on fruit, and lead to a watery but fresh palate. This wine tastes fairly green and bitter, while peppery pyrazine-based flavors dominate the finish.
Name: Rutini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Slightly unclean aromas of lemon peel, wet dirt and damp sand show on the nose of this bottling. Dried lemon rinds and brackish-water flavors show on the sip.
Name: Reyes 2013 Renaissance Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine is a blend of top sites: Boushey (55%) and Red Willow, with just a kiss (5%) of new French oak. The aromas are intriguing, with notes of white grapefruit, nectarine, lemon pith, straw, mineral and herb. Flavors are sleek and puckering, with a steely spine of acidity that keeps the interest high. It only gets better with time open and should sing at the dinner table.
Name: Avennia 2016 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though not labeled as such, all of this fruit comes from Rosebud Vineyard on the Wahluke Slope. Blended with 16% Sémillon, which shows itself, the aromas are light, with notes of citrus, fig, pineapple, lees and herb. The flavors are broad and textured with an extended finish. It's as much about feel as flavor.
Name: Barons 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Light and crisp on the nose, this bottling shows passion fruit, lemon, chilled Anjou pear slices and a hint of grassy scents, proving broadly appealing. There is great zip to the sip and a bit of viscosity as well, with zesty flavors of green apple rinds and chopped lemongrass.
Name: Morgan 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a ripe, rather chunky style, this has a fruit-forward mix of lemon, grapefruit and kiwi. It was half stainless and half barrel fermented, and finishes with a firm grip.
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This clean, grassy wine is a pure and pleasing example of varietal character, from a cool-climate region on the northern Oregon border. Lemon and lime rind and grapefruit flesh combine with plenty of lip-tingling acidity. It's not a big wine, but well done, lively and refreshing.
Name: Phelps Creek 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This Sauvignon Blanc from Ribera del Duero is not a normal Spanish white wine. For starters, it smells overly woody but under control. A thick, resiny palate is creamy and low on acidity. Flavors of woodspice, vanilla and resin are not the least bit fruity, and it's warm on the finish, with a creamy texture. Overall, this is more about the barrel than fruit.
Name: Abadia Retuerta 2016 Le Domaine Blanco de Guarda Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Grassy and herbaceous, as befits this variety, you'll want to drink this zesty, lively wine while it's at its freshest. Peppery and pungent, it's a good stand-in for an inexpensive Loire Valley Sauv Blanc.
Name: Ledger David 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very reductive take on the grape, this bottling shows lawn cuttings, guava skin, tangy green orange pith on the nose, but also hints of an oily underlying structure. Those aromas come together on the palate, with dried grass and citrus skins proving rather pungent.
Name: Montemar Wines 2014 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This wine features a bouquet of white peach and pink grapefruit. It offers a nice balance of fruit and floral flavors, with grapefruit, lemon and jasmine.
Name: Galil Mountain 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Restrained and earthy, this Sauvignon displays citrus peel and crushed stone aromas. The palate offers a bit more intensity and complexity, with grapefruit zest creating a focused line of acidity from start to finish.
Name: Rivera 2016 Terre Al Monte Sauvignon (Castel del Monte)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of melon, pear and herb lead to similarly faint fruit flavors. It's cleanly made but everything seems very dialed back.
Name: Wind Rose 2016 The Keeper Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: With aromas of petrol and spearmint, this wine has flavors of lemon-lime and eucalyptus that do not feel completely integrated. Citrus and minty flavors fight for dominance on the palate, with cooling herb flavors overpowering the finish.
Name: Dalton 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This Sauvignon Blanc has little to no varietal character. The nose is quiet, with just a hint of peach. A round palate shows almost no acidity, while this tastes peachy and yeasty prior to a pulpy finish.
Name: Felix Solis 2016 Flirty Bird Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Oily aromas are loaded with pyrazines and green notes. This is spritzy, dilute and watery in feel. Thin passion fruit and green-onion flavors lack vitality on the finish.
Name: Palma Real 2016 Monte Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: An unusual flavor combination of hazelnut and passion fruit marks the nose of this wine. On the palate, these two poles—one of tart freshness, the other of textured richness—intertwine even more. This simply needs time to come into its full glory: an oak-aged Sauvignon Blanc of immense freshness, concentration and lees-driven richness. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Wohlmuth 2015 Ried Edelschuh Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Soft vanilla tones overlay fresh, bright passion fruit and rich vanilla notes in this wine, but something more intense lies beneath. The palate reveals great concentration, freshness and intensity, with passion fruit, cream and lemon flavors. Despite the creamy descriptors this is resolutely svelte—a real marvel of what mature vines can do. The finish is dry, intense and very long. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Neumeister 2013 Stradener Alte Reben Sauvignon Blanc (Vulkanland Steiermark)

Description: A bright spike of lemon precedes the mossy, green freshness and elderflower notes on the nose of this wine. The palate remains slender but has a creamy, bright edge and a more substantial, textured core. Its central well of passion fruit flavor has yet to unfold. Wait for this; it will be lovely. Drink 2020–2028.
Name: Wohlmuth 2015 Ried Hochsteinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: A subtle hint of passion fruit, fresh lime and lemon, a green, mossy backdrop and a whiff of elderflower: this Sauvignon Blanc's aromas are drawn tenderly. The palate is exquisitely svelte, concentrated, full-flavored and fresh. The lasting, pure finish reveals a superbly tart and appetizing passion fruit-laden intensity.
Name: Wohlmuth 2016 Ried Steinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This wine's tart, spiky glints of passion fruit tease the nose amidst all its lemony freshness. With a little air, the passion fruit note grows smoother and fuller. The palate glows in this fruitiness and complements it with creamy richness. It's lovely and seductive now but sure to get even better. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Neumeister 2015 Ried Moarfeitll Sauvignon Blanc (Vulkanland Steiermark)

Description: This stunning white is sourced from a handful of sources, including the producer's estate, but also Hyde Vineyard in Carneros, Stagecoach on Atlas Peak, and several sites on Sonoma Mountain. It offers a demure nose of honeysuckle and peach before allowing room for lemon, quince and dried herb to come forth on the creamy palate, finishing bright and fresh in acidity.
Name: Spottswoode 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa-Sonoma)

Description: From the Stewart Vineyard in Carneros, planted with the Musqué clone, this white is spicy and sublimely textured, with a persistence of mineral mystique and balanced ripeness. Its well-crafted fruitiness is a mix of white peach and lime.
Name: Peter Franus 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Quince and grapefruit flavors rise to the top of the palate in this well-made estate wine, aged in a mix of French oak, Acacia and stainless steel. While smooth and round in feel, its acidity has impact, providing stony refreshment around a lingering white peach flavor.
Name: S.R. Tonella 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: This wine's grassy notes of fresh, green foliage grow richer with air, but thast green, vivid freshness remains on the palate. Lime and lemon freshness pervades the slender palate, giving it verve. The finish is dry and has more grassy intensity.
Name: Eder 2016 Ried Silberbichl Smaragd Sauvignon Blanc (Wachau)

Description: More subtle in style compared to Giesen's other single-vineyard offering, Matthews Lane, this wine offers stone fruit, lemon tea, snow pea and wild mint aromas. The opulent palate boasts tongue-tingling acidity and a citrus zing amidst a round texture.
Designation: Single Vineyard Selection Dillons Point The Fuder
Name: Giesen 2014 Single Vineyard Selection Dillons Point The Fuder Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Over one million cuttings from the Matthews Lane Vineyard have been supplied to nurseries—and therefore wineries—around Marlborough, so in theory, there's a small piece of it in many of the wines from the region. It's special, then, to taste Giesen's single-vineyard version, aged in 1000 liter German fuders. Trademark regional characters of jalepeño, green beans and grass marry with lemon balm, pressed yellow flowers and butter, all ensconced in an oily texture, slippery acidity and a grassy finish.
Designation: Single Vineyard Selection Matthews Lane The Fuder
Name: Giesen 2014 Single Vineyard Selection Matthews Lane The Fuder Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Earthy notes of mushroom, white pepper, dried leaves and buttered cannellini beans lead over aromas of lemon and stone fruit. The palate boasts mouth-watering acidity yet not without weight and texture, thanks to time maturing on lees.
Name: Hillersden 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromatic and attractive, this wine spends a little time on its skins, causing it to burst with aromas of flowers, peaches, lime leaf and a bit of honey. The skins also contribute to the satiny texture, balanced by crisp acidity and finishing with a limey, saline tang.
Name: Manu 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sublime in texture, all smooth and velvety contours, this fruit-forward wine has a medium-bodied frame rich and ripe in white peach and vanilla. The peach turns to guava and mango as it develops additional fleshy creaminess in the glass.
Name: Merry Edwards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Lifted aromas of lemon and grapefruit combine with toasted nuts, green flower stems and a salty, sea spray quality.
