The acidity in this wine at the moment is searing and texturally it's a little lean and mean, but this fumé-style Sauvignon should be an interesting one to watch develop in bottle over the next few years.
Name: Spy Valley 2015 Envoy Johnson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine boasts a fruity nose of tropical and citrus notes along with white flowers and ginger spice. The acid is balanced by some fruit weight and a chalky texture, while a copper penny tang keeps things interesting.
Name: Kelly's Crossing 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Grass, melon and peach highlight a texture that's creamy and fleshy, with a well-honed balance of lingering acidity. Medium bodied, the wine offers additional flavors of dried herb and nutmeg.
Name: Captûre 2016 Les Pionniers Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: Lifted aromas of stone and passion fruit, lime and flowers meld with with an almond butter note on the nose. It's the palate that turns things up a notch with its chalky texture, mouth-watering acidity and more citrus and floral flavors.
Name: Te Mata 2015 Cape Crest Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Oaky, oily and robust, this white is moderate in acidity, offering a focused line of stone fruit that's fleshy and ripe.
Name: Hoopes 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Coombsville)

Description: This wine starts out seemingly semisweet, with a touch of honey, florals and ripe lemon. The palate, however, is dry, with medium weight, zippy acidity, a creamy, slippery texture and a citrusy finish. Sip with roast chicken.
Name: The Seeker 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine is fruity in lime and passionfruit tones, with green bell pepper and a hint of salty minerality. The palate carries a chalky texture and well-balanced acidity, finishing with a zip of lime zest.
Name: Sileni 2016 Straits Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a full and rich Sauvy, with loads of cedar shavings and dried straw that frame the yellow apple and lemon fruit. The palate is broad and weighty, with lingering notes of toasty, grilled apple and spiced orange rind that linger on the close.
Name: Lismore 2015 Barrel Fermented Sauvignon Blanc (Cape South Coast)

Description: Dried herb and a twist of lemongrass provide an exotic edge to this light white, which is moderate in acidity and fruity in melon and kiwi. The freshness persists with ease on the finish.
Name: Oberon 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Light green-fruit aromas are tight and show a hint of dusty yeast. This has a lean, citric mouthfeel with acidic tang. Oily citrus flavors come with a sprinkle of salt, while this shows both body and length on the finish.
Name: Undurraga 2017 Sibaris Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: The nose is limey and floral, with stone fruit and pea shoots at the core. It's the palate that keeps you coming back for more, with acidity that is in check rather than enamel-stripping, held up by a juicy, limey core.
Name: Villa Maria 2017 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From one of New Zealand's historic producers, this is a solid, well-made wine, with notes of pressed yellow flowers, peas, stone fruit and waxy lemon. It's prickly on the tongue from zippy acidity, with a bit of weight and a long waxy lemon finish.
Name: Seifried 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: This value-driven wine is successful in its smooth texture and floral aromas, with minimal if any oak perceptible on the palate. Peach, apricot and melon mix for a fruity profile dipped in lingering acidity.
Name: Angeline 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of melon, peach and citrus grace the nose, along with vanilla, baking spices and cut grass. There's some weight to the palate amidst a good deal of acidity, which is carried by stoney minerality and a chalky texture.
Name: Chasing Venus 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A nose of ripe, almost confected tropical fruits, apples and waxy lemon lead into a fleshy, chalky-textured palate full of apple skins and citrus. This is a food friendly wine to be enjoyed with a wide variety of dishes.
Name: Lexicon 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A hot 2017 with forest fires in many parts of Chile forced early picking, and seemingly this shear high-acid SB with just 12.3% alcohol was part of that. Spunky sharp flavors of briny citrus fruits include pyrazine-based notes of green herbs, while this ends with a high-acid finish.
Name: Rafael Tirado Wines 2017 Laberinto Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: On the nose, this straddles the fence between citrusy and vegetal. A lean tangy palate plays up crisp minerality over chunkiness, while flavors of green herbs and cactus dominate through the finish.
Name: Aresti 2017 Trisquel Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This wine is zippy and aromatic in tones of tropical fruit, grapefruit and a hint of bell pepper. The palate shows some weight from the rich fruit flavors, balanced by tingly acidity. It's capped off with a clean, mineral finish.
Name: Framingham 2016 Ribbonwood Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Dancing Flame is a value-priced line from Luis Felipe Edwards, and this Leyda Sauvignon Blanc delivers punchy aromas that mix citrus notes with green ones. A fresh palate with lime and green-herb flavors loses concentration on the finish.
Name: Dancing Flame 2017 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A regular Casablanca SB nose with citrus and green aromas introduces a fair and healthy palate. A mix of generic citrus, green herb and bitter flavors tastes salad-like on the finish.
Name: Loma Larga 2017 Lomas del Valle Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Spunky aromas of citrus and green notes are juicy and classic for Chilean SB. This is fresh at first, but turns flat fairly quickly. Flavors of tangerine and orange peel are grassy, with short-lasting edge and zest on the finish.
Name: Santa Rita 2017 Secret Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Prickly single-plane aromas of grass and citrus fruits set up a lean tight palate that's pushing lemon-lime and grassy herbal flavors. A lasting finish with acidity and spunk earns this some extra points. Drink now.
Name: Prisma 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Snappy citrus aromas show mild pyrazine-based scents on a typical Casablanca nose. A standard palate is a touch watery, while this tastes of mild citrus fruits and green melon. A briny tasting finish is low on volume and length.
Name: Santa Rita 2017 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Briny citrus, asparagus and mango aromas cover all ends of the Chilean SB spectrum. A palate with zesty acidity deals green-citrus flavors that carry over to the finish, which is spunky. As to whether this justifies the high price, that's up to you.
Name: Tierra Calma 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: The Irish celebrity presenter's second vintage in his foray into winemaking offers a Sauvignon Blanc that is fleshy and gingery, with notes of watermelon, peach, and custard. The palate is fresh and focused, leading to a gingery finish.
Name: Invivo 2017 Graham Norton's Own Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Peach and passionfruit notes mingle with green bean and white pepper on the nose. The palate is lean with a good lick of acidity and a long, citrusy finish. Enjoy this thirst-quenching drop with a summer salad.
Name: Wairau River 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Bell pepper and corn tortilla aromas announce a cool-climate wine. Those leanings are confirmed on a tangy palate with the consistency of lime juice. Green-citrus flavors are full of pyrazines, while this feels round on a finish cut by citric acidity.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2016 Marea Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: On the lean and mean side, this wine shows green characters of broccoli, green beans and peas are followed by citrus, passionfruit, ginger and wet stone notes. The palate is searing in acidity but the fruit is well integrated, and the wet stone and white pepper finish is appealing.
Name: Grove Mill 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Wairau Valley)

Description: This wine boasts an attractive combo of honeysuckle, green apple skins and white flowers notes while the palate offers balanced acidity with a citrusy, floral finish.
Name: Tablelands 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Lime zest, peach and floral notes precede a clean, zippy, slippery-textured palate. There's a nice weight to this wine, along with a long, peachy finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2017 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Lake County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented, with a small percentage of grapes from Lake County, this light-bodied white is bristling in acidity, highlighted in quince, lemon, melon and a shock of grass.
Name: Captûre 2016 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County-Lake County)

Description: Off the bat, this cool-coast SB leans towards green via flat aromas of bell pepper and jalapeño. A chunky palate shows only moderate lift, while this tastes green and mildly bitter, like Casa Marin's Sauvignon Blancs often do. From a cloudy and rainy year with widespread ripeness issues, this is decent but incomplete.
Name: Casa Marin 2016 Cipreses Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Typical of Casa Marin, this shows aromas that are more vegetal than fruity. On the palate, this offers good weight and balance, although the flavors run heavy on pyrazines, and thus taste distinctly green and bitter on a chunky finish.
Name: Casa Marin 2017 Cipreses Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: This is a very fruity wine in its ripe peach and apple flesh tones. The grainy texture isn't quite in balance with the searing acidity, but the appealing, ripe apple characters will please many drinkers.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2016 Ti Point Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A little shy at first, lime leaf, lemon and peach aromas creep their way out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers a slippery texture and a lemony finish.
Name: Nobilo 2016 Regional Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Lemon, guava, ginger and baking spices lead into a zippy, citrusy and refreshing palate. This is an enjoyable, straightforward wine, perfect for easy sipping.
Name: Sea Pearl 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Citrus and grassy aromas are just lively enough. The same can be said for the palate on this basic SB: it's a touch flabby and not blazing with acidity. Melon, citrus and generic green flavors finish quietly and without edginess. Drink immediately.
Name: Santa Ema 2017 Select Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Punchy citrus aromas are within normal parameters for Leyda SB. A tight citric palate is loaded with pyrazines, causing citrus and lemon-lime flavors to come across as tangy and grassy. A finish with a texture of wet rocks is juicy but green in flavor.
Name: Garces Silva 2017 Boya Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Grassy aromas are mildly citric and show cool, underripe notes of canned peas and beans. A citric bolt adds life to an otherwise fleshy palate, while this tastes of green grape skins, lime and asparagus prior to a slightly bitter finish.
Name: Amayna 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Standard aromas of celery, lime, gooseberry and minerals set up a palate that's not flat but is definitely low on snap and acidity. Lightly vegetal citrus flavors finish soft. Drink immediately.
Name: Montes 2017 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cut grass, wet cement and lemon wedge show on the slightly reductive nose of this bottling. The palate is sour and almost bitter with more cut grass and strong grapefruit-peel flavors.
Name: Owl Ridge 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: Vegetables are in the fore of this wine, leading with notes of buttered green beans and mushrooms—grapefruit and lemon tones bring up the rear. The palate is rich and heavy but with searing acidity.
Name: Prophecy 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A tropical fruit bowl of pineapple, mango and papaya carries intensity on the nose, with a little grass and white pepper in the background. The palate is less exuberant but it makes for an enjoyable sipper nonetheless.
Name: Satellite 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This SB from the southerly outpost of Malleco smells briny and green, which given its cool origins is not a shock. A chunky palate holds vegetal flavors of peas, green onion, fennel and bell pepper, while a lean finish suggests nettle and milkweed.
Name: William Fèvre 2016 La Misión Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Malleco)

Description: Classic Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc aromas of passionfruit, grapefruit and blossoms set the stage for a crisp, easy-going palate.
Name: Overstone 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Subtle stone fruit and delicate floral tones lead into a heavier-than-expected palate. There's a touch of residual sugar here amidst the fleshy stone fruit characters, with a brisk, short finish.
Name: Cupcake 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Subtle notes of tomato leaf, passionfruit and tropical fruit undertones are followed by a boney palate of tongue tingling acidity. Drink now.
Name: Lobster Reef 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Neutral aromas lack pungency and instead are yeasty and suggestive of green pepper and mild citrus fruits. A round palate lacks the pop and zest that Chilean SB often shows, while this tastes of grassy melon and white pepper prior to a flat finish.
Name: Santa Rita 2017 120 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Largely neutral white-fruit aromas include a hint of citrus. On the palate, this SB feels a bit flat and fleshy, with mild acidity. Standard apple and orange flavors are salty across a basic finish.
Name: Lapostolle 2016 Grand Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Melony vanilla aromas are flat, while this mature SB feels plump and fleshy, but distant. Wheaty bland flavors of white melon lack pop and vitality, while this tastes and feels bready on a tired finish.
Name: Lapostolle 2015 Cuvée Alexandre Viñedo Las Kuras Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: A definitive green nose smells just short of vegetal, while a round, plump palate with good acidity is a high point for this Elqui SB. A vegetal flavor of canned beans doesn't shed the wine's core green character.
Name: Mayu 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: Oily, slightly vegetal aromas are lacking in pop and purity. On the palate, this is similar to the nose: flat with no cut or angles. A mix of grass and melon flavors finishes mildly bitter.
Name: Dancing Flame 2017 Chaiten Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A neutral, nearly scentless nose sets up a palate with modest acidity but nothing more. Short citrus flavors see oxidized notes poke through on the finish, indicating that this basic wine from a wet vintage is passing its prime.
Name: Chilensis 2016 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Lifted aromas of ginger, florals and ripe citrus are somewhat enticing, but the palate is acidic to the point of sourness, with an odd combo of spritz and fruit weight.
Name: Giant Sky NV Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A yeasty but light nose with nothing more than a whiff of lime sets up a racy citric palate that's shearing and angular. Tart apple, underripe nectarine and lemon-lime flavors finish long but sharp almost to the point of being sour.
Name: Casa Donoso 2017 Gran Reserva Bicentenario Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Flat aromas of yeast, vanilla and animal cracker cookies lead to a palate that's more amorphous than tight. Bitter flavors of green onion and grassy citrus fruits fail to come around on the finish.
Designation: Araucano Reserva Made With Organic Grapes
Name: François Lurton 2017 Araucano Reserva Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: Overtly vegetal, this wine leads with lettuce and green bean characters, with a note of ripe lemon and a sulphuric, struck-match quality. The slippery-textured palate is a little out of whack and it carries a bitter, green vegetal finish.
Name: Pebble Row 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Wairau Valley)

Description: An odd combo of wet grass, charred nuts, wax and grapefruit on the nose lead into a palate that is on the sour side, with mouth-puckering acidity.
Name: Stony Bank 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This richer, Bordelaise-like take on Sauvignon Blanc is a compelling change of pace for a region that leans more toward fresh and racy. Aromas of ripe nectarine, lemon oil, yellow flowers and marzipan are set against a steely core on the nose. The palate offers oak smoke, creamy pear flesh and distinctive butterscotch on the finish.
Name: Grassini 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is pure Sauvignon Blanc from one of the few wineries in Oregon that produces it. It's fragrant and compelling, with grassy gooseberry aromas, and rounds out nicely in the mouth. The lip-smacking lushness of its ripe citrus fruit comes with terrific concentration and texture.
Name: Andrew Rich 2016 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This block-designated bottling is tightly wound and a bit restrained at first on the nose, but then aromas of flint, peach, ash and white lily begin to elegantly arise. The palate is tart, tense and taut with flavors of lime skin, orange rind and an ashy Brie cheese rind element that makes it very distinctive.
Name: Grassini 2016 Block 14 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and slightly restrained on the fresh and vibrant nose, this single vineyard expression shows lime syrup, citrus zest, wet stone and chalk aromas. There is great lime skin tension to the sip, where bright, lemony flavors meet with hints of guava and crushed slate.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Beeswax, paraffin, petrol and orange pith show on the light but resilient nose of this dessert wine. There's an intriguing ashy and Brie cheese rind quality to the smoky sip, where the honey and peach syrup sweetness is obvious but plays more to the background. This is quite dynamic.
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2013 Voluptuous Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This bright and spicy wine tones down the grape's propensity toward grassiness, showing instead peppery white melon fruit and a phenolic bite. Production has increased in recent years, making this rare Oregon example of this classic Loire Valley grape more widely available.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine strikes a great balance between freshness and concentration. It smells clean and minerally, tastes crisp at first like lemon and jicama but also concentrated and layered in notes of rich pear and fig.
Name: Hess 2016 Shirtail Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp and fresh on the nose, this bottling offers lime skin, lemon juice, crushed flint and graphite aromas. It's tightly wound and zippy on the palate, but with ample flavors of Asian pear flesh, grippy chalk and a Key lime twist.
Name: Gainey 2016 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this sleek bottling by Doug Margerum manages to combines both the grape's telltale grassy tones and tightly reductive qualities with fresh passion fruit and kiwi flavors. There is a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, where lime skin and white rock flavors shine.
Name: Margerum 2016 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Crisp and steely, this wine tastes absolutely fresh from the light herb and green-apple aroma to the lemon-lime flavors, lively acidity and clean snappy finish. It's light to medium in body, has good balance and an especially appetizing character.
Name: Peltier 2016 Black Diamond Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Sugar-cured grapefruit rinds, sour Granny Smith apple slices and wet concrete show on the nose of this bottling from one of the larger growers in Monterey. Green apple skins mix with guava, passion fruit and green grass flavors on the palate, which is lifted by white pepper.
Name: Scheid 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine was fermented in concrete and neutral barrels and aged on lees for 20 months. Its light herb and citrus aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate that's tart, bracing and white grapefruit-like. With acidity like this, it absolutely needs food. Oysters would make an excellent pairing.
Name: Columbia Crest 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This wine is a pretty, delicate time capsule of the cool climes of the Frankland River subregion of Western Australia's Great Southern. White blossoms, peach, pineapple, green apple and lime popsicle abound. The palate is feather light and not lacking in this region's trademark levels of acidity.
Name: Point Ormond 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Frankland River)

Description: Crisp peach and tangerine tones are thirst quenching in this easygoing Sauvignon Blanc. While not a deeply complex or concentrated wine, it's nuanced by hints of grass and spice. The finish is brisk but clean. Drink now.
Name: Villa Wolf 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Pfalz)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of lemon rind, pink grapefruit skins and apple flesh are somewhat reserved on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows apple rinds, seared nectarine, guava skins, lemongrass and a strong cut-grass flavor.
Name: Barton 2015 Forever Young Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and lively, this tangy wine offers seaspray, cucumber and gooseberry flavors, set against a backdrop of bright acidity. There may be a hint of residual sugar—just enough to round out the finish.
Name: Reustle 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Preserved lemons, lime pith, cold cement and a hint of honeydew show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very rounded with yellow apples and cut-grass flavors, upheld by a chalky texture.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Lime and lemon aromas are clean and direct on the nose. This well-cut Sauvignon Blanc is crisp and light weight, with salty green-apple and citrus flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: This light-bodied wine made from organic grapes seems earthy at first whiff but settles down to crisp citrus flavors, good cleansing acidity and very fresh herb and melon flavors. It's just the thing to pair with light appetizers and seafood.
Name: Bonterra 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Very fresh and very herbal in flavor, this wine smells like fresh-plucked snap peas, and tastes crisp and citrusy thanks to bright tangy acidity. It is light bodied and feels cleansing on the palate.
Name: Imagery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of fresh passion fruit kick off the nose of this exuberant bottling, although there are telltale touches of cut grass and green grapefruit pith in the background. There's a pleasing and round freshness to the sip, where ripe stone fruit meets with more sour edges of lime skin and grass.
Name: Avensole 2016 Susan Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A light touch of cut grass leads to lemon rinds, citrus spray, Gala apples and a touch of guava on the nose of this widely available wine. It's clean and crisp on the palate, where stone fruit and apple flavors reign, set against a chalky texture.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2016 Cuvee Jeane Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Mild white-fruit aromas carry the nose of this Biodynamic Sauvignon Blanc. Angular, tangy flavors of gooseberry and green plum carry the flavors and finish crisp and clean.
Name: Pablo Claro 2016 Biodynamic Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mellow aromas of pear, rainy sidewalk and nectarine show on the nose of this bottling. There is bountiful acidity on the sip, with cut grass and apple skin flavors.
Name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Varietally familiar aromas of snappy citrus fruits are feline in nature. This is light in body, refreshing and citric. Flavors of lime and tangerine are stony and show a hint of green herbs, while this is lasting on a fresh finish.
Name: Mocén 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very clean aromas of Pink Lady apple, ripe Asian pear, squeezed Meyer lemon and a touch of wet stone prove refreshing on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of peach and Key lime pie ripeness to the sip, yet the wet cement minerality also shows through. It could use a touch more zippy acid.
Name: Gainey 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Extreme lawn clipping and green bell pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling, with slightly rounder hints of guava, passion fruit and struck flint also arising. It's a bit riper on the sip, with yellow pear, Key lime, rainy cement and wet hay flavors.
Name: District 7 Wines 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: An abundance of white flowers and sweet grassiness (along with some ripe pear) shows on the nose of this bottling from a newer property in Temecula. Apples and nectarine flavors reveal themselves at first on the sip, which then grows more sour with cut grass and apple rind elements.
Name: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Wien Chateau Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine reaches the extreme end of the buttery scale, showing toasty, oaky aromas, butter and vanilla flavors, a very creamy, rich texture and very full body. It has little overt fruit expression but plenty of complexity and savory character.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Sandy Bend Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Saint-Bris is the only appellation in Burgundy where Sauvignon Blanc is grown. The style, as in this wine, hints at herbal while going more for riper fruits. Tangy acidity and attractive rich fruits come together in a crisp wine that is ready to drink now.
Name: Bailly-Lapierre 2016  Saint-Bris

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Frankly herbal in flavor, this wine smells reduced at first, like garlic and onions, but mellows to celery, cucumber and lemon on the palate. It's medium to full in body, has a rich texture and lingering veggie finish.
Name: Hess Select 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: White-fruit and citrus aromas are mild but clean on the nose. This has a light-bodied palate and tart flavors of orange and lime. A juicy finish hangs around for a few moments then dissipates.
Name: Inurrieta 2016 Orchidea Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's scents and flavors suggest cracker and dried grain, while its tangy, herbal fruit suggests peashoot and grapefruit. It shows varietal character, but it's almost like drinking it through gauze; it's already fading.
Name: Carlton Cellars 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Vivid celery aromas and flavors ride a moderately crisp texture in this medium-bodied wine before a hint of sweetness completes the picture.
Name: Sean Minor 2016 4 B Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of mowed lawn, ripe peach and wet concrete show on the mellow nose of this bottling. It's fairly simple on the palate, with ripe pear and seared lime flavors.
Name: Falkner 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Description: Herbal aromas announce the 100% Sauvignon Blanc in this wine. It is crisp, although touches of tropical fruit and citrus bring out the Bordeaux origins. Drink this fruity wine now.
Name: Grand Bateau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Wet concrete and Anjou pear rinds show on the nose of this bottling. Ripe apple flavors and cut green grass show on the sip, where the flavors are a bit wild and sporadic.
Name: Oak Mountain 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Description: Aromas of lanolin and citrus peel lead on the nose. The medium-bodied palate holds a bitter flavor of stone-fruit pit that leads to a clean, short finish.
Name: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Camina Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This thick-textured wine has light melon aromas and muted fig flavors. It feels full bodied and emphasizes an oily mouthfeel.
Name: Iron Hub 2015 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: A nose driven by punchy pyrazine-based aromas is sweaty and not encouraging. Other than spunky acidity, the palate on this Sauvignon Blanc is dilute. Briny flavors are raw and green, while the finish is hollow and tangy.
Name: Monterebro 2016 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)

Description: Complex and composed, this vineyard-designate wine is brightly decorated in flavors of grapefruit pith and lemon zest, with zippy acidity. As it develops in the glass, richer elements of peach and apricot flesh out the palate with succulent aplomb.
Name: Aesthete 2016 Dry Stack Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Description: Neutral French oak played a part in this wine's fermentation, giving it weight and substance without distraction. Exotic on the nose, it's fleshy and high toned in guava and lemon zest, with a memorable length of mineral-like stone that gives it texture and complexity.
Name: Vermeil 2016 Frediani Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a spicy, complex, oak-aged and full-bodied wine instead of a simply herbal one, and it shows hints of ginger and nutmeg in the aroma leading to vibrant but subtle lemon and grapefruit flavors. The layers of spice and crisp fruit make a wonderful combination to sip and explore.
Name: Brassfield 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: Gritty and grippy, this is a well-made reserve-level wine, bright in stone fruit and citrus, especially lemon pith. It offers weight and length in balance, with nuanced use of oak.
Name: Concannon 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: This ripe tropical-fruit style of Sauvignon Blanc is delicious. It's crisp with a citrus flavor and balanced by apricot and ripe mango tones that give the wine richness and fine perfumes. This is a food style of wine, ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Cortes de Cima 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

Description: Strongly herbal while also rich, this tangy, zesty wine shows no concessions in its expression of Sauvignon Blanc. Ripe and full of green plum and gooseberry flavors, it's smooth and ready to drink now.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Moulin des Dames Parcelle A296 Sauvignon Blanc (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Stone fruit and fuzz invite one into this soft silky white wine, buzzing in acidity and with an herbal backbone. Fresh and fruity, it develops into a lush experience of substance and style, finishing in a taste of vanilla bean.
Name: Eric Kent 2016 Cuvée Renee Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Green plum, mowed lawn, pungent green apple skins and a touch of candied peach ripeness make for a classic Sauv Blanc nose on this bottling from one of the region's oldest producers. The palate is zippy with persistent and penetrating acidity, showing tight green apple and well as riper pineapple flavors, with a flash of vanilla toward the finish.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: An aroma like fresh mint leaves and sage leads to lively, crisp lemon and lime flavors in this very refreshing wine. It has just the vibrant palate-cleansing qualities needed.
Name: William Hill Estate 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: Zippy and fresh, this wine also offers deeper layers of papaya and guava that provide a confectionery complement to the fruit. With a stony and gravelly texture on the palate, it spent time in both neutral French oak and stainless steel, and finishes up with honeydew melon flavor.
Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Aveta Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: There are aromas and flavors of pine and fresh herbs in this medium-bodied, crisp and tangy wine. Lemon and lime notes kick in on the palate, and the good acidity keeps the finish fresh.
Name: Château Souverain 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Medium yellow in the glass, this wine features a nose of citrus, with a touch of floral notes. It is bright on entry, and then fills the mouth with soft tannins and flavors of grapefruit, guava and pineapple that lead to a bright citrus splash on the finish.
Name: Ouled Thaleb 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Morocco)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mellow aromas of Asian pear and guava meet with wet slate, tangerine and key lime on the subtle but fresh and inviting nose of this bottling. The crisp and clean flavors are subdued and easy to enjoy, with grapefruit and nectarine riding acidity that hits hard at first and then withers away. It's a perfect sunny day wine.
Name: Buttonwood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied, unbaked wine has light butter and fig aromas that lead to vivid citrus flavors and a good crisp balance. The wine is nicely dry, well-balanced and refreshing.
Name: Michael David 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This herbal wine is full of crisp green fruit. It has lively grapefruit and lime flavors as well as tangy acidity. Spicy on the finish, it's ready to drink now.
Name: Château Berthenon 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Punchy aromas of grapefruit and jalapeño form the greeting on this lean but refreshing wine. A straightforward palate offers zesty acidity, while flavors of white pepper, sea salt, grapefruit and lime lead straight through the finish.
Name: Santa Carolina 2017 Reserva Leyda Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: High-pitched in freshness, this white includes 14% Sémillon, which accentuates a backbone of thick texture and measured oak. Light bodied, it offers flavors of fresh green apple, papaya and pear.
Name: Whitehall Lane 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: This wine is very fresh and crisp, with plenty of fresh herb aromas and vibrant grapefruit flavors. Light bodied and well balanced, it has good acidity and a snappy finish.
Name: Dancing Bull 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Aromatically, this coastal SB from a cold, wet year is caught between citric and vegetal. On the palate, this feels tangy but that's about it. Salty, green-leaning citrus flavors finish strong, although that's not necessarily a ringing compliment.
Name: Undurraga 2016 T.H. Terroir Hunter Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Aromas of snap peas and freshly cut grass lead to tangy lemon and grapefruit flavors in this medium-bodied, crisply balanced wine. It's certainly lively and will cut through the thickest fettuccine Alfredo.
Name: Geyser Peak 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Named after the Bay of Biscay near Gascony, this wine is light, fruity and crisp. It has an herbal character, refreshing green fruit and lively acidity. Drink now.
Name: Biscaye Baie 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp lemon, green apple and riper stone-fruit aromas are hidden behind a slightly reductive and rubbery touch on the nose of this new brand from the Coquelicot team. Grassy flavors show on the sip alongside Anjou pear.
Name: Rose & Son 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This assertive, light-bodied wine has a definite herbaceous, veggie quality along with very crisp acidity. Light earthy white-pepper accents give it a spicy aspect too.
Name: Brassfield 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: This is a cheerful, concentrated white, stainless-steel fermented, that's floral and nutty on the nose. Thick and rich on the palate, it dances in lemon essence and tropical pineapple. An additional 8% Sémillon is blended in.
Name: Markham 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This crisp tightly woven white is showy in fresh-cut grass and gooseberry flavors, with an underlying grasp of grapefruit and lemon. The texture is gritty.
Name: Séamus Wines 2014 Shannon Wood Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Lean, racy aromas of green fruits and cactus pad announce a pinched, zingy, high-acid palate. Briny, lightly green citrus flavors finish tight and chalky, with raw acidity that you can feel on your teeth and gums.
Name: Agustinos 2016 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: The aromas are quite light, with notes of tropical fruit, white grapefruit and sweet herb. The flavors are similarly light and sleek, offering a nip of acid on the finish.
Name: Original House Wine 2016 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (America)

Description: A mix of melon, tropical fruit and passion fruit aromas lead to a tight palate with just enough body weight to not be austere. Flavors of white pepper, citrus and celery are modest on the finish, which tastes briny.
Name: Tres Palacios 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: This crisply herbal wine also introduces some richer apricot flavors. A joint venture between négociant Schröder & Schÿler and the Barton family of Léoville and Langoa Barton, it's attractive, fruity and full in the mouth. Drink now.
Name: Schröder & Schÿler 2016 La Croix Barton  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Perfumed and lightly spicy, this is a Sauvignon Blanc that brings out the tropical fruit side of the grape. With its rich fruit and soft citrus, it is smooth and ready to drink.
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Sauvignon Blanc (Península de Setúbal)

Description: This Transylvanian wines has aromas of vanilla, whipped cream, apple and pear. It is medium dry, with flavors of pear and lemon juice that lead to a touch of sweetness on the finish.
Name: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Medium Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Tarnave)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a truly herbal Sauvignon that is sold under the label of one of the major wine retail chains in France. It's full of green fruit, intense acidity and crisp texture and is ready to drink.
Name: Maison Nicolas 2016 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Fermented entirely in stainless steel, this is meant to be a flinty, grassy and herbal experience, especially as the main variety was blended with 3% Riesling. Simple and dry, it offers peach, lemon zest and lychee fruitiness and medium weight.
Name: Outlot 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of lemongrass and freshly-cut grass carry to a streamlined, lemon-driven palate. It is a touch too acidic to drink on it's own but would pair well with vegetable dishes.
Name: Budureasca 2016 Origini Sec Sauvignon Blanc (Dealu Mare)

Description: This ripe wine is fruity, with both citrus and tropical flavors. Light and bright, with a crisp, tangy texture, it's ready to drink.
Name: Château Grand Bourgeau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The rarely used Atlantique appellation covers much the same region as Bordeaux, with less stringent rules. This 100% Sauvignon Blanc wine is fruity, easy, soft and full of citrus flavors. Drink now.
Name: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Atlantique)

Description: This is a fat wine with light, juicy acidity. Honey and spice notes add interest to its broad melon and apple flavors.
Name: Château Haut Maurin 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Prickly aromas are short on fruit. This is a streamlined SB with spritz on the palate. Lean citrus flavors are briny and slightly bitter on the finish.
Name: Garzón 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Uruguay)

Description: With its signature herbal aromas with tangy, grapefruit-like acidity, this wine is light, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Calvet 2016 Limited Release  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty, oaky and tart, this stainless steel-fermented white shows a shock of acidity wrapped around freshly cut grass and tropical flavors.
Name: Geyser Peak 2016 River Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a thick and somewhat heavy white wine, wrapped in oak and ripe concentrated fruit. The profile is baked apple and pear with a side note of Good & Plenty candy anise.
Name: Salvestrin 2016 Le Blanc Crystal Springs Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: From old vines grown on flinty soil, this is the top wine from this major estate. Its intensity and sophistication are immediately obvious, with ripe tropical fruit giving way to a spicy, peppery character. However, it is still young and should not be drunk before 2020.
Name: Château de Tracy 2014 101 Rangs  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from biodynamically grown grapes, this wine is remarkably floral, high-toned and rewarding—a complex commingling of anise, green apple and grapefruit flavors. A gravelly texture gives it context and supports the lingering, succulent acidity.
Name: Quivira 2015 Refuge Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This barrel-fermented white wine from Jesse Katz of Devil Proof and Aperture Wines is impressively layered and complex. A reductive whiff of petrol leads on the nose yet the palate is juicy, showing a wealth of peach skin and green apple. A bite of acidity supports its fresh, fruity core.
Name: The Setting 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Still young, this rich, lightly honeyed and intensely ripe wine is beautifully structured. It has swathes of apricot, citrus and gooseberry fruits as well as a dense concentrated texture. The wine is certainly in need of aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2015 Le Grand Roc  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from a parcel that is planted at a superhigh density of nearly 7,000 plants per acre. This gives the plants greater competition between each other and encourages concentration of the wine. That is true in this rich wine with its impeccable balance between white fruit and mineral texture from the chalk soil. The wine will age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Tracy 2014 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is a juicy, succulent and high-toned wine aged in both stainless steel and French oak. From a site rich in volcanic soils, it exudes a flinty, stony element that's incredibly compelling, accented with passionfruit and grapefruit flavors and driven by lengthy acidity.
Name: Grey Stack 2016 Dry Stack Vineyard Rosemary's Block Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Description: From one of the most famous vineyard slopes in Sancerre, the wine is tight, structured and still young. It has great potential with rich citrus, herbs and green fruit flavors. Along with the tense, mineral texture, the wine has both concentration and aging ability. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Roger & Christophe Moreux 2016 Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This big wine has everything required of the variety and more. It starts with vivid citrus, herb and melon aromas, then lays on ripe white peach, honeydew and mineral notes that fill out the palate and lend mouthfilling texture. Layering, complexity and diverse flavors make it special.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2016 Reserve Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Tautly structured and lightly refreshing, this wine is an outstanding expression of high-toned stone fruit, lime and salt. The texture is seamless and round, with a lasting streak of juicy acidity.
Name: Heitz 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is the estate wine from this property, owned by the same family for 600 years. It is a rich wine, one that needs to age with its intense green and citrus fruits, a mineral texture and a touch of saltiness at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château de Tracy 2016  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Candied lemon, tangerine and grapefruit zest flavors make for a deliciously refreshing and complex experience in this well-made wine. The bright palate is accented by tropical fruit and is acid-driven yet weighty in feel.
Name: Eleven Eleven 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: Elderflower, hay, exotic fruit and tomato vine aromas leap out of the glass. The bright delicious palate shows honeydew melon, creamy white peach and grapefruit. Fresh acidity lifts the rich juicy flavors.
Name: Ronco del Gelso 2015 Rive Alte Sottomonte Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: This is an unusually complex and intricate wine that has more than simple crispness. It starts with grapefruit and bitter apple aromas and builds toward vibrant but rich grapefruit, mineral and savory consommé flavors. The texture is broad and mouthfilling but well supported and balanced by acidity. A great debut for Berryhill.
Name: Berryhill 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: With a touch more depth and complexity than Six Sigma's other offering, this wine has ripe melon and fig flavors, full body and a creamy texture that make it a standout. It's a far cry from the tangy, herbaceous sstyle of Sauvignon Blanc, bringing plenty of depth and a mouthfilling texture to the table.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2016 Michael's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: The wine is ripe, soft and generous. It has a fine balance between spice and rich white and green fruits. Lightly structured with a herbal edge and with pepper, it is still young. Drink this fine wine from 2018
Name: Domaine Roger & Christophe Moreux 2016 Les Bouffants  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling shows off both sides of Sauvignon Blanc—at once lush and tropical and racy and crisp. Ripe Gala apple and Bosc pear aromas meet tart orange peel and rubber on the nose. The palate is bolstered by energetic acidity, with a stony texture and flavors of sour Granny Smith apple and yellow grapefruit.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Description: This wine comes from ungrafted vines, planted in 2000, a rare phenomenon because of phylloxera. It may be because of that origin, that the wine has its own creamy intensity or it may just be a fine wine anyway. It is rich and full of creamed apples and finely balanced acidity. Drink now.
Name: Henry Marionnet 2016 Vignes Françaises Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Intense and crisp, this wine with its herbal and gooseberry flavors is rich and full bodied. Spicy, with a mineral texture and youthful acidity, the wine is complex and will need to age another few months. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2016 Terroir Silex  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a lively, impressive and fresh white wine with salty, stony minerality and a well-developed texture. Fig, citrus zest and white peach flavors figure into its winning profile.
Name: Quivira 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: San Bernabe, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This vintage shows cut grass, ripe apple, pear, wet cement and nectarine sorbet aromas in a wine that's almost as clear as water. The palate is textural and full of zip, with rainy day-like crispness and green fruit flavors.
Name: Noble Vines 2016 242 Sauvignon Blanc (San Bernabe)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely light in color, this always-zippy bottling from winemaker Karen Steinwachs shows wet cement, green grapefruit, cut grass and faint passionfruit aromas. It's lush and tropical on the palate but remains very racy and tight, with lime and more cut grass flavors.
Name: Buttonwood 2016 Zingy Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: A white pepper aroma and full citrus and mineral flavors make this an interesting and multifaceted wine that also refreshes the taste buds. It has good, bracing acidity, medium body and subtle layering.
Name: Two Angels 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: This wine's flinty, mineral aroma gives way to lively citrus flavors, great acidity and smooth texture that carry into the finish. It's subtle and medium bodied, with very good balance and enough complexity to hold interest.
Name: Brutocao 2016 Feliz Vineyard Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This single-vineyard wine offers high-toned citrus, almond and vanilla bean flavors. Fresh and fruity, it's light  bodied yet doesn't skimp on flavor or texture, finishing on a tart note of lemon pith.
Name: Conclusion 2015 Morgaen Lee Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Enticing aromas of yellow stone fruit, aromatic herb and tomato vine take center stage. Round, ripe and delicious, the juicy palate presents yellow peach, grapefruit and lemon drop while a mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Borgo Conventi 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost transparent in the glass, this bottling offers clean passionfruit, sugar-laced rosemary and cut lawn aromas—a very pure expression of the Musqué clone. It's is grippy in texture, and the flavors are quite light, including grass, lime peel and delicate honeysuckle.
Name: Buttonwood 2016 Musque Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of herb, grass, papaya and kiwi lead to tart, spritely tropical-fruit flavors heightened by grapefruit accents. There's no mistaking the variety and it's appealing, with a drawn-out finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite light aromas of talc, lemon zest and mineral along with whiffs of tropical fruit lead to sleek, bright, focused and lemony flavors backed by zippy acidity. It should shine paired with ceviche or oysters.
Name: Efeste 2016 Feral Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

Description: With initial weightiness and fullness on the palate, this wine ultimately delivers crisp, cool peach and melon flavors, a lingering lemon zest note adding to its freshness.
Name: Ousterhout 2016 Redwood Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: This is a solid example of a Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc: Bright and fruit forward with attractive stone fruit and lemon verbena notes on the nose, while lemon-lime popsicle carries on the palate. The body shows some weight and a slippery texture to keep all that acid in check.
Name: Two Rivers 2016 Convergence Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A pretty nose of delicate citrus, tropical fruit and floral tones is followed by some buttery base notes. The oak is showy but there are many who will like the creamy texture and spice it brings to the palate.
Name: Prophecy 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Grown on the chalk soil, this fine wine has picked up saltiness and minerality to create its tight texture. It is also floral with plenty of white fruits and a light herbal character. The wine will need to age, so drink from 2018.
Name: Michel Vattan 2016 Cuvée Calcaire  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Vanilla and fig hints add interest to this medium-bodied, richly textured wine. It's quietly fruity, suggesting honeydew melon, and has complex layers that unfold on the palate. It's a very good example of how this grape variety thrives in Lake County.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2016 Asbill Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This wine's bold, tropical grapefruit and pineapple flavors and bright acidity make for a refreshing mouthfeel. A slight touch of sweetness rounds off the otherwise vibrant, citrusy personality.
Name: Bogle 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Starting to show its age with a pale golden hue, this fumé is classy and restrained. Aromas of waxy lemon, pineapple and green bean mingle with base notes of butterscotch and smoke from the oak. The palate offers less excitement with the fruit disappearing some and searing acidity taking over. Nevertheless, this wine would be a versatile pairing for a variety of dishes.
Name: Goose Bay 2014 Kosher Reserve Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (South Island)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A piney, minty, earthy aroma and citrus and herb flavors make this light-bodied wine appetizing. It's dry and well-balanced and has plenty of personality, so drink up.
Name: Longboard 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: From a single parcel of old vines, this melon and kiwi-flavored wine has both a round texture and a line of crisp acidity. It is full of ripe fruit, concentrated and brimming with tangy orange acidity at the end. Drink this rich wine from 2018.
Designation: Domaine des Grandes Esperances Le Roi Soleil
Name: Saget la Perrière 2016 Domaine des Grandes Esperances Le Roi Soleil Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Sublety and a crisp, bracing texture make this wine perfect for many different occasions. It has restrained dried thyme, mineral and lemon flavors, an appetizing tang of acidity and a rounded texture on the finish.
Name: Bliss 2016 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of tropical fruit, elderflower, tomato vine and a whiff of hay jump out of the glass. Ripe and tangy, the outgoing palate delivers grapefruit, yellow peach, honeydew melon and notion of dried herb. An oyster-shell note on the close adds interest.
Name: Livon 2015 Valbuins Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Rich and creamy, this is a delicious, ripe, and full style of Sauvignon. It has a light vanilla edge from its creamy texture as well as intense green-fruit acidity. The wine is concentrated and will be better to drink from 2018.
Name: Henry Marionnet 2016 Domaine de la Charmoise Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This opens with aromas of white spring flower, citrus and a hint of thyme. The juicy palate doles out yellow peach, tomato vine and a hazelnut note alongside bright acidity. Enjoy soon.
Name: Attems 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: There's more to this wine than just citrus and grass. On the nose it's floral and nutty, with a hint of ginger. The palate shows more nuttiness alongside waxy lemon, herbs and with some textural weight. Sip with Southeast Asian cuisine.
Name: Goose Bay 2015 Kosher Sauvignon Blanc (South Island)

Description: This shows delicate notes of orange blossom, grass, lime and sea spray. The palate is a little shy but there's bright acidity and lightness to this dainty Sauvignon Blanc that makes it a lovely summer drop.
Name: Whitehaven 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Attractive aromatics of flowers, cut grass, fresh pineapple and watermelon rind immediately seduce, while the palate ties it all together with bright fruit, crisp acidity, and a hint of weight. For a reserve wine, this is fairly “drink now” in style, but there's plenty to like about it nonetheless.
Name: Toi Toi 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine shows an intriguing nose of buttercup flowers, grapefruit, lemongrass and damp grass cuttings. The palate is where it shines, offering a slight roundness, balanced by mouthwatering acidity and plenty of citrus notes on the lingering finish.
Name: Lanark Lane 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh nectarine, wet stone, cider apple and cut grass notes show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are rounded, with Anjou pear, Granny Smith apple and citrus touches, upright tannins and prominent malic acids.
Name: Roark Wine Co. 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This maverick wine looks cloudy and orange in hue and offers citrus zest and peach skin aromas. That's because it was fermented with the grape skins, like a red wine. A plethora of flavors comes through on the palate, from peach and almond to jasmine and prosciutto, and it has a mouthfilling texture. Know that it's not a mainstream wine but enjoy it anyway.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)

Description: Orange peel, melon, and green aromas are muted by a sulphuric overtone. The palate offers balanced acidity and a grainy texture, finishing on spice and lemon peel tones.
Name: Barker's Marque 2016 Arona Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A generous and ripe wine, this is rich with citrus, apple along with hints of tropical fruits. The mineral texture gives the wine its shape and brings out the full-throated fruitiness. It is a wine to age for a few months, so drink from 2018.
Name: Collegiale des Domaines de Loire 2016 Domaine Pascal Balland  (Sancerre)

Description: There's power in this wine amidst the notes of waxy lemon, peach pit and blossoms. The bitterness of melon rind comes in on the finish, but there's enough acidity to keep the palate refreshing, interesting, and quite food friendly.
Name: Greyrock 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine starts on the shy side but with several minutes in glass reveals delicate notes of lemon-lime, watermelon rind and grass along with a touch of butter in the background. It's the palate that's of real interest here. Prickly acidity is backed up with a chalky texture, a hint of spice, and a long lemony finish. This is a light and refreshing drop, with a hint of seriousness thrown in for good measure.
Name: Peregrine 2015 Mohua Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Having spent time in both oak and stainless steel, this wine offers intense golden toast flavor and focused acidity, the fruit recalling grapefruit pith and melon.
Name: Webster Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine has fresh snap pea and lemon aromas followed by crisp green apple flavors. It starts out tangy but is cushioned by a hint of sweetness for a soft finish.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: Green-fruit aromas and intense, tangy fruit define this wine. It is strongly herbal, bringing out a zesty character that is right up front. It is probably a few months away from being ready to drink, so wait until summer 2018.
Name: Sauvion 2016 Loire Valley  (Sancerre)

Description: Nutty and medium bodied, this is a straightforward white wine. Its tropical passionfruit and lush pear flavors are zesty, and its texture is creamy.
Name: Titus 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Full bodied and rounded in texture, this wine has lots of ripe fruit and good balance, without the herbal character typical of Sauvignon Blanc. Mild melon and apple aromas lead to rich melon and fig flavors and a generous, mouthcoating texture. A great value.
Name: Beringer 2016 Founders' Estate Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Paraffin, grapefruit pith, pungent smoke and citrus candy scents show on the nose of this bottling, which is a bit reductive and needs some time to breath. When it does, its honey, lime peel and wet cement flavors emerge.
Name: Point & Line 2015 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This wine is flashy and there's no denying that, starting with a heady nose of toast, smoke and orange peel. The palate is viscous and grainy on notes of mint and ginger, with barely enough acidity to maintain balance. Nonetheless, it is inherently appealing.
Name: Governor's Bay 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with notes of guava, pineapple and citrus. The palate is lightly spritzy with plenty of grapefruit flavors that keep the interest high.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: You've got to dig for them a little, but eventually this wine offers aromas of ginger, white flowers and almonds with a whiff of green beans followed by a citrusy, pithy palate. The finish doesn't last as long as you'll wish it did. Nevertheless, this is a solid example of the region's flagship variety.
Name: Kim Crawford 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: With vegetal notes taking center stage, this wine smells of green beans and grass over subtle notes of citrus, grapefruit and melon rind. It really comes alive on the palate: Notes of lemon-lime popsicle and green herbs are accompanied by a spritzy texture that make it perfect for easy sipping.
Name: Glover Family 2016 Massey Dacta Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This refreshing, well-made wine combines vibrant citrus flavors with richer ripe melon and apple notes for an interesting and enjoyable personality.
Name: Husch 2016 La Ribera Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a good, well-made wine that hits the spot, with lively apple and citrus aromas, fresh and crisp fruit flavors, a lively mouthfeel and tangy finish. It will be easy to pair with appetizers, seafood and light entrees.
Name: McFadden 2016 Blue Quail Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Description: Notes of peach pit, wet stone, tomato leaf and struck match are tied together by a medium body and prickly acidity, finishing with melon rind and more green leafy flavors.
Name: Toi Toi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The bouquet is generous, offering loads of pineapple, peach, canned peas, blossoms and grapefruit. The palate is fresh and zippy with a grassy and citrus combo will please lovers of this style.
Name: Huntaway Reserve 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This stainless steel-aged wine shows confected, marshmallow-like notes before its high-toned, stony minerality comes through. Peach and citrus flavors form the fruit foundation, which is creamy in texture.
Name: Pestoni Family 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: Green notes lead the parade here: Grass, peas and tomato leaf march ahead of the lemon citrus notes, with an intriguing struck-match character taking up the rear. On the palate, the acidity is prominent but in check, and the slightly chalky texture is appealing. When it comes to flavor, however, it loses much of what the nose offers, finishing a little flat and bitter.
Name: Mud House 2014 The Woolshed Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Crisp green-apple aromas and tangy, vibrant flavors give this nicely dry wine a high refreshment quotient, so it will be ideal to stock for everyday occasions. It has great acidity, a tangy mouthfeel and a lingering, fruity finish.
Name: Michael Pozzan 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Vattan's style is for a creamy textured wine. Balanced with its ripe acidity, the wine has weight and richness, given by the clay soil. The wine has plenty of delicious apple and lime flavors, finishing with a great burst of lemon zest. Drink now.
Name: Michel Vattan 2016 Cuvée Argile  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine strikes a balance between crispness and fullness as it offers tart green apple aromas, richer, riper apple and Bosc pear flavors and a texture that's more rounded than sharp.
Name: Pech Merle 2016 Big Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: A light earthy aroma and enjoyable savory flavors suggesting dried herbs, bouillon and canteloupe characterize this deceptively full-bodied, dry wine. It has a nervy, crisp texture, great acidity and intriguing complexity.
Name: Le Mulet Rouge 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tangy and varietal, this emphasizes some pleasing grassiness, with a touch of petrol in the nose. The fresh, herbal components are set against a mix of lemon, grapefruit and pineapple fruits.
Name: Brandborg 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Description: The notes weaves a tapestry of peach, butter, grass, peas and citrus followed by a palate that's all about the texture. With balanced acidity and a chalky mouthfeel propping up flavors of lemon and green herbs, this is a complex and food-friendly offering.
Name: Framingham 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded peach, cider apple, chalk and seltzer aromas mix with a touch of yeast on the nose of this bottling. There's a racy, tactile acidity on the palate, lending depth to its dried apple, pear and sea salt flavors.
Name: Luna Hart 2016 Faith Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Description: Tropical and citrus notes blend with green herb and subtle struck match notes in this wine. On the palate there's some textural weight and the matchstick character carries through. The searing acidity is overpowering and the wine falls apart a little on the finish, leaving a bitter after taste.
Name: Mud House 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tropical fruit flavors are brightened by lemon-lime citrus notes and a hint of the variety's trademark grassiness. A slippery smooth texture and balanced acidity make this easy to drink on its own.
Name: Phantom Bay 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tropical fruit aromas show up on the ripe fruity palate of this wine. With pineapple and mango, it is in the tropical spectrum of Sauvignon Blanc. The acidity is just right to keep the crisp texture in place. Drink now.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Java des Grandes Esperances Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Waxy lemon, green veg, honey and a bit of matchstick lead precede a chalky textured palate. Searing acidity keeps the body light in feel.
Name: Taonga 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Favoring a more tropical spectrum, this wine offers aromas of pineapple and white flowers with some lemon and a touch of grass. The palate comes with a little weight alongside a nice lick of acidity and a long pineapple and citrus finish.
Name: Nga Waka 2015 Three Paddles Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This full-bodied wine relies more on its rich texture and nutty, mineral flavors than on the usual citrus and herb notes, so it's rather thick in profile. It has the heft of a Chardonnay and savory, almond-like accents that are worth appreciating.
Name: Emerald Hare 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Thickly concentrated in a rich style, this wine also possesses a balanced backbone of citrus and melon flavor, made more decadent by accompanying marshmallow and vanilla bean notes.
Name: Flint & Steel 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Characteristic lime-leaf and lemon notes marry with blossoms and grass. The palate, however, is less focused, starting bright, tapering to flatness in the middle, and finishing on the richer side.
Name: Astrolabe 2016 Province Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromas of melon and mango give a good indication of this tropical-fruit-flavored wine. Its acidity and light herbal character are just foils to this bold forward fruitiness. It is an intense wine ready to drink.
Name: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée 2016 Château de Vallagon Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
Winery: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée

Description: Nicely balanced and fairly fruity, this wine is easy to like for its crisp apple and grapefruit aromas, fresh and ripe flavors and smooth and lively texture.
Name: Fetzer 2016 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This is a ripe, oaky wine from Waipara, just north of Christchurch on New Zealand's South Island. Pineapple, mango and honey characters dominate on the nose. The palate is rich and on the flabby side, the oak overpowering much of the fruit, but those who like their powerfully oaked whites will dig this version.
Name: Grey's Peak 2016 Barrel Fermented Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara Valley)

Description: With a few good swirls, the nose reveals ripe peach, melon, lime leaf and grass, while the palate promises the same ripe fruitiness accompanied by balanced acidity and a chalky, slightly round finish.
Name: Bird 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This attractive herbal and spicy wine is the entry-level wine at this showcase estate. The wine is rich, generous with a character that reveals both crisp fruit and ripeness. That makes it rich and very drinkable young.
Name: Château de Tracy 2016 Madamoiselle de T  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This wine delivers pretty stone fruit and grapefruit notes, with a hint of honey and blossoms. The palate is light to medium bodied and offers plenty of acidity to balance. A slightly spicy, white pepper note marks the finish.
Name: Echo Bay 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Produced at Domaine la Gemière in Sancerre, this ripe full-fruited wine is perfect to drink young. Packed with citrus fruits with a strong mineral edge, the wine is rich and floral. Drink now.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2016 French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Based in Anjou, this producer has made a specialty of single varietal wines. This soft lightly herbal Sauvignon Blanc is lively with fruit and acidity. It has a crisp texture, apple and lime flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Colombier 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This is a straightforward wine showing ripe tropical fruits and a melon rind character, while mint and lemon peel ride out in the background. The fruit disappears quickly on the finish but a lovely herbaceousness takes its place.
Name: Kennedy Point 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a nice, low-key wine that won't make any enemies. It has crisp apple aromas, herbal touches and enough acidity to keep it lively on the palate.
Name: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: With green, herbal notes of oregano and fresh cut grass mingling with lemon zest and a good lick of acidity, this wine ticks all the boxes when it comes to a solidly made, refreshing sipper.
Name: Twin Islands 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Ticking all the standard Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc boxes, this wine offers straightforward feline, grapefruit, grass and green bean characters with refreshing acidity. Drink now.
Name: Sineann 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Secondary characteristics like mushrooms, hay, and nuts make this unusual but in a mostly charming way. Tropical fruits take a back seat on the palate; Green beans and peas are in the driver's seat. Texturally it has a surprising weight, but there's enough acidity to keep things fresh.
Name: Invivo 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in a New Zealand-esque grassy style with plenty of herbal notes, this wine is seriously tart, with a stony texture and a strong taste of briny lemon rind.
Name: Gracianna 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: The tropical-fruit aromas set the scene for this ripe apricot and peach-flavored wine. The palate shows rich fruitiness contrasted by a green, herbal edge. Drink now.
Name: Collegiale des Domaines de Loire 2016 Domaine Desloges Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This light-bodied, assertive Sauvignon Blanc exudes classic aromas and flavors of fresh herb and snap pea, helping it taste crisp, dry and true to type.
Name: Sand Point 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Vanilla and butter touches give this medium-bodied, rather oaky wine extra richness. Its soft, creamy texture and muted fruit flavors are a bit unusual for the type, but it's still quite enjoyable to sip.
Name: Save Me San Francisco 2016 Bulletproof Picasso Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Grapefruit, grass and lime characters are woven together in this simple but solid example of Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc. There's a slight weight on the palate, with a chalky texture, refreshing acidity and a long, lemony finish.
Name: Kate Radburnd 2015 Bud Burst Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)

Description: This wine has a grassy element that won't appeal to all palates, complemented by medium body and citrus, wet stone and peach fuzz flavor. Neutral oak aging keeps it fresh and lively.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Description: This soft, although food friendly wine has a creamy character and touch of vanilla. The ripe melon and apricot fruit are balanced with the acidity and the warm texture. This is an enticing ripe wine that is ready to drink.
Name: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée 2015 Les Gourmets Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
Winery: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée

Description: This is an up-front fruity wine with tangy acidity and a crisp texture. It is still young, still almost raw in its character and needs a few months to calm down. But it will be an attractive zesty wine full of fruit. Drink from 2018.
Name: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée 2016 Les Gourmets Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
Winery: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée

Description: This shows a good amount of funk with its matchstick, mushroom and toast aromas. There's a speckle of lime leaf and grass to remind you that this is Sauvignon Blanc, after all, but mostly it is its own beast entirely. Oily yet grainy in texture with a whiff of smoke on the finish, there's just enough acid to keep you going back for more.
Name: Nick Goldschmidt 2015 Boulder Bank Fitzroy Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: With its crisp red-currant fruits and strongly herbal character, this is a ripe wine with intense acidity. It is crisply textured and concentrated. Drink now.
Name: Marquis de Goulaine 2016 Les Landelles Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: The herbal side of Touraine shows strongly here. The wine has richness as well as green fruits and gooseberries. Its acidity is dominant, tangy and full in the mouth. Drink now.
Name: Bougrier 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This floral wine is bright, crisp and zesty. It has the herbal character that is the mark of Touraine Sauvignon—ripe while also intensely green and tight. Drink this wine now.
Name: Marcel Martin 2016 La Perclaire Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This light soft wine is crisp and clean. It moves into the tropical-fruit spectrum of Sauvignon with its ripe mango and peach flavors. There is a fine tang of acidity to this easygoing wine. Drink now.
Name: Lacheteau 2016 Domaine Trotignon Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Lake Erie North Shore, Ontario, Canada
Description: The Charmat process, rather than the Champagne method, is used here. It's a clean, light, generic sparkling wine, done as a brut. Use it as an all-purpose mixer for best effect.
Name: North 42 Degrees 2016 Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Erie North Shore)

Description: This is a good, dry wine with moderate fruit flavors, a straightforward texture and medium body. It has mild lemon and apple notes in the aroma and on the palate.
Name: Geyser Peak 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: The pungent aromas of grass, waxy lemon and canned corn on the nose are followed by more citrus and overripe melon on a palate. This is zippy and clean but finishes slightly bitter.
Name: Smart Cookie 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Green, underripe fruit tends to dominate on this wine, although grapefruit, melon and struck match are there as well. The palate provides searing acidity and citrus notes but the green fruit remain in the fore.
Name: The Infamous Goose 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tart, tangy lemon flavor meets green apple and quince in this lush, oaky wine. Its texture is robust.
Name: Ty Caton 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lake Erie North Shore, Ontario, Canada
Description: Light in both alcohol and concentration, this seems to have a hint of residual sugar, perhaps intent on masking the acidity. It offers little indication of ripe fruit or varietal character. It's a dilute, plain, generic white wine.
Name: North 42 Degrees 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Erie North Shore)

Description: A rounded mouthfeel and plenty of fruit flavors, like apple and honeydew, make this medium-bodied wine user-friendly. The acidity is soft, and the flavors drop off quickly on the finish.
Name: Pomelo 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
