Description: The winery's first wine under screw cap, and only the third vintage of this variety, this has a steely nose and a thick floral layering of sweet peach and vanilla, offering a richness on the midpalate that persists through the finish.
Name: Rombauer 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a soft, lightly earthy style of wine produced from grapes from across the Loire Valley. It has a strong herbal character and a touch of grapefruit. Drink now.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Light-bodied and refreshing, this wine leads with fresh cucumber aromas then opens crisp grapefruit and lemon flavors that feel lively on the palate.
Name: Shenandoah Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Made from Loire Valley fruit, this has the tangy, herbal character typical of cool-climate wines. Drink now.
Name: Villebois 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This crisp, clean and zesty wine is lightly herbal and immediately appealing. It's full of citrus and gooseberry flavors and is ready to drink.
Name: Vindivin 2016 La Belle Saison Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This is an easy, open wine that is lightly herbal. There is a barnyard edge that masks the fruit, although there is bright crisp acidity to give it a lift. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2015 Le Charnay  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This is a light bright wine, full of forward fruitiness. The tangy edge of minerality gives the wine a pleasing texture. Citrus fruits support this texture with their zest and acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Paul Buisse 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: One of the range of single-varietal bottlings from this estate, this wine is lightly herbal, with orange and green-plum flavors. With tangy acidity and a ripe character, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: An herbal wine with gooseberry and citrus flavors, this is full of fruitiness with acidity and touch of flint and steel in the texture. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Pierre Jacolin 2015 Domaine du Manay  (Menetou-Salon)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This warm style of Sauvignon Blanc has apricot and citrus flavors. Packed with fruit and with refreshing acidity, it makes a fine apéritif.
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Gooseberry and lychee candy pervade over subtle notes of lemon, lime and eucalyptus. Vibrant on the palate, lychee and gooseberry remain the stars but take on a bitterness. Racy acidity is prevalent and lends itself to a tart finish.
Name: Stinson 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a soft, simple, light and fruity wine. Its lively acidity is refreshing and crisp. It has a fragrant perfume and is ready to drink.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Ripe while also herbal, this is an easy fruity wine. It has an attractive spice and perfumed white-fruit character that enhances the crisp citrus fruit. Drink now.
Designation: Château de la Roche Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Pierre Chainier 2016 Château de la Roche Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: With its silex soil, this vineyard is able to produce a distinctly mineral wine. This is crisp, tightly woven with acidity and herbal characteristics. That is balanced by the refreshing lemon and grapefruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Pierre Chainier 2016 Domaine Roc de Châteauvieux Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: The wine is soft and open. It has some bright citrus and creamed-apple flavors that give it a ripe character. The wine is juicy, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Bougrier 2016 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Lean, largely neutral citrus aromas set up a palate with medium weight. Melon, pineapple and passion-fruit flavors are fresh but minimal. A bright finish makes this a good match for ceviche.
Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2016 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine is fruity and soft, with hints of citrus and herbal flavors. Its acidity is bright and attractive. Drink now.
Name: M. & J-F Bertrand 2016 Fleur de Carbonnel Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: From a Loire Valley-based producer, this wine is crisp and cool. It has herbal touches and lively, citrusy acidity. Drink now.
Name: Villebois 2016 Loupart Le Petit Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This warm style of Sauvignon Blanc has easygoing acidity and gooseberry fruit flavors. It's lightly tangy, with a bright, crisp texture.
Name: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Slightly gritty, nutty aromas indicate that this Sauvignon Blanc is starting to break down. This wine maintains a citric yet oily mouthfeel, finishing with short flavors of salty white peach.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2016 Dedicatión Personal Sauvignon Blanc

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This ripe, tropical fruit-driven style of Sauvignon Blanc from the south of France is tangy and ready to drink.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Romantic Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This ripe, fruity wine delivers tropical fruit, apricot and white plum flavors. Its warm acidity leaves a rounded, creamy aftertaste.
Name: Les Alliés 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This wine includes grapes from a wide region that extends beyond Bordeaux. It's a classic, light, herbal expression of Sauvignon Blanc with citrus flavors and a tangy texture. Drink now.
Name: Daguet 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Atlantique)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine has the lightest possible taste. Its hints of green fruit, light, citrusy acidity and crisp aftertaste are barely discernible. Drink now.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2016 Perles de Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Balanced and food-friendly, this white is stainless-steel fermented and likably crisp. Medium bodied and textured, it shines in a lively bouquet of apple, peach, apricot and Key lime, finishing in a flurry of nutmeg and lemongrass.
Name: Gibbs 2016 Centa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: From a vineyard in Yountville, this wine has a voluptuous entry of baked peach and vanilla, with a back beat of tart key lime. Layered and lengthy, it offers flavor and body in abundance, ending fleshy and full.
Name: V. Sattui 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a very accessible aromatic entry to this bottling. An almost-sweet touch of crystallized honey and beeswax is cut by green plum, wet stone and chopped lemongrass. The sip delivers rounded and pleasant flavors of nectarine, red apple and chamomile.
Name: Gainey 2015 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Fresh notes of nettle, lemon and green pear appear on the nose. These crisp, fresh flavors are even more present on the light but textured palate that offers substance despite the slenderness. Friendly notes of lemon throughout make this restrained Sauvignon Blanc hugely appetizing.
Name: Wohlmuth 2016 Kitzecker Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Inspired by the Loire Valley, where the “rocks decide” (as this bottling's name suggests), this wine is very light and almost cloudy in color, and shows tons of chalk, wet wool, lime peel and seashore on the nose. The texture is immensely intriguing, presenting flavors of just-ripe Anjou pear, cut grass, and iodine-like kelp tones, with a flash of petrol on the finish.
Name: Shared Notes 2015 Les Pierres Qui Decident Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: From an historic block of the famous vineyard long known as Robert's Block, this white is incredibly complex and concentrated, with richly woven layers of pear, Key lime and peach. A handful of Sémillon is blended in, adding extra oomph and flavor, the finish balanced in acidity and marked by freshness.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2015 Reserve To Kalon Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A touch of peach is edged with leafy notes of citrus foliage and a touch of elderflower. The palate brings out the peach but also a zestiness reminiscent of grapefruit peel, making for a crisp texture. Full of flavor this has a rounded midpalate despite the slender body.
Name: Strauss 2016 Ried Gamlitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost crystal-clear in the glass, this bottling shows broad aromas of red apple and peach before the grass, wet hay, squeezed lime and rainy sidewalk aromas stand up. There is a sharp texture and tension to the sip, where the warmth of poached pear is cut by mowed lawn and wet river stones.
Name: La Honda Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Well balanced and high-toned, this lovely white impresses in spritzy acidity and teases of lemon peel and grapefruit. The back of the palate develops more complex elements of hazelnut and vanilla that add texture and complexity to the fruit.
Name: Ehlers Estate 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: This lovely expression of the grape blends in 21% Sémillon, adding a juicy, fleshy texture that's hard to forget. With a cradling of oak, it has a rich body met and balanced by crisp acidity, amid defined flavors of apple skin, melon and pineapple.
Name: Groth 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Delicate notes of nettle and lemon play on the restrained nose. The palate adds slight but very refreshing spritz to the already slender and crisp body. This is an easy, delicate summer wine with a clean and refreshing finish.
Name: Umathum 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: Bartho Eksteen. This wooded Sauvy shows incredible restraint, harmony and balance. It opens with attractive notes of ripe gooseberry, apple flesh and green melon rind. The palate offers more just-ripe tropical-fruit tones, with a pleasantly pithy texture and lime-rind flavors that hang on through the lingering finish. Enjoy now for the bright acidity, though it should mature well through 2020.
Name: Bartho Eksteen 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Vloekskoot Wooded Sauvignon Blanc (Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Floral and wet-stone aromas are followed by tangy kiwi and jicama flavors keeping to a nicely dry profile. This distinctive wine from extremely consistent Saracina has bracing acidity and good concentration but remains on the subtle side.
Name: Saracina 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Fresh and lively in green grass, melon and pear, this well-made wine is restrained in ripeness and body, opting to highlight its stony minerality and a touch of gravel on the texture. It finishes light and breezy.
Name: Charles Krug 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: This wine comes from a selection of the best concrete egg, oak and stainless-steel-fermented selections of this vineyard-designate, combined with 3% Sémillon. It shows a golden honeyed touch of oak and a rich nose, notions that follow on the palate. Full bodied and lengthy, it holds highlights of lemon, quince and ginger.
Name: V. Sattui 2016 Carsi Vineyard Reserve Stock Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this lively white shows lush and plush flavors of melon, pear and peach, making it likably fruit-forward. Amidst the deft ripeness lies more complex accents of wild vanilla and fennel that please and intrigue.
Name: Decoy 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Cutting crisp tangerine, peach and honeydew melons abound on the nose of this full-bodied textured Sauvignon Blanc. Sprightly lemon-lime acidity lends balance and edge, and a hint of bitterness on the finish lends elegant structure.
Name: McCall 2016 Cuvée Nicola North Ridge Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A restrained mix of peach, passion fruit and lemon plays on the nose. These notions are intensified on a sprightly, light body that shows purity of expression. Fine spritz intensifies the fruit notes, framing them in friendly, ripe lemon. Despite its lightness, this has body and balance. It's an elegant, restrained but invigorating wine with an aromatic finish.
Name: Wohlmuth 2016 Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 20% Pinot Gris in the mix and a percentage of French oak-aging, this white is thirst-quenching and medium bodied, expressive in grassy pea shoots and apricot. On the palate, it offers texture and fruit-forward likability, finishing in crisp pear.
Name: Armida 2016 Redwood Road Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This widely available and affordably priced Sauvignon Blanc is light in the glass, disclosing crisp lime, grass, wet cement and white-flower bud aromas. There is tons of sizzle to the palate, where Key and kaffir-lime flavors accent the grass and ripe pear elements.
Name: Gnarly Head 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Description: Tender, delicate notes of passion fruit can be glimpsed amidst the citrus flavors of the nose. The palate is slender and light, with that same lemony freshness and poise. Drink this fresh, crisp and fruity wine while aromas are at their peak.
Name: Esterházy 2016 Estoras Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Spritzy and fresh in acidity, this white combines the richness of vanilla cream with the crispness of peach and green apple, finding a middle ground between lush texture and zippy stoniness.
Name: Glenwood Cellars 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Lively acidity wraps itself around fresh notions of grapefruit, gooseberry and peach in this fuller, richer style of white. French oak played a part in both fermentation and aging, adding a luxurious undercurrent of texture and complexity.
Name: Cosa Obra 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Steely and stony in texture and underlying minerality, this medium-bodied effort shows a wealth of floral aromatics, along with lighthearted melon and green apple. A lushness to the finish is welcoming and complex.
Name: MacLeod 2016 Indian Springs Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Crisp pear skins, kaffir lime, dewy oregano and underripe honeydew show on the nose of this sprightly bottling. The palate reveals a straightforward, slightly restrained Sauv Blanc, with grass, lime, sliced pear, chilled cherimoya and jasmine flavors.
Name: Alma de Cattleya 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Winemaker: Charles Hopkins. De Grendel always produces stunning Sauvies, and Winemaker Charles Hopkins' CWG selection is another well-balanced and expressive selection. It leads with green gooseberry, orange pith and melon rind aromas, while the medium-weight palate shows a bit more concentration in banana and melon flesh flavors. Ample acidity lifts the ripe fruit tones and refreshes the finish, which lingers with faint hints of dried grass and toast. Drink now–2019.
Name: De Grendel 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Wooded Sauvignon Blanc (Hemel en Aarde)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine brings lightly styled aromas of green grass, herb, snap pea and whiffs of green pepper. The palate is full bodied and textured, bringing a sense of richness but never losing its balance. It lingers on the finish.
Name: Matthews 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Soft notes of green bell pepper, nettle and grass give this a fresh aspect. The slender palate then adds lemon, giving a focused zestiness, with glimpses of boxwood. The wine is citric, slender and very refreshing.
Name: Pratsch 2016 Ried Kittel Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Description: A touch of green bell pepper and boxwood appears amidst the citrus scent on the nose. The palate majors on crisp lemon tartness, with some of those appetizing green boxwood and pepper flavors, too. The body is light, lean, dry and refreshing.
Name: Winzerkeller Andau 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: This oaky white is concentrated in peach, apricot and melon flavors. A stark, underlying acidity provides freshness on the midpalate. The finish is defined in lemon peel.
Name: Ferrari-Carano 2016 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: The slightest touch of flinty reduction clings to the nose. Underneath, the crisp, slender palate is dominated by appetizing notes of ripe lemon. A tiny bit of spritz makes the slender body seem almost weightless, but all that lovely lemon fruit fills mouth and nose. The finish is featherlight and refreshing.
Name: Tement 2016 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: A creamy note hovers above lemon aromas of the nose. The palate has the same creaminess on the midpalate, pervaded by immense lemon freshness that's both flowing and focused, with a refreshng but slightly warm finish.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a nicely dry, fresh and restrained wine. Its best attributes are lightly fruity aromas, white-pepper and wet-stone flavors and a tangy mouthfeel, with a good snap of astringency.
Name: Chacewater 2016 Windrem Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Just a whiff of citrus shows on the restrained nose. The palate is very crisp, even lean, disclosing slight spritz. Some riper fruit waits at the core but you have to savor the midpalate to find it. The wine is light and very refreshing.
Name: Neumeister 2016 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Vulkanland Steiermark)

Description: Just a whiff of citrus shows on the restrained nose. The palate is very crisp, even lean, disclosing slight spritz. Some riper fruit waits at the core but you have to savor the midpalate to find it. The wine is light and very refreshing.
Name: Neumeister 2016 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Vulkanland Steiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 11% Sémillon, this wine brings lightly styled aromas of citrus, herb and spice, along with barrel spice and whiffs of tropical fruit. Kiwi and citrus flavors fill out the palate, which shows a sense of sophistication.
Name: Matthews 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Notes of tart lemon peel appear on the nose. The lean and light body continues in that lemony vein with brisk freshness. This wine is light, with a slight texture made up of yeastiness and zesty lemon. Some notes of grass appear on the finish. Drink this light, dry wine soon.
Name: Strauss 2016 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Light and steely, this wine offers mild flavors that lean tropical, like pineapple and guava. Those succulently ripe layers meet stone fruit and a medium-sized body, making for an enjoyable, food-friendly experience on the palate.
Name: Clif Family 2016 Rte Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Santa Ynez Valley stalwarts explore the slightly riper side of the grape with this bottling that shows fatter Anjou pear and Key-lime aromas but also tighter chalk and wet sidewalk tones. Sour green-apple skins arise on the sip alongside lime zest. The acidity is noticeable but not racy.
Name: Gainey 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Honeyed and smoothly textured, this attractive wine is mellowed in acidity, preferring to highlight fruit-forward notions of peach and melon. An undertone of dried herb and grass accompanies the ripe flavor.
Name: Amici 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Tart but juicy, this medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc offers a bounty of fresh pineapple and tangerine flavors. A touch of sweat on the nose blows off with aeration, leaving a fresh revitalizing finish.
Name: Suhru 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an ebullient wine, full of herb, grapefruit and wet-earth aromas as well as very tangy yet sweet-seeming citrus flavors. It has good concentration and stays fresh through the finish.
Name: Lava Cap 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are generous, with notes of freshly cut wood, custard and herb. The palate is full bodied, rich and creamy in feel. The wood shows prominently and it brings warmth on the finish.
Name: Tenor 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is quite reductive at first, with cut grass and damp herb aromas mixing up with dried seaweed and light lemon peel. There is a tart green-grass flavor to the palate, but also a slightly riper Anjou pear component, with a salty freshness emerging toward the finish.
Name: Mercy 2016 Zabala Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made by the team at Wrath, this is one of the better canned wines on the shelves right now. Light in the glass, it offers very refreshing, mineral-driven aromas of wet riverstone and rain on cement as well as slight touches of Pink Lady apples and green hay. Asian pear flesh mixes with slightly sour lime peel and sweet chives on the palate.
Name: Al 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: Very clear in the glass, this bottling from the Wrath team shows honeydew, passionfruit, pine needle and a hint of wood on the nose. The flavors are straightforward, with green-apple flesh and a hint of more passionfruit.
Name: Ex 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Description: This is a smooth, dry and well-integrated white, highlighted in apricot, peach and lemongrass, with an herbal undertone. It's ready for the table, with food-friendly acidity and medium body weight.
Name: MacLeod 2016 Marie's Cuvée Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: The merest touch of passion fruit streaks the lemony, fresh nose. Although the palate seems a little dilute, it is light, fresh and finishes on a lingering lemon note.
Name: Skoff 2016 Eichberger Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a rich and creamy white with balanced acidity, a wine made in a voluptuous style without being heavy. Grassy notes meld seamlessly with juicier aspects of pineapple and pear, with a crisp undercurrent of refreshment.
Name: Foppiano 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine all comes from Oasis Vineyard. The aromas are light, with notes of citrus peel, herb and guava, showing some reduction. The palate is sleekly styled with nervy acids that keep the interest up.
Name: Sparkman 2016 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Citrus aromas and ripe melon flavors give a clean, fruity personality to this medium-bodied wine. Honeydew, mild peach and lemon nuances ride a crisp texture.
Name: Chacewater 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine all comes from Klipsun Vineyard. It's reductive out of the gate, providing some distraction from the aromas of citrus and herb. The flavors are lightly styled, tart and fleshy, with a puckering finish.
Name: Guardian 2016 Angel Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: This is a spirited, funky white made from old vines, the wine aged in neutral oak. High in acidity, it has flavors of white peach and coconut.
Name: Leto 2015 The Hidden One Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Wisps of smoke and dusty mineral introduce this delicately framed Sauvignon Blanc. Tasted in late May of 2017, its still tightly wound and requires some time and aeration upon opening, but its lemony vitality is refreshing.
Name: Bedell 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Crushed earth notes juxtapose ripe lime, tangerine and melon in this refreshing easy-drinking Sauvignon Blanc. Medium bodied with a crisp tonic mouthfeel and brisk acidity, it's an appealing apéritif and summer quaffer.
Name: Wölffer 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Long Island)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Lime and lemongrass aromas lead to a full-bodied but well-balanced impression on the palate. Light but lingering citrus and melon flavors are buoyed by lively acidity.
Name: Shooting Star 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Chilled tangerines and honeysuckle show on the interesting nose of this bottling, along with a pleasant touch of baked apple. The palate offers black lime and kaffir lime leaves, plus a yellow-apple-flesh component in the midpalate.
Name: Bernardus 2016 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Chalky mineral tones persist throughout this brisk light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It's lean in profile with delicate lemon and cantaloupe flavors. The finish is refreshingly citrus.
Name: Raphael 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ebullient aromas of ripe yellow peach, tangerine and melon introduce this Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is a bit more subdued, suggesting zesty lemons and limes. Medium bodied in style, it's invigorating and fresh with a clean brisk finish.
Name: Sannino 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a medium-strength white, richly constructed to show concentrated flavors of vanilla bean, apple and toasted oak.
Name: Amici 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Spring Mountain District)

Description: Part stainless-steel fermented and part barrel-fermented, this wine showcases a happy medium between crispness and body. It has a slight metallic edge, with integrated layers of Meyer lemon, melon and kiwi.
Name: Freemark Abbey 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas on this bottling are inoffensive but a bit flat, with broad nectarine and light orange touches. There is a citrus twist to the palate and a touch of wet cement.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Willow Creek, North Coast, California, US
Description: This herbaceous wine has aromas like snap peas and flavors like fruit cocktail, white pepper and celery. Light to medium in body, it offers good acidity.
Name: Trinity River 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Willow Creek)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Quietly fruity and rather soft-textured, this wine smells lightly herbal and tastes dry. Light honeydew flavors give a little extra interest.
Name: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a beautifully exotic and delicate wine with steely minerality and subdued power. Full of lemony flavor, it complementarily exudes fresh tangerine and grapefruit peel, enwrapping its nuanced fruit with floral highlights.
Name: Rochioli 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This wine is made from parcels on steep slopes and produced as the family's flagship wine. At nearly three years old, it has already mellowed into a richly endowed wine, ripe with green fruits, spice and concentrated acidity. There is so much complexity to this finely structured wine that will allow it to age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2014 Jadis  (Sancerre)

Description: From the oldest vines owned by the producer, this wine is intense and concentrated. Packed with citrus and still-bright herbal flavors it has layers of minerality and perfumed acidity. It still has its freshness which is in the process of changing into a rich maturity. Drink now and until 2024.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2014 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

Description: Elegant and finely structured, this creamy fragrant white opens with heady scents of jasmine, honeysuckle and white stone fruit. The smooth delicious palate delivers green melon, white peach, cantaloupe, grapefruit and orange zest while a saline note lifts the lingering finish.
Name: Villa Russiz 2015 De La Tour Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This vineyard, just behind the Bourgeois winery, has the steepest slope in Sancerre. With a brilliant exposure to the sun it is capable of producing totally ripe rich wines. This example, packed with mango and apricot flavors, is far removed from an herbal character. Instead, it is exotic, ripe and likely to be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 La Côte des Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: This small production wine has a crisp crackly character with great fruitiness, as well as a tight mineral texture from the chalk soil. Its citrus and herbal flavor is balanced with taut acidity. The wine, one of two from this producer reflecting different soil types, is young. Drink from 2019.
Name: Michel Vattan 2015 Cuvée Calcaire  (Sancerre)

Description: This is the top wine from this producer. Produced, as its name indicates, from old vines, it is ripe with mango and pineapple fruits as well as fine streak of tangerine. There is good mineral texture and tight acidity to give this wine its crisp side. Drink this rich wine from 2018.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: This unusual barrel-fermented white is blended with 5% Sauvignon Musqué for an exotic take on the variety. Floral with apple blossom scents, it reveals sharp acidity underlying its robust fig, preserved lemon, wild vanilla and lemongrass flavors. The texture is silky smooth.
Name: Aperture 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: One of two wines reflecting different soil types, this one comes from ground with a good amount of clay as well as chalk. That produces weight, richness and an open character. Created from nearly 50-year-old vines, there is concentration here, as well as great fruitiness. The wine is still young, still bursting with crisp fruit, so wait until 2018 to drink.
Name: Michel Vattan 2015 Cuvée Argile  (Sancerre)

Description: Extremely light in color, this top-shelf Sauvignon Blanc from McGinley and Grassini vineyards is compelling on all fronts. Fresh, lively and suave key lime, sliced nectarine and wet sidewalk aromas mark the nose. The palate is tense and nervy, with a grippy texture and energetic acidity that invigorates its crisp citrus and river stone flavors.
Name: Margerum 2015 D Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Fermented in stainless steel and neutral oak, this light-bodied, well-structured white impresses with pretty citrus blossom scents and tart, high-toned acidity. Pungent with lemon and lime flavor, it develops bolder melon and pear notes as it opens in the glass.
Name: Stewart Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This 40-acre estate in Pessac-Léognan has produced a spicy, wood-aged wine from 100% Sauvignon Blanc. The wine has a tang while also having concentration, a touch of toast and a floral aftertaste. It will age for a few years, and be ready from 2019.
Name: Château d'Alix 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: From vineyards owned by the producer just across the river from its home base in Sancerre, this wine has the rich intensity that is proper to a Pouilly Fumé. It has bold ripe fruits and a toasty edge along with a strong minerality from the flinty soil. Drink this wine from 2018.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2014 La Demoiselle des Bourgeois  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Finding wine from this vineyard site at this price is unheard of and reason enough to jump on this bottling. It also happens to taste great—a combination of melon and preserved lemon flavor, with spicy acidity and a lift of grapefruit peel and wet stone that keeps it exotic.
Name: Sidebar 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Luscious pear, vanilla and stony, preserved lemon flavors permeate the palate of this crisp, light-bodied white. Though delicate and elegant, it has a subtle texture and plenty of length to the wet stone- and lemongrass-inflected finish.
Name: Balletto 2016 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of tomato leaf, exotic fruit and citrus practically jump out of the glass. The bright palate doles out juicy peach, nectarine, grapefruit, celery and sage while a mineral vein lends energy.
Name: Vie di Romans 2015 Piere Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Fermented in a combination of neutral French oak and stainless steel and blended with 2% Sémillon, this lively white sizzles with lemony acidity and a strong streak of grapefruit and lemongrass flavor. With its high acidity and crispness, it has length and zip.
Name: Starmont 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Stony perfume welcomes one into this full, fleshy white adorned with peach and green apple fruit. Succulent on the midpalate, it delivers flavor and body with balance, finishing on a tart, lingering spark of key lime.
Name: Little Giant 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and stony on the nose, this bottling from one of the region's leading properties shows crisp lime and grapefruit pith aromas. The palate is edged with tart yellow grapefruit yet also offers warmer tones of nectarine-like fruit. Refreshing acidity and chalky grip carry deep into the finish.
Name: Grassini 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Daou brothers aren't known for subtlety, so it's no surprise that this Sauvignon Blanc is rich and plush with oak-kissed peach, smoked apple and toasted nut aromas. There's good energy and grip to the palate, with tangy Meyer lemon rind flavor and that powerful oak smoke that's uncommon for Central Coast whites but befits the house style.
Name: Daou 2015 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Creamy in mouthfeel and spicy with acidity, this is a well-heeled, lightly crafted wine with integrated crispness and peach and lemon highlights.
Name: Draxton 2016 Nelson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Savory and bright, this has classic varietal aromas of grapefruit, tropical fruit and an herbaceous note reminiscent of crushed tomato vine. The vibrant palate delivers green melon, kiwi and dried herb alongside tangy acidity and a hint of stony mineral.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Barrel-fermented and aged briefly in 20% new French oak, this wine offers a whiff of barrel reduction before revealing a well-defined profile of lemon and stone fruit. From vineyards in both Dry Creek and Sonoma valleys, it wears its oak well, finishing crisp and salty.
Name: Enkidu 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: The small production of white wine from this estate, owned by the Kressmann family of Latour-Martillac, comes from a deep gravel outcrop. This wine is rich and beautifully ripe. Apricot and juicy pear flavors are backed with the wood aging. It is just ready to drink.
Name: Château Langlet 2014  Graves

Description: High in acidity, restrained and focused on freshness above all else, this wine shines with wet stone, Meyer lemon and grapefruit peel flavors.
Designation: The Family Secret Indian Springs Ranch
Name: Kivelstadt Cellars 2016 The Family Secret Indian Springs Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Grapefruit, crushed tomato vine, exotic fruit and aromatic herb are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant white. The elegant medium-bodied palate delivers green melon, citrus and white peach alongside a vibrant saline note that energizes the finish.
Name: Castelvecchio 2015 Sauvignon (Carso)

Description: Crushed tomato vine, yellow stone fruit and honeydew melon aromas almost jump out of the glass. The ripe medium-bodied palate gives creamy peach and juicy apricot while notes of aromatic herb accent the finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: From three cool-climate sites within the appellation, this is a floral, fruity wine with a zesty underbelly of acidity. Lemongrass, lemon peel and grapefruit flavors are the main event.
Name: Schug 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This succulent, lively wine shows spritzy acidity and tart lemon and floral honeysuckle accents before deeper, richer melon, pineapple and vanilla bean flavors emerge.
Name: Martin Ray 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This creamy and viscous white from one of the valley's cooler appellations is kept fresh and lively by moderate acidity. Its fruit is of the lush peach and nectarine variety, laced with vanilla.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost crystal clear in the glass, this bottling is loaded with passionfruit, lime candy and white flower aromas, proving quite fresh and inviting. The flavors start a tad sour, recalling squeezed lime, but then open into tropical notes like honeydew and passionfruit. A perfect party-starting apéritif, with both style and substance.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a lively and fascinating Sauvignon Blanc for those who love the herbal side of the grape. Dill, basil and bell pepper aromas garnish its baseline of graphite minerality. The palate also rides the pyrazine edge, showing cut grass, lime peel, jalapeño and wet stone flavors.
Name: Stolo 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: From the ripe 2015 vintage, this is a smooth opulent wine. With its citrus and pear fruits, rich acidity and tangy aftertaste, this concentrated wine is balanced and ready to drink.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2015 Les Belles Côtes  (Sancerre)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc has pronounced aromas of lemongrass and caramelized apple. In the mouth it is creamy and balanced, with flavors of vanilla and buttery pie crust.
Name: Edi Simcic 2012 Sauvignon (Goriska Brda)

Description: This opens with aromas of bread crust, citrus zest and a whiff of crushed aromatic herb. Aged on its lees in barriques, the medium-bodied palate offers toasted oak, mature yellow apple, candied lemon drop and a hint of bitter almond.
Name: Vie di Romans 2015 Vieris Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Pale straw-colored in the glass, this wine has aromas of lemon zest and grapefruit. Flavors recall lemon, grapefruit and white peach. It is well balanced and there's a nice zest to the finish.
Name: Purcari 2015 1827 Sauvignon Blanc (Moldova)

Description: This has aromas of toast and exotic fruit that carry over to the palate along with notes of citrus zest, vanilla and roasted coffee bean. A hint of grilled herb marks the close.
Name: Attems 2015 Cicinis Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of crushed tomato vine, grapefruit and a whiff of aromatic herb take center stage. The grapefruit note carries over to the medium-bodied palate along with honeydew melon and a hint of mineral.
Name: Draga 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This wine is hefty and hearty, with a distinct, salty flavor of stony minerals and dried herbs. Melon and stone fruit notes lend additional succulence and lasting richness.
Name: Troika 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of tropical fruit and crushed tomato vine follow through to the refreshing palate along with a grapefruit note. Crisp acidity gives it a bright clean finish.
Name: Pighin 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine from a Loire Valley clone is light in the glass and reductive at first, showing dried grass and sour green apple skin scents on the nose. That grassiness comes through on the palate too, until more rounded stonefruit pops on the midpalate. Prominent acidity carries those flavors into the finish.
Name: Tangent 2015 Clone 530 Paragon Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 3% Sémillon, this is a creamy, luxuriously textured wine with fresh peach and apricot aromas. Rich with an underlying crispness, it finishes on a squeeze of lime.
Name: Merriam 2016 Danielle Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas suggesting white flower, hay and dried aromatic herb. The medium-bodied palate offers juicy yellow peach and a hint of grapefruit while a salty hint of mineral marks the close.
Name: Venica & Venica 2015 Ronco del Cerò Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Packed with fresh flavors of ripe grapefruit, this palate-cleaning Sauvignon Blanc is a nice match for simple dishes such as boneless chicken breast pan-fried in olive oil. Wet stone minerality underscores the vivid acids.
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp lime skin aromas are warmed by Gala apple and wet river stone scents on the nose of this bottling, which blends fruit from warmer eastern vineyards and cooler western ones. It's light in structure and easy to quaff, with searing acidity that carries into the finish. A stony texture frames its honeydew and grapefruit flavors.
Name: Justin 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: Here's a big round white that opens with aromas of tropical fruit, hay and wet stone while the ripe full-bodied palate offers cantaloupe and green melon. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol.
Name: Muzic 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Aromas of eucalyptus, citrus zest, dill and a menthol note emerge on this nine-year-old white. While it's still interesting and surprisingly fresh for its age, with notes of lemon peel, grapefruit and salty mineral, I would have loved to try this in its prime four or five years ago.
Name: Toros 2008 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Briny grassy aromas are barely ripe and smell of match stick. This feels citric and more or less normal for a coastal SB. Pithy flavors of grapefruit skins blend with passion fruit in front of a juicy finish that tastes of white grapefruit and green herbs.
Name: Errazuriz 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This steely, flinty, medium-bodied wine has spent no time in oak, allowing it to express its peach and pineapple fruit with purity and abundance.
Name: Pedroncelli 2016 East Side Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This light-colored, almost clear, SB opens with pungent, fairly sharp aromas of sea brine and sweaty citrus fruits. In the mouth, this is tight, edgy and pointy due to blazing acidity. Citrus, bell pepper and green-herb flavors finish peppery and with scouring acidity.
Name: Undurraga 2016 Sibaris Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Welcoming bubblegum, key lime, grass and cement aromas check many Sauvignon Blanc boxes in this widely available and reliable bottling. The palate leads with decent structure, but then ripeness prevails, with peach and more bubblegum notes.
Name: Slow Press 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: Briny citrus aromas are mild to the point of quiet. This clear-looking SB is in solid shape on the palate. Peppery lightly zesty flavors include a note of sweet green melon, while this tastes a bit like jalapeño peppers on the finish.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2016 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Snappy grapefruit and tangerine aromas are clean and crisp. That also describes the palate on this Maule Valley SB. Fairly intense flavors of lemon-lime and grapefruit cruise across a racy, unbroken finish.
Name: Balduzzi 2016 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This has subdued scents suggesting grapefruit, citrus and a whiff of sun-warmed hay. Round and ripe, the palate offers yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of green melon alongside a note of dried sage.
Name: Colmello di Grotta 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Balanced aromas of green herbs and citrus zest are fresh and vital but not aggressive. A lemony twinge of acidity lends snap to the palate, while this tastes of pithy briny tangerine and other citrus fruits. Flavors of salt, lime and grapefruit share the finish. Drink now.
Name: Undurraga 2016 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio-Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp-edged aromas show classic notes of grass and fresh asparagus. In the mouth, it pulls the fruit forward: there are lightly honeyed flavors of melon and peach with a slightly sugary, short finish.
Name: Catman 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Muted stone fruit and melon flavors mark this vineyard designate, framed by a steely, simple texture and punctuated by bright sparks of orange and lemon peel.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas in this wine are light, with notes of herb, citrus and orange peel. The palate is dry and broad, with tart citrus flavors. Although appealing, it seems a bit generic.
Name: Zero One Vintners 2015 Copper Lily Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: In a ripe Bordeaux year, Sauvignon Blanc goes towards tropical and yellow fruits, making it ripe while also light and crisp. This refreshing, rounded wine is ready to drink.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château les Jouberts Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Grass and apricot scents define the nose of this lively, refreshing wine—a simple study in vanilla and ripely sweetened peach that was fermented entirely in stainless steel tanks.
Name: Simi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Stainless steel-fermented and aged, this cloudy white offers a spritzy acidity and steely texture. Fig, flint, grass and lemon flavors highlight its light-bodied imprint.
Name: Hanna 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Dusty gritty citrus aromas are briny and piercing. This feels honest and solid, but cutting. Grassy flavors blend with lean citrus notes prior to a basic short finish.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2016 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a curious and compelling saline quality to the nose of this widely available, well-priced bottling, reminiscent of a kelp-lined seashore. It's underscored by Anjou pear, underripe orange and flint scents while a faint hay flavor meets warmer nectarine elements on the easygoing palate.
Name: Tangent 2015 Paragon Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: Saline aromas, celery notes and mild citrus scents make up the nose on this slightly round SB. Herbal green-fruit flavors finish with controlled pyrazinic bitterness.
Designation: Araucano Reserva Made With Organic Grapes
Name: François Lurton 2016 Araucano Reserva Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: Taut and with its youthful acidity still up front, this wine has good potential. Its crisp acidity and lively, bright character all promise well. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Dourthe 2016 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Aromas of sweat and sea water are more pyrazine-based than fruity. This is racy and sharp in feel, with briny salty flavors of lemon and green herbs. Throughout, this cutting SB is more salty tasting than fruity.
Name: Calcu 2016 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: In the spirit that Tejo can grow anything on its fertile soil, this wine is a rounded tropical-fruit-flavored Sauvignon Blanc. It has acidity enough as well as a warm smooth character. It is certainly ready to drink.
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezirias Tyto Alba Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: Fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel, this fun, approachable wine is ready for the beach or picnic grounds. Round and easygoing on the palate, it shows tart apple, lime and lemongrass flavors.
Name: Jax 2016 Y3 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Crisp and tightly fruity, this wine is bright and suffused with a lively streak of acidity. It dances with fruitiness and just a touch of spice. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château de Seguin 2016 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is an improvement over recent vintages, but still a bit vegetal on the nose, with aromas of canned beans or peas blending with citrus notes. A slightly oily mouthfeel frames briny citrus and tarragon flavors.
Name: Polkura 2016 Aylin Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Slightly oily, gritty aromas display some but not a lot of citrus essence. This is a tightly wound SB with briny lime and tart kiwi flavors. A fresh snappy finish tastes of high-acid citrus fruits.
Name: Viña Maipo 2016 Vitral Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Description: This wine is light straw-colored, with aromas of lemon blossom, lemongrass and freshly cut lawn. Flavors of peach, passion fruit and melon finish with a touch of residual sweetness.
Name: Jidvei 2015 Nec Plus Ultra Demisec Sauvignon Blanc (Jidvei)

Description: Briny saltwater aromas dominate a mild mostly fruitless nose. This feels basic and round, with a lemony streak. Mild nectarine flavors don't amount to much, while this is simple and generic on the finish.
Name: Valdivieso 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Flinty and austere in tone, this reserve-tier wine is lemony and tart, with grapefruit flavors heartily enveloped in oak.
Name: Concannon 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: This wine is soft, although with plenty of ripe fruit. It has a touch of spice and light acidity, showing the richness of the white-wine vintage. Drink now.
Name: Château Mémoires 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Vegetal-leaning aromas of beans, peas and squash lead to a round somewhat flabby palate. Green, herbal flavors crowd out mild citrus and melon notes in front of a low-acid soft finish.
Name: Santa Ema 2016 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: The white from baseball players Chris Iannetta and Vernon Wells includes 12% Sauvignon Musqué and was aged six months in oak. The oak shows through in abundance, accenting a lush mouthful of baked pineapple fruit.
Name: Jack 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Briny pithy citrus aromas and a standard-feeling palate tell you this is regular but solidly made. Citrus flavors are largely ripe, while pithy grapefruit notes are found on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Viñedos Marchigüe 2016 Marchile Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Aromas of citrus fruits, green herbs, grass and celery set up a shear lean palate with little body and pointed acidity. Tart lemon-lime flavors are crisp and scouring on the finish.
Name: Indomita 2016 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This stainless steel-fermented wine opens with white flower scents and grassy, herbaceous notes, following up with tart lemon and melon on the palate.
Name: Geyser Peak 2015 River Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This funky, grassy expression of the variety was fermented entirely in stainless steel, is thin on the palate and tastes of exotic passionfruit.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Wheaty white-fruit aromas lack pop and clarity. This feels round and fairly juicy due to its acidity. Lime flavors are tempered by a bready yeasty note and fall off quietly on the finish.
Name: Famiglia Meschini 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Gritty aromas with a matchstick element are low on fruit and driven by pyrazines. This feels round but short on kick. Flat peppery somewhat bitter flavors are low on fruit, while this tastes of white pepper on a lightly bitter finish.
Name: Mayu 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: Lime and orange aromas smell more like a household cleanser than honest fruit. A chunky palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of yeast and white bread more than fruit. Bitterness on the finish transitions to yeasty as this fades.
Name: Cuyen 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: A green nose lacks fruit and instead smells oily and like matches. An O.K. palate feel is helpful, while flavors that hint at passion fruit but are essentially vegetal aren't a plus. On the finish, asparagus and canned bean flavors rise up.
Name: Viña Chocalan 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Melony aromas are soft and candied. On the palate, this is watery and doesn't offer much sizzle. Pithy citrus flavors are typical of Chilean SB, however this is flat on the finish.
Name: Gran Verano 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Mac Watson honors the memory of a wine once made by his mother in this tremendously delicious, balanced and complex botrytised white. Dark gold in color, it layers toasted hazelnut, pear compote and orange peel flavors, reveling in the succulence of its 122 g/L of residual sugar.
Name: Macauley 2014 Special Selected Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly cut quince, guava, lemongrass and key lime aromas combine with a stony quality on the nose of this vibrant, zesty wine. Its acidity is almost effervescent, infusing the palate with boundless energy, while its chalky grip carries sharp green apple notes alongside warmer touches of pineapple and guava. Those vivid flavors linger for a full minute.
Name: Brander 2015 au Naturel Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Description: From the producer's estate vineyard on Mount Veeder, this 100% varietal vineyard designate is oaky, viscous and intensely flavored with green apple, melon and peach. Delicious honeysuckle and grapefruit peel aromas make it all the more compelling, balancing its voluptuous weight and ripeness.
Name: Darioush 2014 Sage Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Envoy is Spy Valley's top range of bottlings. In this case, it's a single-vineyard wine that's fermented and matured in oak for 11 months. It's medium-bodied and silky in texture, with distinctive fumé notes, hints of struck match, and layers of passion fruit and grapefruit flavors. Dry, austere and long on the finish, it's a compelling example of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Spy Valley 2014 Envoy Johnson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Not the easiest vintage in Marlborough, this wine stands out as a notable achievement. It's aromas are slightly feral, adding a funky edge to scents of smoke and grilled white nectarines. The silky texture stands out, as does the long, citrusy finish outlined by hints of pencil shavings.
Name: Greywacke 2014 Wild Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tropical pineapple and guava flavors are restrained and balanced in this bright, soft and seductively smooth vineyard designate. Its high-toned acidity delivers stone and lemon peel characteristics, finding more citrus-tinged focus on the finish.
Name: Judge Palmer 2015 Ellis Alden Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pinot Noir specialist Bryan Babcock explores this aromatic white grape, delivering a lush and creamy expression. Poached pear and orange blossom notes combine with a nutty quality on the nose, while the wine's creamy consistency meets buoyant acidity on the palate. Lush apple, pear and cashews flavors complete the picture.
Name: Babcock 2015 Simpatico Sauvignon Blanc (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This elegantly structured wine is a wonderful expression of Sauvignon's serious side, offering delicate yellow stone fruit, wildflower and toasted nut scents. On the polished, full-bodied palate, a hint of nectarine backs up creamy yellow peach fruit while fresh acidity lends balance.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: A classic expression of Hawke's Bay Sauvignon Blanc, this is a ripe, open-knit wine tinged with barrel influence. Vanilla and tangerine mingle with hints of smoke, lingering elegantly on the long finish.
Name: Te Mata 2014 Cape Crest Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Veteran Kevin Judd has turned out another fine effort. Passion fruit and pea tendril aromas impart a welcome green edge that's never overwhelming, picking up layers of white grapefruit on the plump, medium-bodied palate. The finish is intense, long and citrusy.
Name: Greywacke 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of hay, tomato vine and tropical fruit take center stage in this expressive white, accented with a whiff of wet stone. The savory palate doles out juicy grapefruit, green melon, yellow peach and mineral flavors, with tangy acidity.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Yellow stone fruit, crushed herb and tomato vine aromas leap from the glass. The creamy palate boasts lively elegance, offering ripe peach, juicy grapefruit, chopped mint and stony mineral flavors before finishing on a tangy note.
Name: Venica & Venica 2015 Ronco delle Mele Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This is a bit fuller and more textural than many Marlborough Sauvignons, which gives it an extra dimension. The aromas show just enough grassy punch to make them pop, while smooth grapefruit flavors build in intensity on the long finish.
Name: Spy Valley 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Nutty and slightly reduced on the nose, this wine shines in tart acidity and fleshy texture. Lemon peel, pineapple and mango notes give it a wealth of fresh fruit flavor, a lilt of lemongrass providing a touch of spice.
Name: Ziata 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Description: Elderflower, grapefruit, dried herb and tomato vine scents lead the way in this linear, medium-bodied white. The bright, savory palate offers honeydew melon, kiwi and juicy citrus flavors, with fresh acidity that leaves a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovers of this grape may rejoice that at least a few Oregon wineries have committed to making it in the pure, vivid, racy style that the state is known for. Juicy and fruit-loaded, with white melon, pineapple and citrus flavors, this is a sappy, persistent and thoroughly delicious wine.
Name: King Estate 2015 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: A whiff of wet stone joins varietal aromas of cut grass, tomato vine and tropical fruit in this round, fragrant white. The fresh, full-flavored palate offers pineapple, juicy grapefruit and honeydew melon notes cut with citrus. Tangy acidity adds brightness while an energizing mineral note lifts the finish.
Name: Kössler 2015 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While there was some bottle variation between two samples, this elegant Sauvignon Blanc highlights the variety's more mineral, smoky expressions. Despite six years of cellar aging, there's still plenty of crisp cutting lemon and green-apple flavors augmented by spine-tingling acidity and a long chalky finish.
Name: Shaw 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Structured and alluring, this opens with yellow stone fruit, tomato vine and chopped herb aromas. The enveloping palate doles out juicy yellow peach, grapefruit and savory thyme notes while tangy acidity lends balance.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2012 Riserva Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Bold and pungent, defined by passion fruit and green onion, this is a medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc that packs a fruit-driven punch. White grapefruit fills in the gaps, finishing long and intense.
Name: Vavasour 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Admirably concentrated and complex, this is a medium- to full-bodied wine. Passion fruit and snap pea notes combine with citrus zest on the nose, palate and long, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Neudorf 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh and lemony, this medium- to full-bodied wine starts out crisp and citrus-driven, growing a rounder and more substantial with each sip. The vibrant flavors and zingy acidity keep it lively through the finish.
Name: Boeger 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Description: Mild notes of tomato leaf accent this wine's refreshing white-grapefruit aromas and flavors. It's medium in body and dry, finishing long and elegant. Drink now.
Name: Box O'Birds 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This highly aromatic Sauvignon Blanc dishes out loads of pretty white peach and yellow cherry flavors backed by a bristling streak of acidity. It's a vibrant yet satisfyingly full-bodied wine with a pristine grapefruit finish. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Damiani 2015 Little Lotus Flower Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This compelling white has alluring ripe yellow stone fruit, hay and spring flower aromas. Round and bright, the savory palate doles out succulent grapefruit, yellow peach and dried herb flavors while a mineral touch closes the finish.
Name: Masut da Rive 2015 Rive Alte Sauvignon (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: A considerable step up in quality from the basic Yealands Sauvignon Blanc, this offering boasts attractive aromas of white grapefruit and pea tendrils. There's a silky texture and green, grassy elements on the palate, but they never stray too far into vegetal, finishing zesty and clean.
Name: Yealands 2016 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of hay, tomato vine and honeydew melon lift out of the glass. The structured, polished palate doles out exotic fruit, peach, and graphite notes while tangy acidity keeps it balanced.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This is on the green side, but not overdone, offering grassy, herbal aromas and a touch of citrus fruit. Attractive cut grass and lime notes mark the medium-bodied palate and extend through the finish. Drink now.
Name: Rubus 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

Description: Bright, round and delicious, this has exotic fruit, white flower and cantaloupe aromas that follow through to the lively palate, along with honeydew melon fruit. It has noteworthy freshness for the vintage.
Name: Jermann 2015 Sauvignon (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine bursts with grapefruit aromas and continues with vivid lemon, lime and herb flavors on the palate. It smells dry and tart, but tastes more rich and layered, its tangy citrus character persisting well into the finish.
Name: Vigilance 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Hills)

Description: This medium-bodied wine comes across as a bit plump in the mouth, delivering plenty of pineapple, white grapefruit and nectarine flavors that firm up nicely on the dry, lingering finish.
Name: Greyrock 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A concentrated, medium-bodied wine, this is a fine example of Marlborough and the variety. Hints of passion fruit lend regional typicity, while the core of the wine is built around white grapefruit flavors that finish long and mouthwatering.
Name: Kim Crawford 2016 Small Parcels Spitfire Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is zippy and refreshing, offering aromas of struck flint, pea shoots and grapefruit. For its abv, it's light on the palate, dancing with vibrant grass and citrus flavors and crisp acids.
Name: Palliser Estate 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: For an entry level wine, this is impressive, offering hints of grapefruit pith, bergamot and smoke on the nose and following those up with some meaty-mushroomy notes on the palate. It's not typical, but boasts a silky texture and a unqieu combination of citrus and umami that lingers nicely on the finish.
Name: Spy Valley 2015 Satellite Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A consistent standard-bearer for the variety as expressed in Marlborough, the 2016 Private Bin boasts ample red currant and pink grapefruit aromas and flavors, perked up by a touch of leafiness. It's medium-bodied and perhaps a bit rounder and softer in the mouth than some, but finishes dry and stony.
Name: Villa Maria 2016 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While brawny in alcohol and body, vivacious grapefruit and white-peach flavors add levity to this dry neatly balanced white wine. It's richly textured but finishes elegantly and lean.
Name: Hosmer 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Passion fruit and green onion aromas give a zesty impression even before tasting. On the palate, there's more passion fruit, underscored by underripe pineapple, a long, citrusy finish and a dry, slightly chalky texture.
Name: Nautilus 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Ripe yet restrained on the nose, offering fig and guava. On the palate, those flavors turn citrusy, picking up a hint of bitter pith on the finish.
Name: Nobilo 2016 Icon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Shy when first opened, this wine reveals grapefruit and pineapple scents with a little air. The medium-bodied palate has a tangy quality, offering juicy peach and citrus flavors, accompanied by fresh acidity.
Name: Villa Russiz 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: A sizable 70,000 cases of this bargain were imported, so it should be reasonably available. The citrus fruit does have a greenish tinge to it, boasting hints of passion fruit, snap pea and green onion, but they're within the bounds of regional typicity, and bring a crisp, tart edge to the finish. Drink now.
Name: Kono 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a new grape for the Riboli family's brand, and they've managed to present it with enticing and rounded nectarine and melon aromas. There is a grippy texture to the palate, which serves as a good foil for its tropical ripeness. A solid first effort.
Name: San Simeon 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A stony, wet cement-like aromas meets Anjou lime and jasmine touches on the nose of this bottling from a winery recently acquired by O'Neill Vintners. The palate leads with a dollop of acidity and slowly releases lemongrass, Asian pear and ripe nectarine flavors, cut with a tense streak of lime.
Name: Robert Hall 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: A relatively new entrant to the American market, the 2016 from Glover Family offers subdued aromas of melon rind and fig, while the flavors most resemble white grapefruit. It's an easy-drinking wine with a crisp, tangy finish that just needs more complexity to reach the next level.
Name: Glover Family 2016 Zephyr Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The Dubard family has produced a fine and ripe wine. Perfumed and with tropical fruit flavors it is a rich wine, packed with fruit and also finely textured. It has weight, yellow fruits and fine acidity. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Château Laulerie 2015 Comtesse de Ségur  (Montravel)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Rich texture and generous fruit flavors make this wine feel full bodied and mouth-filling. The aromas suggest lemon peel and lime juice, while the flavors veer more towards honeydew melon. All that fresh fruit lingers on the finish.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2016 High Elevation Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A chalky, mineral aroma leads to lively green apple and dried herb flavors. This wine is light-bodied and subdued but has enjoyable, savory flavors to complement its moderate fruitiness and an easy elegance that separates it from the pack.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Yolo County)

Description: More exuberant than past vintages, this opens with tropical fruit aromas and a whiff of tomato vine. The generous palate doles out ripe honeydew melon, passion fruit and pink grapefruit flavors with fresh acidity. A candied nectarine note closes the finish.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2015 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This medium-bodied, silky-textured wine lacks some of the positive green notes typical of Marlborough, but makes up for it with ample stone fruit, gooseberry and red currant aromas and flavors.
Name: Lawson's Dry Hills 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Attractive hints of celery leaf add complexity to this wine's melon and citrus flavors. It's medium bodied, with a long, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Seifried 2016 Old Coach Road Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: I continue to be impressed by how well even entry-level 2015 Sauvignons are developing. This one is understated and grapefruity, with hints of pea shoots and a silky feel. Drink now.
Name: Tiki Sound 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh key lime aromas meet sweeter tangerine and floral scents on the nose of this single vineyard bottling. The acidity is punchy on the palate, with tangy green fruit flavors that recall Anjou pear and lime skins.
Name: Brander 2015 La Presa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Restrained compared to the winery's other bottlings, this single vineyard Sauvignon Blanc offers dried yellow apple, lime and orange rind aromas. There's plenty of acidity on the palate, but it presents itself subtly, with wet cement-like mineral tension.
Name: Brander 2015 Mesa Verde Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and crisp on the nose, this lively and laser-sharp wine shows grapefruit skin and pith, Gala apple and cut grass scents on the nose. That grassy element grows more prevalent on the sip, accenting tarter lime peel flavors.
Name: Coquelicot 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady exotic fruit, tomato vine and chopped herb aromas jump out of the glass. On the generous, savory palate, tangy acidity balances white peach, honeydew melon and juicy grapefruit flavors.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2016 Sauvignon (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: More austere and stony than many Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs, this is a light-bodied wine built around hints of pineapple and guava. It's a pleasant, well-priced change of pace from overly fruity and herbal versions.
Name: Sileni 2016 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Ample citrus and nettle notes give this wine an earthy aspect. The light, dry palate shimmers with tart grapefruit and lime notes. The finish is refreshing and fruity.
Name: Erich & Walter Polz 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Passion fruit and pea shoots mingle easily on the nose of this medium-bodied wine. This is a fully dry and somewhat austere Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, ending on notes of white grapefruit and hints of underripe stone fruit.
Name: Esk Valley 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The dominant fruit notes here are white nectarine and grapefruit. It's light to medium in body, distinguished a faint, chalky note on the finish, which adds textural interest.
Name: Huia 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: this medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc shows only a bit of grassiness. Rather than green, it offers predominantly pineapple, grapefruit and even a touch of stone fruit, finishing with a citrusy flourish.
Name: Tussock Jumper 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)

Description: A solid two years after the vintage, this shows the concentration of 2015. Fig, melon and nectarine notes mingle easily on the nose and palate, where a touch of creaminess adds an extra dimension.
Name: Giesen 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tropical fruit, aromatic herb and tomato vine scents jump out of the glass. The palate is focused, albeit a bit lean, offering green melon and white grapefruit flavors, with crisp acidity.
Name: Schiopetto 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Tight and linear on the palate, this is evolving very well for a $12 wine. Struck flint is prominent on the nose, adding a touch of Old World character, while the flavors feature cut grass and citrus. It's light bodied, but remarkably intense on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Stoneburn 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Grapefruit, exotic fruit and tomato vine scents lead the nose of this wine while its linear, medium-bodied palate shows honeydew melon and succulent citrus notes. Fresh acidity gives it a clean, bright finish.
Name: Lis Neris 2015 Picol Sauvignon (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: Blended with 5% Sémillon, this crisp, tropical white is generous with bright acidity and a strong taste of pineapple and lemon. Zippy minerality adds a stoniness to the texture and flavor, as a fresh-cut grass note lingers in the background.
Name: Merryvale 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Doug Margerum delivers his annual crowd-pleaser with this bottling, which evokes ripe apple, sweet stone fruit and grapefruit pith on the nose. Chalky texture and racy acidity mark the palate, providing the perfect framework for sour kumquat flavors and a cement-like minerality.
Name: Margerum 2015 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Green and invigorating peppery tones accent this lemony Sauvignon Blanc. It's not a deeply complex penetrating wine but is vivaciously fresh through the finish.
Name: Billsboro 2015 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a ripe style of Sauvignon Blanc with a warm soft character. The lightest hints of a herbal flavor are filled out with apple and white peach. Clean and with great fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Another impressive bargain-priced 2015 Sauvignon Blanc. Consumers looking for summer 2017 refreshment should grab some of this for its crisp flavors of pineapple, passion fruit and grapefruit. Drink now.
Name: Ponga 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's a hint of passion fruit, but no more than that; white grapefruit aromas and flavors dominate. This is light in body, with a crystalline edge to the palate, giving it a combination of delicacy and austerity that's appealing on its own.
Name: Forrest 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This opens with subdued oak, dried tropical fruit and bell pepper aromas. On the medium-bodied palate, a confected hint of coconut accents grapefruit and mature peach flavors.
Name: Primosic 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Hay, tomato vine and grilled herb aromas follow through to the linear, structured palate, along with a citrusy note of grapefruit and a hint of white stone fruit. Fresh acidity lends a clean finish.
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This appetizing wine has attention-getting grapefruit and fresh-cut herb aromas, vivid and crisp fruit flavors, light body and a lingering, citrusy finish.
Name: Mirassou 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Drawn from the cooler Awatere Valley subregion, this is pungent and green. Leafy notes and hints of green tomato accent passion fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine that finishes crisp and refreshing.
Name: Tohu 2016 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine's nose is restrained and carries just a faint hint of peach and nettle. The slender, juicy palate is all about zesty, lithe citrus and herbal spice. Very refreshing and light.
Name: Zantho 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Delicate varietal aromas including elderflower, grapefruit and tomato vine follow over to the bright, linear palate. A hint of graphite lends interest to the crisp finish.
Name: La Rajade 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Tomato leaf features on the nose and palate of this wine, a characteristic of the Awatere Valley (a subregion of Marlborough). Gooseberries provide a fruity base to this medium-bodied wine, but fade quickly on the finish.
Name: Eradus 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
