Description: With a strange pink color and powdery nondescript aromas, this is shapeless and lacking in structure. Weak bitter flavors are completely fruitless; overall this seems to be going nowhere good.
Name: Echeverria 2016 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: From the beautiful, historic site planted to some of the oldest vines of the variety in Northern California, this delicious white explodes in juicy green apple and an intensity of fresh-squeezed lemon. That succulence lingers atop a lengthy, salty texture wrapped in subtle, supportive oak.
Designation: To Kalon Vineyard Estate Grown Reserve
Name: Robert Mondavi 2014 To Kalon Vineyard Estate Grown Reserve Fumé Blanc (Oakville)

Description: A mineral-driven white, this is waxy and lemony on the palate. Light bodied, crisp and vibrant, it doesn't hold back on complexity, weaving a lengthy story of perfumed near-perfection.
Name: Galerie 2015 Equitem Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

Description: This complex white comes from cuttings procured in 2004 from one of the oldest surviving vineyards of this variety, thought to have originated in the Loire Valley, then replanted by the producer onto older rootstock. Lemony acidity meets light, bright floral intrigue around hints of peach, grapefruit and lime, remaining velvety smooth and balanced.
Name: Michael Mondavi Family Estate 2014 Animo Heritage Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Napa County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grapes are meticulously sourced from a range of sites, including Sonoma Mountain and Knights Valley on the Sonoma side, and Spottswoode estate, Hyde and Ink Grade from Napa. Opening with the aromas of grassy knoll, it develops in the glass to show juicy, fresh acidity and well-defined flavors of apricot and wet stone. Young and bright, the acidity is tenacious and supportive, making way for a final lilt of creaminess on the finish.
Name: Spottswoode 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County-Napa County)

Description: This wine showcases the producer's historical devotion and prowess with the variety, leaving a light-bodied impression of floral honeysuckle, wet stone and succulent peach. Fleshy and creamy, it works on every level, and offers value at the same time.
Name: Kenwood 2015 Six Ridges Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is full of lovely aromas and flavors, but something unique about its grippy texture makes it soar. It begins with fresh, mineral-laced scents of Asian pear, yellow-grapefruit pith, crisp yellow apple and chalk. Then comes a palate full of yellow apple skins, lemon wedge and the slightest hint of grass, all served atop energetic, mouthwatering acidity.
Name: Gainey 2014 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This gentle, complex white offers lovingly crafted waves of tropical lychee and golden-apple minerality, with bites of wet stone, gravel and lemon. Balanced in acidity and a lightness of being, it's meant for the table or kitchen, to sip happily while making a meal.
Name: Galerie 2015 Naissance Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral oak, this wine opens with a heady aroma of lemon cookie covered in powdered sugar, as a spicier element of lemongrass rears its head. Bright in acidity and focused, this textured white also shows highlights of grapefruit and dried herb.
Name: Belden Barns 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: Dark golden-hay in color, this white was fermented mostly in 900-gallon French oak foudres, with the remainder fermented in smaller French oak barrels. Nutty lime and gooseberry provide intrigue and saltiness against bright acidity, making for a complex and compelling impression on the palate.
Name: Grgich Hills 2014 Dry Sauvignon Blanc Estate Grown Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: With its vinicultural eye on New Zealand, this full-bodied and rich wine offers a mouth-filling mix of citrus and tropical fruits. It's lush and forward, dense with fruit and highlighted with lemon verbena. The overall effect is like sipping on a vinous lemon-drop cocktail. Quite delicious!
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart in lemon peel and tangerine, this lively white also offers a magnitude of stony minerality that manifests as a gravelly complexion on the texture. Honeysuckle figures prominently on the nose.
Name: Calstar Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This white is blended with 20% Pinot Gris, making for an unusual, interestingly crisp and delightful wine. Stony minerality defines it more than fruitiness, which leans more into savory stone fruit and hazelnut. It offers length and breadth in a medium-sized body.
Name: Armida 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: A woody, toasted note speaks to well-integrated yet present oak in this white that maintains medium-bodied texture on the palate. Bright, lemony acidity complements the creaminess, dashing in wet stone and undeniable floral notes of apple and orange blossom.
Name: Hall 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fermented in stainless steel, this is a pretty wine, with a darker tint of pinkish-orange color. Tangy peach and lime provide a crisp, clear and light-bodied experience atop persistent acidity and texture.
Name: American Thread 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Dark yellow-hay in color, this is a waxy, sumptuous and full-bodied white, not for everyone in its touch of barrel reduction and whiff of petrol that saves itself by releasing subtle waves of melon on the palate.
Name: VGS Chateau Potelle 2015 Eau de Tony Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from top sites Boushey (60%) and Red Willow, the aromas are light, with notes of straw, lemon pith and grapefruit. The flavors show an elegant styling, framed by a tart zing of acidity that stretches out the finish. It's all about nuance.
Name: Avennia 2015 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sweet-leaning aromas of apple, nectarine and mandarin orange are cut by a wet-cement aroma on the nose of this bottling. It's light and easy in style on the palate, with lime rind and chalk flavors. It's altogether quite mellow but very refreshing and quaffable.
Name: Foxen 7200 2015 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Light and bright, this wine is grassy, with intermingling layers of kumquat, lime zest and a restrained touch of oak, fully realized in its purpose of refreshment. It has all the makings of a wonderful starter-course pairing, particularly if shellfish is involved.
Name: Franciscan 2015 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Knowing only time in stainless steel, this light, clear white is zingy in grapefruit, wet stone and melon, its texture and body crisp and focused. The price for this quality is hard to beat.
Name: Jax 2015 Y3 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine impresses in its mix of stone fruit, melon and tangy passionfruit, its texture soft and velvety, marked by moderate acidity. It's a complex, lengthy white that's easy to get lost in, with or without food.
Name: Grey Stack 2015 Rosemary's Block Dry Stack Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Nevada County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The floral aromas and tangy grapefruit flavors of this medium-bodied wine are wonderfully vivid. It tastes nicely concentrated, becomes riper with each sip, and has a lingering finish.
Name: Sierra Starr 2015 Solstice Sauvignon Blanc (Nevada County)

Appellation: Solano County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is made in a fumé style and tastes as if it's been oak aged, making it feel rich and rounded on the palate. It gives generous flavors that are riper than usual, plus a lingering vanilla and almond finish.
Name: Galvan 2015 Russo Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Solano County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Quite dry, crisp and lean, this wine is a great palate refresher that will pair well with raw oysters or goat cheese. It has bright citrus flavors, light body and a tangy finish.
Name: Dancing Crow 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This wine is grassy in aroma, lively and crisp in texture and tastes almost like fresh-sliced Pippin apples. It is fresh and well balanced, perfect for appetizers and seafood.
Name: Tom Gore 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which includes 20% Sémillon, offers aromas of cut grass, sliced Anjou pear and a lemon-lime freshness on the nose. Sour Granny Smith apple and green lime rinds rule the palate, making for a solid and classic style of Sauv Blanc.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2015 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Hailing from Sunset Vineyard in the Ancient Lakes appellation, this wine starts out aromatically quiet, with notes of green apple, toasted Grape-Nuts and herb. The palate is sleek and lightly creamy, lingering on the finish.
Name: Substance 2014 Super Substance Sb Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a relatively cool site for the variety, this white shows an abundance of green olive and Meyer lemon. Moderate body and acidity allow for a touch of lemongrass spiciness and black licorice amid the textured mouthfeel and length.
Name: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: A stainless-steel fermented white, with 4% Sémillon, this bright wine shows vibrant acidity and a lively streak of lemon peel and lemongrass. It offers a taste of summer no matter the season.
Name: Honig 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Stony lemon and a twist or two of grass dot zesty acidity in this clean, crisp and focused white, sure to be a pleasurable quaffer.
Name: Frei Brothers 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a fleshy, voluptuous white, offering smooth, creamy texture around well-defined characteristics of melon, honeysuckle and peach.
Name: Markham 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Light herb and green-onion aromas lead to crisp lemon and green-apple flavors. The body is light and the texture softly tangy.
Name: Proud Pour 2014 The Oyster Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: This tangy, light-bodied wine wakes up the nose with a vivid herb and citrus aroma, and livens up the palate with fresh lemon and green-apple flavors. The texture melts slightly around the edges to keep it smooth on the finish.
Name: Bota Box 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This wine is relatively full bodied and ripe tasting, while also backed up by enough acidity to keep it refreshing. It tastes like crisp green apples with a hint of fresh herbs.
Name: Boatique 2014 Musque Sauvignon Blanc

Description: Round, chunky aromas of grapefruit and passion fruit settle on friendly and varietally correct. This is snappy and solid in feel, with lime, orange and nectarine flavors. An acid-driven finish holds the line and doesn't taste bitter or green.
Name: Emina 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: Citrus and stone-fruit aromas are mostly fresh and round. This shows a grape-skin-based mouthfeel and oily grapefruit flavors that turn dry and lightly pickled and briny on the finish.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: Ripe enough to taste almost sweet, this wine drips with honeydew-melon flavors and has a smooth, unusually rich texture.
Name: AVA Grace Vineyards 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has tart acidity that jumps from the glass, a taste of wet stone and lemon zest that's persistent through the midpalate. Along the way, a hint of grass, gooseberry and peach fuzz ride the waves of textured crispness.
Name: Fritz 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Spunky passion fruit and citric aromas are far from dull. This feels racy due to strong citric acidity. Lime and passion fruit flavors follow the nose, while this is quick and simple on the finish.
Name: Naia 2015 S-Naia Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: One of the more pungent and herbaceous examples of its type, this dry wine smells like green onions and chives and tastes like lemon and lemongrass. It's best for adventurous drinkers.
Name: Marilyn 2015 Sauvignon Blonde Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of herb, grass, pear and citrus lead to sleek fruit flavors. It shows a lot of elegance but lacks concentration.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2015 Fume Blanc Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of tropical fruit, apple, melon and spice lead to lightly styled fruit flavors. The concentration doesn't seem to be all there.
Name: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine smells mildly herbaceous and tastes sufficiently ripe and round to make it attractive to sip.
Name: Loft 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This wine also includes 3% Sémillon, the whole fermented half in oak and half in stainless steel. Simple in its layers of vanilla and fleshy white peach, it shows a wealth of oak and tannin.
Name: Greyscale 2014 Cuvée Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This aromatic herbal Sauvignon is crisp while also showing the ripe fruit of the vintage. It is full of citrus and melon fruits, tangy acidity and a bright, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: A. de Luze et Fils 2015 Fleur de Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Although this smells a bit oily, gritty and pyrazinic—an indication that it's living on borrowed time—at the moment this SB is still in fairly good shape. Pithy grapefruit flavors finish plump and citrusy. Drink immediately.
Name: Bodegas Cerrosol 2015 Monte Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Light in color, sketchy on the nose and dilute on the palate, all of which means this has discernible issues. Bland flavors suggest grape skins, while this is flat, wheaty and yeasty tasting on the finish.
Name: Trencalòs 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: The match for the red wine under the same name, this wine comes from organically grown vines in the village of Champtin. It is rich, full of white currant as well as crisp apple. The tight texture and intense minerality mark it out as a wine to age, while its elegance underlines its fine future. Drink from 2018.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2014 Sauvage  (Sancerre)

Description: A blend of wines from different vineyards in Pouilly, this powerful wine is concentrated, with tight minerality that demands further aging. Rich and packed with apples and green plums, it is a beautiful wine that will age well. Drink from 2018 at the earliest.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2014 Indigène  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This displays a particularly rich style of Sancerre, full bodied and opulent. It has the purest white and citrus fruits, with plenty of crisp acidity. But it is the intensity of the wine and its generosity that marks it. The wine is young and could age—although why wait when it is so good now?
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2014 La Côte  (Sancerre)

Description: Oak aging and no filtration give this beautiful wine richness and dense texture. A touch of spicy toast contrasts with the melon and grapefruit flavors, smoothly ripe texture and nutmeg aftertaste. The wine is concentrated and full in the mouth. This opulent wine is still young, so wait until late 2017 to drink.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2014 Sancerre d'Antan Terroir de Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: One of Jolivet's single-vineyard wines, this comes from a south-facing parcel in the heartland of Sancerre. It is a classic fruity wine, but is developing an opulent character that brings in spice as well as wonderfully ripe flavors. The wine is very drinkable now, although still young and with a great future. Drink ideally from 2018.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2014 Le Grand Chemarin  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine comes from a single vineyard, planted on flint soil. It has a definite steely character that has been softened by the year in bottle. That gives a pure wine shot through with citrus and apples, showing power and concentration from the intense fruit. Drink the wine now.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2014 Le Roc  (Sancerre)

Description: This property excels in some vintages,and the 2015 is a huge success. It's certainly complex, effortlessly combining hints of pungency with soothing notes of grapefruit. In the mouth, it's fairly full and creamy in texture, then punctuates that richness with a long, vibrant finish.
Name: Clos Henri 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Thick, unctuous and impressive, this is one seriously sweet Sauvignon Blanc. Honey and bergamot notes mark the nose, while the palate features more citrus and folds in hints of pineapple as well. Long and sticky on the finish.
Name: Giesen 2013 The Brothers Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a voluptuously honeyed wine, a celebration of baked pear and apricot that's also floral and svelte. It takes a measured approach to layering in texture and body, interweaving the slight sweetness as it develops in the glass.
Name: Cobden Wini 2013 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fournier's top Sancerre wine is released with just that extra bit of maturity, giving it extra depth and richness, and turning the initial fruitiness into something more serious. At three years old, the wine is ripe, still with plenty of fruit while also developing a smoky, flinty character. Drink now.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2013 Grande Cuvée  (Sancerre)

Description: A strong effort, this medium-bodied wine combines hints of nettle leaf with bold fruit flavors of nectarine, pineapple and grapefruit. There's creamy texture and ample concentration on the midpalate, followed by a long, silky finish.
Importer: Vinovia Wine Group/ Marisco Vineyards USA
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2015 The King's Favour Waihopai Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The oak is quite apparent on this bottling, and that's the point. Red apple, ripe pear, pomelo pith and sweetgrass meet with a touch of honey on the nose. The palate shows the oak more prominently, with light honey butter, sweet almond and vanilla, yet fresh, grassy notes shine through on the finish.
Name: Grassini 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Jolivet has crossed the Loire from his home in Sancerre to produce this full-bodied wine that comes from clay and chalk soil. It is textured with acidity and minerality, while the white fruit of this young wine is forward and juicy. The wine, like so many from Pouilly, needs to age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2015 Terres Blanches  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and inviting on the nose, this bottling shows sweet white flowers, Asian pear, yellow-grapefruit rind and lemon blossoms on the nose. Acidity explodes onto the palate, where a grassy, grapefruit-pith-driven tension rides into a rounded midpalate full of pear, nectarine and honeydew flavors.
Name: Grassini 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This version of Sauvignon Blanc retaqins its varietal character, yet in a sweet, unctuous expression. Passion fruit and grapefruit aromas and flavors are intense and concentrated into a tropical-citrus compote, ending in a long, tooth-achingly sweet finish.
Designation: The Ned Late Harvest Waihopai River
Importer: Vinovia Wine Group/ Marisco Vineyards USA
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2015 The Ned Late Harvest Waihopai River Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Produced from 60-year-old vines, with some new wood aging, this complex, ripe wine has an intense structure, with layers of vanilla and spice. The crisp nature of Sauvignon Blanc adds brightness to the ripe roundness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2014 Le Grand Roc  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a top value, offering unusually rich palate weight and texture in a wine this inexpensive. Ripe stone-fruit flavors finish long, picking up hints of fresh herbs and leesy richness. Drink through the end of 2017.
Name: Ant Moore 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine comes from an 8.6-acre parcel of old vines above Jolivet's home village of Bué. It is mineral and tight, with concentration and intensity. The herbal character on this very young wine will soften into the fine fruitiness that is there. It needs to age a bit more, so drink from 2017.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2015 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Description: Round and ample in the mouth, this medium-full-bodied wine combines green notes of cut grass and snap pea with ripe stone fruit, then ends crisp and grapefruity. It's a fine example of Marlborough Sauvignon that's widely available and well priced.
Name: Villa Maria 2015 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Produced in the typical flinty (silex) soil of parts of Sancerre, this wine has a crisp steely texture that is balanced by the ripe yellow fruit. The combination is both taut and ripe, giving good balance and tension. Drink this wine from 2017 to allow it to develop further.
Name: Domaine Girard 2015 Philippe Girard Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: Grown on flinty soil, this strongly mineral-driven wine is structured, tense with acidity and white stone-fruit flavors. The initial crispness opens out into a concentrated, textured wine that will need to age further. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2014 Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: Unlike Marisco's 2015 The Ned Late Harvest, this is a botrytis-affected wine, featuring a darker color and more complex flavors. The aromas suggest Earl Grey tea and honey; the flavors resemble caramel-drizzled orange segments. A slightly bitter citrus-pith note marks the finish, providing balance.
Designation: A Sticky End Late Harvest Waihopai
Importer: Vinovia Wine Group/ Marisco Vineyards USA
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2014 A Sticky End Late Harvest Waihopai Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: With lees aging, this wine has gained richness, balancing crisp acidity with ripe flavors. Aromatic and with a flinty texture and citrus flavors, the wine is concentrated. The finish shows more of the herbal Sauvignon character.
Name: Domaine Girard 2015 Philippe Girard  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine shows how well Sancerre can age. While the initial herbal fruitiness has calmed down, the citrus and green fruit is still vibrant and crisp. The fruit has been joined by a touch of spice, pepper and a hint of toast from the partial wood aging. Drink this wine now.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: With an average age of 45 years, the Chevreau family's vines bestow intensity and richness. This is a generous wine, the green fruits lifted by good acidity and a taut mineral texture that comes from the chalk in the soil. This wine is young but very ready to drink.
Name: Château de Crézancy 2015  Sancerre

Description: The small village of Saint-Andelain is at the heart of Sauvignon Blanc in Pouilly Fumé. This wine is ripe with melon and peach flavors cut with intense acidity. It is well textured, full bodied and should be held until well into 2017.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 En Travertin  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This affordably priced wine has a full, generous mouthfeel and harmoniously blends stone fruit, citrus and grassiness. The finish is smooth and silky in texture. Drink now.
Name: Chasing Venus 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Aromas of freshly mowed grass, lemon pith, and lemon grass open for mineral-driven flavors of Bartlett pear, lemon juice and green apple in the midpalate.
Name: Giocato 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Primorska)

Description: From vines between 20 and 40 years old, this is a ripe, intense wine with great acidity. A good mineral texture enhances the white fruits, apricots and pineapple. The aftertaste is crisp and tight. Keep until 2017 for the wine to be at its best.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh green apple, lemon and gooseberry notes abound in this gorgeously fruity and juicy Sauvignon Blanc. It's surprisingly bold on the palate: full bodied and supple yet balanced. Flavors of ripe white grapefruit and quince are concentrated yet brisk. A hint of musky spray marks the finish. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Kontokosta 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Steely in stony minerality, this lovely offering was blended with 18% Sémillon and whole-cluster pressed for an ultimate mouthfeel of juicy fruit. High-toned lemon and pear offset the intense acidity, combining richness and ripeness with brightness.
Name: Groth 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: The strong herbal edge to this wine has more to do with its youth. Behind that lies rich apples and ripe pears cut deliciously with acidity. The wine is full and will benefit from more aging, so drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2015 Terroir Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: Like so many wines from the Pouilly Fumé appellation, this wine is very young at this stage. It shows pepper and only the beginnings of what will be intense white fruits, good acidity and rich texture. Drink from 2018.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh citrus, apple and white-blossom notes are balanced neatly against layers of dusty mineral and earth in this nuanced Sauvignon Blanc. It's crisp and concentrated, rippling with tart pineapple and grapefruit flavors. On the palate, its silken texture expands and flows lavishly. It's a lovely wine already with a lingering lime-pith finish, but should hold well through at least 2022.
Name: Macari 2014 Lifeforce Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Dark gold-copper in color, this older bottling imparts rich notes of hazelnut, graham cracker and Christmas cake, making for a decadent experience that pleases and doesn't overdo it on residual sugar. A petrol, diesel-like reductive note adds complexity and a touch of the floral.
Name: Work 2009 Late Work Botrytised Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Description: Snappy, chiseled and defined by fresh grass and citrus aromas on the nose, this is textbook Casablanca SB. Flavors of tarragon, sage, lime and citrus peel finish with a lasting wave of mild pyrazinic bitterness and tangy citrus.
Designation: Single Vineyard Block No. 10 Loma Roja
Name: Cono Sur 2015 Single Vineyard Block No. 10 Loma Roja Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: If this lacks the exotic richness and drama of the very best Marlborough Sauvignons, it's still a tasty drop. Fig and melon notes suggest ample ripeness, while hints of leafy greens provide hallmark varietal character, finishing crisp and clean. In golf terms, it's straight and true, down the middle of the fairway.
Name: Astrolabe 2015 Province Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine comes from the producer's home turf in Pouilly. Ripe and round, it shows good potential. Acidity and white fruits are balanced with a touch of minerality. The wine is ready to drink with its warm character and crisp final acidity.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2014 La Moynerie  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Produced from a 3.7-acre vineyard, this immediately attractive wine has pure fruitiness, crisp acidity and just a touch of minerality from the chalk soil. The lime and grapefruit acidity cuts through easily at the end.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2014 Clos du Roy  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Refreshing on the nose, this clonal study shows lively and tropical aromas of Asian pear, guava, Meyer-lemon skin and that characteristic grassy note. It's racy on the palate, where green-apple rinds meet with lime skins, cement and crushed white rocks.
Name: Buttonwood 2015 Musqué Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Description: From one of the oldest estates in Pouilly Fumé, this is an herbal and freshly grassy wine. Delicious apple is textured with minerality, salty character and intense, still-young acidity. It's ready to drink although it will be better from 2017.
Name: Château de Tracy 2014  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: This young, fruity herbal wine also has a smooth, ripe character from the warm vintage. That means it is developing fast to drink young, while the texture indicates that it can age, at least until 2022.
Name: Le Roi des Pierres 2015  Sancerre

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For an affordable, ready-to-drink bottling, this twist-top wine, which gets a touch of Sémillon, shows ripe nectarine, Pink Lady apple, lime water and grapefruit pith on the nose. The palate offers baking soda and lemon-lime flavors, along with tart apple skins and grassy notes.
Name: Buttonwood 2015 Signature Blend Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Pretty straightforward Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, but done well, featuring passion fruit, pink grapefruit and melon aromas and flavors that end on a gently herbal note.
Name: Framingham 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Light in color but loaded with pungent lemon-lime, ocean brine and lettuce aromas, this cleansing spritzy SB offers tangy lime, lettuce and gooseberry flavors. A dry peppery finish with acidic cut provides for a fresh ending.
Name: Garces Silva 2016 Boya Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Fresh and herbal, this young, textured wine shows green fruits and crisp acidity right up front, making it immediately attractive. Drink it now for this fruit or wait until later in 2017 for it to soften.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2015 Les Tuilières  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Delicate and pretty hints of lemongrass, light cement and lime rinds show on the nose of this bottling. There is a distinct racy quality to the sip, where grassy flavors meet with strong lime and tart pear skins, all hinged to a very grippy texture.
Name: Bernardus 2015 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Floral notes of elderflower, dried daisy and lemon blossom precede flavors of passion fruit and gooseberry in this medium-bodied wine. The finish is long with pleasant crisp acidity.
Name: Budureasca 2015 Origini Reserve Sauvignon (Dealu Mare)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A richer-than-usual version, this wine has citrus and light herbs in the aroma, and ripe melon and apple in the flavors. It's both mouthfilling and lively, for the best of both worlds.
Name: Guenoc 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bigger, bolder swathes of fresh grapefruit, gooseberry and citrus distinguish the Katherine's Field from it's sister bottling, the Life Force. Fermented in stainless steel, it's a more primary, forward expression of fruit but with an equally refreshing backbone of acidity. Hints of dusty oyster shell and lime pith lend nuance to the finish. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Macari 2015 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A fresh, grassy aroma and lively grapefruit and herb flavors give a lot of zest to this medium-bodied and almost peppery wine.
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 2015 Diamond Collection Yellow Label Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is subtle but substantial, emphasizing supple texture and lively balance more than overt fruit flavors. It has a light Anjou pear aroma and conveys moderately tangy apple on the palate.
Name: Pennyroyal Farm 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An attractive floral, appley aroma and generous, ripe apple and herb flavors give this medium-bodied wine plenty of personality.
Name: Castle Rock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark golden-hay in color, this contains 45 g/L residual sugar and presents a lushness of baked pear, mango and honey that displays the richer gifts of the variety. With concentrated flavor and viscosity, it allows for enough acidity to provide a brightness to the finish.
Name: Merriam 2014 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This wine shows a lot of spice and pepper as well as the more usual herbal fruitiness. The ripeness of the grapes gives a wine that is plush, full in the mouth and ready to drink.
Name: Les Vignerons des Coteaux Romanais 2014 La Dilecta Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Stony aromas suggest crushed vitamin and lime. This is not thin but not really full either. Crisp flavors of green apple and citrus come with notes of bell pepper, while the finish is mildly green and briny tasting.
Name: Cono Sur 2016 Organic Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: The small appellation of Quincy lies southwest of Sancerre in the Cher Valley (a tributary of the Loire). From light sand and gravel soil, the wine is attractively herbal, crisp with lemon juice and perfumed acidity. It is young, although refreshingly ready to drink.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Haute Victoire  (Quincy)

Description: Fruity while also lightly peppery, this is Fournier's entry-level Sancerre. It is juicy and crisp, delicious with lemon and gooseberry fruit. Still young, the wine will be better from 2017 as its budding fruitiness softens.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of herb, citrus and mineral are followed by tart, racy citrus flavors. It provides a lot of appeal.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Boushey Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Crisp snap-pea and cucumber aromas are lightly citric. This feels fresh, tangy and citric, with plenty of acidic cut. Lime, pea and bell pepper flavors are about as true to Chilean SB as it gets.
Name: Cono Sur 2015 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This initially soft, fruity wine shows its crisp side only gradually. As it opens, it reveals pure citrus fruits that are ripe, shot through with acidity and very ready to drink.
Name: François Millet 2015  Sancerre

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Musk melons, limes and lemons perfume this crisp, cutting Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is refreshingly citrusy, offering brisk grapefruit flavor accented by swathes of green leaf and herb. Full bodied yet spry, it's a neatly balanced wine to enjoy now through 2019.
Name: One Woman 2015 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Green-apple skins and grapefruit rinds introduce the nose of this wine, followed by a bit of tropical papaya and melon. The palate show more apple skin and tangy lime as well as a tight minerality.
Name: Buttonwood 2015 Zingy Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light with notes of herb, citrus and tropical fruit. The palate is a bit more generous, showing pleasing herb and tropical fruit notes accented by tart acidity.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Sharp pointy aromas of citrus and green herbs are edgy. This feels minerally and citric, with no excess weight. Flavors of tangerine, lemon and passion fruit are pickled and briny, while this retains a salty slightly green character on the finish.
Name: Montes 2016 Spring Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Pure fruitiness holds the balance of this wine between crisp acidity and a tightly mineral texture. It comes from the producer's Bué vineyards, one of the top villages of Sancerre. The wine is crisp, made to be drunk young and fruity.
Name: François Millet 2015 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)

Description: This is delicately herbal, with green notes similar to snow peas gracing nectarine and grapefruit flavors. A bit of pineapple creeps in on the abbreviated finish.
Name: Giesen 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Deliciously light and herbal, this smooth, creamy wine is bright, poised with black-currant fruits and ripe gooseberry flavors. Drink this wine young, for its great fruit.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Côtes de Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: Citrusy aromas suggest white grapefruit. Plump but balanced in feel, this tastes a bit salty and briny, maybe a reflection of its partial coastal grapes, something that's new to Argentina. The briny tangy finish is interesting.
Name: Trapiche 2016 Costa & Pampa Sauvignon Blanc (Buenos Aires)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Pristine grapefruit and gooseberry notes are offset by persistent layers of smoke, dusty mineral and earth in this Sauvignon Blanc. Full bodied on the palate yet vibrantly citrusy, it finishes brisk yet clean. Drink now through 2019.
Name: One Woman 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Crisp yet slightly tart in the mouth, this wine exhibits pleasant flavors of Granny Smith apple, lemon custard, and fresh white peach.
Name: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Description: Sharp, briny aromas of citrus and bell pepper teeter on vegetal. This is racy, pointed and minerally, with tangy, pyrazine-heavy flavors of lemon, white pepper and bell pepper. A snappy, piercing finish is lean and scouring.
Name: Santa Rita 2015 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This is an immediately attractive, fruity wine. With its crisply herbal texture, white-currant fruits and touch of pepper, it is a balanced, young wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Collegiale des Domaines de Loire 2015 Domaine Desloges Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine kicks off with awesome aromatics of jasmine flowers, white beach, green tea and Rainier cherry. The palate is clean and crisp with ripe honeydew melon, Gala apple and Anjou pear flavors that are pleasant but simple.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: This instantly delicious, fruity wine has crisp lemon and spice flavors along with generous acidity. Ready to drink, it's all bright fruit with a lively aftertaste.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2015 Domaine la Gemière French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Description: A note of grass blends with tropical aromas centered on passion fruit. Tangy, tight and citric, this offers flavors of green apple, tangerine, lemon and passion fruit. A light streak of green works its way onto the finish.
Name: TerraNoble 2016 Reserva Terroir El Algarrobo Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Despite its Vin de France description, the fruit for this wine does come from the Loire Valley. It has just the right cool character along with lively acidity and a perfumed, white-flower character. Drink now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of herb, kiwi and pink grapefruit are light and subtle. The tart flavors show more generosity, though the concentration doesn't quite seem all there.
Name: Jones of Washington 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

Description: This is a ripe, plump style of Sauvignon Blanc, delivering ripe fig and melon aromas and flavors. It's not the crispest version you'll ever find, but makes up for that in its generosity of flavor. Drink now.
Name: Mussel Bay 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: In a ripe, tropical style of Sauvignon Blanc, this full wine conveys white peach and pineapple, rounded and fruity. The aftertaste has an attractive tang and zest of acidity. Drink now.
Name: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Ripe aromas of peach, nectarine and yellow pear meet with a hint of flint on the nose of this exuberant, well-priced and appealing bottling. Stone-fruit flavors show on the palate, with apple, pear and ripe lemon touches cut by dried grass. It's easy to quaff on a warm day.
Name: Morgan 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Both refreshing and nicely fruity, this wine blends bright apple and lemon flavors on a tangy texture that softens a bit on the finish.
Name: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Blend Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: A ripe while herbal wine, this is crisp and full of grapefruit and gooseberry fruits. Tangy with lively acidity, it is aromatic with white flowers and has a fresh, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Sauvion 2015 Loire Valley  (Sancerre)

Description: This crisp, clean, lightly herbal wine has apple and grapefruit flavors that come through intense acidity. Bright with ripe fruit, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Rémy-Pannier 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This Elqui SB smells about as neutral as you'll come across, with a hint of burnt grass to the nose. Oily and dense in feel, this tastes of salt and bitter dried melon.
Name: Mayu 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Appellation: Guenoc Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine is firmly in the herbal-vegetal camp. It smells like yellow tomatoes and tastes like tarragon and parsley, with a full body and soft acidity. It finishes slightly sweet.
Name: Langtry 2014 Lillie Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Guenoc Valley)

Description: Ripe while also herbal, this is a well-balanced wine. It has good acidity, gooseberry and white currant fruit and a soft, open texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaine des Elephants 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Bright and fruity, this is a crisp, herbal wine. From the Bougrier family estate it is perfumed, creamy and offers refreshing acidity, citrus and hints of apricots. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Bougrier 2015 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reticent aromas of kiwi and herb are followed by tart, medium bodied citrus flavors. The concentration isn't as dense as it could be.
Name: 14 Hands 2015 The Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This rare intrusion of Sauvignon Blanc into Burgundy is in the small northern vineyard of Saint-Bris, close to Chablis. This wine is fruity with a herbal character that is balanced by the crisp citrus and melon flavors. Drink the wine now.
Name: Bailly-Lapierre 2015  Saint-Bris

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Barely-there whiffs of mango, guava and orange blossom lend a breathless delicacy to this light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It's not deeply concentrated or persistent, but invigorating and quaffable. The finish is brisk and palate cleansing.
Name: Fulkerson 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Trapiche has never bottled much Sauvignon Blanc, but this one is true to its name: Pure. Easy citrus aromas are mild and clean. This feels medium in body, with a touch of weight. Orange and other dry citrus flavors are steady across the finish.
Name: Trapiche 2016 Pure Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite light herb and citrus aromas are followed by elegantly styled citrus and tropical flavors. It needs more oomph to bring it together, coming off as a bit generic.
Name: Columbia Crest 2015 H3 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of herb, kiwi and citrus are quite light. The tropical flavors are elegant and spritely, tingling the palate with a light effervescence.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc lacks the depth and concetration of top examples, but remains a tasy glass of crushed tomato leaf and white grapefruit. Gentle greens and modest citrus flavors end clean and refreshing.
Name: The Loop 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Green herbal aromas suggest an untamed field. This is snappy and tangy but dilute, thus there's a watery element to salty citrus and bell-pepper flavors that are maintained on the finish.
Name: Aresti 2016 Special Release Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: The wine comes from the only appellation in Burgundy to grow Sauvignon Blanc, located not far from Chablis. This is classic herbal Sauvignon that is light and fruity with tangerine and citrus flavors and a tropical fruit hint. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Gueguen 2015  Saint-Bris

Description: Dusty stone-fruit and white-flower aromas are mature, while the palate is linear and citric. Dry salty flavors of pineapple and tangerine finish with notes of mustard, lemon and brine.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2015 Dedicación Personal Sauvignon Blanc

Description: A bland pickled nose announces a simple palate with just enough acidity to keep things upright. Mild flavors of orange and green herbs revert to pickled on the finish.
Name: Root:1 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: From vines on the slopes of the Cher River this softly herbal wine has attractive gooseberry and lime flavors. Its young fruitiness is light, bright and ready to drink.
Name: Paul Buisse 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Murky apricot and citrus aromas are lightly pickled. This feels plump despite being cut by malic acidity. Flavors of honey and sweet melon are followed by latent bitterness in front of a finish that tastes mostly of residual sugar.
Name: Echeverria 2015 Late Harvest Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Inspired by Sancerre, but with grapes from other parts of the Loire, this soft, herbal and green-fruit flavored wine is refreshing and lightly textured. Drink now.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of melon, pear and herb lead to tart dry fruit flavors. The concentration comes off as quite light.
Name: Airfield Estates 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This has an oily gritty nose and a palate with lemony acidity. Flavors of lemon and green currant fall off and turn a touch bitter on the finish, something you could probably predict given the gritty start.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2016 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Description: Light aromas of pineapple and other tropical fruit are accented by herb, floral and citrus flavors. The concentration is very light.
Name: Washington Hills 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of herb, citrus and melon rind are light. The palate drinks dry, with the concentration seeming a bit lacking.
Name: Waterbrook 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Punchy prickly citrus aromas are clearly that of Sauvignon Blanc. Light in color and weight, this tastes of tangy citrus with a shot of black and green pepper. Lime is the key flavor noted on a clean but mild finish.
Name: Salentein 2016 Portillo Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: This attractive, herbal wine has intense fruitiness but misses any sense of place. It has appealing white currant and grapefruit flavors and a tight finish of acidity. Drink now.
Name: Rémy-Pannier 2015  Sancerre

Description: A perfumed wine in a square bottle, this is just off dry, with crispness and an herbal, green-fruit character. The wine is peppery, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Bougrier 2015 Pure Loire Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This soft, creamy wine is fruity, with attractive herbal and gooseberry flavors. It is light, crisp and ready to be drunk.
Name: Bougrier 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This is as soft as possible, a gentle view of Sauvignon Blanc. It's an easy, fruity wine that has just a hint of minerality and more of aromatic citrus fruits. Drink now.
Name: Lacheteau 2015  Pouilly-Fumé

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of pear and herb seem a bit overripe. The flavors are dry and seem a bit diluted.
Name: Lagana 2014 Sagemoor Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Herbaceous in aroma, dry and lean on the palate, this wine offers refreshment more than flavor. Light bodied, it has a tangy texture.
Name: 100 Percent Wine 2014 All Profits to Charity Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Cidery apple aromas, a medium-bodied citrusy palate and tart flavors of tangerine end with citrus aftertones. This is about as basic as drinkable Sauvignon Blanc gets.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2015 Alma Mora Sauvignon Blanc (San Juan)

Description: Cidery apple aromas, a medium-bodied citrusy palate and tart flavors of tangerine end with citrus aftertones. This is about as basic as drinkable Sauvignon Blanc gets.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2015 Alma Mora Sauvignon Blanc (San Juan)

Description: A basic, light, veggie-flavored wine, this smells like celery and onion and tastes like zucchini.
Name: Nica 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This is a highly satisfying estate-driven white, impressively crafted in spicy acidity and complex layers of grapefruit. Pithy in its citrus components, it goes on and on, never ceasing to unleash subtle hits of wet stone and a tiny taste of the sea.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This impressive bottling is brightly substantial and tensely textured, lively in acidity and yet brimming with complexity. Stony lemon and peach ride a fruitful wave of flavor and find balance between sweet ripeness and memorable crispness.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)

Description: This light, bright and remarkably floral white from the Musqué clone impresses in its balance and lingering mouthfeel. Subtle flavors of nectarine and peach invite one in and become more pronounced in the glass over time, providing refreshment and elegance.
Name: Amici 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fermented in 80% stainless steel and 20% barrel, this at first shows a touch of barrel reduction on the nose that dissipates into richly layered stone fruit and fresh lime. Lingering minerality provides freshness and perspective.
Name: Tin Barn 2015 Hi Vista Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Carneros)

Description: This white is barrel fermented and then aged further sur lie in a mix of French oak, stainless steel and concrete egg, with the goal of additional texture and complexity coming into play. It does, the wine intoxicating in floral apple blossom and honeysuckle, with a taste of crisp, refreshing lemon and grapefruit. Light bodied, it doesn't hold back on mouthfeel, offering richness without overripeness.
Name: Lancaster 2014 Samantha's Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Named for the proprietor's daughter, Taylor's is stainless-steel fermented and meant to exude juicy waves of pear, apple and lemon, a fully immersive expression of fruit and minerality. Well balanced, it shows a tease of peach fuzz and the crispness of never having met a swath of oak.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 Taylor's Vineyard Musque Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Citrus and herb aromas and crisp, inviting flavors make this medium-bodied wine hard to resist. Nicely dry, well balanced and lively with acidity, it has a lingering finish.
Name: Vigilance 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A light color, vivid citrus and thyme aromas, and crisp gooseberry flavors make this wine very refreshing. Light bodied, dry and well balanced, it will be very versatile with food.
Name: Bella Grace 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Crisp green-apple flavors and a touch of lime make this dry and medium-bodied wine taste clean and vibrant. It's not big or showy, but nice, tight and beautifully balanced.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This small-production, light and bright white wine is worth seeking out and succumbing to, lovely in green apple, peach, almond and apricot. It was fermented in neutral-oak barrels, the oak adding just enough body to what is otherwise a balanced and restrained wine encased in minerality.
Name: MacLaren 2015 Lee's Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy grapefruit and gooseberry flavors make this new wine from Jackson Family Estates lively, fresh and palate-cleansing. It has medium body, good concentration and bracing acidity.
Name: Liberated 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: As this a tropical fruit expression of the grape, Sauvignon Blanc, though aged in oak, works well here. The other reason is that the wood is subtle—just a hint— leaving plenty of room for the fine pineapple fruit and final acidity. Drink from 2017.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Barrel Selection Branco Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An inviting style of Sauv Blanc compared to green-grassy options, this bottling shows rounded red apple and ambrosia melon on the ripe nose. Nectarine, green papaya and full green-apple candy flavors meet with honeysuckle on the palate that is cut by a fine line of acidity that keeps it all dry and balanced.
Name: Joullian 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Carmel Valley)

Description: This is a pretty white wine, light and easy to love, with medium-bodied weight and mouthfeel. Highlights include apricot, vanilla and a touch of grass, with no one element overpowering the other. It's a highly quaffable experience.
Name: Picket Fence 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Fresh and crisp, this light-bodied wine has fragrant pine, floral and citrus aromas, vivid lemon-lime flavors and a nice, tight balance that wakes up the taste buds.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2015 High Elevation Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Green-apple and white-peach flavors mingle with a lively, thirst-quenching texture in this charming, medium-bodied wine.
Name: City Winery Chicago 2015 Morgan Station Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Refreshing and aromatic, this wine is 15% Tocai Friulano and has some good depth. Aromas like lemon and light herbs lead to deeper flavors that have a light buttery element as well as ripe apple and more crisp lemon on the finish.
Name: Graziano 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Crushed oregano, rosemary oil and yard clippings show on the nose of this pyrazine-popping bottling. Flavors of cut grass and jalapeño on the palate grow complex thanks to a green orange-peel element.
Name: Wrath 2015 Ex Anima Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lightly peppery, herbal aromas and honeydew-melon flavors give personality to this soft, soothing and almost sweet wine.
Name: Andis 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A crisp light yellow in the glass, this is a well-priced wine for warmer days. Light grassy tones mix with faint peach on the nose, while the palate is dissected by strong acidity, offering rounded peach, a touch of green pepper and a cement-like minerality.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: Textured and medium bodied, this wine has a simplicity of citrus and peachy stone fruit buoyed by bright acidity. Fermented entirely in stainless steel, it was aged in concrete, stainless steel and French oak. It displays the concentration of the vintage.
Name: Flora Springs 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fermented in both stainless steel and a mixture of French and American barrels, then blended with 7% Sémillon, this wine impresses in grassy pea shoots and ripe peach. Tingling acidity provides stylistic freshness and a pleasant texture.
Name: Matanzas Creek 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: While this is 100% varietal and entirely fermented in stainless steel, it opens with a vibrant note of green apple. That apple quality gives way on the palate to light grassy peach and nectarine, finishing crisp and clean.
Name: Charles Krug 2015 Limited Release Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: Grapefruit aromas and crisp apple flavors energize this light-bodied and appealing wine. It has a lively, tangy feel on the palate and good fruit concentration.
Name: Josh Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A powerful sense of green powers this wine, starting on the nose with sharp grassy tones of rosemary, chives and pine needles. The palate is also extremely grassy, though balanced by a tart pluot character.
Name: Chesebro 2015 Cedar Lane Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Given time to settle in both used French oak and stainless steel, this is a nice effort from a well-respected vineyard that's big and juicy in grapefruit and melon. Made in a lighter style, it offers a bite of oak on the finish, leaving a substantial impression.
Name: Apsara 2015 Kick Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine features noticeable nuttiness—part almond, part hazelnut—before allowing tart citrus and underripe peach to pronounce themselves. A robust wine, it has plenty to say in terms of a lush yet balanced mouthfeel and texture.
Name: Uptick Vineyards 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine is richer and rounder than many of its intentionally crisp peers. It shows a little butter and vanilla in the aroma, wrapping a smooth texture around ripe apple and nutmeg flavors.
Name: Mirror 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a fuller-bodied style of the variety, rich and moderate in acidity, with a fleshiness on the palate. It sings in tropical kumquat and pineapple alongside a succulence of melon.
Name: Black Stallion 2015 Limited Release Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a perfumed wine, soft while also ripe, with great pear flavor protected with night harvesting. It is still young and with its richness, it will be much better from 2017.
Name: Château les Bertrands 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The great Ritchie Vineyard, a renowned site for Chardonnay, also possesses highly sought-after Sauvignon Blanc. Here, it shows as grassy in pea shoots and thick, with a voluptuous texture and body weight.
Name: Carica 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This herbal, lightly earthy wine coveys aromas like thyme and parsley, but takes several minutes to open up. Flavors are subtle and citrusy and the texture smooth, with medium body.
Name: Chacewater 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This is a voluptuously layered, slightly green wine, more fruity than subtle, with highlights of melon, stone fruit and vanilla wafer. Easy to enjoy and nicely priced, it's a perfect picnic choice.
Name: Angeline 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Neutral-oak barrels figured into the making of this full-bodied, richly styled wine, tart and floral in aromas while thick in leathery texture. Lemon, lime and grapefruit frame a larger notion of fresh-cut grass and hay.
Name: Malk 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh fruitiness makes this an appealing medium-bodied wine. It has aromas like cucumber and white pepper and flavors like a mixed fruit salad. The texture is on the soft, almost sweet side.
Name: Helwig 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Light and tangy citrus aromas lead to softer, riper fruit flavors like apple and pear in this medium-bodied wine.
Name: Brutocao 2015 Feliz Vineyard Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this white is grassy and pea-like. A simple thickness on the palate is offset somewhat by a tang of grapefruit.
Name: Charles Krug 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Exotic wafts of almond and lemongrass make way for an intensity of lemon pith and grapefruit in this wholly satisfying, well-crafted and refreshingly complex white, a sure sign that this variety can thrive in the appellation.
Name: Rochioli 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Tropical fruit with an herbal edge lead the nose and palate of this refined Sauvignon Blanc. Lemon and pineapple flavors are carried by a brisk minerality and chalky finish. Delicious with grilled fish or vegetables.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Atalanti Valley)

Description: A strong whiff of oak opens this wine before blowing off to reveal complementary aromas and flavors of mango, peach and melon accented by fresh-cut grass and honeysuckle. Mostly stainless-steel fermented, with just 10% of the wine given time in barrel, it remains crisp and clean, with just the right amount of texture and body.
Name: Rodney Strong 2015 Estate Vineyards Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc (Northern Sonoma)

Description: One of Chile's go-to producers of Sauvignon Blanc has bottled a winner. This deals classic aromas of citrus, nettle and sea brine. The palate is slightly oily and creamy, but lively with acidity. Flavors of persimmon, melon and ocean brine finish slightly salty, with a fresh-meets-oily feel.
Name: Kingston Family 2015 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Aged entirely in stainless steel, this slightly tropical, very pretty wine is inviting on the nose and palate. Pure, crisp and focused, it shows softly crafted layers of lemon and vanilla that provide a lushness on the finish.
Name: Priest Ranch 2014 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine opens in grass and grapefruit pith, crisply inviting one in. Lemon zest complements the refreshing juiciness while the finish has a bit of a bite, giving an edgy complexity.
Name: Heitz 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This single-parcel wine is rich and with layers of wood aging in the flavor, giving a spicy slightly toasty character. Behind that, there is a more herbal green-fruit character that is crisp with acidity and with a tangy, zesty aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2014 Anthologia Parcelle No A299 Sauvignon Blanc (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Spicy and fresh aromas lead this elegant but accessible white from Florina. Tropical fruit flavors are round and layered but the wine has a good spice and mineral mix. A great wine for the table?lots of food-pairing options here.
Name: Alpha Estate 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Florina)

Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this well-made white has lively acidity and a linear approach to flavor, focusing clearly on orange, apple and melon around a full-bodied palate. Pear and lime appear on the finish.
Name: Mersenne 2015 Dalla Gasperina Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: The wine that started it all for the producer, first bottled in 1972, this was 100% stainless-steel fermented and drips in fruity citrus. Lemon pith continues the theme, accented by notes of pineapple salsa and crisp green apple, remaining vibrant and fresh throughout.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Briny, lightly green citrus aromas are round and pungent. A juicy, crisp mouthfeel is formed by citric acidity, while flavors of stony lime and green apple finish crisp and in fine form.
Name: Viña Leyda 2015 Single Vineyard Garuma Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This is cool-coast Chilean SB from front to back. Vegetal-leaning aromas of asparagus, cactus and lime are what the Paredones microzone has become known for. This tastes slightly pickled and intense, with coastal green-fruit notes leading the finish. High acidity ensure that this is super racy.
Name: Casas del Toqui 2015 Coastal Mist Terroir Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cream, vanilla, baking spice, key lime pie and tropical fruit aromas lead to a rich, flavorful palate, redolent with pineapple and kiwi flavors that hang on the clean crisp finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This wine is partially barrel fermented and blended with a small amount of Sémillon. Herb, citrus and passion fruit aromas are followed by flavorful yet sleek tropical fruit notes that linger on the finish. It brings a whole lot of appeal.
Name: Seven Hills 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This SB hails from Huasco, Chile's great northern frontier. It offers aromas of celery, white pepper and cool citrus. The mouthfeel is linear, maybe a touch monotone, while the palate and finish are made up of salty, briny citrus flavors and cutting acidity.
Name: Ventisquero 2015 Kalfu Sumpai Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Description: Briny citrus aromas stick out on an otherwise wan nose. This feels full and plump for coastal Chilean SB, something Koyle owner/winemaker Cristóbal Undurraga says he's shooting for. Flavors of lemon, passion fruit and grapefruit finish long, briny and salty.
Name: Koyle 2015 Costa Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Costa)

Description: One of the major growers in Leyda also makes classic cool-coast SB. This is briny and tight on the nose, with a hint of asparagus. A lean, juicy palate is tight as nails, while this tastes of briny, salty lime and melon. A lean, chalky finish shows strong grip.
Name: Garces Silva 2015 Boya Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Generous herb, citrus and tropical-fruit aromas are followed by a full-bodied palate chock full of kiwi and other broad tropical-fruit flavors. It's unabashed in its appeal.
Name: Sparkman 2015 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This clean, thick, full-bodied expression of the grape balances into elegance as it goes. A splash of 9% Sémillon adds to its charm, the flavors a lush combination of pear and vanilla.
Name: Whitehall Lane 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A tiny bit of effervescence dissipates quickly. Classic aromas recall dried lime peel, wet cement, cut grass, sliced apples and a touch of rosemary oil. The palate holds extreme grassiness along with Anjou-pear peel, pine and thyme, reminiscent of a dewy lawn in springtime.
Name: J. Lohr 2015 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pretty white-flower, lemon and lime notes waft from the glass of this dry light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It's vibrantly fruity, full of fresh pineapple and nectarine flavors accented by a swathe of green herb and bramble. The finish is refreshing, crisp and mineral. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Hosmer 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Cayuga Lake)

Description: The Sauvignon Blanc here creates a wine tasting of ripe pineapples and kiwi fruit. It is rich and full bodied with spice, perfume and attractive acidity. The wine is developing still and will be better starting in 2017.
Designation: Moulin des Dames Parcelle No A296
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2014 Moulin des Dames Parcelle No A296 Sauvignon Blanc (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Pungent and green up front, with a shot of cool-coast pyrazines on the nose, this hits the palate with a lemony blast of citric acid. Flavors of orange and nettle are a touch briny, while a juicy, acidic, peppery finish is racy to the max.
Name: Undurraga 2014 TH Terroir Hunter Lo Abarca Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from Woodinville Wine Cellars. It displays aromas of lemongrass, custard and tropical fruit. The flavors are ripe and full bodied, lingering on the finish.
Name: Ded.Reckoning 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine starts off with some reduction, opening up to show aromas of pineapple and herbs. The palate has generous tropical-fruit flavors, backed by tart acidity.
Name: SuLei 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Slightly floral aromas are yeasty and show a note of vanilla. In the mouth, however, this is tight and lemony. Flavors of lime and green apple are snappy, while this SB from southerly Bío Bío ends with minerality and crispness.
Name: Veranda 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Aromas of nettle and cactus pad are briny and typical of Leyda SB. This is full in body for Sauvignon Blanc, but balanced by needle-like acidity. Flavors follow the nose, meaning nettle, briny citrus and bell pepper. A long finish is sharp but balanced.
Name: Ventisquero 2015 Kalfu Kuda Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Pungent, snappy aromas of nettle and citrus are spunky and lean towards green. A tangy, zesty palate is high-toned and crisp. Flavors of lime, tangerine and green herbs end with cleansing, cool-coast acidity. This is textbook Leyda SB.
Name: Aresti 2015 Trisquel Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: White wines are a rarity from this red-hot appellation. This one offers aromas and flavors of pineapple and other tropical fruit that linger on the finish.
Name: Auclair 2015 Artz Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Clean, reserved citrus and ocean-influenced aromas set up a zesty palate with a common mix of tangerine, lime and green-herb flavors. A lasting finish with peppery snap helps this along.
Name: Espiritu de Chile 2015 Winemaker's Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: With a pinkish hue, this wine has a healthy 21% addition of Sémillon. This contributes thick creaminess to its texture, built around well-defined flavors of vanilla, papaya and pear.
Name: Duckhorn 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Melony fruit aromas with a heavy dose of sulfur and match stick are gritty. This is juicy and bright in feel, with flavors of briny citrus fruits and green melon. A heavily briny and lasting finish closes it out.
Name: Casas del Toqui 2015 Barrel Series Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of lots from the cooler Los Alamos Vineyard and warmer Valley View Vineyard near Solvang, this bottling offers kaffir lime, jasmine and steeliness on the light and easy nose. Crisp lime flavors make for a tangy sip in this simple but quite pleasant wine.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a field blend of eight different clones of this variety. It opens with reserved, slightly reduced aromas of sea shell, mineral and citrus that lead to lighter-styled fruit and mineral flavors.
Name: Savage Grace 2015 Red Willow Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Kiwi, pineapple and herb aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. The concentration isn't quite all there in the middle but it still provides enjoyment.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2015 Linen Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This light-bodied wine smells fresh and tastes refreshing. It has lemon and herb aromas, delicate citrus flavors, good acidity and a lively mouth-feel.
Name: Dark Horse 2014 The Original Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This is a thick, concentrated version of the variety, tropically succulent in mango, papaya and a refreshing twist of lemon.
Name: Peju 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of fresh herbs, kiwi and pineapple are followed by off-dry tropical-fruit flavors that trail toward the finish.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2015 The Expedition Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Pickled, briny aromas of canned vegetables are common for this wine and Casa Marin. On the palate, high acidity sticks out and lends an iron grip to this original coastal SB. A mix of citrus and vegetal flavors include notes of pumpkin and pickled beans.
Name: Casa Marin 2014 Cipreses Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: A fierce nose displays strong notes of pyrazines, making this more love-it-or-leave-it than mainstream. Chunky on the palate, with a bit of flabby weight, it tastes of briny citrus, jalapeño and bell pepper. This is within the norms for Chilean SB, but it might be too green and bitter for some palates.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2015 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Punchy citric aromas come with a note of fresh celery. This is zesty and crisp in the mouth, while orange and celery stalk flavors end with a refreshing, cleansing finish.
Name: Montemar 2015 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Minerally raw aromas brush up against harsh. This is razor sharp, with cutting acidity. Flavors of lemon-lime and tangerine peel lean towards sour due to high acidity. This turns more pickled and briny on the finish.
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2014 Tectonia Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Baked pineapple and mango rise to the fore in this nutty, slightly grassy and herbal wine. It's lightly bodied and creamy in texture.
Name: Decoy 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of saline and paper mill are not the best or most fresh. It is also a touch out of shape and starting to get old. But the wine's briny citrus and melon flavors are solid, while a pickled tasting finish closes it out.
Name: Santa Helena 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Citrusy aromas of lemon rind and lime juice are sharp but welcoming, enhanced by white pepper and Gala apple flesh. Flavors are broad with apples and more lemon rinds, made intriguing with a touch of herbs including fresh-plucked thyme.
Name: Fazeli Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Description: This is a light, focused and cleanly refreshing white, stainless-steel fermented and aged to retain zesty acidity and lingering traces of lemon and lime. It finishes with tartness on the palate.
Name: Mersenne 2015 Chesnut Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Mild aromas of lime, peach and white flowers sit in front of a tight but simple palate. Slightly tart lemon, orange and pineapple flavors finish lean, with freshness but also some scour.
Name: Cousiño-Macul 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Mildly snappy nettle, passion fruit and tangerine aromas are a nice entry to this spunky but basic SB. Lime and tarragon flavors quickly fall off on a light finish.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2015 Olas del Sur Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Light on the nose, then fresh but a bit watery on the palate, this simple SB delivers undefined citrus flavors that lose steam in front of a quiet finish.
Name: Bossy Boots 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This new brand belongs to Santa Ema, and its Leyda SB straddles the line between vegetal and green fruits, with a canned-bean scent rising to the top. Briny citrus and lightly vegetal flavors finish briny and salty.
Name: Aila 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Vegetal notes, mild citrus and sulfuric aromas make up the nose of this fresh but limited SB. Herbal, peppery green-fruit flavors are lean and finish with notes of rosemary and other green herbs.
Name: Ventisquero 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling's slightly dank nose recalls the front lawn being cut on a hot summer day, but a warmer, more inviting peach and nectarine fruit component awaits in the background. The palate is tangy with sharp lime peels and a bit tarry.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2015 Cuvee Jeane Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: A neutral nose announces a fresh but basic palate with briny flavors of citrus, white pepper and bell pepper. A chalky, dry finish is juicy but lacks depth.
Name: Kon Tiki 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
