Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp botanical notes on the nose of this bottling include smoldering pine needles, sharp bergamot plus a stony cement scent. Flavors are also a tad medicinal, with herbal-extract elements prominent.
Name: MCV 2015 ALV Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine shows the tropical side of Sauvignon Blanc with pineapple and nectarine fruit and generous acidity. It does have a crisp mineral character that gives texture to the wine. Drink now.
Name: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: Bland white-fruit aromas are a bit oily and gritty. This has a watery feel and mildly bitter flavors of white grapefruit, the skin included
Name: Finca Patagonia 2015 Expedicion Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light, clean and fresh on the nose, this bottling from a rather extremely sited vineyard on the western end of the appellation shows cut lawn, lemongrass, squeezed lime and wet concrete on the nose. The palate is zesty and sour at first, but a honeydew element warms it up nicely.
Name: Presqu'ile 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Refreshingly marked by a tangy acidity, this white is made to please, fermented entirely in stainless steel. It sings in zesty, medium-bodied layers of peach and lime that are fresh and juicy on the palate, yet it somehow maintains some unexpected complexity.
Name: Roth 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: A consistently great white, this vintage is as impressive as ever, exhibiting steely, rocky minerality around savory, smooth layers marked by light, pretty flavors of key lime and lemon peel.
Name: RouteStock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc from Bulgaria's Thracian Valley has bright aromas of lemon grass, citrus blossom and freshly mowed lawn. It is medium bodied in the mouth, with flavors of freshly cut pineapple, guava and lemon meringue pie. The finish is clean, crisp and fruit filled.
Name: Bulgariana 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A stainless-steel fermented wine, this shows shy elements of grass and herb before delving into fulsome, weighty waves of high-toned melon and peach. Relatively full-bodied in style, it's hearty and welcoming.
Name: Pech Merle 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine from vineyard close to the Atlantic coast is crisp, herbal and already refreshing. It has a touch of spice along with crisp lemon and warmer pear fruits. Tangy and juicy, it has a fresh, almost salty aftertaste. Drink from early 2017.
Name: Cortes de Cima 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

Description: A bouquet of grassy peach greets the nose happily in this fruity, refreshing white, followed by thirst-quenching layers of lime. A pretty wine, it hits all marks in terms of balance and deliciousness.
Name: Long Meadow Ranch 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling packs in all that the grape can be: honeydew melon ripeness, crushed chalk and slate minerality and a grassy edge. The palate shows a citrus rind pithiness, some sea salt and a lime zest freshness. Classic and uncomplicated.
Name: Comartin 2015 Stone Row Zabala Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Lively acidity defined by a taste of lemon peel meets heftier overtones of fresh pear, providing a medium-bodied texture that should work well at the table. The finish highlights the lemony aspects of the wine.
Name: Kristodd 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: In line with the winery style, this is lean and tight on the palate, a bit of a citrus laser blending lime and grapefruit. Try it with raw seafood dishes, like a fluke carpaccio or ceviche.
Name: Shaw and Smith 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: A bit fuller-bodied compared to most Australian Sauvignons, but the lime and herbal-grassy notes remain refreshing on the finish. Melon and fig flavors plump up the midpalate.
Name: Hewitson 2014 Lu Lu Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: This is fairly subtle for a Sauvignon, offering struck flint, fig and melon aromas. In the mouth, it's medium in weight, with hints of pink grapefruit and red currant. The finish is long and silky. Drink now.
Name: Evans & Tate 2015 Fresh As A Daisy Sauvignon Blanc (Australia)

Description: From organically grown grapes from the H4 Vineyard. It was fermented in both stainless steel and mature French oak. Well balanced and smooth in texture, with an underlying richness, it brightens in melon and peach.
Name: Alta 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is “good green,” meaning the aromas and flavors are of limes, cut grass and snow pea pods rather than asparagus or green bean. It's medium in weight, finishing on a citrusy note.
Name: D'Arenberg 2014 The Stump Jump Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Named after the Tyto Alba, the barn owl that lives in the forests around the vineyard, the wine shows a tropical fruit side of Sauvignon Blanc. Mango and pineapple dominate the ripe character of the wine. It is aromatic, just hinting at something more herbal. Drink from 2017.
Designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: Full-bodied and tangy in acidity, this wine is from a hillside site planted with some Sauvignon Musque. Refreshing, it offers a mix of salty green olive with exotic tropical pineapple.
Name: Cosa Obra 2015 Hummingbird Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Medium-straw in color, this wine offers aromas of Asian pear, guava and juniper berry. Featuring flavors of Seckel pear, honeysuckle and anise seed, it is bright on entry, goes through a short cool phase, and then brings the brightness back with a finish that includes lingering notes of white peach.
Name: Dalton 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: Beyond a hint of stuck flint on the nose, this offers clean, varietally correct aromas and flavors of white nectarine, grapefruit and gooseberry. It's nicely balanced in the middle of the spectrum, offering a harmonious mix of stone fruit and citrus.
Name: Beresford 2014 Beacon Hill Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)

Description: Fresh, minerally lime aromas set up a zesty palate with lemon-lime, pineapple and apple flavors. There's nothing complicated about this snappy white, which finishes with some bitterness and lasting acidity.
Name: Doña Paula 2015 Los Cardos Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: While not overly intense in grapefruit, gooseberry and pea-shoot aromas, the palate brings a bit more frivolity into play, with guava, peach and flint. There's some weight behind this wine, which takes it beyond a simple apéritif.
Name: Veritas 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)

Description: Orange in hue, this is a sublime and simultaneously hearty wine, presenting itself as fuller-bodied in style on the palate and expressive of time on oak. The finish features a tanginess of grapefruit.
Name: Highway 12 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Pungent boxwood notes unfold on the nose, while the palate offers hints of tomato and tobacco leaves alongside white grapefruit. This medium-bodied wine finishes bright, marked by fresh greens.
Name: Four Sisters 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Victoria)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a bright but not overdone tropicality to this fresh and inviting wine, which shows lily, Gala apple and pear flesh on the nose and tightens up on gravel and citrus peel. The flavors are broad and easy, with a slight Granny Smith apple sharpness.
Name: Lincourt 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and sliced stonefruit aromas meet with the lightest touch of grass, a slightly reductive tar aroma and a bitter kumquat element on the nose of this wine. The palate is very light with lime peel, Gala apple and nectarine flavors.
Name: Hayes Valley 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: Green beans and snap peas give this Sauvignon Blanc a green cast overall, but there's some citrus and gooseberry fruit as well. It's clean and refreshing on the finish.
Name: Evans & Tate 2015 Breathing Space Sauvignon Blanc (Australia)

Description: Aromas of citrus and petrol are backed by a juicy palate with tangy acidity and semisharp flavors of peach, tangerine and stone-fruit pits. Fresh, citrusy length and a lingering note of orange are the finish.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2015 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Description: This medium-bodied wine features aromas of green apple and crushed stone, while the flavors turn citrusy, veering toward lime and grapefruit. It's nicely silky in texture, while a hint of snow pea marks the finish.
Name: Sidewood 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Snappy, citric aromas are modest in terms of fruit and depth. This SB feels dry and citrusy, while basic orange and lime flavors control the palate. A simple, slightly salty finish rushes by on an acidic base.
Name: Rutini 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Fresh grass, honeydew rind, green plum and orange rind unfold on the nose of this bright and refreshing white. The light-weight, slightly prickly palate boasts great verve and freshness, lending vibrancy to the green fruit flavors and medium-length finish.
Name: Le Jardin d'Eolie 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Cut grass and grapefruit rind aromas are followed by simple, crisp, citrusy flavors. It's medium in body, with a slightly chalky feel and a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Fowles Wine 2014 Are You Game? Sauvignon Blanc (Victoria)

Description: Some of the grapes for this unoaked white come from old vines, as well as some from the Musque clone, making for a tart, linear taste of lemon verbena and sizzling acidity that's somewhat overshadowed by the unctuous texture and full body.
Name: Eco Terreno 2015 Cuvée Acero Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: Lean, tart, angular and edgy, this delivers just what some people are looking for in a Sauvignon Blanc. The fruit is tinged with green throughout, focusing in on lime zest, although there is some yellow plum. It's crisp and clean on the finish.
Name: Fowles Wine 2014 Farm to Table Sauvignon Blanc (Victoria)

Description: Crisp, minerally aromas are low on fruit. Zesty, lively and citric on the palate, this tastes lean, linear and sharp, with orange notes and a salty aftertaste. A briny tasting, tangy finish fits the bill.
Name: Andeluna 2015 1300 Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: Green beans and grapefruit mark the nose; nectarine, pineapple and beans appear on the palate. At just 12.6% abv, it's reasonably plump and a bit sweet-tasting, making for a slightly disjointed package.
Name: D'Arenberg 2015 The Stump Jump Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Hints of pungent boxwood mark the nose of this lean, narrowly constructed wine. The flavors are grassier, “rounded out” by tart citrus and green tomato notes. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2014 The Y Series Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)

Description: This will likely prove a bit too vegetal for some, as the aromas hint at asparagus. But there's pineapple and honey on the palate and decent weight in the mouth.
Name: D'Arenberg 2015 The Broken Fishplate Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Light scents of lime, white melon rind, green gooseberry and fresh-cut grass dance on the nose of this dainty white, followed by flavors of underripe pear and tart currant on the light-weight palate. It's fresh and lively, finishing short but clean. Drink up.
Name: Kiwi Cuvée 2015 Bin 086 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp aromas of cut grass and pencil eraser show on the nose of this tart, sour wine. Dried lime peels and a slight rubber quality make for a somewhat bitter sip, though certainly reminiscent of the grape.
Name: Callaway 2014 Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Gritty, green aromas are not really ripe or friendly. This is high in pyrazines and tastes peppery and largely fruitless. A sour finish with sweaty notes are as expected given the nose and flavors.
Name: Salentein 2015 Portillo Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Uco)

Description: Overtly green in style, with asparagus notes that are too much for this reviewer. It does have some attractive crushed-stone aromas and an appealing mouthfeel, so it's not without charm.
Name: Robert Oatley 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is an inviting and easy-drinking selection, with friendly aromas and flavors of green gooseberry, orange peel and grass. There's a hint of pineapple-like acidity, though a bit more cut would help to better balance the palate and freshen up the finish.
Name: J.P. Chenet 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This is a strange version of the Sauvignon Blanc. It is vegetal and herbal with a salty edge from the ocean breezes close by. The fruitiness of the grape is missing in this lightly toasty wine. Drink now.
Name: Adega Mãe 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lisboa)

Description: Juicy notes of grass and passion fruit make for a very forward, aromatic and intensely appetizing Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is taut, very dry and slender but chock-full of fragrant fruit. The finish is enlivening and resoundingly aromatic.
Name: Sattlerhof 2015 Gamlitzer Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Fresh, friendly citrus and creamy kumquat are irresistible on the nose. The balanced, light palate rounds these appetizing notes even more and brightens them with immense freshness. There is something easy and effortless about this wine that belies both its depth and length. Simply lovely.
Name: Strauss 2015 Gamlitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: The nose promises depth of fruit: very ripe red apple, rich and juicy Bosc pear and the zest of ripe oranges. The palate has an earthy edge that grounds the fruit and a seam of very bright, pungent freshness. All the elements are there and this will come into its own with a little more bottle age. Drink 2018–2026.
Name: Tement 2015 Grassnitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Winemaker: Bartho Eksteen. Don't let the wooded name fool you—attractive aromas of guava, melon, lychee hard candy, rosebud and sweet clementine greet you on the nose of this fresh and lively Sauvy. The ripely fruited palate is balanced by bright acidity and flavors of orange zest and fynbos herbaceousness, with subtle wood-spice accents playing ever so delicately in the background. Well balanced and remarkably accessible, with the stuffing for positive short-term aging; drink 2017–2020.
Name: Bartho Eksteen 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Vloekskoot Wooded Sauvignon Blanc (Hemel en Aarde)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Additions of Sauvignon Musque and Sauvignon Gris add complexity to this rewarding white, full bodied and rounded in anise, creamy vanilla and apricot tones. Succulent and lengthy, it teases in an underbelly of herb and grass. It saw stainless-steel fermenting plus time in French oak, chestnut and acacia.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Beautifully ripe, almost luscious notes of yellow plum complement leafy varietal notes. The palate has that same juxtaposition of ripe generosity and focused freshness but remains toned, slender and superclean throughout. Lip smacking and very refreshing.
Name: Tement 2015 Berghausener Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Made in a style that will appeal to fans of both creamy, fruity richness and more austere notes of fresh grass, this wine is dry, herbal and juicy. It offers accents of vanilla and white plum, as well as the aforementioned fruitiness of peach and pear.
Name: Quivira 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This thoroughly delicious, acid-driven wine opens with aromas of passion fruit, oyster shell, herbs, wet stone and citrus. The flavors are sleek yet generous with electric, mouthwatering acidity. It demands oysters alongside it.
Name: Efeste 2015 Feral Evergreen Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

Description: Full of black currant and perfumed apple fruits, this is a wine that has filled out as it has matured while not losing its tight mineral character. It is a complex wine, tasting of the terroir, structured and fruity at the same time. Drink this impressive wine now.
Name: Domaine Landrat-Guyollot 2012 Des Cuvées Exquises Gemme Océane  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Fuzzy peach with a companionable co-host of Meyer lemon star in this medium-bodied, voluptuously appealing wine. It's balanced and easy to enjoy, its finish taking on added volume and likability.
Name: Peace Water 2015 Bliss Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A touch of flinty smoke hovers above the glass and clouds other varietal aromas of citrus and fern that find ready expression on the dry, fresh palate. The slender body still has some smoky edges, defined freshness and a clean-cut finish.
Name: Tement 2015 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Some grass and Elderflower foliage give a little aromatic lift. The palate is deliciously zesty and slender, lightweight, dry and refreshing, always with a slight grassy citrus perfume. It's hard to stop sipping when a wine has such feather-weight lightness.
Name: Sattlerhof 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: A celebratory, medium-bodied comingling of stone fruit and green apple, this wine delights in its nicely integrated notions of structure and weight. It is ultimately succulent and satisfying.
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2015 Silver Spur Limited Production Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Seeing just a kiss of new oak (20%), this wine offers brooding aromas of spice, white flowers, tropical fruit and citrus. The palate is full of white-grapefruit flavors backed by a zing of tart acidity, with barrel spice flavors lingering on the finish. It shows a lot of tension.
Name: Efeste 2014 Sauvage Boushey Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Slight notes of grass and stone fruit on the nose become more pronounced on the light but intensely flavored palate which bursts with zesty freshness and leaves the mouth bathed in green, leafy aromas forever.
Name: Strauss 2015 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Spicily rich notes of fern and Elderflower foliage mingle beautifully on a generous but well-shaped and toned body. Grassy notes glint here and there and brig added freshness to the grapefruit zestiness.
Name: Neumeister 2015 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Vulkanland Steiermark)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While delicate in body, this elegantly perfumed wine bursts with zesty citrus and crisp honeydew flavors. It's vivacious, cutting and fresh yet persistent through a long, slightly chalky finish.
Name: Paumanok 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Grapes are sourced from St. Helena and Oakville for this light-bodied, tart and slightly herbal wine, blended with 8% Sémillon. Ripe and round, it's both floral and fruity, highlighted by melon and pear.
Name: Yao Family Wines 2015 Napa Crest Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intense white grapefruit and pineapple flavors are edged by a frame of chalk and minerals in this quaffable yet elegant wine. Vivacious lemon-lime acidity drives a long, lean finish. Drink now through 2019.
Name: McCall 2015 Cuvée Nicola North Ridge Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of talcum powder and orange blossom perfume this bright, brisk wine. Crisp white peach and melon flavors are penetrating on the palate, finishing on a clean, slightly mineral tone. Drink now through 2017.
Name: Lieb 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This is a grassy, herbal wine with green and crisp citrus fruits. It is of course very young and its exuberant fruitiness will be better when it all calms down. The acidity and hint of apricots give the promise of a richer fuller future. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Michel Thomas et Fils 2015  Sancerre

Description: This wine comes from the producer's 100% organic farm, 55 acres of its 356 planted to vines. It shows balance and grace, the grapes having enjoyed extended maceration on their skins, then let to age in mostly stainless steel, and a tiny amount of neutral oak. Light, crisp and simple, it offers a length of melon and stone fruit.
Name: Medlock Ames 2015 Bell Mountain Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: Winemaker: Bernhard Veller. This is a surprisingly concentrated and wood-dominated Sauvignon Blanc, with initial aromas of yellow melon, grilled peach, cedar plank, orange cream and baking spice. It's full and round on the palate, with a smooth, somewhat flabby texture and forward oak flavors that overwhelm the fruit character.
Name: Nitida 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Swan Song Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Yellow pear, fresh-squeezed lime, light mint and wet-cement aromas show on the brisk nose of this bottling by veteran Adam Tolmach. A grippy texture and lively acidity frame the palate, where green apple and lime flavors show. It's clean, pure and easy.
Name: Ojai 2014 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied lemongrass, cut apple, wet cement, lime peel and warmer peach notes show on the nose of this very typical and likable bottling. Flavors are rounded on the palate, with tropical notes of peach, mango and pear custard.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: An impressive array of aromas, from chamomile and lemon blossoms to kaffir lime and chilled green apple, show on the nose of this bottling reminiscent of Thai food. Similar flavors hit the palate, as well as lime zest and damp mint, with a tight acidity.
Name: Falkner 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling by Steve Dooley shows fresh-cut green apple, wet cement, sharp green lime and a touch of lemongrass on the nose. The zesty sip is full of stony flavors as well, with Key lime and ripe Gala apple fruit and a pithy citrus note. It's superfresh and very easy to like.
Name: Flying Cloud 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp notes of cut grass, yellow pear, kiwi and a shred of grapefruit pith show on this bottling by winemaker Karen Steinwachs. It is light and clean on the sip, offering flavors of lemon sorbet, lime rind and more mowed grass.
Name: Buttonwood 2014 Signature Blend Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of gooseberry, lime, herb and passion fruit pop. The flavors are broad and tart. The concentration isn't quite all there but it brings plenty to hold the interest and should do well at the dinner table.
Name: Kerloo 2015 Boushey Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: The wine is ripe and soft, with a style that is more towards tropical fruits. So apricots, ripe pears are cut with crisp acidity. The wine is tangy at the end with orange zest flavors. Drink from 2017.
Name: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2015 La Reine Blanche  (Sancerre)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Six months in French oak lend a rounded feel and delicate spice to pressed apple and lemon flavors in this wine. While less forward and fruity in style than most New York Sauvignon Blanc, its richer body and slightly salty, saline palate are enticing.
Name: Saltbird 2014 Migratus Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and straightforward on the nose with squeezed lemon and sharper kumquat, this simple and easy wine shows why this grape can be a great quaffer. The palate offers minerality, touches of dill and other dried herbs, and more citrus-apple fruit.
Name: Koehler 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Herb, grapefruit and passion-fruit aromas lead the way on this well-priced pleaser. The flavors are plush in feel but with plenty of acid backing them up.
Name: Original House Wine 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (America)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of orange blossom and bramble persist throughout this bright, pretty wine, accenting flavors of fresh white grapefruit and lemon. It's sunny and ripe, yet briskly balanced. The finish is moderately long.
Name: Coffee Pot Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh citrus and blossoms accent notes of pressed apple and pear in this aromatic white. Despite the wine's delicate body, barrel fermentation seems to lend a rounded, supple richness that persists long on the finish.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2014 Fumé Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The citrus and tropical fruit aromas are quite subdued. The palate is light, needing more focus.
Name: Matthews 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Bright and really fresh, this is as crisp as Sauvignon Blanc can get. It has a tight, mineral texture and a strong herbal flavor. Lime and lemon dominate the fruit spectrum of this light wine. Ready to drink now.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2015 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Sourced from the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux, the wine is light, crisp and fruity. It has citrus and floral with attractive lime and grapefruit notes. There is a tang of lemon zest giving the wine an even fresher character. Drink now.
Name: Schröder & Schÿler 2015 Chartron la Fleur  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A bright and fruity wine that is herbal in character although with a riper apricot and green plum character running alongside. It is an easy-drinking wine, lightly tangy, and crisp with acidity at the end.
Name: Domaine du Rin du Bois 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Accessible aromas of passionfruit, apple blossoms, candied papaya and a touch of grapefruit peel show on the nose of this bottling. Anjou and Asian pear flavors appear once sipped, alongside Granny Smith apple and a peach note that grows sweeter as it sits on the palate.
Name: South Coast 2015 Winemaker's Signature Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The citrus, herb and mint aromas are expressive but show some reduction. The citrus and tropical flavors are broad and creamy, though the concentration at times seems light.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fruity and herbal, this wine is a crisp style of Sauvignon Blanc. It brings out young citrus flavors, tight acidity and a tangy lemon zest character. It is ready to drink, although by the end of 2016 it will be better because it will have rounded out.
Name: Caves de la Loire 2015 Les Anges Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a warm region in a hot vintage, this wine leans into the tropical with aromas of kiwi and mango, with herb and citrus notes providing accents. The flavors are lean and tart, with the concentration light.
Name: Mercer 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite yellow in color, this wine opts for a deeper rather than fresher style of the grape, offering aromas of iodine, orange extract and concentrated apples. The palate presents dried-apple flavors.
Name: Roblar 2015 Noir Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Three vineyards provided for this dry, easy-drinking wine, medium bodied and fermented both in stainless steel and oak casks and puncheons. Nectarine, pea shoots, corn and a zest of grass give it solid fruity footing, refreshed in acidity.
Name: Schug 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight aromas of yellow apple, green pear, lemon sorbet and slate are sharp and wound-up in this bottling. The palate is light without much complexity, just simple flavors of apple and lime.
Name: Clos LaChance 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of white blossom and lemon are pleasant in this zesty, full-bodied wine, but are accompanied by savory tones of dusty mineral and white button mushroom. The finish is brisk but clean.
Name: Jamesport 2014 Sauvage Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Produced from 52 acres of vines close to Cadillac, the wine is ripe, just hinting at a herbal character. Fresh lemon and apple fruit is crisp and light. It is a fruity wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Château Haut Maurin 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Aromas of fresh asparagus, grass and tropical fruit are followed by dry, light-bodied, easy-drinking fruit flavors. This wine doesn't offer a lot of complexity but still brings appeal.
Name: Original House Wine NV Sauvignon Blanc (America)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in aroma at first, this is a delicate, lithe and lovely bottling, showing lemon and yellow pear tones on the nose. That sensibility carries to the palate, where touches of yellow apple, sea salt, faint banana and a shred of bubblegum converge for a complete yet restrained white wine experience.
Name: Point & Line 2014 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Fresh, angular aromas of jalapeño, bell pepper, beach breeze and citrus fruits are elegant, chiseled and potent. This tingles with acidity and tastes minerally, with orange, tangerine and lime flavors. A stony, bright, pure finish confirms its high quality.
Name: San Pedro 2015 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A dash of Sémillon adds to the playfulness of this wine, which is medium-built and moderate-to-high in acidity. Tangy curls of lemon, lime and grapefruit evolve into a bristling back note of crispness that just begs for oysters.
Name: Starmont 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Light herb aromas and vivid apple flavors make this medium-bodied wine delicious, while the tangy, nervy texture keeps the mouth tingling. It has great balance, concentration and length on the finish.
Name: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Description: A sublime twist of citrus lies at the heart of this light yet complex white, which is refreshing and layered with a subtle bite of underlying oak. From a dry-farmed vineyard maintained by the same family for 30 years, this whole-cluster pressed wine was given time in a majority of stainless steel and neutral French oak. It shines in moderate acidity and tropical flair.
Name: Clif Family 2015 Rte Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine has aromas of grapefruit and prosciutto, flavors of melon and toasted almond, making it one of the most interesting and complex versions around. Its balance is good, its texture crisp and its finish lingering.
Name: Passaggio 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Full-flavored and very crisp, this wine has bright citrus and melon aromas, and more mellow pear and fig flavors that seem to smooth out the texture with each sip. It's well balanced and fascinating to taste.
Name: Shutter 2014 Windrem Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Oceanic aromas of grass, scallion, baby garlic and lime reflect cool-coast origins. A slick, juicy mouthfeel is minerally, while this offers flavors of nettle, lime, passion fruit and green onion. A long, stony finish leans towards green flavors.
Name: Errazuriz 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

Description: Quince, lemon peel and honeydew make for compatible bedfellows in this no-oak white, which is light and inviting on the palate, with more underlying herbal flourishes than it first lets on. Dry and daring, it'll pair well with all manner of fresh seafood.
Name: Ousterhout 2015 Redwood Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: Snappy cool-coast aromas of wet stones and green fruits are pungent but not over-the-top aggressive. This is friendly on the palate, with moderate acidity. Flavors of green apple, lime and scallion finish mild and clean. Drink during 2016.
Name: Casa Silva 2015 Cool Coast Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Dusty aromas blend with cool-climate notes of bell pepper and lime on this racy, green-leaning SB. Flavors of wet stones, lime and salt are crisp, while this finishes with a bell-pepper flavor and zesty acidity. This was made for raw oysters or ceviche.
Designation: Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard
Name: Lomas del Valle 2015 Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bracing and tangy, this light-bodied wine has distinct melon aromas, similar flavors and tasty accents of white pepper and fresh fennel. While nicely reserved it also has complexity and great balance.
Name: Occasio 2015 Del Arroyo Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Punchy citrus and minerally aromas open this fresh SB. A juicy, citric palate points in the right direction, while this tastes like tangerine and orange peel mixed with lime and green herbs. A crisp, persistent finish closes it out.
Name: Concha y Toro 2015 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pear and nectarine flesh are cut by a quince, Gala apple and slightest touches of guava and mango on the chalky nose of this wine. It's refreshingly light on the palate, with sliced pear and squeezed lime notes, bound by a very grippy texture.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2014 McGinley Vineyard Homage Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lively nutty and citrus aromas meet apple and lime flavors in this full-bodied and mouth-watering wine. It has fresh acidity to counter a fairly rich texture, and the resulting balance reinforces the bright flavors.
Name: Boeger 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light and summery on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of yellow melon, green pear, lime blossoms, lime juice and a touch of chalk. Wet rocks, cut garden herbs and green apple skins emerge on the refreshing palate, which is perfect for sunny days and shellfish.
Name: Barton 2014 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Grassy stone fruit and lime zest paint a pretty picture in this full-bodied white, which retains enough acidity to stay refreshing and bright on the palate. Floral tinges of tangerine blossom and lemongrass finish things out.
Name: Mazzocco 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Nectarine and cantaloup fruit flavors highlight this ripe, round style, which makes only the gentlest nod to the grape's typical grassy character. Medium weight and drinking nicely, this finishes with a touch of wet rock.
Name: King Estate 2014 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: There's a pleasing snap to this wine, which sends up scents and flavors of peavine and petrol. It's pungent and penetrating, with lime and citrus fruit (from organically-grown grapes) at the core. Drink lightly chilled, now through 2021.
Name: Upper Five 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Clean, saline-driven aromas of apple and minerals filter into a round, plump, fresh palate. This tastes of lime, green apple and green herbs, while a cucumber note comes up on a juicy, tangy finish.
Name: Calcu 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Grapefruit aromas, bright kiwi and apple flavors and appetizing acidity make a lively, refreshing wine. This will be thirst-quenching on hot summer days and good with seafood, goat cheese and many other dishes any time of the year.
Name: Bogle 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: More assertive and full-bodied than many versions, this wine smells like snap peas and spring flowers, but gets richer on the palate as peach flavors come out and mingle nicely in the unusually rich texture.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Aromas of radiator dust, melon, apple cider and minerals are intriguing and suggest good quality. A minerally, citric, chiseled palate offers flavors of crushed vitamins, tart persimmon and salty sea brine. Saltiness comes back on a minerally finish.
Name: Loma Larga 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Cool, crisp aromas of celery, bell pepper and sea brine introduce a citrusy palate with refreshing acidity. Tangerine, grapefruit and cactus flavors finish tangy, lemony and alert.
Name: Undurraga 2015 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very strong grassy notes met with juicy passion fruit and cut tennis ball elements on the nose of this distinctive bottling from an extremely coastal vineyard. There is a nice tactile acidity and minerality to the palate, which is clean and crisp while dominated by the grassy flavors.
Name: Stolo 2015 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: There is a good range of flavor complexity in this medium-bodied, soothing wine. It starts with a bit of grapefruit and lemon in the aroma, then adds a riper peach flavor that matches the supple texture.
Name: City Winery of New York 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Snappy aromas of lettuce, tarragon and bell pepper are textbook Leyda. This feels plump and a touch oily, but acidic cut provides balance. Salty, briny citrus flavors finish similarly, with a mild pickled note popping up.
Name: Viña Leyda 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This is a fruit-driven wine showing lots of apple and melon aromas, broad peach and apple flavors and a generous texture. It's very tasty and refreshing and has touch of sweetness.
Name: Fetzer 2014 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an elegantly subdued white, at an attractive price, from a part of the valley that does well growing this variety. A sweetness of pear and vanilla interweave across crisp acidity, without intrusion or confusion from oak.
Name: Pedroncelli 2015 East Side Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: On first take, this smells a bit vegetal and chemical, but time and air clean it up. Racy, tight and lean on the palate, this tastes of tart green fruits, lime and green apple in particular. A slightly broken, yeasty finish suggests early-stage oxidation.
Name: Viña Ventolera 2015 Litoral Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Briny aromas of oyster shell blend with green onion, lime and matchstick scents on this sulfuric-smelling SB. Tangy and round, with an oily note to the mouthfeel, this tastes of salty lime, tangerine, saline solution and pickle brine.
Name: Undurraga 2015 Sibaris Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light daffodil aromas meet with lemon curd, wet slate and the slightest touch of green apple skins. The palate is very chalky and mineral-driven, showing a bit of sour apple as it sits longer on the tongue. The finish is nicely mouth-watering.
Name: Byington 2014 Liage Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: Mild apple and citrus aromas are simple and clean. A light, tangy palate with virtually no weight tastes of pithy citrus fruits and tropical papaya. Light on the finish, this fades away quietly.
Name: De Martino 2015 Estate Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc has scents of lemon pith, honeydew and cantaloupe. It is soft on entry into the mouth with flavors of peach, apricot and lemon zest.
Name: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Sauvignon Blanc (Romania)

Description: This is a smooth, easy-drinking white, ready for the patio or picnic blanket, or to serve as an apéritif, that sings in bright acidity, a balanced body and an exuberance of lime and melon.
Name: R35 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sliced Gravenstein apples, guava tropicality, sliced lemon, passion fruit and a touch of white pepper show on the nose of this exuberant bottling. The sip is quite fruity and a tad sweet, showing jubilant pineapple and ripe stone-fruit flavors reminiscent of Juicy Fruit gum.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A steely mouthfeel and tight lemon and herb flavors make this full-bodied wine refreshing, dry and reserved. It will make a good accompaniment to shellfish or pasta.
Name: Paul Dolan 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Description: This is a skin-contact wine, fermented on skins for a week, that displays the technique in its dark golden color. From there, it's ripe in a sweetness of baked pear, honey and dried apricot, while lean on the palate despite the fleshy nature of the fruit.
Name: Judge Palmer 2013 Ellis Alden Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: Aromas of banana, mango, and pineapple open to flavors of tropical fruit salad, mango and banana and a soft finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreamfish Sauvignon Blanc (Romania)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This clean and relatively crisp wine has mild fruit-salad flavors and lively acidity. It's medium-bodied, not too assertive and should please a crowd.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2014 The Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The producer ferments partially in new Acacia barrels, as well as in tank, with the result a mix of floral and fruity melon with firm acidity and a medium build. It's still very much in the throes of that oak.
Name: Kokomo 2015 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Aromas suggesting honeydew melon, exotic fruit and a hint of tomato leaf lead the nose. The simple palate is a bit less expressive, offering grapefruit and a hint of white peach alongside lively acidity.
Name: MandraRossa 2015 Urra di Mare Sauvignon (Sicilia)

Description: This aromatic, medium-bodied white flirts with a distinct grassiness that can overwhelm, before settling into finer notions of grapefruit and stone fruit, as well as ripe, fleshy cantaloupe.
Name: Black Stallion 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas of this light-bodied wine are herbal and savory, while the flavors resemble melon and celery. It has a smooth style, with more of a ripe texture than a tart one.
Name: The Winery SF 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: Light aromas, light body and delicate peach and apple flavors make this slightly sweet wine simple and refreshing.
Name: Succulent Vineyards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smelling like a freshly mowed lawn, the nose on this bottling also offers that funky cut tennis ball and sour-apple aroma common in some Sauv Blancs. There is strong acidity once sipped, and a stony structure frames dried green apple and sour grass flavors.
Name: Byington 2013 Liage Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has veggie and grapefruit aromas and unapologetic herbal flavors on a fairly crisp texture.
Name: 75 Wine Co. 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Aromas like smoke and lemon zest, and sharp citrus flavors make this wine very assertive. It should make a good pairing with fresh-shucked oysters or grilled shrimp.
Name: Twisted Cedar 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Light herbal aromas and lively grapefruit flavors make this inexpensive wine true to type and fun to drink. It is nicely dry and has good, crisp acidity.
Name: Bota Box 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely grassy on the nose, this also shows lime juice and a skunky cannabis character that starts to blow off with time. The texture is racy on the palate, but the grassy component proves rather sour and one-dimensional.
Name: Byington 2014 Ventana Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: Flat, dusty aromas of lees and vanilla cookies are rather lifeless. While this is wet and somewhat juicy in feel, it's bland as a whole, with yeasty melon and citrus flavors that finish bready.
Name: Rios de Chile 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Underripe aromas of bell pepper and scallion correctly announce a shearing, high-acid palate. Salty, tart flavors of citrus fruits finish with pyrazine-driven green notes.
Name: Santa Alicia 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Herb aromas and veggie flavors dominate this light-bodied wine. Not much fruit flavor peeks through the herb garden, but the lean white pepper notes and crisp texture are appealing.
Name: Line 39 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: A heavily pickled-smelling nose includes aromas of sea brine and vinegar. Narrow on the palate, this SB tastes of sour tangerine and green beans. Salty, briny and tart on the finish, with a note of yellow mustard.
Name: Indomita 2015 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Yeasty, pyrazinic aromas are strained and less than clean. This feels chunky, with moderate acidic cut. Generic citrus flavors quickly turn bitter, while the finish is weak in constitution, an indication that this has nowhere to go but down.
Name: Finca Patagonia 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Drinkable and very generic in taste, this medium bodied wine has little varietal character and a broad, soft texture.
Name: Loft 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and crisp, but with nice depth and length, too, this medium-bodied wine is delicious to drink and holds interest with a light touch of oak. Tangy grapefruit and lime flavors have a hint of brioche and the texture is very lively.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Old Gum Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: This wine harmoniously blends hints of cut grass and struck flint with pink grapefruit. It's medium in body, not at all overdone, delivering the long citrus and berry finish with the precision of cut crystal.
Name: Huia 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an elegantly oaked but not oaky wine, with light aromas of baking spice and fresh bread, mouthfilling flavors like honeydew melon and Meyer lemon, and a layered texture that is tangy but supple at the same time. Imagine it with sushi, seared scallops or even veal.
Name: Easton 2014 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This is a gorgeously floral and herbal wine nuanced in curvy minerality that both defines it and allows it to support lovely accents of apricot and peach.
Name: Grieve 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: As usual, the team at Craggy Range has turned out an excellent rendering of Sauvignon Blanc from the estate vineyard in Martinborough. There's a lovely, lively interplay of stone fruit, citrus and subtle grassiness, plus a plump, silky mouthfeel and a smooth, elegant finish.
Name: Craggy Range 2015 Te Muna Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This wine captures the passion fruit notes typical of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, then underscores them with a silky textural element. Hints of white nectarine and celery stalk add nuance to the long, white-grapefruit-inflected finish.
Name: Greywacke 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Juicy, with a firmness of acidity and a tenacious crispness, this wine evolves in the glass, shedding some of its wet stone and green apple for more voluptuous tenets of Asian pear and nutmeg. Lovely for the table, this is a well-balanced white that'll do well on its own or with food.
Name: Girard 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Enticing aromas of tropical fruit, elderflower, tomato leaf and a whiff of hay lead the nose on this full-bodied white. The savory palate offers juicy honeydew melon, creamy white peach, passion fruit, chopped herb and mineral. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Villa Russiz 2013 De La Tour Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Ah, this is a wonderfully dry and bracing wine that avid wine drinkers will appreciate for its great balance, sense of reserve and mouthwatering quality. The aromas and flavors are like cucumber, grapefruit and white pepper, the acidity is almost electric and the finish lingering.
Name: Bell 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: The faintest notes of sea-breeze conjure up lemony freshness on the nose of this spritzy, light-bodied and fragrant wine. The aromatic allure of citrus foliage and lime zest unfolds beautifully on the creamy, balanced palate and makes for grown-up fun.
Name: Wohlmuth 2015 Kitzecker Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Lemon pith and honey-vanilla provide substance to a floral, light and lingering wine also accented in melon that's food-friendly and refreshing.
Name: Martin Ray 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is an intriguing, complex rendering of Sauvignon Blanc. It's reasonably weighty and plush, yet marked by hints of tomato leaf, wet mossy stone and grapefruit that linger on the finish.
Name: Palliser Estate 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Lime zest and guava notes make for a tropical nose. The palate adds greener tints of grass and midpalate texture that combines a creamy core with spiky freshness. The concentrated core results in a resonant, clean finish. Not your usual Sauvignon Blanc but one worth trying.
Name: Skoff 2013 Obegg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This assertive and refreshing wine smells powerfully fresh and herbaceous, and tastes crisp and citrusy like grapefruit juice. It comes off dry, medium bodied, nicely acidic, and extremely mouthwatering. It's a fine example of the type.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Description: Struck flint and tomato stalk on the nose lead into a medium-bodied wine with strong citrus overtones. White grapefruit and green leafy notes linger on the dry finish.
Name: Loveblock 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fresh and light in aroma, crisp and delicate in flavor, this wine is light-bodied, well-balanced and attractively restrained in character. Because of all that it will be extremely versatile with food—everything from shucked oysters to Thai food to smoked salmon.
Name: Oak Farm 2015 Mohr-Fry Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Wet stone, cut grass and white pepper create an appetizing nose. The palate positively sprays with refreshing, lively pepperiness and verve while the balanced body cushions its freshness in a creamy, white-pepper-scented core of pleasant lightness.
Name: Skoff 2014 Kranachberg Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: Bursting with citrus and savory aromas, this wine is an extrovert that layers spicy, herbal notes on top of ripe and delicious melon and citrus flavors. It has the at-first almost pungent aroma of oak-aged Sauvignon, and slowly reveals more interesting layers of fruit and spice with each sip.
Name: Boatique 2014 Sauvignon Blanc

Description: Grassy, herbal notes accent pink grapefruit on the nose. There's ample weight without it ever seeming heavy, and a silky feel to the wine that lingers on the finish.
Name: The Crossings 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Citrus zest, faint passion fruit, guava and woodland ferns all vie for attention here—this is a zesty, aromatic mix of greenery and ripeness. The central freshness makes this very appetizing and moreish. This is crisp and mouthwatering with a lasting, wonderfully aromatic aftertaste.
Name: Skoff 2015 Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Aged half in stainless and half in new French oak for eight months, this is a complex, tangy wine with medium viscosity and a strong taste of lemon peel and green apple. With a slightly tropical edge of lemongrass, it's lively and fresh.
Name: Amici 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intense salinity and tropical fruit meld beautifully in this ripe, lusciously textured Sauvignon Blanc. Tart grapefruit and lime notes lend a zesty vitality to the midpalate. The finish lingers with chalky, salty minerality.
Name: Macari 2014 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: The nose promises creamy freshness with the telltale passion fruit notes of Sauvignon Blanc wrapped in a rounded, sunny palate which restrains aromas but delivers lime-zest refreshment and a very clean, satisfying finish.
Name: Zantho 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine's delicately lemony bouquet belies the exuberant tropical mango and guava flavors that await on the palate. While intensely ripe and boldly concentrated, it balances neatly with a refreshingly citrus finish.
Name: Damiani 2014 Davis Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: The Sauvignon Blanc style here has gotten more refined and restrained in recent years, less opulent and flamboyant. This hints at snow pea and struck flint on the nose, then delivers primarily grapefruit on the palate, ending on a slightly austere note.
Name: Cloudy Bay 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Exuberant aromas of spring blossoms, melon and stone fruit transfer gorgeously onto the palate of this ripe, fruity Sauvignon Blanc. White grapefruit and grassy gooseberry flavors are densely concentrated, spiked by lime and a chalky, saline finish.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: The freshness of ripe lemon and crunchy, green apple pervades everything: the nose and palate sing with light-footed, unfettered freshness. This is crisp, light and spritzy and just the thing for a sunny, summery mood where refreshment is supposed to come on tiptoe but have a lasting effect. Full points for joy and ease. Drink soon.
Name: Winzerkeller Andau 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Slight spritz and a very restrained nose of subdued fruit lead onto a fresh but rounded palate where lime zest encounters riper notes of passion fruit. There is a more serious midpalate texture that calls out for food. Drink soon.
Name: Wohlmuth 2015 Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Bright flavors like citrus and crisp apple light up this medium-bodied wine from Lake County winemaking veteran Jed Steele. It tastes dry and fresh, appetizing and just fruity enough to complete the picture.
Name: Shooting Star 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: The extreme side of the grape variety comes out in this boisterous wine that smells like lemon and garlic, tastes like gooseberries and grapefruit, and has that vibrant, crisp texture that goes great with seafood.
Name: Captûre 2014 Les Pionniers Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: The quality of the vintage shows through in this wine, which is being produced in ever-increasing quantities. It's plump in feel, marked by ripe fig and melon flavors, with hints of grapefruit and nectarine. Drink now.
Name: Starborough 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This shows the sunny opulence of the vintage, brimming with tropical- and stone-fruit notes. Guava and nectarine flavors meet ample weight on the palate, balanced by a slightly chalky finish.
Name: Whitehaven 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine is weightier than expected, with a broad, round, soft mouthfeel that delivers subtle notes of green fig and citrus. There's a hint of wet stone as well, which adds a bit of interest.
Name: Lagoon Hill 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An overtly fruity aroma and lightly sweet citrus flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. It tastes fresh and clean, and is rich enough to calm down spicy foods like Thai or Mexican.
Name: Di Arie 2014 Estate Grown & Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Description: The light herbal and citrus aromas of this medium-bodied wine lead to light grassy, herbal, grapefruity flavors. A good backing of acidity keeps it lively.
Name: Avant 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This fruit-forward Sauvignon Blanc offers a blend of pineapple and nectarine up front, then shows a stony, austere side on the palate, where it ends on dry notes of crushed stone.
Name: Murdoch James 2015 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Potent vanilla announces a sizable oak presence on the entry of this wine, which follows somewhat on the palate before it weaves in a bite of preserved lemon and generous acidity.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: With his background in Bordeaux, François Lurton knows how to handle Sauvignon Blanc to good effect. This wine is crisp and herbal, suggesting the cooler vineyards of the southwest in its style. It is packed with citrus and spice flavors. Refreshing and delicious, this is an immediately drinkable wine.
Name: François Lurton 2015 Les Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Like many of Bedell's whites, smoky, flinty notes take some aeration to ease off, but with some time, elegant white grapefruit and lemon tones peek out nicely. This light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc is bracingly lemony with a steely, cool backbone of minerality.
Name: Bedell 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This wine has very little aroma and mild flavors, but a crisp mouthfeel that is lip-smacking and fresh, and will cut through a fettuccine Alfredo or green currry with no problem.
Name: Captûre 2014 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Notes of spring blossom and fresh herbs perfume the nose of this Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is markedly riper, almost ruddy with fleshy yellow peach flavors. Aged one year on the lees, it shows a uniquely textured, mouth-coating feel that lingers on the finish.
Name: Shaw 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: This wine leans toward the vegetal side of Sauvignon Blanc, without ever crossing over into objectionable. In fact, it shows attractive notes of struck flint and snow pea, accompanied by hints of citrus and tomato stalk. It's fresh, clean and would be perfect with a ceviche starter.
Name: Tablelands 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This relatively simple but satisfying wine hits all the basic Sauvignon Blanc notes: Melon, fig, citrus and grassy herbs. It's medium-bodied and boasts a decently long finish, too. Drink now.
Name: Sea Pearl 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Sauvignon from the south of France tends towards a tropical-fruit character, and this is no exception. It has pineapple and white-peach fruits and a texture that only hints at a more herbal edge. It has fruit, light texture and immediate drinkability.
Name: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: A bit austere, this is an undeniably crisp offering. Delicate herbal notes accent underripe pineapple and white grapefruit, then end on a dry, stony note.
Name: Ten Sisters 2015 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Dusty bramble aromas outshine delicate blossom notes on this zesty medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. White grapefruit and herb tones brighten the midpalate. While not persistent, its brisk finish is refreshing.
Name: Fjord 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Intentionally made in a low-alcohol style, this is both a little underripe and a little sweet. Pungent notes of boxwood, white grapefruit and celery leaf don't lack for character or intensity, but the wine finishes short and noticeably sweet.
Name: Brancott 2015 Flight Song Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A soft, almost sweet version of a typically more crisp varietal, this is fruity, smooth in texture and uncomplicated. It has fresh citrus and apple flavors.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Vintner's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Fresh lime and lemon aromas light up this crisp and tangy wine. The flavors are bright, the texture tight at first but it smooths out on the finish.
Name: Geyser Peak 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Light, bright and crisp, this wine is based around grapes grown in the Loire Valley. It offers attractive apple and pear fruit flavors cut with acidity, with a tangy aftertaste.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2015 La Petite Perrière Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Produced in the western end of the Loire, close to the Atlantic Ocean, this tightly herbal wine is packed with crisp lemon and grapefruit. It is dry, tangy and light, ready to drink.
Name: La Forcine 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This lightly herbal wine is crisp and has a tangy mineral character. It's tight, green and full of citrus fruits. The acidity is right up front, keeping the wine fresh and bright at the end.
Name: Le Val 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fleshy in pineapple and papaya, with a pinch of Sémillon blended within, this wine displays itself in a fuller-bodied style, quite ripe and robust, with strong, lingering flavors of dried apricot and vanilla.
Name: Merriam 2015 Danielle Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: There's an intensity of apricot and melon in this full-bodied, textured wine that veers on becoming overbearingly ripe, with a ghost-like finish.
Name: Trinitas 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has quite fruity aromas but more lean flavors as it goes from banana in the smell to light celery and other savory flavors on the palate.
Name: Renwood 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Description: A softer than usual texture and mellow flavors mark this medium-bodied wine. It has tasty honeydew melon and lime notes and enough richness to satisfy.
Name: Oak Grove 2014 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Broadly fruity flavors, like those in mixed fruit salad, power this medium-bodied wine. It has a touch of tartness, but mostly a smooth, easy-going texture.
Name: Parducci 2014 Small Lot Blend Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Aromas like dried herbs and flavors like green apple and pear nectar make a colorful combination in this medium-bodied wine.
Name: Castle Rock 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: There is only the faintest of aromas on this soft, lightly juicy wine. It is a warm-climate wine, rounded, soft and gentle. The freshness comes at the end, bright and with a citrus touch.
Name: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine comes from the north of the Gascony region in Southwest France. It has some herbal character as well as a delicious cool feel. Riper fruit flavors such as peach and pineapple give a warmer, soft aftertaste.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 La Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine has soft flavors, fruity and bright, with a light, easygoing character that will sip down easily. Drink immediately, well chilled.
Name: L'original French Kiss 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A selection of grapes from several hamlets (hameau in French), this light wine is soft and ready to drink. Lemon and green-herb flavors have a ripe, juicy character alongside flightly flat acidity.
Name: Grandissime 2015 Le Hameau Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Aged in new Russian oak, this wine comes off as slightly sweet and quite tropical, with an essence of fuzzy apricot and toasted wood.
Name: Trinitas 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: There is a distinct herbal, green character to this wine. That combines with a light, juicy texture and crisp acidity to make it totally ready to drink.
Name: Voiturette 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a soft wine, almost off dry. It is perfumed with candy aromas and flavors of pineapple and citrus. Light and clean, it will be an attractive apéritif.
Name: Grandissime 2015 So Shellfish Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Simple flavors like a fruit salad and a rather soft texture make for a basic wine that's easy on the palate.
Name: Bonterra 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is soft, unfocused and gently fruity. Hints of herbal and citrus flavors give a green-fruit character to the wine, which has a tight, nervy aftertaste.
Name: Café du Midi 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Vanilla cream and a stony minerality form around a bitterness of preserved lemon and a touch of heat, that takes on an abundance of intensity on the finish.
Name: Vermeil 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Mouthwatering acidity combines with a sweet aftertaste to give a wine that could be unbalanced but, surprisingly, has an attractive soft texture and easygoing fruitiness. Drink immediately.
Name: Le Pépin 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This wine has herbal, floral aromas and a candied lemon flavor. Medium-bodied, it is fruitier and seemingly sweeter than many of its peers.
Name: Peltier 2014 Hybrid Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Potent herb aromas and flavors mark this medium-bodied wine. It will need something assertive like pesto pasta to make a good match.
Name: Layer Cake 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This is a delicious and complex white wine, beginning with its aromas of matchstick, hay and hazelnuts. Zesty citrus stars on the midpalate, giving way to more generous, rounded layers of vanilla cream. Age-worthy, it peaks in bursts of orange blossom and tangerine, and would be a lovely partner for some fresh oysters on the half shell.
Name: Grgich Hills 2014 Miljenko's Selection Essence Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Made entirely from estate fruit, and given time to settle in French oak puncheons, only a third of them new, this dry and complex white is easily quaffable and yet so much more. Citrus peel and dried herb complement on the nose and palate, with a lightness of being that never veers on frivolous.
Name: Joseph Phelps 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: The grapes for this lovely wine come from the Dry Stack Vineyard and Fallenleaf, some of which is planted to the Sauvignon Musque clone. Zesty acidity takes the first punch, remaining brightly balanced and explosive on the palate, with additional hits of white peach, apricot and honey.
Name: Eric Kent 2014 Cuvée Renee Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This delicious wine makes you wish that a lot more Sauv Blanc was coming out of the Willamette Valley. It's sharp, spicy and bright. The grapefruit and pineapple flavors carry well-defined accents of herb and pine needle. The pinpoint acidity adds further focus.
Name: Andrew Rich 2014 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Salted caramel, brine, herb and lemongrass combine for a complexity of flavors and textures in this consistently great white. A sizzling vein of minerality on the palate balances the heartiness of the wood. Lemon pith features on the lengthy finish.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2013 Fumé Blanc (Oakville)

Description: A fresh, invigorating citrus and pine flavor energizes this crisp and yet substantive wine in a way that will taste great with seafood and fresh cheeses. It shows nice concentration, fine balance and a lingering finish.
Name: Husch 2014 La Ribera Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This intriguing and delicious wine includes 15% Viognier, the two grapes spending nine months in French oak, only 30% of it new. The oak provides structure and strength in unobtrusive ways, allowing the freshness of pomelo and grapefruit to speak and remain tangy against a tease of vanilla. The finish is dry and lengthy.
Name: Hall 2014 T Bar T Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Part stainless-steel fermented, part neutral French oak-fermented, this light, refreshingly upfront wine offers bristling acidity around shocks of grapefruit, lemon and lime, settling into itself as it goes. The oak is well integrated and nicely subtle, allowing the fruit and minerality to speak.
Name: Alysian 2014 Grist Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral oak, this wine opens with a reduced, closed nose that expands on the palate into a creamy, luxurious bite of apple and melon. Juicy and complex, it has a balance of weight and length.
Name: Hersly 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: A big, round and fuller-styled white wine, this comes entirely from estate-grown grapes.It offers lemongrass tartness complemented by melon and a taste of tangerine cream, a ready companion for the table or picnic basket.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2014 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Description: From the winery most responsible in America for popularizing this style of Sauvignon Blanc, this vintage delivers savory, lemony goodness, within a light-to-medium-bodied frame. Integrated and round on the palate, it's a great wine for the table.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2014 A Dry Sauvignon Blanc Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fleshy fig and creamy, rounded layers of vanilla provide a complete experience marked by zesty, mellowed acidity. Then a long finish of lemon peel and melon takes over and persists nicely on the palate.
Name: Duckhorn 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Tart lemon verbena is highlighted in taste and aroma in this structured, elegant and zesty wine. Textured and medium bodied, it finishes with some graceful weight.
Name: Flora Springs 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Oaky petrol opens the nose of this classically popular and well-loved white from the queen of Russian River Valley Pinot Noir. Vibrant and fresh, it's medium bodied with a rounded girth and complexity. The finish is sheer orange blossom and tangerine.
Name: Merry Edwards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Ripe, fleshy and tightly woven with bristling acidity, this nicely layered and complex white is food-friendly and structured, with just the right amount of nuanced tropical character.
Name: Peter Franus 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A new offering from the producer, this is a barrel-aged white chiseled in a complexity of melon, dried herb and lemongrass. With subtle hints of baked pineapple and papaya, it veers tropical without becoming overripe, finishing in refreshing waves of light, bright acidity.
Name: Quivira 2014 Refuge Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: There's a lot to like in this vineyard-designate, a longstanding site for the producer. Honeysuckle aromas invite along with a waft of beach sand, leading to a light and creamy palate with a small amount of revealed residual sugar.
Name: Deerfield 2014 Peterson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very approachable and easygoing aromatics invite the nose with salted lime, yellow apples and buttery strudel scents. The palate is equally smooth and tasty, with warm apple and lemon-brioche flavors and a creamy mouthfeel. This is a full-body take on the grape rather than lean and grassy.
Name: Foxen 2014 7200 Vogelzang VIneyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Cool, crisp, green-leaning aromas of lettuce, pole bean, bell pepper, jalapeño and citrus oil set up a juicy, round, easygoing palate. Flavors of bell pepper, jalapeño and white pepper finish with a reprise of fresh lettuce along with a hint of cactus.
Name: Errazuriz 2015 MAX Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

Description: This is a bright, medium-bodied wine with a thickness of creamy vanilla that makes it seem slightly sweet, built atop crisper shocks of lime zest and orange peel. Ultimately it finishes smooth and velvety, a nice match for the table.
Name: Davis Estates 2013 Private Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: Youthfully exuberant in fresh-squeezed grapefruit, lemon and lime, this wine has zesty acidity and pillows of vanilla, ending clean and bright. This is the first national release of this variety for the winery.
Name: Rombauer 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite grassy and brisk in style, this wine releases generous aromas of cut tennis ball, wet cement and sour limes. That citrusy acidity and sour-grass energy picks up lime pith, green-apple skins and a touch of white pepper on the palate, a very classic profile.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2014 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh apple blossoms, lemongrass, Meyer lemon, kiwi and intriguing exotic citrus notes work well together on the nose of this bottling. The palate packs Key-lime pith with slightly warmer green papaya notes as well as brisk wet cement, kumquat rinds and green tangerine.
Name: Four Sisters Ranch 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: For a large-scale offering at this price, this wine hits it out of the park. It honors the winery's early days with the variety and shows off a great vintage. Grapefruit, peach and tangerine spark atop a subtle minerality and crisp mouthfeel.
Name: Kenwood 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Dusty aromas offset by lime, nettle and snap pea scents get this off to a good start. A direct, stony, minerally palate with tangerine, bell pepper and jalapeño flavors finishes with a controlled level of pyrazinic bitterness.
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Matchstick and flint arise out of the bottle before blowing off to show off a mix of herb and jalapeño around a well-oaked, robust white wine. The stronger, more savory characteristics evolve pleasantly into a fresher, rounder taste of tangerine that provides a freshness to the finish.
Name: Davis Bynum 2014 Jane's Vineyard Virginia's Block Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Pungent aromas of wet stones, citrus fruits, grass and bell pepper are lively and intense. This has a crisp, clean palate and pyrazine-based flavors of nettle, bell pepper and lime. On the finish, it remains racy until the end.
Name: Quintay 2015 Q Grand Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Some may find this coastal SB to be too green and vegetal, but that's cool-climate Leyda in a nutshell. Aromas of bell pepper and asparagus bring on the pyrazines, while in the mouth, this is spritzy and chunky. A reprise of green, pyrazine-driven flavors finish fresh but slightly bitter.
Name: Santa Ema 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
