Description: Delicate scents of cut grass, fresh hay and whiff of tomato open on this vibrant wine. The bright, linear palate tastes of yellow grapefruit, green melon and citrus and offers up a lively acidity.
Name: Bottega Vinaia 2014 Sauvignon (Trentino)

Description: Subdued aromas of hay, pineapple and crushed stone eventually unfold in the glass. The reserved but elegant palate shows honeydew melon, peach, citrus and mineral alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Lahn Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Varietal scents of cut grass, grapefruit and a hint of tomato vine come forward on this vibrant white. The racy palate offers gooseberry, kiwi and a note of green bell pepper that lead up to a tangy finish.
Name: Caldaro 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This has a rather shy nose that reluctantly reveals hay, fennel, white flower and a whiff of exotic fruit. The bright, linear palate shows grapefruit, unripened yellow peach, vanilla and a mineral note accompanied by tangy acidity.
Name: Elena Walch 2014 Castel Ringberg Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Cut grass, tomato vine and gooseberry aromas lead the way on this zesty white. Racy acidity underscores grapefruit, kiwi and a hint of green bell pepper while a mineral note invigorates the finish.
Name: Kornell 2014 Cosmas Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Alto Adige Terlano, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This lively white opens with aromas of grapefruit, light oak and crushed rock. On the racy palate, zesty acidity underscores yellow peach, citrus zest, ginger and a hint of vanilla. A hint of mineral marks the finish.
Name: Manincor 2014 Tannenberg Sauvignon (Alto Adige Terlano)

Description: This linear wine opens with aromas that suggest tomato vine, white spring flower and yellow grapefruit that carry over to the crisp palate along with a hint of zesty lemon peel. Racy acidity adds even more verve.
Name: Nals Margreid 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Cut grass, tomato vine and gooseberry aromas almost jump out of the glass. The tangy, racy palate offers grapefruit, papaya, a light kiwi note and a hint of mineral alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Falkenstein 2013 Val Venosta Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Tomato vine, elderberry flower, hay and dill aromas mingle on this crisp white. The vibrant palate delivers grapefruit, pineapple, celery and graphite accompanied by vibrant acidity. Nectarine backs up the finish.
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Classic varietal scents of gooseberry, tomato leaf, cut grass and a touch of tropical fruit lead the nose. The tangy palate offer white peach, pink grapefruit and mineral alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Tramin 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This is bright and crisp, with aromas of hay, passion fruit and citrus. The tangy palate shows classic varietal flavors, including grapefruit, kiwi, honeydew melon and mineral alongside lively acidity.
Name: Kössler 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: The nose is at first rather shy but slowly reveals cut grass, kiwi, tomato leaf and tropical fruit. The svelte, vibrant palate offers grapefruit, raw white nectarine, sage and white pepper alongside racy acidity. A mineral note signals the close.
Name: Muzic 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This fragrant white opens with aromas suggesting tomato vine, cut grass and gooseberry. The slender, rather angular palate offers fresh herb, grapefruit, green melon, mineral and a note of yellow bell pepper. It has a crisp, racy finish.
Name: Cantina Valle Isarco 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Enticing scents of elderflower, gooseberry and a whiff of exotic fruit are noticeable on this elegant white. The bright palate offers grapefruit, kiwi and mineral accompanied by lively acidity.
Name: Andriano 2014 Floreado Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with scents that recall elderflower, white stone fruit and a whiff of yellow pepper. The linear palate offers white peach, grapefruit and tart gooseberry brightened by racy acidity.
Name: Pighin 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Cut grass, citrus, gooseberry and tomato vine aromas lead the way. The crisp palate delivers grapefruit, white peach, kiwi and mineral with just a hint of green bell pepper. Racy acidity provides the framework.
Name: St. Pauls 2014 Gfill Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of hay, tomato leaf and medicinal herb lead the nose and follow over to the racy palate together with grapefruit, lemon drop and mineral. It's linear, with bracing acidity.
Name: Borgo Conventi 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Tomato vine, elderflower, hay, chopped herb and passion fruit aromas take center stage. The palate isn't as exuberant as the nose, offering grapefruit, sage and mineral before the salty finish.
Name: Gigante 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: This pure varietal is fresh and creamy, with bracing minerality. Fruit flavors suggest fresh-cut apples with a twist of lemon.
Name: Eola Hills 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Oregon)

Description: The nose isn't overly expressive but eventually reveals suggestions of tropical fruit, chopped herb and a whiff of stone. The straightforward, slender palate offers grapefruit, a hint of peach and mineral accompanied by crisp acidity.
Name: Alois Lageder 2014 Lehen Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Subtle herbaceous aromas of cut grass and tomato vine lead the nose. The somewhat lean, straightforward palate shows white grapefruit, a hint of tangerine, mineral and a note of green pepper.
Name: Livio Felluga 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Hay, chopped herb, exotic fruit and a light whiff of oak come together on this wine. The firm palate shows grapefruit, unripe yellow stone fruit and mineral accompanied by racy acidity.
Name: La Tunella 2014 Col Matiss Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This offers subdued aromas of elderflower, sage and a slight whiff of tomato vine while the crisp palate shows notes of mint and tropical fruit. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, racy finish.
Name: Poggiobello 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Varietal aromas of tomato vine, elderflower, gooseberry and citrus lead the nose and follow through to the palate along with grapefruit, sage and mineral. Racy acidity leaves a crisp finish.
Name: Erste Neue 2014 Classic Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of pineapple, peach and a touch of vanilla lead the way. The nervy palate offers grapefruit, nectarine and a mineral note further brightened by racy acidity.
Name: Ca'Ronesca 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This offers delicate aromas of tomato vine, trimmed grass and white stone fruit that follow through to the bright, linear palate along with grapefruit, unripened white peach, chopped sage and crushed stone. It's fresh, with a clean finish.
Name: Tenuta La Ponca 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This straightforward white opens offers aromas of tomato vine, exotic fruit and a whiff of elderflower. The tangy, slender palate shows grapefruit, sage and a hint of green melon lifted by crisp acidity. It finishes clean and refreshing.
Name: Castello di Buttrio 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of tomato vine, freshly cut grass and a whiff of tropical fruit emerge on this straightforward white. The vibrant, rather lean palate shows grapefruit, citrus zest and a hint of green melon alongside racy acidity.
Name: Petrucco 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Grapefruit, mineral and freshly cut grass aromas lead the way. On the palate, brisk acidity supports pink grapefruit, tangerine and a mineral note.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Kandorian makes a stainless-steel version of Sauvignon Blanc, and also this heavily-oaked style, which is about as far in the other direction as possible. It's deep gold, scented with strong whiskey-barrel aromas, and tasting of nut oil and superripe apples, plus plenty of oak.
Name: Kandarian 2012 Croft Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Aromas of toast, nut, oak and yellow stone fruit emerge on this linear white. The palate is rather lean, offering grapefruit, mineral, thyme and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Attems 2013 Cicinis Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Delicate varietal aromas of tomato vine, cut grass, citrus and yellow stone fruit come together on this lively wine. The linear palate offers green melon, juicy grapefruit and a hint of tangerine alongside zesty acidity.
Name: La Vis 2014 Vigna Maso Tratta Sauvignon (Trentino)

Description: Aromas of cut grass, tomato leaf and kiwi lead the way on this vibrant white. The lively palate offers grapefruit, honeydew melon and a tangy note of nectarine zest alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Cembra 2014 Sauvignon (Trentino)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Fermented and aged in wood, this opens with aromas of toast, dried yellow fruit and a whiff of green bell pepper. The linear—almost lean—palate offers unripe peach, vanilla and a mineral note alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Dorigo 2013 Ronc di Juri Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: White peach, hints of smoke, yellow pear and squeezed lemon show on the rounded nose of this wine. It's softer in style on the palate, with kumquat cream, poached apple and pear, white flowers but also a sharper herbal backbone of dill and fennel.
Name: Firestone 2014 Barrel Select Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Delicate aromas of tomato leaf, citrus and a whiff of chopped herb unfold in the glass. The vibrant palate offers yellow grapefruit, green melon and mineral alongside bracing acidity.
Name: Draga 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of tomato vine, chopped herb and gooseberry set the tone while the lean, direct palate offers white grapefruit, yellow bell pepper a saline note. Bracing acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Comelli 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Cut grass, tomato vine and gooseberry aromas lift out of the glass. The thin, brisk palate offers grapefruit and pineapple alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Valle 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Hay, papaya and tomato vine aromas lift out of the glass. On the thin palate, you can find notes of grapefruit, mineral and a hint orange peel alongside bracing acidity.
Name: La Tunella 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with muted aromas of yellow stone fruit and tomato vine while the rather lean palate offers unripe peach, citrus and mineral alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Dorigo 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Subdued aromas of yellow stone fruit and a whiff of cut grass lead the nose. The linear, rather slender palate shows grapefruit, tomato leaf and lime alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Castel Sallegg 2014 Leisen Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Alto Adige Terlano, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This racy white opens with scents of cut grass, tomato vine and grapefruit. The zippy, rather lean palate offers citrus, pineapple and a mineral note alongside bracing acidity.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2014 Winkl Sauvignon (Alto Adige Terlano)

Description: Delicate scents of white flower and stone fruit emerge on this brisk white. The slender, racy palate shows grapefruit, citrus zest, slate and a note of crushed herb.
Name: Cormòns 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of hay, tropical fruit and yellow bell pepper lead the nose. It's rather lean, with grapefruit, candied nectarine peel and hints of a confectionary note alongside bracing acidity.
Name: Loacker 2014 Tasmin Sauvignon (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Clean in the glass, this SB smells like lime and grapefruit. The palate is equally citrusy in feel, with old-vine minerality. Flavors of white pineapple, tangerine, lime and grapefruit span the citrus spectrum, while the finish is sharp and angular.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: Catty and grassy this is a very Sauvignon style of Sauvignon. It is tight, herbal and intense with a cool climate character that comes from the proximity of the Atlantic Ocean to the vineyards. Drink now.
Name: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lisboa)

Description: Pungent, feline aromas of sweat and cactus set up a sharp, citric palate that's loaded to the brim with acidity. Austere flavors of passion fruit and lime end with a note of mango along with a wave of citric burn.
Name: Naia 2014 S-Naia Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas that suggest chamomile flower, passion fruit and a whiff of adhesive bandage. The lean, stringy palate shows notes of crunchy celery, grapefruit and a hint of stone alongside nervous acidity.
Name: La Rajade 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: This is a ripe, fruity wine with a herbal character alongside richer yellow and apple fruits. It is fresh and crisp, ready to drink and with a rounded, full aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Lacheteau 2014  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Citrus and tropical-fruit aromas are basic. This feels plump and, yet again, basic. Vegetal flavors of bell pepper finish with hints of citrus as well as pyrazinic green notes.
Name: Emina 2014 Sauvignon (Rueda)

Description: Sweaty sautéed onion and pyrazinic citrus aromas set up a palate with citric acidity and dominant flavors of white grapefruit. Pithy and citric on the finish, with strong Sauvignon-like residual flavors.
Name: Pata Negra 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Oily aromas of orange peel are inoffensive. A shearing palate offers little textural pleasure or complexity. Flavors of lemon and blood orange finish with a sour note of underripe pineapple.
Name: Finca Salazar 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Chunky, wayward aromas are vague at best. This has no structural integrity, while waxy green-apple flavors come with bitterness and a flabby, oily finish. Barely passable.
Name: Mureda 2014 Organic Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Smoke and fruit, citrus peel and cream—what a seductive combination! This is subtly oaked Sauvignon Blanc of the finest order, from verdant Styria. The palate is taut but elastic, there is focus but also charm and whole oceans of gentle, tropical fruit with a fillip of lively citrus. It is hard not to drink this now but if you have patience, or even better, a whole case, do wait and this will flourish. Drink 2015—2020.
Name: Neumeister 2013 Moarfeitl Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: From the winery's historic To Kalon Vineyard in Oakville, one of few sites in the state to nurture old-vine Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is complex and compelling. It balances between green olive, basil, thyme and crisp squeezes of lemon. Subtle in oak, it maintains buoyant acidity throughout.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2013 To Kalon Vineyard Reserve Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This ripe wine, from young vines, has softened its Sauvignon Blanc herbal character and developed ripe apricots and a delicious richness. The wood-aging shows, although not so as to hide the fruit and the tighter, nervy texture. Still developing, it will be best from 2018.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2013 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This is a wild-yeast, barrel-fermented wine that makes one wonder why other producers' versions are so pricey. Silky textured and moderately weighty on the palate, it offers up complex aromas of smoky struck flint, subtle herbaceousnes and ripe melon and fig. Drink it now–2017.
Name: Jules Taylor 2013 OTQ Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a sophisticated, stylish and ultimately tasty wine, given time in mostly stainless steel, with 10% in neutral oak. Fleshy, floral and full bodied without ever becoming obtrusive, it offers a nice mix of Meyer lemon and vanilla. The elements are integrated and the punchy texture offers both depth and breadth.
Name: Kelleher 2014 Block 21 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Former Cloudy Bay boss Kevin Judd scores big in this challenging vintage. The wine is round, ripe and amply concentrated, with grassy, herbal shadings and pineapple and stone fruit notes that linger on the lush finish.
Name: Greywacke 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: It's interesting to compare this to the 2014, which I also tasted recently. The 2013 is balanced and silky by comparison, with a fine tapestry of interwoven aromas ranging from pineapple and mixed citrus to charming herbaceousness and fresh-cut grass. Pink grapefruit flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Clos Henri 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From a couple of pioneers of the style, this barrel-fermented Sauvignon Blanc shows aggressive fumé-style aromas of smoky struck flint. Grilled melon and fig flavors take hold of the silky midpalate, followed by lingering grapefruit on the finish. True to its usual impressive standard.
Name: Dog Point 2013 Section 94 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Subtle green notes highlight concentrated fruit in this wine. Drilling down, it's something akin to celery leaf alongside nectarine and ripe citrus. It's plump in the mouth, with a long, balanced aftertaste. Well done, from start to finish.
Name: Vavasour 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: At first glance, this appears to be a well-made but fairly innocuous Marlborough Sauvignon. But give it a little more time in bottle, or air in the glass, and it fills out, gaining length and complexity. Pineapple and stone fruit aromas and flavors are appealing from the start, but the quality shines through on the long, vibrant finish that's filled with suggestions of nectarine and wet stone.
Name: Villa Maria 2014 Taylor's Pass Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fermented in neutral French oak and kept light and bright, this wine is sourced from two high-elevation vineyards (both estate) above the producer's winery, including La Perla at 1,100 feet. Ripe in voluptuous white peach and pear, it's lush yet balanced, offering tawny toffee and vanilla, yet finishing in more complex lemongrass. The blend holds 5% Sémillon.
Name: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2013 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tight-wound minerality jumps from the glass in this crisp, delightful white, the grapes sourced from the famed Ritchie Vineyard. With just the right amount of richness, it remains balanced and elegant, exhibiting a complex mix of white flowers, crushed rocks and a squeeze of salty lemon.
Name: Halleck 2014 Little Sister Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: The blending of estate-grown lots given different vinification and maturation regimes has yielded uncommon elegance and complexity in a wine of this price. Stone fruit, citrus and modest herbal notes merge seamlessly on the medium-bodied palate, while the mouthfeel has a silky-creamy texture that's undeniably appealing.
Name: Staete Landt 2014 Annabel Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There is a smoky edge to the grassy notes on this slightly aromatic white. Underneath there is some appealing, creamy citrus that puts the palate on a different, more serious footing. This is very fresh and very light, but it has character.
Name: Erwin Sabathi 2014 Pössnitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Struck flint and tomato leaf notes add welcome complexity to this wine's grapefruit aromas and flavors. For a wild-ferment Sauvignon Blanc, it's reasonably clean, with moderate body and a long, dry finish.
Name: Greywacke 2013 Wild Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This Australian (Yarra Valley-based) brand has bottled an excellent Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. It's plump and ample in the mouth, while the aromas are laced with hints of struck flint, snow pea, celery leaf and gooseberry, all woven into fine balance and possessing a long, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Innocent Bystander 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Medium-crisp, this wine delights in stone fruit and lime zest, with a taste of fuzzy apricot dominant on the palate. Showing a balance of body and weight, it wraps things up with a layer of acidity.
Name: Silverado 2014 Miller Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Owner-winemaker Kim Crawford knows a thing or two about Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, and despite a challenging vintage, this wine shines. Dry stony precision underscores passion fruit and herb notes, while crisp, citrusy flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Loveblock 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A lovely Sauvignon Blanc at a lovely price, this shows characteristic notes of snow pea, cut grass and tropical fruit upfront, followed by hints of pink grapefruit and nectarine. It's medium in weight, with a long, stony finish.
Name: Staete Landt 2014 Map Maker Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Soft apple notes play on the subdued palate which holds more fruit than the nose promises. The varietal notes of Sauvignon Blanc are hidden in the predominance of zesty citrus, but they are there. There is pleasing length and steadfast character on this light-bodied wine.
Name: Neumeister 2014 Klausen Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: Even big brands like Oyster Bay benefitted from the excellent vintage conditions in 2015, so consumers shouldn't be shy about trying some of them. This medium-bodied wine has a pleasant, silky texture, understated graphite and citrus aromas and flavors, and a long, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Oyster Bay 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This producer shows its aptitude for whites with this dry, estate-grown effort, a bit cloudy thanks to the lack of fining and filtering. A touch of grass is on the nose, but then it's all rich, vanilla-laden texture and pear, the body medium and the wine lengthy and in balance.
Name: Belden Barns 2014 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Classic and yet distinctive in aromatics, this bottling from the Niven family's cool-climate vineyard shows cut grass, wet cement and a touch of struck match on the narrowly focused nose. The palate intrigues, with fresh-cut thyme and oregano lifted by a white pepper element.
Name: Tangent 2014 Paragon Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: This wine is widely distributed and often discounted, but don't shy away from it because of that—it's really well made. Subtle herb and citrus shadings mark the nose, but so do riper hints of fig and melon. Those riper notes shape the palate, giving it breadth up front, then gently tapering into a long, elegant, citrusy finish.
Name: Whitehaven 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The Awatere Valley is a cooler subsection of Marlborough, where the wines can sometimes be a bit more leafy or herbal. This wine holds true to that pattern, but balances the celery leaf and tomato stalk character with melon and fig notes. It's verging on full-bodied, even a touch oily in texture, with a long, vibrant finish.
Name: Eradus 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: This combines bold fruit flavors reminiscent of peach or nectarine with leafy, herbal notes. The tomato and celery leaf tones provide a cool contrast to the ripe fruit, and a burst of crisp acids on the finish keeps the wine refreshing.
Name: Lake Chalice 2014 The Nest Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Cairnbrae's 2014 is a pleasant surprise, boasting fine aromatics of celery leaf and struck flint, bold passion-fruit flavors and a long, mouthwatering finish. Subtle herb shadings and a rich texture add extra interest, but drink up by the end of 2016.
Name: Cairnbrae 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is the dry white wine made from the Sauternes estate of Rayne Vigneau. Grapefruit and other citrus flavors are prominent, cutting through the taut texture, along with with a light touch of honey that gives richness. The wine needs to age a little longer, so drink from late 2016.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2013 Le Sec de Rayne Vigneau  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from a field blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Musque, this wine is given three months in French oak. Structured, it also has a decadence of vanilla cream and pear pie surrounded by briny aromas and plenty of citrus.
Name: Gustafson Family 2014 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: After some struck flint on the nose, this shows classic Marlborough Sauvignon characters, ranging from snow pea and cut grass to grapefruit and pineapple. It's medium bodied, with a clean, crisp finish, but should be consumed by the end of 2016.
Name: Mud House 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A step up in weight, texture and concentration from VM's Private Bin bottling, Cellar Selection is the middle tier of the company's Sauvignon Blancs. Delicate leafy characters mark the nose, but the emphasis is on the engaging gooseberry and pink grapefruit notes. Textures of silk and cream add richness to the palate, lingering on the mouthwatering finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2014 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: For only clocking in at 13% abv, this is remarkably full in body and rich in texture, with hints of smoke highlighting citrus and stone fruit. The finish is particularly notable for its fine chalk dust and silk feel.
Name: Spy Valley 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Despite some honeyed notes on the nose, this is a bit austere and stony overall. Herbal shadings accent pineapple and underripe stone fruit flavors, while a dry finish reinforces the impression of restraint.
Name: Drylands 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Snow pea is a descriptor often attached to Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, but I don't think I've ever tasted a wine that captures it as precisely as this one does. Zesty citrus notes fill out the wine's medium body and linger on the finish.
Name: Mount Nelson 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a bold, assertive Sauvignon Blanc, boasting bright citrus aromas and flavors, lifted by just a sprinkling of cut grass. A bit of creaminess adds dimension on the palate, which then finishes on a burst of lime and grapefruit.
Name: Waipara Hills 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A very subdued nose precedes an equally tame palate. However, there is fruit at the heart of this and its innate freshness is balanced by supple mouthfeel and subtle aromas. The finish is clean and refreshing.
Name: Erwin Sabathi 2014 Alte Reben Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Subtle leafiness accents pineapple and grapefruit aromas in this solid effort from an inconsistent vintage. Despite its age, it's still tight, offering coiled notes of tropical fruit and citrus and finishing with crisp acids.
Name: Sileni 2014 The Straits Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Punchy, grassy aromas of citrus and tropical fruits capture most of what's good about coastal Chilean SB. This feels angular, fresh and minerally, with flavors of tangerine, lime, lemon and grapefruit. A tangy, lasting finish is pure Leyda.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2015 Marea Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: The namesake is long gone from the company, but the wine is still a very good drop. Hints of snow pea and cut grass offset stone fruit flavors and a touch of honey. Drink this medium-bodied, mouthwatering wine up by the end of 2016.
Name: Kim Crawford 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Some smoky notes temper the exotic but subdued aromas of both stone and tropical fruit. The palate is slender and has a pleasing varietal edge of nettle and grass. Some oak lends a creamy palate structure that softens the bright freshness. A light but balanced wine.
Name: Gross 2014 Sulz Sauvignon (Südsteiermark)

Description: For an Awatere wine, this isn't overly herbal. Instead, it delivers passion fruit and citrus aromas and flavors. It's plump, with a slightly creamy midpalate and medium body, making it an easy drink.
Name: Yealands 2014 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Given the great potential of the 2015 vintage, it's reassuring to see that some big brands have scored successes like this. Explosive aromas of lime, tangerine and pink grapefruit burst from the glass, followed by ample citrus flavors. There's a hint of herbaceousness that grounds it in Marlborough, along with a long, passion fruit finish.
Name: Brancott 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Concentrated aromas of ocean brine, sweat and citrus fruits feed into a juicy, minerally palate. Green, tangy flavors of tangerine and canned beans end long, minerally and fresh, with lasting acidity.
Name: Matetic 2015 EQ Coastal Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Initially, this is all about lemon and yellow grapefruit—all citrus freshness, lightness and zip. It is on only on the midpalate that some of the lovely nettle and passion fruit notes come through. Drink soon for its utter liveliness.
Name: Strauss 2014 Gamlitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This is a good value, offering plenty of the plump, ripe fruit flavors and leafy, herbal notes that have come to define Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc.
Designation: Ranga Ranga Estate Grown Certified Sustainable
Name: Barker's Marque 2014 Ranga Ranga Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Apple notes play with citrus overtones on this superfresh and light wine. This is a summer wine with great refreshment potential: light and lifted with spritzy citrus.
Name: Tement 2014 Berghausener Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe, clean apple aromas meet with a touch of green honeydew and an interesting note of cut celery on the nose of this wine from the Riboli family. The palate offers decent tension and verve, with flavors of chilled pear juice and fresh lemon rinds.
Name: Maddalena 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: Unusually toned down on the nose for Sauvignon Blanc, the palate offers some slight glimpses of fresh citrus and intimations of distant passion fruit. In the face of the challenging 2014 vintage, this is ultraclean and very refreshing: a zippy, light-bodied summer wine.
Name: Tement 2014 Sausaler Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Stainless-steel fermented and given no time in oak, this wine is a nod to the producer's longstanding devotion to the Loire Valley and its aim to make a crisp, balanced, non-fussy white. It succeeds here in concocting a mix of lemon peel, apple and herb—a light pretty wine that's lovably quaffable.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Green notes reminiscent of tomato leaves accent fig and melon flavors. It's only medium in body, but comes across as otherwise ripe in style, with a medium-length finish.
Name: Astrolabe 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Villa Maria's entry-level Sauvignon Blanc remains a solid bargain year after year. Delicate leafy notes provide lift to gooseberry and pineapple flavors. It's a very good, fruit-driven introduction to the regional style at a fair price.
Name: Villa Maria 2014 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This may only weigh in at 12% abv, but the flavors are nicely ripened, ranging from gooseberry and peach to citrus. It's medium in weight, with a refreshing, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Nobilo 2014 Icon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is on the more herbal side of the Sauvignon Blanc spectrum, showing obvious notes of tomato leaf and boxwood, but there's ample white grapefruit to back up those green elements. This medium-bodied wine finishes long and crisp.
Name: Mount Fishtail 2014 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's no real estate associated with this label, but don't let that stop you from trying this reasonably priced wine. Hints of struck flint and damp fern mark the nose, followed by bright passion-fruit flavors and a stony, crisp finish.
Name: Domaine Australis 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Full and weighty, this vineyard-designate is salty and floral, offering whiffs of orange blossom around lime zest and brine. The minerality shines through despite the size, making for a food-friendly, yet hedonistic wine.
Name: Tamber Bey 2014 Mello Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)

Description: Smoky pear and flinty citrus set the tone for this slender, fresh and very sprightly wine. The ultralight body delivers lemony refreshment and finishes with clean zip. Drink soon.
Name: Gross 2014 Ratsch Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight, clean and refreshing aromas of sliced green apples, lemongrass, river rocks and a bit of chive power the nose of this bottling from a winery that owns estate vineyards in four of the new Paso sub-appellations. The palate is full of wound-up energy, with pear and apple skins and a grassy character quite prevalent.
Name: Vina Robles 2014 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine checks all the Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc boxes. It's medium in weight and ably marries some green, leafy character with white grapefruit notes. The lasting impression is of an herbal grapefruit sorbet that leaves behind a clean, refreshed palate.
Name: Greyrock 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Herbal and fruity at this young stage, this wine is bright with acidity, citrus fruits and a tangy texture. It is still young and almost too crisp for its own good, although it will likely develop into an attractively fruity, ripe wine with a fine weight of flavor. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2014 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Few wineries in Central Otago devote much time or energy to Sauvignon Blanc, so it's nice to try one on occasion. This is pungent and boxwood-like on the nose, but the flavors are less aggressive, more white grapefruit and celery stalk. There's ample weight and a crisp, refreshing finish.
Name: Peregrine 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Otago)

Description: Waxy apple and peach open this wine, before deeper hits of vanilla give it a complexity of flavor. Crisp, bright and refreshing, it offers a touch of brine and sour lemon on the finish.
Name: Vinoce 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is rich in spice, herbal characteristics and tangy acidity. It has a strongly mineral edge along with green fruits and tight lemon zest. Drink from 2017. André Lurton bought de Rochemorin in 1973; the estate has grown vines since the 16th century.
Name: Château de Rochemorin 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Crisp, citric aromas fold in notes of green herbs. This is a direct, citrusy Sauvignon Blanc that's textbook but rudimentary. Tasty orange, lime and mango flavors finish with purity and zest. Drink immediately.
Name: Echeverria 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: This wine is all about herbaceous fruitiness. Made from 100% Sauvignon Blanc, it offers gooseberry, grapefruit and other crisp citrus flavors along with a tight, tangy texture. Fresh, crisp and fruity, it is ready to drink.
Name: Prince de Tabourg 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Aromas of green apple and citrus are as classic as it gets for Chilean Sauv Blanc. This is straight forward but enjoyable, with modest minerality. Flavors of citrus and gooseberry carry over onto a refreshing finish.
Name: Ritual 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is marked by dry, stony notes rather than a profusion of fruit. Subtle leafiness and hints of underripe melon give this a restrained aspect and suggest it's more of a food partner than a wine that will shine on its own.
Name: Mills Reef 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Pungent and leafy at first, this also boasts honey and passion fruit aromas. It's medium in body, with tropical, pineapple flavors and a clean, refreshing finish. Drink up.
Name: The Crater Rim 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

Description: Traditionally, Hawkes Bay Sauvignon Blancs were riper and richer than Marlborough versions, but that isn't the case for this wine, which carries a modest 12% abv. It's pungently herbal on the nose, while the flavors of white grapefruit are complemented by greenish, leafy notes.
Name: Trinity Hill 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)

Description: Green aromas of asparagus and canned peas come in front of a punchy palate, with minerality and blazing acidity. Pyrazine-driven flavors of asparagus are offset by citrus and tropical fruit notes, while asparagus is the dominant flavor on the finish.
Name: Cono Sur 2015 20 Barrels Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Slight smoke and a notion oaf leafy greenness play on nose and palate. The body is light and fresh and has pleasingly spicy edges of greenish grapefruit and grapefruit pith. Drink soon.
Name: Erwin Sabathi 2014 Poharnig Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This is a light- to medium-bodied example of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, one that offers somewhat pungent, sweaty aromas that veer toward scallion at times, followed by mouth-puckering grapefruit flavors.
Name: Woollaston 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Half fermented in neutral oak and half in stainless steel, this offers a bold, generous take on the variety. The fleshy, creamy taste of crème brûlée and Meyer lemon compote is full bodied and somewhat shy in acidity. It finishes tangy and somewhat salty.
Name: Salvestrin 2014 LeBlanc Crystal Springs Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: From vines planted in the 1960s and 1970s, relatively old for St. Helena, this white was aged in entirely French oak. It holds on to a bristling level of acidity throughout, speckled in lemon, lime and grapefruit tartness. Light and effusive, its finish is all floral.
Name: Leto 2013 The Hidden One Old Vine Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine all comes from Rosebud vineyard and is blended with 17% Sémillon. Bright aromas of lees, pineapple, fig and lemon are followed by tart, full-bodied flavors with mouthwatering acidity.
Name: Elevation Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

Description: This is a seriously dry wine, somewhere between stony and chalky in terms of texture. Aromatically, it strikes a balance between herb and citrus, finishing long and crisp.
Name: Amisfield 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Otago)

Description: At the risk of overgeneralizing, Martinborough Sauvignons typically show less overt herbal characters than their Marlborough counterparts. At least, that's the case for this medium-bodied wine. White grapefruit, stone fruit and underripe melon notes finish crisp and clean.
Name: Palliser Estate 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This is a fresh, fruity rendering of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. Ripe, peachy notes on the nose give way to hints of nectarine and citrus on the palate. It's plump and round in feel, with a moderately long finish.
Name: Wakefield Bay 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A ripe character of Anjou pear and nectarine flesh mesh with honeydew rinds and smashed cement minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows a touch of smoke wrapped around green and yellow pear flesh, plus cooked apples in the midpalate.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: Pungent, feline aromas of nettle and passion fruit are sharp and uric. This feels narrow and angular, with racy acidity. Flavors of passion fruit, grapefruit, bell pepper and cactus pad finish with pink-grapefruit sharpness and pithy bitterness.
Name: Santa Luz 2015 Gran Reserva Corte Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: For a reserve wine, this lacks a bit of weight and richness, offering immediate quaffability by way of compensation. Modest citrus and cut grass notes mingle easily on the palate, then fade slowly on the finish. Drink up.
Name: Toi Toi 2013 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fresh-cut grass and gooseberry dominate on the nose of this wine, a style that's not for everyone. From there, bristling sparks of lemon and lime dominate, giving the wine a refreshing edge. Unoaked, the finish is a tad severe in its austerity.
Name: Apriori 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas on this wine from the Carmel Valley-based producer are relatively light, with hints of honeysuckle, white lily and peach blossom. The palate is quite tart and crisp, with flavors of lime skin and grapefruit pith.
Name: Bernardus 2014 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Given time in both French oak and stainless-steel, this wine combines grapefruit with melon and stone fruit like apricot to offer an unctuous weight on the palate. It finishes dry and balanced with shy acidity.
Name: Ferrari-Carano 2014 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of bell pepper and canned peas are offset by lime and grapefruit notes. This feels citrusy but diluted, while pyrazine-driven flavors of bell pepper and lettuce finish fresh but watery.
Name: Santa Rita 2014 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This is a light-bodied, quaffable Sauvignon Blanc. Ripe aromas and flavors of peach and nectarine marry with passion fruit and some slightly discordant herbal notes, then finish quickly.
Name: Barker's Marque 2014 Arona Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This medium-bodied wine features plenty of pungent, boxwood-like scents and musky, herbal flavors. Thankfully, there's enough melon and fig to compensate and the wine finishes with a pleasant touch of anise.
Name: Urlar 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Wairarapa)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Despite the relatively low alcohol, this wine is fleshy and unctuous, thick in tropical pineapple and mango with an undercurrent of caramel vanilla.
Name: Owl Ridge 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: The basic aromas of grapefruit, green herbs and stone fruits are generic. This feels young, fresh and fruity, with flavors of lime and grapefruit that end in standard fashion.
Name: Grÿphus 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Peach pit and apricot aromas are subdued. The palate is pulpy and fruity, with a light cut of acidity. Pithy flavors of orange and quince end with minor notes of bitterness and greens.
Name: Alto Los Romeros 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of high-toned herbs, butter and toast seem to show some oxygen exposure, giving a latex-paint smell and leading to elegantly styled pineapple, kiwi and papaya flavors. It's tropical fruit in a glass.
Name: Barons 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Given St. Clair's track record, this has to be viewed as a bit of a letdown. That said, it's still a well-made, light- to medium-bodied wine, offering a blend of modest tropical fruit and some grassy, tomato-leaf notes.
Name: Saint Clair 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Lightweight and lacking in intensity, this is nevertheless a respectable wine. Herb and passion fruit aromas give way to a blend of melon and salad greens on the palate. Drink up.
Name: Hay Maker 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This estate's French owners seem to experience more pronounced vintage variation than some of the neighbors, as other years have rated considerably higher. This is pretty green and herbal, with pronounced leafy, nettle-y notes and some tart passion fruit.
Name: Clos Henri 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine offers touches of tropical fruits as well as a crisper edge of citrus and herbal flavors. It is a lightly textured, tangy and very fresh 100% Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now.
Name: Château Grand Bourgeau 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The 2015 version of this wine has scored big in New Zealand wine competitions, but this vintage is best consumed soon. It still retains a lovely, slightly creamy texture, but the aromas and flavors are trending toward sweet peas and green tomatoes. Drink up.
Name: Starborough 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fresh and fruity, this already-attractive wine offers bright acidity, a lightly herbal edge and a tangy citrus texture. It is ready to drink. The estate is owned by the Perrin family of Château Carbonnieux.
Name: Château Lafont Menaut 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Hints of asparagus and struck flint give an almost Sancerre-like impression before heading in a lemony direction. This lean, citrusy wine offers good value, but consumers should be looking out for stocks of the 2015, a better vintage that should be arriving soon.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2014 Ti Point Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Despite some ripe, honeyed aromas, this is light in body and quite lean on the palate. Underripe pineapple flavors show a tart, herbal edge on the finish.
Name: Chasing Venus 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Prickly aromas of nettle are simple as well as diluted. This feels basic and fresh, while green, citrusy flavors end with pithy notes and an oily feel.
Name: Concha y Toro 2015 Reserva Casillero del Diablo Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of butter and vanilla overwhelm any sense of the variety. The oak remains out-front on the palate, which seems broad but lacks the acidity to hold it together.
Name: Gamache 2013 Estate Select Gamache Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: One sniff is all that's necessary to identify underripe, grassy aromas of green bean. Hard and tangy in feel, this tastes a lot like canned beans, as if pyrazines were sucked from early harvested grapes.
Name: Santa Carolina 2015 Specialties Ocean Side Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: This is lean and green, so if you like your wines redolent of green tomato, celery leaf and lime this is one to try. It's flavor profile and tart finish would make it pair well with ceviche.
Name: Clos Henri 2014 Petit Clos Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Muscat gummy and herb aromas are followed by dry tropical fruit and ale flavors that are lightly styled. Drink now.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2014 The Expedition Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a vegetal SB, no two ways about it. Aromas of canned beans and peas are greener than Ireland. Flavors of asparagus, canned peas and citrus finish soft, with low acidity.
Name: Piggy Bank 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: Oily, uric aromas of nettle and cactus are at the forefront. This shows reasonable mouthfeel and citric kick, while briny, salty, pyrazinic flavors of citrus fruits finish chalky, salty and sharp.
Name: William Cole 2015 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Disappointing, but perhaps this is just past its best? Scallion and green veggies nearly swamp nectarine fruit in this medium-bodied wine.
Name: Kate Radburnd 2014 Bud Burst Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Gritty, uric, green aromas come in front of a round palate with little cut. Vegetal, bitter flavors of bell pepper and grapefruit finish with another wave of bitterness.
Name: François Lurton 2015 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: Almost neutral on the nose, an herbal arugula element finally emerges. The palate is light and crisp, with a bitter aftertaste.
Name: Aguirre 2014 Kunza Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This superb unfiltered wine comes from some of the steepest slopes around the village of Chavignol. It is impressively dense and concentrated with layers of tight fruitiness, a strongly mineral texture and bone-dry acidity. It is a wine for aging several years. Drink from 2018.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2013 Jadis  (Sancerre)

Description: From the Lovall Valley section of the Napa Valley quite near Sonoma, this lovely wine is awash in tropical mango, with lilts of pear and vanilla. Creamy, it's made in a fuller-bodied style but never gets ridiculous, instead offering balance and elegance, finishing with a squeeze of grapefruit.
Name: Grieve 2013 Grieve Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Given four months in concrete egg, this is an exotically crisp and textured white, lean and high in acidity with plenty of mouthcoating body to find its balance. Lemon, grapefruit and tangerine are the highlights, finished in refreshing layers of white peach.
Name: B Cellars 2014 Juliana Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Luscious golden in color, this dessert wine shows aromas of honeyed and seared lemons, with hints of marigold and toasted sunflower seeds. The palate is rich and sweet, but balanced expertly with a great tartness.
Name: Testarossa 2012 Novitiate Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: While barrel-influenced and full-bodied, this unctuous wine remains crisp in edgy acidity, with lean flavors of lemon and grapefruit amidst a deeper, richer background of oak and caramel.
Name: Merryvale 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: From a fourth-generation farming family, this wine is sourced from the Niebaum-Tonella and Morisoli-Borges vineyards along the Rutherford Bench. It opens with a bouquet of sweetly ripened mango, peach and pear, which continue on the palate. Fierce acidity and a drop of anise form the backdrop of the wine, which finishes somewhat tropical.
Name: S.R. Tonella 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: The natural richness of a Pouilly-Fumé is revealed well here. Plenty of mineral, herbaceous flavors contrast with the ripe yellow and pear fruit flavors. It is generous and full in the mouth, still young and needing to age. Drink from 2017.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2014 En Travertin  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This tight and steely wine is fresh with crisp fruits and a strongly herbaceous character. It offers gooseberry, grapefruit and intense, youthful acidity that needs to calm down. Give this very young wine until the end of 2016.
Name: François Millet 2014 Empreinte Blanc  (Sancerre)

Description: Still so young, this herbal, fruity wine is as crisp as possible. It is packed with lemon, grapefruit and tight acidity, needing to age. Drink this tense, steely wine from late 2016.
Name: François Millet 2014 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine shows perfumed lychee on the nose, before weightier tones of melon, lemon and oak enter the picture, providing a richness of body and power. The oak and a sprinkling of nutmeg remain firm and focused on the finish.
Name: Martin Ray 2014 Dutton Ranch George Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: An intense, mineral-driven wine, this is tight and very textured. Its dryness is mitigated by hints of riper mango and apricot that fill out the palate. The structure and the tense acidity show this wine is still young. Drink from 2017.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2014 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

Description: Kiwi, peach and pineapple mark this blend of 93% Sauvignon Blanc and 7% Sémillon, providing a tropical character and personality. Medium in body and weight, it finishes moderately influenced by oak and a touch of vanilla cream.
Name: Heritance 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Lemon and quince flavors characterize this crisp, dry, 100% varietal wine from a single vineyard site. It was fermented and aged in both stainless steel and oak, in addition to concrete egg. High-toned acidity remains sharp on the palate around a medium build and spicy finish.
Name: V. Sattui 2014 Carsi Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Why, at the northern limits of Burgundy, there should be a small village producing Sauvignon Blanc is a curiosity, as the name of the wine suggests. This ripe, tropical fruit and crisp green plum-flavored wine is tightly textured and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2014 Curiosité de Bourgogne  (Saint-Bris)

Description: Full bodied and brimming in vanilla and ripe peach, this white also offers big flavors of grass and lime zest, coming down in the middle in terms of acidity. Fermented in stainless steel, it's fresh and fruity, with a creaminess to the finish.
Name: The Rule 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Coteaux du Giennois, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced just north of Sancerre, this wine shares many of the fresh, lightly herbal characters of those wines, just on a smaller, softer scale. Fruity with lemon zest and crisp acidity, it is ready to drink now, though will be better from late 2016.
Name: Domaine de Villargeau 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Produced in Anjou, this is a totally crisp wine, with lemon and fresh gooseberry flavors that just burst from the glass. It is bright and fruity, with just a touch of mineral texture to add interest at the end.
Name: Chatelain Desjacques 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: The oak is pronounced from the start of this full-bodied, slightly over-the-top white, which comes off as reduced among layers of caramel and almond. A hint of ripe cantaloupe, peach and apricot provides a sense of freshness on the finish.
Name: Charthia 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: With a handful of Sémillon blended in, this white was fermented in both stainless steel and concrete egg, with less than 3% having spent time in oak. Tart green apple is most pronounced in flavor, with a slight metallic edge to the finish.
Name: V. Sattui 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Simple, fresh and fruity, this has attractive herbal flavors and crisp citrus. It has a tangy edge that will allow it to age a little longer. Drink now, but better from early 2017.
Name: Château Laulerie 2014 Comtesse de Ségur  (Montravel)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: While this wine has hints of a green herbal character, its main character conveys creamed apples and even riper fruits such as white peach. It is soft and lightly textured with just a touch of final acidity. Drink now.
Name: Nicolas Idiart 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This wine shows the tropical fruit side of Sauvignon Blanc with pineapple and mango flavors. The acidity is there, floral and ripe. The wine is ready to drink now.
Designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Less tangy than some Loire Sauvignon Blanc, this easy, soft wine has attractive acidity and a balanced, steely texture. It's crisp, with some herbaceousness over grapefruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Bernier 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Melon and cidery aromas are distant. This feels low on acidity, while pear, papaya and briny flavors taste bitter on the back end of the palate. A briny, pickled note marks the finish.
Name: Pablo Claro 2014 Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of canned peas and beans indicate this was probably fresher smelling nine months ago. Zesty and solid on the palate, this tastes oily, pyrazinic and briny, with stone fruit notes.
Name: Peñascal 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Mild peach and quince aromas come with zero zest or edge. This lacks shape on the palate and tastes jumbled, with bland peach and tropical fruit flavors. This finishes flat as a board, with almost no lasting flavor.
Name: Trencalòs 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: A magical blend of 73% Sauvignon Blanc with 27% Sauvignon Musque, from a landmark producer of the variety, this is a complex and elegant expression of lushly layered peach and mandarin orange, balanced and structured for years to come. From vineyards both within Napa Valley and throughout Sonoma, including Knights Valley and Sonoma Mountain, it's eminently sippable and a fine wine for the table.
Name: Spottswoode 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa-Sonoma)

Description: Beautifully balanced and elegant, this is made by one of the winemakers at Cardinale and inspired by the Loire Valley. It offers equal parts fruit, weight and minerality, tasting of fresh-squeezed lime and wet stone, with a layering of viscous vanilla. Medium-sized in terms of texture, it dances on the palate, refreshing throughout.
Name: Galerie 2014 Naissance Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: In this full-bodied, well-earned Reserve-level wine, white peach, cantaloupe and lemon-lime define the ripeness of fruit on the palate, providing a fresh lushness around its substantive body and weight. A hit of decadent toffee lurks on the finish.
Name: Round Pond 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Enticing aromas of white lilies, nectarines, white peach, honey-lime water and chalky stone hit the nose on this wine from a new vineyard on Highway 154 in the likely-to-be-named Los Olivos District. The palate is creamy down the center but with tangy edges, offering flavors of lime yogurt and pink grapefruit pith.
Name: Vincent Vineyards 2013 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made from all free-run juice with no oak, this wine by 40-year veteran Frederic Brander shows candied lemon and lime peels on the approachable, inviting nose, along with fresh-cut apples and a growing passionfruit perfume. The passionfruit tang also shows on the palate alongside ripe limes and a lingering grassy note, held together by grippy acidity and pithy texture.
Name: Brander 2014 Mesa Verde Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This late harvest Sauvignon Blanc is honey gold in color, with tantalizing aromas of honeysuckle, white flowers and lanolin. It is generous on the palate, with flavors of apricot and tinned peaches supported by floral notes. Its sweetness is enhanced by a pleasing level of acidity on the finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2013 Conocul Ambrozy Sauvignon Blanc (Recas)

Description: With Kirk Venge as winemaker and Beckstoffer grapes at its core, this intriguing new project is out the gates with a rocking wine, a compelling and complex mix of lemongrass and hard lemon candy that gets more inviting in the glass. Light-bodied, crisp and focused, it offers a twist of New Zealand-like grass that never gets out of hand, becoming a delight on the palate instead.
Name: Eleven Eleven 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: This is a smooth, herbal and fresh 100% varietal wine. The label has been brought back to life by a trio of partners, including winemaker Patrick Sullivan, who were involved with the original Grey Stack many years ago. Pineapple rises to the fore on the nose, finding consistency on the palate, a complex expression of the variety from a great site, seasoned in lemongrass and dried herb.
Name: Grey Stack 2014 Rosemary's Block Dry Stack Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this wine by regional Sauv Blanc veteran Kathy Joseph offers cut green apples, sweet lime blossoms and a light honey element on the nose. Lime zest and citrus pith decorate the palate, with steely white pepper and dried oregano flavors that race across the tense palate.
Name: Fiddlehead 2014 Goosebury Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: From high-elevation blocks once devoted to Cabernet Sauvignon, this exceptionally crafted wine reveals a worthwhile trade-off, flavors celebratory in pear and peach. Fragrant and floral, it offers zesty acidity in Meyer-lemon form, finishing in lasting waves of more lemon.
Name: Stonestreet 2014 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slight hint of petrol on the nose of this wine by veteran Kathy Joseph then ventures into delicate and soft aromas of preserved lemons and scratched grapefruit skin. It's edgy in style, treading a pithy line of tangelo, pomelo and yellow grapefruit, with racy and lingering lemon-spritz acidity.
Name: Fiddlehead 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Complemented by 9% Sémillon, this concentrated, creamy young wine is generous in pear, peach and subtle pineapple. Tart, it remains fresh and focused in the glass, with a lushness that's memorable and compelling. An impactful finish wraps things up nicely.
Name: Groth 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A sleek blend of wet-cement minerality, slight dairy notes, citrus pith and a grapefruit spritz freshness makes for a very inviting nose on this wine from a new vineyard that overlooks the Santa Ynez River. A rocky, grassy element powers the palate, with lime zest and chopped Granny Smith apple-peel flavors.
Name: Grimm's Bluff 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grassy lime, kiwi and crème brûlée provide succulence and substance to this wine, surrounded refreshingly by ebullient acidity. Fermented in stainless steel, it was then aged minimally in neutral French oak. The wood provides firm structure without getting in the way of the fruit.
Name: Trione 2014 River Road Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slight skunky, entirely pleasant aroma of damp herbs hits the nose first on this bottling by South African vintner Ernst Storm, then a slick rush of lemon-lime peels, ripe kiwi and green apple blossoms washes in. Flavors are driven by grapefruit and pomelo, with a wet-cement minerality.
Name: Storm 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from esteemed Boushey and Red Willow vineyards, this was aged in a mixture of concrete and French oak (10% new). The herb, lemon verbana and citrus flavors are light on their feet with a creamy texture and a tart zing of mouthwatering acidity that stitches it all together.
Name: Avennia 2014 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Both elegant and refreshing, this citrus and floral-infused wine follows the Navarro house style for whites, which includes great balance, rounded mouthfeel and honey and floral accents. It's medium bodied, vibrant with acidity and wonderfully complex.
Name: Navarro 2014 Cuvée 128 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: High and tight aromas of chopped grass and cut tennis ball are met with a pretty floral element that veers toward fresh purple flowers. The family-owned estate, which boasts some of the more dramatic vineyard blocks in the region, offers lemongrass, squeezed lime, citrus zest and Granny Smith apple skins on the palate.
Name: Grassini 2014 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: An inviting hint of coconut water opens the bouquet of this wine, followed by lemon zest, lime and grapefruit. Oak makes an appearance on the palate, but with subtlety, finishing dry and refreshing with a lightness to the end.
Name: Galerie 2014 Equitem Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

Description: This wine comes from a single vineyard and is 100% varietal, offering dry, crisp lightness. Light oak aging provides structure underneath tart acidity and floral aromatics, providing intensity and vibrancy.
Name: Ehlers Estate 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a touch of reductive petrol on the nose of this wine, which is a 50-50 blend between Vogelzang and Grassini vineyards. It also offers lime zest, golden pear flesh and barely ripe peach. A cut-grass element shows on the palate as well as sour lime and Bosc pear peels.
Name: Dragonette 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Flinty, mineral-like aromas and flavors lend a complex personality to this compelling, medium-bodied wine. The palate is crisp, dry and citrus-driven, inviting another sip and begging for some fresh-shucked oysters.
Name: Wente 2013 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)

Description: Pineapple appears first on the nose and palate, followed by high-toned acidity and a back-up of lemon and lime. Medium bodied, the wine remains light and crisp throughout, finishing in a swirl of lemon zest and grapefruit pith.
Name: Rodney Strong 2014 Charlotte's Home Estate Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Northern Sonoma)

Description: This is a new line of label-driven wine meant to be adventurous and whimsical. Catchy label aside, the wine inside entirely delivers in well-integrated fruit and floral characteristics, showing the crispness of its stainless-steel fermentation. Tangy, it's both tart and tropical, finishing focused and lean.
Name: Liberated 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Underripe, slightly green orange peels mix with honeydew, grass and lime on this straightforward selection. The palate shows a touch of peach on the first part of the sip before delving into pungent grassiness that continues through the finish, all complemented by a wet stone frame.
Name: Kitá 2013 Camp 4 Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: San Bernabe, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's nice restraint on the nose of this judiciously priced bottling by the Delicato group, with lemon-lime citrus and slightly green apple flesh on the nose. The wine is strongly textural once sipped, with sour apple, lime peel and riper stone fruit in the background, finishing grippy and clean.
Name: Noble Vines 2014 242 Sauvignon Blanc (San Bernabe)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: A notion of light citrus peel rises on the nose before a nicely packaged selection of Asian pear, fennel-like herb and lemongrass appears. Thick, rich and nearly full bodied, the wine settles into a crisp, tangy finish.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Distinctive elements on the nose of this wine from the Buellton-based winery include dried peach, lemon ice and a touch of yogurt and sour cream. There is a dairy tang to the palate and only the slightest touch of green, with aged lemon peels, sour nectarine and tart plum-flesh flavors.
Name: Dragonette 2013 Grassini Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made by Jordan Fiorentini of Epoch in Paso Robles, this boutique bottling shows red apple flesh, yellow pears, salted lime skins and scratched lemon aromas. There is bright energy to the sip, with flavors of stony chalk and apples drizzled with pink lemonade.
Name: Magna Mater 2014 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Crisp and appetizing lemon and grapefruit flavors do their job very well in this vivid, refreshing and medium-bodied wine. Its bright acidity makes the mouth water and will help it pair beautifully with a wide variety of foods.
Name: Lake and Vine Cellars 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: With a handful of Sémillon in the blend, this is a fleshy, full-bodied style of white wine, offering darker tones of caramel and oak. Well made, it features a tangle of vanilla and butterscotch on the big finish.
Name: Black Stallion 2014 Limited Release Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Poached apple, tart nectarine skins and a tiny whiff of petrol decorate the nose of this single-vineyard study that received 14% new oak. It's clean and easy on the palate, with Golden Delicious apples, cement stoniness and a pear skin tartness.
Name: Dragonette 2013 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and delicate on the nose with lime blossoms and damp herbs, this top-end bottling from Fred Brander shows lots of peppery energy once sipped. The tense palate is more about texture than flavors, yet wet cement, ripe lime, grass and oregano do make flashy appearances.
Name: Brander 2013 au Naturel Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a sleek, crisp and streamlined first offering from the young appellation's newest vineyard, which overlooks nearby Lake Cachuma. Fresh and bright lime sorbet aromas lead to peppery verve on the palate, with flavors of white pepper, cut grass, sour lime skins and apple peels.
Name: Grimm's Bluff 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This majority Sauvignon Blanc also contains almost 25% Sémillon, giving it a tropical, papaya-like bouquet. Layers of medium body and a developing texture provide weight and complexity while a balance of tangy acidity and floral aromas remain pleasing all around.
Name: Frostwatch 2014 Kismet Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For those who want classically grassy and energetic Sauv Blanc flavors, this widely available bottling is perfect. Aromas of both boisterously tropical fruit and funky cut grass lead into a zingy palate of white pepper, bell pepper, cement and lime.
Name: J. Lohr 2014 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and fresh on the nose with crystalline aromas of lime juice, apple skins and tropical-leaning plumeria, this is a very quaffable wine. The palate shows apple and pear flesh, cut with just enough lime zest.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This is favorably marked by hints of stuck flint and bold, herbal flourishes on the nose, then settles down to deliver stone fruit and citrus on the palate. For the price, it's surprisingly long on the finish.
Name: Massimo 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft and easy on the nose, this wine by a newer estate suggests ripe kiwis, Key lime and a brisk minerality. Broad and approachable flavors will be inviting to many palates. Flavors of apple flesh and pear cider go down easy on a hot day.
Name: Brave & Maiden 2014 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Passion fruit, lettuce, grapefruit and tropical aromas get this Sauvignon Blanc off to a nice start. Zesty, speedy and super fresh on the palate, with blazing acidity, this tastes of passion fruit, green herbs and grass, especially on a racy, slightly pithy finish.
Name: Montes 2015 Spring Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lemon rinds, green apple skins, white flowers and a hint of pineapple guava decorate the nose of this wine from a former race car driver. It has tons of chalky mineral zing on the palate, which is crisp and light with grassy flavor and pithy grip.
Name: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: All ranges of pear show on the nose of this tasty wine, from Anjou to Bosc, poached to canned, and so forth. The palate also offers a pear-cider flavor profile, with some yellow apple peels, iodine and a sour yogurt character adding to the intrigue.
Name: Morgan 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Gooseberry and lemon peel mix with a wet cement, stony character on the nose of this crisp sipper from the middle of Monterey County. It's light, bright and tart on the palate, with lime peel, grapefruit peel and grassy tones, all laid across a zesty energy and cement minerality.
Name: Comartin 2014 Stone Row Zabala Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: This wine has a nose of lemon peel, lemon grass, and a freshly cut lawn. It is clean in the mouth, with flavors of lemon, lime and Seckle pear that wind down to a mineral-laden finish.
Name: Giocato 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Primorska)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The expected cut-grass greenness shows on the nose of this wine, but so do plenty of white flowers, nectarine, golden apples and chalk. The palate is rather rich in style for this grape, perhaps explained by its slight aging, but well done with ripe apple flesh and more cut-grass flavors.
Name: Magna Mater 2013 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Petrol, sliced tennis ball and fresh-cut grass show on the nose of this bottling that is boosted in the suavity category by 13% Sémillon. It's immediately lively on the tongue, with soda and lime-pith energy giving tension to the Anjou pear skins and kumquat fruit.
Name: Piocho 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fragrant aromas of Anjou pear and green apple skins make for a fresh and fruit nose on this wine that is cut with lime-peel bitterness. It's delicate at first on the palate, with a slightly sour yellow grapefruit-peel flavor that leaves an energetic zing in the mouth.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The herb, grapefruit, tropical fruit and melon aromas are light but very varietal. The palate has a slight spritz that perks up the tangy fruit flavors.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Hard-driving aromas of nettle, jalapeño, sea brine, wet stones and grapefruit set up a chunky palate with a ton of weight. Passion fruit, orange and controlled vegetal flavors are in harmony. Drink now.
Name: Arboleda 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

Description: Effervescent lemon, lime and grapefruit and a flinty edge define this crisp white, aged mostly in stainless steel. A ripe, unctuous finish gives the wine subtle power and voluptuousness.
Name: J. Rickards 2014 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine captures the popular grapefruity, grassy style of the variety in a crisp, refreshing and flavorful way. Light to medium bodied and full of bracing acidity, it will be great with seafood or as a pre-dinner drink.
Name: Guenoc 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fresh-squeezed lemon and jalapeño open the bouquet of this wine, kosher-made in Berkeley by Covenant. With the right pairing, it'll sing, offering medium texture and a lengthy finish, the acidity balanced and in keeping with the fresh elements of tropical fruit and citrus.
Name: Red C 2014 Allan Nelson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A delightfully light, crisp and well-rounded expression of the variety—aged in stainless steel—this has a beginning, middle and end, all well defined. The bouquet is part lime and part mint and cilantro, while the middle traffics in peach. The finish accents the acidity that's been there all along, refreshing and well balanced.
Name: Geyser Peak 2014 River Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Zesty acidity wraps itself around well-defined flavors of lemon and grapefruit in this mostly stainless-steel fermented white. The finish maintains the minerality, adding on a taste of fig.
Name: J. Lohr 2014 Carol's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: This estate-grown white is consistently yummy, tangy in lemon peel and fresh-squeezed lemon, with a splash of fresh grapefruit. Dry and crisp, it finishes refreshingly, an ideal wine for light appetizers and most rewardingly, raw oysters.
Name: Kunde 2014 Magnolia Lane Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
