Description: Bristling grapefruit pith and gooseberry notes are concentrated and crisp on this bright, punchy Sauvignon Blanc. While delicate in body, partial skin contact seems to lend richness to palate, freshened by swathes of herb and orange blossom on the finish.
Name: Raphael 2014 First Label Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Zingy and restrained Sauvignon Blanc, none of those tropical top notes but greenish concentration on the palate. The slender palate shows tingling freshness and verve reminiscent of grapefruit zest. Very refreshing.
Name: Wohlmuth 2014 Steinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This is clearly labeled as "Certified Sustainable," although, to be fair, a lot of other New Zealand wines are also sustainably produced. Once past the labeling, 's a light- to medium-bodied wine, with slightly vegetal notes of nettles and garden peas that add nuance to refreshing citrus flavors.
Designation: Three Brooms Single Vineyard Certified Sustainable
Name: Barker's Marque 2014 Three Brooms Single Vineyard Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Central Otago isn't exactly known for its Sauvignon Blanc, but this is a credible version. It's pungent and sweaty, but compensates with a rich texture, ample grapefruit flavors and a long finish.
Name: Peregrine 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Otago)

Description: A restrained hint of earthiness does not forebode the intense lime and grapefruit-like freshness on the palate of this slender, fresh and yet concentrated wine. The finish lingers and is whistle-clean.
Name: Wohlmuth 2014 Klassik Sauvignon (Südsteiermark)

Description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc adds a bit of creamy depth on the midpalate, while its aromas and flavors of fig and melon are on the ripe side for Marlborough. Despite that, it's still clean and refreshing, with a long, citrus-pith finish.
Name: Jules Taylor 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A very restrained nose of rounded ripeness belies the aromatic nature of this grape variety, but the palate shows the verve and zing we are accustomed to. The greenish notes are mere glints in the background but refreshment is guaranteed.
Name: Tement 2014 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Pink grapefruit plays among the greener top notes while the palate is juicy with green plum fruit. This is appetizing and utterly friendly with a totally clean, long finish.
Name: Hillinger 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is more a Bordeaux Blanc with Sémillon (15%) playing a prominent role. It leads with aromas of custard, barrel spices, pear and fig followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. The concentration isn't all there but the balance of what is is spot-on.
Name: Januik 2013 Sagemoor Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: For such a large-production wine, this is admirably complex, featuring delicate herbal shadings accenting hints of nectarine and citrus. The texture is a bit oily, but that's balanced by a long, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Yealands 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Ripe, rounded peach flavors with an earthy edge on the nose give way to a tingling, peppery, grassy and grapefruit-driven palate full of zing and crispness. This is tingling and fresh. Drink soon.
Name: Umathum 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe gooseberry and white grapefruit flavors are cut by a razor's edge of acidity in this juicy, bracing Sauvingnon Blanc. Fermented using indigenous yeasts, it's brisk on the finish, ending on a distinctly saline, mineral tone.
Name: Bedell 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Light straw to the eye, this wine offers aromas of pineapple, grapefruit and cut grass. There is a nice balance of citrus and herbal notes on the taste buds, with flavors of pear, peach, lemon and chopped parsley and basil. It has a bright, fresh finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This is plump, medium-weight Sauvignon Blanc that's fully ripe and easy to drink. Pineapple and pink grapefruit aromas and flavors are mellow and harmonious at this stage. Drink up.
Name: Craggy Range 2013 Te Muna Road Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: California winemaker Nick Goldschmidt reaches back to his New Zealand roots for this bottling. It's a finely balanced mélange of grapefruit, cut grass and fig notes carried by medium body and a soft, appealing finish.
Name: Forefathers 2014 Wax Eye Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A rather subdued nose turns into a citric pool of grapefruit pulp and peel on the palate. This is fresh and easy, light and zippy. The finish is clean-cut and refreshing. Drink soon.
Name: Gross 2014 Jakobi Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A new wine for this winery, this is all varietal and aged in neutral French oak. Notes of pineapple and papaya are followed by full-bodied, rounded, sweet tropical flavors that linger.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: After starting out reductive, this wine opens to reveal light aromas of fig and tropical fruit, seeming a bit muddled. The flavors, however, come through clearly, providing a textured feel.
Name: Auclair 2014 Artz Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Nectarine and fig notes mark the nose, while the palate is mellow and well-ripened, then delivers a refreshing citrusy kick on the long, grapefruit finish. Drink this medium-bodied wine over the next 6–9 months.
Name: Tussock Jumper 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fleshy and dry, this voluptuous wine has an abundance of creamy weight on the palate, but it never veers too far, remaining balanced and ultimately elegant. Stone fruit and quince vie for attention, with a salty undertow of lemongrass and ginger.
Name: Raymond 2013 Estate Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This Waiheke Island-based winery sources its Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough. The result is a rather leafy, slightly vegetal wine that's reminiscent of tomato stalk and celery leaf, yet remains refreshing and pleasant, with a strong citrus core. Try it with ceviche or simple broiled sole.
Name: Kennedy Point 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This light- to medium-bodied wine is composed, restrained and balanced. Scents of struck flint and tomato leaf add a welcome edge, while delicate white-fruit notes play in the background.
Name: Goldwater 2014 Wairau Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A distinctly musky note mingles amidst pretty orange blossom and grapefruit on this dainty, but surprisingly complex Sauvignon Blanc. Mouthwatering acidity yields a brisk but clean finish.
Name: Raphael 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This medium-bodied wine smells a bit like a bouquet of pineapple, sage and lemony thyme. On the palate, the wine is restrained and citrusy, with a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Frenzy 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (South Island)

Description: Toasted oak and vanilla give this wine substance and style. It's fuller bodied and robust on the palate, still young and holding on to some weight. A touch of grapefruit spruces up the proceedings, providing crispness just in time.
Name: Raymond 2013 Reserve Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While elegant and a bit restrained, this dry, mineral-laden Sauvignon Blanc boasts crisp white grapefruit and lemon flavors. It's refreshing and brisk, finishing on a delicate green, herbaceous tone.
Name: Bouquet 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A wine of contradictions, this attempts to merge ripe elements, like fig, nectarine and melon, with taut notes of citrus and hints of garden peas. It's medium bodied, with a crisp, pleasant finish.
Name: Yealands 2013 Aware Valley Single Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine is fresh, crisp and still young. Crisp acidity dominates the strongly citrus character and gives a tight aftertaste of lime and pink grapefruit. This 100% Sauvignon Blanc was aged on the lees for six months to enhance aroma. Wait to drink until early 2016.
Name: Dourthe 2014 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Sweet aromas of jasmine jump from the glass in this vineyard-designate, followed by palpable acidity that makes the wine fresh and refreshingly dry. A finish of grapefruit pith provides for a citrus-tinged end.
Name: St. Supéry 2013 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This tastes bright and lively, just a bit sweet and brimming with fruit flavor. It smells like green apples and grapefruit, tastes like honeydew melon and adds a bit of acidity to balance out the ripeness.
Name: Vigilance 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Hills)

Description: This is a crisp, clean and zesty wine, built on a simple but tasty base of white grapefruit. It's light to medium in body, with a refreshing finish.
Name: Jackson Estate 2013 Stich Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Intense youthful Sauvignon, this is all about lemon, pink grapefruit and acidity. A textured quality gives an orange-zest character while still letting the bright fruit speak freshly and easily. Drink from late 2015. The estate, near Cadillac on Bordeaux's Right Bank, is managed by Jean-Louis Sanfourche, fourth-generation producer at the estate.
Name: Château Haut Maurin 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The Sauvignon Blanc here never seems to hit the highs of the Burgundian varieties, but the 2013 is a solid effort. Aromas of struck flint give a faintly Old World character to this medium-bodied wine, followed by hints of stone fruit and pineapple and an abbreviated finish.
Name: Ata Rangi 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Tight and herbaceous, this nervy, crisp wine is full of lemon and lime juice cut with an orange zest. Floral and full of acidity, it leaves a mineral, steely aftertaste.
Name: Dourthe 2013 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Ever get served a grapefruit half topped with a maraschino cherry? That's kind of what this wine smells like. So it's a bit confected, but pleasant, with hints of currant and citrus, with a slightly sweet-and-sour finish.
Name: Fire Road 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This smells sugary, floral and herbaceous, then the flavors become more crisp and zesty like lemon and green apple. While the wine seems to start sweet, it finishes very dry and tangy, and should stand up well to rich salads, cheeses and seafood.
Name: Two Angels 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This wine hits all the standard Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc notes: ripe notes of fig and melon joined by cut grass and citrus. It's not overly concentrated, but it's easy to drink and comes together harmoniously on the finish.
Name: Framingham 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A mix of Sauvignon Blanc (77%) and Sémillon, this wine comes from three separate vineyards in the Columbia Valley. It shows plenty of Sauvignon's herbal character while also displaying the ripeness of the vintage, with lightly spritzy tropical fruit and fig flavors that possess a fleshy feel.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2014 Fumé Blanc Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: At this scale (170,000 cases imported), the quality is remarkable. Leafy notes accent pink grapefruit aromas and flavors, coming together in a harmonious, easy-drinking finish.
Name: Oyster Bay 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: For the price, this delivers exactly what you should expect: clean winemaking; varietally true aromas and flavors of white grapefruit, nectarine and tomato leaf; and a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Zeal 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine seems a bit confected and simple, combining ripe stone fruit with lemon zest to achieve a sense of balance. Short on the finish.
Name: Smythe & Renfield 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Racy, this stainless-steel fermented white is fuzzy in gooseberry and pineapple, not quite veering into fresh-cut grass, but staying more tropical and generous in ripe fruit. A dry, lemony finish provides refreshment.
Name: St. Supéry 2014 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a bit herbal and sweaty, even a little boxwood-pungent. The herbal, leafy flavors are light and refreshing, vanishing too quickly on the finish.
Name: The Crossings 2014 Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a straightforward easy-drinker with aromas of cantaloupe and kiwi leading to off-dry, lightly styled fruit flavors.
Name: Songbird 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: While a bit earthy in aroma, this gains more fruit flavors on the palate and wraps them in a soft, smooth texture. Elements of apple and pear make it rich rather than bright.
Name: McFadden 2014 Estate Grown Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A slightly earthy aroma leads to lean citrus aromas, attractive kiwi and apple flavors and a somewhat tangy texture. Overall it is light-bodied and modest in flavor.
Name: McFadden 2014 Blue Quail Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of melon, grapefruit and herbs lead to sweet tropical fruit flavors. The concentration isn't all there and the acid seems a bit wanting.
Name: Goose Ridge 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is soft, watery and misses out on character. It is gentle, but with a bitter almond aftertaste.
Name: Château du Cros 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel and one neutral barrel, this aromatic and compelling wine is clean, fresh and full of delicious fruit. Meyer lemon, satsuma orange and fresh pineapple are in the mix, with supporting acidity. Tasted a full day after being opened, it remained vivid and expressive.
Name: Ledger David 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This standout wine has enticing herb and mineral aromas, plus rich, unorthodox flavors that resemble fresh fennel bulb and crisp white peach along with racy acidity and a good, substantial mouthfeel. It tastes concentrated, though not overly full bodied, but most of all it has a memorable personality.
Name: Easton 2013 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A fascinatingly flavorful wine by South African Ernst Storm, this shows very perfumed apple peels, pungent green pears and telltale grass shavings on the nose, all lifted by white pepper, wet thyme and hints of dried peaches. The incredibly vibrant palate, with lots of energy and acidity yet not in a biting way, offers flavors of rainy cement, limestone, Granny Smith apple skins and more grass.
Name: Storm 2013 Presqu'ile Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This has a vibrant yellow-gold color and aromas like fresh herbs and sliced celery. Almost electric acidity pulses in the crisp grapefruit, lime and melon flavors that lead to a lingering finish. The vivid freshness and tangy texture sets it apart from the crowd, and it will work wonderfully with foods from raw oysters to roast chicken.
Name: Bodkin 2014 The Victor's Spoils Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Bright and polished, this low-alcohol wine is rounded off—to good effect—with some noticeable residual sugar. It's a luscious wine, loaded with grapefruit, lime and Meyer lemon flavors. They carry through a mouthfilling and palate-refreshing middle into a lingering finish.
Name: Upper Five 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Casa Silva is a pioneer in the chilly Paredones region, but it has taken them a few years to get this wine right. In 2014, it's there. Dusty, round, briny citrus aromas are not overly pungent or spiky. This is tangy and citric on the palate, but not unfriendly. Lime, gooseberry and sour orange flavors finish long and true.
Name: Casa Silva 2014 Cool Coast Viñedo de Paredones Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Snappy aromas of briny citrus fruits, jalapeño and bell pepper leave no doubt that this is Leyda Sauv Blanc. The palate is minerally and crisp, with juicy acidity. Flavors of lime, pickle brine, gooseberry and wet stone finish elegant and pure, with cleansing acidity.
Name: San Pedro 2014 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A mix of tropical and citrus aromas is balanced by classic Leyda scents of bell pepper and jalapeño. This is crystal clear and zesty on the tongue, with cutting acidity. Lemon, tangerine and briny notes create a citrusy flavor profile, while the finish is juicy, crisp and cleansing.
Name: Concha y Toro 2014 Marques de Casa Concha Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crystalline in appearance, this wine offers ripe fruit aromas of nectarine, kiwi and crisp Pink Lady apples, without being too flowery. Lots of minerality and lime pith appear on the lively palate, showing just a touch of tropicality but honing in on the grassy lemon-peel line. Ripe apples show on the finish.
Name: Estancia 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Showing just a hint of sweetness, this well-rounded effort offers a ripe and tangy mix of lime, grapefruit, pineapple and white peach fruit flavors. There's a touch of honey running alongside and trickling out through the finish. It's drinking at or near its peak.
Name: Melrose 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Briny aromas of bell pepper, jalapeño and canned pea are green-leaning but not overly vegetal. This has a round mouthfeel and ample body to absorb the wine's acidity, while flavors of celery, bell pepper, lime and tangerine come with a strong grassy accent and a persistent, briny tasting finish.
Name: Claro 2014 Justo Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and exotic aromas of lychee and orange-blossom water tighten up on the nose, with a more mineral-driven strain of rain on cement. It's restrained and light on the mouth-watering palate, with flavors of squeezed lemons over apples, pears, wet stone and a bit of white pepper.
Name: Kaena 2013 La Presa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Lean aromas of bell pepper and green fruits are not overly intense. This is linear, juicy and tight in frame. Flavors of lime, scallion, caper and dry cider finish racy and scouring. Good mouthfeel is a plus.
Name: Indomita 2014 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of melon and salty peaches rise to the nose on this wine from the Monterey County appellation just south of the Santa Lucia Highlands. The palate is driven by citrus, grass and a rather extreme sense of sea salt, enhanced with mouth-watering acidity and a nectarine flesh finish. It's tasty though varietally uncommon.
Name: Martin Ranch 2012 Thérèse Vineyards Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Fleshy peach, melon and papaya aromas set up a round, pulpy, full-bodied palate housing a creamy weight. Grapefruit, lime, melon and guava flavors finish a bit herbal, with shades of tarragon.
Name: Mayu 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very citrusy aromas of fresh squeezed lemons grow rounder with pear and nectarine flesh, all cut by a white rock minerality, without many of the typical grassy notes. The palate is very tight with lime juice and green apples, and driven by chalky grip and vibrant acidity.
Name: Baehner Fournier 2013 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: A fruity, forward nose of melon, citrus and guava aromas comes with a hint of match stick. Vivacious and lively on the tongue, this delivers a bolt of grapefruit flavor leading to pithy green notes of bell pepper and scallion through the finish.
Name: Matetic 2014 Corralillo Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: This wine is unusually rich, with a color is deeper and more yellow than the norm. Concentrated aromas suggest ripe honeydew melon and fig. The wine also has a plush mouthfeel and lingering finish. Full-bodied and flavorful, it will be happy to take the place of a Chardonnay at your next dinner.
Name: Peirano 2013 The Heritage Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: With light herbal and earthy aromas, and crisp citrus flavors, this is a mouth-cleansing, appetizing and refreshing drink. Tangy grapefruit, lemon and tart apple notes make it vivid and the ample acidity carries everything through to a lingering finish.
Name: Chacewater 2013 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a light-tasting, dry wine with white pepper and fennel aromas, crisp green apple and lemon flavors, and a savory, earthy nuance that adds complexity. Medium bodied and mouth-filling, this interesting wine steps outside the flavor box.
Name: Foursight 2013 Charles Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Description: Briny citrus, green melon, bell pepper and grassy aromas are 100% coastal Chile. This has a citrusy yet round palate that's lively but not overtly complex. Salty, briny flavors of lime and white grapefruit ride through the finish.
Name: Santa Carolina 2014 Specialties Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Briny citrus, match stick and yeasty aromas are a bit jumbled on the nose. The palate is minerally and nicely textured, with grapefruit, passion fruit, tarragon and lemongrass flavors. A lingering lime note hits on the finish.
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2014 Summit 2900 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Grassy aromas blend with notes of melon on a round, slightly flat bouquet. This is chunky in feel, with briny citrus flavors and a lively core acidity that keeps it moving along. Tangerine and bell pepper flavors on the finish are fitting.
Name: San Pedro 2014 Castillo de Molina Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: Like most Leyda Sauv Blancs, this pops with cool-climate aromas of bell pepper and grapefruit. It's narrow on the palate, with razor-sharp acidity and green tannins. Bell pepper and briny citrus flavors finish sharp, with a touch of sourness.
Name: Undurraga 2014 T.H. Terroir Hunter Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Lime and passion fruit aromas are subtle and appealing. This delivers a fresh, alert palate and crisp, lightly brined flavors of lettuce, apple and cucumber. On the finish, it runs peppery but not overly aggressive.
Name: Santa Alba 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of passionfruit, ruby red grapefruit and a juicy grass element show on the nose of this wine by Andres Ibarra and Caren Rideau. That ripeness tightens on the palate, with Granny Smith apple skins, yellow grapefruit juice and pressed green apples.
Name: Ibarra 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Pungent, borderline sweaty aromas of passion fruit, mango and orange peel are classic SB. This Rueda-based Sauvignon is zesty on the palate, with strict flavors of grapefruit, passion fruit and tangerine. A crisp, fresh, slightly pithy finish doesn't hurt.
Name: Montespina 2013 Sauvignon (Rueda)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: The light grassy aroma and mild citrus flavor are pretty quiet, yet this wine still comes through with a vibrant texture, crisp acidity and good, tangy finish. It should make a pleasant match with lots of appetizers, salads and creamy pastas.
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: Clean, modest lemon-lime aromas open this citrusy Sauv Blanc. Citrus, nettle, white pepper and jalapeño flavors are direct, while the finish hums with peppery spice and preserving acidity.
Name: Viña Maipo 2014 Vitral Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Description: Powdery, wayward aromas pick up more raciness and green character with time in the glass. A linear palate flat-lines at lime and green apple in terms of flavors, while the finish brings a slightly vegetal tone.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel
Name: Concha y Toro 2014 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Apple, pear and a hint of bath soap comprise the aromas on this light, friendly Sauv Blanc. Ripe white-grapefruit flavors are solid but short-lived.
Name: Carmen 2014 Wave Series Left Wave Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Gently herbaceous with a character that also allows room for a creamy texture, this is a refreshing wine with a crisp edge, always in moderation. Drink this fresh wine now.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Salty in lemon-lime, the freshness on the nose develops into riper, more defined aspects of apricot, pear and quince, with a suggestion of honey in terms of taste and viscosity. The finale is rich in swirls of vanilla cream.
Name: Chateau St. Jean 2013 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Passion fruit and citrus aromas are straightforward and a bit sharp. This feels lemony yet wan, with tangy, lean flavors of lemon-lime mixed with fresh green herbs. Notes of scallion and tarragon blend with lingering lime on the finish.
Name: Inurrieta 2013 Orchidea Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)

Description: Floral and grassy aromas, followed by apple, grapefruit and white pepper flavors, create a lively and fruity profile in this medium-bodied wine. Crisp acidity cuts through the rich texture to create good balance.
Name: Line 39 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Snappy aromas of spring peas and fresh herbs come with punchy citrus scents. This is a full-volume, summertime wine that's in good shape. Loud citrus flavors, particularly grapefruit, turn chunky before falling off on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Undurraga 2014 U Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tropical ripeness shows strong on the nose of this wine, which is made from the Musque clone out of the Carter Estate Vineyard. It shows aromas of Juicy Fruit gum, papaya-orange-guava juice and daffodils. The palate offers a honeyed red-apple flavor.
Name: South Coast 2014 Winemaker's Signature Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cut grass and cat pee aromas arise off of this appellation blend, with squeezed lime zest and dust also present on the nose. It's a textbook version of the grape, with more citrus peels and grassy elements on the palate, alit across a nicely weighted body.
Name: Martin Ranch 2013 J.D. Hurley Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: Subtle, fresh, green aromas like celery and cut grass are followed by light cucumber flavors, a soft texture and short finish. It's a delicate wine at a good price.
Name: Fetzer 2013 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A tad watery on the palate at first, this grows into cut grass, green apples, steely minerality and a touch of nectarine flesh. It's pleasant if not particularly special on the palate, with apples, pears and kiwi flesh.
Name: Acumen 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Solano County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Practically a liquid fruit salad, this smells and tastes like orange, apple, cantaloupe and banana. The texture is smooth and rounded, rather than crisp. A little buttery flavor comes through on the finish.
Name: Barrel Racer 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Solano County)

Appellation: Côtes du Tarn, Southwest France, France
Description: Grapefruit flavor is the key to this attractive, fruity wine. Crisp and lightly herbaceous, it is fresh while also having a rounder background. Drink now, but better to wait until early 2016.
Name: Domaine D'en Ségur 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Tarn)

Description: This smells taut, lean and crisp, while the mouthfeel is moderately rich, with mild flavors of pear and melon to fill it out. This wine is not a solo star but a good supporting player for lunch, wine time, or a first course at dinner, especially considering the price.
Name: Pepi 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Flowery and fresh, this is a classic cool-climate white. Fragrant acidity is balanced by the citrus and pear flavors. Fruity and crisp, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Uby 2014 No. 1 Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This is fresh and citrusy, with lemon and grapefruit aromas that lead to lightly herbal flavors. It tastes almost dry, is medium bodied, and has a good balance of crispness and straightforward fruit character.
Name: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This has a barrel-aged style, with a buttery and possibly oaky note in the aroma and a smooth texture. Mostly mellow pear and ripe apple flavors are spiced with a bit of vanilla and nutmeg. Medium bodied, it stays crisp through the finish.
Name: Save Me San Francisco 2013 Bulletproof Picasso Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This chunky, full-volume wine straddles the line between soft tropical tones and a cool, crisp character. Hard-pounding orange and grapefruit flavors finish monotone and citric. This is vital but lacks sophistication.
Name: La Playa 2014 Block Selection Tinga Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Herbaceous and aromatic with a touch of minerality, this is a crisply light wine. It is bright, cool and ready to drink.
Name: Chantebelle 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes du Marmandais, Southwest France, France
Description: This is pure Sauvignon Blanc, fresh, crisp and lightly herbaceous. It has attractive lemon flavors, a touch of saltiness and a bright, fruity texture. It is ready to drink.
Name: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Ferran Pradets Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Marmandais)

Description: Pungent, feline aromas of green citrus and passion fruit filter into a citric, pulpy palate. Flavors of mixed citrus fruits, green herbs, onion and passion fruit finish heavy, with a lingering note of pickle brine.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: With a pink-meets-tan color and funky aromas of mustard, grass and citrus, this is challenging but ultimately modest. A lean, light body is home to leesy, mustardy flavors of passion fruit and nectarine, while the finish is citrusy but also mildly bitter.
Name: De Alberto 2014 Monasterio de Palazuelos Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: The nose is faint and neutral. In the mouth, lemony acidity creates a pointy mouthfeel, while orange and lemon flavors finish bland despite getting a boost from citric acidity.
Name: Gran Verano 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This citrusy wine is all grapefruit, lime and citrus peel, with green notes poking through. Enjoyable, easy and varietally characteristic of Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Balduzzi 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Fruit salad aromas, simple apple and pear flavors and a soft texture add up to a pleasant wine. Light bodied, and balanced away from crispness, it is still enjoyable and refreshing.
Name: Buffalo Grove 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: The nose on this pulpy Central Valley Sauv Blanc is candied and otherwise neutral. Tropical fruit and citrus flavors float on an undefined palate, while the finish brings orange pith tones.
Name: Galán 2014 Private Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Lontué Valley)

Description: Modest citrus, earth and almond notes come up from the glass, and continue in the flavors of this smooth, rounded, and straightforward wine. The balance is on the soft side, and the body is quite light.
Name: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Mild citrus and grassy aromas are quiet, while this feels pithy and flat for a young wine. Tangerine and persimmon flavors are not on the money for Sauvignon Blanc, with a mildly bitter and pyrazinic finish.
Name: Alto Los Romeros 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very watery, almost scentless wine, with hints of golden apples on the nose. The palate is also lacking, showing slight pears and nectarines. The DIY label is a cute gimmick though.
Name: Scratchpad 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Chunky aromas of hay and mealy stone fruits are acceptable. This Sauvignon Blanc has a melony, creamy palate and mealy flavors of melon and papaya that match the bouquet. A yeasty, undefined finish indicates this is past its prime.
Name: Trencalòs 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Powdery bath-soap aromas are odd on the nose. The mealy palate boasts flavors of bitter melon and papaya.
Name: Autoritas 2014 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Leesy vanilla aromas are bland and don't amount to much. The palate follows suit, with additional briny melon flavors.
Name: Kon Tiki 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This has a deeper-than-usual yellow-gold color, and slight aromas and flavors that are more earthy and nutty than fruity. It is difficult to find the varietal character. It's a basic, rather full-bodied and drinkable white wine.
Name: Schmitz 24 Brix 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This smells and tastes quite buttery, which is unusual for the variety, and has a thick texture to go with it. Fruit aromas and flavors are pretty sparse, and the balance leans toward soft.
Name: Page Mill Winery 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: This wine has a rustic, unclean quality. At a high alcohol level it also tastes disjointed, all about heat without fruit.
Name: Ektimo Vineyards 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Description: This is fleshy and dilute up front, then heavy and globular in feel. Pickled melon and vegetal stone-fruit flavors finish weak.
Name: Rai 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Smoky oak and flinty overtones signal that this is a wine to keep. It is fresh and zesty right now but will reward cellaring. Underneath all that, the richly green herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc shines through, tempered by ripe fruitiness of juicy, yellow plum. Having such a symphony of flavors all at once is quite a feat. It's delicious now but full of potential. Drink 2015–2018.
Name: Tement 2012 Zieregg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Everything you'd ever want in a Sauvignon Blanc is here—and then some. Grassy, herbal, citrusy aromas set the pace, joined by some slightly feral, wooly pungency that adds even greater complexity. On the palate, it's plump and mouthwatering without being excessively tart, and lingers gloriously on the finish.
Name: Dog Point 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The Dillons Point subregion of Marlborough often produces particularly pungent examples of Sauvignon Blanc, but this wine doesn't quite hew to that mold. The herbal notes are prominent but well mannered, backed by plenty of mild citrus—think white grapefruit—and melon. Ample weight, a silky texture and a lengthy finish complete the package.
Designation: Pioneer Block 20 Dillons Point Cash Block
Name: Saint Clair 2014 Pioneer Block 20 Dillons Point Cash Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a well-balanced, well-structured white wine that's sure to evolve through 2020, at least. It's certainly attractive now, with subtle toasty notes of sweet spice and wood-grilled apple alongside hints of kiwi, sweet grass, green plum and lime. The medium-weight palate offers ample acidity and a streak of minerality that keeps things fresh and lifted through the softly spiced finish.
Name: Reyneke 2013 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and herbal from the get-go, this medium-bodied white from a great vineyard offers a lot to like. Stainless-steel fermentation gives it a lean underbelly, rounded out by sharp Meyer lemon and tangerine, buoyed by mouthwatering acidity. Green apple and an accent of honey peak on the finish.
Name: Dutton Estate 2013 Cohen Vineyard Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Classic gooseberry and pink grapefruit notes feature gentle herbal nuances on the nose. There's ample weight and texture on the palate, with a burst of mouthwatering citrus on the finish.
Name: Cloudy Bay 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp, dry and searing in acidity, this 100% varietal wine is complex, showing sour lemon and brine notes, with orange blossom tones weaving their way throughout. A delight on the palate, the wine takes on structured weight toward the finish, making sure to leave an impression.
Name: Bodkin 2014 Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Juicy, yellow pear and red apple make for that irresistible sweet-sour combination. This is so full-flavored, rounded and yet fresh that you simply want to sip more and more. If you haven't yet discovered the Sauvignon Blancs of Styria, this wine tells you what treasures await if you start looking.
Name: Polz 2013 Therese Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Grassy, herbal notes accent grapefruit and lime aromas, while riper hints of stone fruit sneak in on the palate, adding roundness and weight. Dusty, slightly chalky nuances on the finish give the impression of dry minerality.
Name: Kim Crawford 2014 Small Parcels Spitfire Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Grassy notes of green conference pear with incredibly ripe overtones of yellow plum give a fruity but non-tropical spin on Sauvignon Blanc. A strident vein of acidity keeps everything superfresh and lively. Vibrant and full of fruit, this shows what Sauvignon Blanc can do in the right climate in the right hands. The lingering citrus and fruit finish just calls for another sip.
Name: Sattlerhof 2014 Gamlitzer Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Perfumed lemon blossom is at the heart of this wine's bouquet, wrapped around a full body of lemony oak and savory herb. Complex, it's built on a core of girth and structure, but never becomes overly heavy on the palate, finishing with plenty of minerality.
Name: Paradise Ridge 2014 Grandview Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: On the nose, this shows some of the Awatere Valley's classic nettle or tomato leaf-like signature, but also hints of stone fruit and struck flint. On the palate, it nicely combines elements of stone fruit, citrus and fresh herbs, finishing gentle and easy.
Name: Yealands 2014 S1 Single Block Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a delightful, fruity white, highlighted by orange blossom and jasmine on the nose and crisp waxy green apple on the palate, with a touch of dried herb and grass. Complex and medium in weight and oak, it holds up structurally, with a juicy finish.
Name: Angeline 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This wine spent time in both new and used oak, and benefits in terms of texture and creaminess. Flavors of pear and fig are integrated into the wood, offering backbone and complexity, with a spark of fennel on the back palate. The minerally finish ends things neatly and with a certain level of intensity.
Name: Envy 2013 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Tingling lemon and grapefruit pith make for a tantalizing experience in this white made from several vineyard sources throughout the Napa Valley. Saline and wet stone provide the minerality, with a searing seasoning of lemongrass. The wine finishes on a tart, herbal note that yearns to be matched with seafood.
Name: Atalon 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a subdued struck-match aromas on this wine by Billy Wathen and Dick Dore, with apple soda, seared pear and chalky minerality also apparent. There is powerful zing on the palate, like apple slices splashed with lemon juice, altogether clean, crisp and lively, with chalky grip arising on the finish.
Name: Foxen 7200 2013 7200 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The producer continues to impress with this variety, an increasingly popular wine for her loyal followers and beyond. Rich in crème brûlée and vanilla, it's layered and well-textured, a mix of pear and orange blossom with a tropical edge that finishes with a nice lift of minerality.
Name: Merry Edwards 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Nettle, tomato leaf and ripe, juicy pear make for an intriguing aroma that is still recognizable as varietal Sauvignon Blanc but brings an individual note of ripeness. Not quite tropical it nonetheless bursts with juicy pear. If you love Sauvignon Blanc this is an intriguing facet of this variety to try. Juicy refreshment is guaranteed.
Name: Polz 2013 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Austere and steely at first, this white settles into crisp, tangy grapefruit and lemon notes, centered around a bright, medium body. The mouthfeel is crisp and clean, uncomplicated, yet well-crafted and composed.
Name: Mill Creek 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: A waft of Nilla Wafer opens the bouquet of this light, well-composed wine, followed by fruity notes of lemon and orange, a floral component at its core. Zingy, it remains balanced in the glass, lightweight with plenty of fruit.
Name: Waterstone 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Light hints of herbs and fynbos add character to the green melon, plum and grapefruit pith aromas. The palate follows with more of the same, in addition to accents of green plantain and lime leaf. This is direct and lifted, with a clean, brisk finish. Enjoy now.
Name: Mulderbosch 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Done in a super fresh, leesy, creamy style, this tastes of mineral-drenched fruit. A mix of jicama, green apple, white melon and Asian pear, it's finished with a burst of lemon that makes it light, crisp and refreshing.
Name: Township 7 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Okanagan Valley)

Description: Light, lean and lemony, this stainless-steel fermented and resultantly steely wine delivers plenty of enjoyment. Layered and nicely textured, it finishes creamy in wild vanilla.
Name: Conn Creek 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Very fruit-forward aromas of green apple, kiwi, passion fruit and even chopped scallion are pleasantly pungent on this wine by Dr. Enrique Ferro. Nectarine flesh mixes it up with white flowers on the palate, all held together by bright acidity. It taste good, but is rather powerful, reminiscent of the grassier New Zealand style.
Name: Ferro Family Wines 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Description: Herbal scents of Kefir lime leaf and hay mingle seamlessly with notes of kiwi peel and gooseberry. The palate is bright and refreshing, with lively acidity and a clean, mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
Name: Thelema 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This is clean and lively, with soft aromas of fresh grass, gooseberry and green melon rind that carry through to the palate alongside hints of underripe mango and kiwi. The acidity is bright and refreshing, resulting in a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Vondeling 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Paardeberg)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A relatively tiny offering from the winery, this white showcases a 44-acre estate site planted to the variety since the 1970s and offers subtle aromas of lemon and lime. Medium in weight and mouthfeel, it ventures into ripe kiwi and pear before ending in a lift of wet stone.
Name: Chateau St. Jean 2013 La Petite Etoile Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: A fresh but subdued nose leads to an easy-drinking, lightweight palate dominated by fresh, zingy citrus flavors. There is just a hint of that Sauvignon Blanc grassiness.
Name: Strauss 2014 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: Completely tropical-fruit-driven on the nose—think guava and mango—the palate brings additional notes of grapefruit to liven things up. A nice weight and roundness gives this wine enough presence to hold up to summer fare such as herb-marinated grilled chicken.
Name: Trump 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hinting at oak and steeped in ripe fig, this is a hearty white wine with an herbal edge, fermented in stainless steel and then aged in neutral oak. From prime spots within Dutton Ranch, it provides a layering of tropical pineapple and melon within a suggestion of lemon, finishing dry.
Name: Dutton Estate 2013 Kylie's Cuvée Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This explodes aromatically with honey and apricot and is balanced and silky on the palate, with 13.9% residual sugar. Somewhere midway through and on the finish, a hint of jalapeño provides a stark segue, before an appearance of pear and honey saves the day.
Name: Merry Edwards 2012 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Steely at first sip, and then oaky and midweight, this white reflects the vintage and the region, providing ripe creaminess and plenty of oomph. Made in a heavier style, it remains well-balanced in acidity, with a lengthy, tropical finish.
Name: Clos Pegase 2013 Mitsuko's Vineyard Musque Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Carneros)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Zesty white grapefruit and blossoms perfume this full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It's expansive and bold in mouthfeel, but swathes of freshly cut grass and crisp green plum lend freshness.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: From grapes grown in the cooler, southern reaches of the Napa Valley, this dry white exudes the time it spent in oak cask and barrel, providing a woody, sweet vanilla touch to the nose and palate. Fig and lemon rind come to the fore on the finish, accenting a medium body and length.
Name: Grgich Hills 2013 Estate Grown Dry Sauvignon Blanc Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatically generous, this displays notes of pineapple, pear and guava. The palate drinks off dry, with abundant tropical fruit flavors, but lacks the acidity to hold it all together.
Name: Apex 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a crowd-pleaser made in larger quantities that succeeds in its herbal lemongrass and suggestion of fresh-cut grass, which lovers of that style will find appealing. The finish is reminiscent of lemon curd and tastes ripe.
Name: Hanna 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Creamy vanilla and pear open this wine from a new Napa Valley producer. It offers a nice mix of minerality and fruit ripeness, before finishing a tad flat.
Name: Jack 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Creamy vanilla and fig combine around a thick texture complemented by bright, consistent waves of ripe tangerine. The finish is short, filled in by more citrus.
Name: Sterling 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County)

Description: Lively fresh-cut grass and gooseberry notes pervade on the nose and carry to the light-bodied, citrus-driven palate. A clean, flinty note offers some nuance on the brisk finish.
Name: Stinson 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: There's a slight spritziness and ripe fruit sweetness at the core of this appealing wine. The mix of mango and papaya on the palate will show well with spicier foods or at casual get-togethers. Unfussy and well-priced, it's layered and creamy with a crisp finish.
Name: Verse & Chorus 2013 Mat Kearney Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Dark color and a severe tartness make this wine challenging on the palate. It's overripe in terms of tropical fruit and bogged down by a sourness that's hard to shake. Let it open and pair it with creamy foods like goat cheese to get it to behave.
Name: Envy 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Description: This is a slightly grassy, green white wine that fans of this style may enjoy; others not so much. Light in alcohol, it has medium body and crispness.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Muddled citrus and lemongrass give way to hints of peach and guava on this easy-drinking, medium-bodied wine. While simple enough to be enjoyed as an apéritif, it can pair with herbed goat cheese when hunger pangs encroach.
Name: Doukénie 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: Citrusy and grassy, this light-bodied wine shows delicate tropical fruit tones on a perceptibly sweet finish.
Name: Bogati 2013 Black Label Club Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: Classic Sauvignon aromas of cut grass, straw, tropical fruit and crushed tomato vine mingle in the glass. The vibrant, elegant palate shows finesse and balance, delivering juicy white peach, grapefruit and green melon alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2013 Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Subtle and sophisticated, this opens with a floral and fruity fragrance of honeysuckle, peach and tropical fruit. The focused palate delivers creamy stone fruit, cantaloupe, citrus zest, mineral and a hint of candied ginger. It's impeccably balanced with fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2013 Aquilis Sauvignon (Friuli Aquileia)

Description: Still young, this has fine potential. As it matures, the ripe gooseberry and apple fruit notes will open up to yield a rich, complex and mineral wine. It will always have a tight texture along with vibrant acidity to finish. Drink from 2017.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2013 Le Domaine  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This polished, structured white opens with intense aromas of yellow peach, passion fruit, dried hay and crushed tomato vine. The linear, vibrant palate delivers juicy nectarine, creamy white peach and green melon. It's balanced, with refreshing acidity.
Name: Lis Neris 2013 Picol Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this wine, which is now being made by former Harlan Estate cellar master Adam Henkel, is fresh and boisterous with lime sorbet and lemon glacé aromas. The palate is clean and crisp yet quite tropical, with sweetgrass, mango and papaya flavors.
Name: Westerly 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A whiff of barrel smoke flows throughout aromas of fresh cut apple, pineapple and guava on the tropical-leaning nose. The palate is is fresh and light, the steely character giving way to a blend of tropical ripeness and lean cut-grass flavors on the finish.
Name: Fiddlehead 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Full bodied but elegant, this opens with aromas of crushed tomato vine, exotic fruit and a whiff of bell pepper. The ripe, round palate doles out creamy white peach, juicy nectarine, pink grapefruit, celery and mineral alongside soft but refreshing acidity.
Name: Vie di Romans 2012 Piere Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Doug Margerum blends fruit from the McGinely, Curtin, Star Lane, Happy Canyon and Grassini vineyards for this ever-popular bottling. Aromas of honeysuckle, green pears and ceanothus blossoms introduce a palate laden with white flowers, poached pears and white peach.
Name: Margerum 2013 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: The single-vineyard Enclos of Maimbray produces ageworthy wines. This is structured, with a young and vibrant character that will be become richer as it ages. A steely, mineral background to the freshly sliced apple fruits gives a strong texture. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2013 Enclos de Maimbray  (Sancerre)

Description: Structured and delicious, this opens with classic varietal aromas of tropical fruit, cut grass and crushed tomato vine. The linear palate boasts a nice depth of flavors, including juicy cantaloupe, creamy peach and a note of candied ginger. It's well balanced, with mouthwatering acidity.
Name: Elena Walch 2013 Castel Ringberg Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This delivers the best of both worlds for this aromatic grape. Crispy cut-grass notes blossom into tropical pineapple guava and green papaya. A laser focus of lime on the palate subsequently opens toward green pears, freshly cut oregano and dill, and an apple skin-driven bitterness.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2012 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: At perfect maturity, this rich and complex wine is ripe and full of the more tropical flavors of Sauvignon Blanc. Peach and pineapple are dominant, cut with acidity and tangy lemon zest. It's a full-bodied, concentrated wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2011 Domaine de la Perrière Mégalithe  (Sancerre)

Description: The winery does well with this grape, though each new vintage brings some sort of a twist or turn as far as grape sourcing, blend and overall style are concerned. Pungent with fusel oil and grass, it's not for the faint of palate. Full and flavorful on the palate, it combines sweet grasses with tree fruits, citrus and rind, showing excellent concentration and length, and finishing with a hint of ginger cookie.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Oregon)

Description: Vibrant and elegant, this opens with classic varietal aromas of elderberry flower, passion fruit, crushed tomato vine, dry hay and stone fruit. The linear palate delivers white peach, cantaloupe, juicy citrus and a vein of mineral alongside bright acidity.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2013 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Description: Made with Sauvignon cultivated in high mountain vineyards, this vibrant, firmly structured wine presents aromas of tropical fruit, crushed tomato vine and a whiff of hay. The linear palate offers passion fruit, alpine herb and fennel alongside brisk acidity that leaves a pristine finish.
Name: St. Pauls 2013 Passion Sauvignon (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Jim Clendenen project focuses on wines the winemaker makes to please his palate more so than the bottom line. This one discloses aromas of white flowers, honeysuckle, applewood and a slight nuttiness. The palate shows smoked apple, chalk and lime zest.
Name: Clendenen 2012 Stallion Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Delicate and refined fragrances convey passion fruit, white flower and an herbal note. The palate offers creamy white peach, green melon, nectarine and a light mineral vein alongside bright acidity. This wine is well balanced and loaded with finesse.
Name: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2013 Superiore Sauvignon (Friuli Aquileia)

Description: Still young with delicious tangy acidity, bright fruit and intense acidity, this is a crisp wine. It has some weight and some concentration while focusing on total freshness. The zesty, mineral texture works well and will develop. Drink from 2016.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2013 La Moynerie  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Briny citrus and green-fruit aromas reflect cold-climate origins. This is zesty yet round, with acidic grit and bite. Green pepper, jalapeño and green melon flavors finish spicy and tangy, like bitter lettuce mixed with passion fruit and tangerine.
Name: Matetic 2014 EQ Coastal Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Winemaker Christian Roguenant makes a strong series of affordable white wines from the Niven family under this label. This Sauvignon Blanc delivers aromas of lemongrass, wet stone, lime zest and white pepper. Flavors recall sipping ice-cold creek water, with refreshing notes of cut grass, honeydew melon, ripe apple and lime juice.
Name: Tangent 2013 Paragon Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, white spring flowers and stone fruit lead the nose. The savory palate doles out nectarine zest, passion fruit, yellow peach and a ginger note alongside bright acidity.
Name: Attems 2013 Sauvignon (Venezia Giulia)

Description: This barrel-fermented Sauvignon opens with aromas of toast, baked stone fruit, yellow flower and citrus zest. The round palate offers ripe yellow peach, celery, juicy grapefruit, crystalized ginger, roasted almond and vanilla bean alongside soft acidity.
Name: Attems 2012 Cicinis Sauvignon (Collio)

Description: Fresh aromas of stony minerals, white grapefruit and passion fruit are a proper opening for a zesty, cutting palate that's loaded to the brink with citric acidity. Flavors of wet stones, lime, lemon and green apple finish long, zesty and without a stumble.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2014 Coastal Cool Climate Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This vibrant wine opens with varietal aromas of cut grass, passion fruit and crushed tomato vine. The linear palate offers up yellow peach, cantaloupe and a hint of ginger drop alongside racy acidity. It offers excellent value.
Name: Cembra 2013 Sauvignon (Trentino)

Description: Lightly herbaceous, this is a ripe, lively wine. Grapefruit and lemon zest flavors are complemented by fuller apple and quince flavors. A tight minerality in the background will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine de l'Ermitage 2013  Menetou-Salon

Description: This is a ripe, fresh and fruity wine that's filled out with a tangy, mineral texture. Grapefruit and lime juice flavors give a zesty feel as well as intense acidity. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Rome 2013  Sancerre

Description: Subtle aromatics and a zing of acidity lift this steely, medium-bodied wine, buoyed by streaks of fresh-squeezed lemon and grapefruit. The majority of the grapes come from Alexander Valley, with additional components from Sonoma Valley and Knights Valley. Aging was done entirely in stainless steel.
Name: Sivas-Sonoma 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light in color and seemingly simple, this wine celebrates the virtues of fresh-squeezed citrus and peach while floating through floating clouds of air, that's how light it remains on the palate. Still, there's flavor and refreshment, all at a more-than-fair price.
Name: Taft Street 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a round style of Sauvignon Blanc, bringing out tropical fruit, ripe gooseberries and fresh grapefruit. It is a lively, bright wine from stony, chalky soil, delivering a tight mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2013 Comte de la Perrière Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Elegant and fresh, this features aromas of crushed tomato vine, green melon and a whiff of passion fruit. The vibrant palate delivers white peach, cantaloupe and a mineral accent alongside bright acidity.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2013 Sauvignon (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: This golden dessert Sauvignon Blanc smells mature, with honeyed apricot and botrytis aromas. The palate is alert, bright and just sticky and honeyed enough, with apricot, quince and honey flavors. Juicy acidity on the finish keeps this from turning cloying.
Name: Santa Ema 2012 Late Harvest Tardío Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Given time in stainless steel only, this is a crisp, lightly golden-colored wine forceful in apple, apricot and pear. Medium in weight and acidity, its vibrant refreshment lingers melodically on the palate.
Name: Noble Tree 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Michel Redde makes some attractive Sancerres, like this wine, across the river from its base in Pouilly. It is crisp and light as the vintage dictates. Green fruits, a touch of herbaceousness and lively acidity are well integrated already. Drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2013 Les Tuilières  (Sancerre)

Description: Totally grassy and herbaceous, this green, crisp wine also has a more serious, ageworthy side. There is a firm minerality here, along with a nervy, tense character that will allow it to mature. Drink from 2016.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2013 Comte de la Perrière Silex  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of passion fruit and herb leap from the glass. The round palate doles out yellow peach, nectarine, mint and a note of candied ginger alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Masut da Rive 2013 Sauvignon (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: Fruity and textured, this offers flavors of yellow and white fruits. It's crisp, herbaceous and light with attractive acidity and a full, ripe aftertaste. It's clean, beautifully fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Beauséjour 2013 Les Grenettes Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This is young of course, but the creamy richness makes it attractive even at this early stage. As it fills out, the more complex acidity and mineral texture will come forward. Drink now for the fruit, or wait until 2016 for a more complex wine.
Name: Domaine Gilles Chollet 2013  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Creamy vanilla and pear give this white a decadent edge, brought back to earth by its integrated acidity. The use of oak is not overdone and there's body and structure to spare, along with tropical-leaning flavors of papaya and pineapple.
Name: Beltane Ranch 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: There's a lot to like in this spritely, vibrant wine, well-crafted in lemony papaya and starfruit. With a small percentage of both Sauvignon Gris and Sauvignon Musque, it's made in a fuller-bodied style, with time spent fermenting in French oak, a smattering of it new, as well as stainless steel. A squeeze of lime closes things out.
Name: Chalk Hill 2013 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Chalk Hill)

Description: This linear white presents varietal aromas of tropical fruit, cut grass and crushed tomato vine. The bright, juicy palate offers green melon and white peach alongside zesty acidity that gives it a clean finish.
Name: Pighin 2013 Sauvignon (Friuli Grave)

Description: Aromas of candied citrus and bell pepper lead the nose. The firm palate offers toasted oak, baked yellow apple, vanilla and lemon drop, with the warmth of alcohol on the close. Drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the remaining fruit richness.
Name: Vie di Romans 2012 Vieris Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Gritty, gaseous aromas are demanding. This SB offers up a citric, pulpy body and slightly bitter flavors of passion fruit, orange and tangerine. Citrus pith and related bitterness blend with citric acidity on the finish, but this wine is starting to fade.
Name: Undurraga 2013 T.H. Terroir Hunter Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Round, plump aromas are a bit vegetal, with a suggestion of canned beans and peas. The palate is balanced but full. Pithy flavors of green fruits finish lightly bitter, with notes of arugula, bell pepper and lime.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Olas Del Sur Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Crushed tomato vine, dried grass and tropical fruit aromas unfold in the glass. The bright palate delivers exotic fruit, nectarine and white grapefruit alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2013 Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Punchy, feline aromas of passion fruit and grapefruit set up a citrusy, acid-driven palate that tastes of white grapefruit, passion fruit and lime. Citric flavors of lime and scouring acidity combine forces to create a lasting, racy finish.
Name: Undurraga 2014 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Aromas recall kiwi, cut grass and citrus zest. The lively palate delivers nectarine, celery and white peach brightened by racy acidity.
Name: Tenuta Fernanda Cappello 2013 Sauvignon (Friuli Grave)

Description: Fresh and with a herbaceous background, this is a tight, taut and mineral wine. It presents a definite tang of lemon zest, steeliness and a crisp aftertaste. It can be drunk now, although it will be better from 2016.
Name: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2013 Origine Blanc  (Sancerre)

Description: This pungent, zesty SB hits strongly; the bouquet is racy, citric and full of lime and passion fruit scents. A zesty, jumpy palate is charged with acidity, while flavors of lemon-lime, seashell, passion fruit and grapefruit finish with oceanic zest and length.
Name: Viu Manent 2014 Secreto Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of green bell pepper, chopped herb and crushed tomato vine lead the nose on this bright, fragrant wine. The fruity palate offers juicy white grapefruit and passion fruit alongside mouthwatering acidity. It has a clean, dry finish.
Name: Alta Luna 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Aromas of cut grass, crushed tomato vine and stone fruit come together in the glass. The vibrant palate doles out passion fruit, raw white peach, pink grapefruit and a celery note alongside refreshing acidity.
Name: Antonutti 2013 Sauvignon (Friuli Grave)

Description: Vanilla and leesy aromas create a reticent bouquet. This feels plump, chunky and oily at first, but more cut and precise with time. Green apple, canned green bean and bell pepper flavors turn more spicy and in the direction of jalapeño on the finish.
Name: Alto Los Romeros 2014 Gran Reserva Triumpheros Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Vanilla cookie and dill pickle aromas are unimpressive at first but come around with time. Round, full and balanced in the mouth, this offers tropical fruit, citrus and melon flavors in front of a round, oily-feeling finish.
Name: Ritual 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Chunky, lightly vegetal, green-fruit aromas are authentic for Casablanca SB. This has a full, slightly oily feel with girth and weight. Punchy, tart citrus and green-fruit flavors finish with lime, bell pepper and jalapeño notes.
Name: Valle Hermoso 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Waxy apple opens the nose before this tame stainless-steel aged white builds flavors of pear and vanilla extract amid a medium-bodied frame. More pear, with a wrapping of gingery spice, is featured on the finish.
Name: Napa Cellars 2013 Classic Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine puts a smokier note on the grape, with aromas of apples pan-fried in butter, yellow peaches and roasted nuts. Salty dried apples and pears meet with applewood-smoked fruits on the palate. It makes for a pleasant wine, although not varietally typical.
Name: Still Waters 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: The inaugural vintage of this wine, named for a water goddess, this offers herb, grass, lemon and peach around a medium body influenced by some oak. As it develops in the glass, tropical fruit unfurls in a refreshing spritz before settling down to a tart finish.
Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2013 Aveta Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A mix of oak and hazelnut savoriness contrasts against piquantly tart Meyer lemon and grapefruit. Everything is structured around a medium body and abbreviated finish.
Name: Treasure 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of citrus blossom, stone fruit and dried hay lead the nose of this wine. The bright palate offers unripe yellow peach, nectarine and bright acidity. Refreshing and easy-pleasing, it would be good to pour at parties and informal occasions.
Name: Botter 2014 Prodigo Sauvignon (Friuli Grave)

Description: Grassy, green aromas are mild. This feels citrusy and snappy on the palate, with herbal, grassy flavors of lime, tarragon and chives. On the finish, racy flavors touch up against vegetal but remain fresh.
Name: Emiliana 2014 Novas Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Gritty aromas of sulfur and matchstick come with citrus and field-like scents. A round but lively palate with lemon and sulfuric bitterness finishes green, briny and juicy. This wine is plump and oily, but with enough zest to maintain balance.
Designation: Del Viento Paredones Estate Single Vineyard
Name: Estampa 2014 Del Viento Paredones Estate Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Grass, citrus fruits, feline and canned green-vegetable aromas lead into a plump, round palate. Green bean, passion fruit, lemon-lime and bell pepper flavors end with strong influences of arugula and asparagus. This is coastal-driven and green, but good.
Name: Santa Luz 2014 Gran Reserva Corte Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Citrus aromas lead the nose, followed by feline notes, yeasty vanilla and green pepper scents. This wine has a citric, tangy, hard-driving palate. Flavors of orange, tangerine and grapefruit finish with zesty acidity.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2014 La Joya Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, dried hay and mint lead the nose. The bright palate offers grapefruit, pineapple and unripe yellow peach. Brisk acidity gives it a breezy finish.
Name: Piera Martellozzo 2014 Terre Magre Sauvignon (Friuli Grave)

Description: Clear to the point of having almost no color, this older white is high in acidity, offering a bite of crisp green apple and minimal to no oak presence. Tart, with wispy structure and body, it's a light quaff that will take a back seat to food.
Name: Beaucanon 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Touraine produces immediately attractive Sauvignon Blanc, fresh and light. This is typically crisp while keeping a light poise and ripe acidity. It's ready to drink.
Name: Antoine Simoneau 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Grass and mango aromas show a note of fresh white mushroom. This SB is simple, modest and round in feel. Flavors of orange and passion fruit are direct, while a plump, citrusy finish keeps things lively and in tune.
Name: MontGras 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This light, fresh and crisp wine presents cut-grass aromas and citrus flavors. It's a fragrant, bright wine ready for immediate drinking.
Name: Antoine Simoneau 2014 Domaine de la Rabelais Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This wine's personality is all peach fuzz and tropical thunder, wrapped in grassy herbs. With bristling acidity, it's refreshing and bright, with a flattened finish.
Name: Peace Water 2013 Bliss Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Despite being labeled Vin de France, this is a Gascon-style of herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc. It is crisp with gooseberries and fragrant acidity. Bright, just dry and fruity, it is a great wine to drink now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2013 La Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Aromas that recall grapefruit, medicinal herb, thyme and adhesive bandages carry over to the lean palate, along with a note of bitter almond.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2013 Sonoro Sauvignon Blanc (Friuli)

Description: Tropical aromas of mango and orange are solid as a whole. This quaffable SB is citric and layered on the palate, with lime, orange, passion fruit and grapefruit flavors. A pithy, slightly bitter note rises up on a lively finish.
Name: Santa Rita 2014 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a gentle style of Sauvignon Blanc that has just a touch of herbaceousness to go with the fresh, young grapefruit and crisp apple flavors. It's a wine to drink this summer.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2014 La Petite Perrière Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This gently ripe wine has generous apple flavors, tropical fruits and the freshest warm, rounded aftertaste.
Name: Antoine Simoneau 2014 Cuvée St-Georges Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: A blast of passion fruit is accompanied by mango and lettuce scents on a lean nose. This wine is citric and lemony in the mouth, with tangerine and lemon-lime flavors boosted by scouring acidity. The wine is one-dimensionally lean and tangy throughout.
Name: Montes 2014 Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Gritty citrus aromas are tight and crisp. This is wet, basic and zesty on the palate, but lean. Flavors of citrus, green herbs and brine finish with a mix of bitterness and notes of tangy green apple and passion fruit.
Name: Emiliana 2014 Natura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Totally fresh, crisp and lightly herbaceous, this attractive, fruity wine is ready to drink. Bright acidity cuts through the yellow and pear fruit flavors to give a refreshing aftertaste.
Name: Fiuza 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Description: This New World style of Sauvignon Blanc is ripe, intense and catty in flavor. Very herbaceous, concentrated fruits are right up front. There is no complexity, just fruit.
Name: Confrerie de Oisly et Thesée 2014 Les Gourmets Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Sourced from both the Russian River and Alexander valleys, this wine is steely and high in acidity, a tart explosion of lemon, grapefruit and green apple. It veers into the tropical midway through and finishes in a sea of vanilla.
Name: Sonoma-Loeb 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Lightly vegetal aromas of green beans and canned peas feed into a fresh, lifted, zesty palate. Similar to the nose, this tastes of canned beans and grass, while the finish is grassy and green in flavor, but fresh in feel.
Name: Anakena 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Gold in color, with waxy aromas of baked corn, toasted apple and sweat, this is juicy and acidic in the mouth, with flavors of apricot and peach. The wine shows early signs of oxidation on a waxy, honeyed finish that's braced by moderate citric acidity.
Name: Pueblo del Sol 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Juanico)

Description: Vegetal aromas of canned green beans and peas are sketchy and less than inviting. This tastes green but candied, with spritz to the mouthfeel. Flavors of asparagus, lime, mango and peas make this a vegetal, green-tasting SB.
Name: Polkura 2014 Aylin Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Aromas suggest vanilla, lees and children's vitamins. This has a plump, chunky body and weedy, grassy citrus flavors that taste bitter and oxidized on the finish.
Name: Doña Isadora 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: A continuing success story for the white from Château Margaux, this crisply herbaceous wine delivers impressive depths of flavor and texture. Lemon and apple dominate the fruitiness, with a touch of honey to contrast with the crisp acidity. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Margaux 2012 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Chalky in stone fruit, this white combines a crisp lightness of being with a creamy texture, making it satisfying on the palate, balanced and elegant, with just enough ripeness to keep it sharp. The finish continues the theme, crisply refreshing and long-lasting.
Name: Rippey 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Tart gooseberry and grapefruit notes are restrained on the nose but concentrate considerably on the palate. Dry and brisk, yet satisfyingly weighty in mouthfeel, it finishes with a cutting edge of lime and sea salt.
Name: Macari 2013 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Muted at first, this wine slowly opens, revealing a suggestion of oak, generous tropical fruit and honeydew melon. Medium to fuller-bodied in style, it holds back before going over the edge, maintaining a nice structure through the finish.
Name: Markham 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is already developing well. It has a definitely toasty character although this is integrating with the yellow fruits and hints of honey. It will age further, so wait until 2016 before drinking.
Name: Château des Tourtes 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While intensely mineral on the nose, redolent of crushed rock and smoke, the palate of this Sauvignon Blanc is remarkably fruity, bursting with fresh peach and apricot flavors. It's brisk, straightforward and primary in style, yet undeniably refreshing and quaffable.
Name: Hosmer 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Cayuga Lake)
