Description: Tart lemon and green apple make this a refreshing quaff, followed by creamy, weightier overtones of papaya and pear. Well-integrated and enjoyable, it has tannin presence and structure, finishing with a backbeat of fennel.
Name: Rutherford Hill 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Grass and gooseberry are prominent on the nose and palate in this crisp SB, bright in dialed-high acidity. That sense of vibrant freshness mellows somewhat midway through the wine, allowing it to finish with a lushness on the tongue.
Name: Coquerel Family Wine Estates 2012 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine offers generous aromatic notes of guava and pink grapefruit. Flavors are lighter in style with the concentration a bit wanting but it finishes well.
Name: 14 Hands 2013 The Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Crushed rocks and smoke mingle with savory dried herb and bramble in this lean, dry wine. Lemon-lime acidity reverberates against a core of fresh pear flavor. The finish is tight and brisk.
Name: Billsboro 2013 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A first release, this wine offers light suggestions of red apple, herbs and tropical fruit. It's medium bodied yet leaner in style with tart acids but the concentration doesn't seem all there.
Name: Va Piano 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromatically restrained, this dry, refreshing wine highlights minerality over fruit. Fresh lime and lemon flavors brighten the palate, but fade quickly on the finish.
Name: Damiani 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Made with 100% Sauvignon Blanc, this is very fresh, very crisp and herbaceous. It's all about grapefruit, lemongrass and a mineral texture. It should be aged for a few months, so drink from late 2015.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2013 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Pure Sauvignon Blanc, this is fresh and herbaceous while also having some ripe red apple and quince flavors. The wine is crisp, packed with acidity and delivers a lively, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Clos Monicord 2013 Blanche de Monicord  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: While the aromas of herbs and citrus seem a bit muddled, the flavors of ruby-red grapefruit, passion fruit and guava are crisp and sharply delineated on this mostly dry wine that is startlingly reminiscent of POG fruit juice—in a good way.
Name: Ste. Chapelle 2012 Sauvignon Blanc

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Demure on the nose with hints of dust, smoke and dried herbs, this is a dry, decidedly savory style of Sauvignon Blanc. It's crisp and spry on the palate with pleasant lemon-lime flavors, but finishes briskly.
Name: Stony Lonesome 2013 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: This light and refreshing SB offers mild apple and citrus aromas, a snappy, citric palate and basic flavors of green apple and lime. As a whole, it's a cleansing but fairly standard wine.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2014 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas recall overripe pear, tin, pineapple, grass and mineral. The lightly tropical flavors seem dilute backed by green apple-like acidity.
Name: Zero One Vintners 2013 Copper Lily Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This lightly aromatic wine offers notes of herbs and kiwi. The flavors and acid seem dilute.
Name: Corvidae 2013 Wise Guy Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine comes from a partnership between winemaker David Galzignato of Jada Winery in Paso Robles, and Mark McWilliams of Arista Winery in Healdsburg. A devotion to Sauvignon Blanc, it succeeds with this sophisticated expression of lemon chiffon and mandarin orange that's bright and complex. With two handfuls of Sémillon to the mix, it's medium in body and length, with just the slightest suggestion of caramel-vanilla oak.
Name: Mark David 2013 Transitus Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The extremely cool-climate Presqu'ile Vineyard delivers an exciting wine, with herb-bomb nose aromas of oregano, thyme, grass and rosemary, with a bit of green apple fruit on the background. There is peppery verve to the palate, where the wine bounces off the tongue with flavors of lime zest, Granny Smith apple and cut grass. It's almost spicy.
Name: Presqu'ile 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Flinty and austere, this is an elegant white wine crafted from 100% Musque clone, dancing in pear and grapefruit. The layered texture impressively stands out, riding the wave between creamy and lemony crisp with precision, opening the door for the wine to finish refreshingly.
Name: Lancaster 2013 Samantha's Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This well-crafted white is made from Sauvignon Blanc Musque, Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, with winemaker Charles Thomas tapping sites in both Napa County (67%) and Sonoma County (33%). A pretty wine, it's creamy, herbal and completely lifted by a strong sense of minerality, coasting to the razor's edge of just-squeezed lemon.
Name: Illumination 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Description: Crafted from estate Sauvignon Blanc and 5% Sémillon, this delightfully perfumey and flowery white offers creamy layers of fig, Asian pear and lemon around a full-bodied structure. With a big finish of oak, it stays on the palate in refreshing ways.
Name: McGah Family 2013 1070 Green Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though definitely grassy in the nose, this round and juicy wine has compelling freshness. Flavors of grapefruit, lime, fresh herbs and a dash of wintergreen give complexity and length.
Name: Kriselle 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The family farms 125 acres in the Russian River Valley, where the Sauvignon Blanc is planted in gravelly soils. The resulting wine is stately in bristling acidity, ripe melon, peach and a sneaky streak of jalapeño that gives intrigue. Juicy and ripe, it offers a moderate level of richness that's pleasing on the palate.
Name: Trione 2013 River Road Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This pale, clean wine shimmers like a diamond in the glass. The nose is a shape-shifter, jumping from tropical elements of honeydew, bubble gum and guava to sharper-cut grass tones. It's dynamic on the palate too, proving both ripe with stone-fruit flesh and sour with chopped herbs, green pepper and grass. A touch of crushed rocks rounds it out nicely.
Name: Ventana 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Aromas of toasted walnut, nectarine zest and dried apricot carry over to the palate, along with notes of maple syrup, lemon cream, honey and vanilla. Bright acidity stops it from being cloying.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2012 Cielo d'Alcamo Sauvignon (Alcamo)

Description: A 100% Sauvignon Blanc that was fermented in both stainless steel and neutral oak, this wine offers floral, nutty and deeply layered suggestions of structured oak. Medium to full-bodied, it's lengthy and impressive, with crispness to the finish.
Name: Salvestrin 2013 LeBlanc Crystal Springs Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: This wine packs a punch of flavor for the price, and is made in large enough quantities to find easily. Vibrant in lemon, lime and mandarin orange, it's smooth, refreshing and delicious.
Name: Girard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bill Foley named this winery after his daughters. This wine shows stark sour grass aromas at first but then reveals riper scents of dried pears, poached apples and a touch of guava. It's very fresh and both soft and striking on the palate, with lime zest and bitter pith balancing more tropical elements.
Name: Lincourt 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Aromas of peach and lemon peel prime the palate for flavors of peach, apricot, and lemon curd. It's well balanced, with flavors of ripe stone fruit and citrus that wash across the palate and leave a creamy texture in their wake.
Name: Carmel 2013 Selected Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Using fruit from Castoro, Pear Valley and Rabbit Ridge vineyards, this wine offers ripe aromas of white peach set against a steely backbone. On the palate, there is a slight pear flesh ripeness, but the green apple skin bitterness and lemon juice acidity drive the experience.
Name: Tower 15 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: A fruit basket-like mélange of fig, cantaloupe and orange, this is a crisp, light and refreshing white from a sought-after site for Sauvignon Blanc, Kick Ranch. Smooth and creamy with an unyielding minerality, it's perfect for oysters or other briny seafood.
Name: Overland 2013 Kick Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this wine from the longtime Santa Ynez Valley producer is a bit faint, with wet lawn and lemon most apparent. The palate is more sensation-based than flavor-driven, all about light texture and simmering acidity, with green apple and lime skin elements.
Name: Gainey 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Herbal jalapeño aromas invite one in initially, before the wine takes on a bright, lively acidity and components of dried fruit and nuts. Creamy on the palate while still maintaining that acid, it offers a lingering sense of fresh-squeezed lemon and grapefruit on the finish.
Name: Medlock Ames 2013 Bell Mountain Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy and dry, this single-block designated white is fresh in cut grass and hay, with a tropical edge. Composed and steely, especially on the finish, it provides plenty of richness balanced by classic acidity.
Name: Davis Bynum 2013 Virginia's Block Jane's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Grassy and tropical in papaya and melon, this SB has a creaminess that gives it substance, surrounded by fig and apricot flavors that finish crisply in lemon zest. Made from half Sauvignon Musque and half Sauvignon Blanc, the wine was mostly stainless-steel fermented.
Name: Amici 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Apricot fuzz and grapefruit burst first in this white, surrounded by handfuls of generously high-toned tangerine. The oak presence is minimal, providing texture without impeding flavor. Refreshing, the wine's finish suggests thyme and lemon verbena. Under 10% Sémillon is also in the blend.
Name: Matanzas Creek 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Effervescent in honeysuckle and papaya, this vineyard-designated white offers medium body and a long length. It becomes a rounded expression of melon and minerality on the palate that's both fresh and fruity.
Name: J. Rickards 2013 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: A blend of grapes from Washington and Oregon, this includes 25% Semillon also. As you might suspect, it's an unusual wine, opening soft and spicy, with a lightly honeyed character. Fruit flavors emphasize lemon curd and key lime, and there's a refreshing ginger ale flavor running through the fruit core.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2012 56% Washington/44% Oregon Sauvignon Blanc (Washington-Oregon)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a softer Sauvignon Blanc for those not sworn to the grassy side of the grape, as the Buellton-based winery does a lot of barrel-fermenting. Aromas include pressed kiwi and a sour pucker of lime, and the broiled pear flavors prove easy drinking, if not exceedingly complex.
Name: Dragonette 2012 Vogelzang Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Lime zest reminiscent of a gin and tonic plays on the nose in this refreshingly crisp white, accented aromatically in honeysuckle and orange blossom. Full-bodied and oak-tinged on the palate it tells the story of two wines, crisp and fulsome, with an exotic twist.
Name: Martin Ray 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Subdued in just-ripe cantaloupe, this light wine dances in lemon, lime and grapefruit, skirting the line between delightful and sour. Midweight, it allows a touch of oak on the back palate to intermingle with the fruit.
Name: Glenwood Cellars 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Sourced from organically farmed vineyards in Napa's Pope Valley, this tropical, grassy and steely Sauvignon Blanc was fermented in stainless-steel. High in acidity and ebullient in the glass, it finishes with generous green apple and lime.
Name: Phifer Pavitt 2013 Date Night Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit, cut grass and crushed tomato vine lead the nose. On the palate, hints of fresh Mediterranean herb add interest to the grapefruit and lime flavors. Firm acidity gives it a zesty finish.
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2013 Kaid Sauvignon (Sicilia)

Description: The grapes for this 100% Sauvignon Blanc are sourced from estate American Canyon vineyards as well as an estate plot in Carneros. The result is intense in oaky apple skin and tropical, fleshy lime and guava. Large French oak casks were used for aging.
Name: Grgich Hills 2013 Miljenko's Selection Essence Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose is a bit curious, with hard vanilla, smoked melon and grilled citrus. Smoke carries to the palate, with charred applewood most prominent, making for an atypical but somewhat enjoyable Sauv Blanc.
Name: Sevtap 2013 Bosphorus Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The majority of the grapes for this white that's musky on the nose was stainless-steel fermented, with 20% given time in neutral French oak. The combination provides easygoing texture, accented by notes of grass and herb. A fleck of stone fruit and papaya tease midpalate before an abbreviated finish.
Name: Uptick Vineyards 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Smooth but tangy, this offers good fresh citrus aromas and flavors, a softer-than-usual texture but a bright, clean character that stays fresh on the finish.
Name: Bota Box 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Sweet and somewhat disjointed, this 100% Sauvignon Blanc offers ripe apricot and peach before becoming slightly sour and herbal on the finish.
Name: Marilyn Sauvignon Blonde 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A very subtle hint of oak transmutes the super-fresh varietal notes into gentler stone-fruit notions of ripe yellow plum and apricot. The leesy texture of the wine lends body and weight, while the expert handling of oak adds a layer of complexity to the slumbering, ripe fruit underneath. This is delicious now but will get even better.
Name: Skoff 2011 Obegg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Full apricot and peach fruits give this wine a rich, warm character. It hasn't lost sight of its mineral, textured origins that shine through and give the wine shape. The fruit is pure on this impressive, ripe while structured wine. Drink from late 2015.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2012  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: The hinted lushness of passion fruit plays intriguingly around the straight-laced acidity of this classy Sauvignon Blanc. The body is light but profound. Very refreshing on its own or with light, delicate foods.
Name: Tement 2013 Berghausener Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Subtle yet totally inviting notes of ripe yellow pear and grapefruit skin lead to a slender palate, zippy but also edged with some spice. The textured midpalate is a wonderful counterpoint to the refreshing acidity.
Name: Wohlmuth 2013 Edelschuh Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Coteaux du Giennois, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is one of a range of three wines from different soils. Silex soil is flinty, giving, as here, ageworthy, structured wines. It is dense, powerful and with a range of steely textures that dominate the very crisp, taut and nervy fruits. Drink this from 2017.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2013 Terre de Silex Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)

Description: The distinctive old-fashioned gin bottle used for this wine doesn't detract from the quality of what's inside. The wine is rich and complex. It has both crisp herbaceous fruit and ripe spice and yellow fruit flavors that support the steely texture. This is a wine that should age, so don't drink before 2016.
Name: Domaine Landrat-Guyollot 2012 Gemme de Feu  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: From a good Sancerre vintage, this is a rounded and ripe wine with both structure and a tensely mineral texture. It also has white fruits that combine with acidity and lemon juice to give a wine that is just in balance. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2012 Thauvenay  (Sancerre)

Description: Grapefruit zest and chervil meet in a happy union that suggests riper fruit the longer this stays on the palate. There is a little heat but lots of acidity, as well as midpalate texture and layers of citrus interspersed with yellow plum. Intense, concentrated and age-worthy, with a lasting citrus finish.
Name: Sattlerhof 2013 Sernauberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Hints of ripe yellow pears with just a suspicion of passionfruit dominate the nose. The palate is intense and balanced, the lushness of the fruit brightened by a tight streak of refreshing acidity. Racy and versatile.
Name: Wohlmuth 2013 Hochsteinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Coteaux du Giennois, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is part of the range of three wines from different soils. Marne, or clay and chalk soil, is relatively heavy and produces a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc. This brings out the more tropical fruits and ripe pineapple that dominate the youthful acidity that cuts through the texture. Drink from 2016.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2013 Terre de Marne Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal comes from two standout vineyards—Boushey (70%) and Red Willow.Made with native yeast and barrel-fermented, it is aromatically mesmerizing with kiwi, lemon oil and herbs. As opulent as the aromas seem, the wine is quite restrained in style with a panoply of citrus and stone fruit flavors framed by vivid, mouthwatering acidity.
Name: Avennia 2013 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This wine does take time to open up but convinces with a spicy freshness dominated by lemon zest and a suggestion of wet pebbles. Concentrated yet subtle, this deserves some aging but is delicious right now.
Name: Tement 2013 Grassnitzberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Initially this is closed, but slowly some leesy notes appear. While some may look to Sauvignon Blanc for its usually overt aromatics, in this wine the creamy but streamlined midpalate texture is the real interest. For those who like their Sauvignons restrained and very food-friendly.
Name: Neumeister 2012 Moarfeitl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: From cellars in the heart of the village of Pouilly-sur-Loire, the seventh generation of the Masson family produces this classic Pouilly Fumé, structured and full of ripe fruits. It is a wine for aging, with its tense minerality and tight texture that parallel the fruitiness. Wait until 2016.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2013  Pouilly-Fumé

Appellation: Capay Valley, Central Valley, California, US
Description: There is no mistaking this for any other variety, with its unapologetic grassy aromas and snap-pea flavors, crisp balance, nervy texture and lively finish. Very refreshing and alive, it will be great with fresh cheeses and practically all kinds of seafood.
Name: Casey Flat Ranch 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Capay Valley)

Description: Rich and full in the mouth, this is a ripe, tropical fruit flavored wine. With a year in bottle, the herbaceousness has softened and become rounded. The wine is still tangy and mineral at the end, and could age further, but is ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Sancerre 2012  Sancerre

Description: Celery, lemon and zesty grapefruit are the dominating aromatic trio on this slender, moreish offering. The palate is balanced—even rounded—for such a slender, zippy and refreshing wine. The aromatic intensity becomes even more pronounced on the palate.
Name: Skoff 2012 Kranachberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Coteaux du Giennois, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is another of the three bottlings from different soils. The Caillotte or limestone soil has produced a ripe and tensely textured wine. With intense acidity and a strongly herbaceous character, it's a complex wine that needs to age. Drink from 2016.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2013 Terre de Caillotte Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)

Description: Tulip blossom, fresh green apple and feisty lemon acidity play on the palate of this wine that offers flavorful refreshment. The lasting length suggests hidden depths worth plumbing.
Name: Neumeister 2013 Klausen Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Zesty lemon paired with riper tropical notes of pineapple counter the racy acidity of this full-flavored wine. This takes time to open up but the intense palate is worth the wait. So serious it should be had with food.
Name: Skoff 2013 Kranachberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: The style of this young wine is for ripe fruit as well as really crisp acidity. Bright lemon flavors are combined with yellow fruits and only the slightest hint of herbaceousness. This is already well balanced, although it will be even better from the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2013 Thauvenay  (Sancerre)

Description: The producer adds a small percentage of Pinot Blanc to the wine to great effect, combining seamlessly with the Sauvignon Blanc and resulting in notes of honeydew, green fig and subtle herb. The blend offers layers that are both fresh and fruity.
Name: Flying Horse 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: From the Touraine cru area of Chenonceaux, this is Loire Sauvignon Blanc at its ripest. It has a rich texture and and round apple and lime flavors. Coming from selected parcels, it conveys concentration as well as final freshness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Vieil Orme 2012 Inphini Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Hailing from the coolest section of Colchagua's coastline, this is almost neutral on the nose except for some citrus and sweaty notes. The palate is full, chunky and noticeably more creamy than past vintages. Grapefruit, passion fruit and briny flavors finish full and citrusy. Drink now.
Name: Koyle 2013 Costa Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: From the winery's signature vineyard and old Sauvignon Blanc vines, originally planted in 1959, this wine offers complexity and intrigue. Flavors range from crisp lemon to savory fennel and herb, a long, lingering finish sealing the deal.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2012 To Kalon Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This smells typical of coastal Chilean SB, meaning it's citrusy and green, but the nose seems a touch flat. Not so the palate, which is snappy and juicy. Flavors of grapefruit and passion fruit lead the way, with a backing of green bean and mild bell pepper controlling a crisp, fresh finish.
Name: Errazuriz 2014 Max Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

Description: Alert but a bit yeasty on the nose, with notes of citrus, tropical fruits and green herbs filling things out, this is weighty and mature, with acidity to spare but also some creaminess to the palate. Briny, salty flavors of orange, tangerine and lime finish long and reflective of the Pacific Ocean, which isn't far from the vineyard that yielded this new-to-the-market SB.
Name: Kalfu 2013 Kuda Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A fragrant nose of citrus and ripe pear make for an aromatic opening, while the palate is grassier, tighter and more linear than the ripeness on the nose may suggest. Incredibly refreshing.
Name: Wohlmuth 2013 Steinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: A soft and ripe wine, full of apricot and apple fruitiness. An intense background of acidity shines through the rich flavors and brings out a more tangy character. It's not for long-term aging; drink now for its fruit and freshness.
Name: François Millet 2013 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)

Description: Intensely herbaceous, this is grassy, crisp, catty—all the flavors that come from young, cool-climate Sauvignon Blanc are here in bucketsful. It is delicious, refreshing and aromatic. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine Landrat-Guyollot 2012 La Rambarde  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: The gentlest suggestion of very ripe yellow plums gives way to an earthier element. Meanwhile the palate remains fresh with an interesting finish that offers the same pleasant bitterness you get from radicchio and castelfranco.
Name: Skoff 2012 Obegg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Mineral and wet stone are a pleasant entry into this wine, which continues into flavors of pretty pear, melon and citrus. The presence of oak on both the nose and palate is not overwhelming.
Name: Kalaris 2013 Kalaris Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Intriguing with bites of melon, stone fruit and bristling acidity, this bright, fresh white wine maintains a level of tension and creaminess. It balances the two personalities against each other with aplomb, before losing some of its luster on the finish.
Name: Round Pond 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: Light, lemony and crisp, this refreshing wine has some layers of complex herb midpalate and remains bright in acidity through the finish. From both the Miller Ranch in Yountville and Soda Creek Vineyard.
Name: Silverado 2013 Miller Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Intensely young and closed up, this is a wine for some good aging. The fruit is all there behind the tight structure and acidity. As it develops, the wine will reveal ripe white fruits that are cut with lemon-zest acidity. It needs to age longer, so drink from 2016.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2013  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Despite showing sulfur and matchstick on the nose, this smells crisp, oceanic and a touch green, like pole beans. The mouthfeel is crisp and stony, with minerality. Flavors of lime and green apple finish chalky and mildly bitter. This is quite typical for the coastal Leyda region.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2014 Reserva Privada Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Light lemon-lime aromas and fresh fruit flavors make this refreshing, crisp and lively. Not at all heavy, it's well-balanced, has good acidity and tastes dry.
Name: Paul Dolan 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Description: Fuzzy apricot skin and peach form the backbone of this white that's stainless-steel and neutral-oak fermented, giving just a suggestion of barrel age. Tingly in acidity it's a balanced wine with oomph.
Name: Jericho Canyon Vineyard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Textbook Leyda Valley aromas of grapefruit, passion fruit, lime and ocean spray open this spritzy, citric SB. Flavors of crystallized mango, pineapple and lime are a touch candied, while mild notes of grass and bitterness infiltrate the finish.
Name: Santa Ema 2014 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This grassy, citrusy and streamlined number offers Sauvignon Blanc in a subtle but ripe guise with oodles of tart passionfruit.
Name: Skoff 2013 Classique Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: The Xavier Flouret brand covers the world, but its Sancerre is always among its most consistent. It is balanced, fruity and only lightly herbaceous. Touches of white currants add to the fruitiness of this ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2013 Domaine la Gemière French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Description: This attractive, ready-to-drink wine is both fruity and structured. With vines in Sainte-Gemme, to the north of the city of Sancerre, Berthier has produced a bright and crisp wine, full of grapefruit fruits and a strongly mineral, zesty texture.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2013 Domaine des Clairneaux  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Tangy citrus and crisp green apple aromas and flavors light up this snappy wine. It smells like lemon and grapefruit with a typical touch of grassiness, and tastes lively, similar to lemon and grapefruit zest, but not too tart. It's medium bodied and finishes smoothly.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2013 High Elevation Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This is full, ripe and strongly mineral. Its young apricot and citrus fruits are very fresh, bright and have a sense of structure with minerality and zesty, tangy lemon peel. With its good depth of flavor, it is ready to drink.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2013 Passeport  (Sancerre)

Description: A truly herbaceous, juicy wine from the cool climate of Touraine. It has bright, crisp, pure lemon flavors, light and fruity. A light minerality gives texture. A wine to drink now.
Name: Domaine Joël Delaunay 2013 Domaine Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Millet's Bué vines are in one of the classic chalk terroirs of Sancerre, and this wine revels in the richness of the fruit and brightness of the acidity. It does have some grassy herbaceousness, although this is broadened by the warm fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: François Millet 2013  Sancerre

Appellation: Coteaux du Giennois, Loire Valley, France
Description: Crisp and fresh, this is a soft style of Sauvignon Blanc that brings out pineapple and apricot flavors as much as herbaceousness. A streak of lemon and pink grapefruit acidity is well integrated into the riper fruits. The aftertaste adds bright acidity to the mix.
Name: Vignobles Berthier 2013 Domaine de Montbenoit Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)

Description: Initially this is minerally on the nose but not overly fruity, with notes of grass and green bean. The palate is fairly crisp despite being round and mouthfilling. Flavors of papaya, grapefruit and green banana finish with controlled pithy bitterness.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2014 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Yeasty vanilla and mild vegetal aromas lead the way on this otherwise neutral-smelling SB. The palate is lively but more generic than specific; flavors of bell pepper and asparagus dot the picture, with lime and grapefruit also apparent. A salty, briny finish may stem from the ground water used to irrigate this desert-origin new SB.
Name: Kalfu 2013 Sumpai Huasco Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Description: Not your usual SB, this full-bodied version combines herbal, savory aromas and mineral flavors with a fairly rich texture and lingering finish. It's complex and satisfying, and will pair well with rich seafood.
Name: Bogle 2013 Bogle Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Barrel-fermented and blended with a splash of Sémillon, this is a creamy, rounded and concentrated white, intense in vanilla and apricot flavor.
Name: Bougetz 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Marmandais, Southwest France, France
Description: Grapes from the vines around the 13th-century castle of La Bastide are sent to the Marmandais co-op for a separate bottling. This smooth and ripe wine shows plenty of rich mango and apricot flavors cut by lime acidity that gives a lift of freshness. Drink now, although the wine will age until 2018.
Name: Cave du Marmandais 2013 Château la Bastide Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Marmandais)

Description: A subtle mix of ripe fruit notes of red apple, melon and slight pineapple play on nose and palate. There is a phenolic edge and very clean-cut acidity.Simple but effective.
Name: Sattlerhof 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Lime, green bean and asparagus notes vie for leadership on the nose. The palate is plump, round and a touch creamy, then coastal flavors of green bean, green apple and raw asparagus take over and finish with an oily texture and mildly bitter flavors.
Name: Santa Ema 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Dusty, yeasty citrus aromas show some grit and harshness. The palate is chiseled and acidic, with tart flavors of orange, lime and green herbs. Fresh and highly quaffable, this is the kind of wine to drink with shrimp salad or raw oysters.
Name: Peñalolen 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Bell pepper, jalapeño and brined bean aromas straddle the line between snappy/citrusy and vegetal. This has a round palate with weight and punch. Flavors of grapefruit, tangerine, lime and bell pepper hint at vegetal, while the finish is plump and feels fresh.
Name: Siegel 2014 Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: The wine is soft, gently herbaceous and fresh. Grapefruit and gooseberry flavors are bright, steely and fruity in this clean wine that's ready to drink.
Name: Sauvion 2013  Sancerre

Description: Fresh and inviting aromas of fynbos, gooseberry and lime leaf leap from the glass of this value-priced Savvy. The palate is light and crisp, with a lemon-lime note that finishes brisk and refreshing. Easy to drink and immensely accessible; drink now.
Name: Spier 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Aromas of fresh-cut grass, citrus peel and yeasty dust are typical of the Casablanca region. A round mouthfeel offers proper acidic cut, while flavors of grapefruit, lime and bell pepper finish green but fresh.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2014 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Green apple and lime aromas are well presented and clean. This has a citrusy feel to go with lime, passion fruit and grapefruit flavors. A mildly pithy and citric finish delivers plenty of youthful kick.
Designation: Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve
Name: Viña Requingua 2014 Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Pungent but usual passion fruit and tangerine aromas are slightly sulfuric. The palate is lean, zesty and citric. Snappy lemon, lime and gooseberry flavors show a hint of bell pepper prior to a juicy finish with sour apple notes.
Name: William Cole 2014 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Aromas of celery, arugula, snap pea, dusty apple and citrus announce a clean palate with scouring acidity. Lemon-lime and grapefruit flavors are typical of Casablanca SB, while a fresh, citrusy finish brings a green-herb element into play.
Name: Root:1 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Light and crisp, this is an open, bright and lightly herbaceous wine. Green fruits and lime juice are dominant along with a fresh, bright texture. It is ready to drink.
Name: Marquis de Goulaine 2013 Les Lorys  (Sancerre)

Description: A single-vineyard wine, this is rich, not too herbaceous while full of grapefruit and lemon zest flavors. It's full bodied, rich in the mouth and finishes with a mineral, tangy aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Joël Delaunay 2013 La Voute Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Green apple is the lead aroma along with yeasty vanilla and a dash of white pepper. There's modest roundness to the palate and nonscouring bright acidity. Slightly candied lime and mango flavors feature controlled bitterness on the finish.
Name: Santa Ema 2014 Select Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a soft, simple wine with attractive, clean acidity and a good splash of grapefruit and gooseberry. It's fruity, lightly textured and fresh. Drink now.
Name: Dauny Père et Fils 2013  Sancerre

Description: This largely neutral-smelling SB shows minor aromatic hints of pool chlorine and lemon rind. The palate is citrusy and generally well cut, with flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and tart apple that finish with a note of bitterness and green herbs.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Pungent and green on the nose, this is showing cool-climate aromas. In the mouth, this is shear and tangy, with a high level of citric acidity. Flavors of lime, Granny Smith apple and asparagus finish briny, crisp and scouring.
Name: Aresti 2014 Trisquel Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A ripe wine, blended from fruit from across Touraine, this lively, smooth wine has a touch of sweetness at the end. That makes for a wine that's ready to drink with a soft aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Joël Delaunay 2013 Le Grand Ballon Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A cool, fresh wine that is packed with crisp herbaceous flavors. It's as clean as a whistle and deliciously bright with lemon, pink grapefruit and gooseberry flavors. Drink now.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2013 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This is a creamy style of Sauvignon Blanc, bone-dry while softly textured. Balanced, fresh and with attractive green apple flavors, it is ready to drink.
Name: Danielle de l'Ansée 2013 Cuvée DA Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Fresh on the front end, this offers lean, citrusy aromas suggestive of grapefruit and lime. A citric, cutting palate brings lime, green apple and pickled mango flavors in front of a zesty but basic finish. Drink now.
Name: Echeverria 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Herbal notes of fynbos, lime peel and green melon rind lead the nose and palate of this straightforward yet refreshing quaff. It's bright, lightweight and ready to drink now.
Name: Beau Joubert 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Stony lemon-lime aromas are low on fruit but clean and familiar. This is racy and fresh, with cutting acidity. Flavors of lime and passion fruit register as common, while the finish is zesty, with an emphasis on grapefruit.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Petirrojo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This is entirely neutral on the nose, then dull-edged on the palate. Flavors of papaya, green banana and bell pepper don't offer much beyond the basics, while this finishes soft and mildly bitter.
Name: Siegel 2014 Crucero Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Tropical mango and pineapple flavors give this attractive wine an exotic character. It does have some herbaceous character but it is more about ripe fruits and a light texture. Drink now.
Name: Paul Buisse 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Lime, green bean, asparagus and a blast of punchy sweat greet you on the nose of this zesty, acidic, lean-bodied SB. Limited, tight flavors of lemon, lime and bell pepper finish tart and gritty, with a suggestion of sourness. Tasted two times with somewhat mixed results; this note and score reflects both tastings.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2014 Los Vascos Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Grassy, lightly vegetal aromas of briny gooseberry and asparagus come in front of a citric palate. Flavors of citrus fruits, green bean and asparagus finish crisp but green, with scouring acidity.
Name: Santa Carolina 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Marmandais, Southwest France, France
Description: Bright and herbaceous the wine is on the cusp between cool, fresh flavors and more tropical richness. It has a perfumed character, bright and crisp citrus and warmer apricot fruits. Drink now.
Name: Cave du Marmandais 2013 Ferran Pradets Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Marmandais)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Bright, soft and herbaceous, this has a touch of sweetness as well fresh fruit. Citrus and gooseberries abound with only the lightest structure to hold it together.
Name: l'Escargot 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: It's rather understated in flavor, and more smooth and round than typical for the variety. This is a good, rich-textured, medium-bodied wine with straightforward flavors.
Name: Pomelo 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Hailing from the interior Maipo Valley, this SB is oily up front, with an aromatic note of gooseberry and lime. A round mouthfeel matches the nose, while pithy lime and white grapefruit flavors finish melony and oddly honeyed.
Name: Tres Palacios 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: There's a pickled scent, but no fruit on the nose. This is pinched on the palate, with underripe, nutty, oily flavors of spent white fruits and bitterness.
Name: Maray 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling masterfully handles the young appellation's tropically inclined fruit, with apple candy aromas and a soft, rich mouthfeel. The flavors nod briefly toward the traditional greener, grassy side of the grape, but it's a smoother experience, less biting, with a hint of barrel smoke.
Name: Fiddlehead 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: With a handful of Viognier blended in, and nine months spent in new French oak, this wine offers deep layers of melon and peach surrounded by a wall of floral aromatics. Delicious and ripe, the wine holds enough structure to hold well for another couple of years.
Name: Hall 2013 T Bar T Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: This beautifully brings out and blends the crisp citrus side of the grape variety along with a touch of riper fruit flavor that's shaped by oak aging. It offers classic, grassy aromas, thirst-quenchingly tart flavors and very light touches of vanilla and nutmeg.
Name: Hourglass 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Subtle in honey and grapefruit, this is a playful wine, vibrant in acidity and swirls of lemon zest that make it simultaneously refreshing and intriguing. Oysters are the obvious call.
Name: Galerie 2013 Equitem Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

Description: Pretty in honeysuckle and gardenia, this bright wine, blended with 5% Sémillon, recalls fresh-squeezed lemonade before the sugar, refreshing and intensely delicious. The acidity is balanced by enough weight to dial the volume down and flavors of rich, lush melon.
Name: Starmont 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Floral and exotic, the tingling acidity in this wine is the standout, but it's equally buoyed by a mouth-filling texture adorned by a sensation of fresh-squeezed lime and grapefruit. Balanced, this lovely Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc should convince one and all of the variety's regional merit.
Name: Joseph Phelps 2013 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: Wild vanilla and white peach intermingle in this substantial wine, entirely well-composed in round layers of tropical pineapple and juicy citrus. The oak is subtle and gives the finish a lift, accenting the vanilla.
Name: Galerie 2013 Naissance Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This elegant but firmly structured white wine opens with an alluring fragrance of honeysuckle, exotic fruit and cantaloupe. The linear palate offers juicy white peach, apricot and mineral alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Tenuta San Leonardo 2013 Vette Sauvignon Blanc (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This very approachable and likable wine puts the typical dried-grass aromas atop stone fruit scents. The palate is very herb-tinged, with parsley, thyme and rosemary finding a nice symbiosis with the riper nectarine and melon flesh.
Name: J. Lohr 2013 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Doug Margerum presents a very steely nose on this wine, which picks up some red apple and cinnamon intrigue as well. The palate is all about finding a great tension between bitter citrus rinds and riper fruits like pineapple, proving both refreshing yet intellectual at the same time.
Name: Margerum 2013 D Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: The addition of 5% Sémillon proves to be the right call in this white, a structured, spritzy glass of tree-ripened apricot and exotic lemongrass with a pleasant heft to the palate. A twist of ripeness gives a mouthwatering, juicy finish.
Name: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2012 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Steely citrus marks the opening of this wine, complemented by the addition of 7% Sémillon. Grapefruit, ripe apple and pear intermingle nicely before the weighty wine adds creaminess to the midpalate and finish.
Name: Hill Family Estate 2013 Tiara Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: There's a distinct freshness to this wine. Stainless-steel fermented and aged, it's high in acidity with enough spirit to feel almost effervescent. Lightly textured tastes range from pineapple to papaya, a squeeze of Lemonheads candy on the long finish.
Name: Clos du Val 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A quirky blend of aromas arise off of this wine, from yellow melon and honeydew to toasted pound cake and a tiny bit of reductive skunkiness. It's also interesting once sipped, with yellow cupcake, crushed Italian herbs and kiwi-driven acidity that morphs into an almost-buttery finish.
Name: Coquelicot 2012 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: The aroma of this sleek, dry wine made from organic grapes is subtly herbal. Flavors suggest crisp green apple and kiwi, and it has a crisp balance, smooth texture and very clean finish. It shows a sophisticated restraint that will pair well with any number of appetizers and seafood courses.
Name: Alta 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Peach and lime play off each other in this well-integrated, mineral-laden white that's medium bodied and bright. The finish is a pleasant mix of lemongrass and Meyer lemon.
Name: Dominican Oaks 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A punch of lemon opens up on the palate of this medium-bodied, textured white that features an interesting combination of bright, sour fruit and subtle acidity. From the cooler region of Oak Knoll District in southern Napa Valley, it offers minerality and depth.
Name: Malk 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Inviting in jasmine aromas, this medium-bodied, 100% Sauvignon Blanc tastes of ripe grapefruit lightly sprinkled in sugar, a nice mix of acidity and texture with a burst of sun-ripened Napa Valley fruit. The finish is long and satisfying.
Name: Rock Wren 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Description: Light and crisp, this delivers straightforward lemon, lime, grapefruit and melon around soft, simple textures, making it both juicy and inviting.
Name: Franciscan 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a wood-aged wine, rich and with a mix of toast, spice and citrus flavors. Acidity cuts through the richness, making it full-bodied while fresh. Still young, the wine needs time to integrate the wood with the fruit. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: The winery has made SB since 1982, blending in Sémillon and barrel-aging in new oak to craft a fuller style of the wine that's well structured. In this vintage 16% Sémillon was used and barrel fermentation took place in 15% new oak. The result: a light, ethereal wine abundant in tropical aromas and flavors that's crisp on the palate.
Name: Duckhorn 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fruity and slightly effervescent, this is a classic California Sauvignon Blanc. Balanced and lingering in crisp melon and tropical fruit, it provides enough creamy texture to go well with food.
Name: Quivira 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Tropical and creamy, the aromas thick in grapefruit and pineapple, this light, citrus-tinged, refreshing 100% Sauvignon Blanc is well-balanced and easy to enjoy, approachable with some depth.
Name: J. Lohr 2013 Carol's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from the Estrella District walks the entire rainbow of the varietal, with chopped dill, fresh oregano, yellow rose and guava nectar on the nose. On the palate, it goes in reverse, starting with tropical elements of passion fruit before bending toward the sharper, grassier side of the grape.
Name: Vina Robles 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: Aromas of almond skin on top of minerally apple are nice yet somewhat neutral. Bright on the palate, this is a clean version of Sauvignon Blanc showing citrus, apple cider and melon flavors. A mellow finish with modest acidity is just refreshing enough.
Name: Eresma 2013 Sauvignon (Rueda)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Managed acidity provides the backbone to this white. A taste of stone fruit, namely peach and apricot, figures in most prominently. A curious herbal streak weaves itself in and out on the palate, giving the wine an earthy edge.
Name: Quivira 2013 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: An affordable wine that'll please a host of palates, this SB was fermented in stainless steel before 40% of it spent two months aging in new French oak. The result is a florally aromatic wine with straightforward layers of pineapple and vanilla and juiciness on the finish.
Name: Michael Pozzan 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This ethereal, crisp white is pretty in guava and melon, approachable, easy to enjoy and not fussy. The majority of the experience is in the beginning and midpalate.
Name: Courtney Benham 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A whiff of grass opens on the nose in this wine. Stainless-steel fermented, it's crisp, dry and clean, with flavors of papaya and apricot.
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2013 Silver Spur Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A touch of 7% Sémillon rounds out this Sauvignon Blanc, the fruit from both Rutherford and Yountville in the heart of the Napa Valley. Subtle on the nose, it offers elegant layers of tart squeezed lemon and a bite of melon.
Name: Heritance 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fragrant in floral jasmine and tropical aromas, this light, lean Sauvignon Blanc stays fresh in the glass.
Name: Worthy 2011 Five Clones Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This full-bodied, creamy blend of Sauvignon Blanc and 9% Sémillon is rich in tropical aromas and flavors, layered and slightly honeyed in a finish of ripe fruit.
Name: Whitehall Lane 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A full-figured white dancing in pear and apple Jolly Rancher, it features a strong taste of oak on the palate followed by accents of lemon zest.
Name: Kobler 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Pineapple and mango play off each other in this tart, fleshy and fuller style of the variety, with a finish that goes on and veers ripely sweet.
Name: Flint & Steel 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Refreshing honeydew and lime open the nose in this crisp white, followed by a strong floral sense akin to Gewürztraminer. Flavors of fig finish things off.
Name: Mason Cellars 2013 Yount Mill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Citrus and gooseberry aromas are mild but typical of the variety. A basic citrus palate delivers modest tangerine and nectarine flavors which lead to a mild, pithy finish showing light citric notes.
Name: Zagarrón 2013 Garbeo Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)

Description: Aromas of passion fruit, citrus and green leaf tones follow through to a juicy palate showing lightly vegetal flavors. The finish is mellow in feel, with grassy, green notes.
Name: Naia 2013 S-Naia Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: Totally herbaceous, this fruity wine has grassy aromas and gooseberry flavors. It's crisp, fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented and aged, it's lightly aromatic with notes of herbs and kiwi. The palate is medium-bodied with sweet tropical fruit flavors but the concentration doesn't seem there.
Name: Valley View 2012 Anna Marie Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Not at all a typical Sauvignon Blanc, this smells like apricot and honeysuckle and tastes like marmalade. It is dry, yet tastes like a late-harvest dessert wine. Expect a little taste adventure here.
Name: Schmitz 24 Brix 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: There aren't many $4 wines out there, but this is actually quite decent. Yes, it's a touch flat and creamy on the nose and the palate is slightly disjointed, but the wine's peach, melon and apple flavors are reasonably good. Drink now.
Name: Felix Solis 2012 Flirty Bird Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Citrus peel, melon and peach aromas are ordinary. This feels pithy and citric, while flavors of white grapefruit and underripe stone fruits finish almondy and bitter.
Name: O. Fournier 2013 B Crux Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: While the wine is definitely herbaceous that crispness is softened by the ripe fruits that also give currant fruitiness and an attractive aromatic aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
Name: Avant-Garde 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a touch mealy on the nose, with ripe stone-fruit and melon aromas. A juicy, direct palate follows, with citrus and green-fruit flavors that finish quick and clean.
Name: Zagarrón 2013 Hacienda Zargón Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)

Description: Pungent and sweaty on the nose, the palate brings a heavy mouthfeel showing pithy flavors of citrus and almond skin.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: The palate shows modest citric acidity which sets up a flavor profile of sulfur, grapefruit and tangerine. Pyrazines and bitterness run roughshod on the finish.
Name: Bodega Atamisque 2013 Serbal Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Description: Soft, bland aromas of applesauce and herbaceous green fruits lead to a jumbled, acidic palate that's awkward and scouring. Green flavors of lime and grass finish tangy.
Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2014 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of chewable vitamins, apples and pine needles set up a plump, soft palate of bland, pithy grapefruit flavors.
Name: Monterebro 2013 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Prickly, sweaty aromas include matchstick and herbaceous green-fruit notes. In the mouth, this is chunky yet citrusy. Flavors of grassy citrus trend toward green, while a pithy, citric finish is bitter.
Name: Verum 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Description: Yellow in color, the nose is soapy, with odd notes of shampoo and yeast. The palate is adequate, with tropical fruit flavors which fall flat and bitter on the finish.
Name: Emina 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The grape's stereotypical green nose gets a whole new interpretation, with aromas of sunburned hay, bags of desiccated grass and wild oregano. The herbaceous characters carry the palate, but it's smooth with thyme and chile verde flavors, and a lingering bit of citrus tartness and tannic grip.
Name: Mercy 2013 Zabala Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: With rich melon aromas, ripe apple flavors and a soothing, almost soft texture, this wants some rich, sophisticated cooking to go with it, like sautéed fish with a classic French sauce. Subtle acidity keeps the notes of almond and apple lingering on the finish.
Name: Wildhurst 2013 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp citrus aromas and fresh lemon and grapefruit flavors define this medium-bodied, appetizing and unapologetic wine. With lots of personality, a tingly texture and tangy finish, it's just the thing for appetizers and first courses.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2013 The Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From vines now a dozen years old, this unusual Walla Walla AVA Sauvignon Blanc is a brilliant straw color—aromatic with light scents of ripe grain and tangy fruits, and fills the mouth with delicious flavors of melon, white peach, lemon verbena and a dash of pepper. Complex and engaging, it finishes dry but leaves an impression of slight sweetness. Drink it slightly chilled.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Grapefruit rind jumps out of the glass in this vivid, balanced and refreshing white that also carries a complex mix of lime, more grapefruit and the tiniest suggestion of fresh-cut grass. A creaminess to the texture rounds things out and soothes the edges.
Name: VML 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle flavors, great balance and some mineral complexity add interest. It is tangy, refreshing and just a bit restrained until the finish, where it opens up and stays with you.
Name: Bink 2013 Randle Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Tasty and well integrated, this offers fresh fruit flavors married to subtle oak nuances. It's medium bodied and balanced in acidity, which bolsters the ripe fruit flavors, vanilla and baking spice accents.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2013 Asbill Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Aromas of pink grapefruit, grass and coriander seed open the palate of this wine. Passion fruit, apricot, green apple and freshly chopped parsley mark the palate, with a touch of iodine on the finish.
Name: Sula 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Nashik)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Almost entirely fermented in stainless steel, it has unquestionable acidity captured in the bottle, without a sacrifice of ripe, juicy peach fruit. Lemongrass lingers on the tail end.
Name: Fritz 2013 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Nevada County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very tasty and fresh, this well-balanced wine combines tart citrus aromas with rich lime peel and melon flavors. Mostly fermented in tank, 15% was barrel fermented, which would account for the smoothness and roundness in texture.
Name: Sierra Starr 2013 Solstice Sauvignon Blanc (Nevada County)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: With wood aging, the Sauvignon Blanc has developed vanilla flavors that are currently smothering the fruit. Ginger dominates, along with black pepper, giving a wine that has a tangy texture just hinting at juicy white fruits. Age until 2016.
Name: Château la Baronnerie 2012 Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Passionfruit dominates the nose on winemaker Matt Ortman's tropically infused take on the grape, with a dash of kiwi to lighten things up. That tropicality rules the palate as well, but with a touch of flint as a grounding element.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: A zesty, citric crispness balances with a soothing element of soft apple character. Fermented in stainless steel, it has a smooth texture and ripe fruit flavors. Balanced and approachable; drink now.
Name: Michael David 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Totally herbaceous and crisp, this is a rich, citrus-flavored wine. Grapefruit flavors dominate with a twist of lemon on top, giving a zesty texture that shows a young wine. For it to calm down and broaden out, wait until the end of 2015.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2013 Grande Cuvée  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: A taste of Key lime and tonic unveil a vibrancy of aroma and high-acid flavor in this wine, additionally characterized by layers of crisp white peach and pineapple juice.
Name: Cosa Obra 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: The majority of the grapes for this wine were fermented in stainless steel, a mere 10% in neutral oak, resulting in a fruity, dry expression of fresh pineapple juice and a surprise jolt of natural sweetness, especially on the midpalate. In the end, things finish fantastically in a whirl of acidity.
Name: Kelleher 2013 Block 21 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Selected from the Ritchie Vineyard, this expressive white offers lychee and lemongrass, plus exotic back currents of spice that playfully interject themselves throughout the fruit. Refreshing in acidity the wine veers into tart grapefruit and lemon before settling on satisfying white peach.
Name: Gary Farrell 2013 Russian River Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Fruity in faint white peach, this dry and balanced Sauvignon Blanc carries enough Oakville heft to give texture and grip. It'll pair magnificently with fresh shellfish or red curries.
Name: Flora Springs 2013 Soliloquy Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely sharp scents of freshly cut grass morph into tart Granny Smith apple and hints of guava on this bottling from one of the most striking vineyards in California. It's bright and lively on the palate, proving easy-to-drink, uncomplicated and fresh.
Name: Star Lane Vineyard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: A stunning squeeze of fresh tangerine enlivens both the aroma and palate of this crisp wine that's high in acidity and dancing in refreshing tangents of lemongrass, kiwi and pineapple. Enjoy poolside or on a patio.
Name: Rodney Strong 2013 Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc (Northern Sonoma)

Description: Light amber in color, this five year old Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of caramelized pear and grilled pineapple. This style of wine pairs perfectly with strong, earthy cheeses.
Name: Batič 2009 Sauvignon (Vipavska Dolina)

Description: Offering great value white, this is 90% Sauvignon Blanc with 10% Sémillon. It's bright and intensely flavored, first with pineapple followed by a flash of grapefruit and layering of vanilla. A crowd pleaser and food-friendly quaff.
Name: First Press 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An unusual version of Pearl, this includes 9% Grenache Blanc and 5% Roussanne in the blend. Though it's labeled Sauvignon Blanc, those other grapes seem to command center stage, and the wine might as well be thought of as a creative white blend rather than a single variety. Pungent and herbal, it has well-knit and balanced green and yellow fruit flavors, with notes of caraway seed and grass.
Name: Sparkman 2013 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented in both tank and new acacia barrels, there's definitely a depth of woodiness on the opening aromas. This is followed by a creaminess of texture on the palate, the taste leaning toward pear, vanilla and fresh melon. The finish is first creamy, then crisp, veering on spritzy.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty and zesty in mouthcoating, tingling acidity, this features a depth of grassiness and lime. It has just enough heft on the palate to be enjoyed alone or with spicy Mexican food like chilequiles.
Name: Truett Hurst 2013 Bluebird Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: The bouquet is fairly neutral, but the palate is tangy and citrusy, with cutting acidity. A mix of tart citrus and mild green flavors set up the finish that's laced with hints of bell pepper and green bean. Drink immediately.
Name: Veranda 2013 Quinel Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a winery based in the Santa Cruz Mountains, this Monterey wine features a delicate nose of chives, white flowers, pear and cut grass. It's fresh but brief on the palate, with limestone minerality, and a little dill on the finish.
Name: Byington 2013 Ventana Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Tight, very dry and startlingly fresh, this is a crisp and fruity wine. It's all about citrus, bright with green fruits and lively acidity. It could age, but it's a wine to drink now in all its freshness.
Name: Château Manon la Lagune 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Bright and zesty on the nose, this wine boasts an aromatic emphasis of passion fruit and citrus. The palate shows tension, with ringing acidity, while lime, green mango, grapefruit and passion fruit flavors finish fresh and racy.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2014 La Joya Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Pale straw in color, this wine has aromas of lemon peel, dried herb and lemon blossom. It's zesty on the palate, with flavors of lemon peel and green apple.
Name: Vini 2013 Veni Vidi Vici Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Key lime pie and chalk lead the nose on this affordable offering from a longtime Paso producer. The flavor profile is wide and welcoming, with apple, pear and citrus elements.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a dash of rockiness to the nose of this wine from one of the main producers in this warmer Santa Barbara appellation, but the aromas are mostly ripe pear and red apple. There's not a ton of flair to the light and easy palate, so expect poached pears, a touch of green apple and some grassiness.
Name: Grassini 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Faint hints of gooseberry and pineapple peek through on the nose and palate of this modestly concentrated Sauvignon Blanc. It's refreshingly crisp, with bright lime acidity cutting through the midpalate and finishes on a zesty citrus note.
Name: Damiani 2013 Davis Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Layers of flavor and a buttery note characterize this medium-bodied Sauvignon. It falls between the crisp New Zealand style and the oak-aged Fumé Blanc style, with good aspects of both. The finish turns slightly sweet.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Oasis and Sagemoor vineyards aged in stainless steel, this wine shows the warmth of the vintage with notes of tropical fruit, grass and melon. It drinks a touch off dry, with the concentration a bit lacking but pineapple flavors pull it together on the finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Clean aromas of mineral-infused citrus are fresh on the nose. This is zesty on the palate, with flavors of lime and tangerine, and a lively, mineral finish. Drink now.
Designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
Name: Santa Alicia 2014 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: This wine is all about its restrained mineral character, with hints of honeycomb and grassy herb on the nose. It's elegant in feel but the palate is modest and is focused toward simple citrus. This is a new selection from William Fèvre; let's see what future vintages bring.
Name: William Fèvre 2012 Quino Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Malleco)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: The wine is soft, relatively rounded even though it has plenty of crisp and herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc flavors. Acidity is kept in check by the ripe green and yellow fruits, lime and apricot to the fore. The aftertaste brings out a more tangy texture. Drink now.
Name: Château la Baronnerie 2013 Grand Baron  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Lemon blossoms and tangerines bring lift to the aromatics. On the palate there are flavors of tropical fruit and tart, green apples.
Name: Cramele Recas 2013 Dreamfish Sauvignon Blanc (Viile Timisului)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Made closer to a New Zealand style, freshly cut grass never far behind, this white also exhibits plenty of California tropical fruit and an intensity of acidity, particularly as it finishes.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)

Description: White pepper and celery aromas, along with distinctly herbaceous and tart flavors give a tight aspect. It is definitely light, crisp and mouth-cleansing; would be great with raw oysters or goat cheese on toasts.
Name: Tuck Beckstoffer 2013 Est. 1975 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: For a young Sauvignon Blanc, this is surprisingly rich. A concentrated character supports the yellow fruits and light vanilla flavor. Drink now and until 2018.
Name: Château Queyssard 2013 Cuvée Dorianne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Well-rounded, this offers aromas of fresh-cut grass and citrus fruit, citrusy flavors, good acidity, a smooth texture and soft finish. Very refreshing, it will be a good match with seafood, goat cheese or grilled chicken.
Name: William Hill Estate 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: This has a restrained but earthy personality that grows on you as you sip. It smells faintly like a pine forest, tastes like grapefruit and stays nicely tangy on the finish. It should loosen up and taste even better by mid-2015.
Name: Bink 2013 Old Chatham Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: Dry and refreshing this is a crisp white from a warm region of Sonoma County. A hit of sweetness to the finish is a mere accent, the way adding vanilla to pancake batter can be. The fruitiness comes from lemon, melon and grapefruit rind.
Name: Field Stone 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: This has the herbaceous character that is true to its varietal type. A bit more zip (acidity) would complement the strong flavors. It shows grassy, snap-pea aromas, canteloupe notes and a soft texture.
Name: Circadia 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Grass and gooseberry compete for favor in this zesty, straightforward wine. It's long on the finish in tropical hits of pineapple and guava.
Name: J. Rickards 2013 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: A piercing opening of nettle and green fruits gives way to a crisp, round palate. Flavors of brine, tart fruits and citrus are stunted. A fresh, lean, zesty finish tastes overwhelmingly green.
Name: Santa Rita 2013 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc is totally herbaceous and much too young to drink. Fruity, packed with citrus and with a floral aroma, it's juicy, crisp and needs until 2016 to calm down and round out.
Name: Château Loumelat 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Green aromas and citrusy scents are a touch sulfuric. This is light in body, with citric acidity fueling the machine. Flavors of celery, green fruits, tangerine and white pepper finish with scallion and thyme notes.
Name: Montes 2014 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Ripe sweet tropical pineapple and guava mark this wine as does a sway of wild grass, the wine otherwise perfectly crisp and clean.
Name: Chasing Venus 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A waxy texture wraps around tropical fruit, cantaloupe and lemongrass in this simple quaff of refreshing juice.
Name: Owl Ridge 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Green notes of jalapeño pepper blend with passion fruit on an extreme nose. The high-acid palate is bracing, with flavors of sour apple and citrus.
Name: Casa Silva 2012 Cool Coast Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Green fruit aromas, grassy notes and hint of sulfur define the bouquet on this herbaceous wine from a cool vintage. Bell pepper, pea and green bean flavors finish with a hint of tropical fruit.
Name: Santa Rita 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is mild on the nose, with soft scents of white-fruit and sulfur. The palate lacks definition and feels disjointed. Flavors of green apple, stone fruits and herbaceousness end in a swirl of green, pithy, bitter flavors.
Name: Sierra Batuco 2014 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Earth and matchstick define the nose of this easygoing wine. The palate is quiet, with low-intensity flavors of passion fruit and citrus that finish mildly pithy.
Name: Veramonte 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Vanilla wafer, slightly mealy apple and citrus aromas open this slightly unfocused wine. The palate is flat, with flavors of green fruit and citrus that finish abruptly.
Name: Viña San Vicente 2013 Geiser Tatio Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Match stick, tropical notes and green banana aromas make up the nose. This is dilute in feel, with a hint of generic tropical fruit. Drink now.
Name: Caliterra 2013 Tributo Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A softer than usual style of Sauvignon Blanc, this drinks more like a Chardonnay. It features honeydew melon and kiwi flavors, low acidity and a smooth texture.
Name: One Hope 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Grassy aromas of green melon and white pepper feed into a plump yet citrusy palate. Slightly pyrazinic and mildly bitter, underripe green melon and grapefruit are the lead flavors.
Name: Terrapura 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Dull, dilute aromas of vanilla cookie and apple are a fair introduction to a bland, plump-feeling palate with simple green-fruit and peach flavors. The finish is light and easy.
Name: Chilensis 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Mealy aromas suggest that this wine is past its peak. The palate is unbalanced, with flavors of bell pepper and green fruit, showing hints tropical fruit. Drink now.
Name: François Lurton 2013 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: This wine leads with vanilla over characteristic varietal notes. The palate is spritzy, while modest flavors of nectarine and citrus finish light.
Name: Porta 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Vegetal aromas outmuscle the wine's green fruit character. A plump, round mouthfeel offers only mild acidity, while the vegetal essence returns on the palate, with sulfuric bitterness on the finish.
Name: Rios de Chile 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: The nose shows little fruit against persistent matchstick aromas. The palate is zesty but also pithy, while flavors of citrus turn sulfuric and bitter before hollowing out on the finish.
Name: Root:1 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Sauvignon Blanc can vary in style from merely crisp and almost neutral to more herbaceous examples like this. It conveys an assertive, slightly heavy personality with plenty of herb and eucalyptus flavors, a rather soft texture for this variety and dry finish.
Name: Brutocao 2013 Feliz Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: This is plump and mildly citrusy in feel, with dull peach, melon and nectarine flavors. A flat and flabby finish doesn't do much to aid the short finish.
Name: Rayun 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Aromas of vanilla cookie and mealy fruit are slightly offputting. A palate with yeasty notes and a tropical banana flavor yields a creamy, unbalanced finish.
Name: François Lurton 2014 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: The palate is flat and low on acid. Pithy white fruit flavors and a dull almond note form the palate.
Name: Tololo 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A slightly different flavor spectrum makes this pale-colored, lean and crisp sparkling wine stand out. With notes of honeydew melon and cucumber, and great balance from juicy acidity, it tastes slightly sweet and as refreshing as those fruit descriptors would suggest.
Designation: Extra Dry Cuvee Januariis Blanc de
Name: Bodkin NV Extra Dry Cuvee Januariis Blanc de Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Unmistakably Sauvignon Blanc, it carries notes of herbs, citrus and guava. It's lightly spritzy and drinks dry with mouthwatering citrus flavors. Try it with shellfish.
Designation: Prayer Rock Vineyards Talitha Cumi Bloc
Name: Reustle 2013 Prayer Rock Vineyards Talitha Cumi Bloc Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
