Description: Despite the 4% Viognier added, the aromas of guava and pink grapefruit still seem light and elusive. Tank fermented, it's clean in feel and drinks off dry (2.5g/L residual sugar). Good concentration and length make for an ideal patio wine.
Name: RoxyAnn 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: This ripe wine has currant aromas and a soft texture offering perfumed pears and ripe apricots. It's richly endowed, rounded with a layer of acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Cortes de Cima 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

Description: Fruity and lightly herbaceous, this is a crisp wine. Gooseberry and pink grapefruit flavors are rounded out with a fresh apricot and tightened with minerality. It's ready to drink.
Name: La Chablisienne 2013  Saint-Bris

Description: A soft, fruity wine, this features attractive citrus and peach flavors. It's light and fresh with a crisp, bright aftertaste. Saint-Bris is the only appellation in Burgundy to produce Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Simonnet-Febvre 2012  Saint-Bris

Description: The heady scent of baked apple and candied orange peel merges into a citrus-zesty, supersweet but tight palate. Sugar-crusted citrus peel—orange, mandarin and tangerine—play about the palate alongside a notion of fragrant pine resin. A rarity and source of pure joy. If you have a fruitcake laced with candied peel, don't hold back.
Name: Esterházy 2012 Eiswein Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: It's taken New Zealand's largest producer a while to get on board the barrel-fermented express, and this wine is still only 50% done in wood, mainly large formats. Some funky, slightly acrid notes mark the nose, but this adds welcome complexity to the stone-fruit aromas. It's rich and textural in the mouth, the ripe fruit marked by intriguing hints of green herbs and spice before drawing to a long, elegant finish.
Name: Brancott 2010 Chosen Rows Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine bursts from the bottle with rich and appealing fragrances and flavors of grapefruit, pineapple and citrus. Tart and expressive, it seems to gain extra dimensions from fermentation with wild (native) yeasts. It holds a floral character that is most intriguing.
Name: Efeste 2012 Boushey Vineyard Sauvage Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: A tremendous effort from Spy Valley, this easily eclipses the winery's regular Sauvignon Blanc. Fig, melon and hints of vanilla mark the nose, while the palate amps up the citrus component, providing delineation to the nectarine flavors. It's on the full side of medium-bodied, with a silky, slightly creamy texture and a lingering finish that seamlessly blends citrus and stone fruit.
Name: Spy Valley 2012 Envoy Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Starts off with a slightly funky, struck-match aroma, but then opens to reveal tangerine, nectarine and roasted-nut scents. The flavors are an blend of all that, delivered via a rich silky-textured palate and ending long.
Name: Cloudy Bay 2011 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A relative bargain in the scheme of barrel-fermented Sauvignon Blanc, Kevin Judd's version boasts toasty, nutty notes upfront, followed by creamy citrus and stone-fruit aromas and flavors. It's a top example of the richness and potential age-worthiness that oak can bring to carefully selected lots of Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Greywacke 2010 Wild Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A strength of the winery, this single (Rosebud) vineyard effort includes 9% Sémillon. Fermentation was done in a creative mix of oak, steel and concrete egg, and enhanced with eight months in two-thirds new oak. Tart citrus—mostly lime and grapefruit—along with snappy green apple and a hint of fresh herb, keep the palate lively and complex. A hint of barrel toast elevates the lingering finish.
Name: Barons 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A grassy, slightly feral style of Sauvignon Blanc, this is tight and linear despite the ample alcohol listing. Flinty notes on the nose strike a French pose, while the fruit on the palate is grapefruit and cut grass. Finishes long and mouth-watering.
Name: Giesen 2012 The August 1888 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Cloudy Bay's Te Koko was the first widely commercialized version of barrel-fermented Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, and it remains near the top of the pack. Notes of toasted nuts add a rich veneer to the core of stone fruit and melon, which then finishes on a refreshing, grapefruity note.
Name: Cloudy Bay 2008 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the warm 2013 vintage, this is an aromatic offering, with notes of pineapple, kiwi, herbs and oak spices (40% barrel fermented). It's creamy in feel, but with tart, vibrant acidity that keeps the palate fresh and lively.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With alcohol in the low-moderate range, this immaculately fresh wine is flush with juicy gooseberry and grapefruit. It carries the varietal hallmarks of fresh herbs, notably chive, and a balancing lick of minerality.
Name: Mercer 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Green gooseberry and freshly-cut grass lend elegant perfume to this ripe, full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It's silky in mouthfeel, with opulent Meyer lemon and honeysuckle tones, but balanced with a squeaky-bright acidity that cleanses the mid palate. Finishes with a lingering sheen of oyster-shell minerality.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2013 Reminisce Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A tangy grapefruit flavor and refreshing acidity make this a good before-dinner quaff and an apt pairing with seafood. Herbaceous and citrus aromas carry through to the flavors, medium body and good balance.
Name: Husch 2013 La Ribera Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This is a broadly expansive wine in the mouth, but what it may lack in focus it makes up for in mouthwatering fruit intensity. Gooseberry and grapefruit lead the way, with just the right amount of herbal flourishes. Drink now.
Name: Echo Bay 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Yellow pear skin, crushed pine needles and white rocks bolster traditional cat-pee aromas on this wine from the ancient river stone-laden Arroyo Seco appellation. Sharper grassy elements deftly integrate into the palate, with apple and pear flavors as well. Serve with vinaigrette-doused oysters.
Name: Comartin 2013 Stone Row Zabala VIneyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Description: This wine's expressive aromas and flavors of sweat, green herbs and passion fruit all speak of the Dillons Point subregion, but those excesses are toned down by aging in 1,000-liter oak casks known in German as fuders. That aging has imparted a pleasant creaminess to the midpalate, again mellowing the regional character.
Designation: The Fuder Single Vineyard Selection Dillons Point
Name: Giesen 2012 The Fuder Single Vineyard Selection Dillons Point Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a medium-bodied, slightly plump Sauvignon Blanc that hits the right herbal notes of snow pea and tomato leaf, then blends those with grapefruit and hints of stone fruit.
Name: Twin Islands 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel, then aged in a mix of neutral oak and stainless steel barrels, this offers a crisp, varietally true style with an emphasis on fruit rather than grassy herbs. Honeydew melon, tangerine and peach roll across the tongue, propelled with fresh, juicy, natural acidity. The wine did not go through (nor did it need) malolactic fermentation. Lively and light-hearted.
Name: SuLei 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: There's a pleasant sweetness to the nose, a mix of white flowers and fragrant apples. On the palate, green banana, apple juice and papaya rise to the occasion. A strong minerality holds through the finish.
Name: Noble Vines 2013 242 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though labeled Sauvignon Blanc, this includes 20% Muscat, which makes it more of a proprietary white wine than a pure varietal expression. The flavors combine grassy, salad greens with citrus and grapefruit rind. The Muscat shows up in the orange blossom highlights. As the low alcohol would suggest, this dry wine has plenty of natural acidity.
Name: Lagana 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This nose features much more nuance than a typical Sauvignon Blanc, with chalky minerality, bright stone fruit and barely ripe tropicality. It's a bit tight at first on the palate, but poached pear and papaya flavors emerge, then open to candied guava in the midpalate.
Name: Eight Sides 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From one of the cooler climate vineyards for Sauvignon Blanc on the Central Coast comes this intriguing wine. Aromas of petrol, tar and crushed sea shells are set alongside a background of green apple and pear. There is nice zing on the palate, with the petrol elements continuing with roasted bell pepper and crisp apple.
Name: Presqu'ile 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all Sauvignon Blanc, with a mix of herbal components including cilantro, chervil and lemon verbena. Crisp apple fruit flavors are also present. Overall it's a well-made, rather steely white wine.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is fresh, with good pungency and a mix of passion fruit and bell pepper aromas. A scouring mouthfeel pulls no punches, while grassy, slightly bitter flavors of arugula and lemon-lime finish citrusy and tangy.
Name: Montes 2013 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Well-rounded pear and apple aromas get a fresh squeeze of lemon in this good-deal Sauv Blanc. It's easy to drink, with apple popover flavors (whose toasty elements come from the 20% barrel fermentation) and a brisk acidity.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The expected aromas of cut grass and cat pee get a bit of support from peach and herb accents. On the palate are flavors of green apple, oregano, lemon, dill and bell pepper. This is light and refreshing.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Description: This shows the briny citrus and bell pepper aromas typical for Chilean SB. This is tangy and feels good, with snappy cactus, lime and tangerine flavors. A mild but fairly long finish is citrusy and juicy.
Name: Emiliana 2013 Natura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Simple, clean and grapefruity, this will do nicely on the patio or deck in summer. It's medium-bodied, crisp and refreshing.
Name: The Better Half 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Stony, crisp lettuce and mild white-fruit aromas define the nose on this fresh SB. Flavors of lime and tangerine are reticent and lean, while the finish shows persistence and good acidity.
Name: Concha y Toro 2013 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

Description: Marked by passion fruit and pineapple, with a bit of honey included in the mix, this is beginning to broaden out and lose a little bit of its vitality yet still remains attractive. Drink this medium-bodied wine before the end of 2014.
Name: Giesen 2011 The Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An appealing wine with notes of herbs, gooseberry and guava. It's medium-bodied with some residual sugar (1.2 g/L) helping it go down easy.
Name: Two Ponds 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: On the nose, this everyday SB delivers pungency and citrusy green-fruit scents. The mouthfeel is racy, while flavors of lime, passion fruit and grapefruit finish zesty and with green, herbal notes of thyme and oregano.
Name: Undurraga 2013 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All from Rosebud Vineyard, this moderately aromatic wine brings notes of herbs and pineapple, with Sémillon (15%) adding fig to the mix. The concentration doesn't seem all there and it needs a bit more acid to stand it up.
Name: Finn Hill 2013 Soleil Sauvignon Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp, pungent grass scents and a bit of rough citrus form the nose. Once sipped, thin and brisk apple cider flavors get help from slight kiwi and fresh acidity. Serve with bay scallop salad.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2011 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This offers fruit cocktail aromas, with canned pears and light honey, making for an inviting if not varietally typical nose. The flavors are light once sipped, closest to nectarine and apricot. This would be a very drinkable lunchtime wine.
Name: Esser 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This rounded wine adds richness to its herbaceous character. Apple and quince flavors are razor-sharp in freshness, bright and deliciously lively. Drink now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2013 Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Somewhat aromatically restrained with notes of kiwi, pineapple and citrus. It's somewhat sleek in style but has with a lightly creamy feel. The wine is enjoyable but the acidity doesn't quite seem to be there to pull it all together.
Name: Columbia Crest 2013 H3 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Citrus and green herb with a prickle control the nose. Mixed citrus, passion fruit and arugula are the main flavors, and they are backed by matchstick bitterness, citric acid and sulfur on the finish.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2013 Anderra Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a rather light wine in both density, flavor and impact. Some dilute citrus fruit flavors are framed with the lightest hint of cracker. Drink it chilled or use it as a mixer.
Name: Maryhill 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While juicy white grapefruit and gooseberry notes are concentrated on this easy-drinking Sauvignon Blanc, grassy, stemmy herb and leaf tones are prominent from nose to finish. The palate is refreshing with bristling lemon and lime acidity.
Name: Ravines 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lychee and kiwi soda aromas meet up with slight yeastiness on the nose of this single-vineyard Sauvignon Blanc. A sharp zing of acidity runs from the front of the palate to the finish, with apple cider flavors holding up the fruit. Serve with fish tacos.
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2013 Great Oaks Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Citrus and apple aromas are dusty. This is easygoing and just juicy enough, with apple, orange and tangerine flavors. A clean finish turns softer and more mealy the longer it sits.
Name: Valdivieso 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Sauvignon Blanc, yes, but it's a round, tropical fruit style of Sauvignon. It gives a rich texture and and a warm feel to the wine, reinforced by its soft aftertaste. It's ready to drink now.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2013 Cuvée Jeanne Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the nose is slightly savory with whiffs of dried herbs and stems, the palate on this Sauvignon Blanc is ripe with juicy white grapefruit and peach flavors. Sunny tangerine-lime acidity keeps the mid palate pert.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc—what more need be said? Since the bubbles aren't derived from a second fermentation, the wine tastes like a Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc with bubbles. Pineapple and passion fruit notes finish clean but short.
Name: Ara NV One Estate Brut Sauvignon (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An appealing quaffer with notes of passion fruit, papaya and citrus. It drinks a hair off dry (1.2g/L residual sugar), with moderate concentration, and goes down easy.
Name: Original House Wine 2013 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A fresh, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc, mainly from the French south-west. It has a lively, crisp, totally fruity character with grapefruit, gooseberry and a more tropical fruit hint. Drink now.
Name: François Lurton 2013 Les Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: The smell suggests passion fruit juice. The palate is modest and just racy enough. Flavors of passion fruit, lime and nectarine are solid but quiet, while the finish is short, with no variation off the palate.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2013 Los Vascos Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh-cut flowers and gooseberries lend characteristically green, grassy notes to this light-bodied, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. It's delicate in concentration but finishes elegantly on a chalky, mineral note.
Name: Raphael 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This boasts typical Marlborough characters of passion fruit and herbal notes, layered with a hint of nectarine and extra pungency. It's round in the mouth without being especially concentrated, finishing short but pleasant.
Name: Dashwood 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a light and very crisp wine. Acidity, gooseberry and pink grapefruit give a fruitiness without any complexity. The bright texture and simple aftertaste make it a wine to drink immediately.
Name: Les Vins de l'Herré 2013 La Galope Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The reserved nose offers chalk, nectarine and apple cider. It remains lean once sipped, with crushed white rock minerality and a bit of nice creaminess.
Name: Justin 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: This shows a mild SB character on the nose. It's citric on the palate, with lime, lemon and tangerine flavors. Just enough crispness and scour make it a worthwhile quaffer.
Name: In Situ 2013 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: The vintage was notoriously cold in Chile, and this wine reflects that. Green, herbaceous flavors of grass and alfalfa blend with citrusy notes, while the finish is pyrazinic and borderline bitter.
Name: Montes 2013 Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This is on the lean side, with tomato-leafy—almost ashy—notes that impart a dry, austere quality to the white grapefruit flavors.
Name: Mount Nelson 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Notes of grassy stems and leaves are prominent on this lemon-scented Sauvignon Blanc. It's fresh and brisk with tart gooseberry and yellow-plum flavors, but savory, green tones tend to overwhelm.
Name: Fulkerson 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Gritty apple and matchstick aromas are not overly stable. This feels plump and sticky, while flavors of ripe citrus turn soft with time in the glass. A chunky, melony finish lacks the resolve and acidity Sauvignon Blanc is known for.
Name: Lapostolle 2013 Casa Grand Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Punchy citrus aromas have a tropical accent. This is soft on acidity, with flavors of grass, green fruits and bitterness that end in a swirl of green herbs and pepper. Overall, there isn't much fruit.
Name: Kon Tiki 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Dusty mineral notes accent fresh lemon and apple on Raphael's premium Sauvignon Blanc bottling. It's slightly bolder in body and alcohol than the regular label, but balanced with a nervous, palate-shocking acidity. Stark and lean on the mid palate, it finishes on a slightly green, unripe note.
Name: Raphael 2013 First Label Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This SB smells neutral except for a pinch of grassy green. The palate is tangy, while citrusy flavors are not specific. On the finish, this is zesty at first and then falls off.
Name: Porta 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Flat citrus and green-herb aromas are mealy. This is tangy and citrusy in the mouth, with orange and nectarine flavors. An adequate finish doesn't show a lot of varietal character or crispness.
Name: Rios de Chile 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Crisp citrus and jalapeño aromas offer a tropical fruit offset. This is citrusy in the mouth. Flavors of passion fruit and citrus are basic, while the finish echoes all that's come before.
Name: William Cole 2013 Columbine Special Reserve Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Wide, gritty aromas control a broken-down bouquet. This feels plump and unfocused, while sweet, flavors of citrus and melon finish more mealy and less convincing than the palate.
Name: Patagón 2013 Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very faintly aromatic wine that has you leaning far into the glass searching for something. The palate drinks medium sweet with tropical flavors, but lacks the acidity to hold them together.
Name: Willow Crest 2013 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a bland yet varietally correct Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is heavy and spritzy, while flavors of melon and pithy citrus finish with a clunk.
Name: Veramonte 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Lean and crisp, this offers aromas of lettuce leaf, jalapeño and tropical fruits. The palate is tart and shearing, with citric acidity and green pepper notes. A zesty, juicy, sour palate doesn't fully bring things around.
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2012 Summit 2900 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Bland aromas feed into a soft, plump, unfocused palate. This tastes of grapefruit and citrus peel, while on the finish pyrazines take over as the wine turns increasingly bitter.
Importer: Arion Spirit & Wine/ Arion Product Solutions
Name: Cantina 1678 2013 Chrysoberyl Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Tropical fruit aromas rest mostly on banana. This is regular in the mouth, with a touch of citric lift. Flavors of orange, tangerine and lemon finish citrusy.
Name: TerraNoble 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: White-fruit aromas have no impact. This is a flat SB with soft citrus and white-fruit flavors. The finish is dull.
Name: Alta Delta 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Aromas are briny and green. This is narrow, acidic and tangy in feel, while the flavors run tart and pickled. Sauerkraut and briny citrus are the lasting impression, and the finish is vegetal.
Name: Emiliana 2013 Novas Gran Reserva Organic Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: White-fruit aromas are bland. In the mouth, this is heavy and flat, with no zip. Sugary flavors of mango and melon deliver no finish, just the forced sweetness of residual sugar.
Name: Beach Kite 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: From selected, sunny parcels of vines, it's powered by its citrus and pear fruits along with an intensely mineral texture and supreme concentration. It's a Sancerre to keep, still young and gawky, best drunk from 2016.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 Jadis  (Sancerre)

Description: From the flint soils of Les Romains, this tight wine is full of acidity, steely minerality and a promise of future greatness. It's powerful, concentrated and rich, with yellow fruits, toast, gorgeous acidity and a long-lasting aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2012 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: One of the impressive range of single-vineyard wines from Vacheron, this is massive and dense, its acidity and citrus flavors masked by the ripe yellow fruits and opulent texture. The structure comes in with a firm showing of steeliness that suggests the wine could still age. Wait until 2016.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2012 Guigne-Chèvres  (Sancerre)

Description: From the intensely steep Monts Damnés vineyard, this wine is rich and full of ripe tropical and citrus fruits, with a tight line in steely minerality. It's still too structured and firm, so drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2013 Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: This opulent, ripe wine comes from a single vineyard. It has a rich texture, with dense yellow and apple fruits that are allied to a more citrus, gooseberry and lemon character. It rolls around the mouth with a smooth, satisfying aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2012 Chambrates  (Sancerre)

Description: The challenge is not drinking this gorgeous wine, but just lifting the bottle. Once in the glass, the wine is rich, superripe and still elegant. It's a fine mix of yellow fruits, crisp green and citrus fruits and a tight, intense texture. Hold until 2016.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2012 Le Paradis  (Sancerre)

Description: Silex, a flinty soil, is commonly found around the village of Saint-Andelain. It gives a wine that is all about minerality, very textured and tight when young. This full wine shows considerable tightness, nervy acidity and a crisp, zesty character. It's a wine to age for a few more years; drink from 2016.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2012 Les Bois de Saint-Andelain  (Sancerre)

Description: Showing its powerful chalky terroir, this single-vineyard wine has intense herbaceous and steely characters. They go with the ripe, open fruitiness that brings in citrus, crisp apple and quince flavors. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2011 Le Paradis  (Sancerre)

Description: From the classic sand and flint soil that makes up much of the Sancerre vineyard, this complex wine has both fruit and intense minerality. The touches of toast and almonds round out the still young wine, contrasting with the more steely core. Drink from 2017.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 Sancerre d'Antan  (Sancerre)

Description: The top cuvée from Jean Thomas is hugely ripe and rich. A touch of toastiness and almonds give an extra dimension to the already full citrus and tropical fruit flavors. It's dense and rounded, while still shot through with tight, nervy acidity. Keep until 2015.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2012 Ultimus  (Sancerre)

Description: This single-vineyard wine is full of ripe fruits that are touched by tropicality as well as a more citrus edge. It's moving gently towards a more mature phase with its hints of toast and almonds. Drink now with great pleasure.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2011 Chambrates  (Sancerre)

Description: There's a light, salty texture to this rich, wood-aged wine. It's the top of the line for Michel Redde, giving a rich wine that's touched by toast as well as full apple and tropical fruit flavors. It is likely to be ready to drink in 2015.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2011 Cuvée Majorum  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Now in maturity, it has an opulent ripe character, full of apricot and mango fruits that are fill the mouth and give a rich aftertaste. Floral and fragrant, it's completely ready to drink now.
Designation: Cuvée François de la Grange de Montigny
Name: Henry Natter 2010 Cuvée François de la Grange de Montigny  (Sancerre)

Description: Complex and rich, this is packed with apple and pear flavors that are cut with citrus to give a balanced, lightly tropical character. It's ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Paul Picard 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Sancerre)

Description: The heavy bottle indicates a major cuvée for Gitton, and this rich wine lives up to it. It's full, complex and powerful, ripe with yellow fruits while still keeping an intense steely acidity and strong minerality. It's a fine wine for aging, so keep until 2015.
Name: Gitton Père et Fils 2012 X-elis  (Sancerre)

Description: Grown on Kimmeridgian chalk, this is one of a series of wines from different soils. It's mineral driven, while also having great fruitiness. Full and rich, it's likely to take a few years to mature. It offers an impressive expression both of Sauvignon Blanc and its terroir.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2012 Les Cornets  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Hugely herbaceous, this is a crisp, mineral-driven wine that's so fresh and fruity at the same time, with bright stone fruit and citrus character. Textured with a nervy acidity and a steely core, it could age to round out its corners. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2013  Sancerre

Description: Voluptuous and well-developed, this is tingling in acidity with a luscious mouthfeel and flavors of ripe peach, grapefruit and vanilla bean. Complex, the citrus is seasoned with a vibrancy of herb and pepper spice. A delicious wine for fresh oysters or crab cakes.
Name: Hall 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: In its youthful state, the wine has an earthy character that will soon move into a ripe, fruity while always structured state. Rich and  fruity now, it's likely to become a serious, ageworthy wine.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2012 Les Duchesses  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Full in the mouth and packed with ripe apricot and white peach fruit, this is a generous wine. The citrus element cuts through the rich fruitiness to give a sustained structure that's  also brought out by the steely texture in the background. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine A. Cailbourdin 2012 Triptyque  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fred Brander and winemaker Fabian Bravo study Sauvignon Blanc through several bottlings each year, but this Santa Ynez Valley appellation cuvee is an early favorite for 2013. Delicate flinty notes on the nose are bolstered with honey dew and apple. The palate leads with a lot of zing that evolves into flavors of kiwi and pear, with a slightly buttery, almost vanilla finish.
Name: Brander 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Very closed and tight, this is still a young wine. Its fruitiness, with citrus and pear flavors, is just beginning to develop into something that's rich and full-bodied. With its steely structure and taught acidity, it shouldn't be drunk before 2016.
Name: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2013 Silex Cuvée Maxime  (Sancerre)

Description: Rounded ripe fruits and a touch of wood aging give an unexpected softness. The Sauvignon acidity is there, but it's filled out with spice and apricot flavors. The wine is topped with rich toast. Keep until 2015.
Name: Domaine de la Villaudière 2012 Cuvée Héritage  (Sancerre)

Description: Tensely mineral, this is a tight, crisp wine. The palate ranges from pink grapefruit to a more steely, stony texture. The acidity shooting through the wine is well in balance with the fruits and structure. It could go through 2015 to be even better.
Name: Domaine de la Villaudière 2012  Sancerre

Description: “Today, as in the past,” reads the title of this wine. Rich and full, it was aged on the lees to give extra weight and body. The result is ripe with yellow fruits as well as citrus, with full-bodied flavor. It could well age until 2015.
Name: Hubert Brochard 2012 Aujourd'hui comme Autrefois  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a deeply rich and concentrated expression of steely Sauvignon Blanc. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth with yellow fruits vying with citrus and capped by the more tense texture. It could still age, so wait until 2015.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Ripe and rich, it offers upfront apricot and lime flavors. In the background, a more mineral, firm character acts as a great support for this open, generous wine.
Name: Michel Bailly et Fils 2012 Les Loges  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Pure chalk soil has produced a complex, ripe and full-bodied wine. With tight acidity, grapefruit and herbaceous flavors, it still is holding back on its full, fruity and structured potential. Age until 2016.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2012 Les Champs des Billons  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This vintage of 92% Sauvignon Blanc and 8% Sémillon presents a savory study in herbal-laced lemon and melon, rich and ripe. Expressive and expansive, it combines balanced acidity with a dry finish, spicing things up with notes of lemongrass and almond. All fruit is sourced from the famed To Kalon Vineyard.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2012 Fumé Blanc (Oakville)

Description: This is a ripe Sauvignon Blanc, full and rounded. Tropical fruits and ripe apricots are balanced by lively acidity. With its concentration of flavors, this is an already delicious wine, but would benefit by waiting until 2015 to add complexity.
Name: Bertrand Jeannot et Fils 2012  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Initially fresh and fruity, it opens to show a richer side, full of ripe pear and quince, with an apricot touch. The wine is textured and steely with a firm core that suggests it will age. Drink now, but better wait until 2015.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2013 Les Belles Côtes  (Sancerre)

Description: There is a good balance of tropical and citrus flavors on this warm, ripe wine. The fruit easily covers the more mineral core that gives structure. Rich and full-bodied, it can age through 2015.
Name: Domaine Chatelain 2012 Les Vignes de Saint-Laurent l'Abbaye  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Tasty and tangy, it brings together fresh citrus and herbal aromas, crisp grapefruit and green apple flavors in a well-balanced, medium-bodied package. The texture is lively and the finish is fresh.
Name: Saracina 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Tropical fruits dominate this rich wine. Mango and pineapple flavors are freshened with a twist of lemon. There are only hints of a more steely character in this full and round wine that's ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2012 Clos Paradis  (Sancerre)

Description: An opulent wine, it offers ripe yellow fruits, apricots and white peaches and just a touch of mango. It's full in the mouth and rich, developing well and likely to mature to 2015. The fruits are balanced by a steely, nervy texture that comes through at the end.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2012 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: Still in its first flush of youth, it shows great minerality as well as intense citrus and apple fruit flavors. A light touch of ripeness brings out a more yellow fruit character. Drink now, but better to keep until 2015.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2012 Sancerre le Rochoy  (Sancerre)

Description: A complex, ripe wine from a fine single-vineyard site, it has rich yellow and citrus fruits that are right up front. Behind, the texture is steely and nervy, with intense herbaceous acidity. It's full of potential, so wait until 2016.
Name: Domaine A. Cailbourdin 2012 Les Cornets  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A smooth, soft and full wine, rich in fruits and warm acidity. A touch of minerality expresses the chalk soil of the vineyard. Still dominated by young fruitiness, it will be better in 2015.
Name: Domaine Cherrier et Fils 2013  Sancerre

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Banana blends with cut grass for a tropical-meets-traditional take. On the palate, the wine is very soft, reminiscent of pineapple-flavored whipped cream, and there is a nice touch of smoke as well.
Name: Still Waters 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Description: Full-bodied, with a rich character that adds to the fruitiness, this still needs to mature. Bright apples and citrus are caught up in a strongly mineral texture that gives a steely character. Wait until 2015.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2012 La Moynerie  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Tropical scents of guava and cherimoya with the mineral edge of concrete lead the aromatics on this Carmel Valley wine. Sharp acidity at first sip massages into softness soon afterward, upholding the nose's rocky promise as well as delivering lime-zest tang throughout.
Name: Joullian 2013 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Description: With intense, mineral aromas, this is a complex, tight and nervy wine. It has great concentration, serious amounts of acidity and a final series of herbaceous flavors that give a totally dry, steely aftertaste. Age until 2015 to round it out.
Name: Patient Cottat 2013 Anciennes Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Very mineral and textured from the limestone soil, this is a concentrated and complex wine. It boasts considerable acidity and very crisp fruit, with grapefruit and juicy lemons coming through strongly. Age until at least 2016.
Name: Vincent Vatan 2012 Sélection Silex  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: The wine is round, full in the mouth and rich. With yellow fruits as well as red apple flavors, it's ripe without missing out on a more steely, cool and herbaceous backdrop. Drink now.
Name: Gitton Père et Fils 2012 Les Herses  (Sancerre)

Description: Calcite (chalk) is the nature of much of the bedrock of Pouilly. Here it gives a tight, mineral wine that's also full of ripe fruit and juicy apple flavors. Crisp at the edges and ripe in the center, it's a wine to age through 2015 to bring out the full fruitiness.
Name: Francis Blanchet 2012 Calcite  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Fresh and fruity this is a fuller style of Sauvignon Blanc with 10% Sémillon blended in, whole-cluster pressed, and barrel-fermented in neutral oak. It offers tingling acidity and a briny mouthfeel amidst highlights of apricot and savory herb.
Name: Apsara 2013 River's Reach Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas recall freshly chopped herbs such as thyme and parsley, with a very likable hint of pine tar as well. That mix of tree resin and Italian herbs comes through on the palate too, making for a flavorful and stand-out wine.
Name: Alta Maria 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Winemaker Steve Law, a specialist in cool-climate Syrah, offers a barrel-fermented and barrel-aged Sauv Blanc named for his mom. It's completely herbal, dry, savory and complex, yet deliciously sippable.
Name: MacLaren 2013 Lee's Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Tangy green-apple aromas and flavors make this medium-bodied wine refreshing, crisp and palate-cleansing. The texture is vibrant and the finish lively.
Name: Dancing Bull 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Named after a parcel of vines, this youthful, fruity wine is on its way to being delicious. It has a proper steely character, shot through with acidity and minerality while the citrus character is strong and firm. Drink from 2015.
Name: Michel Vattan 2012 Les L-O  (Sancerre)

Description: A classic Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc, buzzing in margarita-ready lime, grapefruit pith and sweet jasmine, with a nuance of grassy underbrush. Creamy in vanilla-bean flavor on the midpalate, it finishes dry and crisp.
Name: Charles Krug 2013 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: A handful of Sémillon adds to this wine's creaminess and texture, which is otherwise alive with citrus, stone fruit, grapefruit and ginger swirling through the glass. A lift on the finish makes the wine mouthwateringly juicy and complete.
Name: Black Stallion 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Strong tropical fruit aromas conjure up richness. It's soft and round while not losing touch with the more nervy, herbaceous character of Sauvignon Blanc. Full in the mouth while still poised and light, it's ready to drink.
Name: Dominique Pabiot 2012 Les Vieilles Terres  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: From the weight of the bottle, this is obviously the top of the Moreux range. Intensely tropical, the wine is full, rich and ripe. Well structured, it shows hints of minerality while being more about full fruit and delicious finishing acidity.
Name: Domaine Patrice Moreux 2012 Les Bénédictins Cuvée Prestige  (Sancerre)

Description: Rounded and full, it's firmly in the tropical fruit Sauvignon Blanc camp. It is rich, softly textured and ripe. The warm fruits are well balanced with a line of acidity to keep a good element of freshness. Apud Sariacum was the Latin name of Raimbault's village of Sury-en-Vaux.
Name: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2012 Apud Sariacum  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Istanbul native Ertugrul “Art” Sevtap is former underwater oil worker and wine tour guide who started his own label in 2008 and makes a passion-driven line of wines. This Sauvignon Blanc, named after his hometown, offers nicely rounded melon aromas with saffron, toasted herbs and spiced nuts, scents which are pleasing if not varietally typical. The amazing nose goes a tad flat on the palate, where nuttiness overwhelms the acidity. But it's soft and massaging to the mouth, and would make great partner for a croque monsieur.
Name: Sevtap 2012 Istanbul Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: The wine balances acidity and full fruitiness. These show in the lively, fresh character as well as the rich apple and pear flavors. The end shows more youthful texture, offering the chance to hold this wine until 2015.
Name: Producta Vignobles 2013 Mission St Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Rich and soft, this is powerful and ripe. Concentrated white fruits show through the still-young citrus character and give complexity. The flint soil gives a steely underlay that sustains density. It will be even better in 2015.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2012 Grand'Chaille  (Sancerre)

Description: A warm and generous wine with its peach and tropical fruit flavors and properly cut through with ripe acidity. Rich and rounded, it's ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine de Rome 2012  Sancerre

Description: From the estate vineyard, this crisp white opens with ripe, slightly tropical aromas of cantaloupe, guava and papaya, with a darker, riper undertone of honey on the palate. Although fleshy and full on the palate, it's also bright in acidity and offers attractive floral aromas throughout.
Name: St. Supéry 2012 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This complex wine shows both good acidity and layers of fruit and mineral texture. It's ripe, rounded and fruity; the chalky substrate gives a structure that's likely to round out. Drink now, or in 2015.
Name: Henry Natter 2012  Sancerre

Description: Bouncing in acidity, this crisp white offers nuttiness around a core of melon rind, citrus and herb. Despite the relatively low alcohol, it offers enough weight on the palate to be companionable to appetizers laced with seafood, goat cheese and feta, or easily enjoyed on its own.
Name: Frog's Leap 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The pungent grassy elements of these aromas are nicely rounded, with sour apple candy and hoppy herbals. On the palate, there is apple cider and bright citrus as well as a slightly savory note of herb butter, thanks to the 25% Sémillon.
Name: Brander 2012 Cuvée Nicolas Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: With a year's aging, it's impressive how a Sancerre can bring out so many more interesting flavors. Here a softer acidity is allied to ripe yellow and mango fruits and a ripe, full-bodied character. Dense minerality comes through strongly without masking the fruitiness. Drink now, or age until at least 2015.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2012  Sancerre

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A brilliant pairing for chilled oysters, this age-worthy wine from Fred Brander offers traditional green grass and feline notes on the nose. There's refreshing tartness when sipped, with apple and dill flavors upheld by a minerally backbone.
Name: Brander 2012 Au Naturel Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: White rocks and green bell pepper aromas take centerstage on this somewhat rare Sauvignon Blanc from Edna Valley, which usually focuses on Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Those bell peppers carry into the palate alongside a round melon presence and the savory contribution of dried herbs. Try with chile verde.
Name: Tolosa 2013 Tolsosa Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of sautéed pears, apple sauce, pineapple candy and tarragon make for an intriguing entry into this wine from Rancho Sisquoc, whose label features a nearby chapel built in 1875. It's well-rounded on the palate, with steely flavors, a sharp greenness and toasted almond on the finish.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2013 Flood Family Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A flavor spectrum emphasizing grapefruit and kiwi makes this lively and original. Assertive aromas of grapefruit and new-mown grass leap out of the glass, then the flavors are vivid, tangy and lingering. A crisp texture and just enough richness in the body complete the package.
Name: Castle Rock 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: While herbaceous, this wine also has ripe tropical fruits that bring out a richer, early drinking side. It's bone-dry and crisp, the apricot fruits balanced by intense citrus. Concentrated and very fruity, it can be drunk now.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2013 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

Description: Still young, it's fruity but closed up. A tight, steely character gives a strong texture that is still dominating the fruit. Wait until 2015 for the citrus and white fruits to come through.
Name: Bouchié-Chatelier 2012 Premier Millésimé  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this crisp, floral white is defined by minerality and an underpinning of herb. With a heft to the palate, its balanced acidity is complemented by a richness of tone.
Name: Broman 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A rare style of California white, this is made from 100% Sauvignon Blanc, but is not labeled that way. Striking smoky, white-pepper aromas and aggressive dried herb flavors jangle with apparent oak character. The combination of sharp acidity and soothing body begins to come together on the finish. It needs time to mellow and may improve after 2015.
Name: Shared Notes 2012 Les Pierres Qui Decident Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: It marries subdued but exotic aromas and flavors of lime, fennel and melon with an ultra-smooth texture, showing a sophisticated facet of this variety.
Name: The Girls in the Vineyard 2013 Rooster Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This tight, young wine is shot through with steely acidity and minerality. It tastes of the flinty soil of Pouilly, full in the mouth and concentrated. Give it until 2015 before drinking.
Name: Dominique Pabiot 2012 Cuvée Plaisir  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This lightweight, fruity wine is very direct in its acidity and canteloupe flavors. Citrus cuts the richness, while a fine chalky texture comes from the soil of the region. It's a wine to drink soon, fresh and packed with crisp fruits.
Name: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2013  Sancerre

Description: Round and soft, it offers apples, citrus and gooseberries enveloped in a full-bodied texture. An edge of steely background suggests it's a wine for some aging, so wait until 2015.
Name: Domaine A. Cailbourdin 2012 Les Cris  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Tight, nervy and mineral, this crisp and fruity wine needs a few months to develop fully. It's lively with citrus fruits, an herbaceous character and steely aftertaste.
Name: Prince de Tabourg 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a fresh, lemony wine, crisp and steely. A richer element rounds out the tight texture and acidity. Lively and fruity, it will be ready to drink in 2015.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2013 Eclat de Fraîcheur  (Sancerre)

Description: The winery's signature widely distributed white is heady in flowery jasmine, with vibrant acidity and a sense of sweetness on the palate thanks to fresh fruit flavors of grapefruit, peach and nectarine. An ideal wine for summer or whenever one needs to recall a summer's day.
Name: St. Supéry 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Herbaceous and crisp, this wine shows its steely side before it brings out the fruit. It's mineral in character along with a strongly zesty intensity and a bone-dry, very fresh aftertaste.
Name: Les Vignerons des Coteaux Romanais 2013 Domaine du Haut Morlu Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Argile is French for clay soil, and that terroir gives this wine a full-bodied feel that is ripe and rich. The Sauvignon flavors lean more to tropical, rounded and fruity. It could benefit from some aging, so wait until 2015.
Name: Michel Vattan 2012 Cuvée Argile  (Sancerre)

Description: Dry, savory and richly steeped in oak, this SB has the markings of whole-cluster pressing and 3% Sémillon blended in, along with an inviting floral hum on the nose. The taste leans toward peach and grapefruit, zesty and alive.
Name: Groth 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Crisp with apples and citrus, it's also laced with a more mineral character. It's full in the mouth, very bright with acidity and grapefruit. Drink now.
Name: Francis Blanchet 2012 Cuvée Silice  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: From clay and chalk (Argile and Silex) soil, this wine is all texture, very young and very crisp. With a strongly herbaceous character, it's an intense wine that needs until at least 2016 to soften and fill out. For the moment, just revel in its concentrated flavor.
Name: Bouchié-Chatelier 2013 Argile à S  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: The ripe and fruity style typical of Vacheron wines is evident here. Citrus flavors are given a rich fillip by yellow fruits and a rounded, full texture. Touches of minerality and youthful acidity are already well integrated into the body of the wine. Drink in 2015.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2013  Sancerre

Description: A soft and rounded wine, it's ripe, full in the mouth and warm in character. A steely edge merges with the ripe apple and pear flavors to give a wine that's rich and ready to drink.
Name: Gitton Père et Fils 2012 Les Montachins  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Thirst-quenching, lean and tangy, it would make a good match with shucked oysters. It shows lemon and green apple aromas, plus fresh and crisp citrus flavors. Medium in body, the texture is pleasantly lean while the finish is refreshing.
Name: Clos du Lac 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Description: Quince and rhubarb aromas give an exotic feel. The palate is soft, ripe and warm with layers of apricot, quince and pear emphasizing the wine's fruitiness. It's a wine to savor now, ripe and full-bodied.
Name: Gitton Père et Fils 2012 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: Totally herbaceous, it's full of green herb flavors and tight with citrus and gooseberry. A light touch balances the intensity, giving freshness to the wine that's ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2012 Le Pierrier  (Sancerre)

Description: While the aromas scream herbaceous, the palate is more subdued and rounded. That gives space for the citrus to mingle with green apple skin and white peach flavors. It's very fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Philippe Portier 2012  Quincy

Description: Inviting in tropical aromas of guava and pineapple, it smells sweet but drinks dry, balanced in melon and high-toned citrus, just a hint of grass on the finish.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2012 Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: A lemon-scented, crisp wine, it's also full of ripe yellow fruits. It's a warm in style, rich with both fruit and an open texture. Almonds and acidity give a refreshing aftertaste.
Name: Pierre Prieur et Fils 2012 Domaine de Saint-Pierre  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made with organically grown grapes, it features a levity of citrus at its heart, a celebration of crisp grapefruit and lime. Dry and midweight, it has texture and a pleasant, long-lasting finish.
Name: Horse & Plow 2013 Preston Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This fragrant wine is full of fresh citrus and green apple flavors that are crisp and lively. A steely element comes through to give structure.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2012 Cuvée C.M.  (Sancerre)

Description: A softly textured, fruity wine that has a feeling of richness. Apricot fruits are balanced by lime crispness. Full and ripe, it's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Patrice Moreux 2012 La Loge aux Moines  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Warm and ripe, it's roundly textured, full of yellow fruits and rich acidity. It has developed well, giving a palate feel that is soft and fruity. Enjoy now.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2012 Les Chante Alouettes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is a rich and soft Sauvignon, full of ripe fruits that are heading in a tropical direction. Acidity cuts easily through the yellow fruit flavors and hint of herbaceousness. It's ready to drink now.
Name: Les Vignerons des Coteaux Romanais 2013 Le Grand St-Vincent Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: In this lemon-scented wine, flavors range easily from herbaceous to pears with a touch of grapefruit thrown in. It's an attractive, ready-to-drink, fruity wine.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2013  Sancerre

Description: Creamy, balanced and tropical, it's a bang-up deal for the quality. Deeply layered in fig and vanilla, it offers sweet aromas of honeysuckle on the nose. Stock up for parties or all your midweek meals.
Name: Josh Cellars 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Apple aromas and flavors characterize this medium-bodied wine. It tastes concentrated, focused, bracing and fresh. The texture is lean and crisp, with enough body to add some richness on the finish.
Name: Benziger 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: While this is obviously Sauvignon Blanc, it also has some rich creaminess that makes it more rounded and rich. The citrus and crisp apple flavors are well-integrated into this ripe wine.
Name: Closerie du Bailli 2011 Tradition  (Côtes de Bourg)

Description: Rounder and less textured than a Sancerre, this style of Menetou-Salon makes a fine alternative Sauvignon Blanc. It's full and ripe, fresh with acidity while also bringing some tropical fruits into play. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Jean Teiller 2012  Menetou-Salon

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This vintage of the winery's Sauvignon Blanc doesn't reflect the tropicality that's started to define the region. It has more warmth to the nose than the grassy pungency common elsewhere, but the stronger differences are on the palate, with cooked apple, squeezed lemon and a brisk acidity, though not a particularly long finish. Altogether, this is a mellow, subdued wine.
Name: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bold white wine, it smells and tastes like grapefruit, canteloupe and very crisp apples. It has a fresh, acidic texture that cleans the palate and makes the mouth water, but wraps in enough richness for good balance.
Name: Steven Kent 2013 Lola Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: This is a bony, tight and herbaceous wine, sharp and crisp with bright apples and lime flavors. Light and full of minerality, it has a steely line that goes to its heart. Drink now, but it will be better in 2015.
Name: La Grille 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Fresh, lively and brimming over with fruit flavor, from lemon to lime to peach. The appearance is light gold, the aromas are very immediate and effusive, the texture tangy and the finish light with a hint of sweetness.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Avant Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: The wine is soft, a gentle meander through the flavors of Sauvignon Blanc without any shocks. It has an attractive, rounded texture, with shots of acidity that complement the apple skin and pear flavors. Drink now.
Name: Hubert Brochard 2012  Sancerre

Appellation: Sonoma County-Napa County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: From Sonoma and Napa-grown grapes, this white combines fresh peach and apricot flavor with a taste of grapefruit and fresh-squeezed lime. Through the middle it veers into vanilla and tropical swirls, before finishing crisp.
Name: Bartholomew Park 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County-Napa County)

Description: This is steely, crisp and mineral. It is brightly lit by acidity and juicy green fruits, plums and limes. Over all the fruitiness, a tight structure gives a cool aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Roux 2012  Quincy

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A light straw color, bright fruit aromas and a dot of sweetness paint the picture of an easy-drinking refresher. The bracing grapefruit and green apple aromas and flavors are attractive and pleasurable. It's medium-bodied, crisp in balance and slightly soft on the finish.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2013 Horseshoe Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yolo County)

Appellation: Coteaux du Giennois, Loire Valley, France
Description: From a small region just north of Pouilly Fumé, this is light and fruity. It's soft, just herbaceous and full of green apple and grapefruit flavors that give a fresh, lively character. It's completely ready to drink.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2012 La Gaupière Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)

Description: Soft and smooth, it has warm fruit flavors and an open, generous character. It's full of apple juice, with just the lightest texture, crisp and bright at the end.
Name: Pierre Jacolin 2012 Le Prieuré de Saint-Céols  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: Fruity and fresh, this is Sauvignon Blanc at its most attractive. It shows a touch of minerality, but the citrus and crisp apple flavors dominate. With its light touch, it will make a fine apéritif wine.
Name: Domaine Dyckerhoff 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Reuilly)

Description: Soft and ripe, it has attractive peach and pear fruits and a lively shot of lemon acidity. It's rounded, rich and ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2012 Le Charnay  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This austere wine tastes lean with a touch of wax, honeysuckle and apple. Creamy seafood will coax out its soft and subtle nature.
Name: Robert John 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This smooth wine has plenty of varietal character, from the grassy, citrus-like aromas to the lemon and green-apple flavors. Balanced and flavorful, it should pair well with seafood, goat cheese and other food choices.
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 2013 Diamond Collection Yellow Label Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Soft and fruity, it shows rounded apple and fresh pineapple flavors. A crisp side is smoothed by the natural fruitiness. It's a wine to drink now, easy and fresh at the end.
Name: Gitton Père et Fils 2012 Les Belles Dames  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a simple, bright fruity wine, with crisp apple and lemon fruits. It's fresh and ready to drink, with no need to age. A touch of minerality gives the necessary texture.
Name: Chavet Fils 2013  Menetou-Salon

Description: Fresh and lightly fruity, it's crisp and fragrant. With great acidity and a touch of herbaceousness, it's ready to drink.
Name: Château du Cros 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Soft while still herbaceous, this is simple and fruity. Lemon partners melon, bringing ripe fruit and acidity attractively together. It's a bright, fresh wine to drink now.
Name: Bougrier 2013 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Herbaceous in flavor and firm in texture, it brings a freshness and tang with plenty of acidity to perk up fish, shellfish or chicken like a squeeze of fresh lemon.
Name: Graziano 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fans of sharply scented Sauvignon Blancs will be happy with this bottling, which features a strong nose of green pear skin and freshly cut lawn. It is fairly flat upon sipping, though, with a bit of Granny Smith apple tang and faint lemongrass.
Name: Brander 2012 Mesa Verde Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Light and textured, it's packed with lime and lemon flavors with a hint of sage. As dry as a bone, it's very much for food and is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Patrice Moreux 2012  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Quince and lemon aromas continue on the palate. Crisp and tightly textured, it's spoiled by a metallic flavor that hardens the aftertaste.
Name: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2012 La Reine Blanche  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Classic herbaceous, catty aromas usher in a wine that has crisp, gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. It's bright and tight, with acidity that dominates all the fruitiness. It needs to be drunk by 2015.
Name: Henry Brochard 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This is an attractive, soft wine, with fruit right up front. It has light acidity, with pink grapefruit and lime flavors that are bright and lively. Drink now.
Name: Vincent Grall 2012  Sancerre

Description: Tight and herbaceous, this bright and fruity wine offers grapefruit, very fresh acidity and lemon zest flavors. It's all about fruit with no complexity, just pleasure.
Name: Caves du Val de France 2013 Jovly Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Flowery in aroma, this dry, balanced wine offers ripe flavors of melon and a touch of barrel.The finishis fleshy but abbreviated.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a ripe while intensely herbaceous wine. It's steely and crisp, but spoiled by the intrusion of sulfur that hasn't gone away. If the sulfur blows off, this is a potentially attractive and fruity wine finished off with lemon zest.
Name: Isabelle et Pierre Clément 2012 Châtenay  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: While this wine is herbaceous, the attractive aspect lies in its lemon and orange zest flavors that are full and bright. It's crisp while deliciously fruity, ready to drink.
Name: Jean Maréchal 2013 Le Roi des Pierres  (Sancerre)

Description: A yeasty character masks the fresh fruitiness. Underneath the bready notes, grapefruit and other attractive citrus flavors are waiting to get out. Wait until 2015 to see if the wine improves.
Name: Jean-Max Roger 2012 Cuvée Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Description: It still tastes very young with its aggressive acidity and herbaceous character. It's mineral, tight, with zesty lemon, lime and strong gooseberry flavors. It needs until 2015 to calm down.
Name: Les Vignerons des Coteaux Romanais 2013 Château de Pont Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Tightly herbaceous, this is also a friendly, fruity wine. With bright acidity, crisp lemon and grapefruit flavors, it's cool and bright. Drink now.
Name: Les Vignerons des Coteaux Romanais 2013 Les Roches Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this slightly cloudy wine is ruled by lemon-lime soda and chalky candy, which is interesting but one-dimensional. It's easy to drink and smooth enough, with a slight green apple skin tartness, but somewhat flat on the palate.
Name: Indigené 2012 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Carmel Valley)

Description: There is an earthy, barnyard character to this Sauvignon Blanc, with a tightly herbaceous flavor overshadowed by a more rustic style. It's ready to drink, but does need food to balance that earthiness.
Name: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2012  Menetou-Salon

Description: With a metallic aroma that follows through to the palate, this tight wine is all about texture and not much about fruit. Mineral and concentrated, it might round out, but is always likely to be firm in character.
Name: Francis Blanchet 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Round and ripe, with an earthy character, this is a simple, fruity wine. Attractive apple and grapefruit flavors have been hit by a barnyard element that leaves a bitter taste in the mouth.
Name: Eric Cottat 2012 La Vallée des Vignes  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the astonishing Klipsun Vineyard, this wine is rich in Red Mountain fruit, polished by winemaker Jerry Riener. Barrel-fermented in new French oak, this matches ripe, tropical fruit flavors to barrel-generated streaks of toast and caramel.
Name: Guardian 2013 Angel Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This single-vineyard selection is full-bodied and exuberantly rich. It captures the power of Klipsun/Red Mountain fruit, with a lush array of candied orange, citrus and papaya.  There's a touch of sugar, excellent length and a lingering hint of honeycomb.
Name: Barrister 2013 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Winemaker: Bartho Eksteen. Aromas of toasted brioche, almond shell and wood-grilled peach dominate the bouquet of this wooded Sauvignon Blanc. Behind the oaky veil are supporting notes of white peach, citrus oil and lemon curd, all lingering in the background until the prominent oak characteristics mellow a bit more with time. Grilled apple and baking spice flavors carry through the long finish. Drink now–2018.
Designation: Bartho Eksteen Cape Winemakers Guild Vloekskoot
Name: Hermanuspietersfontein 2013 Bartho Eksteen Cape Winemakers Guild Vloekskoot Sauvignon Blanc (Hemel en Aarde)

Description: Winemaker: Charles Hopkins. Fresh and bright, this opens with scents of gooseberry, green plum, fynbos, mineral and lime that continue through to the mouthwatering palate. Well balanced and refreshing, this ends clean and brisk, with a hint of fresh herbs on the close. Drink now–2017.
Name: De Grendel 2014 Cape Winemakers Guild Wooded Sauvignon Blanc (Ceres Plateau)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This young wine is classic and spicy, with still-yeasty aromas of pear and apple. The flavors are focused, with vivid, lightly lemony acidity underscoring highlights of beeswax and flowers.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dry Creek hits another Sauvignon Blanc grand slam with the 2013, dripping in racy minerality, pretty floral aromatics and layers of fresh-squeezed lemon, melon and tropical mango. The palate gives just enough weight to keep things complex and interesting without becoming overbearing. A small percentage of Sauvignon Musqué adds to the mix.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: The family-owned, Santa Lucia Highlands-focused Wrath Winery produces their Ex Anima line to show off wines from their estate San Saba Vineyard made with very little intervention and no new oak. This wine is nearly as clear as water, and yet offers aromas or freshly cut grass, honeydew melon, kiwi and fresh rain on rocks. On the palate, minerality lingers alongside poached pear and peach. Refreshing and light, yet full of flavor.
Name: Wrath 2013 Ex Anima Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Full-flavored and textured, probably from the use of a Sauvignon Musque Clone for half of the wine, this is nonetheless a light wine, subtle in stone fruit, kiwi and lemon-lime. The acidity has an electricity and bubbliness that almost make it come alive. It's the right wine for fresh-shucked oysters.
Name: Armida 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Winemaker: Louis Nel. Green banana, gooseberry and fresh grass lead the bouquet of this Sauvignon Blanc, with a delicate hint of white flowers adding depth. Immediately attractive and refreshing, it offers bright orange and white-currant flavors that finish fresh and juicy. Drink now–2016.
Name: Louis Nel 2014 Cape Winemakers Guild Wild Rumpus Sauvignon Blanc (Darling)

Description: Fermented entirely in stainless steel, this is a floral and fruity wine from a great Carneros vineyard. Offering sharp acidity and rounded flavors of honey and apple, it begs to be enjoyed with food along the lines of foie gras and fresh oysters.
Name: Maisonry 2013 Hudson Vineyard Sans Chêne Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather than pungent green aromas, this bottling tends toward a sweeter aromatic profile, with limeade, mandarin orange and tangerine scents. On the palate, there is a slight creaminess and a nod toward bell pepper, but the tart, bitter and acidic elements of apple and lime pith combine memorably.
Name: Carr 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Flowery and electric in high-toned grapefruit and peach, this is a crisp, clean white from a consistent producer. Medium-bodied, it holds small percentages of Sémillon and Muscat. The finely hewed texture benefits from 10% of the wine having been aged in neutral oak.
Name: Honig 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Dry and layered in crisp melon, lime and lemon zest, this aromatic SB is complex and kissed by honeysuckle. It's a natural go-to for shellfish, especially Hog Island oysters from the coast near Point Reyes. A warm goat cheese salad would also do nicely.
Name: Kunde 2013 Magnolia Lane Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: A bouquet of white peach, honeysuckle and rose petal with a whiff of freshly mowed grass yields to flavors of cantaloupe, Turkish delight and nutmeg joined by a touch of salinity. Soft mouthfeel and well-integrated flavors make way for a bright floral splash on the finish.
Name: Tabor 2013 Adama Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dry and refreshing, it's steely in stone fruit and pineapple. The acidity is clean and bright but not so overpowering that the wine won't develop more nuance over time. It balances well between cool-climate minerality, an underpinning of herb and fresh California fruit.
Name: Longboard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Light straw in color, this wine offers aromas of pineapple, river rock and toast. Flavors of honeydew, guava, orange blossom and bitter almond are evident on the palate. The symmetry of creamy and tangy sensations continues into the smooth finish.
Name: Sevilen 2012 Denizli-Guney Plateau Sauvignon Blanc (Aegean)

Description: Bristling in acidity and steely in wet stone, this SB is crisp and layered in lemon, with more lemon on the finish. It yearns for shellfish.
Name: Ousterhout 2013 Redwood Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

Description: Almost clear in color and faintly aromatic, it offers nuanced layers of pineapple, guava and pear. A suggestion of barrel fermentation makes it mid-weight and fuller in body. The finish is creamy and swathed in herb, an ideal companion to shellfish.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Uboldi Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Description: The beautiful floral nose is inviting and intoxicating. In taste, it offers lemon, quince, plenty of acidity and a long finish, a touch of grass and vanilla-sugar just slightly in the background. Complexity makes the wine intriguing.
Name: Ziata 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cut grass, green apple and crisp stone fruit comprise the aromas on this wine from a rocky block of the Margarita Vineyard, a cool spot just 14 miles from the ocean. The flavors balance between the perceived sweetness of baked apple and cherimoya and the bitter tannic tension of a grape leaf.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Scented with toasty oak, it conveys round, ripe fruit flavors. The Yakima Valley acidity keeps it fresh and lively.
Name: Sol Stone 2012 Solitude Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Buttonwood's accurately named Zingy boasts an exciting amount of verve on both the nose and palate. Fresh aromas of passionfruit juice and guava translate to zesty flavors of Granny Smith apple and brilliant acidity. Serve with freshly shucked oysters and jalapeno-topped, yuzu-splashed sushi.
Name: Buttonwood Farm 2013 Zingy Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, it delivers notes of herbs, mineral, white grapefruit and an assortment of tropical fruit. Dry and tart, it discloses grapefruit rind flavors on the finish.
Name: Cave B 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

Description: New Dry Creek Vineyard Winemaker Tim Bell is showing finesse with this signature white for the winery. All stainless-steel fermented, it's racy in acidity and offers juicy fruit flavors of apricot, lemon and lime, plus fresh-cut grass and an herbal streak on top of stony minerality. It finishes long. Pair it with oysters and a day on the bay.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2013 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Smooth and bright, this fruity Sauvignon Blanc offers vanilla and tropical coconut, with medium levels of acidity and weight. The finish revisits the sun-kissed tropical theme.
Name: Dealy Lane 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Fragrant, floral and mouthfilling, this easy-to-love wine is a crowd pleaser. Notes of sweet peach, citrus and vanilla are not overly done in any way. It offers juicy minerality and generous fruit.
Name: Kenwood 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sweet honeysuckle and fresh-cut grass open up on the nose, before high-toned grapefruit and peach hit on the midpalate. There's a mellowness to the finish, where grapefruit comes back to the fore, sprinkled in honey.
Name: Cuvée Wine Cellars 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Classically aromatic and slightly grassy, it has touches of sweet pineapple and vanilla dancing throughout the soft layers of easy-drinking acidity and crispness.
Name: Decoy 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This well-integrated wine delivers intoxicating aromas of jasmine, tangerine and peach. These intertwine citrus-y minerality with a candied sweetness, especially on the finish.
Name: White Oak 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: A straightforward, nicely priced wine offering mid-weight texture amidst grapefruit, lime and peach flavors and aromas. It's an easy-to-like quaffer for summertime or to enjoy before meals.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Description: Exotic strips of lemon zest mark this wine, followed by intense acidity that begs for food to tame it down. The vineyards involved are on the cooler side. Expect spice and tangy grapefruit to glide on the finish.
Name: Schug 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: With smidgens of Viognier and Sémillon, this wine offers aromas of sweet jasmine and fig, and is bright with some heft on the palate. With suggestions of tropical fruit and apricot, the acidity is subtle.
Name: Simi 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: John Shaw and Lisa Cuevas Shaw run this boutique-sized, Bordeaux-minded winery, which offers this Sauvignon Blanc alongside their higher priced reds. This wine starts with lemongrass, crushed rock and white flower aromas, then indulges in some tropical guava on the palate, which is very soft and full.
Name: Alma Sol 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The alcohol has dropped to just above 12% in this vintage, and the wine seems a tad underripe. Overtly grassy and pungent, it suggests with petrol, gooseberry and green banana. Drink it well-chilled.
Name: Airfield Estates 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Here is a steely, bright Sauvignon Blanc that's rounded in citrus, melon and herbal flavors, finishing clean and with ample acidic lift.
Name: Foppiano 2012 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From owner/winemaker Kathy Joseph, the wine has subdued tartness on the nose, and green apple and citrus elements on the palate. Stone fruit emerges quickly when poured, but the wine loses such nuance as it sits in the glass. It's a good brunch wine to serve with frittata.
Name: Fiddlehead Cellars 2013 Goosebury Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Creamy and nutty, this wine offers ample herbaceous qualities around muted melon and citrus, finishing with ample lift and refreshment.
Name: Novy 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: There's a layer of sweetness to this viscous wine, which exudes aromas of graham cracker and pear, finishing in a light coating of lemon.
Name: Pangloss Cellars 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A whiff of petrol leads off on this oaky, full-figured white, which is creamy and textured with a touch of sweetness on the finish.
Name: Rochioli 2013 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
