Description: Grown in a chalk and flint soil, this is a strongly textured, tight wine. It has a dense mineral character, steely and with layers of citrus. Very dry, very young, this impressive wine needs to age until 2015 before drinking.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 La Chapelle des Augustins  (Sancerre)

Description: This starts off a bit nutty and funky, but give it time in the glass and it delivers bright aromas of nectarine and grapefruit in addition to the nut and dough notes. Despite this wine's weight and richness, it's crisply focused on the finish, where its grapefruit flavors really linger. It should prove relatively long-lived, but I'd still opt for drinking it over the next few years.
Name: Dog Point 2011 Section 94 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Full bodied and lushly textured, this is not a typical Marlborough Sauvignon. On the nose, there's a restrained smoky character and some grapefruit, while the plate bursts with lovely pink grapefruit and some understated leafiness. It's all brought together by a balanced, harmonious finish.
Name: Greywacke 2011 Wild Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Named after a pioneer of wood-aged Sauvignon Blanc, this wine has toast as well as rounded fruit. The subtle wood focuses on enriching the fruit and bringing out its steel and citrus character. The wine can certainly age, drink until 2020.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2011 Etienne Henri  (Sancerre)

Description: Most barrel-fermented Marlborough Sauvignons will set you back close to twice as much, making this a bargain. Awesomely pungent and smoky aromas leap from the glass, followed by complex flavors that range from saline to pink grapefruit and stone fruit. Drink this full-bodied, silky-textured wine over the next year or two.
Name: Jules Taylor 2011 Barrel Fermented Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Produced from old vines, this is a properly concentrated, full-bodied wine. It has great weight and richness while retaining citrus and grassy flavors. The texture, very mineral from the chalk soil, is nervy and tight. The wine needs to age until 2015.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2011 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

Description: This grassy, aromatic wine is rich and fruity. With a year's age it has lost its puppy fruitiness and mellowed into a richer, more complex wine. White currants, gooseberries and a chalky texture give depth to this well-crafted wine that is ready to drink.
Name: François Millet 2011 Tentation Blanc  (Sancerre)

Description: Full and ripe, the wine has smooth flavors of apricots, ripe apples and pears and a structure that includes wood tastes. It's a rich wine, hinting at spice and showing fresh, juicy acidity at the end. Drink until 2019.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2010 Grande Fumé  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Still young, this intense wine is packed with tropical and citrus fruits. It is also structured, textured with a chalky, mineral feel. This is a wine that feels rich and that needs several years aging. Drink from 2016.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 La Demoiselle de Bourgeois  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: From the home vineyards of the Saget family, this a warm and generous wine. While endowed with many green Sauvignon Blanc characteristics, the tropical fruit style makes it feel rich. As it ages, it will offer even more complex flavors. Drink from 2015.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2012 Le Domaine  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A full, fruity wine, it is ripe and finely textured. It also has a good chalky, mineral character, rich apple and grapefruit flavors and tight, dense acidity. It should be aged until 2015.
Name: François Millet 2012 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)

Description: The silex, flint soil typical of Sancerre creates this style of crisp, very textured wine, as sharp as the soil itself. The wine is glass brittle, very fresh and with intense citrus flavors. Drink now, but better to wait until the end of 2014.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2012 Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: An intensely herbaceous, still-young wine, it has picked up chalky, stony texture from the soil that gives also the wine structure and density. Age this fine wine uneil 2015 to broaden its tight character.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2012 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Sourced from the Waihopai Valley, this rather full-bodied Sauvignon boasts intense aromas of ruby red grapefruit and crushed tomato leaf. It's round on the palate, where the leafiness recedes a bit, replaced by ripe, stone-fruit characters that are soft and silky on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2011 The Ned Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With a handful of 24% Sémillon, this is a crisply rich Sauvignon Blanc with tempting aromas of crème brûlée and vanilla bean and a taste of tart grapefruit and lime. Easy to drink, it's complex and layered with a long finish, soft and balanced.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Description: The wine shows good depth along with suggestions of oak aging. It is ripe, full in the mouth and generous. Tropical fruits, orange zest and citrus combine well. The aftertaste shows a nutty bite. Drink now, or age until 2016–2017.
Name: Chavet Fils 2011 Cuvée Exception  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This wine is concentrated and very fruity while also being stylish and elegant. Combining white fruits, light citrus and a strong texture, it merits aging until 2016 before drinking.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 En Travertin  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A crisp, linear Sauvignon Blanc, with tantalizing flavors of tangerine, that's bright, clean and easy to like. On the finish, the tangerine evolves into melon and lime.This wine will sit well on tables set for brunch or a seafood feast.
Name: Wente 2012 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)

Description: Cool and crisp, this tightly herbaceous wine has a concentrated, juicy, green fruit character along with a tangy texture. The fruits are complemented by the tight, acidic aftertaste. Drink from 2014.
Name: François Millet 2012 Empreinte Blanc  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc, the natural acidity rounded out by warmer fruits, currants, spice and a sense of structure. It is young, like many Pouilly Fumés at this stage, and will be best in 2015.
Name: Sauvion 2012 Loire Valley  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Aromas of peach, green apple and freesia yield to flavors of apricot, peach, orange zest and rose petal. Light in the mouth, with touches of smooth viscosity, the finish is bright but pleasantly subdued.
Name: Ouled Thaleb 2012 Médallion Sauvignon Blanc (Zenata)

Description: This concentrated, ripe Sauvignon Blanc brims with rich apple, gooseberry and citrus flavors. It has a strongly mineral texture, tense acidity and a delicate, floral finish. The wine should be aged until 2015.
Name: Régis Minet 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: The wine is young, which explains the intense acidity and flavors of currants as well as citrus. It is right up front with its fruitiness. Bright acidity shines through and gives the wine delicious, ready-to-drink character.
Name: Domaine Sautereau 2012 Côte de Reigny  (Sancerre)

Description: This crisp and fruity wine aims at the tropical fruit side of Sauvignon Blanc. It has citrus, pineapple and red apple flavors that are given some structure by the acidity and the zesty nature of the wine. Drink now and until 2017.
Name: Sauvion 2012 Loire Valley  (Sancerre)

Description: An attractive wine with just the right mix between herbaceous and riper fruit flavors. Apricots and a strong citrus element are cut through with tangy, textured acidity. Drink until 2018.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2012 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: A ripe wine that goes in the direction of tropical fruits, only hinting at a more herbaceous character. It is full of peach and pineapple that are balanced with lime. Ready to drink in 2015, it leaves a warm, rich aftertaste.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

Description: There is a touch of earthiness typical of Menetou-Salon in this wine. It brings out gooseberry, catty flavors as well as swathes of citrus. Very crisp, this is a wine that could do with a year to round out.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2012 Côtes des Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: Aromas of bright lemon zest, freshly cut grass, passion fruit and grapefruit lead to flavors of kumquat, mango and lemongrass. There's salty minerality and a nice touch of acidity on the finish.
Name: Chateau Burgozone 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Danube River Plains)

Description: Zesty and full bodied, this has delightful aromas of freshly mowed lawn, lemon pith and grapefruit zest. It's clean, crisp and somewhat astringent on the palate, making this a great wine to pair with raw clams and oysters.
Name: Pullus 2012 Dry White Sauvignon Blanc (Štajerska)

Description: This SB delivers citrus peel, grass and other common varietal aromas. The feel is a touch flabby and soft despite modest acidity, while flavors of citrus fruits and green herbs finish round and long.
Name: Michel Torino 2013 Ciclos Fume Sauvignon Blanc (Cafayate)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Classic herbaceous aromas plus a tropical touch make this wine refreshing. A zingy texture brings the whole wine to life. Attractive and accessible, with a friendly price point. Drink now.
Name: Le Petit Panier 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: A grassy wine that is made richer with pear and melon flavors. Full and fresh, it offers green fruits layered with chalky texture. It could age until 2015, but is ready to drink.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2012  Sancerre

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This Lake County Sauvignon Blanc from a Lodi-based producer shows off the North Coast appellation well, with pear compote and marshmallow on the nose, followed by a taste of apricot fuzz and oak, medium in body with a long-lasting finish.
Name: Van Ruiten 2012 Rooster Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Brilliant yellow with green highlights, this Bulgarian Sauvignon Blanc has aromas and flavors of tropical fruits like mango, papaya and kumquat. There's gentle acidity in the palate and generous mouthfeel.
Name: Bulgariana 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Description: Pale straw colored, with aromas of white flower, lemon blossom and vanilla caramel, this fills your mouth with flavors of caramelized apple tart and finishes with crisp, clean acidity and a splash of lemon zest at the back of the palate.
Name: Vini 2012 Veni Vidi Vici Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With a suggestion of New Zealand-style grass, this is a widely distributed Sauvignon Blanc with layers of racy acidity that's all in all snappy and cleanly linear. The taste is mostly grapefruit rind, crisply rendered. A great wine to have on hand for large gatherings.
Name: Castle Rock 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This simple white is creamy and crisp with layers of peach flavor. It would be enjoyable alongside shellfish of just about any kind, but especially with raw oysters in a mignonette sauce. The wine's textures can hold up against both the richness of the sauce and oysters' salty brine.
Name: Cedar Mountain 2012 Blanches Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: The scene is set by the natural herbaceous notes of Sauvignon Blanc. They follow through to the green, crisp flavors of the wine. However, it also has a more sunny feel, more tropical in character at the end. Ready to drink now.
Name: Cortes de Cima 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

Description: This soft, fresh Sauvignon Blanc just hints at herbaceousness and brings out riper fruits, peaches and red apple skins. A ripe and warm wine, it is ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Chavet Fils 2012 Tradition  (Menetou-Salon)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Totally herbaceous, this is a lemon and mown-grass scented wine. Crisp, light and with gooseberry flavors, it shows a direct, bright, tight aftertaste. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2012 Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Description: Very herbaceous, this is a light and simple wine. It has attractive green fruits, citrus and fresh acidity. Crisp and clean, it is ready to drink.
Name: Langlois-Chateau 2012  Sancerre

Description: A ripe and smooth wine that has just the right amount of herbaceous flavors to partner the riper pear and lime. It's a soft, refreshing wine, ready to drink.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Gooseberry and feline aromas are true to the variety but a bit austere and sharp. The palate is plump like you'd expect from warm-climate SB, while flavors of nectarine, citrus and melon finish full, tangy and a bit heavy.
Name: O. Fournier 2013 Urban Uco Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: From vineyards owned by Paul Buisse, this is a ripe, tropical-fruited wine. It is light in texture, with herbal and grassy flavors on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Paul Buisse 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A marshmallow-kissed Sauvignon Blanc with a touch of grass and tropical lime, this is a straightforward white that finishes quick and is wanting in texture.
Name: Abbeyville 2012 Fumé Blanc (North Coast)

Description: With a touch of herbaceousness and a rounded texture, this is a simple and fruity wine. Light chalkiness in the texture indicates the only complexity.
Name: Drouet Frères 2012 La Forcine  (Sancerre)

Description: Aromatically intense notes of flint, smoke and gunmetal already hint at the precise and profound nature of this Styrian Sauvignon Blanc. Everything is in abundance: concentration, savory undertones of boxwood and moss and an integrated acidity that gives both length and structure to this intense wine. Drink 2015–2018.
Name: Manfred Tement 2011 Zieregg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The first Feral made by new winemaker, Peter Devison, continues a tradition of excellence. Natural yeasts and fermentation in neutral oak, combined with a superb vintage and world class vineyard, equal a gorgeous bottle of wine. Creamy, leesy, textural and deeply imbued with mineral-soaked citrus fruit, flesh and rind, this ultrarefreshing wine is a joy. Notes of cucumber and melon contribute further complexity through the long finish.
Name: Efeste 2012 Feral Evergreen Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A rare Walla Walla Sauvignon Blanc, this is rich and round in this new vintage, fully-ripened to lush flavors of apple, pear and papaya. Great concentration and length are in play, though the ripe fruit shows none of the lovely herbaceousness generally associated with this grape.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2012 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A first for K Vintners, this fruit was sourced from the Sunset and Evergreen vineyards, and supervised by winemaker, Brennon Leighton. Cool climate characteristics are shown in the form of unripe berry and juicy acid flavors. There's a slight natural herbaceousness, as well.
Name: K Vintners 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Snappy aromas of citrus and lime come with minerality on a bouquet that's pungent but doesn't punch. This feels clean, friendly and well built; flavors of lime, tangerine and mango finish persistent, with no breakdowns. This is what top Chilean SB is all about.
Name: Viña Leyda 2013 Single Vineyard Garuma Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This lovely blend of Sauvignon Blanc, and 14% Roussanne, is as crisp and fresh as its name implies. Bright fruit flavors of lemon, lime, orange and pineapple speak to the success of this unusual blend. It's a bracing, palate-cleansing white wine that will be appealing all year round.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2012 Linen Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this 100% varietal wine is bright and focused with notes of herbs, citrus and kiwi. It's ripe and full of juicy fruit flavors with a spine of citric acidity running throughout. Give this some time to open up.
Name: Apex 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This attractive, bright white opens with aromas of orange, green apple flesh and barely-ripe white peach. The light-weight mouth offers more of the same, alongside notes of melon rind and soft brioche. A slight creaminess is countered by brisk acidity, ending clean and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Morgenhof 2011 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: While creamy in texture, and with rich vanilla, honey and pear flavors, this SB has a cleansing citrus mid-palate where it's crisp, bright personality shines through. Well priced and well made, this is a good representative of Lake County's new High Valley AVA.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2012 High Elevation Collection Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: Pungent and snappy up front, with grapefruit and nettle aromas, this is classic Leyda Sauvignon Blanc on the bouquet. On the palate, this is fresh, juicy and upright. Well-cut flavors of green pea, lime and tangerine finish pithy and firm.
Name: San Pedro 2013 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Aromatically reminiscent of creme brûlée, this delightful Mendocino-grown wine, made from organically grown grapes, is crisp, clean and bright with grapefruit flavor. Textured, and with some flesh to its bones, it should pair especially well with wintertime shellfish.
Name: McFadden 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Description: Tropical more than green and pungent, this fragrant wine offers powdery, sweet notes and stronger coastal ones. It's lean and angular in feel, with oceanic flavors of nettle, tangerine and lemon. A light green flavor and a chalky feel make up the finish.
Name: Viña Leyda 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Ripe, rounded and grassy varietal flavors set this apart from more slender offerings of the new world. This is Sauvignon Blanc from a continental climate, with substance and roundness that puts flesh on the bones of this sleek variety. This is ideal for pairing with soft, washed-rind cheeses.
Name: Manfred Tement 2012 Berghausener Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Herbal hints of fynbos and white-floral accents frame the bright clementine-fruit core of this wine. Subtle notes of hay and toast add depth to the otherwise brisk and lively palate. This is well-balanced and drinking beautifully now.
Name: Backsberg 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit sources—Klipsun and Gamache—are excellently displayed in this white that includes 8% Sémillon. A bracing, cool blast of citrus, white peach, melon and cucumber is buoyed with crisp minerality. The wine spent seven months in 15% new French oak.
Name: Three Rivers 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Tight, gritty, steely aromas of nettle and ocean mist allow for a modest amount of citrus fruit to poke through. A narrow, high-acid palate may peel back the enamel on your teeth, while flavors of sour green apple and gooseberry finish shear and tart.
Name: Garces Silva 2013 Boya Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: There's lots of grapefruit and kiwi flavor here, as well as a touch of creme brûlée. High toned in style, it has a rounded body, along with a suggestion of herbs. The finish is long and satisfying.
Name: Angel's Secret 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: Focused aromas of lime and green herbs are fresh and properly parceled. This shows nice acidity and punch, along with green fruit and mild bell-pepper flavors. A long, dry, peppery finish is tasty, like the rest of the wine.
Name: Santa Carolina 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a light, tropical Sauvignon Blanc that's widely distributed. The palate is marked by pleasant layers of pineapple, guava and melon. On the finish a streak of lemon lingers awhile. A great wine for parties, picnics and other casual gatherings.
Name: Uppercut 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Apple and pear fruit is set in a frame of citrus, grapefruit flesh and rind. Skin flavors are well modulated, with a hint of minerality, as well. This is wine is drinking nicely—clean and persistent.
Name: Snoqualmie 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Here's a crisp and refreshing Sauvingon that opens with aromas of stone fruit and a hint of crushed tomato vine. The crisp palate shows juicy white peach, green melon and mango, as well as a delicate mineral note.
Name: Conte Leopardi 2012 Calcare Sauvignon (Marche)

Description: Aromas of grass and green citrus fruits are just pungent enough. This is basic but lively in the mouth, with grassy flavors and citrus notes of grapefruit and lime. A chalky finish is cleansing.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2013 La Joya Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Grassy aromas blend with tropical fruit notes to create a good but regular Casablanca bouquet. This feels lively and easy to take, while flavors of green herbs, grass and citrus finish a touch bitter, evidence of a cool vintage.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2013 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: With heavy notes of botrytis and oak, this is reflective of the European style of sweet whites. The palate is fleshy but not terribly precise, while flavors of caramel, butter and baked apple finish modest and shy on acidity.
Name: Santa Ema 2011 Late Harvest Tardío Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Crisp, spicy, grassy, citrus aromas are all good. This is acidic and cleansing; zesty flavors of orange and pineapple finish nervy, pithy and a touch bitter. For patio-ready SB, this is ideal.
Name: Quintay 2013 Clava Coastal Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Grassy, straw-like aromas offer bits of lime and orange. This is light, juicy and tangy. Flavors of lime, tart apple, grapefruit and kiwi finish with stony minerality and lasting lemon-lime notes.
Name: William Cole 2013 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: There's an oaky edge to this attractive Sauvignon Blanc, with sweet-spice notes that accent the ripe-fruit aromas and flavors of peach, apple and melon. Medium weight and clean, with a touch of menthol that unfolds on the finish.
Name: Nederburg 2011 The Winemaker's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: Uncommitted aromas of citrus, generic green herbs and vanilla set up a fresh, slightly fleshy palate with lemon-lime flavors. Citrusy on the finish, this is good, functional SB to drink right away.
Name: Máscara de Feugo 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This is a bit vegetal on the nose, where nectarine aromas compete with greener notes of canned beans and asparagus. In the mouth, this is oily in feel, while flavors of green fruits trend toward herbaceous. A minerally finish with citrus flavors and herbal leftovers is what you'd expect.
Name: Anakena 2013 Enco Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: With grapefruit and orange aromas, this is on the ripe side, but the feel is fresh and flavors of citrus, white pepper, arugula and briny melon get the job done. Drink this quaffer soon and it will satisfy; hold it too long and it will lose its fresh character.
Name: Tololo 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Briny aromas of lime, jalapeño and minerals filter into a juicy, acidic palate with flavors that match the nose: briny citrus, lime and bell pepper. A narrow feeling finish turns pithy and bitter the longer this sits.
Name: Arboleda 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: There's a lot of character to this wine, with lively aromas and flavors of grapefruit, green plum, lime peel and a touch of dried grass. It's brisk and clean on the palate, with refreshing acidity and a mouthwatering finish. Drink up.
Name: KWV 2011 Cathedral Cellar Sauvignon Blanc (Paarl)

Description: This is adequately pungent on the nose, with a touch of the veggies. The palate is modest in acidity but not flat or flabbby. Flavors of green fruits mix with a hint of asparagus, while controlled capsicum and bitterness work the finish.
Name: Anakena 2013 Tama Vineyard Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: There's a suggestion of sweetness underlying this pleasant, crisp and fruity wine. Though labeled 100% Sauvignon Blanc, it does little to showcase varietal character. However, as a fruit-forward, quaffable white, it works quite nicely.
Name: Columbia Crest 2012 Two Vines Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Description: Every vintage this wine pulls the same score, so there's something to be said about consistency. This bottling is neutral on the nose, with hints of dust and melon. The palate is clean and citrusy in feel, with melon and green herb notes. An easy finish seems right given the precedings.
Name: Palo Alto 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: With almost no color, this is pungent and feline on the nose, with ample citric essence. Tangy, chalky and acidic on the palate, this offers lime and tangerine flavors in front of a short but clean finish.
Designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
Name: Santa Alicia 2013 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: A direct and appealing wine with notes of freshly cut grass and citrus. It's medium bodied and off-dry (15 g/L residual sugar) with sweet fruit flavors that come off as a bit diluted.
Name: Washington Hills 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Description: Pleasant yet bland up front, this lacks the punch of a serious Sauvignon Blanc. A plump, flat mouthfeel and pithy flavors of citrus fruits and minerals finish without a lot of kick or length.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2013 Petirrojo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Notes of sour apple and lemon accompany this wine's dialed-high acidity. Priced to sell, it'll suffice in certain settings as an apéritif or quaffer with snacks.
Name: un4seen 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Spunky citrus and nettle aromas offer a fair and honest opening. This is fresh on the tongue, with white grapefruit as the lead flavor. On the finish, it's a bit flat. Quaffable is the best way to describe this value SB.
Name: La Playa 2013 Estate Series Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Husch has been making Sauvignon Blanc since 1980. This one is fairly full-bodied with a thread of acidity weaving in and out of the tropical fruit flavors. In the background, hints of peach and grass linger.
Name: Husch 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: While the nose is pungent and true to the variety, there isn't much else positive to say about this cypher of a Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is plump yet fizzy, while the flavor profile offers citrus, bitterness and nothing more.
Name: Llai Llai 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: With little varietal character on the nose, this qualifies as a basic, plump white wine with mild fruit, oily notes and some bitterness.
Name: San Pedro 2013 Gato Negro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This particular cuvée is fermented in a large acacia barrel which helps to round out the fruity flavors without sacrificing focus or precision. It's pleasantly grassy, with a strong pineapple flavor at the core. With excellent length, structure and mouthfeel, this wine could be cellared for another five or six years.
Name: J. Christopher 2012 Croft Vineyard Über-Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: If aiming for a Loire-style Sauv Blanc, this wine hits it right on target. Saline, crisp and steely, it's got great concentration, length and purity. Sappy citrus, orange peel and grapefruit combine in a bracing, thoroughly delicious and refreshing wine.
Name: J. Christopher 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: The Wohlmuth family has owned this vineyard since 1803, producing wines with impressive continuity. The Sauvignon Blanc is rich, and almost tropical, but without being heavy. Apples, pears and apricots combine beautifully. It could age for a year or two, but is thoroughly drinkable now.
Name: Wohlmuth 2012 Hochsteinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This wine is rich and full in the mouth with a fine combination of citrus acidity and yellow peach flavors. The texture is smooth at first, but then shows a more mineral and zesty character. It's promising to age, but is also quite drinkable now. Drink until 2019.
Name: Wohlmuth 2012 Steinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of three Sauvignon Blancs from J. Christopher, this limited-quantity, single-vineyard bottling mixes pretty citrus fruit with lightly grassy, herbaceous elements. Nothing is overblown, and everything combines into a seamless, fresh, delicious wine with oyster-shell minerality.
Name: J. Christopher 2012 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Deliciously refreshing and herbaceous, this wine is also quite fruity with flavors of apples and citrus. Lively acidity and a fine tang of lemon zest makes it crisp and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Wohlmuth 2012 Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This is an attractive, fruity wine that is full of tropical fruits and herbs. Apricots mingle with citrus, pink grapefruit and a tangy, zesty texture, making this a bright, light wine that's ready to drink now.
Name: Pezat 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a crisp, herbaceous and classic Sauvignon Blanc. It has a light character with fresh citrus and grapefruit flavors. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Forstreiter 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Description: This lively, fruity wine is simple in character but full of grapefruit and lemon crispness. It is softly textured, but has a final bite of lemon zest and tight acidity.
Name: Château Seguin 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Soft and rounded, this is a wine that shows its ripe fruits upfront. It has a lightly textured character along with some spice for added interest. The aftertaste is fresh and crisp.
Name: Château Mémoires 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is a benchmark Washington Sauvignon Blanc, from old vines at Red Mountain's Klipsun Vineyard. Rich and textural, it showcases tightly wound apple and pear with lightly-applied suggestions of barrel toast. It finishes with, bracing, slightly saline acidity.
Name: JM Cellars 2012 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: The original Dagueneau domaine, Berthiers has produced a rich, warm wine, full in style, layering its crisp lemon acidity with ripe pear flavors. As often with Pouilly Fumé, it's a wine that needs aging, so drink from 2014.
Name: Domaine des Berthiers 2012 Saint-Andelain  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Despite its modest acidity, this is a rich, overwhelmingly herbaceous wine. It has red currant and intense citrus flavors and considerable concentration. This white wine needs at least six months before drinking.
Name: Patient Cottat 2012 Anciennes Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: The 2012 vintage was so hot in Chile that harvests came very early. Thus finding mature, complex SBs in this year won't be easy. This perennially excellent wine is as good as you'll find in 2012. Scallion, lime and other green aromas precede a zesty, hard-driving palate. Sea shell, grapefruit, lime and chervil flavors set up a tight, minerally finish.
Designation: Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5
Name: Concha y Toro 2012 Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Not just old vines, but ancient vines, this is a juicy, concentrated and ripe wine. It is sufficiently rich and textured to need some aging to bring out the full fruits even more. Drink from 2014.
Name: Patient Cottat 2012 Anciennes Vignes  (Menetou-Salon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Several different clones are blended into this Loire-influenced Sauvignon Blanc. The freshness and tart, tangy citrus fruit flavors are impressive, and would certainly match well to a plate of raw oysters.
Name: Savage Grace 2012 Red Willow Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Two thirds Boushey Vineyard, and one third Red Willow, this pure Sauvignon Blanc has not yet completely knit itself together. There's a solid core of clean and tangy ripe lemon, citrus and pineapple fruit. The finish is where it lacks some focus, and may benefit from another year or two of bottle age.
Name: Avennia 2012 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This includes 10% Sémillon in the blend, which works nicely. It brings lush fruit flavors of melon, pear and passionfruit, along with a leesy, textural mouthfeel.
Name: Garofalo 2012 Les Collines Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This fresh but generic Sauvignon Blanc offers white-fruit aromas and zesty passion fruit scents. The mouthfeel is juicy, while flavors of grapefruit, lime and orange finish with a touch of pithy bitterness. Along the way, riper notes of melon fade in and out.
Name: Peñascal 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: One hundred percent varietal and aged in stainless steel, it's direct and appealing with notes of fresh herbs, guava and pineapple. Light and airy in style, it drinks off dry (9 g/L residual sugar), and finishes a bit short.
Name: Willow Crest 2012 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: A broad, ripe wine, it is simply fruity with attractive lemon and grapefruit flavors, touched by gooseberries. It's tangy, textured and likely to age for a 2–3 years, but you can also drink now.
Name: Caves de Pouilly sur Loire 2012 Les Moulins à Vent  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Get passed the name and label and this is a typical fresh and fruity wine from Gascogne. It is light, herbaceous and immediately drinkable with its lemon and green fruits. Screwcap.
Name: The Gnome Knows 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Only mildly herbaceous, this is a soft, gentle wine. It has ripe apple and peach fruits, juicy acidity and an attractive perfumed character. The wine is still young, so give it a few months.
Name: Bougrier 2012 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Angular, slightly sweaty aromas let you know up front that this is Sauvignon Blanc. In the mouth, it's a bit soft and short on acidity. Flavors of mango, banana and brown sugar finish with candied sweetness and a shot of bitterness.
Name: Palacio de Bornos 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Very herbaceous, fruity wine, right up front in its crispness and lemon and grapefruit flavors. It's all fruit, just lightly textured and ready to drink.
Name: Patient Cottat 2012 Le Grand Caillou Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Very fruity and soft, this wine blends tropical pineapple aromas with a crisper, lemon zest palate. It's a gentle wine, its acidity tamed by the ripe fruits. Screwcap,
Name: Tortoise Creek 2012 Cuvée Jeanne Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: The nose is true to the variety: there's grapefruit and lime aromas along with grassy notes. The palate is solid, maybe a bit plump and vapid, with lemon, lime and other citrus flavors. A bell pepper and jalapeño sharpness comes up on the finish.
Name: Terrapura 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: The cool, light Sauvignon Blanc of Touraine has an intensely herbaceous, catty character. This is typically crisp, fresh and very fruity, if one dimensional. Drink now.
Name: Paul Buisse 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This is almost brutally austere. The nose expresses nothing but grass and zest, and the palate is sharp in feel, with chiseled, raw power and pithy, stony flavors of lemon, grapefruit and sour orange. This is overpowering and clipped; it has merits but needs to be more friendly.
Name: Koyle 2012 Costa Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Costa)

Description: After a quick start of citrus and grass aromas, the bouquet loses clarity and becomes mealy and old smelling. Acidity keeps the palate afloat but the longer this sits, the more briny and pickled it tastes. Drink fast for some citrus character.
Name: Maray 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Gold in color, with a chunky palate and pushy, reduced, mealy flavors of grapefruit. Vegetal on the finish. Tasted twice with identical results.
Name: Ventisquero 2012 Queulat Single Vineyard Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This vintage marks a big step forward for this Oregon Sauvignon Blanc. As fresh and racy as a bright young Quincy from the Loire, this sappy Sauvignon has the snap of natural acidity and a tongue-tingling mix of melon, lime and grapefruit on the palate. It's drinking beautifully right now while at its most fresh.
Name: Kandarian 2012 Blue Eye Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A 50-case release from Six Sigma, this Sauvignon Blanc is fleshy, dark and complex, complete with lime, lemon and guava tones. It'll stand up to creamy shellfish dishes or a platter of fresh oysters—an intense study in barrel-kissed Lake County Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2012 Bootleg Limited Release Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Varietally correct aromas of grapefruit and lime show a touch of coastal Leyda's patented cool-climate, vegetal qualities. In the mouth, this is tangy and fresh, with scallion, green herb, grapefruit and tangerine flavors. A long, persistent finish is minerally and oceanic in style, with some bitterness.
Name: Santa Rita 2012 Medalla Real Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Capay Valley, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This is another intensely crafted Sauvignon Blanc from Casey Flat. This wine opens with muted aromatics of orange rind and melon, a swirl of sweet jasmine too. It has a rich, creamy palate that captures the warm climate of the vintage and its provenance.
Name: Casey Flat Ranch 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Capay Valley)

Description: This delicious and refined Sauvignon Blanc from Tuscany offers classic varietal aromas of crushed tomato vine and green melon. Succulent cantaloupe, peach and apricot flavors are balanced by crisp acidity and a creamy texture.
Name: Bindella 2012 Gemella Sauvignon Blanc (Toscana)

Description: This is hard to resist, a crisp, easy sipper that's gentle on the wallet and bright with sweet jasmine aromatics. On the palate expect refreshing Mandarin orange and lemon zest flavors. It's a clean, crisp wine made from organic grapes, 52% of which hail from Lake, the rest from Mendocino County.
Name: Bonterra 2012 Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino-Lake)

Description: This is a tremendous value for such a good wine, made by Casey Flat Ranch winemaker Laura Barrett, a medium-textured swirl of grapefruit, melon and ripe orange. Grapes from Lake County also add a  tropical element, just right in the mix.
Name: Open Range 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Guenoc Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: From a tiny patch in the tiny Guenoc Valley, where the Langtry winery lies, this Sauvignon Blanc is partially barrel fermented, and it shows in the texture. In taste, expect Mandarin orange and melon, along with acidity that's high and mighty.
Name: Langtry 2012 Lillie Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Guenoc Valley)

Description: This is a perfectly good, honest Chilean SB with snappy, pungent aromas of gooseberry, grapefruit and lime. The mouth is racy as it should be, with textbook lime, grapefruit, nettle and pithy flavors. If there's any drawback, it's on the finish, which ends with bitterness.
Name: Santa Rita 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a classic, well made Lake County Sauvignon Blanc. It's creamy with fig, vanilla, cantaloupe and pineapple flavors, but with a crisp finish.
Name: Guenoc 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Made in the charmat method, this has a light mousse and subtle notes of tropical vanilla, lemon, lime and Golden Delicious apple. Semi-dry, the richness is offset by healthy acidity and a long finish.
Name: Bodkin 2012 Blanc de Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich in orange peel and with a sharp jab of New Zealand-style grass, this white is full bodied and meaty, with a kick of acidity on the finish.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A white with inviting floral aromas, this Lake County-sourced Sauvignon Blanc is layered with stone fruit and the region's signature tropical imprint. It's creamy in mouthfeel, to the point of being full-bodied, yet still bright.
Name: Bell 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This screaming vintage of Secreto is the living definition of pungency. Immediately it hits with fierce gooseberry and nettle aromas along with passion fruit and grapefruit. The palate is acidic and searing, with tangy, cool-climate flavors of lime and passion fruit. On the finish, this zinger is firm as concrete.
Name: Viu Manent 2013 Secreto Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: One whiff says this hails from a warmer region like Maule as opposed to someplace cool and coastal. The aromas are tropical more than zesty, with notes of mango and banana. On the palate, this is round but acidic enough, while flavors of tangerine, grapefruit and lime wind down well.
Designation: Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve
Name: Viña Requingua 2012 Puerto Viejo Estate Bottled Single Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: From a hot year with an early harvest, this Sauvignon smells green and ashy, like asparagus mixed with green tobacco. In the mouth, spunky acidity suggests sharpness, while tangy flavors of nectarine and nettle finish with touches of bell pepper and tarragon.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel
Name: Concha y Toro 2012 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Lodi-based Michael David turns to Lodi, Sonoma's Dry Creek Valley and Lake County to craft this white wine, mostly Sauvignon Blanc with a drop of Sémillon too. Ready for a summer's day with subtle Mandarin orange, mango and lime notes, it finishes quick and crisp.
Name: Michael David 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Very much in the style of the light whites of Gascony, this is crisp with apple and grapefruit flavor, herbaceous and clean as a whistle. It's ready to drink, but keep a few months if you'd like a softer character. Screwcap.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 La Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Powdery aromas of bath soap are more generic than varietal. The mouthfeel is a touch gritty, while flavors include sulfur, bitterness, pithy white fruits and citrus. An almond-skin bitterness and a chalky feel define the finish.
Name: Lazo 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Floral aromas akin to Argentinean Torrontés smell a lot like air freshener, while in the mouth this is juicy and light, with lychee, passion fruit and honeydew flavors.
Name: William Cole 2012 Columbine Special Reserve Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Pithy, citrusy aromas are about all the nose offers. This feels citrusy, with adequate weight. Flavors of citrus, apple, melon and bitterness end chalky and dry.
Name: L.A. Cetto 2011 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: Generic white-fruit aromas come with a modicum of zest. The palate is simple in feel but holds steady, while flavors of citrus and pith finish sweet, with distant notes of orange and passion fruit.
Name: Beach Kite 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Bell pepper, green bean and asparagus aromas come with a touch of melon but nothing more fruity than that. A citrusy, round palate houses bitter, stretched flavors of green fruits and sulfur. Green herbs and citrus peel are the finishing notes on this grassy, green SB.
Name: Alto Los Romeros 2012 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made without oak, this wine is brisk with acidity, with citrus, gooseberry and white pepper flavors. A touch of ammonia makes it challenging.
Name: Keating 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: The nose on this SB is pure grass, bell pepper and hay. The palate is citric on one hand but still flat and wayward in feel, with globular green-fruit flavors and a bitter tasting finish.
Name: Alto Los Romeros 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Vanilla cookies and sulfuric match stick are about all you can draw from the bouquet. This is flat in feel, with candied, flabby flavors of green fruits. The finish is bland.
Name: Santa Ema 2012 Select Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is as good as Sauvignon Blanc gets in Washington—a dense, pungent, intensely aromatic and gloriously flavorful wine sourced entirely from the Klipsun Vineyard. Inaugural scents suggest wet hay, new-mown grass, fig and citrus. Following are flavors of pineapple, more citrus, beeswax and a suggestion of bee pollen. This is one of those bottles that empties much faster than you'd like.
Name: Guardian 2012 Angel Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Here's a structured white that boasts a classic varietal fragrance of cantaloup and tomato vine. The delicious palate delivers melon, pineapple and mineral flavors of great depth and impeccable balance. This will pair magically with asparagus recipes.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2011 Sauvignon (Collio)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a wonderful edition to Pearl, Sparkman's 100% Sauvignon Blanc. It's vibrant and energetic, the kind of high-wire flavors more commonly found in Sancerre. Three days after it was first tasted, the wine was still drinking beautifully, with candied mixed fruits and terrific concentration.
Name: Sparkman 2011 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A well-balanced wine, showing good acidity and honeyed ripeness in equal measure. With its pure line of bright acidity and dried apricot flavors, it's a wine that has a promising future. Drink from 2016.
Name: Angerhof Tschida 2010 Beerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This fresh, young wine, showcases a palate-thrilling mix of ripe tree fruits—sappy apples, juicy citrus—and some hints of pineapple as well. The ripeness turns the lemony fruit into limoncello, and the finish is long and wonderfully refreshing.
Name: Januik 2012 Sagemoor Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of grapes from Klipsun, Spring Creek and Boushey, this new release of Pearl is as distinctive as the 2011, but offers somewhat different flavors. The precision and detail remain, with a powerful caraway note, like a sniff of fresh rye bread. It's firm, tart and penetrating, with excellent balance and length.
Name: Sparkman 2012 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: Rich, smoky wine, that has roundness from wood aging and aging on the lees. Ripely tropical with toasty vanilla and just a hint of herbaceous fruit, it is complex, textured and worth aging. Drink from 2014.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2011 Haute-Serre Albesco Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Done in a bracing, sappy style, this is a concentrated wine with lush flavors of lemon drop, orange candy and Key lime. It's ripe and juicy, with a suggestion of beeswax in the mouth.
Name: Novelty Hill 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This rich Sauvignon Blanc shows classic aromas of crushed tomato vine, cantaloup and a hint of bell pepper. The palate shows succulent green melon and apple flavors, with a hint of smoke and a freshly acidic backbone. This will pair well with asparagus dishes or pasta topped with pesto.
Name: Vie di Romans 2011 Piere Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rather delicate flavors of green melon, apple and fresh cut grass infuse this elegant Sauvignon Blanc. The precision and balance are impressive; the price and overall lightness make it an excellent, mealtime quaffer.
Name: Airfield Estates 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the warm 2012 vintage, the notes vary from stone fruit, such as apricot, into tropical with dried pineapple. Aged in a mixture of stainless steel and older French oak barrels, it's fresh and appealing while also displaying some weight and density, drinking quite dry with a tart finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Matured on its lees for eight months in barriques, this wine offers aromas of crushed tomato vine, evident oak and vanilla. The palate boasts cantaloupe and green melon flavors, along with vanilla and bitter wood sensations.
Name: Vie di Romans 2011 Vieris Sauvignon (Friuli Isonzo)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A grassy, green wine, although with some weight and richness filling out the fresh fruitiness. It's soft, showing lemon and red apple fruits but with a crisp final taste. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit is the story here, fresh, clean and loaded with flavors of apple and pear. This is a simple, well-made Sauvignon Blanc, neither grassy nor complex, just forward, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Mercer 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon offers subdued aromas of cantaloup and tomato vine while the palate shows melon, mineral and citrus notes. It's linear and lean, with a clean finish.
Name: Maculan 2012 Ferrata Sauvignon (Veneto)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Fragrant and fruity, this is a delicious, forward and crisp wine from south-west France. It is bright, light, full of citrus fruits and a juicy, refreshing texture. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: l'Escargot 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This pleasant Sauvignon from Friuli shows typical varietal aromas of tomato vine and cantaloupe. The palate offers green melon and spice flavors and has a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Piera Martellozzo 2012 Sauvignon Terre Magre Sauvignon (Friuli Grave)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The notes of herbs and citrus are quite light. It's medium bodied and drinks just a hair off dry, thinning out toward the finish.
Name: Jones of Washington 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

Description: Not far from Chablis, there is an enclave of Sauvignon Blanc in Saint-Bris. The wine is properly herbal, very fresh and citrusy. It has a definite animal flavor, tight and crisp to finish.
Name: La Chablisienne 2012  Saint-Bris

Description: Wood-aged wine, showing both spice and ripe tropical fruits. Mango and pineapple combine with vanilla and coconut milk to give a full, rich wine, though with Sauvignon Blanc's fresh acidity. Age for 2–3 years.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2009 Le Grande Cuvée des Edvins  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Serious Sauvignon Blanc from the Saget home domaine, this full and ripe wine has considerable depth of flavor. Like many wines from Pouilly, it is for aging, a rich, concentrated wine that needs at 3–4 years.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2011 Le Domaine  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Very ripe and concentrated, this wine offers fruit-forward peach and pear flavors. There is also a hint of mango, and a sense of toastiness and smooth texture, although the acidity is never far away. Give the wine another year to mature.
Name: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2011 Maxime Vieilles Vignes sur Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: Fragrant currant aromas drive this concentrated and rich wine forward. The old vines give a great depth of flavor and ripeness while keeping the fine herbaceous citrus touch. It's that rare Sancerre for aging, over 3–4 years.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Celebrating 500 years as grape growers, the Mellot family offers this top Sancerre. It is rounded and spicy with a touch of wood to add to its rich character. Apricots and pineapple are a delicious addition to the citrus acidity that cuts right through the wine. Age for 3–4 years.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2010 La Grande Châtelaine  (Sancerre)

Description: A rich, full-in-the-mouth wine. It is finely textured and concentrated, with ripe character. Its grapefruit flavors are spiced with pepper and nutmeg, giving a firm and structured wine at the end. Age for another year.
Name: Domaine des Mariniers 2012  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: A small, 15 acre estate controlled by Joseph Mellot, giving a full, ripe wine, very bright, crisp, with great flavor depth. The delicious wine offers good acidity with lemon and lime flavors. Drinkable now, but worth aging for 2–3 years.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2012 Domaine des Emois  (Sancerre)

Description: A beautifully balanced wine, bringing together ripe apples and citrus with fragrant acidity. There is a sense of minerality in the texture, with depth of flavor finishing with lively acidity.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2012 Les Belles Côtes  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a very fruity, youthful wine, with fine acidity and great citrus and green apple flavors. It also has a firm texture, with a mineral core that promises several years of aging ahead. A well-made wine from the son of Denis Gaudry, who has a separate vineyard in Pouilly.
Name: Nicolas Gaudry 2012  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Aromatic and fruity wine with soft texture and ripe apple and citrus fruit flavors. From a small vineyard area not far from Sancerre, this wine is just that bit warmer and fatter in style with a full-bodied aftertaste.
Name: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2012  Sancerre

Description: A chalky textured and mineral-driven wine, it's crisp while also smooth and rich. It is full of white fruits, softly textured herbaceousness and lively final acidity. A wine to age for a few months or even a year or two. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2012 Le Chant des Vignes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented and aged, this Sauvignon Blanc is juicy with kiwi and melon flavors, and pleasant in its crispness and bright acidity. A fantastic sipping wine to enjoy with all manner of seafood.
Name: Bink 2012 Randle Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: Relatively soft wine, it is fruity, showing ripe yellow as well as green and citrus fruits. It is a mouthful of fruitiness and minerality neatly combined with acidity. It has enough structure to suggest it could age for up to four years.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2012 Domaine de la Perrière  (Sancerre)

Description: A totally fresh and herbaceous wine, this is very crisp and citrusy. It does have some weight as well, a ripe character that comes from apple juice and pear flavors. The wine is great to drink now but could age.
Name: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2012  Sancerre

Description: A very herbaceous, aromatic wine. The acidity cuts through the grapefruit flavor, giving a touch of minerality at the end.
Name: Domaine des Levrys 2012  Sancerre

Description: The Cramele Recas Dreamfish is always a pleasant surprise, and at $7, an especially good bargain. Intensely fruity with concentrated tropical fruit and berry flavors, it's balanced with a streak of lemon-lime acidity and a murmur of lemon pith that keeps things brisk and clean.
Name: Cramele Recas 2012 Dreamfish Sauvignon Blanc (Viile Timisului)

Description: Ripe yellow and white fruits are the dominant factor in this smooth, rich wine. It has good weight, along with a juicy, lemon and zest texture. Not for aging, unlike some Pouilly Fumé, so drink over the next few months. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2012 Le Troncsec  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A soft and rounded wine with a warm fruitiness that comes from the edge of spice and lime flavors. The wine has weight and good depth of herbaceousness. It is designed for accompanying food.
Name: Domaine des Chaintres 2012  Sancerre

Description: Steely, mineral wine, very textured and tight in character. Though touched with apple and citrus fruit notes, this one needs to age to round out. With its acidity and green asparagus flavors, give it 2–3 years. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2012 La Chatellenie  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Bink's Old Chatham Ranch spends four months in neutral oak. It's alluring with vanilla and floral aromas, and a taste of orange peel that gives it signature appeal. The wine is medium bodied with finely textured layers, making it a food-friendly wine ready for seared scallops.
Name: Bink 2012 Old Chatham Ranch Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: Classic herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc, packed with green fruits, gooseberries and lime. It's textured and almost chewy in its youthfulness. The dominant character, though, is crisp, breezy and very fruity.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2012 French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Description: A soft wine that shows a rounded green apple character. It has a touch of nervy texture to give some structure as it opens up. It's otherwise fresh and crisp, ready to drink.
Name: Domaine des Coltabards 2012  Sancerre

Description: One of the more herbaceous Sauvignons in Joseph Mellot's range, this is crisp, leaning to green fruits although with an underlying feeling of ripeness. There is a touch of minerality in the texture, giving the acidity a taut, nervy feeling at the end. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2012 Le Montarlet  (Sancerre)

Description: Made in a family winery based in San Francisco that sources fruit mainly from Lodi, this Sauvignon Blanc is rich with fig and Nilla Wafer notes, with a pretty, floral nose.
Name: Eristavi Winery 2012 Vintner's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Greg Graziano blends 81% Sauvignon Blanc and 19% Pinot Grigio for a dynamite combination of tropical guava flavor, bracing acidity, and a pronounced hit of grapefruit on the finish.
Name: Graziano 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Ripe and creamy wine, with some herbaceousness and yellow fruits. Layering citrus and a tangy texture, it's fruity, full of lively acidity and ready to drink this year. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2012 La Gravelière  (Sancerre)

Description: A simple, fruity wine, there is a fine line of acidity that shoots right through to give a bright and breezy character. It is light, very fresh with an attractive lemon zest at the end.
Name: Domaine des Caves du Prieuré 2012  Sancerre

Description: A fresh, fragrant Sauvignon Blanc. It's bone dry, full of citrus flavors and a fine swathe of acidity. Herbaceous, crisp and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine de Bellecours 2012  Sancerre

Description: Bright and fruity wine, showing its acidity prominently. Crisp layered citrus and apricot fruits flavors finish with fine texture.
Name: Gilles Blanchet 2012 Les Champs des Plantes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Very fruity, catty wine. It is green and crisp, tightly herbaceous yet explodes with fruit. The acidity cuts right through, this clean, fresh wine.
Name: Saget la Perrière 2012 Domaine des Grandes Esperances Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This is a lean and crisp Sauvignon Blanc exhibiting apricot and fig notes, and just a bite of lemon sourness on the finish.
Name: Pat Paulsen Vineyards 2012 Mio Vigneto Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Earthy with hints of roasted nuts and dried herb, this is a uniquely savory Sauvignon that would pair well with herb-accented fowl and fish. The palate is round and rich, but balanced with brisk lime acidity and a characteristic grassiness on the finish.
Name: Ciringa 2011 Fosilni Breg Sauvignon Blanc (Slovenia)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This meaty, oaky Sauvignon Blanc, with a trace of Semillon, is slightly bitter with grassy and lemony aromas and flavors coming to the fore.
Name: Martin Ranch 2011 J.D. Hurley Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Wispy hints of stonefruit and clementine mingle with savory notes of nettle and dried herb on this characteristically grassy, brisk Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is delicately flavored, with a dusty mineral note that lingers.
Name: Vino z Czech 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Moravia)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc is so intense it's almost too much to handle. Sharp aromas of nettle, juniper and passion fruit are expressive but also assaultive. The palate is round on one hand, but with shooting acidity, there's intensity to the flavor profile, which revolves around salt, bitterness and citrus flavors. A little funky and herbaceous.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: The single vineyard Grassnitzberg offers some warmth to the naturally herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc. There's crisp acidity to be sure, but this serious, complex wine is rounded with tropical fruits and a rich texture. Very fresh now, it needs 2–4 years to age. Glass stopper.
Name: Manfred Tement 2012 Grassnitzberg Erste Lage Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Andis's Sauvignon Blanc is a lightly textured and light in alcohol (12.5%) version of the wine that's heady in aromatics, completely aswirl in perfume. In taste, expect exceptional layers of fig, white peach and candied ginger. Delicious and crisp, this white is worth stocking up on in good weather or bad.
Name: Andis 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A terrific wine, with a crisp, clean, classic nose of pure, crystalline Sauvignon Blanc. Done in all stainless, sourced from Artz (Red Mountain) and Stillwater Creek (Ancient Lakes), this riot of melon, citrus, apple and sweet hay is just about perfect, with lovely natural acidity.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Now approaching maturity, the wine is showing its tropical fruit flavors and aromas. Ripe and full in the mouth with a rich, but lively acidity, it's an impressive expression of Sauvignon Blanc. Glass stopper.
Name: Manfred Tement 2010 Zieregg Grosse Lage Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: This small-production Sauvignon Blanc (700 cases) overdelivers on its price by a factor of two or three times. It gets going with crisp, crystalline aromas of passion fruit and briny grapefruit. A pure, juicy, ripped palate offers lime, grapefruit, tangerine and herb flavors, while the finish is minerally and clean.
Name: Kingston Family 2012 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Matthew Loso makes excellent Sauvignon Blanc, and this is no exception. Smooth, lush and creamy, it's bursting with concentrated fruit flavors of apple, peach and papaya—definitely not a grassy style by any measure. Everything points to barrel fermentation, including the lick of fresh cream in the finish.
Name: Barons V 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is an expressive Sauvignon Blanc with almost vegetal aromas announcing coastal origins. The palate is chiseled and lemony, then minerally flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and lemon give way to passion fruit and stony finishing notes. Laser-beam acidity and minerality are what drive this.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2012 Marea Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Fresh and fruity, Saracina's offers tart citrus, white peach and a long-lasting, oaky backbone, with textured mouthfeel and a level of concentration that calls out for food.
Name: Saracina 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With 12% Sémillon in the blend, this is a lovely, fresh, almost exuberant Sauvignon Blanc. Bracing and textural, with good varietal character but no excessive herbaceousness, it's loaded with fruit flavors of melon, grapefruit, kiwi and apple. A fine mix of precision and length.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a warm style of Sauvignon Blanc that brings out ripe peach and apricot flavors, balanced by a crisp acidity. It has weight, and shows the warmth of the climate and richness of the soil.
Name: Kollwentz 2011 Steinmühle Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: One of the range of single variety sparkling wines from Steininger, this Sauvignon Blanc shows all the herbaceous character of the grape. It is tangy with a strong zestiness, gooseberry fruit and a tight lemon aftertaste.
Name: Steininger 2011 Sekt Sauvignon Blanc (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: An intensely herbal wine, this is very green and crisp. It brings out citrus, fresh apple and lemongrass spiciness to yield a wine that is concentrated and likely to age for 2–4 years. Glass stopper.
Name: Lackner Tinnacher 2012 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: An exceptionally priced Sauvignon Blanc from estate-grown fruit, Brutocao's Feliz Vineyard offers pronounced aromatics, all honeysuckle and apricot. Floral, savory, even slightly salty, the fruit that will stand out most here is honeydew melon. The wine's just-enough level of sweetness is reminiscent of nature's best.
Name: Brutocao 2012 Feliz Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: A lush, creamy Sauvignon Blanc from Foothills producer C.G. di Arie, which has traveled to Lodi here for its fruit. Full and rich, the wine has a pronounced taste of lime, especially on the finish. It is dry and crisp, ready for goat cheese and seafood.
Name: Di Arie 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: The normal Los Vascos style of Sauvignon Blanc is lean and citrusy, with an emphasis on passion fruit aromas and flavors. This wine, from a very warm vintage, is more tropical and plump than the norm. And while it's still tight and nervy in the mouth, with lime, grapefruit and orange pith flavors, it's definitely less angular than in the past.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2012 Los Vascos Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consistent with past vintages, this tart, grassy and spicy effort features green apple fruit dusted with white pepper. There's a trace of grain in the aroma and in the finishing flavor as well. The blend includes 9% Sémillon.
Name: DiStefano 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Sauvignon Blanc, Styria's (Steiermark) signature white grape shows richly and herbaceously here. It has a grassy character with notes of nettle, green fruit, citrus. Spice, acidity and a ripe feel give it weight. Screwcap.
Name: Fuchs 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: This straddles the fence between vegetal and citrusy, with both sides appearing on the nose. In the mouth, this is high-toned and piercing, with laser-beam acidity pushing passion fruit, grapefruit, green herb and melony flavors. On the finish, a wave of mild green settles in, while the feel is actually a touch creamy. Drink now.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This varietally labeled Sauvignon Blanc sourced from the southern portion of Margaret River is delightfully clean, crisp and refreshing. Nectarine, pineapple and citrus flavors mingle easily on the medium-bodied palate.
Name: Robert Oatley 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: This medium-weight Sauvignon Blanc features admirable purity and focus. The lime and mixed citrus aromas and flavors are very clean and likable, showing decent length on the crisp, slightly chalky-textured finish. Drink now.
Name: Plantagenet 2011 Omrah Sauvignon Blanc (Great Southern)

Description: This is an intensely herbaceous wine that's very crisp, green and mineral driven. It's a textured wine that's tangy, nervy and full of fruit. Delicious to drink now for its freshness, but it will age for 2–3 years. Glass stopper.
Name: Manfred Tement 2012 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: Classic, pungent feline aromas of passion fruit, citrus and grass set up a friendly palate with moderate acidity and nice flavors of nectarine, lime and green melon. The finish introduces sweet notes of banana to go with lime.
Name: Santa Ema 2012 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Light, classic aromas of gooseberry, lime and nettle are good indicators of what's to follow. That would be a high-acid, racy, seemingly early picked wine with flavors of lemon, Granny Smith apple and gooseberry. A lasting, tangy, acidic finish is crackling as a lightning bolt.
Name: Concha y Toro 2012 Marques de Casa Concha Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Although this opens with slightly hard, stalky aromas, it picks up character in the mouth. Flavors of lemon, lime, passion fruit and green apple are solid, while the wine's acidity functions as a proper palate cleanser. This offers good value and overall quality.
Name: Mancura 2012 Guardián Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A very Styrian Sauvignon Blanc, this is herbaceous while lined with tropical fruits. It has great acidity, green fruits, and a sense of texture and minerality. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Strauss 2012 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: Initial aromas of peach pit, match stick and citrus settle on minerality. This is juicy and bright in the mouth, with good acidity and indications that the grapes were picked early to beat 2012's heat. Briny, salty, tangy flavors are normal for coastal San Antonio, while the finish is racy and citrusy.
Designation: Novas Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes
Name: Emiliana 2012 Novas Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: With yeasty aromas of Animal Crackers, vanilla and pear, this is more warm, soft and sweet than in the past. The year's warm characteristics are draped all over the palate, which is soft and wide. Flavors of creamy white fruits and vanilla finish with lychee and grapefruit. This lacks some spine and vivacity but will be good through the end of the year.
Name: Veramonte 2012 Ritual Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: For the money, this delivers about as much Sauvignon Blanc character as one could ask for. Aromas of orange and grapefruit are basic but correct. The palate is a bit low on acid, thus the flavors veer toward warm and melony, with a citrusy base. A mild, yeasty finish says drink this wine as soon as possible.
Name: Caliterra 2012 Reserva Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Feline aromas of nettle, passion fruit, green herbs and sweat are not unusual for Casablanca Sauvignon Blanc. This is crisp, juicy and good in a normal way, while minerally citrus and passion fruit flavors finish with only mild pithy bitterness.
Name: Morandé 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Hay, straw, match stick and minerally aromas outweigh this wine's fruit scents by a measurable margin. This is chunky and a bit soft in the mouth, a reflection of 2012's heat. And while it's round as a ball, it's slightly vegetal and bitter tasting on the palate, with grapefruit and bell pepper flavors.
Name: Errazuriz 2012 Max Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Crafted from organic grapes, this creamy Mendocino Sauvignon Blanc has a great mouthfeel of apple, pear and stone fruit, a trace of citrus and vanilla playing in the background. With an abundance of minerality, the wine's acidity lingers on the finish.
Name: Patianna 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This fresh, fruity and herbaceous wine has a delicious, creamy texture, citrus flavors and lively acidity. Fine as an apéritif or with shellfish.
Name: Dourthe 2012 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Crisp aromas of nettle, citrus and tarragon are not too extreme or edgy. A round, citrusy, correct palate offers flavors of pithy citrus and grapefruit. The finish is mild and chunky, with modest flavors. Drink now.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2012 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Tight, grassy, green aromas of pole beans and alfalfa get this racy Sauvignon Blanc going. It's certainly fresh and lively on the palate, where green, briny flavors of passion fruit and citrus finish minerally and lasting.
Name: Anakena 2012 Enco Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Made from organic grapes, Horse & Plow delivers another great vintage of Sauvignon Blanc, subtle in aromatics at first, but very creamy in feel with lemon and vanilla highlights and a zingy finish. Fermented in mostly stainless steel, is exudes grapes grown in a cool climate.
Name: Horse & Plow 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: A cool, very Sauvignon wine, with strong herbaceous and citrus flavors. It's crisp, showing a bright, tight, slightly mineral texture.
Name: Pezat 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: More fruity than herbaceous, this is a green and citrus fruit flavored wine, crisp and bright. It has a fine, tight streak of acidity that also hints of more tropical flavors. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Glatzer 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Carnuntum)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The citrus and herb notes seem a bit muddled here but it still offers enjoyment for the price. It's a touch off dry to balance the sharp-edged acid.
Name: Waterbrook 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Despite showing neutrality on the bouquet, you will find modest salinic, citrusy aromas. The palate feels round and good, with flavors of orange and briny lime. A fleshy feeling, citrusy tasting finish is nice even if it isn't overly zesty. Drink now.
Name: Chilensis 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Tightly herbaceous and very crisp, grassy and citrusy, this is the epitome of cool, fresh Sauvignon Blanc. It's a light, bright, easy-drinking wine that's ready to go now.
Name: Domaine Uby 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This is a fresh and easy selection, with low-intensity aromas and flavors of tart gooseberry, lemon-lime citrus and soft grass. The mouthfeel is light and breezy, and the finish is clean and brisk. Drink now.
Name: Pelter 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a ripe wine, its herbaceous character tempered by green plum and pineapple flavors. It's full in the mouth, with a hint of steeliness to give texture. Great to drink this summer.
Name: Domaine de l'Herré 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Fleshy, tropical aromas with a touch of varietal snap set up a green palate with sweet lime and scallion flavors. The finish shows ripeness and tropical notes before turning heavy. Drink this well chilled.
Name: Undurraga 2012 U Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Mild citrus aromas come with green notes. This is a medium-level Sauvignon Blanc without a lot of acidic snap. Melon and grapefruit flavors are friendly, simple and chunky, while overall this shows characterisitcs of a warm, bland vintage.
Name: Veramonte 2012 La Gloria Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is a slightly spicy wine that's rounded and quite rich in style. It leans towards a tropical character although textured and still quite youthful. Give this attractive, ripe wine another six months or so to develop. Screwcap.
Name: Markus Huber 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Description: Aromas of passion fruit, tangerine, bell pepper and grass lead to a plump palate with soft acids. Flavors of pithy, slightly bitter green fruits, bell pepper and passion fruit end in a modest finish that rapidly loses steam.
Name: Anakena 2012 Tama Vineyard Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
