Description: Although this presents itself on the bouquet as being a bit soft and mealy, the palate is solid albeit chunky and blocky. Standard citrus and lemon flavors hold onto some tang on the finish. Overall, this is clean and friendly but a bit dull.
Name: Concha y Toro 2012 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Tarn, Southwest France, France
Description: This is an intensely herbaceous wine; all grapefruit and hedgerow fruits with a grassy core. It is light, very fruity, clean and crisp; a typical cool climate Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Domaine D'en Ségur 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Tarn)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Straight down the middle, this 100% varietal wine brings notes of citrus and herbs. It has a touch of residual sugar and tingles the palate with broad fruit flavors.
Name: Magnificent Wine Company 2012 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Oak aging gives this wine weight and richness, but detracts from the natural herbaceous fruitiness. The palate is spicy and peppery. Screwcap.
Name: Strauss 2010 Gamlitzberg Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: Nectarine and tangerine aromas come with a floral note and a whiff of sea foam. This is light in acidity, so the palate is round and chunky. Flavors of citrus and melon finish pithy and slightly bitter.
Name: Vaya Vadiso 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Stalky, lightly vegetal aromas come with notes of match stick and bitterness. This feels fresh in the mouth but tastes briny, with citrus, jalapeño and green bean accents. A bland, pithy finish feels round. Drink now.
Name: Santa Carolina 2012 Ocean Side Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is perfect for lovers of light, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc. All the grassy and citrus flavors are here, attractively crisp while not aggressive. Drink this year. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine de l'Herré 2012 La Galope Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Oily, salinic aromas of match stick and pickled white fruits offer up a pinched palate with briny, stalky flavors of burnt orange and passion fruit. A briny tasting, clampy finish doesn't do much to bring this around.
Name: De Martino 2012 Estate Made with Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Gritty match-stick aromas come with grapefruit and citrus scents. This is lifted and entirely regular for Chilean Sauvignon Blanc. Flavors of lemon, lime and grapefruit are soft and mealy for such a young wine, while bitterness enters the frame on the finish.
Name: San Pedro 2012 Epica Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: A curiously earthy wine with ripe fruits but also a sense of bitterness. Notes of gooseberries and undergrowth finish with an off-dry character at the end. Screwcap.
Name: Hager Matthias 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is light and fresh, with melony aromas. It's plump and waning on the palate, with a splash of citric acidity. Mealy nectarine flavors lead to a stalky finish that loses steam.
Name: Leyendas de Familia 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Aromas of orange blossom and pineapple juice are not substantial. In the mouth, this is chunky and plump, with oily peach and nectarine flavors mixed with some green bean. A heavy finish with little spine provides minimal cut and freshness.
Name: Vistamar 2012 Brisa Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This mild Sauvignon Blanc offers simple citrus and passion fruit aromas in front of an oily-feeling, pulpy palate. Flavors of vinaigrette, cactus and grapefruit finish with mealy lemon and orange notes.
Name: Misiones de Rengo 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Mushy peach, mealy pear and soft melon aromas flood the bouquet, and are accented by a hint of honeycomb. A touch of citrus flavor unfolds on the round, flabby palate, followed by a short finish. Drink up.
Name: Binyamina 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Upper Galilee)

Description: The nose on this low-acid white is neutral at best. The palate feels soft and mushy, while the flavors are mealy, creamy and bland, with touches of passion fruit and citrus. This will have a very short shelf life.
Name: Vistamar 2012 Sepia Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Punchbowl sweetness and pineapple aromas come in front of a chunky palate with banana and oily green-fruit flavors. A short finish is heavy before it fades.
Name: Arauco 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Mild, powdery and innocuous on the nose, this boxed wine is dilute and citrusy in the mouth, with tart orange and lime flavors.
Name: Black Box 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Xurus shows off the beauty of Lake County Sauvignon Blanc with this wine, which tastes of crème brûlée with a delicious twist of lime. Austere and well-balanced with some heft on the finish, the minerality on this wine particularly stands out, a complement for food.
Name: Xurus 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Yorkville Highlands producer Bink has made a lovely Sauvignon Blanc with hazelnut, fig and darker pear flavors, 100-percent stainless-steel fermented and aged. With a depth of minerality and lovely lingering finish, it's well worth seeking out for dinner parties or days by the pool.
Name: Bink 2011 Randle Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a hint of smoke that adds a dark edge to the pretty white floral notes of this easy drinking, elegantly balanced Sauvignon Blanc. It's dry and refreshing on the palate, while hints of waxy minerality and bitter lime pith lend complexity to the finish.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2012 Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: With feline aromas of juniper bush, grass and sweaty citrus, this is true Sauvignon Blanc. Oak aging has lent an easiness to the mouthfeel, which shows good acidity. Flavors of green fruits, melon and pithy bitterness end in chalky clarity. This is one of Argentina's best Sauvignon Blancs.
Name: O. Fournier 2010 Alfa Crux Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A hint of spritz introduces this brisk, fresh Sauvignon Blanc, adding verve to concentrated notes of waxy white florals, peach and grapefruit. Mineral tones and a whiff of green lend complexity to the finish.
Name: Palmer 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This bright, intensely citrusy Sauvignon Blanc boasts concentrated lemon rind and white blossom notes highlighted by a shower of minerality. It's a dry, refreshingly brisk wine with hints of wax and honey that add richness to the palate.
Name: Waters Crest 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: For Argentina, this is as varietally correct as you're going to find for Sauvignon Blanc. The bouquet is loaded with pungent nectarine, citrus and peach pit aromas. Those are backed by a citrusy, angular, spritzy palate with lime and orange flavors. Tang is the operative word as the wine fades out with tangerine and grapefruit flavors.
Name: O. Fournier 2012 B Crux Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intense minerality shines through concentrated lemon and green apple flavors in this fresh, vivacious Sauvignon Blanc. It's refreshingly brisk on the palate, with bright acidity and just a tickle of spritz on the tongue.
Name: Macari 2012 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A juicy, tropical Sauvignon Blanc ripe for warm weather sipping, textured in mango, pineapple and a hit of fresh pear. Intense with a savory taste on the finish, this white is perfect on its own or ideal with seafood or crackers smothered in goat cheese.
Name: Newsome-Harlow 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A very bright, citrusy Sierra Foothills Sauvignon Blanc, very fairly priced, that tastes of cool lemonade on a summer's day.
Name: Clos du Lac 2012 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Cecchetti Wine Company makes a lot of Line 39 Sauvignon Blanc, but does it well, offering an affordable wine that tastes great. Grassy and tropical, it's true to Lake County, with just a touch of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc character. Crisp and easy to drink.
Name: Line 39 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Sauvignon Blanc is, in general, one of Baja's more consistent performers. This version is light in color, with varietally familiar aromas of nettle, grapefruit and passion fruit. It's a bit weighty, with apple, grapefruit and tropical flavors. A mild bitterness can be found on the finish.
Name: Monte Xanic 2012 Viña Kristel Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: The nose on this Sauvignon Blanc is chunky and shows hints of corn and baked apple. The body is in good shape, as proper acidity offsets any fat in the wine. Melony flavors match the texture, and there's some notorious Baja saltiness to the finish. This is definitely a food wine.
Name: Paralelo 2012 Emblema Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: Sassy passion-fruit and feline aromas set up a crisp, clean-feeling palate with tangy, green, zesty flavors of scallion, lime and sour apple. A minerally, chalky finish is zingy and clean. This is nice for value-priced Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: O. Fournier 2012 Urban Uco Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this single-vineyard Sauvignon Blanc is medium bodied, with notes of lime and herbs. There's a touch of sugar to offset the tart acids, and the alcohol lingers on the finish.
Designation: Talitha Cumi Bloc in Prayer Rock Vineyards
Name: Reustle 2012 Talitha Cumi Bloc in Prayer Rock Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whispers of smoke and flint on the nose of this intensely minerally Sauvignon Blanc blow off to reveal a bright, elegantly balanced wine with hints of fresh green grass and stems. It's brisk and refreshing, with an easy drinking feel.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A value-priced Sauvignon Blanc from Sobon, which also makes Shenandoah Vineyards wines in the Shenandoah Valley of California, within the greater Sierra Foothills. This white opens with floral aromatics followed by wet stone, apple and lemon, all in a subtle, lightly rendered way.
Name: Sobon Estate 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: A low-priced white with a smoky quality and rounded textures of pear and coconut. Twist the cap off on this one for patio and pool parties or to enjoy with a platter of raw oysters.
Name: Shenandoah 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Lemon and apple aromas come with modest minerality. This is fairly full bodied, with a mix of briny citrus and salty, slightly oily tasting melon flavors. A chunky, round finish manages to hold its pose...for now.
Name: Finca Los Maza 2012 Coleccion Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Pungent, feline aromas of sweat, nettle and grapefruit precede a lemony, dilute palate with lime, scallion and green-herb flavors of tarragon and thyme. It's tangy and light on the finish, with a chalky feel.
Name: Familia Cassone 2012 Finca la Florencia Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Flat early aromas seem smoky at first and then more like apple and papaya. This is a plump Sauvignon Blanc with mouthfilling weight; it's a touch mealy in flavor, and no particular fruits stick out. It's fine, but short on character.
Name: Unión de Productores del Valle (UPVG) 2012 Estacion el Porvenir Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: Mild hints of tropical fruit are less than convincing. The palate on this Sauvignon Blanc is round, weighty and offers quiet flavors of melon and spiced apple. The finish remains soft and a touch bitter.
Name: Tres Valles 2012 Jalá Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: This is yet another plump, sweaty smelling Sauvignon Blanc from this producer. This vintage is fat in the mouth but kept alive by adequate young acidity. Salty, briny flavors of citrus, particularly grapefruit, end in similar briny fashion.
Name: Casarena 2012 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe mango, peach and pineapple all come together in this rich, opulent wine. Round yet there's a strong ginger and spice component. This is a complex wine, textured, rich and worth aging for at least another two years. Glass stopper.
Name: Sattlerhof 2011 Sernauberg Erste Lage Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: A rounded style of Sauvignon Blanc that has a full feeling to it. Yes, there is plenty of herbaceous and citrus character but this is just a part of a rich medley of riper fruits all in a steely texture. Worth aging for 2–3 years.
Name: Neumeister 2011 Klausen Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sadly, this is the last vintage for this Klipsun vineyard-sourced Sauvignon Blanc. It's a fine send-off, a buttery, caramel-soaked take on the grape, with rich fruit flavors of Meyer lemon and light tropical. A deep and damaging freeze cut the crop by more than 80%, and the vines have been pulled.
Name: Stevens 2011 AFinalThought Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is pure Sauvignon Blanc, fermented in acacia barrels. Intense and grassy, with a deep splash of citrus and a long, tangy finish. A Sauv Blanc for those who love the grape in its most dense and unadorned expression.
Name: J. Christopher 2011 Croft Vineyard Über-Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: The village of Gamlitz is dominated by the Kranachberg vineyard. The example from Sattlerhof shows the natural tropical richness from the warm soils. There is a herbal character to go with the more spicy, fruity. A mineral texture at the end gives bite. Glass stopper.
Name: Sattlerhof 2010 Kranachberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wente remains remarkably adept at making very good wines in big volumes at fair prices. This is a textbook example—a crisp, layered and complex SB that's as floral as spring, generous in acidity and lemony on the finish. Pair with shellfish, chicken or goat cheese on crackers.
Name: Wente 2011 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Despite hot conditions in 2012, this manages to deliver pungent aromas of nettle, green herbs, passion fruit and pink grapefruit. It's clear and straightforward in the mouth, with passion fruit, lychee, lime and tangerine flavors. A long finish holds off on the bitterness while maintaining exuberance and pop.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2012 Pequeñas Producciones Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This Casablanca SB opens with crisp, dry, capped aromas of ocean foam, citrus and green herbs. It's true to form in the mouth, with nice acidity and citrusy zest. Flavors of citrus and green herbs are focused but pithy, while the finish is fresh, crisp and tastes of lime and thyme.
Name: Undurraga 2012 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A wisp of a wine, like Marilyn in her All About Eve years, before the buxom bravado kicked in. Clean, light in color, with an inviting floral aroma, this gentle wine is dry and delicious. Pair with shellfish and think of the star's more innocent years.
Name: Marilyn Sauvignon Blonde 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: With tropical fruit richness, this is a full and rounded Sauvignon Blanc. It has weight, its spicy texture filled out with both opulent fruits and a crisper citrus acidity. Glass stopper.
Name: Sattlerhof 2011 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Like any good coastal Chilean SB, this crackles with minerality, grassy notes and tight citrus aromas. The palate has zest and acidity, while core flavors of arugula, jalapeño, nettle and green fruits shout “cool climate.” Because 2012 was very hot by Chilean standards, the finish is a bit flatter and fuller than in past vintages.
Name: Arboleda 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: This relatively snappy SB reflects coastal Chile in a good, true way via minerally and citrusy aromas that include jalapeño notes. The palate is friendly but exact, with passion fruit, grapefruit and lime flavors. The minerally finish is sweeter and less acidic than in years past.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2012 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Minerally opening aromas yield to a tight collection of green herb and citrus scents that steer clear of anything feline or grassy. This offers shear, zesty flavors of gooseberry, lime and tarragon in front of a stony feeeling finish that's crisp but not grating.
Name: San Pedro 2012 Castillo de Molina Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: Bright, fruity Sauvignon Blanc that has a touch of tropical fruits as well as more citrus and grassy characters. Klassik is the most open, attractive, ready-to-drink style from Styria. Screwcap.
Name: Neumeister 2011 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: This inaugural wine from Estampa hails from Paredones along the Colchagua coast. It's plump and dusty smelling, with lime and green-herb aromas. A chunky, round, somewhat soft palate carries flavors of fleshy melon, green herbs and mild citrus to a quiet finish.
Designation: Del Viento Single Vineyard Paredones Estate
Name: Estampa 2012 Del Viento Single Vineyard Paredones Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: An almost neutral nose offers mild green herb and citrus aromas but little more. The palate is zesty, tangy and fresh, while a narrow set of lemon-lime, grapefruit and lime flavors ends with focused crispness. For something tight and refreshing, this is it.
Name: Undurraga 2012 Sibaris Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This SB is more plump and tropical than you might expect for Leyda, but it's still honest, grassy and quite good as a whole. Basic coastal aromas of grass and citrus give way to a round palate with honeyed citrus flavors and length. A focused, comfortable finish is perfectly good; drink right away.
Name: Caliterra 2012 Tributo Single Vineyard Block #Algarrobo Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This opens with cool, coastal aromas of passion fruit, minerality, ocean spray and tarragon. It's just round enough to avoid being shearing, with cutting acidity and true varietal flavors of green herbs, lettuce and lime. The finish maintains those flavors while cleansing the palate.
Name: Viña Leyda 2012 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This clean, fresh, bracingly grassy wine makes you wish there were more Sauv Blancs from the Willamette Valley. It has the crisp elegance of the Loire, along with a delicate suggestion of chalk.
Name: J. Christopher 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A textured and layered Lake County SB that's rich, but savory in style. With a big mouthfeel and tropical taste, pair with richer fare, like crab or lobster in butter.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2012 Asbill Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Just bottled when tasted, this is a wine that needs a few months to come together. Its ripe pear and apricot fruit and dense flavor will offer a full, rounded wine that goes more for a tropical Sauvignon Blanc character.
Name: Calvet 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Styria's trademark Sauvignon Blanc in its purest, freshest form. It has delicious acidity, pear and white peach flavors and a burst of grapefruit freshness. Drink now, or hold for a year. Screwcap.
Name: Sattlerhof 2012 Vom Sand Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a broadly fruity, wide open style with fresh melon, pink grapefruit and orange marmalade flavors criss-crossing the palate. It's ready to enjoy right now, low in alcohol, with a touch of marshmallow sweetness to cut the acid.
Name: Zero One Vintners 2011 Copper Lily Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Ripe, tropical fruit Sauvignon Blanc from vines close to the Neusiedlersee lake. The wine has peach and pineapple flavors that are counterbalance by a more herbal, grassy back taste. Because it is so young, it does need a few more months in bottle. Screwcap.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2012 Obere Wies Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Cool-climate aromas of passion fruit, nettle, tarragon and minerality are present in this Chilean SB. It is mostly fresh in the mouth, with body and standard Leyda flavors of citrus, nectarine, green herbs and sea salt. A round, herbal finish is showing a steady pulse that won't last forever. Drink now.
Name: Caliterra 2011 Tributo Single Vineyard Block #Algarrobo Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: With its soft bouquet and friendly but easygoing melon and apple flavors, this ranks as a good but chunky SB with maturity and moderate oxidation already showing. It's good, tasty and easygoing, but it lacks the sizzle and snap Chilean SB is known for. Drink immediately.
Name: Rios de Chile 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The nose on this racy SB provides a combo of stalky citrus, minerality and tangerine. The palate feels light, zingy and fairly innocuous, while flavors of green herbs, lime, green apple and lemon finish mild and a bit washed out. This will function best as a well-chilled summer quaffer.
Name: Peñalolen 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: For a large-production wine (47,000 cases made), this is nice and easy to drink. Tropical fruit aromas are lightly citric. In the mouth, this is fresh and easy, with nectarine and tangerine flavors. Freshness and simplicity are this wine's calling card.
Name: Undurraga 2012 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó and Leyda Valleys)

Description: Salinic, minerally aromas come with citrus and passion fruit notes. This Central Valley SB feels round and medium in terms of intensity, with melony, green-leaning flavors of lime. On the finish, pithy grapefruit flavors end with mild bitterness.
Name: Rios de Chile 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: For a spring or summer sipper, this fits the bill. The nose is neutral except for light apple, pear and lime aromas. In the mouth, it's zesty and linear, with acidic cut. Flavors of white pepper powder, fresh yellow pepper and citrus lead to a crisp, clean finish.
Designation: Selección del Directorio Gran Reserva Cool Coastal Vineyard
Name: Santa Helena 2012 Selección del Directorio Gran Reserva Cool Coastal Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Passion fruit, lime and feline aromas give the bouquet crispness and varietal snap. The palate is tangy, lean and somewhat dilute, with pithy grapefruit, lime and tarragon flavors. The finish shows modest cut but regular, weakly defined flavors.
Name: Echeverria 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is basic and mild as a whole. The nose blends citrus, apple and fresh bell pepper aromas in front of a zesty, medium-intensity palate with standard citrus flavors including lime and orange. For a refreshing quaff this summer, this more than suffices.
Name: MontGras 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Citrus and tropical fruit aromas are basic and the slightest bit stalky smelling. Spritzy lift gives the body some kick, while zesty flavors of sport pepper, jalapeño and citrus culminate in a juicy finish.
Name: Casa Viva 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The nose on this average SB is bland and neutral, but inoffensive. A fleshy, normal feeling palate leads to slightly dilute flavors of scallion, mustard green and apple. This finishes mellow and slightly pithy, with nothing in particular standing out.
Name: Château Los Boldos 2012 Cuvée Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: For most people this oak-aged SB is a love-it-or-leave-it type of wine, but in this case it falls somewhere in the middle. A largely neutral bouquet comes with resiny aromas of melon. This is round, smooth and soft in the mouth, with toasty, resiny apple, melon and bitter flavors. It's showing oxidation and age on the finish, meaning it's got one foot in the grave.
Name: O. Fournier 2010 Alfa Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Lime and mineral notes are about all that arise from the bouquet. On the palate, this is a sizzler with blazing acidity and narrow flavors of lemon and green apple. Yes, it's very fresh and cleansing; but this is also acidic and lean.
Name: Emiliana 2012 Natura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A bright, herbaceous wine that is full of citrus and grapefruit flavors. These go with a tangy character, crisp and hinting at black currants and more tropical fruit.
Name: Château Laubès 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Just what the label says, this is fresh, fruity, simple and attractive Sauvignon Blanc. Lemon, crisp apple peel and fragrant acidity all meld easily together. Screwcap.
Name: Calvet 2011 Limited Release  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Somewhere between neutral and bland is where this wine's bouquet resides. The palate is plump feeling but stagnant, with chunky apple and pithy citrus flavors. Bitterness comes up on the finish, which is pithy as a whole.
Name: Maniña 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This amounts to a flabby, basic SB from a hot vintage. The nose is dull and lacks spunk. The palate is soft and fleshy, with bitter-leaning, bland flavors of melon, mild citrus and white pepper.
Name: Soleca 2012 3 Generaciones Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Lapostolle makes many excellent wines and quite a few good values; this Sauvignon Blanc from the warm Rapel Valley is not one of them. Like in prior years, this is bland and fleshy, with soft, wide, dull flavors of melon and sweet apple. And it's weak on acidity. 60,000 cases made.
Name: Lapostolle 2012 Casa Grand Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A Lake County SB with very little in the way of aromatics. It's acceptable for everyday, but a generic white wine.
Name: Green Truck 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: The top cuvée from Thomas (you can tell by the heavy statement bottle), this is an almost opulent expression of Sauvignon Blanc. It builds on its texture, gained from the chalk soils of Sancerre, with intense tropical fruits, pineapple as well as citrus and grapefruit. It is structured, dense and impressive.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2011 Ultimus  (Sancerre)

Description: Now mature, this rounded, ripe wine has yellow fruits, mango and a soft, opulent texture. It's an impressive example of how well Sauvignon Blanc can age in Pouilly Fumé, a style that doesn't quite forget the herbaceous edge of the grape while rounding it out deliciously.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2008 Grand Fumé  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: One of the pair of top end wines from Fournier (the other is the Grande Cuvée from Pouilly-Fumé) this ripe and full wine is soft and rounded. The initial herbaceous character gets replaced by a more sophisticated, rich and ripe character, intense and a very good pairing for food.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2009 Grande Cuvée  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a rich, green-plum and yellow-fruit flavored wine. Toast gives an extra roundness to a palate that is full, fragrant and ripe with fruit. It's delicious now, but could age for 2–3 years more.
Name: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2010 Maxime Vieilles Vignes sur Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: Still young, this rich and full-bodied wine is densely packed with red currant and bitter-orange fruit. Along with the fruit, there is a flinty, crisp edge that comes from the bright acidity. It needs at least two years to come together.
Name: Domaine des Berthiers 2010 Saint-Andelain  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: The flagship wine from Fournier is rich, showing maturing Sauvignon Blanc along with smooth, creamy plum and apricot flavors. It is full and intense—a complex wine that will repay another 2–3 years of aging.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2009 Grand Fumé  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: While this is certainly herbaceous, it also carries richer fruit flavors like apricots and melon to go with the grapefruit acidity. That gives it a rounded texture, full in the mouth and with a touch of minerality. Age this impressive wine another 1–2 years.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2010 Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)

Description: A terroir driven wine, its name reflects the shellfish shells that are found in the chalk soil of Sancerre. It's full, rounded and rich, but still youthful and needing a further year to age into a complex, mineral-textured wine.
Name: Domaine Roblin 2011 Ammonites  (Sancerre)

Description: While there is an herbaceous element in this wine, it is more to do with ripe berry fruits. It has a tangy orange-zest character that is bright and fruity, along with the black-currant flavors that give the wine some good intensity.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2011 La Crêle  (Sancerre)

Description: With three years' aging, this has developed into an almond- and toast-flavored wine that has softened and rounded the fruit. It has turned into a serious wine, its rich structure allied to the acidity. Ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Roblin 2010 Ammonites  (Sancerre)

Description: Initially youthfully crisp and herbaceous, the wine then broadens into riper more yellow-fruit flavors. That gives it richness and weight that balance with the grapefruit and lemon-juice freshness. Give this fine wine a year to meld together
Name: Domaine Seguin 2011  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Ripe black currant aromas set this wine on its full, warm path. It is intensely fruity with a rounded feel to it. The acidity cuts through the ripe character, giving tension and a piercing crisp aftertaste.
Name: Patient Cottat 2010 Anciennes Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Over the past few years, San Pedro has consistently put out excellent SBs under its 1865 label. This sings of coastal Chilean Sauvignon via mineral, passion fruit and grapefruit aromas. In the mouth, it's chiseled like a statue, with a mix of citrus and green flavors. Expect a cutting, crisp, zesty finish.
Name: San Pedro 2012 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This winery makes good Leyda Valley SB. This is green leaning on the nose, with lettuce, bell pepper and melon aromas. It's racy and showing firm acidity and zesty flavors of passion fruit and lime. A clean, crisp finish seals the deal. For under $15, this is a very nice wine for summer sipping.
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2012 Summit Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Crisp and fragrant, this wine is lively with lemon and green-apple fruit flavors. Floral, fresh and herbaceous, this has a great swathe of tangy acidity to finish.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2011 Grand'Chaille  (Sancerre)

Description: This is rich, smooth and weighty as befits a Pouilly-Fumé. Peach and green-plum flavors befit this impressively warm, full-bodied wine. The grassy Sauvignon character is there, but restrained by the ripeness of the wine.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2011 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is a dusty, white-currant and green-plum flavored wine. It has youthful richness to go with its open texture. The acidity brings out a refreshing, bright aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Roblin 2011 Enclos de Maimbray  (Sancerre)

Description: This is intense Sauvignon Blanc with pungent aromas of nettle, snap pea, bell pepper, gooseberry and passion fruit. The palate is typically fresh and precise, with zesty passion fruit, lime and pithy bitterness for flavors. The finish is crisp and echoes with a mix of tropical and cool-climate flavors.
Name: Matetic 2012 EQ Coastal Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: An attractive fruity wine with crisp citrus, ripe apple and a fine line of minerality. It is still young and could mature nicely over the next three years, but it's fruitiness makes it pleasant to drink now too.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2011  Sancerre

Description: This is a full, ripe wine that's rounded and rich on the palate. With ripe yellow fruit and tangerine flavors, it's tropical in style, although there is a tangy lemon edge to it to keep it crisp and herbaceous.
Name: Patient Cottat 2009 Anciennes Vignes  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: A powdery smelling, pungent opening leads to a spotty palate with citric acidity and a few holes in the textural fabric. A mix of generic citrus and white stone-fruit flavors ends in a citrusy, minerally finish that's tangy and fresh.
Name: Santa Helena 2012 Vernus Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: One sniff and you will be able to peg this as cool-climate SB. The nose is full of nettle and gooseberry aromas, while the palate feels trim and citrusy. Flavors of gooseberry, nettle and green bean leave a tropical note on the finish. This shows fine acidity but narrow, raw flavors.
Name: Errazuriz 2012 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is a briskly herbaceous wine that's lush with citrusy flavors of pink grapefruit and lime. Sweet tasting red apples round out the palate, giving a fragrant, juicy character. With lively acidity at the end, it is ready to drink now.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2011 Domaine Chatelain French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A vibrant, racy Sauvignon Blanc with concentrated notes of white grapefruit, herbs, and onion peel. It's mouthwatering and richly flavored with mineral notes speckling the finish.
Name: Melrose 2011 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Hinting at tropical fruits, this is a Sauvignon Blanc with some herbaceous, grapefruit flavors but also apricot and fresh pineapple. That gives it a good balance between crisp acidity and warmer texture. Screwcap.
Name: La Grille 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Currant fruits, a tight, mineral character and crisp citrus are combined with a richer potential that will round this wine out over the next year. It has weight, a steely edge and youthful structure.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2011 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Given one year's aging, this fruity wine has blossomed out with pear and peach flavors that go beyond the initial youthful herbaceousness. It has a good depth of flavor, a wine that is both bright with acidity and rich with ripe fruit.
Name: Patrick De Ladoucette 2010 Les Deux Tours Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Initially fresh and herbaceous, then exotic with a tropical-fruit note, this wine boasts both a steely edge and a ripe center. It's young and could age, but at the moment it is fruitily delicious.
Name: Patrick De Ladoucette 2011 Les Deux Tours Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: The nose on this basic Sauvignon is likeable, with moderate citric bite and zing. It's smooth and tasty in the mouth, with lime, tangerine, passion fruit and minerality. A cleansing, smooth finish confirms the wine's quality. It says a lot for the potential of Chilean SB.
Name: Casa Rivas 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is a steely, herbaceous wine with citrus fruits and pink grapefruit propelling it forward. Intensely fruity and ripe but with a refreshing lemon-zest aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Vincent Delaporte 2011  Sancerre

Description: Although the bouquet on this coastal wine is green, meaning there are aromas of canned beans and alfalfa, the body is plump and properly acidic. Flavors of vegetal-leaning lime, grass and bell pepper culminate in a solid feeling but mildly bitter tasting finish.
Name: O. Fournier 2011 Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Like all Matetic SBs, this wine from a warm year is pungent and prickly on the nose, with jalapeño, nettle and gooseberry aromas. The palate feels lively and bouncy, with citrusy lemon and passion fruit flavors along with green notes of nettle and cactus pad. This is mildly acidic and grassy tasting on the finish.
Name: Matetic 2012 Corralillo Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: This is focused up front, with grassy passion fruit and citrus aromas. The mouthfeel is plump and easy due to modest acidity, and the flavors of pole bean, bell pepper and lettuce are green but not severe. White pepper and jalapeño flavors carry the finish.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: A mineral-driven wine with typical herbaceous flavors, some pineapple and peach fruit and a tangy, lemon-zest aftertaste. It's crisp and fresh, ready to drink now and over the next 2–3 years.
Name: Langlois-Chateau 2011 Château de Fontaine-Audon  (Sancerre)

Description: Round and soft, this is a ripe, fruity Sauvignon Blanc. It has some citrus elements while veering more to peach and apricot flavors. Only towards the end does a greener, herbaceous character show through.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2011 Côtes de Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This SB opens with melony aromas along with green, spunky notes. At first it's chunky and grabby feeling, and then it flattens out a bit. Flavors of scallion, bell pepper and citrus end mildly bitter, with some heat and burn.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2012 Reserva Privada Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: The entry level wine from Roblin is all fruitiness—citrus and pineapple—with bright acidity. It's fresh, herbaceous edge is well integrated into the fruit character. Ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Roblin 2011 Origine  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is an intense, dense Sauvignon Blanc, full of concentrated lemon zest and green herbs. It has a young, mineral texture, while possessing a nervy acidity.
Name: Patient Cottat 2011 Le Grand Caillou Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: The nose on this wine is fresh but nothing unusual or exciting. In the mouth, it's racy, with acidity and flavors of green veggies, citrus fruits and pith. Things turn more pithy and mildly bitter on the finish, where tarragon and rosemary accents take over.
Name: Rios de Chile 2011 Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Showcasing a rich style of Sancerre, this wine is creamy in texture with flavors of almonds, ripe melon and citrus. The palate is full and soft, with just the aftertaste showing crispness.
Name: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2011 La Reine Blanche  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A delightful bottle of Sauvignon Blanc with notes of pink grapefruit, lime zest, and medley of fresh herbs. What the palate lacks in terms of fruit concentration it makes up for with a fine zip of acidity.
Name: Kriselle 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Talk about a sharp wine; this almost socks you in the nose upon taking a whiff. It's full of citrus and jalapeño aromas, which are backed by sizzling bell pepper, serrano chili and lime flavors. Expect a raw feeling and super crisp finish.
Name: Errazuriz 2012 Aconcagua Costa Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: This is a standard SB that was made for near-term quaffing. The nose delivers citrus and oceanic crispness, while in the mouth it's modest, with white pepper, green bean, bell pepper and citrus flavors. On the finish, it's citrusy at first but then slips toward bitter tasting.
Name: Siegel 2012 Crucero Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Spunky passion fruit, scallion and green-herb aromas are crisp and varietally correct. In the mouth, this is refreshing and not too serious, with citrus, passion fruit and green flavors that turn mildly vegetal on the finish. For a $9 quaffer, you can't ask for more.
Name: Peñascal 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A satisfying Sauvignon Blanc with pronounced swirls of pineapple and guava, a creamy texture and long finish, with just a bit of vanilla on the finish.
Name: Chatom Vineyards 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Calaveras County)

Description: This searingly tart take on Sauv Blanc is ready made for fresh Pacific coast oysters. Lemon juice and lemongrass flavors highlight a very acidic wine, that's clean as a whistle..
Name: Carlton Cellars 2011 Proposal Rock Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: Green herb, grass, bell pepper and asparagus aromas outmuscle the wine's citrus aromas, leading to a crisp body and flavors of green apple, grass, green pepper and jalapeño. The finish is solid and fresh in feel but limited in flavor.
Name: Concha y Toro 2011 Marques de Casa Concha Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: An herbaceous wine made with Sauvignon Blanc grapes grown in Southwest France, this has fine, crisp acidity, with grapefruit notes and a positive zing in the texture. Deliciously fruity. Screwcap.
Name: François Lurton 2011 Terra Sana Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Tropical aromas of melon and banana come with a citrusy kick and briny notes. The palate feels about normal, with good acidity supporting a mix of green herb and citrus flavors. Briny, pickled flavors take over on the finish, which is short in length.
Name: Misiones de Rengo 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This grassy, slightly stalky smelling SB struggles with purity on the nose. In the mouth, however, it's lifted and shows good feel along with flavors of green herbs and citrus. The finish is under control, with adequate cut.
Name: TerraNoble 2011 Reserva el Algarrobo Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Oily, slightly stalky aromas set up a spritzy feeling, narrow palate with lemony acids and razor-sharp flavors of sour apple and gooseberry. The finish amounts to an acidic wash of zesty tang. This is good and sharp, but limited.
Name: Calcu 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: With that intense herbaceous aroma that is often the hallmark of Touraine Sauvignon Blanc, this is as crisp as they come. It has currant fruit flavors, gooseberry and a lemon-zest texture. Taut and mineral to finish.
Name: Bougrier 2011 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Typical herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc, filled out with pineapple and apple fruits to give a wine that has some weight. It has a ripe yet very fresh feel.
Name: Domaine Gibault 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Pays de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a tense, herbaceous wine—all gooseberry and lemon acidity. That said, there is a more gentle side to this wine that makes it already attractive to drink.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Pays de Loire)

Description: This is a very tight, acidic wine with extreme herbaceousness. The wine has a mineral texture and the fruit profile is intensely citrus and crisp with a touch of mango. The acidity is mouthwatering, very fresh and really needing a few months to round out.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011  Sancerre

Description: Touraine produces some of the most herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc in the Loire, and this wine from Oisly, the regional heartland of the grape, is classic. It's intensely citric with grapefruit and gooseberry flavors that fill the palate and give a tight, tangy aftertaste.
Name: Domaine des Corbillières 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: With just the merest hint of bubbles, this is a bright, breezy wine, very herbaceous in its clean character. The bubbles and the wine sit uneasily together, resulting in a wine that's not altogether balanced. Screwcap.
Name: François Lurton 2011 Fumées Blanches Lightly Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Vin Pétillant)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A full 170 g/L residual sugar and pressed from frozen grapes, this aromatic wine shows some heat with alcohol and whisky barrel notes along with brown sugar. The palate is thick and rich with copious amounts of granular sugar and dried mango flavors.
Name: Valley View 2008 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Bland, plump aromas of honeyed white fruits aren't exact or zesty. The palate is modest in feel, with basic citrus flavors that come with green notes. This is soft on the finish, so drink now before it fades.
Name: Yali 2012 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: Fresh but simple nectarine and tangerine aromas lead to a nice palate with slightly pithy and bitter tasting lemon and lime flavors. This delivers a cleansing round of acids and basic flavors.
Name: Tacora 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Dusty apple aromas are warm and chunky. In the mouth, this is plump and oily feeling, with mealy apple and peach flavors. The finish is also kind of bitter, with a mealy aftertaste. This feels and tastes very much like a warm-climate SB.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2012 La Joya Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine is for lovers of easy going yet herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc. It is properly crisp, yet has a fruity, fragrant character that softens the more mineral element.
Name: Saget Père et Fils 2011 Les Petits Sarments Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: This SB hails from a warm region in Chile, so in a warm year like 2012 the wine is extra soft and lacking in bite. The palate is round and chunky feeling, with slightly mealy citrus flavors and a similar tasting finish. Call it old school, inland Sauvignon and drink soon.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2012 La Joya Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Given the $27 price, this “limited edition” Sauvignon is lacking in many places. The nose is challenging, with a strong scent of bathroom cleanser, while the palate delivers acid and citrusy flavors but no middle tier. On the finish, it's like scallions and tarragon, with cutting acidity.
Name: William Cole 2011 Bill Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Initially this smells perfumed and powdery, like a grande dame preparing to go out for the night. On deeper inspection, it smells grassy and citrusy, then tastes and feels dilute. At best this is a quaffing wine due to minimal character but good acidity.
Name: William Cole 2012 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Very pale, almost transparent, despite alcohol over 14% abv, this very light, citrusy wine carries a background flavor of vitamin pill, and feels a bit flat in the mouth.
Name: Ledger David 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: The color is gold, the nose is heavy, and the flavors are bland and suggest apple cider. All of this adds up to an average, warm-climate white that won't last long. Even in its youth, it's honeyed, soft and flabby.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2012 Petirrojo Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Flat, mildly stalky, grassy aromas announce a bland wine with a rudimentary mix of citrus and nectarine flavors. It's so mild and simple that it's devoid of a finish. This will not stay fresh for long.
Name: Aresti 2012 Estate Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This flat, dull wine is showing hardly any Sauvignon Blanc character. It's chunky and tastes of apple juice and banana. It lacks kick and depth, and it falls apart on the palate and finish.
Name: Sar 2012 Casa Mateo Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: A beautifully balanced and well-crafted Sauvignon Blanc, opening with attractive aromas of grapefruit pith, green fig and lime zest, all complemented with a soft saline accent. Lightweight, with medium acidity and a bright palate, flavors of green melon, citrus rind and a hint of dried grass linger into the medium-length finish.
Name: Cape Point Vineyards 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Cape Point)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Striking minerality and hints of freshly cut grass add briskness to this floral, peach-inflected wine. Dry in style, with a voluptuously supple palate, it's remarkably languorous on the finish.
Name: Shaw 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Subtle spice and fresh hay accents add depth to this wine. Aromas and flavors of orange, lime and melon rind mingle with green fig and plum notes in the nose and on the vibrant palate. Hints of savory herb and pepper unfold and linger softly on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Neil Ellis 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Groenekloof)

Description: A zesty and somewhat prickly Sauvignon Blanc, this starts off with scents of white melon rind, tart gooseberry, green pepper and sweet grass. The palate offers a more assertive citrusy flavor alongside hints of green fig and zesty spice. The close is juicy and refreshing. Enjoy now.
Name: Tokara 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With 5% Riesling in the blend, this bone-dry Sauv Blanc gains just a touch of roundness and spice. Clear, crisp flavors mix celery, gooseberry and tart melon fruit. It's very fresh, almost delicate.
Name: Va Piano 2011 Brunos Blend Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this Sierra Foothills' Sauvignon Blanc is creamy, with great texture, and lilting layers of light peach, kiwi, lime and melon. Delicious—enjoy it with seafood or goat cheese on crackers.
Name: Sierra Starr 2011 Solstice Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Description: The bouquet of this wine is somewhat dainty, offering layered aromas of yellow apple, gooseberry, melon and crushed mineral. Ripe stone-fruit flavors add breadth to the dominating citrus notes, with a hint of sweet grass unfolding on the finish.
Name: Bouchard Finlayson 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Description: Lemon, green gooseberry and plum lead the nose and mouth of this refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. The texture is ripe and fruit forward, but lifted with good acidic cut that ends on a mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
Name: Southern Right 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aged entirely in new French oak, the opening aroma reflects woody notes before revealing waves of rich, thick coconut and caramel. Full bodied in style, it finishes with a hint of sweetness.
Name: Occasio 2011 Del Arroyo Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Soft hints of talc and fresh hay accent the orange and lime core of this wine. Lightweight with medium-high acidity, fresh kiwi and white-melon rind flavors linger on the clean close. Drink now.
Name: Groot Constantia 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: A delicate feline note accents the fresh herb, green gooseberry and lemon-rind aromas of this wine. The mouthfeel starts off round, but is quickly lifted by medium acidity to produce a brisk palate with flavors of lemon and tart green berries. The finish is lifted and somewhat sharp, but clean and refreshing.
Name: Catherine Marshall 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: A light, bright and easygoing wine with clean notes of citrus, fresh-cut grass and lime zest. Lively acidity keeps the palate vibrant and refreshing, ending with a mouthwatering, tart green-plum flavor. Drink up.
Name: Hermanuspietersfontein 2011 Nr 3 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very distinctive Sauvignon Blanc with leesy notes of biscuit, spice and custard at the fore along with herbs and a spine of lemony acidity that runs from head to tail.
Name: Vin du Lac 2010 LEHM Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)

Description: Faint suggestions of fynbos and asparagus mingle with bright notes of orange peel, green plum and melon rind. Lively and easy, with good cut to the melon and plum flavors on the palate that end quickly but cleanly.
Name: Creation 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Description: This is a clean, basic wine with white-fruit aromas of peach and apple. The palate is well balanced, and there's a good level of citrus flavor along with green herb accents. On the finish, it's more tropical, with a hint of banana.
Name: Chaltén 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Neuquén)

Description: While there's a New Zealand-style twist of grass and gooseberry, this Sauvignon Blanc is otherwise woody and tropical with pineapple juice flavor and quivering lemony acidity.
Name: LangeTwins 2011 Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: Green aromas and flavors take center stage on this wine, with assertive notes of bell pepper, asparagus, green bean, grass and flint. The palate is somewhat astringent and sharp, ending with a tart, saline finish.
Name: Springfield Estate 2011 Life from Stone Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Description: This is light on the nose, where minerally lime scents are barely detectable. The mouthfeel is fresh but dilute, while flavors of lemon, green apple and tarragon end in simple fashion.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2012 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Description: Mild lemon and apple aromas are compromised by a harsh, stalky element. The mouthfeel is basic and spritzy, while generic apple and green melon flavors end in tropical sweetness.
Name: Pascual Toso 2012 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: With acrid matchstick aromas and little else, this wine gets off to a rough start and never finds solid footing. The palate is chunky and grabby, while the flavors are burnt and stalky, with bitterness to the finish.
Name: Solo Contigo 2011 Premium Series Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Full of vitality from start to finish, this wine has bright flavors of pear and melon. Well balanced and refreshing, pair it with Asian fare and spicy seafood, or enjoy it on its own.
Name: Navarro 2011 Cuvee 128 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has great viscosity and bracing minerality, plus a tongue-tickling texture. The refreshing palate offers gooseberry and melon notes, which combine to make this a go-to Sancerre substitute. One can only hope production increases from the miserly two barrels that were made in this vintage.
Name: Columbia Crest 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Intensely green and herbal on the nose, this has penetrating flavors of gooseberry, lavender, mint and grass. This Sauvignon Blanc, which was aged for two years in French barrique, is textural, with its hints of green-tea-like tannin.
Name: Movia 2010 Sauvignon (Brda)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fleshy and fruity, fresh and full bodied, this generous wine offers scents of orange peel and citrus, and the palate exudes ripe flavors of grapefruit, lime and a hint of melon.
Name: Snoqualmie 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Redolent of intense grapefruit and pineapple, this is a classy, fruit-driven single-vineyard Sauvignon Blanc. Although this is aged entirely in stainless steel, there is a hint of cracker on the finish.
Name: Arbor Crest 2011 Bacchus Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consistent in every way with the previous vintage, this barrel-fermented Sauvignon Blanc includes 9% Sémillon, both of which were sourced from 15-year-old vines. It's aromatic with scents of sweet herb and citrus, and it tastes of Meyer lemon and grapefruit, plus a hint of brioche.
Name: Upland Estates 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has been barrel-fermented and aged, yet it retains more than a hint of the grape's natural herbaceousness. Sharp-edged and assertive, it might pass for a Quincy from the Loire Valley.
Name: Columbia Crest 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This Sauvignon Blanc tastes lightly grassy, with a creamy texture and plenty of bite. The flavors that pop include grapefruit, kiwi, cantaloupe and wet stone.
Name: Courtney Benham 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean, tart and herbal, this Sauvignon Blanc has front-and-center flavors of bright citrus and green apple. A slight hint of baking spice comes through on the finish.
Name: Mercer 2011 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This wine is nicely balanced and easy to drink, with clean notes of green plum, gooseberry, white melon rind and lime peel. Bright and flavorful with a fresh, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2011 Yarden Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This is a vegetal Sauvignon Blanc, with forward aromas of green pepper, asparagus, green plum and a touch of talcum powder on the nose. Tart, lean, green fruit flavors fill the mouth, ending on a brisk yet clean finish.
Name: Recanati 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Shomron)

Description: Sweet flower and cherry aromas perfume this dry, berry-tinged Sauvignon Blanc. It's refreshing and quaffable, and it offers bright acidity and just a hint of green that lingers on the finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2011 Dreamfish Sauvignon Blanc (Recas)

Description: Fragrant of baked apple and vanilla spice, this Bulgarian Sauvignon Blanc is just a shade off dry. It offers straightforward but easy-drinking apple and flower flavors, and the bright acidity lends a clean, brisk finish.
Name: Vini 2011 Veni Vidi Vici Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and glossy, this refreshing, stainless-steel Sauvignon Blanc has the appropriate varietal flavors of fresh herb, sweet grass, lime and grapefruit. The flavors of citrus and herb are in perfect balance and complement each other perfectly.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: This wine consistently shows off its excellence and purity. This vintage is typically aromatic, with scents of ocean, honey, green herb and grass. The palate is full, round and lemony, with scallion, lime, melon and tarragon flavors. Will pair well with shellfish and ceviche.
Name: Undurraga 2011 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: For South American dessert wine, this is at the top of the class. The nose is light and offers nectarine, tangerine and peach aromas, while the mouthfeel is honeyed and plump, with orange marmalade, cinnamon and nutmeg flavors. The finish is long and complex, and a touch soft in feel.
Name: Errazuriz 2011 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is about as racy as Sauvignon Blanc from Chile gets. It's green and melon-like on the nose, with punchy asparagus and lime aromas. It is wide awake on the palate, where citrusy acids push lemon, lime, green herb and lemongrass flavors. It cuts like a razor; drink with shellfish.
Designation: Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5
Name: Concha y Toro 2011 Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: There's no denying this wine's greenness: It's draped all over the nose, palate and finish. But that doesn't mean it's not a classy, structured, tangy wine with length and clarity. It's a food wine for sure, with pickled, briny notes on the finish. Drink with ceviche, crudo and raw oysters.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel
Name: Concha y Toro 2011 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Rapel Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This juicy white opens with a blend of citrusy and grassy aromas. The mouthfeel is healthy and round, with good acidic cut. Flavors of lime, Granny Smith apple and green herb are fresh and correct, while the finish is clear and refreshing. Drink now before it begins to fade.
Name: Loma Larga 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Hailing from coastal Leyda, this wine has a bouquet that comes with an oceanic edge, plus grass and green fruit aromas. The palate is crisp and lively, with good acidity bolstering citrus, lychee, melon and grass flavors. The finish is cleansing.
Name: Santa Carolina 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This crisp, acidic Sauvignon Blanc leans green with pea and canned bean aromas, but it offers enough green apple and citrus character for enjoyment. The palate is zesty and lemony, with flavors that include green veggies, herbs, limes and tangerines. The finish is mildly green and citrusy.
Designation: Selección del Directorio Gran Reserva Cool Coastal Vineyard
Name: Santa Helena 2011 Selección del Directorio Gran Reserva Cool Coastal Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a crisp, medium-bodied wine, with pleasant aromas of apricot, lemon and pineapple. A smidgen of almond nuttiness marks the finish.
Name: Paul Dolan 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A fresh, fragrant and herbaceous wine, this dances lightly and brightly on the palate. Flavors of grapefruit and lime come with crisp acidity, lending a mouth-tingling finish.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2011 Cuvée Jeanne Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This has pungent aromatics of petrol and grass, and the flavors follow. It's a reasonable style for the Sauvignon Blanc grape, but it likely will not appeal to all palates.
Name: Kandarian 2011 Blue Eye Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: The bouquet is neutral except for a spot of lemon-lime. The palate is clean and balanced, with decent weight and fresh acidity. Flavors of green fruit, scallion, mineral and herb fall off on the finish. Drink immediately.
Name: Con Carne 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: A creamy style of Sauvignon Blanc, this has flavors of ripe citrus and pineapple. It has a bite of acidity that adds lightness and freshness. Fully of juicy flavors, this is ready to drink now.
Name: Pratsch 2011 Rotenpüllen Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A gold-hued, oaky wine, this is well along the aging curve, but suitable for near-term drinking. Think of it as Sauvignon Blanc made in an old-fashioned Chardonnay style.
Name: Kandarian 2010 Croft Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This has grassy tones and tropical fruit flavors that'll pair with oysters and other shellfish just fine.
Name: Souverain 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: This is a prickly wine, with a strong blast of nettle and green herb aromas. It has weight and texture on the palate, while the flavors of citrus fruits and salad greens are pithy and mildly bitter. Green and white pepper notes dominate the finish.
Name: Arboleda 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Punchy and prickly up front, this has sharp aromas, which signal that the grapes were picked early in a hot vintage. Flavors of nettle, white pepper and jalapeño rest on a zesty palate. This wine finishes with snap and freshness.
Name: Miguel Torres 2012 Las Mulas Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Dusty, citrusy aromas form the greeting, while the palate is juicy in style, without much definition beyond zestiness. The flavors offer notes of papaya and nectarine. The finish sizzles for a moment, then fizzles.
Name: Viña La Rosa 2012 La Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Slight in aroma at first, this wine slowly reveals a waft of lemon. It's light in flavor, and it delivers crispness, with a hint of oak on the finish.
Name: Insatiable 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A simple Sauvignon Blanc that tastes of cantaloupe. Serve it at a big outdoor party or any other time the focus is not entirely on the wine.
Name: Cable Car 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Orange and lime aromas control the nose on this spritzy, tangy wine that literally shows bubbles in the glass. The flavors are lemony and sharp, with a grassy accent. Tasted twice.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2011 Coastal Cool Climate Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Melony and green on the nose, with an asparagus note. The palate sports enough acidity to keep it afloat, but the flavors shift quickly from lime and melon to peas and asparagus.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2010 Reserva Privada Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This seems like it was probably better earlier in its life. Now, it's kind of wan and fading, with a maderized note of vanilla, plus white fruit.
Name: San Nicolas 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: This smells sort of gaseous and mealy. It's soft and fleshy on the palate, with green banana and melony flavors. The finish is mild, green-leaning and bitter, with a flabby structure.
Name: Aguirre 2011 Reina Ana Villa Alegre Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This is mild on the nose, with a lemon-lime aroma. The palate is soft, but it has a pulse. The wine's citrus, melon and tropical flavors finish flat. For the most part, it's clean and quaffable.
Name: Sombras del Sol 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: The flabby citrus aroma is dusty and shows a tinge of vanilla, which is an aroma that isn't normally associated with Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is big and globby, with an oily note and flavors of citrus, green herb and nettle.
Name: Viña Requingua 2012 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Shy and neutral on the nose except for a touch of apple. The palate is hollow and citric, with racy lime flavors that end tangy. This is short on substance and offers minimal character.
Name: Sundance 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This is flat, oily and waxy on the nose, which indicates that this 2010 offering is past its prime. Melony flavors are soft and bready, and the feel is flabby and on its way to expiring.
Name: Flying Angels 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: This wine is made from fruit that was sourced from very close to the Pacific Ocean. As a result, it's ultragreen and vegetal on the nose, with a palate that bears high acid and a flavor of citrus extract, plus touches of beans and peas.
Name: Santa Helena 2011 Vernus Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Crystal clear, loaded with enticing aromas and flavors of lemon zest, orange, tangerine and spice, this is a juicy, delicious and complete wine. Tangy and tart, it is almost impossible not to drain the glass quickly in order to refill it.
Name: Novelty Hill 2011 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a rich wine that's full of apricot, melon and pear flavors. It has weight, ripe fruit and a good touch of minerality, with a clean and crisp finish. Age this for a year or two.
Name: Château Haut Grand Champ 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is succulent yet delicate, with dried hay and sweet grass flavors. Textural, vivid and racy, it has a Loire-like mix of fruit, flower and herb, with the possibility of improving still further over the next 4–5 years.
Name: Barons V 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This lightly wood-aged wine's toasty character is finely balanced with tropical and citrus fruits. Full and ripe, the wine has both weight and a concentrated, rich aftertaste.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011 Heritage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A creamed apple flavor gives this wine a warm, rich feel. Its weight matches its touch of minerality. Toward the end, a tropical character emerges, adding an exotic, ripe feel.
Name: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Michel Lynch  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Deep, ripe fruit is the focus, brimming with lemon-lime flavor. There's a touch of vanilla cookie also—thoroughly delicious, if a bit blocky. The finish has just a hint of alcohol warmth.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This finely balanced wine has richness and a crisp citrusy character. It has a fine bite of lemon zest, plus concentrated herbaceousness. Screwcap.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011 Intense  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Aromatic and herbaceous, this is a fresh red-currant- and citrus-flavored wine. With textured acidity and a bright, crisp character, it is developing well and it should be ready to drink in a few months.
Name: Dourthe 2011 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Lightly herbaceous aromas lead to an attractive, creamy wine. It has grapefruit-like acidity as well as a ripe apple character. Fresh and fruity. Screwcap.
Name: Schröder & Schÿler 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a bright, fruity, rounded wine with a soft texture. It's full and ripe, with melon and green plum notes, plus a touch of bitterness on the finish.
Name: Château du Taillan 2011 La Dame Blanche  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is definitely herbaceous, with gooseberry and citrus flavors and a crisp, cool feel. It dances lightly on the palate with vibrant acidity.
Name: Château de Seguin 2011 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Pungent on the nose, this offers blasts of nettle, sweat, mineral and stone along with citrus. It feels fresh and forward, but the flavors of white fruit, jalapeño and bitter pith don't impress. Holds onto its bitterness on the finish.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: This smells bland but clean, with a hint of citrus. It feels spritzy but simple, with papaya, green melon and mild citrus flavors. Good in a very basic way, but drink now before it fades.
Name: Bodega NQN 2010 Malma Finca la Papay Sauvignon Blanc (Patagonia)

Description: This is a simple, fruity wine that's herbaceous in character. A yeasty edge produces some bitterness.
Name: Château du Cros 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Notes of vanilla, melon and oily bitterness define the nose. The wine feels both creamy and grabby, with pithy, sweet-tasting flavors of melon and peach. A persistent, mild bitterness downgrades the finish.
Name: Casarena 2011 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: This smells stalky and oily, with a peach pit aroma. It feels citrusy, tangy and a touch bitter, with flavors of white grapefruit, white peach and grass. It shows a tangerine note and a sticky feel on the finish.
Name: Bodega Margot 2011 Maula Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: This tastes herbal and light on fruit, textured with tight mineral qualities. Acidity comes through on the finish.
Name: Yvon Mau 2011 Yvecourt  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Prickly aromas of saline and citrus precede an acidic, spritzy palate that's home to modest mango and melon flavors. Turns rather bitter and oily on the finish.
Name: Salentein 2011 Portillo Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The alcohol has dropped almost a full percentage point in 2011, but the wine has plenty of ripe, round fruit, with the emphasis on Meyer lemon, orange blossom, and pineapple. Forward and fruity, with mouth-filling sappiness, this is a wine to enjoy in the splendor of its youth.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2011 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: As good as last year, this vintage has a subtle lemon taste that's layered with dashes of lilting lychee and fresh cantaloupe. Well integrated and pleasant, it will pair with spicy and seafood-infused foods, or go down easy on its own.
Name: Husch 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Easton blends the Musque clone with Clone One for a Sauvignon Blanc that's not overly herbaceous nor overly rich and creamy. The wine has a crisp minerality and tastes of ripe golden apple and lemon, with just the right amount of richness and a sliver of nuttiness in the background.
Name: Easton 2011 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Description: A fine bottle at a great price, this fresh and clean-tasting Sauvignon Blanc offers a bracing mix of tree fruit, with just a touch of sweet herb. It's clearly varietal: no frills, just straightforward and very nicely made.
Name: Columbia Crest 2010 Two Vines Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Named for winemaker Virginie Bourgue, this entirely stainless-fermented Sauvignon Blanc has a grassy, spicy edge reminiscent of Loire Valley whites. It's also tongue-twistingly tart, a reflection of the vintage, like a lemon explosion in the mouth. In other words, this is a perfect seafood wine.
Name: Lullaby 2011 Blanc de Virginie Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Sauvignon Blanc, this is a light and fresh wine, with notes of lime, melon and a hint of bell pepper. It's nicely rounded off with a touch of residual sugar—a perfect thirst-quencher.
Name: Vin du Lac 2011 Savvy! Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made from certified biodynamic grapes and the Musqué clone, this is crisp with a creamy texture and a long finish. Tasting of brioche, lemon chiffon and wood, it screams out for seafood.
Name: Jeriko 2011 Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Assertively grassy, this pungent Sauvignon Blanc also carries a fairly strong diesel scent. Call it Pouilly-Fumé in style, though as a New World wine, it has more fruit, without the bracing minerality. The finish is clean and medium in length.
Name: Cave B 2011 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharply defined with fruit flavors of melon and green berry, this has real cut and drives through the palate with confidence. It's a great food wine, neither wimpy nor too assertive, and it's made to be chilled and set out with any white-wine-friendly food.
Name: Snoqualmie 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Horse Heaven Vineyard adds a welcome touch of minerality to the plain apple fruit flavor of the wine. It is this minerality that elevates it a notch, giving it a textural and refreshing mouthfeel.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a pleasant-drinking wine with no distinguishing features—a Sauvignon Blanc with training wheels. It's perfectly enjoyable and can be paired with a wide variety of poultry and seafood.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is an intensely creamy white that's full, bright and delightfully clear in its grapefruit zest flavor. The finish features touches of lemon and lemongrass.
Name: Paul Dolan 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: An easy-drinking Sauvignon Blanc thats fermented in barrel and stainless steel, this has a depth of pear, tangerine and lime flavors. Creamy and rich, it will make a consistent companion to most fish dishes.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2011 The Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Line 39 is a consistently solid name in Lake County Sauvignon Blanc. The 2011 delivers an aromatically inviting, grassy, New Zealand-style wine, with layers of citrus and grapefruit.
Name: Line 39 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This grassy North Coast offering has plenty of lime, kiwi and jalapeño flavors that are able to stand up to spicy appetizers with its crisp, long finish. Proceeds are donated to the restoration of watersheds for steelhead trout and coho salmon.
Name: Steelhead Vineyards 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: Minerally and mildly salty, this has white-fruit aromas of citrus and pear. It feels true and lively, with green, tropical notes of lime and apple along with chalky minerals. Mellow and smooth, it's long on the finish.
Name: Maycas del Limari 2011 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Grassy, herbal notes add a pungent kick to aromas of ripe yellow peach and melon on this gorgeously fruity, floral wine. Full-bodied in style, it has a richly textured mouthfeel.
Name: Edi Simcic 2010 Sauvignon (Goriska Brda)

Description: This is a perfectly nice Sauvignon Blanc from stand-alone vineyards in Zapallar. The nose features a varietal aroma of white pepper and a piquant hint of green. The acid-driven palate bears lime, tangerine and bell pepper flavors.
Designation: Outer Limits Beyond Frontiers Zappallar Vineyard
Name: Montes 2011 Outer Limits Beyond Frontiers Zappallar Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
