Description: This wine gets going with aromas of grass, citrus and mineral. Next comes a chiseled palate, bearing tight, pure flavors of lime, pink grapefruit and green herb. It's elegant and has a minerally, just-long-enough finish.
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2011 Pomerape Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Composed, correct and minerally on the nose, this wine has typical and attractive pungent-green aromas. It feels zesty and crisp, with cutting acidity in support of grassy, classically Leyda flavors of lime, grapefruit and lemongrass. It's angular but long on the finish.
Name: Undurraga 2011 Sibaris Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This is snappy in the front of the palate, with green pea, bell pepper, tangerine and grass aromas. It feels alert, crisp and citric, with dry lime, grapefruit and pole bean flavors that culminate in lemon and persistent grapefruit notes on the finish. A linear, high-acid style of Sauvignon Blanc, this has definite coastal influences.
Name: Koyle 2011 Koyle Costa Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Costa)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh, clean and bright, this is resplendent with lemon and lime tones, with a grassy touch that's similar to the New Zealand style. Well-made and refreshing, this has a pure green-apple-flavored finish.
Name: Benziger 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Description: Fresh and grassy up front, with bell pepper, tropical fruit and citrus aromas, this features briny flavors of lime, grapefruit and tarragon. The finish is controlled, and tangy.
Name: Undurraga 2011 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó and Leyda Valleys)

Description: Crisp, green and snappy on the nose, this is however not as defined, cut or chiseled on the palate as in previous vintages. It tastes grassy, bordering on vegetal, but also a little wayward and soft.
Name: Kingston Family 2011 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is concentrated on the nose and palate, with ripe, fleshy peach and a spray of yellow flower. Dry and medium bodied, it features zesty acidity and a hint of green herb on the finish. A great value wine to be enjoyed now.
Name: Senator 2010 Varius Sauvignon Blanc (Viile Carasului)

Description: This opens with an oily note that's soon replaced by generic white peach and apple scents. It feels plump, with chunky flavors of citrus, kiwi and lime, and it's mild yet fairly long on the tail end.
Name: Piggy Bank 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: Cool and green smelling, with briny notes and whiffs of green pepper and sea foam, this shows intensity, while the flavors veer toward lime, passion fruit and green herb. It's nervy and tasty on the finish.
Name: William Cole 2011 Columbine Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The snap pea, tarragon, scallion and passion fruit aromas make this wine easy to identify as Sauvignon Blanc. It feels linear and razor sharp, with sizzling grapefruit and apple flavors. Tangy and very fresh, it turns to lime and green onion on the finish.
Name: Miguel Torres 2012 Santa Digna Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This is a soft, tropical-fruit-driven Sauvignon Blanc made in a warm-climate style. It has a clean, fresh character, with an apricot note and a soft touch of orange zest. It's fragrant, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Cortes de Cima 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

Description: This is mild and lightly citric smelling, with an ocean spray note on the bouquet. On the palate, it is fresh and deep, with a note of nectarine. The finish is solid, but loses some fruit and gains some bitterness.
Name: Echeverria 2012 Classic Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Pungent up front, with green herb, white pepper and citrus aromas, this is zesty and acidic on the palate, with a monotonous lemon flavor on the finish. It turns more tart and acidic as it airs.
Name: Root:1 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The standard Sauvignon Blanc aromas of lime and mineral define the nose of this wine. It tastes juicy to an extreme, with fruit flavors of nectarine and apple that don't rise to a high level. It's tangy, candied and bright on the finish.
Name: François Lurton 2012 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: On the nose, this smells like bath soap or air freshener. It feels fleshy and oily on the palate, with tropical flavors of banana and papaya. The finish is smooth and tastes of candy.
Name: Cono Sur 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Grassy with green leaf and fresh-cut herb notes, this dry, easy-drinking wine boasts lively lime-juice acidity and pleasant apple flavor. Slightly dusty notes of dried herb and reed distract on the finish.
Name: Targovishte 2011 Premium Quality Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Black Sea Coastal)

Description: For wine drinkers who don't mind briny aromas, here is a wine with a funky-oyster quality on the nose. This adequate wine tastes of orange, brine, asparagus and pickled beans. It's juicy and plump on the tail end.
Name: Viña Chocalan 2011 Selección Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Soapy on the nose, this feels soft, melony and low in acid, while the flavors suggest banana and mango. It's flabby on the finish.
Name: Quasar 2011 Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Molina)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An excellent follow-up to the luscious 2010, this features a generous array of melon, citrus and light tropical fruits. There is noticeable residual sugar—much in the style of the Sancerres from French producer Cotat—but at one-third the cost.
Name: Barrister 2011 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Texture, texture, texture—that's the story with this wine. Fermented using wild yeast, this Sauvignon Blanc dazzles the palate with notes of sweet grass, clover, grapefruit and mineral. It's made in a lip-smacking, tart and tangy style, with a wet stone finish.
Name: Efeste 2011 Feral Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe, succulent peach and melon flavors mark this dry but lusciously textured Sauvignon Blanc. Crisp and minerally, yet juicy and thirst quenching, this has so much dimension in each sip. It finishes quite floral, with just a touch of lime-pith astringency.
Name: Ravines 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Floral and fruity, with hints of peach, muskmelon and quince, this concentrated Sauvignon Blanc bursts with fruity sweetness on the attack, becoming refreshingly dry and minerally on the midpalate. Lime-like acidity brightens the long, white-peach-flavored finish.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Violet perfume and hints of sweet red berries are intoxicating on the nose of this brisk yet concentrated wine. Delicate flavors of gooseberry and white peach are ripe yet elegant, finishing on a crisp, tonic note.
Name: Macari 2011 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Ripe and accessible, this Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc includes 20% Sémillon in the blend. Melon and light citrus flavors abound, with enough acidity to keep it fresh and lively.
Name: Page Cellars 2010 Sentimental Blonde Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from the Boushey Vineyard, this is a tart take on Sauvignon Blanc. Once past the acid rush, you'll find a tightly focused wine, with laser-like precision and a wealth of mineral and lemon flavors.
Name: Avennia 2011 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Grassy and audaciously herbaceous, this is a fresh and high-acid Sauvignon Blanc, finishing with a blast of pepper. The blend includes 10% Sémillon.
Name: DiStefano 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Ripe notes of pineapple and firm guava are framed by bracing acidity that lends a slight prickle to the palate. Flavors of sweet grass and Key lime develop and carry onto the clean finish. Drink now.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2011 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly scented with a Riesling-like petrol note, this pungent, grassy Sauvignon Blanc offers a crisply focused mix of celery, green berry and spring herb.
Name: Tildio 2011 Lonesome Spring Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Green plum and tart gooseberry aromas and flavors lead the way of this lively selection. Linear and direct on the palate, it has refreshing notes of lime rind, sweet grass and a touch of white flower. Clean and balanced; drink now.
Name: Indaba 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is lightly grassy and quite fresh. Whatever the residual sugar may be, it simply helps round out the searing acidity.
Name: Airfield Estates 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is forward and fresh, with notes of green apple, gooseberry and lemon-lime on the nose and palate. Zippy and mouthwatering, it has faint suggestions of lime zest and fresh-cut grass on the back.
Name: MAN Vintners 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a slightly dusty, grassy element to this understated Sauvignon Blanc, but the palate is nicely concentrated, with abundant yellow-peach and tangerine flavors. The lemonade-like acidity is brisk and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: White Springs 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Light and easy, this has direct aromas and flavors of green plum, lime, just-dried grass and underripe mango. Medium acidity keeps the finish clean and bright. Drink now.
Name: Durbanville Hills 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: Sauvignon Blanc's Burgundy enclave of Saint-Bris produces a round version of the grape, leaning towards yellow fruit flavors, with herbaceous aromas. This is fruity and can be consumed now.
Name: La Chablisienne 2011  Saint-Bris

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A nut skin note and a whisper of smoke add a savory element to the lemon and apple aromas. It's refreshingly light on it's feet, with a brisk, tonic mouthfeel.
Name: Hector Wine Company 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Capay Valley, Central Valley, California, US
Description: From Casey Flat's 2,000-feet-high estate near Sacramento, this is a creamy, voluptuous Sauvignon Blanc that has reams of texture. It retains a lot of acidity and is rich and fruity, with a seamless midpalate. Its richness comes from extended skin contact and lees stirring.
Name: Casey Flat Ranch 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Capay Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Light, fruity and clean, this was aged in all stainless steel, showing delicious tones of tangerine and lemon peel and a crisp, long finish, with a soft touch all around.
Name: Bell 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A full and creamy style of Sauvignon Blanc, this has a lot of dense almond and vanilla notes set against high tones of bright peach and flint. With its great, fresh acidity, it will hold up against an appetizer like goat cheese on crackers.
Name: Saracina 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This Sauvignon Blanc opens with beautiful flowery aromas. It's crisp and complex, bearing intense notes of grapefruit and mineral, with a kick of lime on the finish. This would go very well with seafood or spicy Thai.
Name: Shed Horn Cellars 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This is a large-production Sauvignon Blanc that tastes delicious. If you like grapefruit and pomelo flavors, you will love this enticingly priced white that's got razor sharp acidity, a touch of New Zealand-like grass and a long finish.
Name: Pomelo 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Sourced from both Mendocino and Lake counties, this is Casey Flat Ranch's accessible, affordable Sauvignon Blanc. Full of bright tropical fruit and lemon aromas, this is true to the varietal, with plenty of acidity to match well with food. An addition of 5% Viognier is blended in.
Name: Casey Flat Ranch 2011 Open Range Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This smells of lemon cream and pear, with dark, ripe and creamy layers of vanilla and fig, and a nuttiness, too. Stainless-steel fermented, it's a lovely example of how this variety thrives in Lake County.
Name: Rock Wall 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Working with a new vineyard source, Gregory Graham has made a sweetly perfumed white, with pretty grapefruit and lime notes. Its well-integrated and layered with flavor.
Name: Gregory Graham 2011 Windrem Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Full of fig and grapefruit flavor, this was never aged in oak. A small addition of Sémillon adds to its richness and long finish.
Name: Shooting Star 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: With lilting lemon, grapefruit and pretty pineapple aromas and flavors, this is a good example of Lake County Sauvignon Blanc. It's light and bright, and the flavors on the finish veer into equally pleasing peach and apricot notes, with a touch of almond.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2011 Asbill Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Balanced and affordable, this is an example of a straightforward, well-nourished Sauvignon Blanc, bursting with stone fruit and melon flavors, with Lake County's typical hints of lemongrass and pear—particularly on the finish.
Name: Vigilance 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Hills)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a tropical-fruit-oriented Sauvignon Blanc, with notes of yellow fruits and spices and a very floral character. With its textured nature, it could age for another year.
Name: Domaine Uby 2011 No. 1 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: There aren't many Argentine Sauvignon Blancs that make a statement, so this is commendable for showing a lightly citric and minerally nose in front of fresh, citrusy flavors of lime, tangerine and grapefruit. More friendly and easygoing than intense or pungent, it fades quick and easy on the finish.
Name: Pulenta 2011 VI Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Bright and fruity, this has an herbal character that's balanced by flavors of pineapple, red apple and a fine tang of refreshing citrus. Screwcap.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A straightforward Sauvignon Blanc, this has hints of cheese rind and lemon swirling within fistfuls of minerality that may need more time to settle down. But Occasio is a name to trust, and it should develop more flair with a bit of bottle age and/or air.
Name: Occasio 2011 Del Arroyo Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Here's a true Sauvignon Blanc with spunky green aromas and plenty of grapefruit. It feels citric and lemony on the tongue, with citrusy flavors of tangerine and lime. It finishes tight and zesty, like a good Sauvignon Blanc should.
Name: Monte Xanic 2011 Viña Kristel Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: With layers of nutty, toasty oak flavors lingering in the background, this is a Sauvignon Blanc with lushness to its core of melon, guava and grass notes.
Name: Wattle Creek 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: With no time spent in oak, this bright, simple Sauvignon Blanc has pear, grapefruit and gooseberry notes and a quick finish.
Name: Wildhurst 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a pure and herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc. Crisp, citrus driven and refreshing, it has a clean character and a delicious zesty texture that acidity to the fruitiness. Screwcap.
Name: François Lurton 2011 Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is refreshing, with herbaceous hints as well as a warm yellow-fruit character. It's ripe, full of youthful fruitiness and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Guy Saget 2011 La Petite Perrière Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Opening with a bouquet of dried apricot and almond paste, this is a full style of Sauvignon Blanc, with tons of lemon on the finish. Pair this with seafood.
Name: Clos du Lac 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a slightly sweet Sauvignon Blanc that's shy on the nose, without much depth or breadth.
Name: Robledo 2011 Seven Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this crisp white flirts dangerously with herb and grass tones—what is often called gooseberry—before settling down. It's quite drinkable, if a bit heavy on the finish.
Name: Chacewater 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Guenoc and Langtry, its parent company, have made some great Sauvignon Blancs in their time, showcasing Lake County's good fortune with this grape. This is a good effort, with a prevailing pineapple note.
Name: Guenoc 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Oyster shell and matchstick aromas come with distant peach and melon notes. Feels good but rudimentary, with peach and papaya flavors that end soft and easy. Drink this immediately for maximum zest and freshness.
Name: Árido 2011 Sustainably Farmed Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: A touch of minerality on the nose comes with apple and lemon aromas. It feels fleshy, with pulpy white-fruit flavors that end with honeydew and papaya notes. Drink now.
Name: Bodega Norton 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Overtly simple and drying, this has crisp acidity and oily flavors of popcorn and tart white fruits. It finishes with citrus and astringency. This would likely be better with seafood or salad than on its own.
Name: Paralelo 2011 Emblema Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: This 100% stainless-steel-aged Sauvignon Blanc has a crisp, herbal mouthfeel, with a melon-like brightness. Just a touch of green pepper and jalapeño muddle the finish.
Name: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Description: This smells a bit oily and like a match, with additional aromas of white fruits and corn flakes. It feels pulpy but just crisp enough, with pithy grapefruit and sweet papaya flavors. It tastes candied on the finish.
Name: Pascual Toso 2011 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Papaya, lime and peach aromas are basic but clean. The palate, too, feels basic and clean. Flavors of orange and citrus pith lead to a fleshy, sweet-tasting finish.
Name: Funky Llama 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: One of the top wines from Henri Bourgeois, this is rich and ageworthy. Its green and white fruits push through a concentrated structure to give a dense wine with ripeness and great elegance.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2010 Jadis  (Sancerre)

Description: The steep Monts Damnés Vineyard is one of the top sites in Sancerre. It has produced a wine that is both concentrated and aromatically fruity. It is stylish and full of acidity, with white fruits and tight structure. Ready for aging over several years.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2010 La Côtes des Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)

Description: An impressive blend from some of the top vineyards in Sancerre, this is a rounded, smooth, almost toasty wine. It has flavors of spice as well as green and citrus fruits. Full in the mouth and intense, age this for at least two years.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Exception  (Sancerre)

Description: The idea that Sauvignon Blanc cannot age is emphatically disproved by this impressive, mature wine. It is rich and concentrated, full of almonds, herbs and a great sense of length and ripeness. This is now perfectly ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2006 Le Grand Rochoy  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a ripe and full-bodied; it benefitted from the warm vintage, offering rich yellow-fruit flavors to go with its touches of toast and sweet herb. On the finish, acidity and minerality come forward to suggest its aging potential.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2009 Sancerre d'Antan  (Sancerre)

Description: A rich, yeasty wine, this is a ripe expression of Sauvignon Blanc, with balanced and concentrated mineral intensity and taut lemon and grapefruit flavors. There is a strong sense of structure and texture, and the wine needs to age at least two years.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Sauvage  (Sancerre)

Description: Old vines have produced a superconcentrated and ripe wine. It has notes of toast, spice and yellow fruit as well as bright acidity. With its structure, depth of flavor and density, it should age well over 3–4 years.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2009 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

Description: The flint and sand soil of this vineyard brings out the minerally, steely character of this taut, tight wine. While it is herbaceous and flavors of pineapple and white fruit, the structure dominates. Give this impressive wine another year or two.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2010 La Chapelle des Augustins  (Sancerre)

Description: The Romans made it to Sancerre, hence the name of this wine. The flavors are rich, with a mineral edge to the notes of green fruits, plums and greengages and a serious citrus core. With its structure, the wine needs to age for 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2010 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: The steep south-facing Chêne Marchand vineyard provides fruit for this very concentrated and impressive wine. Its weight doesn't come from richness, but rather a powerful structure that underpins a mineral tang and intense freshness.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Le Chêne Marchand  (Sancerre)

Description: Dominated by minerality, this is a flinty and steel textured wine. It has some richness while remaining straight and narrow. With its structured character, it will need to age for over several years.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2010 La Demoiselle de Bourgeois  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This Pouilly Fumé works well, balancing the ripe yellow and pineapple fruits with toast and spice notes to give a rounded, richly textured wine. It is now mature, while retaining a fruity character on the finish.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2007 La Grande Cuvée des Edvins  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A standout in this new vintage, Waterbrook's pure varietal bottling explodes into life with bright, spicy, pungent scents of recently mown lawn, herb, pine needle, citrus and melon. Fresh, clean, textural and persistent, it has a depth of flavor rarely found at this price.
Name: Waterbrook 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Redde's top wine, named after the winery, is rounded, rich and full in the mouth. Flavors of toast and ripe pear combine with tangy acidity, producing a complex, intensely fruity wine that should age for two years.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2010 La Moynerie  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: An impressive, ripe wine, this is packed with baked apple and grapefruit flavors, with a taut, mineral texture. It needs at least a year to round out.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Indigène  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is very smoky, with flavors of bacon as well as a yeasty character. The fruit has migrated into a taut texture, spiced with parsley and bay leaf. It's mature yet still zesty.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2007 Grand Fumé  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is a tropical-fruited wine, with mango and sweet peach notes showing the wine's richness. As a complement, there is the taut green-fruit acidity that's bright and fresh. The two together lend a rich, yet structured wine.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2010 Clos Paradis  (Sancerre)

Description: This is intensely minerally and very tight. It has a real steely character, with its acidity packed tight into the concentrated texture, making this dense wine likely to age over three years.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Clos du Roy  (Sancerre)

Description: Very pure—this has a straight line of acidity right to the wine's citrus- and pineapple-flavored heart. It is structured and taut, with its acidity dominant. It is concentrated and ready to age for 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2010 Les Chailloux  (Sancerre)

Description: Mineral and spice notes dominate this full-bodied wine. It is ripe and rich—the more mineral side balanced with yellow fruit and a touch of pepper. Age this rich wine for 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine Landrat-Guyollot 2009 Gemme de Feu  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Rounded and rich, this is an impressive wine. It has weight, with ripe yellow and white fruits to go with the intense acidity and citrus edge. The finish is crisp and taut. It's worth aging this wine for 2–3 years.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a richly ripe 2009 Pouilly Fumé. It steers right to the tropical fruit end of the spectrum while not losing sight of a more textured mineral character. It is rich and could age for 1–2 years and more.
Name: Château de Tracy 2009  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Moving toward the more tropical fruit spectrum of Sauvignon Blanc, this is round, with apricot and pineapple flavors. There is a fine streak of citrusy acidity that lifts the ripe fruit.
Name: Domaine Landrat-Guyollot 2010 La Rambarde  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: This is very aromatic, with minerality vying with fruit and tense acidity. This complex wine has an austere side, both rich and structured that will soften in a couple of years.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2010 Le Rochoy  (Sancerre)

Description: Moving toward the floral side of Sauvignon Blanc, this fruity, rounded wine has ripe acidity, a tangy citrus flavor and a full-bodied feel. It's set to age over several years.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2010 Les Duchesses  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: While the wine is round, full and rich, it also has a tense minerality that joins the acidity in cutting through the smoother structure. There is a clean, tight tang to the texture that offers a ripe aftertaste.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Les Terres Blanches  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Hailing from a separate domaine whose wines are bottled by Henri Bourgeois, this is a soft, fruity wine. It has attractive citrus and pear flavors—a combination that gives both crispness and a rounded texture. Age for a year.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2010 Domaine Gérard Fiou  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A textbook example of Washington Sauvignon Blanc, this is bright, racy, juicy and vibrant, with an array of crisp, clean fruit flavors. Citrus, grapefruit and pear are all in the mix, accented with notes of sweet grain from aging in new oak.
Name: Flying Dreams 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: An intensely herbal and ageworthy wine, this has tight acidity and a very fresh gooseberry character. With its intensity of flavor, it has something in common with New World Sauvignon Blanc—except this has terroir-driven minerality on the finish.
Name: Château de Tracy 2010  Pouilly-Fumé

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This well-made, pure Sauvignon Blanc seems to have a noticeable amount of residual sugar—not surprising in a high acid vintage such as 2011. Zesty, lightly grassy, spicy and stylish, it's fresh and rich on the palate, with a finishing streak of minerality.
Name: Jones of Washington 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Old vines on a single parcel provide the base of this fresh-faced wine. It has an attractive herbaceous and green-fruit character that's laced with a grapefruit note. This has exceptional depth of flavor, and the aftertaste is more steely and flinty.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

Description: While this is certainly crisp, it also has a rich, creamy undertow giving the green plum and herb flavors some warmth and ripeness. It's ready to drink, but could age a year or two.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2010 Les Tuilières  (Sancerre)

Description: This is an attractive wood-aged wine that puts spice and vanilla notes at the same level as the fruitiness. It retains an aromatic character, with hints of green fruit and citrus. Keep for another year.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2009 La Grande Châtelaine  (Sancerre)

Description: Flavors of yellow fruit, peach and apricot are given a light burst of acidity and sent on their way with a mineral texture. This wine is all fruit at first, but with the apple skin edge, it needs a year of bottle age.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2010 Les Chasseignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Tropical fruits and richly herbaceous flavors come together in this ripe, fruity wine. It has a citrus core along with a fine tang of orange zest and pineapple. Ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2010 Les Grands Groux  (Sancerre)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Luxurious on the nose and palate, this has loads of sweet, juicy peach, melon and white blossom. Dry in style, with notes of waxy lemon peel and a brisk oyster-shell minerality, this builds in elegance and complexity on the palate. Drink now.
Name: Shinn Estate 2011 First Fruit Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A rounded wine, this is full of ripe white fruits that are laced with a citrus note. It does have a herbal tang, although this is finely integrated into the finish's ripe final texture.
Name: Domaine Landrat-Guyollot 2009 Gemme Océan  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A well-made wine, with complex aromas of orange blossom, pea vine and lemon oil. Flavors are equally varied, buoyed by racy acidity, showing good concentration through the finish. The rapes were sourced from the Evergreen and Klipsun Vineyards.
Name: Sparkman 2010 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Attractive, fruity and round, this offers tangy acidity, fresh apple and citrus fruits and a full texture. It is floral and aromatic—a wine that will be ready to drink in the next year.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2011 En Travertin  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Soft and rounded, this is full of white fruits and a soft texture. It has a crisp citrus edge that gives a bite of acidity. On the finish, the tang is balanced by richness.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010  Pouilly-Fumé

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Pure refreshment from start to finish, this is gorgeously concentrated with sweet gooseberry and grapefruit flavor, yet it's nervy with acidity and a tonic sea breeze quality. Dry in style, this has a crisp cut-grass finish.
Name: Paumanok 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Taut, minerally and delicious, this could age but is refreshing and zingy now. It has fine depth of flavor—its herbal and grapefruit flavors are right up front.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2011 Les Belles Côtes  (Sancerre)

Description: Clean and herbaceous, this high-acid Sauvignon Blanc recalls an excellent Quincy for style and value. Sharp and grassy, clean and refreshing, it's a perfect shellfish wine.
Name: Washington Hills 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Description: A wine that is so herbaceous and crisply textured, this has intense grassy, herbal flavors of thyme and tarragon.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2010 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly grassy and pleasantly fruity, this mingles kiwi, melon and apple with notes of fresh herb. The flavors are fresh and balanced, with just a small percentage of the fruit fermented and (briefly) aged in new American oak.
Name: Mercer 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Taut, tangy and minerally, this has a steely texture to go with the intense green-herb and citrus notes. The wine has a green, crisp aftertaste, with acidity and a tight structure.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2011 Domaine des Mariniers  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: One of the small Sauvignon Blanc areas close to Sancerre, Menetou-Salon produces a light, crisp and herbal style of wine. This fits that bill well, its freshness contained within the flavors of hedgerow fruits and tangy acids.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2010 Côtes de Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This is a herbaceous wine with dominant green fruit, followed by acidity and fine flavors of sweet currant, kiwi and thyme. It is fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Fouassier 2010 Sur le Fort  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine that has pear and apricot flavors and a soft, warm feel. It's fruity, tangy and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2011 La Chatellenie  (Sancerre)

Description: This is a soft wine, with light green-plum and apple flavors, and an asparagus edge that comes through on the finish. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2011 Le Montarlet  (Sancerre)

Description: Varietally and regionally correct, with green, grassy, punchy aromas of citrus, white pepper and jalapeño. This is prickly in the mouth, with lively acidity and flavors of lime, scallion, green apple and bell pepper. It finishes with cut and juicy acids.
Name: Montes 2011 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The small appellation of Quincy, near Sancerre, produces soft, ripe Sauvignon Blanc. This has ripe acidity, with flavors of baked apple and pear and a fine citrus streak.
Name: Domaine Philippe Portier 2010 Cuvée des Victoires  (Quincy)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: More fragrant than herbaceous, this is a rounded, creamy wine. It has creamed pear, apricot and ripe lime flavors to go with the smooth texture and finish.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Attitude Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This is fresh, light and very crisp. Citrus fruits dominate the grassy, herbaceous texture. There is perfumed white-currant acidity on the finish.
Name: Michel Redde et Fils 2011 Petit Fumé  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Taut, mineral and also fruity, this expresses both the simple attraction of bright Sauvignon Blanc and its more structured, tangy character. Not for aging; enjoy this year.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2011 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

Description: While it does have a rounded texture, the dominant character here is a black currant and pink grapefruit herbaceousness. The wine has richness and good concentration along with tight acidity on the finish.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2010 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Pays de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a smooth, ripe fruited wine. It has refreshing pink-grapefruit and lime flavors bursting with crispness and surrounded by a creamy character. Screwcap.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2011 Destinéa Sauvignon Blanc (Pays de Loire)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Truly herbaceous and aromatic, this is a crisp, clean, easy-drinking wine, with a fresh, bright line of acidity. Ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2011 Le Bouquet Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Truly herbaceous and aromatic, this is a crisp, clean, easy-drinking wine, with a fresh, bright line of acidity. Ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2011 Le Bouquet Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A light, bright, herbaceous wine, this is the epitome of easy-drinking Sauvignon Blanc. Crisp apple and grapefruit flavors dominate the lemon zest texture. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2011 Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Pays de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Light and bright, this is full of crisp green-apple and citrus flavors, with an herbaceous edge. It's a summer wine, ready to drink now.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Pays de Loire)

Description: Notes of light grass, green melon rind and a touch of green pepper unfold in the bouquet, while the palate boasts more citrus-based flavors of lime and tart gooseberry. This is bright and lively, with a short, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Recanati 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Shomron)

Description: Taut and herbaceous, this has a refreshing line of perfumed pear and lime flavors. It's crisp, tangy and drinkable now with a clean, bright finish.
Name: Alpha Loire 2011 Domaine de la Croix Bouqure Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This has a light herbaceous character followed by notes of warm yellow fruit, kiwi and bright acidity. It's crisp, fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Château de Seguin 2010 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Standard white-fruit aromas mark the nose. The wine feels medium bodied, with pithy, soft grapefruit and nectarine flavors. It's textured but turns bitter on the finish.
Name: Cuevas del Sur 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This is sweaty and pungent on the nose. It feels O.K. in the mouth, with roundness offset by honest acids. On the palate, it tastes tropical and grassy, with vegetal notes sneaking in. The flavors turn toward canned beans and mealy fruit on the finish.
Name: Vistamar 2011 Sepia Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The melon and apple aromas are slightly dull but harmless. It feels decent, with orange and green-herb flavors. The finish is citric and green.
Name: Cremaschi Furlotti 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Loncomilla Valley)

Description: This is tropical on the nose, with light pear and banana aromas. It feels crisp and shearing, with mildly bitter flavors of citrus and scallion. Additional bitterness marks the finish.
Name: Arauco 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Simple white-fruit aromas of apple and pear are as good as it gets. Feels slightly wan, with apple and green-herb flavors, finishing a bit bland.
Name: V Norte 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Basic citrus and apple aromas lead to a round palate that won't stay fresh for much longer. It tastes melony and green, with lettuce flavors and a flat finish.
Name: Viña La Rosa 2011 La Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: This is nearly indistinguishable from Arauco's standard 82-point 2011 Sauvignon Blanc, smelling stalky, with zero pungency or varietal character. It shows lemony acids, but that's about all.
Name: Arauco 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Other than notes of white flowers and green herbs on the nose, this wine is all about canned peas and beans. The palate has texture and flesh, but the flavors are vegetal.
Name: Santa Ema 2011 Selected Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: This is oily and strained on the nose and fleshy in the mouth. It tastes herbal and quasi weedy, with a matchstick note on the finish.
Name: Viña el Aromo 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Complex on the nose and richly textured in the mouth, this wine delivers it all. Hints of struck flint and wild onion accent grapefruit aromas, while the flavors range easily from pink grapefruit and red currant to delicate herb shadings. It's full without being too full, with a potent yet refreshing finish that seemingly lingers forever.
Name: Dog Point 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: At first, this shows faint aromas of lemon, pear and orange zest before gaining steam and finishing with a dollop of balanced white peach. Light in alcohol, this fresh, floral, mineral-laced wine should pair with goat cheese or seafood—especially in summer.
Name: Andis 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Description: This bottling is a bit green and herbal while remaining plump and ripe in the mouth. The aromas are intense and vibrant, redolent of gooseberries and crushed tomato leaves, while the flavors are a beguiling mix of ripe tropical fruit, with an herbal edge that lingers on the finish.
Name: Saint Clair 2011 Pioneer Block 3 43 Degrees Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Saint Clair's flagship Sauvignon, the 2011 Wairau Reserve features layers of tropical fruit aromas and a slightly sweaty pungency—just enough to lift and accentuate the fruit. Flavors are a lively mix of ripe tropical and stone fruit, with nettles and other green herbaceous notes. The wine is medium to full bodied and richly textured on the palate while remaining zesty and refreshing.
Name: Saint Clair 2011 Wairau Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This Marlborough classic remains on form, artfully blending pineapple and crushed tomato leaf notes. If it's a bit leaner than some examples from the region, it's also more elegant and refined; less explosive and flamboyant, but tighter and more focused.
Name: Cloudy Bay 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Intensely passion fruity from start to finish, with accents of fresh herbs just adding a bit of complexity. This is a medium-bodied, creamy-textured Sauvignon Blanc that displays an admirable blend of ripe tropical fruit and just a hint of green.
Name: Saint Clair 2011 Pioneer Block 1 Foundation Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From a block in the lower part of the Wairau Valley, this is a pungently herbal expression of Sauvignon Blanc. Yet there's plenty of body and textural richness to offset and even complement the green tomato and tobacco notes, and a suggestion of briny minerality on the long finish.
Name: Saint Clair 2011 Pioneer Block 18 Snap Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From a challenging vintage, this wine matches the intensity of barrel-fermentation and aging with potent grapefruit notes. The mouthfeel is creamy and lush, while the flavors of oak spice and citrus linger easily on the finish. Fully mature; drink up.
Name: Dog Point 2008 Section 94 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Impressive for its bold tropical fruit flavors and subtle texture, this is a nicely proportioned Sauvignon Blanc that manages to combine richness with enough refreshing citrus to achieve balance. Drink now.
Name: Jawbone 2010 Reserve Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Former Cloudy Bay winemaker Kevin Judd's new label displays a vibrant pungency to its leafy aromas, then opens up on the palate to add gooseberry and grapefruit notes. It's refreshingly medium bodied, with a slightly creamy texture and a long finish filled with pink grapefruit.
Name: Greywacke 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Framingham is one of New Zealand's Riesling pioneers, but this shows the winery is serious about Sauvignon Blanc as well. There's a smoky, struck-flint character on the nose, then layers of citrusy fruit on the palate. It's medium bodied, with a long, grapefruity finish.
Name: Framingham 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: A crowd-pleasing Sauvignon Blanc from the heights of Yorkville, this full, creamy and fresh, teeming with acidity. Its combination of aromas and flavors of honeysuckle, pear and grapefruit are near impossible not to like. Pair this wine with Hog Island oysters.
Name: Bink 2010 Randle Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is bright and refreshing, filled with tart citrus flavors. Hints of fresh-cut grass, passion fruit and pineapple keep it interesting. Drink now.
Name: Lil Rippa 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Saint Clair produces some 86,000 cases of this solid Sauvignon Blanc. If it's not quite as rich, concentrated or flamboyant as its Pioneer Block bottlings, it still delivers authentic Marlborough Sauvignon character. Pineapple and tomato leaf notes are well balanced, while the wine is medium bodied and slightly creamy in the mouth.
Name: Saint Clair 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Lake County-Mendocino County, North Coast, California, US
Description: With organically grown grapes from both Lake County (58%) and Mendocino (42%), this showcases the best of both regions. It has a great mix of lemon, grapefruit, honeydew and kiwi freshness that remains balanced on the finish. It's a quaffable summer wine.
Name: Bonterra 2010 Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County-Mendocino County)

Description: Sadly, this is the last Patianna Sauvignon Blanc made by the late Mike Lee. It opens with great, subtle aromatics of just-ripe pear and melon and is balanced and easy to like. The finish is long and lean, with layers of acidity that would match well with scallops, shrimp or fresh oysters.
Name: Patianna 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This is a soft, ripely fruited Sauvignon Blanc, embued with hints of passion fruit and lime. It's plump and medium bodied, round on the palate, then tart and lingering on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Smythe & Renfield 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is only light to medium in body, but it has a tactile, peach-skin element that gives it extra interest on the palate and pleasant flinty notes alongside modest citrus fruit. Drink now.
Name: Starborough 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Relatively light bodied, this Sauvignon Blanc has pungent aromas of crushed tomato leaf and nettles. It's a green style from start to finish, capped off by lime-like acids.
Name: Giesen 2010 The Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Ripe and round in style, this large-production (almost 100,000 cases) Sauvignon Blanc may lack a bit of length, but otherwise offers a lush mouthful of stone and tropical fruit accented by modestly grassy notes.
Name: Saint Clair 2011 Vicar's Choice Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent scents of crushed tomato or nettle leaves enliven this lightweight wine. It's citrusy and pleasantly leafy on the palate, with a finish that turns slightly chalky.
Name: Oyster Bay 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This Hawkes Bay producer has turned out a plump, medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc sourced from Marlborough. Notes of orange and lime sherbet enliven the nose, while tropical fruit comes through on the palate. Clean and refreshing on the finish.
Name: Sileni 2011 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Starts well, with pineapple and gooseberry aromas, but it doesn't seem that intense or concentrated on the palate. This is a medium-bodied, slightly creamy-textured wine that's easy to drink.
Name: Konrad 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: An explosion of gooseberry comes first, followed by layers of creamy apricot fuzz and lemongrass, trailed by Lake County's typical acidity. This has balance and texture.
Name: Shannon Ridge 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Citrus and crushed stone notes start this wine off, followed by lemon sorbet on the palate. It's lightweight, a real summertime refresher, with a short, clean finish.
Name: Overstone 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A lightweight wine seemingly made for poolside sipping, with herbal-grassy tones accenting citrus notes. It's clean on the finish and as refreshing as a cool breeze.
Name: Zeal 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This Sauvignon Blanc smells of lemon, vanilla and pear. It's crisp and steely, with sourness on the finish.
Name: Parducci 2010 Small Lot Blend Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: An intense aroma of lemon peel marks the nose, with a note of apricot fuzz a musky overtone of flavor.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine, made from organic grapes, opens with a nose of steely lemon but it devolves quickly into lemony cough drop territory, with a sourness in taste.
Name: Green Truck 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: This has the typical character of Sauvignon Blanc and its purity of fruit. But it is the minerality, the sense of vineyard that sets it apart. This fruity, rich wine has a creamy texture that's worth aging for several years more.
Name: Manfred Tement 2010 Grassnitzberg Erste Lage Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: With its richness and complex wood and spice character, this is an ageworthy wine. It has weight and concentration, with a series of flavors that go deep into the powerful interior. Tropical fruit notes balance with the wine's herbal edge.
Name: Manfred Tement 2009 Zieregg Grosse Lage Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: SuLei's Tanya Woodley ferments her Sauvignon Blanc in stainless steel, then ages it in a mix of neutral oak and stainless steel barrels. In this new vintage some residual sugar (just under 1%) remains, to soften the otherwise-searing acidity. It works well, crafting a fleshy wine loaded with citrus and honeydew. The finish lingers and has plenty of lift.
Name: SuLei 2011 Spring Creek Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Intensely herbal, this is classic Sauvignon Blanc. It is packed with green fruit and herb flavors, with lively acidity. It is crisp, full bodied and fruity. Drink now.
Name: Manfred Tement 2011 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: Attractively herbaceous, this is full of green fruit and intense citrus, with a tangy texture. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2010 Rotenpüllen Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a ripe Sauvignon Blanc, with herb, yellow fruit and grapefruit aromas. Let this attractive, fruity wine age for another year. Screwcap.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This crisp white is inviting and dry, with aromas of citrus, fig and fennel. Reminiscent of a fine Sancerre, it's finely structured, steely and still lushly textured and full enough in the mouth to enjoy with seafood, a creamy goat cheese salad or entirely on its own.
Name: Easton 2010 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Strikingly pungent on first take, with crackling aromas of cactus, nettle, lime and grapefruit. Feels zesty, deep and layered, with an even mix of tropical fruit flavors, stone fruits and green notes. About as right as it gets for Chilean Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Matetic 2011 EQ Coastal Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Winemaker Denis Malbec has created a brilliantly delicious, crisp, dry yet richly textured version of the variety that opens with golden honey, dried apricot and lychee on the nose and mouth. Very minerally, the wine has a steely finish with smoky, oaky edges.
Name: Alienor 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: A perennial favorite due to its precise yet prickly nose of green melon, passion fruit, grapefruit and minerality. It's smooth yet cutting on the palate, with pithy lime, orange, passion fruit and lemon flavors. More refined than CDB's Gran Reserva, but generally speaking it's a similar wine.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2011 Pequeñas Producciones Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Veramonte's first high-end Ritual Sauvignon is a big success. The nose is mellow, refined and minerally as opposed to pungent and feline. The feel is fresh, clean as a razor, and easygoing, with lime, nectarine and passion fruit flavors. Long and lightly green on the classy finish.
Name: Veramonte 2011 Ritual Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Pungent and precise, with a textbook mix of green aromas, tropical fruits and lushness. Feels lively and juicy, with lime, lychee, green apple and pineapple flavors that settle on passion fruit come finishing time.
Name: Quintay 2011 Q Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Casas del Bosque makes some of the most pungent, expressive Sauvignon Blancs in Chile. This vintage fits the blueprint; it's forward, punchy and full of passion fruit, white grapefruit and tarragon on both the bouquet and palate. Shows mineral components, saline and scallion on the finish. A high-quality wine with a commensurate price tag.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2011 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Emphasizes intense passion fruit aromas that grow more pungent upon breathing. Feels tangy as it dances on the palate, with passion fruit, lemon-lime and tarragon flavors. Long and focused on the finish, with tons of zest.
Name: San Pedro 2011 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Light and fresh up front, with lychee, passion fruit and wet stone aromas. Feels good and balanced as if offers a nice mix of textured fruit and minerally acidity. Flavors of green melon, passion fruit, lime and green herbs come straight from central casting. Perfect for summer drinking.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2011 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: More neutral than fruity or pungent, with vivacity and minerality on the bouquet. Feels lifted, medium-bodied and citrusy, with lime, tarragon, wet stone and green apple flavors. Level and chiseled on the finish.
Name: Anakena 2011 Single Vineyard Plot: Anís Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Smells neither tropical nor citric as it falls somewhere in the middle of those two common denominators. Feels wet, fresh and minerally, with flavors of lime, green melon, sour apple, green herbs and mineral. Clean, well-cut and tight on the finish, with zesty length.
Name: Casa Silva 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Minearally and fresh on the nose, with hints of grass, lime and apple. Good and round in the mouth, with ample acidic punch and lively flavors of nopal, citrus and tarragon. Mellow and just zesty enough on the finish.
Name: Ventisquero 2011 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Pungent off the bat but not punchy, with pure citrus aromas. Feels fresh, with good acidity and overall balance framing layered flavors of lime, orange, grapefruit and lemon. Turns slightly pithy and green on the finish, but by then it has made its mark.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2011 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Neutral up front except for green apple and mineral aromas. Feels quite good and healthy, with juicy acids pushing fresh bell pepper, lime and white peach flavors. Short but fresh and citrusy on the finish.
Name: Chilcas 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Nice on the nose, with tropical aromas, ocean-based saline and mild green-fruit notes. Feels crisp and cleansing, with tangy flavors of lemon, green apple and underripe pineapple. Lime and green flavors of tarragon and grass drive the finish.
Name: Montes 2011 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Shy and clean on the nose, which offers up only mild grapefruit and lime. The feel is tight and stony, with pithy citrus and green apple flavors. Leans towards green and herbaceous on the finish, but never fully goes green while maintaining clarity and crispness.
Name: Veramonte 2011 La Gloria Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Round and grassy smelling, but turning more pungent and pointed with airing. Shows good grip and a slight spritz on the palate in front of grassy, green flavors of lime, bell pepper and tarragon. Pithy on the finish, where jalapeño and white-pepper notes rise up and take over.
Name: Matetic 2011 Corralillo Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Citrusy aromas of lemon, grapefruit and orange blend with grass and herbs. Feels tangy, crisp and correct, with lime, grapefruit and fresh green-bean flavors. Mellow on the finish, but as a whole it's quite good and honestly reflects the qualities of Chilean Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Viña Requingua 2011 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Fresh and salinic on the bouquet, with lime, grapefruit and melony aromas. Feels more tangy and citric than it smells, with tangerine, lemon-lime and grapefruit flavors. Fresh, lean and cut on the citrusy finish.
Name: Carmen 2011 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Pungent and punchy on the nose, with nettle, passion fruit and tangerine aromas. Zesty and well-cut in the mouth, with citrus, green herb, lime and bitter flavors of raw kale or collards. Finishes green, spunky and full.
Name: Viu Manent 2011 Secreto de Viu Manent Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Nice yet quiet on the opening, with lime, apple and minerally aromas. Feels tangy, maybe a touch sharp and pointed, with standard Casablanca flavors of lime, bell pepper and green apple. Short and tangy on the finish, with washing acidity.
Name: Quintay 2011 Clava Coastal Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Oceanic aromas of saline and grass mix with vanilla wafer and lime on the bouquet. Feels round and full for basic Sauvignon Blanc, with grapefruit and passion fruit flavors leading the way. Fleshy on the finish, with mild bitterness. Drink immediately to capture the wine's maximum freshness.
Name: Santa Carolina 2011 Leyda Estate Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Pungent but green up front, with a mix of citric and vegetal aromas that includes lime, peas and canned beans. Feels good and bright, with zesty acidity propelling passion fruit, grapefruit and bell pepper flavors. Finishes both green and crisp, with a blend of tropical and cool-climate character.
Name: Errazuriz 2011 Estate Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lava Cap Sauvignon Blanc is made from estate-grown grapes, then barrel ferments for a tropical, nutty, round version of the wine, with lots of creamy, tropical flavors. The finish shows off the wine's time in oak.
Name: Lava Cap 2010 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Description: Casablanca is the new source for this winery's Sauvignon Blanc, which smells prickly and spicy, with lychee and melon notes. Feels smooth, fleshy and round, with green flavors of lime and lychee offset by mild bitterness. Peppery on the finish.
Name: Echeverria 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: After sulfuric and match stick aromas muddle the nose, things turn for the better via prickly green-fruit scents. Feels wet and fleshy, with stalky, somewhat bitter flavors that offer mild notes of apple and peach. Melony on the finish, but there's still some bitterness and a stalky, oily character.
Name: Errazuriz 2011 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Creamy with ripe apricot and peach fuzz flavors, this Sauvignon Blanc has a wet stone quality to it as well, with an oak presence and lightly sweet finish.
Name: Page Mill Winery 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Yellow tinted, which announces that this wine was barrel aged. And that barrel character is huge on the nose, which smells of raw oak, vanilla and dried cheese. Feels creamy, but the acidity is lively as well. Shows flashes of brilliance but also fights to absorb all the wood that's been thrown at it. A quality wine but definitely not for everyone.
Name: O. Fournier 2009 Alfa Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Powdery smelling, with green melon and a lightness to the nose. Feels good, with adequate layering, balance and minerality. Nothing complicated about the flavors, but it's dealing nice notes of apple, lime and orange. Finishes dry, pithy, long and slightly bitter.
Name: Paso Grande 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Grassy, green aromas are suggestive of honeydew and lychee but also canned beans and peas. Feels round while showing medium intensity and lightly vegetal flavors of fresh asparagus mixed with bitter greens.
Name: Santa Ema 2011 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Light and reserved on the nose, with a hint of green apple and minerality but that's it. Feels citrusy and tangy, with lean, fresh flavors of lemon-lime and lettuce. Mild citric acidity keeps things lively on the finish.
Name: Viña La Fortuna 2011 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Reasonably accurate on the nose for Leyda Sauvignon Blanc, but also a little pickled smelling. Feels chunky and a little flat, with mild flavors of green apple and citrus. Finishes somewhat bitter, like walnut or almond skins, with a green-banana flavor.
Name: O. Fournier 2010 Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A middle-tier wine that's honest and good for the money. Smells of spunky citrus fruit and vanilla, then offers a tight, minerally palate with a mix of white peach, lemon and lime flavors. Crisp and quick on the finish, with a lemony aftertaste.
Name: Yali 2011 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Tarn, Southwest France, France
Description: Very herbaceous and green, this wine has intense aromas of grapefruit and white currant. Some softer flavors come from kiwi and bright green apples. Drink now.
Name: Domaine D'en Ségur 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes du Tarn)

Description: A mild Sauvignon Blanc, with white grapefruit, grass and mild asparagus aromas. Feels chunky and round, with soft acids creating sweet, green flavors of grapefruit and grass. Round on the finish, with a modest variety of flavor.
Name: Odfjell 2011 Babor Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Seems old due to mild vegetal aromas infiltrating the wine's core aromas of banana, vanilla and melon. Still zesty in feel despite 2011 being the current vintage; tastes of mature orange, grapefruit and pith, with lime on the finish. Drink now.
Name: San Elias 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Fleshy, soft and uncommitted on the bouquet, with sulfur aromas along with basic apple and pineapple. Feels wet but nothing more, with modest flavors of citrus and grass. Shy on the finish, with a spot of acidity.
Name: Viña La Rosa 2011 La Palma Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Smells vegetal, with aromas of canned peas and beans vying for attention with mature tropical fruit. Feels mealy despite decent acidity, while the flavor profile is from the garden, meaning it's mostly about asparagus and green beans.
Name: Viña Chocalan 2010 Selección Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: A strange wine that's not very aromatic beyond basic pear fruit and grass. Feels basic and tastes both green and oddly sweet, with a short, oily feeling finish that ends bitter. Tasted twice with similar findings.
Name: Amayna 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: An intense, flavorful rendition of Sauvignon Blanc, this is grapefruity from start to finish, balanced by slightly riper notes of pineapple and a custardy richness to the wine's texture. Pair it with bold fish dishes over the next 6–9 months.
Name: Plantagenet 2010 Omrah Sauvignon Blanc (Great Southern)

Description: A delicious Sauv Blanc from one of the coolest areas of South Africa, it takes a while for this wine to fully express itself. Green pepper and grass start on the nose, but then subside to allow green fig, lime rind and tart tropical fruit accents to unfold. Balanced and refreshing, with a fynbos herb note that remains through the long finish, almost like fresh hops.
Name: Lomond 2010 Pincushion Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Cape Agulhas)

Description: Lemon verbena and green grass aromas waft from the glass, with secondary notes of grapefruit and stone fruit to round it out. Vibrant acidity brightens this medium-weight mouth, with a touch of green plum-skin flavor and soft bitterness remaining through the lively finish.
Name: Morgenhof 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

Description: Tart and fresh, with lovely aromas of grass, green plum and asparagus. Glimmers of stony minerality flash on the palate, with lime pith and plum skin flavors driving through to the mouthwatering finish. Brisk and slightly pricky texture.
Name: Steenberg 2010 Private Cellar Series Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: There's a ripe orange-oil streak in the background of the bouquet, boosting rich aromas of tropical fruit and hay. The texture is full but framed by cleansing acidity and a tart, slightly pithy accent on the close.
Name: Constantia Glen 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: There's a detectible fynbos character to the herbal edge of this wine, mingling with the white peach and gooseberry fruit aromas and flavors. A clementine citrus edge remains through the long finish.
Name: Thelema 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This opens soft, even a bit flat, and should be served chilled for best showing. With some breathing time tropical fruit flavors come up, ripe and fleshy, with a butterscotch finish and a bit of heat. Best for near-term drinking.
Name: Upland Estates 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Snipes Mountain)

Description: Hay, green plum and gooseberry lead off on the nose, while ripe hints of passion fruit and pineapple acidity flood the mouth. Lifted, with good cut and freshness, and a mouthwatering close. Delicious now, but should hold together nicely for another couple of years.
Name: Southern Right 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This takes a page from California in its naming convention and style, which includes a good proportion of barrel-fermentation and oak maturation. Toast and vanilla frame melon and fig notes, and the midpalate is slightly creamy in texture before the wine turns crisp and lemony on the finish. Drink now.
Importer: Clos Du Val Wine/Goelet Wine Estates
Name: Taltarni 2009 Three Monks Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Coonawarra's not known for Sauvignon Blanc, but this is a very good example. It's medium in weight and dominated by citrus, but it also sneaks in some slightly tropical nuances before ending in a zesty, mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
Name: Katnook Estate 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Coonawarra)

Description: This could be straight out of New Zealand given its styling, which features pungent notes of crushed tomato leaf and gooseberries. It's light and refreshing, with a clean, crisp finish.
Name: Sidewood 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: With its distinctive herbaceous edge, the wine has a grapefruit-and-citrus character that offers a bright acidity. It has density and richness, fruity and forward.
Name: Jean-Marc Brocard 2010 Domaine Sainte Claire  (Saint-Bris)

Description: Solid and straightforward, this refreshing and vibrant Sauv Blanc is light and approachable, with aromas and flavors of lemon, sweet grass and pineapple core throughout. A crowd-pleasing selection for entertaining.
Name: Morgenhof 2010 Fantail Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: The relatively cool Adelaide Hills are making a name for their Sauvignon Blanc, and this example shows a restrained, grassy bouquet and flavors of grapefruit and tangerine. It's plump on the midpalate, then almost razor-sharp on the finish. Drink now.
Name: D'Arenberg 2010 The Broken Fishplate Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: This is a fresh, grapefruity wine, accented by fresh cut grass and green herbs. It's nicely proportioned and medium bodied, with a tart, slightly pithy edge to the finish. Drink now.
Name: James Oatley 2010 Tic Tok Sauvignon Blanc (Western Australia)

Description: A good value selection, with green notes of bell pepper, asparagus and lime on the nose and in the mouth. Lightweight, with good lift and a herbal character that lingers on the finish.
Name: Glen Erskine 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: Coldstream Hills is better known for its Chardonnays and Pinot Noirs than its Sauvignon Blanc, but this is a solid effort. It's medium in body, with simple grapefruit and pineapple flavors and a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Coldstream Hills 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Yarra Valley)

Description: A bit muted and shy on the nose, with faint accents of fresh grass, sweet citrus and just-ripe gooseberry. The palate offers a pithy-citrus flavor, adding a touch of bitterness to the clean close.
Name: Thelema 2010 Sutherland Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This rare Walla Walla-grown Sauvignon Blanc is superbly balanced, with rich, ripe, round, full-bodied fruit flavors anchored by defining acidity. From the Woodward Canyon estate vineyard, it conjures up a farmers' market of mixed stone fruits and melon, adding candied orange peel highlights to a lingering finish.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2010 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Sweet on the nose yet firm as a bristle brush, with lime and pineapple as the key aromas. Feels juicy, tight and light on the tongue, with fine acidity propelling nectarine, lime and melon flavors. Zesty, crisp and pure throughout. A serious value among white wines.
Name: Emiliana 2011 Novas Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This barrel-fermented SB opens with a rich vanilla nose and then gets delicately tropical without overdoing it. A very fine example of Lake County's ability to grow nicely mannered Sauvignon Blanc and Six Sigma's deftly achieved balancing act between crisp and creamy.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2010 Michael's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Opens with peach, bell pepper and mellow mineral notes. About as wet, fresh and zesty as they come, with passion fruit, pineapple and tangerine flavors. Lively, crisp, green and pithy on the finish. Pure liquid freshness from start to finish.
Name: Cono Sur 2011 Organically Grown Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Fresh, pointed and tropical up front, then nothing but wet and fun in the mouth, with snap pea, fresh bell pepper and lime flavors. Short, tight and ultrafresh on the finish, with a hint of pith and bitterness as it fades away. Really good value SB.
Name: Cono Sur 2011 Visión Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Stony, oceanic and minerally on the nose, with no shortage of pungent green aromas. Feels tight and juicy, with wiry acidity and zesty flavors of gooseberry, green vegetables and lime. Definitely a green, cool-climate wine, but one with lasting zest and juicy acidity.
Name: Emiliana 2011 Novas Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Six Sigma's workhorse Sauvignon Blanc is light and bright, like a lemon crisp enveloped by grapefruit and melon. It's fully stainless-steel fermented and ready for spring and summer.
Name: Six Sigma Ranch 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Crystal clear and easy to like. The nose is a mix of crisp, oceanic, green aromas tied to fresh tropical fruit and bitter nut oil. Zesty and pure on the palate, with tangerine and pink grapefruit flavors leading to a cleansing finish. Drink this year.
Name: Morandé 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and fruity, with a lip-smacking mix of green apples, citrus, grapefruit and melon. There is a peppery kick at the heart of the wine, moving past simple varietal herbaceousness into a livelier realm.
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Klipsun vineyard grapes are fermented in stainless steel to produce this crisp and refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. In 2010, a cool vintage even at this Red Mountain site, the grassy side of the grape is in the spotlight. A little sweatiness blows off with airing, then the lemongrass and light melon flavors come through, with plenty of acid backing.
Name: Stevens 2010 AnArtisticThought Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: About as typical and pleasant as you'll find in this price range. The nose is snappy, with aromas of fresh peas, bell pepper, citrus and wild herbs. Feels light and fresh, with flavors of lime and apple alongside tangerine.
Name: Ventisquero 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermentation was done in a mix of stainless steel and French oak, yielding a soft, accessible, lightly spiced wine. Flavors mix notes of fresh cut grass and celery with melony fruit.
Name: Preston 2009 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Solid and varietally correct, this brings citrus and melon fruit flavors in modest proportion to a simple, but balanced midpalate. It carries a hint of sugar in the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2010 H3 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: It's pretty easy pegging this for Chilean SB; the nose is full of grass, lettuce leaf and bell pepper along with citrus. Feels fresh and deep, with good cut and pointed flavors of green bean and lychee. Runs heavy on the bell pepper and capsicum.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Light on the nose, with a hint of apple and lime. Feels scouring, with sour-apple acidity and juicy but narrow flavors of white citrus and pineapple. Tangy but limited in flavor. Will work best as a palate-prepping or cleansing wash.
Name: Cornellana 2011 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Basic tropical aromas suggest apple and slight minerality. The feel is standard and melony, with sweet, chunky flavors of melon and green banana. Round and turning bitter on the finish, with a sugary sweetness and stalky notes.
Name: Lapostolle 2011 Casa Grand Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Lime pith, green plum and white clover aromas lead the nose of this Sauv Blanc, and the mouth offers similarly tart and tight flavors. The short finish favors white grapefruit accented by green grass.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2010 Yarden Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: Crisp and grassy on the nose, then lemony in the mouth, with narrow citrus and white peach flavors along with a hint of the veggies. Tangy, lean, slick and acidic in terms of feel, with a tight, lemony finish.
Name: Indomita 2011 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Contra Costa-grown SB, fermented entirely in stainless steel, has grassy and flinty aromas and flavors but could use a little more oomph in its middle.
Name: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Entropy only made 30 cases of this SB, sourced from the Blanches Vineyard in Livermore Valley. It's a tad thin, made in the grassy style of the variety.
Name: Entropy Cellars 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Dainty accents of sweet grass and white clover florals jazz up the otherwise straightforward profile of ripe gooseberry and green plum aromas and flavors. It's a lively and refreshing white, with a slightly prickly sensation in the mouth.
Name: Spice Route 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Darling)

Description: More tropical than herbaceous, this gooseberry- and pineapple-flavored wine is balanced and fresh. Its ripe character is concentrated all the way to the taut, fresh finish.
Name: Esterházy 2010 Estoras Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Brightly fresh and grassy Sauvignon Blanc that comes from south-west France. It is crisp with citrus and green plum fruit flavors, the acidity mouthwateringly refreshing. Screwcap.
Name: François Lurton 2010 Terra Sana Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Green gooseberry, underripe mango and pineapple core notes abound on the nose and continue on into the palate of this easy-drinking white. The mouth is a bit rounder than expected, but brilliant acidity keeps things balanced and lifts the close. Drink now.
Name: La Capra Presented by Fairview 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: A soft but pretty wine, with notes of yellow florals, orange supremes, sweet grass and a touch of peony. It's balanced and lifted with a good acidic cut to the palate, leading through to a mouthwatering finish laced with white strawberry flavors.
Name: Robertson Winery 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: From selected vineyards, this is a rich, tropical fruit-flavored wine. It has peach and ripe plum fruits laced with citrus. Smooth and fruity. Drink now.
Name: François Lurton 2010 Fumées Blanches Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This fresh Sauvignon Blanc offers an easy drink with bright notes of juicy citrus, white cranberry and tart green plum. Lightweight and zippy with a short but clean close. Drink now.
Name: La Motte 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Citrusy in style, with aromas of orange, passion fruit and grapefruit. Feels flush and full-bodied, with basic tangerine and navel orange flavors. Fresh on the finish but hollow in terms of depth, with a light fade.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2011 Dedicación Personal Sauvignon Blanc

Description: This light and approachable wine boasts easy notes of green apple, melon rind and a touch of hay. The mouth shows more citrus dominance, with a brisk lemon-lime character staying through the finish. Drink now.
Name: Two Oceans 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
