Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Floral, fruity wine, very herbaceous in a New Zealand intense style. Grapefruit and melon give the wine great freshness. It's ready to drink.
Name: François Lurton 2010 Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: An easy-pleasing and refreshing wine with ripe aromas of pineapple and guava alongside a citrus-infused grassy note, almost like fresh hops. Lightweight in the mouth with a brisk finish reminiscent of fleshy green apple slices.
Name: Partnership Vineyards 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: A grapefruit pith note dominates the finish, taking away from the more traditional refreshing lift that one might expect from Sauv Blanc. But the rest is gorgeous and inviting, with notes of white peach, hard gooseberry and white cranberry throughout.
Name: Mulderbosch 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Green plum, tart gooseberry and lime rind aromas are accented with a touch of feline essence on the nose. Flavors of guava and banana unfold in the riper mouth, but the wine closes clean and zippy. Drink now.
Name: Ernst Gouws & Co. 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: A bit muted and easy-drinking with soft notes of tart green apple and lemon peel throughout. It's brisk and prickly on the tongue with a fleeting finish; drink up.
Name: Bon Cap 2011 The Ruins Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Description: A distinct green streak shines throughout this wine, with aromas of green bean and plantain and flavors of grass and pepper. Light weight but a bit round in the mouth, with a medium-length finish.
Name: Helderberg Wijnmakerij 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: With matchstick, pith and sulfur in addition to standard melon, apple and peach aromas, the start is rough. In the mouth, it's gritty and oily feeling, with citrus and apple flavors. Then bitterness and pith come into play on the finish.
Name: Nice 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is just the third Sauvignon Blanc from Stevens (none was made in 2008), sourced from Klipsun vineyard and stainless steel fermented. Richly textural, with a creamy minerality, this has a pleasing intensity, a sort of nervosity (as the French might put it), limned with a sweet grain character. The fruits are tart and racy, a mix of citrus rind and pulp, tangerine and pineapple, finished with natural acidity.
Name: Stevens 2009 AfterThought Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Ripe, fruity, full flavored wine. It shows its wood aging in the toasty character that lies over the herbaceous fruit. Rounded, smooth with a burst of citrus. Drink next year, but also age.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Powerful but well cut and elegant. The nose is hardly bashful and hits with a mix of fresh greens, bright citrus and minerality. Healthy in the mouth, with blazing acidity, grapefruit and lasting green notes. The epitome of a zesty white wine.
Name: Peñalolen 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Very much on the ripe, tropical side of Sauvignon Blanc, this is rich and concentrated. There are citrus and toast along with the spice and pineapple. Textured, it is still young and will age.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2010 Elegance  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: A glass of pretty aromatics, grapefruit and orange blossom mostly, with a range of depth and texture that speaks of serious wine. Made from organic grapes.
Name: Yorkville Cellars 2010 Randle Hill Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: With its rich texture from aging on the lees, this is a Sauvignon Blanc that goes more to the tropical and pineapple fruit direction. It has refreshing acidity along with weight and concentration. The lemon acidity kicks in in the aftertaste.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Chunky aromas of apple and citrus are regular and mellow. Has a more fleshy feel than many Chilean SBs, with apple and grapefruit flavors in front of a round, pithy, mildly bitter finish. Just juicy enough; contains 15% Carmenère for added body.
Name: oops 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A dry, slightly washed-out Sauvignon Blanc, with varietally correct flavors of apple and herb. Thins out quickly, but a decent quaffer at this price.
Name: Hogue 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Airy smelling, with citrus and grass aromas brewing underneath. Has a wet, simple, refreshing feel and rather intense flavors of lime, tangerine and other citrus fruits. Cuts a direct path.
Name: William Cole 2011 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Green and snappy smelling, with scallion, lime and jalapeño aromas. Feels an awful lot like soda, with spritz and citric acid. Tastes 100% citric, like orange juice and pithy lime and grapefruit. Could use more body and support.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2011 Los Vascos Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A soft wine, with some herbal, pear and kiwi flavors. It has just an edge of sweetness that gives it a soft aftertaste. For drinking now.
Name: Jean-Michel Cazes 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There is considerable power to this wine, its rich, smooth texture offering pear and peach fruits as well as a more typical herbal character. An impressive and concentrated wine, with a powerfully intense finish.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Full, rich wine, with a concentrated structure to go with the pineapple and apple juice flavors. Still young, the wine should age for a year, to fill out the structure and give final richness.
Name: Guy Saget 2010 Le Domaine  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel, then aged in a mix of neutral oak and stainless steel barrels, this single-vineyard, 100% varietal Sauvignon Blanc is racy and bone dry, a true Loire Valley style. Classic varietal flavors of gooseberry, lemon/lime and slate, with a bit of spritz to liven it up.
Name: SuLei 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: John Kinney is doing great things with Livermore Valley fruit, most especially with many of his whites, including this classically oaked Fumé Blanc, the grapes barrel-fermented in 100% French oak (Seguin Moreau and Taransaud) and left sur lie for six months, Montrachet style. Creamy but bright with aromatics of caramel and vanilla, but only 50 cases were made.
Name: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Intense, concentrated wine with herbaceous flavors allied to gooseberry, pink grapefruit and a steely edge of acidity. With its powerful fruits, it is worth aging for a few months.
Name: Michel Vattan 2010  Sancerre

Description: A more rounded, full-bodied style of Sancerre, pushing aromatic fruits, kiwi and grapefruit along with its intense acidity. There is a mineral edge, coming from the chalk soil of Sancerre. Age for a few months.
Name: Guy Saget 2010 Domaine de la Perrière  (Sancerre)

Description: A fine expression of mineral Sauvignon Blanc, very textured with green herb and fruit skins giving a tense shape to a wine that could age. It's finely balanced, the refreshing acidity cutting right through the wine.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2010 Les Belles Côtes  (Sancerre)

Description: Given that Argentina is hardly SB country, this wine sticks out for its clarity, minerality and freshness. The nose offers lean lime and other citrus aromas. That's followed by a juicy palate with lime, passion fruit and tangerine flavors. Tropical but also citric, with cutting acidity.
Name: O. Fournier 2010 B Crux Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Castle White is a fresh and well-made Sauvignon Blanc, with just a splash (2%) of Sémillon in the blend. Crisp and grassy, in a mouth-pleasing, true-to-varietal style.
Name: Le Chateau 2010 Castle White Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Piercing aromas announce that this is no basic quaffer. The palate shows blazing acids that narrow everything down to citrus, lemon, underripe pineapple and Granny Smith apple flavors. While almost sour, it's not, with briney green fruit on a long, scouring finish.
Name: Undurraga 2010 T.H. Lo Abarca Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Almost indistinguishable from its companion Horse Heaven Vineyard bottling, the Columbia Valley Sauvignon Blanc also clocks in at a modest 12.5% alcohol. It offers light, succinct, pure varietal flavors, on the cool side with green apple, peavine, and a bracing minerality.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Rounded while still fresh, this is a full-bodied Sancerre, the Sauvignon Blanc herbal flavors given more character with touches of green apple, bold lime and grapefruit. Ready to drink over the next several months.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2010 Domaine Chatelain French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A return to pure, single vineyard Sauvignon Blanc. With alcohol at 12.5% this dry wine is quite European in style. Elegant, lively and fresh, with a cool mix of cucumber, melon and green apple fruit flavors.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From organically grown, estate vineyard grapes, this light, subtle wine has a strong acid underpinning. Citrus fruits and a suggestion of fresh pear are streaked with vanilla wafer.
Name: Gordon Brothers 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Light and clean up front, with green apple, melon, lime and minerally aromas. Crisp and balanced in the mouth, with driving citric acids propelling a mixture of scallion, lime, apple and green herb flavors. Tangy late, with lime and tangerine flavors working the finish.
Name: Oveja Negra 2011 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: McFadden's SB is a fine, easy drinker, light in weight and feel, like a lemon custard in summer. Have it with fish or chicken and be happy.
Name: McFadden 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)

Description: Briney and oceanic on the nose, but not vegetal as lime and green melon aromas take control. Citrusy, juicy and fresh in the mouth, with passion fruit, citrus, mango and pineapple flavors. This is pure coastal Chilean SB, and it finishes grassy and green, with lasting tang.
Name: Viña Leyda 2011 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: The tech sheet for this wine nicely mentions how the vineyard is surrounded by both 100-year-old walnut trees and, what do you know?, marijuana. Does either influence the wine? It does show a muskiness but really its strengths are steely drops of extreme lemon, most decidedly on the long, exuberant finish.
Name: Rock Wall 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: A little closed still, Simaine's SB is very lemony with good balance of acidity though the finish veers sour. From organic, dry-farmed grapes.
Name: Simaine Cellars 2010 Larry Venturi Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: A mineral touch graces the bouquet, which is otherwise regular and salinic, with a touch of sweet animal cracker. Medium in weight, with citrusy acidity, pithy grapefruit and lime flavors. Tangy but calm on the finish, with a final dose of citrus pith.
Name: François Lurton 2011 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: A fruity wine, full of grapefruit, lime and melon flavors, cut with passion fruit acidity. The wine has a light texture with a zesty edge, clean and totally ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Villebois 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Light and generally clean smelling, with standard green apple, melon and lime aromas. Feels a touch flat and pithy for Casablanca, with generic citrus and mild bitterness for flavors. Pithy and just juicy enough on the finish.
Name: Chilensis 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Clean, citric and precise on the nose, then exceedingly lean and pointy in the mouth, where uncompromised flavors of mineral, lime and orange peel set up a chalky, crisp finish. Mouthwatering and cleansing.
Name: Maipe 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Fresh but simple smelling, and generally neutral save for mild apple and lime aromas. Healthy in the mouth, with white grapefruit and nectarine flavors. Pithy and a bit grassy on the finish, which is apropos for coastal Leyda.
Name: Siegel 2011 Crucero Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Sweet aromas of sugar cookie come with a pinch of citrus fruit. The mouth is plump, with just enough citric acidity to keep it together. Flavors of pineapple, lemon, tangerine and grapefruit peel lead to a pithy, slightly bitter finish. Drink immediately; it's starting to fade.
Name: Vintage Sun 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Neutral smelling except for a bit of lime, grass and mineral. Feels juicy and citric in the mouth, with pithy flavors of lime, orange and green grass. Finishes slightly bitter and pithy, but fresh and tangy.
Name: Familia Cassone 2011 La Florencia Sauvignon Blanc (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Full in the face Sauvignon Blanc, with a cough drop bite, tense with acidity. It has ripe green fruits and lime zest. Drink now.
Name: Bougrier 2010 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Lightweight, very herbal Sauvignon Blanc, full of green fruits, lemon zest and refreshing acidity. Ready to drink, it finishes as fresh as can be. Screwcap.
Name: Guy Saget 2010 La Petite Perrière Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: A touch green and vegetal on the nose, with hints of canned peas and bell pepper. Fortunately there's enough lime and minerality to keep it fresh. Feels crisp, tight and wet, with green notes pervading core citrus flavors. Finishes pithy and zesty, with mild bitterness.
Name: Botalcura 2011 El Delirio Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Dominated by green-fruit aromas and also green veggies, for example bell pepper and asparagus. The body is pretty good and the acid level keeps it kicking, while the flavors run toward vegetal, just like the bouquet. Finishes with a final dose of green beans and capsicum. Seems to be fading.
Name: Cono Sur 2009 Grapes Organically Grown Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Yes, it's a good price, but this SB from Mendocino has loads of green pepper and peach fuzz that overpower its otherwise varietally familiar acidity and texture.
Name: Castle Rock 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Green and vegetal in aromas and flavors. The nose deals pea, green bean and asparagus tempered by lime and melon. The palate has weight and a mix of green, grassy flavors as well as apple, lime and pineapple. A jalapeño-like burn is prominent on the finish. Definitely a cool-climate SB.
Name: Anakena 2010 Indo Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Simple, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc, straight down the line of citrus acidity and light spice. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Bougrier 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: From young vines, this is a very tangy, citrus-driven wine, full of lemon zest with a strong herb and barnyard character. Acidity is intense. Screwcap.
Name: Villebois 2010 Petit Villebois Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Description: Largely neutral from front to back, with citrus and apple on the nose. Easygoing and basic in the mouth, with green melon and apple flavors in front of an inoffensive, slightly bitter and pithy finish.
Name: San Elias 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Opens with can't-miss aromas of asparagus, canned beans and other coastal overtones that scream “cold climate.” Feels full and chunky, with a modest spine and vegetal flavors of asparagus, bell pepper and green banana. Grassy and green on the finish.
Name: Anakena 2011 Indo Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Was probably better a year or two ago; now it's losing steam and smelling and tasting oily and pithy. Aromas of almond skins denote old age, and while there's still vital acidity and leftover citrus flavors, it's fast approaching its deadline. Best to wait for the 2010, or even the 2011.
Name: Zorzal 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Neutral smelling, with mild apple and briney aromas. Feels heavy, flat and on the thick side, with average flavors of melon but little to no citrus or smack. Melony, soft and bitter on the finish.
Name: Siegel 2011 Crucero Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Muddled aromas break up with airing and fade from citrus and grass to vegetal and a bit dirty. The palate has gaps in it, while the flavors are a sketchy mix of bland citrus and mealy apple. Acceptable but not convincing.
Name: Maniña 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Pungent and pretty right off the bat, with tangerine and apricot aromas. The viscosity and texture are excellent, while the concentrated flavor profile vacillates between sweet honey and cinnamon and fruity orange. Wonderfully ripe, elegant and pure; drink now through 2013.
Name: Morandé 2007 Edición Limitada Golden Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Clean and very fresh, with an ideal mix of grass, green citrus and nothing too overpowering on the nose. The palate is zesty and tasty, with lemon-lime flavors, chive and elegance. Definitely a top performer and a good value; only 430 cases made.
Name: Kingston Family 2010 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: La Playa knows what it's doing here. This wine is consistently on the money. It delivers clean, straightforward peach and citrus aromas on top of a crisp, linear palate with texture and creaminess along with orange, tangerine and brown sugar flavors. Honeyed and citrusy on the finish.
Name: La Playa 2009 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Initially it offers up vegetal notes, but later the nose settles on bell pepper, green melon and lime aromas. The palate is fine and linear, with a slight creaminess and good acidity. Flavors of citrus, green herbs and grass lead to a lightly herbal finish.
Name: Quintay 2010 Q Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Lively and tangy, but refreshing as it captures the new Chilean style of racy Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is spritzy, with lime, orange peel and tart apple flavors. Cleansing on the finish. Good value and purity for the money.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2011 BrisAndes Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Grassy, this opens into pineapple and lemongrass flavors as well as lemon. It's got elysium (code for cat pee), too, but its racing minerality is worth seeking out, the wine simple, clean and balanced.
Name: Guenoc 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: A consistent wine based on the previous vintage, with nice melon, grass and tropical aromas. The palate runs quick and crisp, with tangy citrus flavors, particularly orange, lime and pineapple. Finishes tropical and healthy, with a hint of pine needle.
Name: Bodega Renacer 2010 Punto Final Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Green and spunky on the nose, with light citrus aromas and nothing forced, sour or funky. The palate is full and a little creamy, with just enough acidic kick. Tastes of green melon, lime and banana. Lasting acidity provides pulse to the finish.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2010 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Crisp green aromas suggest lime and then passion fruit. It's lively and spritzy in the mouth, with high acidity yielding green flavors that transition to pithy and heavy. Lemon-lime mixed with celery notes come up on the finish.
Name: Matetic 2010 EQ Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Minerality and passion fruit aromas control the bouquet. The palate is fresh and zesty, with grapefruit, lime and green apple flavors. Holds its form and tightness on the finish, staying juicy and fresh from front to back.
Name: Root:1 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Comes out feisty, with sassy green fruit aromas, tropical offsets and minerality. It's sheer and driving in the mouth, with sour apple, lemon and green bean flavors. Finishes pointed and pithy, with a lasting cool green character. Captures the essence of coastal SB.
Name: Casa Silva 2011 Cool Coast Paredones Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A new label for Cowhorn, this is sourced from organically grown grapes and fermented with wild yeasts. Despite the relatively high alcohol, this is made in a cool-climate style, with crisp apple fruit and suggestions of celery and white pepper.
Name: Sullivan Steele 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: More peachy and melony than sharp, with simple, lightly prickly aromas, honeyed peach and passion fruit flavors, and a round, soft finish. A solid, round quaffer that doesn't sizzle but won't disappoint.
Name: Concha y Toro 2010 Casillero del Diablo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This great-value SB from Lake County hits it out of the park on all sorts of fronts, including price. It's got subtle aromatics of pear and lemon, and is a little generic and simple, but at $10 it's so perfectly drinkable who cares? All in a colorful package. Best Buy.
Name: Line 39 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: For simple SB, this is a good value with legitimate aromas of lime, green apple and mineral. The palate has a round feel along with good acids, so the flavors of lemon, tangerine and melon are lifted and fresh. About as honest as you'll get in under-$10 Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Concha y Toro 2010 Xplorador Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: A straightforward example of Chilean SB, meaning there's citrus and mineral on the nose, juicy acidity and lime, grapefruit and tangerine flavors. It's clean and solid, with slight pithiness. Delivers a lot for $9; drink now.
Name: Tololo 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Citrus aromas are familiar. Lively and zesty in the mouth, with refreshing acidity. Orange and passion fruit lead the palate, which transitions to grapefruit. Crisp on the finish. Good for an everyday white wine.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2010 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Ordinary but well made. The nose is snappy and shows lime scents, while the palate is tight and crisp, with dryness, green melon, citrus and pithy notes. Doesn't run that long on the finish, but for a quaffer you can't go wrong. Drink now.
Name: Echeverria 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Dry apple aromas are about as much as the nose offers. The palate has a simple feel and flavors of spiced applesauce and citrus fruits. Short and not very viscous or rich on the finish.
Name: Chilcas 2010 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: A little rough and oily on the nose, with citrus and green notes. The palate is soft and melony in feel, with banana, papaya and other tropical flavors. Sweet and melony on the finish; won't last for very long.
Name: Santa Carolina 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Starts out varietally correct, with zest in the mouth and citrusy, green aromas. Time doesn't really help it along; the lime and grapefruity crispness is surface-level. Turns more pithy and less focused as it airs out. Drink immediately before it fades.
Name: Sundance 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Very sharp and acidic, with a powerfully grassy core. It might be thought of as Loire valley-style Sauvignon Blanc, but without the minerality. Herb and lemon rind flavors dominate.
Name: Reustle 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Green bean and lettuce aromas run the tight, green nose straight into a lip-smacking, acidic palate with tart apple and green citrus flavors, i.e. lime. Crisp and acidic on the finish, with a minerally feel.
Name: Viña Tabalí 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Smells a bit sweaty and oily, with the variety's feline and funky aromas on display. The palate runs flat, with bitter green fruit flavors and a vegetal leaning.
Name: Sundance 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Salinic and simple on the bouquet. The palate is narrow and citric, with lean, sour tangerine, lemon and lettuce-like flavors. Tangy and lemony on the finish as well.
Name: Terrapura 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Less adequate than in the past. The wine lacks aromatic zest and pungency before showing tart apple and ultimately vegetal flavors. Canned pea notes are prevalent.
Name: Santa Rita 2010 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A cat-pee, grassy Sauvignon Blanc that's a little long in the tooth.
Name: Cedar Mountain 2008 Blanche's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a gorgeous wine, so good in fact it makes one wonder why Sauv Blanc hasn't yet become a superstar grape for Washington. Lush tree fruits, preserved lemon, Satsuma orange and highlights of honeysuckle and citrus oil keep the wine moving and changing. It simply fills the mouth with luscious flavor.
Name: Barrister 2010 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Minerality, hints of earthy loam and a whiff of barnyard augment this nicely-nuanced wine. Complex, crisp and lingering, it's balanced and threaded with mixed citrus, green apple and some grape skin flavors.
Name: Apex Ascent 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A generous mix of lime, rock, pineapple, vanilla wafer and still more detailed notes that suggest orange, papaya and lemon verbena. Still young and a bit hard; this fine value should be cellarable for up to five years.
Name: Novelty Hill 2009 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A delightful expression of the grape, cleverly mixing 80% stainless with 20% French oak fermentation, and bringing out the best of both. Juicy and refreshing, with a tangy fruit core of citrus, grapefruit and pineapple flavors. It's lively and acidic without being at all sour, and a pleasing, lightly toasty roundness fills out the finish.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromatically inviting, with a lovely mix of sweet grass and light, fresh sugar pea scents. Tart, spicy passionfruit, grapefruit and starfruit flavors contribute to a lovely bottle of Sauvignon Blanc, with plenty of acidity that does not turn at all sour.
Name: Washington Hills 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Description: The brisk finish lifts the round mouthfeel of this ripe Sauv Blanc, as flavors of ripe gooseberry and green fig are perfectly poised against a backdrop of sweet grass and a touch of chamomile. Refreshing and satisfying all at once; drink now and through 2012.
Name: Rustenberg 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: On the tropical side of Sauvignon Blanc, the wine is packed with great acidity, and a fresh, creamy texture. It's as clean as a whistle, a delight to drink.
Name: Fiuza 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pretty, fruity and round, with good varietal character and fruit flavors running from tree fruits to tropical. There is also a palate-pleasing, spun sugar highlight, suggesting a trace of residual sugar has been left in the wine.
Name: Waterbrook 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A great, inexpensive example of Lake County's prowess at Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is marked by grapefruit and kiwi throughout and a creamy opulence that should appeal to a wide range of palates and plates.
Name: Cartlidge & Browne 2009 Dancing Crow Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A terrific deal in Mendocino Sauvignon Blanc, subdued in the nose at first, this wine opens up into easy-drinking vanilla and lemon flavors, its stainless-steel fermentation keeping it refreshing and light and a go-to apéritif; its depth keeps it fresh and bright over time. An ideal SB to go with a light dinner.
Name: Parducci 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Green apple and white watermelon rind lead the way on this Sauv Blanc, as flavors of green fig and bright citrus liven up the medium-weight mouth. Balanced and very drinkable; enjoy now.
Name: Porcupine Ridge 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 83% Sauvignon Blanc and 17% Sémillon, sourced from vineyards located on Red Mountain and in the Columbia Basin. A mix of sweet herb, lemongrass and citrus scents and flavors, this is a crisp, stylish and smooth-drinking white.
Name: Three Rivers 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Ripe tropical notes of kiwi and firm guava are lifted with accents of dried white florals and lemon rind citrus. The racy mouth finishes with a grapefruit-infused finish that shines bright. Drink now.
Name: Ken Forrester 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Rich and complex, this Sauv Blanc shows more depth and weight on the nose and mouth than most would anticipate, but the finish cleans it all up with an endless mouthwatering sensation. Fresh green grass, orange, green fig and apple flesh out the palate.
Name: Nabygelegen 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Wellington)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Smelling sweet of candied orange and jasmine, this majority SB with about a quarter Sémillion blended in has pleasing flavors and textures and is crisp, a nice effort from the husband and wife winemaking team at this longstanding Sierra Foothills stalwart.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Vegetal notes of asparagus mingle with accents of chalk and sweet grass on the nose, while ruby grapefruit and underripe mango flavors burst in the mouth. Vibrant and clean; drink now.
Name: Plaisir De Merle 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A zippy Sierra Foothills SB with pleasing grapefruit and a coating of minerals, this wine has length and lift.
Name: C.G. di Arie 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Light and easy with a great lift to the green plum, hard guava and banana notes. Lively but not overly zippy or mouth-puckering on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Riebeek Cellars 2010 Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Swartland)

Description: Green grass and a hint of baby powder are paired with notes of green gooseberry and lime on the nose, while riper but similarly tart flavors of white cranberry and citrus take hold of the mouthwatering palate. Drink now.
Name: Eikendal 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Round, floral and sweet smelling, with citrusy acidity that pushes up passion fruit, orange and lemon flavors. There's weight and body come finishing time, and the overall impression is that of a tropical, dense white wine with some creaminess. Priced high for what you get.
Name: Michel Torino 2010 Ciclos Fume Sauvignon Blanc (Salta)

Description: Fresh grass, green plum and lime rind notes characterize this easygoing white. There's a lifting prickly sensation to the palate followed by a short but cleansing finish.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2010 Bergkelder Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A perfectly simple, stainless-steel fermented Lake County SB with tangy lemon and lime notes, subtle at first. The finish falls off fast.
Name: Stephen Vincent 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Citrus and peach aromas are basic but clean. The palate starts out fresh and easy before losing some steam, but along the way there's peach, green apple and dry melon flavors. Good for a simple, tropical-style white wine.
Name: Salentein 2010 Portillo Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: This Sauv Blanc could use a bit more lift to the lightweight but round mouth, but overall it's clean and easy-drinking with notes of lime pith, gooseberry and dried grass notes. Drink now.
Name: Durbanville Hills 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: Neutral on the nose, with a touch of white fruit essence peeking through. The palate is easygoing and slightly lemony, with lemon-lime flavors and tropical overtones. Finishes sweet and bland.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Smells murky and sweaty, with corn and wheat aromas in addition to strained citrus. The palate is chunky, with acrid flavors that underwhelm. Finishes sulphuric, green and weedy.
Name: Pulenta 2010 VI Sauvignon Blanc (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fragrant with a mix of sweet grass and dusty blossom, this pleasant Sauvignon Blanc makes you wonder why the grape is so rare in Oregon. Here in the Umpqua Valley it finds a sweet spot, fresh and varietal, round and tart, with the added complexity of the flowery aromatics.
Name: Melrose 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Pleasantly fruity with sweet pears, peaches and apple aromas. There's a lovely floral quality on both the nose and palate of this North Fork Sauvignon Blanc, but the watery palate is lacking in concentration.
Name: Pindar Vineyards 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Savory on the nose and palate with subdued notes of apples and nuts. The vibrant acidity is refreshing, but overall a bit lacking in concentration and depth.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A Sierra Foothills Sauvignon Blanc with incredibly inviting aromatics of grass, grapefruit and melon that evolves into a delicious texture that's light, dry and yet still somehow rich with crisp acidity. So good for summer and fall.
Name: Easton 2009 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented with wild yeast in neutral French oak barrels, this Evergreen Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc opens with a burst of peppery citrus fruit, almost Grüner-like. That spicy note persists throughout the long, sweetly herbal flavor set, blending lemon and lime, pineapple and grapefruit in a harmonious, lively and palate-cleansing crescendo.
Name: Efeste 2010 Feral Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The Bay is back! This bold, fruit-driven offering is the best Cloudy Bay Savvy in at least a few vintages, with subtle leafy shadings layered over tropical fruit and adding complexity to the long, fresh finish. Drink now
Name: Cloudy Bay 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Winemaker Clive Jones has been steadily improving the wines at Nautilus, and the 2010 Sauvignon Blanc may be his best yet. Leafy, capsicum notes arise on the nose and persist through the finish, backed with just enough grapefruit to see them through. Lithe and refreshing.
Name: Nautilus 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: It took this Concha y Toro specialty label a few years to find its footing with Sauvignon Blanc, but in 2010 they found it. This is a subtle but chiseled wine with structure, juicy acidity and pure apple, lime and tarragon flavors. It's consistent from nose to tail, and it's deep and layered, too.
Name: Maycas del Limari 2010 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Honeysuckle scents and ripe, fresh fruit flavors run from grapefruit on into tropical. This was fermented in Hungarian puncheons, picking up just a hint of toast along the way. Clean and quite delicious.
Name: Jones of Washington 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Intense from the first sniff right on through the last lingering aftertaste, this seems far more extracted than its 13% alcohol would indicate. Concentrated fruit flavors of citrus flesh and citrus rind, married to the snap and sizzle of Sauvignon's grassy acidity. Amazing depth.
Name: Ardenvoir 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Perfumed and exotic at first, this benchmark Chilean SB settles into familiarity upon airing. The nose is pungent and tropical, with green accents. The palate is zesty and sharp, with acid-driven lemon, lime and green apple flavors. Not timid; this is Sauvignon Blanc served up on a laser beam.
Name: Concha y Toro 2010 Terrunyo El Triángulo Vineyard Block 28 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Although this brand has been going for under a decade, it has become a perennial favorite, showing great harmony and balance in its combination of sweet pea and citrus aromas and flavors. Drink it over the next year.
Name: Eradus 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Appellation: Capay Valley, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An invitingly rich, golden, inaugural Sauvignon Blanc from Casey Flat in the Capay Valley, a small growing region nudged between Napa and Sacramento that shows off its mountain tannins and concentration. Blended with 7% Viognier, the wine has pear and pineapple aplenty, and a lingering finish.
Name: Casey Flat Ranch 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Capay Valley)

Description: Nobilo's top-of-the-line Sauvignon Blanc starts off with the fresh, pungent scent of crushed tomato leaf, then delivers ample melon and fig flavors that push the leafy characters into the background. It nicely balances weight and freshness, ending on a clean, bright note.
Name: Nobilo 2010 Icon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Villa Maria's Wairau Reserve showcases the ripe tropical fruit associated with the “bony” soils of the Wairau Valley, alongside hints of pink grapefruit, currants and just a touch of leafy greens. It's medium bodied and slightly creamy in texture, further enhancing that impression of ripeness, although it's never heavy or fat.
Name: Villa Maria 2010 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Wairau Valley)

Description: Bright, lively and full of aromatic, floral flair, this balanced Sauv Blanc offers bright acidity with a curvier fruit, giving it versatility with fish, poultry and salads. Flirty and easygoing.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2010 Domaine Hatzimichalis Sauvignon Blanc (Atalanti Valley)

Description: Mills Reef's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc stays true to the Hawke's Bay style, with ripe fruit notes that recall nectarine and passion fruit, medium body and a zesty finish reminiscent of fresh citrus. Drink it over the next year.
Name: Mills Reef 2010 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Brancott may be big, but under the direction of Patrick Materman, the winemaking continues to be solid. The 2010 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc displays slightly herbal-grassy aromas, but also hints of white nectarine and grapefruit. This medium-bodied wine comes across as fully dry and tightly focused on the finish.
Name: Brancott 2010 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A joint venture between Tuscany's Ludovico and Piero Antinori, Mount Nelson's 2010 is a fresh, herbal rendering of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. Treble notes of tomato leaf and bell pepper predominate, with grapefruit providing the bass.
Name: Mount Nelson 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dark gold Sauvignon Blanc with clean, fine notes of apricot that's dry and has complex texture. Needs time to develop.
Name: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: Villa's entry-level Sauvignon Blanc is a reliable performer year after year, and the 2010 displays a robust blend of leafy-grassy notes with bold citrus flavors. Very refreshing.
Name: Villa Maria 2010 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Nicely done from the start, beginning with hints of stuck flint and going through some honeyed tree fruit and citrus flavors. It's a touch creamy on the midpalate, imparting some extra richness, before fading a little abruptly on the finish.
Name: Martin's Rake 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Prickly and crisp on the bouquet, with jalapeño snap, lime and other frisky green notes. The palate is cut by acidity but is nicely balanced by citrus, grapefruit and green-ish flavors. Turns greener on the finish before going pithy.
Name: Undurraga 2010 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: VM's 2010 Cellar Selection SB is slightly weightier than its Private Bin counterpart, but not necessarily better. Tomato leaf notes cruise alongside bold pineapple and citrus, ending in a mouthwatering crescendo of flavor.
Name: Villa Maria 2010 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Crisp aromas bring both tropical shadings and mild grassy scents. The palate offers the right meshing of acidity and pulp. Tastes right, with lime and passion fruit leading the charge. A dry, clean style of SB with only a touch of green.
Name: La Playa 2010 Block Selection Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure varietal, bracing and pleasantly grassy. This brings bright, herbaceous flavors of melon and citrus to the front, with a lemony snap that is indeed the sort of wine that goes well with many types of seafood, from oysters on up to halibut steaks.
Name: Magnificent Wine Company 2010 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this Sauvignon Blanc opens up with flint and melon, has a crisp. clean taste throughout that delves sweet and low on the finish.
Name: Paul Dolan 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Like many Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs, this one starts off leafy and pungent, then develops greater depth of white nectarine and grapefruit on the palate. It's plump, medium-bodied and slightly creamy in texture, making it an attractively versatile option.
Name: Drylands 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Lime, fresh-cut grass, tangerine and other clean, pure aromas are the greeting. The palate is whimsical and offers good acidic cut; flavors of lime, green apple and chili peppers are correct and turn mildly pithy on the finish.
Name: De Martino 2010 Made with Organically Grown Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Austere in aromatics, this lightly colored, almost-clear Fumé Blanc is rich in texture and acidity, would pair well with a range of seafood and is very good for the price.
Name: Sierra Vista 2010 Fumé Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Pungent and nettle-like upfront, but those leafy elements are balanced by bright grapefruity flavors on the palate. It's medium in body and fresh, clean and appealing on the finish. Hard to do better at the price.
Name: Brancott 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A medium-bodied, creamy-textured rendering of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, with notes of tropical fruit and clementines balanced by hints of struck flint and red bell pepper. Finishes soft and easy. Drink now.
Name: Wairau River 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Surprisingly multifaceted, this lovely Sauvignon Blanc counters sweet, ripe stonefruit and gooseberry on the nose and palate with elegant hints of fresh tarragon and bergamot. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a refreshing wine with brisk acidity and balanced alcohol.
Designation: Single Vineyard Selection Sebes Alba Transylvania
Name: Cramele Halewood 2010 Single Vineyard Selection Sebes Alba Transylvania Sauvignon Blanc (Sebes)

Description: Sourced from Marlborough's main valley, this is a nicely made example of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Grapefruit and crushed tomato-leaf notes mingle easily, backed by ripe, vaguely tropical fruit. It's medium in body, finishing clean and refreshing.
Name: Goldwater 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Wairau Valley)

Description: Leafy and nettle-like upfront, but deepening a bit on the palate to show nectarine, grapefruit and tomatillo notes. The only quibble with this medium-bodied white from the winemaker at Nautilus is that it seems almost a little sweet on the finish (the stated residual sugar level is 3 g/L). Drink now.
Name: Twin Islands 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A modestly priced, nicely integrated, easy-to-drink Sauvignon Blanc from the Sierra Foothills with notes of pear and honey and good acidity.
Name: Clos du Lac 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Description: Fairly neutral on the nose, but clean and easy to get into. The palate offers good acidity and vitality for Maule SB, with tropical fruit leading the flavor profile followed by pithy green notes. Overall this is a good value white.
Name: Viña Requingua 2010 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This Marlborough Sauvignon from a Hawke's Bay winery is a little on the herbal side—even close to vegetal, although it doesn't quite go that far. A trace of sweetness lingers to balance out the tobacco- and tomato-leaf elements.
Name: Crossroads 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A super pungent style of SB that will knock you over with nettle, grapefruit, passion fruit and sweaty aromas. The palate is sheer and citric, with tight, angular flavors of lemon, lime, pineapple and green herbs. Zesty to the point of scouring, with jalapeño heat on the finish.
Name: Viu Manent 2010 Secreto Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Honeyed on the nose with bursts of ripe yellow peach and apricot, this dry, full-bodied Sauvignon is similarly soft and fruity on the palate. Fresh green floral and herb notes add vibrance to a moderately long finish.
Name: Pullus 2009 Sauvignon (Štajerska)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: A clean, crisp Sauvignon Blanc with a sweet, pineapple nose and flavors of mango and melon that finishes sweet. Made from vineyards overlooking Clear Lake in the High Valley AVA, 2,200 feet up in Lake County.
Name: Angel's Secret 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Description: Oceanic and green, with lots of pop and Sauvignon character. The palate is tight, linear and citric, with sharp acidity. Tastes citrusy and zesty, with flavors of passion fruit and lemon-lime. Similar on the finish, with a snappy edge.
Name: Tamaya 2010 Winemaker's Selection Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is for acid lovers only. Tart almost to the point of sourness, it is saved by its sharply etched green apple crispness. Definitely a Sauvignon Blanc in the style of a piercing Quincy, with that sort of acidity, but not the minerality.
Name: Claar 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a clean, fruity, pleasant white wine that could just as easily be something along the lines of an Italian Orvieto rather than a Washington Sauv Blanc. Melon and cucumber, fresh acidity, and alcohol just a little over 13%.
Name: Mercer 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A bit heavy and oily on the nose, with chunky passion fruit and pink grapefruit aromas. The palate is weighty and the flavors run toward tropical fruit before pithy, almost bitter passion fruit takes over. A bulky, semigreen wine with tropical shadings.
Name: Arboleda 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Essentially a second label for Vavasour, the 2010 Dashwood Sauvignon Blanc displays restrained gooseberry aromas that turn tropical and citrusy on the palate. Turns a bit chalky or metallic on the finish, but it's still a solid wine, and some may like the edge that sharp note provides.
Name: Dashwood 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: While floral and fruity on the nose with juicy white peach, lemon and orange blossom notes, the palate is all Sauvignon Blanc, full of ripe gooseberries and a green, grassy backdrop. Refreshingly high in acid, yet ends on a soft peach candy note. Pretty remarkable for $7.
Name: Cramele Recas 2010 Dreamfish Sauvignon Blanc (Viile Timisului)

Description: This successful brand is a huge seller in Australia, and the company reports that 200,000 cases of this vintage are available in the U.S. It's a little less overt than many Marlborough Sauvignons, with restrained celery leaf and citrus aromas and flavors that finish with just a hint of sweetness. Drink now.
Name: Oyster Bay 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The nose and palate of this dry, full-bodied Sauvignon bursts with freshly squeezed limes and herbaceous grass and lemon verbena notes. Dry and full bodied in style, it's enlivened by zesty acidity, but with a 14% alcohol content, finishes with some heat.
Name: Pullus 2009 g-Pullus Sauvignon (Štajerska)

Description: Richer than previous releases, this Sauvignon Blanc goes for a more tropical view of the grape, very ripe and perfumed.
Name: Simonnet-Febvre 2009 Sauvignon  (Saint-Bris)

Description: Powdery on the nose, with aromas of sweet pear and lime. The palate is round and melony, indicating a warmer origin. Tastes a lot like basic Pinot Grigio; peach and green melon are the lead flavors. Finishes solid but soft, with lasting sweetness.
Name: Viña La Rosa 2010 La Palma Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Piercing SB with a lot of zap and sheering character. The nose is green but true, with briney flavors of grapefruit, asparagus and lemon. Spritzy on the mouthfeel; finishes citrusy and lean, and then pithy.
Name: Casa Silva 2010 Cool Coast Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Tropical and fresh, but monotone and dilute on the nose. The palate is lemony and tart in feel and flavor, with orange and tangerine tastes as well. Dry and basic on the finish, with a lemony, grapefruity fade.
Name: Casa Silva 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Mild pungency with an oily edge describes the bouquet. It's lemony and slick in the mouth, with green papaya and lemon flavors. Dry and crisp on the back end, with white pepper notes and sharp lasting acidity.
Name: Santa Alicia 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Typical passion fruit and gooseberry aromas turn tropical and almost rich on the palate. This is weightier than many Sauvignons, lushly ripe and maybe even a touch sweet—serve it well chilled for best effect.
Name: Nobilo 2010 Regional Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent and stiff, but clearly it's Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is a pure citric wash of tight lime, lemon and cucumber flavors. Turns toward crisp tangerine on the finish. Lean and bright in style.
Name: Tamaya 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very sweet-smelling, like putting your nose in a bowl of sugar, followed by aromas of ripe pineapple juice, this smooth Sauvignon Blanc from the Michael David folks is sweet through and through.
Name: Michael David 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Description: Aromas of grapefuit blend with green, vegetal notes of asparagus. The palate is pliant and easy, with mango, citrus and green bean flavors. Doesn't commit to being green and vegetal or blaring and citric; falls in between.
Name: La Cruz 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Bland at first, with applesauce aromas. The palate is more zesty and lively, with tropical flavors of melon and mango along with lime. Finishes with green citrus and jalapeño heat. Basic but good enough for quaffing.
Name: Haras 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Smells like spiced applesauce. The palate is more full than light, with roundness but lemony, tart flavors of citrus and green apple. Tart again on the finish, with an odd oily feel. Seems green as well.
Name: Chilcas 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Winemaking team Alex MacGregor and David Ramey have produced a beautiful Sauvignon Blanc here, from organically farmed grapes grown in several vineyards throughout Mendocino County, including owner John Fetzer's Kathleen's Vineyard, named for his mom. Barrel-fermented but having not undergone ML, the wine is deliciously fresh and vibrant with lots of minerality to recommend, as well as depth.
Name: Saracina 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Tart gooseberry and zesty lime are followed by flavors of green plum and lemon curd in the prickly mouth. Light and vibrant, this is a nice selection to pair with grilled fish or shrimp. Drink now.
Name: Hartenberg 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Sweet grass and soft baby powder notes mingle with the ripe gooseberry and lime aromas and flavors. Brisk and lively with a soft prickly sensation on the palate and a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Brampton 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: White florals and clover add an interesting edge to this brisk Sauv Blanc, otherwise loaded with flavors of grapefruit pith and pineapple core acidity. Drink now.
Name: Edgebaston 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Granny Smith apple and clementine flavors are the backbone of this wine, with additional accents of white florals and green plum skin. Medium weight with aggressive but enjoyable acidity and a zippy finish.
Name: Indaba 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Green apple and gooseberry are at the forefront here, spotted with nuances of dandelion and dill weed. The mouthfeel is light and zippy with a fresh finish.
Name: Ken Forrester 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Winemaker Mike Lee continues to prove his prowess with Sauvignon Blanc in this latest vintage of Patianna, Patti Fetzer's line of organically farmed wines from outside of Hopland in Mendocino County. Fermented entirely in stainless steel without undergoing ML or barrel aging, it delivers everything you love about the variety, inviting one in with melon and minerality, then following through with a surprising creaminess and almost decadent, mousse-like finish.
Name: Patianna 2009 Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Grapefruit and gooseberry scents and flavors mark this as a New Zealand-style Sauvignon Blanc, and a very good one at that. The acidity carries the fruit, and brings a zesty freshness to the finish. Some suggestions of stone and spice liven it up. All stainless, and 100% varietal.
Name: Apex Ascent 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: One sniff receives immediate prickle and a hint of fresh bell pepper offset by citrus blossom and passion fruit. All the components of excellent Sauvignon Blanc appear in this carved, sizzling wine: tangerine, orange, grapefruit and lime flavors; freshness and physique; purity and sense of place.
Name: Undurraga 2010 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Green and focused on the nose, with a hint of fresh bell pepper. The palate is light and chiseled, with crisp flavors of white grapefruit, lime and passion fruit. Finishes elegant and fresh. An ideal quaffer to go with salads and shellfish.
Name: Los Molles 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A light in color, tropical, pineapple- and coconut-infused Sauvignon Blanc that's balanced in flavor and finish and would be truly delicious at the end of a hot day. Fermented in stainless steel, it retains plenty of acid to pair with a range of spicy foods.
Name: Guenoc 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A great first effort from the new Jaxon Keys winery's estate Sauvignon Blanc vineyard, with green apple, pear, ripe melon and honey prominent throughout the wine's rich, creamy texture, with just a touch of key lime. A great example of inland Mendocino Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Jaxon Keys 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: With fruit from coastal Leyda in the blend, this Curicó wine surprises with crisp, focused understatement. The mouth is fresh but basic, with juicy, perky apple and citrus flavors followed by a crisp, slightly pithy finish. Overachieves in the context of  Echeverria's past Sauvignon Blancs.
Name: Echeverria 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Molina)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from excellent Yakima Valley sites, fermented in stainless steel, and ripened perfectly to 13.5% alcohol, this juicy, fresh, fruit-laden wine captures the ideal mix of snappy citrus and luscious stone fruits. Delicious.
Name: Waterbrook 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasantly spicy and round, this pure Sauvignon Blanc has light lemon and orange peel flavors, and a lively core which leaves a finishing impression of buttery, fresh-baked brioche. Not especially deep, but appealing.
Name: Couvillion 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Tropical aromas rise up and win you over. Bold and citrusy in the mouth, with crisp lime, green apple, grapefruit and passion fruit flavors. Zesty and remaining fruity until the end. A ripe, fresh, familiar wine done right.
Name: Undurraga 2010 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó and Leyda Valleys)

Description: Fresh and chiseled on the bouquet, with lettuce leaf, green-fruit aromas and white pepper. The palate is elegant, lean and balanced, with green-fruit flavors of lime and kiwi as well as citrusy grapefruit. An honest SB that won't steer you wrong.
Name: François Lurton 2010 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dramatically reduced production coupled with a fine vintage add up to a stellar Snoqualmie Sauvignon Blanc in 2009. Loaded with melon, citrus and apple fruit flavors, this brisk and refreshing wine is reminiscent of a racy Quincy. Perfect springtime sipper.
Name: Snoqualmie 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is actually a 2010 wine, but for consistency it is not labeled with the vintage. Fragrant and floral, with the addition of 5% Riesling contributing a pleasing orange blossom/orange peel accent. Overall, it's refreshing and succulent, a juicy mix of citrus fruits and balanced acids.
Name: Va Piano Bruno's Blend II NV Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A little hard at first, with match stick aromas. After that blows off, there's green fruit notes carrying the nose. Full in the mouth, with acidic cut and spunky flavors of nectarine and orange. Finishes round, with citrus and passion fruit.
Name: De Martino 2010 347 Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Melon, grass, tarragon and other patented SB aromas open the show. The palate is crisp and well cut, with flavors of white citrus, nectarine and lime. Light on the finish, with mild but lasting green notes.
Name: Oveja Negra 2010 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: A light colored, lightly treading Sauvignon Blanc from vineyards around California, made by Lake County's Guenoc, cool-fermented in stainless steel and ready to drink now. Refreshing pear and vanilla flavors and lively acidity make it a good choice for summer drinking.
Name: Guenoc 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: There is plenty of typical herbaceous character here, although the wine does seem a little raw at this stage. It needs to calm its very fruity character to let the grapefruit flavors come out. Glass stopper.
Name: Zantho 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Tropical and also plump and melony from nose to palate. Round and soft in the mouth, with sweet mango and tangy grapefruit flavors. Seems a little flat and wanting on the finish, which is sweet and candied.
Name: Santa Ema 2010 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Very perfumed, this Sauvignon Blanc is soft and round, warm in character, with lemon and yellow fruit flavors giving richness. The acidity shows slowly, and lingers attractively. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2009 Hofenthal Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Description: Zesty and lightly citric on the nose, with a hint of asparagus. The palate is tangy and borders on sheering, with lime, grass, kiwi and bell pepper flavors. Quick on the finish, with lasting tarragon and other green herb flavors.
Name: Santa Rita 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Dainty aromas of gooseberry, hay and dandelion dance in the bouquet, while more assertive flavors of tangy citrus and green plum fill the lightweight mouth. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Coussergues 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Yellow in color, with almost vegetal coastal aromas that suggest canned peas and/or asparagus. The palate has a big, heavy, chunky feel despite decent acidity, and the flavors run toward asparagus and beans. Hangs in there but seems over the top.
Name: Errazuriz 2010 Aconcagua Costa Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: This Sauv Blanc is light, brisk and perfectly priced for summer entertaining. Tart green plum flavors and zippy citrus acidity keep things clean and refreshing.
Name: Arrogant Frog 2010 Savvy Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Covey Run has dropped the Fumé and gone with Sauvignon Blanc, along with a label redesign that puts the Quail label into a more colorful, eye-catching format. The blend includes Sémillon, Chenin Blanc and Riesling, and there is just enough residual sugar to take the edge off the grassiness. Light apple fruit flavors, sharp acids and a hint of fresh asparagus.
Name: Covey Run 2009 Quail Series Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Animal cracker, lemonade and bell pepper aromas are a mix of sweet, soft and pungent. The palate has a wet, zesty feel and lemony flavors that blend in softer peach and cream notes. Tangy and a touch vegetal on the finish.
Name: MontGras 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Green bean aromas are less than inviting. In the mouth, it's heavy and citrusy, with mealy, generic flavors of lime, bell pepper and other green notes. Finishes with a dull hum; Colchagua is not SB country, as evidenced by wines like this.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2010 La Joya Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc may be cheap but unfortunately you get what you pay for. The nose is waxy and pithy, with lime notes. The palate is also pithy, with bitter apple and muddled citrus. A weak, compromised wine from warm-climate fruit.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2010 Petirrojo Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Smells like drug store air freshener, and in the mouth it's grating and high in acid. Flavors run toward lemon and grass, while the finish is tangy to excess. In no way does it sing; more like a mumbler.
Name: Morandé 2010 Pionero Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Very rich style of wine from 50-year-old vines. It is smooth, opulent almost, packed with pure pink grapefruit along with an herbal, grassy character. Concentration is the hallmark of this fine wine.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2008 Jadis  (Sancerre)

Description: Unfined, unfiltered, wood aged, this wine was created as a tribute to old-style Sancerre. With its intensity and definite wood aging character, it is certainly different. It retains the green fruit character of pure Sauvignon Blanc while offering a more oxidative richness.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2008 Sancerre d'Antan  (Sancerre)

Description: Mendocino's Navarro Vineyards hits it out of the ballpark with this truly stellar Sauvignon Blanc, its 20th year making SB. Partially barrel-fermented, this is an inviting wine of subtle jasmine aromas and touching minerality. An incredibly well-balanced version of the varietal full of lemon thyme and passion fruit. The acidity would cut nicely through a potato gratin.
Name: Navarro 2009 Cuvee 128 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This is great Sancerre from the Monts Damnés vineyard. It shows all the right varietal character, stylized by initial austerity, flint and a dense texture. Gradually it opens up to show a balance of acidity and richness.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2009 Le M.D. de Bourgeois  (Sancerre)

Description: Perfumed, rounded wine, packed with fruit, its ripe flavor given point with kiwi fruit acidity. There is a light spiciness that adds to the complexity. Age for 3-4 years.
Name: Guy Saget 2009 Le Domaine Saget  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Rich style of wine, its lime and mineral character enveloped by the ripe peach flavors. It's a beautiful wine, forward and ready to drink over the next year.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2009 La Demoiselle de Bourgeois  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Made from old vines and partially fermented in wood, this is a complex wine, offering plenty of pure white fruits. It is very precise in character, crisp, tangy, the edge of wood just a hint.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2008 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)

Description: Rare is the Chilean SB that rises high enough to be called gorgeous, but this wine is just that. New Zealand-born winemaker Grant Phelps has crafted a bright, bold, citric Sauvignon that's crisp as a mountain stream and endowed with tangy, lovely flavors of tangerine, lime, pineapple and green apple. Long and delicious; a cut above the rest.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2010 Pequeñas Producciones Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Cailloux means flinty stone, and this wine certainly has a mineral character, its fruit tang still young. It has a tight structure, crisp, herbal and concentrated.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2009 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Particularly intense on the herbaceous front, the wine shows rich grapefruit and lemon zest flavors. Long, deep and delicious.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2009 Côtes de Morogues  (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This SB has one of Chile's best track records for high quality. The nose and flavors both exceed norms, with the former showing bold citrus, lime and melon aromas and the latter revolving around grapefruit, lime and gooseberry. It's ripe, healthy, pithy, acid-driven and piercing. Summer sipping calls.
Name: Montes 2010 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Very intense herbal wine, full-bodied, with hints of mineral and a very forward grapefruit and lime fruit character.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2009 En Travertin  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Bright, bursting aromatics of green apple, white peach and summer grass are pungent yet controlled. The palate has a fresh, friendly feel that supports papaya, passion fruit and lime flavors. This is full of pop and typicity; it lasts on the finish and mixes the best of leesy weight and tropicality.
Name: Errazuriz 2010 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Piercing and pungent up front, with sharp-edged aromas of nettle, lime, arugula and green bean. The palate is lithe and crisp, with green-leaning flavors of lettuce, lime and passion fruit. Lasting on the finish, with bell pepper and celery. A prime example of cool-climate Chilean SB.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2010 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Oceanic and mildly green on the nose, with grassy notes and appealing citrusy scents. The palate is juicy, crisp and zesty, with flavors of fresh lettuce, lime and green herbs. Finishes light and pretty.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A pure mineral wine, extremely fresh and bright with acidity, all the way to the finish. It's packed with herbs and gooseberry fruit flavors.
Name: Henri Bourgeois 2009 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)

Description: Clean on the nose, with pure citrus and minerality. It's full but not heavy in the mouth, with developed, mature flavors of grapefruit and other citrus fruits. Mildly pithy, green and long on the finish. Not a prima ballerina; this has force and strength along with elegance.
Name: Chilcas 2010 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Attractive aromas of ripe guava and mango mix masterfully with earthy notes of fresh grass and sweet pea florals in the bouquet. Lime flavors drive the palate, with a great cut to the mouthfeel and a juicy finish. Drink now.
Name: Cederberg 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Cederberg)

Description: Odfjell previously struggled a bit with SB but this one is quite good and correct. It features green aromas of lime and herbs with some minerality folded in. The palate is zesty and lively, with lime and green apple flavors. Finishes in direct fashion. Drink soon.
Name: Odfjell 2010 Armador Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Soft and ripe, the normal herbaceous character rounded out with pear and peach fruits. Sure, there is a tang, a kick to the wine, with acidity. But it is the ripeness that dominates.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2009 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: Fresh but full with ripe flavors of kiwi and Key lime citrus accented by savory herbs on the palate. Balanced, with bracing acidity and a lingering finish accented by notes of white peach. A nice choice for poached halibut. 300 cases imported.
Name: Shannon 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: Although it's standard in many ways, sometimes regularity done right works. In this case, the wine brings tropical aromas along with saline and green herbs. In the mouth, it's fresh and briney, with tropical fruit, citrus and green notes. Tangy and pure; nice for the price.
Name: Quintay 2010 Clava Coastal Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The prickly mouth and forward acidity makes this a live-wire choice that would be a great companion to a rich chicken dish or cream of asparagus soup. Fresh- cut grass, soft chive and watermelon rind all occasionally shine through the citrus-dominant nose and mouth. Drink now.
Name: Neil Ellis 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Groenekloof)

Description: Lime, mineral and green herbs combine to create a nice aromatic opening. The palate is juicy and healthy, with flavors of jalapeño, lime and green apple. Finishes solid and quite long for a basic SB. Well made and tasty.
Name: Montes 2010 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Clear, breezey tangerine and grapefruit aromas roll out the red carpet on this crisp, citrusy SB that pours on the green fruit and scallion flavors. The palate is both round and crisp, and the finish is long and juicy. For fresh, citrusy, varietally correct Sauvignon Blanc, it's hard to do better.
Name: Peñalolen 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Pungent and nettle-y, but those elements are nicely counterbalanced by a medium-bodied core of pineapple and fig. Finishes pleasantly soft; easy to drink.
Name: Palliser Estate 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Pure grapefruit and other citrus fruits make for an inviting bouquet. The palate is pure, round, fresh and full of green melon, citrus and passion fruit flavors. Overall this is ripe but properly green, with a hint of pithy lime and mineral on the finish.
Name: Chilcas 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Tropical fruits and a mix of grass and green herbs make for a nice bouquet. The palate on this Casablanca wine is juicy and round, not pointy, with citrus and nectarine flavors. Finishes with green apple tang; definitely gets the job done.
Name: Cono Sur 2010 Visión Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A glassy, crisp style of SB from Bío Bío in Chile's south. The nose is pungent and slick, while the palate has a smooth, tangy set of green fruit flavors like lime and apple. Reserved on the finish, with chiseled acids and fresh simplicity.
Name: Emiliana 2010 Eco Balance Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Bright and drinkable with easygoing green fig, underripe melon, herbs and sweet lemon drop flavors. Approachable and balanced with medium acidity and a crisp finish. Drink now.
Name: Paul Cluver 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc displays a range of flavors from nettles to citrus to honey while remaining essentially dry. The leafy notes really emerge on the finish, along with a chalky note.
Name: Nelson Bay 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Clean and to the point, the fresh grass notes ground the lively tart gooseberry and underripe mango flavors, keeping the mouth from feeling too crisp and lean. Refreshing and easy to drink; try with grilled spiced softshell crab.
Name: Thelema 2009 Sutherland Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: Snappy, crisp and green on the nose, but well balanced and showing the good side of Chilean SB, which is oceanic, fresh, green and citrusy. Flavors of lime, grapefruit and passion fruit are true, while the finish is fruity at first before breaking up.
Name: Errazuriz 2010 Estate Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A light- to medium-bodied Sauvignon, the 2009 Discovery is more delicate than many of its counterparts, with hints of stuck flint, accenting stone fruit and citrus flavors. Turns chalky and crisp on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Discovery 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (East Coast)

Description: For as long as Chile has been taken seriously for its SBs, Veramonte has been a value leader. This wine is a bit softer and less pungent than previous efforts, but it's still tangy and shows good green apple and melony flavors. Finishes more flat and fleshy than in the past, so drink right away.
Name: Veramonte 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Light green aromas of melon and lime are nice, while the palate is solid and full of lime and pithy grapefruit flavors. Like many Chilean SBs, this is salinic, citrusy and pithy, but also round as well as clean. Drink right away.
Name: Chilensis 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This wine is tart and mouthwatering with strong notes of green gooseberry, lemon supremes, hay and a touch of green banana rind throughout. Balanced but bracing with a lively citrus finish. Drink now.
Name: Oak Valley 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: The mouthfeel of this wine is full and round despite lean flavors of tart tropical fruit and melon rind. The nose offers aromas of fresh herbs and green fruit that reappear on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Warwick 2010 Professor Black Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Fresh and appealing, but definitely on the green side of the Sauvignon Blanc spectrum. This medium-bodied wine features pungent sweaty and grassy aromas, as well as leafy, green-tomato flavors. Drink now.
Name: Clifford Bay 2009 Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Green plum skins, bitter lime pith, hay and pepper all dominate the nose with barely a hint of ripe fruit to be found. The mouth, however, offers a bit more ripeness to the lime and plum flavors, fleshing out the medium-weight mouth and adding depth to the wine.
Name: D'Aria 2009 Terra D'Aria Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: This fumé has a zesty character, with aromas of tropical fruit and flowers and fresh, fun flavors of peach, citrus and pineapple. The oak offers spice for added character, and clean acidity makes it a great find for fresh, summer meals.
Name: Gerovassiliou 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Epanomi)

Description: Piquant aromas mix with dusty apple on the nose. The palate is tangy and zingy, with green apple, pineapple and lemony flavors. More simple and straightforward than complex, but well made and spans the 3 Z's: zest, zap and zing.
Name: Morandé 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Classic southwest France Sauvignon Blanc, bright, fresh and citrus-flavored. Great for summer drinking, clean and delicious.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2010 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Opens with aromas of lettuce, underripe peach and mineral water. The palate is healthy and crisp, with lemony acids and fresh flavors of green fruits and lettuce leaf. Clean but lightly bitter.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Light and easy-drinking with fresh notes of lemon citrus, watercress and a touch of wild field grass. Clean acidity and herbal flavors carry through the palate to the crisp finish. Drink now.
Name: MAN Vintners 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
