Description: Minerally on the nose but also slightly pickled, with a wet but basic tasting palate that is a touch dilute as it deals grapefruit and lime flavors. Finishes clean, fruity and a bit sweet.
Name: Loma Larga 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Ripe fruit flavors are countered by a fresh citrus zing in the mouth, with notes of underripe melon and hard banana sprinkling the bouquet. Drink now.
Name: Bouchard Finlayson 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A dark-golden SB from the Sierra Foothills with a nose full of honeysuckle and mango, this wine's got significant depth and concentration but also a healthy dose of alcohol (14.7%) and is a tad sweet on the finish. A small amount of Sémillon is blended in for body and texture. Pair with seafood.
Name: Lava Cap 2009 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)

Description: Herbal and fruity all at once with clean aromas of gooseberry, hard mango and green grass. Ctirus flavors dominate the lightweight mouth with crisp lime acidity charging through on the close.
Name: Simonsig 2010 Sunbird Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Light, mellow aromas don't go much beyond green fruits and orange blossom. Round and easy in the mouth, with melony, reluctant flavors of honeydew and peach. Lean on the finish, with some jalapeño heat. Pretty much average for Chilean Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Cono Sur 2010 Organically Grown Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Pithy and citrusy on the nose, but ultimately it's rather neutral. The palate is citric and lean, with orange, lemon and sour apple flavors. Zesty to the point of tartness, with a citrusy, juicy finish. A pointed SB with zing.
Name: Emiliana 2010 Natura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Lightly herbaceous, this is a soft, open, easy wine for summer drinking. Attractive grapefruit, green apple and orange zest mix easily together.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2009 Sauvignon Blanc  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Mildly tropical on the nose and pleasant overall, with a touch of match stick to the bouquet. The palate is lemony and sheer, with flavors of Meyer lemon, white peach and apple. Pointed on the finish but clean. Good but normal in the scheme of things.
Name: Vistamar 2010 Sepia Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Salinic and also melony on the mostly clean and crisp nose. The palate is healthy, with round, lightly pithy flavors of green melon, peach and kiwi. Citrusy on the finish and a little green on the fade out. Good for summer quaffing. Drink this year.
Name: Yali 2010 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Soft grass, green gooseberry and a hint of fig unfold on the nose, while ripe green plum and lime rind fill the medium-weight mouth. Clean and easy to drink; pair with crab salad canapés.
Name: KWV 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Riper in style than Ara's Composite bottling, offering straightforward pineapple fruit and a clean, refreshing style. It's nicely balanced, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
Name: Ara 2009 Resolute Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent and sweaty smelling, with nettle and other sharp aromas. Surprisingly, the palate is short on acidity so there's a flat feel along with green, salinic flavors that border on vegetal. For proof, there's a clear wave of asparagus to the finish. Not as good as in past years.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Los Vascos Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A light, perfectly quaffable Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, the 2009 Sea Breeze displays classic grapefruit and gooseberry notes, accented by hints of tomato leaf. Finishes a bit short, but provides decent value.
Name: Sea Breeze 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (East Coast)

Description: Crisp and brisk on the palate, with hints of grapefruit, melon and fig accented by herbal, leafy notes. The flavors fade quickly on the finish, but the wine makes for a pleasant apéritif.
Name: Terroir 2009 by Ant Moore Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Peppery and sweaty upfront, backed up by white grapefruit notes. This is a light- to medium-bodied Sauvignon with a zesty finish of chalk and lime.
Name: Ara 2009 Composite Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Clean yet dilute on the bouquet, with touches of lime and grassiness. The palate, however, is kind of heavy and honeyed, a direct reflection of its warm Maipo roots. Tastes sweet and creamy but without much zesty fruit. Maybe a little too soft and candied, but still pretty good.
Name: Santa Ema 2010 Selected Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Here's a well balanced and easy to drink value priced Sauv Blanc, offering notes of sweet grass, barely ripe peach and melon on the nose and mouth. Perfect for summer entertaining; pair with sushi or cocktail shrimp.
Name: Rooiberg 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A light golden SB from Calaveras County with tons of tropical aromas, predominantly pineapple, that follow into the taste, which veers disproportionately sweet, with not enough acidity to balance it out.
Name: Chatom Vineyards 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Calaveras County)

Description: Passion fruit, grapefruit and capsicum all speak to this wine's Marlborough origins. It's medium bodied and features a hint of creaminess on the midpalate, then adds a hint of canned pineapple on the finish.
Name: Tiki Sound 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Kind of bland and regular, but on the plus side it's fresh, feline and green, with lightly pickled gooseberry flavors. Fleshy and wan on the palate but with no glaring issues or off flavors. Drink now.
Name: La Playa 2010 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Sauvignon Blanc has never been a focus at Kumeu River, and this is an overly lean, green and underripe rendering.
Name: Kumeu River 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Kumeu)

Description: Aromas of currants and tropical fruits are followed by ripe nectarine and star fruit flavors with the acidity coming from a fresh pineapple character. It's an intense wine, with delicious, full concentration of flavors.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: A big, ripe wine, still very young and fresh in the mouth, showing how concentrated Sauvignon Blanc can age well. From a densely planted vineyard, the wine is bold, with a hint of minerality. It will age for several more years.
Name: Château de Tracy 2006 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Soft, ripe quince and pear flavors are lifted by the presence of pink grapefruit. The wine has weight as well, the ripe Sauvignon blossoming in the glass. It's crisp, while also having a rounder profile.
Name: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2009  Sancerre

Description: Herbaceous and with an extra ripeness from the fine summer of 2009, this is a deliciously smooth wine, the Sauvignon's natural acidity balanced by sweet apple juice over a greengage skin texture.
Name: Philippe Portier 2009  Quincy

Description: Pure Sauvignon Blanc, this is herbal while also crisp, very fruity, bright and lively. Gooseberry juice dominates this intense wine.
Name: Domaine des Pierrettes 2009 Element Terre Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Very fruity in character, in high tension, its acidity pushing through the mineral texture and ripe fruit.
Name: Sauvion 2010 Loire Valley  (Sancerre)

Description: Ripe, soft wine, deliciously rounded with fresh white and green fruits combining into a creamy herbaceousness. There is a final tang to this concentrated, full wine. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine Joël Delaunay 2009 Le Bois Martin Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: As crisp and clean as they come, this smooth and creamy Sauvignon bursts with just the right amount of herbaceous, green pea and grapefruit flavors. It is great to drink as an apéritif or with food.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2009 Domaine Chatelain French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Description: The bright young thing in the Tracy range, this is an intensely herbal wine, its acidity fully integrated into a rich texture. It's packed with lemon, green plum and pink grapefruit flavors. Give it six months.
Name: Château de Tracy 2009 Mademoiselle de T  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A complex style, its acidity very well defined, full-bodied, tasting very mineral. The gooseberry fruit flavors meld into a final herbal character.
Name: Pierre Chainier 2010 Les Hospices  (Sancerre)

Description: Very tangy, nervous wine with lively acidity and crisp fruit. There is a fresh, very steely character, and a mineral, chewy aftertaste.
Name: Pierre Chainier 2010 Château de Pocé Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Saint-Bris to the west of Chablis is noted for its Sauvignon Blanc. This wine has an attractive grassy character, showing good tangy freshness, orange zest and grapefruit. Screwcap.
Name: La Chablisienne 2009  Saint-Bris

Description: While the aroma is characteristically herbaceous, the palate is softer, with a rounded grassy, gooseberry flavor. It's clean, fresh, with just a tang of orange zest.
Name: Domaine Guenault 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Full, ripe wine, lightly smoky in character. There are flavors of mandarin orange and lime enveloped within a mineral structure.
Name: Sauvion 2010 Loire Valley  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Delicate and lithe Sauvignon Blanc from Navarra? Interesting. Tastes sort of Galician due to its clean, tropical pineapple, citrus and green apple flavors. Like a fruit salad with more acidity; doesn't taste particularly Sauvignon-ish, but likable nonetheless.
Name: Inurrieta 2009 Orchidea Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)

Description: Fresh and citrusy on the nose, with apple and gooseberry notes. The palate is jumpy, tangy and zesty, with lemon, lime and pineapple flavors. Not the most “varietal” SB going, but it's tangy and lively nonetheless. Hanging in well for a 2008, but drink now.
Name: O. Fournier 2008 B Crux Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: Recommended with caution. The sample this note is based on was weighty and smooth, with apple and floral notes and then an almosty buttery palate with baked apple and citrus flavors. Oddly, it's a soft, ripe wine that's fading and not showing much Sauvignon Blanc typicity.
Name: Spanish Vines 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)

Description: Aromas of talcum powder, lime and melon are simple, sweet and pretty good. The palate is clean and zesty, with gooseberry, melon and citrus flavors. Quite fruity and long on the finish for such a basic NV Sauvignon.
Name: Amadores NV Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Perfumed with white flowers, this wine is crisp, bright and light in character. Lovely, pure acidity is highlighted in an attractive combination.
Name: Sauvion 2010 Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Slightly stalky on the nose, with aromas of haystack and snappy citrus fruits. The palate is citrusy and acidic, with flavors of orange and grapefruit. Rounds into form with airing and time in the glass, but overall it's just a modest, regular SB for basic purposes.
Name: Nemesio 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Patagonia)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A bit volatile, with a hint of fusil, light herb and cut grass flavors, and fruit that is just ripe enough. Green banana and green apple, with a soft mouthfeel and a gentle fade.
Name: Columbia Crest 2009 H3 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Classic crisp, tangy wine, with plenty of grapefruit flavors, very fresh, crisp and clean.
Name: Pierre Chainier 2010 Château de la Roche Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Fresh-faced Sauvignon Blanc, with distinct citric character and a green herbal edge. A lightweight wine that has a great zesty finish.
Name: Joseph Mellot 2009 Sincerité Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Description: A simple style, with nutty notes. There is an edge of bitterness, the wine's freshness masked by some weight.
Name: Langlois-Chateau 2009 Château de Fontaine-Audin  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A nice, citrusy nose suggests lemon and orange hard candy. With alcohol at just 11%, residual sugar is around 2%, which softens the acids but gives the mouthfeel an odd flatness. Drink up.
Name: Silver Lake 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: A chunky style of SB with apple and green melon aromas. The palate is a bit soft and mealy, while the flavors revolve mostly around lemon. It's also pithy, zesty and a touch bitter on the finish. Not easy to peg as Sauvignon Blanc; drink now to capture its remaining freshness.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2010 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maipú)

Description: A light but easy-drinking white with flavors of fresh gooseberry and grapefruit pith. Light -weight with a short but clean finish; pair with summer salads.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2009 Cuvée Jeanne Sauvignon Blanc (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Soft and rounded wine, showing some herbaceousness, and a sense of dilute fruit. The wine is pleasant, but undistinguished. Screwcap.
Name: Bougrier 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: It might be a tad too late to enjoy this typically early-drinking wine, with the alcohol now overpowering the green plum and pineapple core fruit flavors. Hold out for the 2010.
Name: Domaines Paul Mas 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Pungent and grassy on the nose, with a strong nettle and green herb character. The palate is soft and playful, with pithy white fruit flavors and then a soda-like dry finish. Plump, wayward and a bit green overall.
Name: Reina de Castilla 2009 Sauvignon (Rueda)

Description: Not a bad little SB for bargain shoppers. It's soft and simple, with white fruit aromas and a touch of orange blossom on the nose. The palate is easy in feel, with mild citrus flavors. Innocuous as they come.
Name: Funky Llama 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Neutral on the nose except for a spot of peach and citrus. The palate is soft and chunky, with generic citrus flavors that suggest passion fruit and grapefruit. Turns a little mealy on the finish, so drink ASAP.
Name: Bodega Norton 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Hard, oily, prickly and not impressive by global Sauvignon Blanc standards. The palate deals semisour grapefruit and passion fruit flavors, and the finish is a monotone continuation of the primary flavors.
Name: Doña Paula 2010 Los Cardos Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: In the four years that San Pedro has been making this SB, it has improved steadily. This is pungent, strong and piercing, with sharpness that comes up just shy of being too much. Spritzy in feel, with lime, fresh lettuce and tarragon flavors. Sheer, long and tangy on the finish; excellent Leyda SB.
Name: San Pedro 2010 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The future of Finger Lakes Sauvingnon Blanc is bright, at least in the hands of Steve Shaw. Fragrant with sweet, ripe gooseberries, apples and a touch of herbs and grass, this is a delicious choice for any occasion. Full bodied and complex, its palate is lush with quince and green plums, highlighted by a refreshing minerality and a lime zest astringency.
Name: Shaw 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Santa Helena has moved to the Colchagua Coast for its SB, and the results are impressive. This wine is pungent, cool and citrusy, with grapefruit, mineral, saline and fresh asparagus on the nose and palate. It's slightly sheering and lemony but honest and snappy to the max. Tangy late and very nice overall.
Name: Santa Helena 2010 Selección del Directorio Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Effusive scents of passion fruit leap from the glass, but the flavors are more subtle, less over the top. Grapefruit notes with herbal shadings are easygoing and should be reasonably versatile at the table. Fresh and lively on the finish, but drink up over the next few months.
Name: Yealands 2009 Seaview Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A very pleasant, well-made SB with green melon, green apple, bell pepper and minerality on the bouquet. This wine captures the essence of Casablanca via citrus, apple, grass and minerally flavors that dance on a crisp bed of fine acidity. Long and uncompromised on the finish.
Name: Misiones de Rengo 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A touch neutral on the nose, but overall this is a nice, minerally, grassy SB with lots of green apple and freshness. The palate offers depth and clarity, and the flavors of green fruits are good. Falls off on the finish, which seems flat compared to the rest of the wine.
Name: Root:1 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A one-dimensional, pungent style of SB that's fresh, zesty and tangy in the mouth courtesy of zippy acidity and flavors of tangerine, grapefruit and passion fruit. Finishes more in the pink grapefruit zone, but with snap. Chiseled and linear, but definitely still kicking.
Name: Cameron Hughes 2009 Lot 225 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Marked by a touch of struck flint on the nose, this wine delivers Sherwood's customary fresh nettle-like aromas and flavors. It's grassy and pungent yet light and zesty in style, with enough citrus fruit to help the greens go down easily. Drink now.
Name: Sherwood Estate 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This bargain Sauvignon is leafy and intense on the nose, with fig, ripe citrus and herbal overtones on the palate. It's plump and round, and decently concentrated for the price.
Name: Yealands 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A plump, nicely concentrated Sauvignon Blanc, the 2009 Mount Beautiful doesn't have the most intense aromatics, but is holding on to its weighty melon and fig flavors and lingering citrus finish. Drink up.
Name: Mt. Beautiful 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Canterbury)

Description: The quality here has been consistent over the past few vintages, offering solid value in an easy-drinking style. It leads with herbal aromas, but the flavors are less green, more melon and fig carried by a sense of creamy lushness. Drink now.
Name: Starborough 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fragrant apple blossoms and honey perfume this deliciously fresh and fruity Sauvignon Blanc. The dry palate is full bodied with a shower of white peach flavors marked by a quirky lemongrass note and a bright lemon-lime acidity.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: It's rare that a boxed wine scores this well, but truth be told: it's a nice, easy, clean and honest Chilean Sauvignon Blanc with citrus, green fruit aromas and flavors, and ample crispness and snap. Flavors of green pear, passion fruit and anise hint at complexity, while the mouthfeel is acidic, fresh and cleansing.
Name: Gran Verano 2010 3 L Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Tropical is how to best describe the bouquet; it's melony and sweet, but not that zesty or pungent. The palate is round and works well, while flavors of orange pith, lime and sweet grapefruit are just lively enough. Drink now or wait for the 2010.
Name: Aylin 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Tropical is how to best describe the bouquet; it's melony and sweet, but not that zesty or pungent. The palate is round and works well, while flavors of orange pith, lime and sweet grapefruit are just lively enough. Drink now or wait for the 2010.
Name: Aylin 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Solidly mainstream in style, Whitehaven's 2009 Sauvignon Blanc displays slightly sweaty aromas to accent its red bell pepper and passion fruit flavors. It's nicely concentrated, with enough palate weight to pair with slightly rich fish or poultry dishes. Drink up.
Name: Whitehaven 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Still admirably fresh, Delta's 2009 Sauvignon Blanc features pretty straightforward Marlborough traits of red bell pepper, passion fruit and grapefruit in a medium-bodied format. Drink up.
Name: Delta Vineyard 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Bright orange citrus coupled with rich aromas and flavors of green apple, underripe peach and soft fresh grass fill the nose and mouth, with a lively tart acidity cutting through and keeping things lively on the palate. Mouthwatering and easygoing; drink now.
Name: Recanati 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Shomron)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This charming Sauvignon Blanc smells sweetly of fresh pears and honeydew with a sprinkling of powdered sugar. Full bodied but dry with concentrated white grapefruit flavors, its brightened by a nervy acidity and a refreshing minerality in the midpalate.
Name: Damiani 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: For under $10, this is a medium-bodied, slightly soft Sauvignon Blanc that's a good introduction to Marlborough. Melon and fig notes show some herbal underpinnings, but this is an easygoing wine meant to be drunk, not contemplated.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2009 Ti Point Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Try as I might, I haven't been able to jump on board this wine since it debuted three harvests ago. The nose is minerally but short on fruit, which pretty much describes the wine. It's lemony, sharp-edged and lean, with a minerally foundation and modest fruit character. What it lacks is a middle tier or two.
Name: Maycas del Limari 2009 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Light in weight, this is a simple, citrusy sipper, with modest grapefruit and herb elements and a touch of crushed tomato leaf for character. Seems a touch sweet on the finish. Drink up.
Name: Ketu Bay 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Tropical on the nose with lots of melon, guava and pineapple, this is reminiscent of fruit cocktail on both the nose and palate. Despite it's juicy profile, however, it lacks in intensity, but a clean minerality and bright, citrusy acidity keep it refreshing.
Name: Palmer 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: French oak aging makes this rich and creamy with loads of buttery, salted popcorn, toast and vanilla. Dry and full bodied with a luscious mouthfeel, there's a bright, grassy gooseberry note hiding behind all of the oaky richness that could use a bit more attention.
Name: White Springs 2009 Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Grassy and green with tart gooseberries and hints of honeysuckle and pineapple on the nose and palate, this dry wine a little lacking in concentration but refreshing with zippy acidity.
Name: Imagine Moore 2009 Bliss Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Kind of dull on the nose, with white pepper but also a vegetal whiff. The palate is plump, wet and soft, with mealy citrus and green-leaning flavors of canned peas and bell pepper. Not horrible but not all that enticing either; wait for the 2010.
Name: Terra Andina 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This barrel-aged wine just isn't showing well. The nose is all nettles and field weeds; there isn't much fruit and hardly any pungency. The palate is soft and lays around lazily as it offers foxy lemon, banana and oak flavors. Only 250 cases made.
Name: François Lurton 2009 Hacienda Araucano Humo Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

Description: Light weight and somewhat sweet with flavors of gummy peach candy and tropical fruit juice. Short and simple; drink now.
Name: Binyamina 2009 Reserve Kosher Sauvignon Blanc (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This varietally correct Sauvignon Blanc is clean, crisp and refreshing, with plenty of honey, pineapple and green apple, and yet has some meat on its bones, with a rich mouthfeel that belies its all-stainless-steel aging. It also has just a touch (2%) of Sémillon.
Name: Wente 2009 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: This fumé starts with aromas of peach, vanilla and spice, followed by an elegant balance of citrus fruit, toasted vanilla and lemon zest. Fresh but with added body, this SB will pair well with oilier, bolder flavored fish, cheese, cream dishes.
Name: Gerovassiliou 2007 Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (Epanomi)

Description: This is a gorgeous Sauvignon Blanc with notes of sweet pea, honeydew, gooseberry and lemon rind citrus. Medium weight with assertive acidity and a vibrant, mouth-watering finish. Try with lemon roasted chicken or grilled swordfish.
Name: Ataraxia 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: The mouthfeel of this wine is so full and weighty that one might never guess that it's a South African Sauvignon Blanc. On the nose, glimmers of baby powder and chamomile mingle with soft notes of honeydew rind and crisp apple. The limey finish seals the deal nicely, like a comforting signature.
Name: Southern Right 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Description: Bright citrus fruit and slate comes through on the nose of this fresh Sauvignon Blanc. Elegant, minerally and spun with sea salt, it's lemon and orange character is fun and easy drinking. Pair with clams, oysters, grilled fish.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2009 Amethystos Sauvignon Blanc (Drama)

Description: There's a very cool minerality on the nose of this wine, followed by notes of green fruit, white currant and fresh hay on the nose and mouth. Medium weight in the mouth with bracing acidity and a clean, lingering finish.
Name: Lomond 2009 Pincushion Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Cape Agulhas)

Description: The bouquet immediately draws you in with aromas of sweet pea florals, fresh grass, ripe gooseberry and preserved Meyer lemon. The medium-weight mouths offers slightly riper nuances of stone fruit but ends with a tangy citrus-infused finish.
Name: Partnership Vineyards 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: There's a nice complexity to this wine with hints of chalk, fresh honeysuckle and a touch of green pepper spice among the typical sweet grass and citrus characteristics. Balanced with appropriately assertive acidity and a crisp but lingering finish.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: Medium intense aromas of green fig, hard peach and fresh herbs dominate the bouquet, and the riper fruit flavors continue on the fleshy palate. The weight is lifted by accents of clementine citrus that shines through on the close. Drink now.
Name: Groot Constantia 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: Here's a bright Sauvignon Blanc with appealing accents of baby powder and orange blossom running through the dominant nectarine and tangerine aromas and flavors. The mouth is surprisingly round but the finish is mouthwatering and clean.
Name: Beau Joubert 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: The entry starts off a bit green with notes of grass, green plum and a touch of pepper. The mouthfeel is light and lean but offers loads of fresh citrus flavors by way of tart orange supremes and lime rind. The bracing finish and prickly texture make this an easy-drinking choice.
Name: Iona Vineyards 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: This is a lean, easy-to-drink Sauvignon Blanc with traditional flavors of green gooseberry and sharp lime citrus. Herbal thyme and fresh hay aromas add complexity to the nose, while the wine closes on a slightly bitter pith note. Drink up.
Name: Neil Ellis 2009 Sincerely Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: A terrific value: Bright citrus, soft grass and a touch of hard white peach dominate the nose and mouth. Balanced, clean, and very easy to drink. Try with fresh grilled fish or crab cakes.
Name: Makulu 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Orange peel, lemon and peach start this uplifting white. Fresh and fun, it offers flavors of bitter lemon, lime and slate. Pair with grilled octopus, goat cheese or fruit.
Name: Michalakis 2008 Green Passion Sauvignon (Greece)

Description: Sweet notes of orange marmalade, kiwi and green grass keep the leaner notes of gooseberry and pineapple acidity from being too tart. There's the impression of effervescence in the mouth with vibrant tropical fruit flavors lingering through the finish.
Name: KWV 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan, Southwest France, France
Description: A great value white with 8,000 cases imported, so it should be relatively easy to find. Tart gooseberry and lemon flavors integrate with hints of fresh herbs, green hay and soft smoke. Medium weight but lively with gently prickly acidity that lingers through the finish.
Name: François Lurton 2008 Les Fumees Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan)
Region: Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan

Description: Mild yellow peach, citrus and white floral aromas appear on the nose, and a similarly nuanced intensity of flavors continues in the mouth. Clean and soft, this wine is remarkably easy to drink and should match well with lighter fare.
Name: Stellenbosch Hills 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Forward citrus is lifted by accents of thyme and green melon rind in the bouquet. White cranberry and lime pith unfold in the medium-weight mouth and linger through the finish.
Name: Hartenberg 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Here's a clean, racy white with aromas of green gooseberry, wet grass and lemon rind. Balanced in the mouth with a juicy finish.
Name: Bouchard Finlayson 2009 Edgebaston Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This wine smells immediately fresh and tart, with scents of green plum, gooseberry, hard nectarine and straw filling the nose. The leanness continues in the mouth with citrus flavors leading thorough to the clean but lingering finish.
Name: Simonsig 2009 Sunbird Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: An easy-drinking selection with a mouthwatering finish and a softly prickly mouthfeel. Vibrant fruit flavors of hard mango slices, firm nectarine and pineapple acidity. Enjoy now while it's fresh and young.
Name: Domaine de Coussergues NV Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: White peach, sweet citrus, underipe nectarine and delicate dried savory herbs flesh out this racy, light bodied white. Pair with grilled seafood or salad with a lemon vinaigrette.
Name: Mont Tauch 2009 Le Dog d'Anaïs Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Watermelon rind, lime pith and green plum round out this wine's profile. The mouth is light and lean and the finish clean. Drink now.
Name: Raka 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Klein River)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Soft and easy to drink, with notes of green plum, lime citrus and fresh green grass throughout. Round but structured with medium acidity and a crisp, clean finish. Drink now.
Name: Les Jamelles 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: A soft minerality is matched with notes of sweet pea, white peach and green melon on the nose and mouth. Full but clean with a racy citrus finish.
Name: Spier 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Here's a riper, more tropical fruit infused Sauv Blanc with notes of mango, kiwi and yellow peach nectar. The rich fruit continues to dominate the palate, but the lemon-lime citrus finish livens things up on the end.
Name: Le Bonheur 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

Description: Lean but enjoyable with straightforward lemon citrus and green plum aromas and flavors. Drink now.
Name: Ernst Gouws & Co. 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Guenoc Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very light in color and, alas, pleasing flavors, this 100% Sauvignon Blanc from the Langtry Estate's organically farmed Lillie VIneyard begins with guava and coconut, very tropical, but gives in too easily to a not quite ideal level of sweetness and a finish that can only be described, unhappily, as bitter.
Name: Langtry 2009 Lillie Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Guenoc Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Delicate aromas of fresh hay, bay leaf and orange rind unfold in the bouquet, while the mouth offers more green plum and tart citrus pith flavors. Light weight with a short but clean finish.
Name: Les Vignerons de la Méditerranée 2009 Réserve St. Martin Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Always one of the superstar Sauv Blancs from Washington, this is especially good in this vintage. Lots of toast, butter cookie and a streak of vanilla are wrapped into silky, seductive, ripe fruit flavors that mix citrus, orange, papaya and lemon hard candy. This is about 20% Sémillon, barrel fermented.
Name: Novelty Hill 2008 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pungent aromas of concentrated stone fruits, bubble gum, a whiff of diesel and pine tar introduce a multidimensional wine with lip-smacking acidity. All stainless fermented, no malolactic, no acidification—just a clean, pure, natural and richly delicious wine, loaded with ripe, luscious peach, pear, papaya and apricot fruit.
Name: Arbor Crest 2009 Bacchus Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A tasty, round, nicely-balanced, fruity style. Flavors are fruit driven, with lots of melon, apple and pear dominating. The acids are just right, and the wine is as clean and fresh as it can possibly be.
Name: Barrister 2009 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This could be called the signature white for Barnard Griffin, for it always delivers astonishing flavor for the modest price. A small percentage of Sémillon is in the blend, but the sappy, spicy, penetrating herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc is showcased, not disguised. Done in a Sancerre-like style, under 13% alcohol, this is a gorgeous food wine, but you may just want to sip on it all by itself.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2009 Fumé Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A smooth operator with peach, botrytis and flower-blossom aromas. The palate offers flow and a fine mouthfeel, and the flavors of orange, apricot and mango are fresh and tasty. A thorough late-harvest wine that should elicit a smile.
Name: La Playa 2007 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Brown-gold in color, with a staunch, ripe bouquet of syrupy peach, apricot and caramel. The palate is rich and full bodied, with peach, apricot and sweet melon flavors. Thick and satisfying on the finish, but still fairly juicy due to good core acidity.
Name: Morandé 2008 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Happily the fumé has been discarded and it's simply labeled Sauvignon Blanc, as it should be. The blend includes 6% Sémillon, the wine is finished with a screw cap, and the flavors are crisp and quite refreshing. Melon, grapefruit, a little snippet of pineapple and overall a mouth-cleaning liveliness make this an excellent wine for sipping or with lighter entrées.
Name: Hogue 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Pricy for Chilean SB, but clean, good and spunky, with citrus, nettle and bell pepper on the nose. The palate is wet, fresh and snappy, and the flavors exhibit grassiness along with tropical fruit and lime. Cleansing and crisp on the finish, and ready to drink now.
Name: Matetic 2009 EQ Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Green, mildly vegetal and lightly tropical, with a tangy, acid-driven palate and citrusy, sharp flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and orange. Quick on the finish but sizzling, with an abundance of mouth-washing acidity. Very food friendly even toward the end of its prescribed lifespan.
Name: Caliterra 2009 Tributo Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Apple, grapefruit and citrus aromas are neither hard nor pushy, while the palate is fleshy and offers standard citrus, grapefruit and passionfruit flavors. Pithy on the finish but it holds steady. Made for everyday drinking.
Name: Caliterra 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The bouquet delivers snap, clarity and a pure Leyda character, which revolves around ocean-influenced notes of asparagus and green bean. The palate has scour and sizzle, and the flavors suggest lime, green apple and asparagus. Zesty and tangy but also green and leaning toward vegetal.
Name: Viña Leyda 2010 Garuma Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A little soft and showing warmer-climate aromas of passionfruit and tropical citrus. The palate is starting to fade just a bit, but it's still pumping out grapefruit, lime and green apple. Perfectly fine to drink now or wait for the 2010 version.
Name: O. Fournier 2009 Urban Maule Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Honest, citrusy aromas are simple and nice, while the palate is spritzy, zesty and tastes mildly sweet but also correct with mango, lime, apple and orange flavors. Clean, fun and leaning toward sweet. A good value white to drink immediately.
Name: Palo Alto 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Pungent aromas of asparagus, sea grass and lime are pure Leyda, and while the wine seems to be softening with age, it does offer enough acids to keep it moving. Flavors of lime and green bean are green in nature, and there's seltzer and more lime on the finish. May already be past its sell date.
Name: Amaral 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Opens with honey, orange and a bit of harsh matchstick. The palate is sticky and comes up just short of cloying, with candied melon, citrus and mango flavors. Finishes sweet and sugary, with caramel and toffee notes. Tasty but unctuous.
Name: Echeverria 2007 Late Harvest Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: An attractive wine that is herbaceous, with a hint of citrus and with a richer texture that also offers fresh pears and cream. A good, fresh apéritif.
Name: Real Companhia Velha 2009 Quinta de Cidrô Sauvignon Blanc (Duriense)

Description: This wine varies in quality and perception based on when in its lifespan you taste it. Now, toward the end of the line, it's tropical and hanging in there, with green apple, citrus and other typical SB aromas and flavors. Even with 15% Carmenère in the blend for kicks, it's standard and workmanlike.
Name: oops 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Sweaty and sharp on the nose, with punchy, oily, green aromas. The palate is wet and basic in feel, with nettle, grapefruit and passionfruit flavors. Good in terms of core qualities but not all that intense or layered. A basic wine for general consumption.
Name: William Cole 2010 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The low-level “good” rating is more a reflection of the wine's age than its core qualities. It's flat and wayward now, with no real direction to the nose or palate. It tastes bland and semisweet, with dying acids and simple flavors of apple and melon. Go with the '09, then look for the '10.
Name: Matetic 2008 EQ Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Loved the 2008 but at this point in time I can't say the same about this bottling. It's vegetal, with heavy bell pepper and asparagus aromas and flavors. Low-volume zest and kick indicates that it has turned; best to wait for the 2010 because this is too green and flat.
Name: O. Fournier 2009 Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Neutral on the nose to the point of dull and mute. The palate is more wet than complex, and the flavors of apple, candy and toffee are basic at best. For a half-bottle priced at $25, this is underwhelming and far too simple in all facets.
Name: François Lurton 2008 Hacienda Araucano Kochii Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Hard, acrid and sweaty smelling, with a plump but dilute-feeling palate that shows flavors of bitter peach pit, white grapefruit and citrus. Hard and bitter on the finish. Harmony is questionable; overall quality is sketchy.
Name: Viña el Aromo 2009 Private Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Short on aromatics, with only a whiff of pear and corn. The palate is soft and fleshy, with dry, limited papaya and melony flavors. Lettuce and other green notes carry the finish, which is bland and dilute. Will have a very short lifespan.
Name: Echeverria 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Simple and neutral, with sweetness to the nose. It's soft and flabby in the mouth, with candied vanilla and melon flavors. Sweet and low in intensity, and already it's dull despite being a new release.
Name: Quasar 2010 Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: This marks two years in a row that this wine ranks low. It's dull, devoid of aromas and sour. Tastes green and bland, with little to latch onto. Just never gets going.
Name: Morandé 2009 Edición Limitada Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Regarded as a Styrian Grand Cru, the Kranachberg produces landmark Sauvignon Blanc. In the hands of Wilhelm Sattler, the richness of the fruit, with its almost tropical spice element, is tinged with elegance as well as great concentration. There is a fresh, racy aftertaste.
Name: Sattlerhof 2008 Kranachberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: With a density of nearly 7,000 vines per acre, and consequent low yields, it is not surprising this is a concentrated, intense wine. It has quintessential herbaceous flavors, rounded out with a creamed apple element and a tight, steely texture. Age for 3–4 years.
Name: Château de Tracy 2008 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A full-bodied wine, just lightly wooded in character. Its acidity is beautifully integrated with rich lees flavors, grapefruit and bright apple. It is a complex wine, deliciously perfumed and likely to age well over 3–4 years.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2008 La Vigne de Beaussopet  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Sancerre-like effort shows amazing concentration and distinct, vineyard-driven flavors of grain and herb. Racy, textural, crisp and penetrating, it's lifted by a refreshing minerality. Lemon polish, citrus oil, a very delicate suggestion of honey in the nose and mouth, and above all a wonderful persistence make this a standout Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2009 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A floral, tropical fruit-influenced wine that is round in character and full of wonderfully opulent fruit. The final acidity stays within the ripe fruit character.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2008 La Comtesse  (Sancerre)

Description: A big and bold Sauvignon Blanc, packed with flavors of mango, nectarine and fresh herbs that come together beautifully on the nose and palate. Long on the finish. Drink now through mid-2011.
Name: Villa Maria 2009 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Wairau Valley)

Description: This terrific Sauvignon Blanc is marked by slightly pungent notes of green tomato or crushed tomato leaf, seamlessly married to smooth, ripe, tropical fruit. It's a bit creamy in texture, almost lush, with a long, mouthcoating finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2009 Taylors Pass Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The flint of the Rochoy vineyard gives off great heat, turning this into a ripe and complex wine. It is steely, with a strong mineral character, finishing with a wonderful, lifting acidity.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2008 Le Rochoy  (Sancerre)

Description: The folks at Wairau River have picked up their game, turning out a slightly austere, minerally 2009 that balances those attributes with hints of nectarine, melon and fig. It's medium-bodied, with a long finish.
Name: Wairau River 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From a parcel at the highest point of the Tracy vineyard, this is a spectacular, densely mineral wine, taking its flavor from the soil. It is spicy, ripe and very full, with light tropical fruits as well as a taut and tight texture. Age for 2–3 years.
Name: Château de Tracy 2008 101 Rangs  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: A powerful wine, tropical in its fruit flavors with mango and guava and layered with a mineral texture. This is rich and concentrated, with acidity that gives a great final bite.
Name: Pascal & Nicolas Reverdy 2008 Les Anges Lots  (Sancerre)

Description: Ripe, rich Sauvignon Blanc with apple and green pepper flavors, spiced up with herbs. It moves to the herbaceous side of Sauvignon Blanc while also retaining fine concentration. Screw cap.
Name: Sattlerhof 2009 Sernauberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This starts off herbal and green, with hints of nettles, but those elements settle down, ending up as a welcome, complex accent to the ripe nectarine fruit. Drink up over the next few months.
Name: Forefathers 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A taut and mineral wine, with intense acidity followed by peach flavors. The wine successfully manages   to combine a crisp edge and rich fruit, with delicious results.
Name: Pascal & Nicolas Reverdy 2008 Les Coûtes  (Sancerre)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In 2009 this single vineyard offering includes 11% Sémillon. It has wonderful texture, and a mix of light herbal flavors that run through a gamut from celery to lemongrass and up into tart citrus fruit. The acidity is generous but not searing; it penetrates but never overpowers. A quintessential food wine.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: With its aromas of tropical fruits, this is a rich wine. There is also a fine streak of minerality, spiked with lemon juice and textured with green plum skins. It is fresh, full and very dry.
Name: Vincent Pinard 2008 Cuvée Florès  (Sancerre)

Description: This wine does a nice job balancing its tropical fruit aromas and flavors with leafy, green notes. Ripe nectarine and grapefruit lie at the core, while herbal flourishes garnish the nose and finish.
Name: Saveé Sea 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Wonderful herbaceous aromas shout Sauvignon Blanc. There is also a tropical element in the ripe fruit of this fine, cleanly fresh wine. It has good density, a layer of minerality and a shot of bright final acidity.
Name: Château de Tracy 2008  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Ata Rangi isn't known for its Sauvignon Blanc—the Pinot Noir is what everyone clamors for—but perhaps it should be. This is an excellent effort, balancing pineapple and citrus fruit with a hint of grassiness. Despite being well over a year old, it remains fresh, lively and crisp, with a long, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Ata Rangi 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: A rich wine with some tropical fruit character fixed firmly in a very mineral context. Very firm and rich, there is a grapefruit character to the texture. A fresh finish rounds it off.
Name: Domaine Laporte 2008 Les Duchesses  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Year after year this ranks as one of Chile's most complex and satisfying SBs. The nose is like an ocean breeze mixed with saline, citrus and fresh greens. The palate blends zestiness with fleshy weight, and the flavors suggest lime, green apple and grapefruit. Clean and long on the finish; drink now before it fades.
Name: Montes 2009 Limited Selection Leyda Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Minerally and pure, with coastal-influenced nettle, green apple and passion fruit aromas. This is a very good, snappy wine with pure citrus, minerality, lime and grapefruit flavors. And that's also how it finishes. As the field of coastal Chilean SBs grow, Cool Coast from Casa Silva is one to keep an eye on.
Name: Casa Silva 2009 Cool Coast Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: On the restrained side, with flinty aromas giving way to notes of grapefruit, melon and fig on the palate. Finishes with a touch of leafiness.
Name: Nautilus 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though crafted in 100% new French oak, this retains its strong varietal character, but some of the acidic sharpness is softened by the barrel fermentation. Fresh and clean, it brings sweet grain and herb flavors to a mix of pineapple and green apple fruit. Nice, snappy, tart finish.
Name: Guardian 2009 Angel Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a food-friendly Sauvignon blended with hints of Riesling (for acidity) and Viognier (for fragrance). Citrus and grassy notes strike just the right balance, and there's a pleasant creaminess to the wine's texture. Drink it over the next six months.
Name: Wild Rock 2009 Elevation Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A very good effort, with attractive nectarine and melon fruit underscored by grapefruit notes that brighten and enliven the long, mouthcoating finish.
Name: Tablelands 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Wilhelm Sattler's entry-level Sauvignon Blanc is a beautiful, intense wine, packed with black currant and pineapple fruits, layered with gooseberry. The effect is vibrant, fruity, with just an extra touch of class.
Name: Sattlerhof 2009 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Old vine (1967 planting) Sauvignon Blanc from Oregon? OK, this is a rarity. The wine has a gentle grace, and manages to convey layering and complexity within a fairly light frame. Moderate acidity, some yeasty texture, and a mix of apple and citrus fruit all come together in a clean, fresh, well-balanced effort.
Name: Kestrel 2008 Old Vine Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (OR))

Description: From Sauvignon Blanc grown in the vineyards of the Mateus palace, this is a classic, herbaceous wine with attractive fresh and grassy acidity. The high altitude fruit is bright and crisp.
Name: Lavradores de Feitoria 2009 Três Bagos Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Duriense)

Description: A step up in quality from the 2008—not surprising given the relative strength of the vintage. A flinty note accents nectarine and grapefruit flavors in this light- to medium-bodied offering, lingering nicely on the finish.
Name: Mount Fishtail 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Grove Mill's 2009 Sauvignon Blanc strikes a pleasant balance between zesty citrus and ripe stone fruit. It's medium-bodied and plump in the mouth, with a crisp, clean finish that invites another sip.
Name: Grove Mill 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: With mineral and apple on the nose, this qualifies as a pure and pleasing SB for almost any occasion. The palate is elegant and lithe, while the flavors of green apple, gooseberry and grapefruit are what they should be. Pure, sound and solid wine to drink right now.
Name: Casa Silva 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With the largest production in the entire Northwest, it is important that this wine express clean, varietal flavors with characteristic brightness and focus. And it does. Lightly herbal, fresh and clean, its fruit flavors suggest lemongrass, orange and ripe apple. Excellent balance and persistence
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With aromas of prickly citrus, nettle, cucumber and green fruits, this is hanging in there well. The palate seems to be softening with age, but there's enough acidity left to prop up the green apple, bell pepper and tarragon flavors. A good, basic SB from Casablanca to drink now.
Name: Veramonte 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The Crossings continues to be a reliable source of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc at a reasonable price. The 2009 seems almost sweet in its intensity of ripe nectarine fruit, but there's enough grapefruit for balance and just a trace of herb on the finish.
Name: The Crossings 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Tropical and ripe with aromas and flavors of gooseberry, soft lychee, rose petals and orange blossom. Attractive and easy to drink with moderate acidity and a clean, medium length finish.
Name: De Grendel 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: A good Sauvignon Blanc but not up to the standards set by previous vintages of Terrunyo. The nose is less exciting and pungent than it has been, with grassy, generic citrus aromas. The flavors are slightly green and vegetal, with asparagus mixing with green apple and melon. And it's more soft-sided than memory suggests it should be. Drink now.
Name: Concha y Toro 2009 Terrunyo Vineyard Selection Block 28 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This value-priced offering starts off with slightly subdued notes of passion fruit, but gains a bit of intensity on the palate. It's a simple, tropically fruity Sauvignon Blanc with a soft, easygoing finish.
Name: Frenzy 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Restrained, with a slightly herbal edge to the mineral notes of wet stones. This is medium in weight and rather creamy in texture, giving it a food-friendly vibe. Drink up.
Name: Nick Goldschmidt 2009 Boulder Bank Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fairly pungent and lively for an '09, with citric, grapefruit aromas. The palate is still fairly vivid and driving, and the flavors of lemon-lime and green apple are true if a touch pithy. Just zesty enough on the finish, but it's starting to fade. Drink now.
Name: TerraNoble 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Beautiful fresh green grass aromas are backed by sweet grapefruit oil and ripe gooseberry in this attractive Sauv Blanc. Full but not fat with a hint of ripe melon lingering on the finish.
Name: Thelema 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This medium-bodied, slightly creamy-textured Sauvignon Blanc showcases gooseberry and pink grapefruit flavors, with an appealing herbal note on the finish.
Name: Sileni 2010 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Waipara isn't usually considered Sauvignon Blanc country, but this is a creditable effort, boasting ample melon and fig flavors and a shot of grassiness on the otherwise soft finish.
Name: Grey's Peak 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

Description: There's a nice minerality to this wine, with ripe and juicy aromas of citrus, honeydew and soft white florals. The mouth is tightly structured with flavors of sweet citrus, green berries and white strawberry hull. Balanced and clean with the medium weight mouth countered by appropriately zesty acidity.
Name: Mulderbosch 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Fresh and vibrant, with hints of herbs and flowers alongside figs and citrus fruits. This is light in body but not light on flavor, although it does finish a bit short.
Name: Martinborough Vineyard 2009 Russian Jack Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: The light and soft bouquet offers faint glimmers of fresh-cut grass and tart green berries. More of the same unfolds in the mouth, with lime citrus and green gooseberry leading through to the crisp finish.
Name: Vrede en Lust 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: Very leafy and herbal—think crushed tomato leaf—but there's an adequate complement of tropical fruit to keep things moving along. Would work just right with parsley-laden mussels.
Name: Waimea 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: This Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc is very easy to drink, if slightly lacking distinctiveness. Melon and fig flavors finish on a slightly grassy note, while the texture is plump and soft.
Name: Smythe & Renfield 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Spunky and bright in terms of its aromatics, with musky lime and mineral notes. The palate is both juicy and round, with lemon, lime and piercing, pithy citrus flavors. Citric, sheering and foxy on the finish, and exceedingly cleansing.
Name: William Cole 2009 Albamar Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is a fresh and easy to drink white that's perfect for pairing with salads or citrus-based grilled fish. Medium weight with prominent tart flavors of lemony citrus and green berries, and the finish offers a hint of fresh hay.
Name: DeWaal 2009 Young Vines Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This wine would compare favorably with the least expensive Sauv Blancs from New Zealand or Chile. It avoids the unripe pea vine or asparagus flavors that can afflict those wines, and brings light, fresh, sweetly grassy flavors to the palate. A little unfocused, but pleasurable and crisp, this is a good all-purpose seafood wine.
Name: Columbia Crest 2009 Two Vines Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Description: Leafy and herbal, with green tomato and pineapple flavors that mesh surprisingly well. It's medium-bodied, with a slight tang on the finish.
Name: Zeal 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Light in aromas, with hints of Barlett pear, vanilla and stone. The palate is tangy and citric, with lemon-lime and green apple flavors. Turns more astringent and tart the more you get to know it, so chill it down and drink it soon for best results.
Name: Catrala 2009 Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A soft, medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc, the 2010 Overstone features ripe fruit flavors that skirt melon and fig before heading into guava, with just enough citrus to help balance the ledger.
Name: Overstone 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc smells like fruit cocktail, and the flavors that follow are pleasantly reminiscent of guava, but slightly one-dimensional. Finishes soft.
Name: Konrad 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Starts off slightly flinty on the nose, then delivers restrained grapefruit flavors on the palate, tinged with green peas. Medium-bodied, with a short finish; drink it over the next couple of months.
Name: Silver Beach 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite grassy and herbaceous, this is a Sauvignon Blanc for those who favor the tight, acidic-style of Loire valley versions. Citrus fruits and plenty of sharp acidity make this a wine to match with food, especially a nice goat cheese from the local farmers' market.
Name: Covey Run 2008 Quail Series Fumé Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From the folks at Spy Valley, this is a sweaty, pungent rendition of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, laden with hints of tomato leaf and herbs. Drink up.
Name: Satellite 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Smells like green pepper, saline and green apple. The palate has a pithy feel and sweet, mildly flabby flavors of tropical and citrus fruits. Seems a touch bitter and pithy on the back palate, with lime peel controlling the finish.
Name: La Playa 2009 Block Selection Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Disappointing after the success of last year's version, Kato's 2009 is a lightweight Sauvignon Blanc with herbal, bell-peppery component. There's a tart stridency on the finish that will serve it well with some dishes, less so with others.
Importer: Clos Du Val Wine/Goelet Wine Estates
Name: Kato 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Honeyed on the nose and palate, with mild citrus and green qualities like nettle and lime. The feel is kind of soft for Casablanca SB, and the flavors seem more tropical and sweet than they should be. Finishes soft, pithy and sweet.
Name: William Cole 2009 Columbine Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Smells bland, with a bit of apple. The palate is candied and soft, with sweet orange, mango and other tropical flavors. Finishes honeyed and lazy, with sweet, simple flavors of honeydew and apple juice.
Designation: Equilibrio Made With Organically Grown Grapes
Name: Aresti 2009 Equilibrio Made With Organically Grown Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays de France, France Other, France
Description: Ripe Sauvignon Blanc, bringing out pear and apple flavors, topped with cream. There is a bite from an apple skin texture, along with bright, delicate acidity.
Name: Guy Saget 2008 La Petite Perrière Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays de France)

Description: Light in body and pungent almost to the point of sweatiness, with leafy, herbal flavors that soften on the finish.
Name: Woollaston 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc features some nice lime and grapefruit flavors, but it turns tart, chalky and almost metallic on the finish. It's certainly zesty, but it clangs off the rim instead of swooshing straight on through.
Name: Martinborough Vineyard 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Light and herbal, marked by restrained, melony fruit and leafy notes that lack overall intensity and complexity. Drink now.
Name: Glazebrook 2009 Regional Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: The bubbles really intensify the varietal character of this sparkling Sauvignon Blanc, supersizing its grassy, grapefruity aromas, while passion fruit flavors come through on the palate.
Name: De Bortoli NV Emeri Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Aromas of hay, baked corn and honey suggest that this wine has lost or is fast losing its vitality. The palate is round and full, with honeyed, soft flavors of apple and grass. Finishes mushy, another indication that it's on its last legs.
Name: Maniña 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Starts out solid enough, with notes of white grapefruit, passion fruit and mineral. Then it turns decidedly vegetal, with heavy flavors of asparagus, canned green beans and bell pepper. By the time it finishes you're firmly in the green zone.
Name: Viña Leyda 2009 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Strongly herbal and pungent to the point of sweatiness, with just a bit of citrusy fruit creeping in on the otherwise lightweight finish.
Name: Mussel Bay 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Creamy, bland and short on kick, aromas and flavors. The palate is spongey and tastes of creamed apple, light herbs and white pepper. It's inoffensive but not worth much attention. Finishes a bit vegetal as well.
Name: Uva Negra 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: A bit sweaty smelling, with pinched grapefruit aromas and distant citrus. The flavors say generic apple and lime, and there's a flatness to it. It's a little sugary as well. OK for a wine with pronounced low acidity.
Name: Staphyle 2009 Vástago de Gea Sauvignon Blanc (Argentina)

Description: A bit skunky on the nose, with pickled green-fruit aromas. The palate is spritzy at first and then goes flat, while it tastes of generic tropical fruit and bitter greens. Soft, fleshy and hollow on the finish.
Name: Sun Valley 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Lontué Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Smells oxidized, as if it's dying. The palate is bland in feel and the flavors suggest fermented orange juice. Not hideous but uninspired; shows only a modicum of citrus character and pulse.
Name: Familia Cassone 2009 La Florencia Sauvignon Blanc (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: The acidity is the problem here. It is out of balance with what seems to be a layer of sweetness that leaves a huge hole in the middle. Screw cap.
Name: Michel Picard 2008  Sancerre

Description: . Christoph Neumeister's top wine, this is a classic among Sauvignon Blancs. It is tightly structured, very herbal, with greengage and gooseberry flavors over asparagus and spice. It can age well, needing 3–4 years to reach its peak.
Name: Neumeister 2008 Moarfeitl Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: From a steep vineyard above the village of Straden, this has wonderful tropical fruit aromas, the fruit beautifully ripe. Ripe, smooth, rounded, the acidity giving just the right final burst of herbal freshness.
Name: Neumeister 2009 Klausen Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is just the third Sauvignon Blanc from Stevens (none was made in 2008), sourced from Klipsun vineyard and stainless steel fermented. Richly textural, with a creamy minerality, this has a pleasing intensity, a sort of nervosity (as the French might put it), lined with a sweet grain character. The fruits are tart and racy, a mix of citrus rind and pulp, tangerine and pineapple, finished with natural acidity.
Name: Stevens 2009 AnotherThought Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Fresh and creamy wine, green herbs over apricots and pears. The wine is textured, with a good mineral, sea salt character, the fruit giving a rich final mouthfeel.
Name: Neumeister 2009 Sauvignon Blanc Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: On the tropical side of Sauvignon Blanc, this is packed with mango and apricot flavors, direct and fruity. There is just a final touch of green herbs.
Name: Kollwentz 2009 Steinmühle Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Pithy and peachy on the nose, and not nearly as zesty smelling as it is in the mouth, where angular, crisp acids push flavors of citrus and passionfruit. Zesty with a ton of kick, and very much in the Leyda mold of being oceanic and full of passionfruit. Mature but not fading; drink before summer 2011.
Name: Santa Rita 2009 Medalla Real Single Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Lively and a touch prickly, with strong aromas and flavors that properly reflect its Leyda roots. The nose is oceanic and sharp, while the palate is forward and tastes of lime and grapefruit. On the finish, notes of passionfruit and lychee are introduced. Tropical but true SB to drink as soon as possible.
Name: Arboleda 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Clean and ripe, with apple, pear and zesty citrus aromas. The palate runs more round and candied than linear and sharp, with sweet, welcoming flavors of white peach and dried citrus fruits. Fuller-bodied and inviting, but still fresh. Drink immediately.
Name: Montes 2009 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Tropical and also citric, and holding steady as the 2010s hit the market. The palate here is familiar, tangy and well constructed, with sweet melon and zesty citrus flavors offsetting one another. The finish is easy and overall this is a fresh, clean, modest wine that should be drunk right away.
Name: Espiritu de Chile 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Fragrant of freshly cut grass, honeydew melon and orange blossoms, this dry, medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc from Slovenia has pleasant grapefruit and lemon flavors and a racy, zippy acidity that tingles on the tongue. It's a simple but refreshing wine with a lime zest and smoke finish.
Name: Verus Vineyards 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Štajerska)

Description: Tropical and more blunt and citric than previous vintages. At first blush, it's borderline sheering and sharp, but with time it mellows and settles on pungent grapefruit and citrus flavors. Predominantly it's about zest and power; not as balanced as prior bottlings.
Name: Kingston Family 2009 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Flowery and powdery on the nose, and then pillowy on the palate. Yes, there's enough acidity here to keep it vital, while the flavors lean toward sweet, ripe passion fruit and pink grapefruit. Very easygoing and at peak maturity; drink now.
Name: Ventisquero 2009 Queulat Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Over-the-top, starting with the aromas of nettle, sweat and grapefruit. With Sauvignon Blanc there's citric and then there's citric, and this SB forgoes elegance and finesse and instead pushes wild grapefruit, passionfruit and green citrus. It's extreme and highly aggressive. Needs refining.
Name: Santa Carolina 2009 Ocean Side Specialties Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Smells like pineapple blended with lemon candy. Zesty in the mouth, with crisp lemon, lime, bell pepper and a touch of mineral stoniness. Long on the finish, and for a wine of this price it's delivering the max. Likable and not complicated.
Name: Viña La Rosa 2009 La Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Grapefruit and oily mineral aromas are typical of average Chilean SB, while the palate carries a bland citrusy feel and generic flavors of lemon and grapefruit. A citrusy specimen, but that's about all it's showing.
Name: Odfjell 2009 Armador Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Nothing special but probably a better wine and better value than Crucero's Reserva SB. The nose offers matchstick and some hard minerality, while the palate is crisp and tangy but gives smooth edges and reasonably nice citrus and mineral flavors. Highly regular, even for a Central Valley Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Siegel 2009 Crucero Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Generic tropical fruit and melon aromas are basic but still largely fresh. The palate brings a zesty, acid-driven approach and flavors of lemon and sour orange. Finishes crisp but short on flavor; adequate but not offering a lot. Typical Central Valley SB.
Name: San Elias 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: The nose on this Bulgarian Sauvignon Blanc opens with white flowers and honey, but devolves rapidly to scents of musk and feline spray. Dry, with brisk acidity, there's some refreshing lemon zest and melon rind flavors on the palate. The viscosity of this medium-bodied wine is pleasant, but the finish ends on a dusty note.
Name: Vini 2009 Veni Vidi Vici Sauvignon Blanc (Thracian Valley)

Description: Sulfur and matchstick on the nose is offputting, while what remains suggests oily green fruits. The palate is sharp and acidic, with green fruit flavors and a sharpness that suggests salad with vinaigrette. Doesn't click, really.
Name: Siegel 2009 Crucero Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Though pleasant aromatically with lots of freshly cut grass and gooseberry notes, this full-bodied, dry Bulgarian Sauvignon Blanc has a dense, clunky mouthfeel and a bracingly high acidity. There's some decent lemon and grapefruit flavors, but plenty of tinned green asparagus as well.
Name: Targovishte 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Bulgaria)

Description: Dull pear and papaya aromas are not very Sauvignon-like, and the mouth is both flat and spritzy, creating a “go figure” type of reaction. Flavors of banana and papaya are weak and bitter. Frankly, this just isn't good SB.
Name: Lapostolle 2009 Casa Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Evergreen vineyard, and again it was barrel fermented in neutral French oak. The aromas are wild and true, sweet herb and grass, suffused with marmalade and honey. The wine is intensely bright and spicy, with sharply-defined citrus fruits and rinds, and exceptional length.
Name: Efeste 2009 Feral Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Sweet grass, tart gooseberry and tropical fruit acidity abound on the fairly intense nose of this Sauv Blanc. Prickly and jumpy in the mouth with solid underripe pear and white peach flavors. Refreshing and satisfying with a clean finish; try with mayonaise-based seafood salad or lemon-grilled fillet fish.
Name: Jardin 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Crisp and juicy, with melon and sweet grassy fruit flavors, this nicely textural and fruit-powered Sauvignon Blanc is varietal without being aggressively herbaceous.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A delicate and more nuanced wine that needs a little bit more attention to unearth all its complexities. A soft chalky minerality and dried thyme herbality complement the soft white peach and plantain aromas. The tangy, medium-weight mouth shows more lemony cirtus notes, supporting flavors of white currant and flowers. The finish is clean and brisk, leaving you ready for more. Drink now.
Name: Warwick 2009 Professor Black Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Vibrant, tart aromas of green gooseberries and lime rind elevate the underlying hay and fresh thyme herbal accents. Lean, barely ripe white peach and hard pear add volume to the medium-weight mouth. Balanced and seamless with a clean, refreshing finish. Drink up!
Name: Douglas Green 2009 Vineyard Creations Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: A more earthy and herbal option with intense aromas of fresh hay, thyme sprigs and whole bay leaf among notes of green stone fruit and citrus. The mouth exhibits a wonderful balance between tart and ripe fruit flavors, with lean gooseberry and ripe guava playing well against one another, while still maintaining its herbal core throughout. Smoothly textured with excellent, clean acidity and a solid finish.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2009 Bergkelder Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: With 7,000 cases imported, you should be able to find this stellar Sauv Blanc fairly easily. Aromas of sweet grass, gooseberry and pineapple acidity draw you in immediately, while flavors of ripe stone fruit carry through to the clean but not aggressive finish. Lightweight and linear but not meaningless, with a hint of peach pit nuttiness lingering on the close.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2009 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: This is a light-weight, clean and refreshing wine that's a perfect choice for grilled chicken salads and crab cakes over frisée. Wet grass, underripe nectarine, lemon-lime citrus and green gooseberry along with accents of white lilly florals fill the nose and palate. Vibrant and enjoyable now, so drink up.
Name: Fairvalley 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: Medium intense on the nose with hints of feline essence, green grass, white cranberry and firm peach. Grapefruit citrus lifts the palate and livens up the finish. A well-balanced wine with all of the elements integrating nicely and a crisp finish to seal the deal.
Name: Juno 2009 Cape Maidens Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Smells tart and lean with aromas of white currant, green pepper, hay and feline. The linear mouth offers more orange citrus and slightly sour but surprisingly vibrant watermelon rind flavors. Brisk and mouthwatering; pair with cold soups like watermelon gazpacho or chilled asparagus soup.
Name: Sunshine Organics 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Refreshing and light, with a mix of melon, apple and pear. Slightly fizzy, yeasty, and with a hint of vanilla cracker in the finish.
Name: Mercer 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A touch of feline essence plays against notes of sweeter tropical notes in the bouquet, producing a somewhat conflicting initial perception upon nosing. The mouthfeel is flabby and a little too round, with overly soft stone fruit and mushy pear flavors leading to into the mowed grass finish.
Name: Tall Horse 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A sharp, just this side of volatile Sauvignon Blanc, this is already showing some tawny tones though it's only a 2008. Perhaps the clear glass bottle is the culprit, but the wine is pretty far down the aging curve. Grassy and herbal, with a quick, sharp finish.
Name: Canyon's Edge 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Intense and ripe in the nose and mouth with notes of passion fruit, mushy peach and mango acidity. The mouth is medium weight and a bit flabby, needing a bigger lift and vibrancy from the acidity than what's offered.
Name: Rooiberg 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Young, yeasty, almost to the point of being beery, this thin Sauvignon Blanc recalls a Vinho Verde. Cucumber and fennel flavors dominate, along with plenty of acidity.
Name: Springhouse Cellar 2008 Drawing A Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: Eradus continues a successful run with this year's Sauvignon Blanc. As usual, it's fairly pungent and herbal upfront, but then delivers waves of passion fruit. It's concentrated and fairly full-bodied for a Sauvignon, with a lingering finish.
Name: Eradus 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A terrific example of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, the 2009 Swamp Block features ripe melon and nectarine fruit, balanced by hints of garden greens, such as tomato leaf and bell pepper. It's plump and succulent on the palate, with a long, slightly honeyed finish.
Name: Saint Clair 2009 Pioneer Block 2 Swamp Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Even tasted blind, this wine's Awatere origins shone through, bursting with fresh nettles and tomato leaf which garnish currant-like fruit. It's amply concentrated and round in the mouth, then long and mouthwatering on the finish.
Name: Awatere River 2009 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Of all this year's seven Pioneer Block Sauvignon Blanc offerings, this one most seamlessly blends passion fruit, green tomatoes and leafy notes into a medium-bodied yet amply concentrated wine with a long, citrusy finish.
Name: Saint Clair 2009 Pioneer Block 6 Oh! Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Grassy and almost feline on the nose, with lime and grapefruit flavors, this is a bit simple in some respects, but the power and intensity of this wine make a strong statement that lingers forever on the palate. Distinctive and well worth a try.
Name: Saint Clair 2009 Pioneer Block 18 Snap Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent and sweaty but nevertheless inviting, this is a walk on the wild side of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. It's full-on boxwood and passionfruit; a potent, weighty wine with a intensely feral quality. Drink now.
Name: Barker's Marque 2009 3 Brooms Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
