Name: Corinto 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Grassy, citrus aromas are followed by fresh flavors of herbs, apple, lemon and grapefruit in this refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. Simple but appealing, it will pair well with grilled fish and spicy cuisine.
Name: Glen Manor 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Description: Fresh and lively, this wine offers grapefruit and lemon on the nose and clean, citrus flavors on the palate. Lean but friendly, it will pair well with spicy cuisine: think Chinese or Indian.
Name: Penns Woods 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Pennsylvania)

Description: Opens with slightly pickled apple and melon aromas. Next in line is an edgy palate of pickled apple and vinaigrette flavors. Very pithy and tasting of grapefruit late. Fairly heavy and aggressive for SB.
Name: Alpataco 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Neuquén)

Description: Citrus, lychee and a slight, briney, pickled quality define the nose. The palate has enough acidity to ensure a proper mouthfeel, although the flavors of white grapefruit and pear are basic at best. Finishes slight, bland and mildly bitter.
Name: Funky Llama 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is another outstanding Sauvignon Blanc from Novelty Hill—ripe and juicy, showing citrus, mango and pear, laced with cinnamon highlights. Winemaker Mike Januik manages to get the most from these young vines, crafting white wines that are both rich and elegant, retain varietal character, and seduce you with hedonistic detail.
Name: Novelty Hill 2007 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A lovely, ripe rendition of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, the 2008 Stich features bold passion fruit and guava shadings, a lushly textured mouthfeel and a long, vibrant finish. It should be consumed now and over the next few months.
Name: Jackson Estate 2008 Stich Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: We won't call this the best Terrunyo SB to date, but it is typically clean, mineral and full of lime and passion fruit. The overall balance and purity are up the ladder, while the flavors of green fruits, passion fruit, brine and lime don't hold back. Top notch SB from Chile to drink now.
Name: Concha y Toro 2008 Terrunyo El Triángulo Vineyard Block: 28 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: It seems this Italian venture is starting to hit its stride, turning in a plump, round offering layered with complexity. It starts off sweaty and pungent, then develops more melon and nectarine scents with aeration. Those flavors follow through on the palate, followed by persistent notes of white grapefruit on the finish.
Name: Mount Nelson 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This captures the essential flavors of Washington Sauvignon Blanc. There are no aggressive grassy-herbal flavors, none of the vegetal or canned pea flavors that show up in other New World Sauv Blancs. Here it's all about clean melon and yellow fruit flavors, backed with bracing natural acids, round and ripe.
Name: Ardenvoir 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made in a fruity, fairly ripe style, this affordable Savvy features scents of fig, melon and nectarine, with a richer texture than most and a long, lush finish.
Name: Wild Rock 2008 Elevation Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: As close to a sure thing as Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc gets, St. Clair's Wairau Reserve offers hints of tropical fruit accented by leafy notes reminiscent of nettles and tomato plants. There's plenty of weight and concentration on the palate, leading into a long, greenish finish.
Name: Saint Clair 2008 Wairau Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: VM's Clifford Bay bottling almost always has a pronounced herbal-vegetal streak running through it, and the 2008 is no exception. The bell-pepper note is balanced by melon and fig in this medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. Crisp and assertive on the finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2008 Clifford Bay Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a nicely made Marlborough Sauvignon at an attractive price, with herbal, grassy notes and a touch of bell pepper backed by underlying tropical fruit. It's round without being soft, retaining sufficient crispness to serve alone or with seafood.
Name: Wairau River 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an estate-grown, stainless-steel fermented, perfectly varietal expression of Sauvignon Blanc. It's not trying to be Chardonnay, happily; rather it shows the pleasantly grassy side of the grape, with light melon and green apple fruit flavors.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2008 Steel Horse Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Couvillion's Sauvignon Blanc is pure varietal, from Sagemoor vineyard grapes. It's been barrel fermented in neutral oak, and the resulting wine has a round, lightly oaky, buttery mouthfeel. Well made.
Name: Couvillion 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Driven by bold pineapple and passion fruit aromas, this medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc boasts a smooth mouthfeel and silky texture. It's a nice drop, with the only quibble being that the herb and citrus flavors peter out a bit quickly on the finish.
Name: Long Boat 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Snappy lemon, grapefruit and apples aromas lead this fresh white from Bovin. On the palate, grassy flavors with fresh white fruits are backed by a lively minerality. Clean and flavorful—a perky go-to white with food pairing potential.
Name: Bovin 2007 Sauvignon (Tikves)

Description: Like many very good Marlborough Sauvignons that don't quite merit a top score, this wine features bold citrus and herb flavors that start strong but lose their intensity on the finish. Still, the pineapple and nectarine notes graced with grassy-herbal hints are undeniably attractive. Drink now.
Name: Tupari 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This speaks to the increasing popularity of Sauvignon Blanc, as Ste. Michelle has more than doubled its case production over 2007. It's herbal and clean, with lightly grassy scents and flavors, leading into a mix of citrus and grapefruit and green apple. A fine standard for affordable Washington Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and lemony, with green apple and lime flavors. The vintage is noted for its high acidity, and this wine is definitely for acid lovers. Fermented in stainless, with 20% aged in new French oak for just 14 weeks.
Name: CAVU Cellars 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Wood aging has given this wine some roundness and softness without taking away from the intense grassy, grapefruit flavors of Sauvignon Blanc. It has good richness as well as taut fruitiness.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007 Héritage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Apple and green melon aromas are solid although not pungent or piercing, yet the palate is zesty to the precipice of being sharp, with lively lemon-lime flavors and a citric finish. Honest and earnest SB; drink now.
Name: TerraNoble 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: White-fruit aromas suggest peach and melon, but there's also some sourness and green thrown in. Acidic but fresh in the mouth, with citrusy flavors of lime and grapefruit. Acutely citric on the finish, with a hint of asparagus.
Name: Chilcas 2008 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Nice melon, apple, talcum powder and mineral aromas set this off in a good direction. The palate is lively and balanced, with grapefruit as the prime flavor. Calm on the finish; a good quaffer if you get at it as fast as possible.
Name: Echeverria 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Passion fruit, pickle brine and other marine-influenced aromas work the nose on this cool-climate, value-priced SB. The palate is both sweet and sour, with tangy lemon as the lead flavor and softer citrus coming on later. Basic in composition; easy to drink.
Name: Viña Leyda 2008 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Chasing Venus is made in textbook Marlborough style, with aromas and flavors of grassy herbs laid over passion fruit and gooseberries. It's medium in body, pleasantly soft and round in the mouth, just fades a bit rapidly on the finish.
Name: Chasing Venus 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: So far (two vintages) this high-end Limarí SB has shown positives and shortfalls. The nose on the '08 is of lettuce, bell pepper and pickle, while the palate is lean, green and a little mean. On the plus side, there's pointed acidity, minerality and length. A particular style that needs work.
Name: Maycas del Limari 2008 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: The 2004 and 2005 vintages of this wine were priced at $15, which gives some idea how fast the supply of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc has increased. Kono's 2008 is on the light side, but tart and zippy, with a refreshing aspect to its pineapple and grapefruit flavors and herbal overtones. Drink now.
Name: Kono 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A heavy dose of Sauvignon Blanc brings herbaceous, grassy, white currants and gooseberry flavors. It's young, and needs more time to coalesce. It is certainly fresh, fruity, right up front.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2008 Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Opens with honest green notes of gooseberry, lime and sea foam, and while the palate is a touch soft in texture, it has true Chilean SB flavors of bell pepper, fresh lettuce and melon. Sturdy on the finish, with a forward attitude.
Name: Yali 2009 Wetland Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: This totally fresh wine has benefited from the quality of whites in 2007 Bordeaux. It is lemony with pink grapefruit flavors giving an intense lift. There is some herbaceousness, with green herbs and juicy fruits. To drink now.
Name: Yvon Mau 2007 Premius Bordeaux Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Elements of this thick, ripe, almost late-harvest SB succeed. The palate is creamy and layered, and it works that angle to its advantage. By the same token, it's flat and won't last for much longer, and the finish is pithy and borderline cloying. Drink right away.
Name: Simone 2008 Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This sophisticated Sauvignon Blanc sets itself apart with its rich nose of nuts, vanilla and flowers, followed by pretty flavors of spice and white flowers and fruit. Acidity balances the fruit. A fuller-bodied style that can handle richer seafood dishes.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2008 Amethystos Sauvignon Blanc (Drama)

Description: Aromas of nettle, gooseberry, grapefruit and mineral are sharp, distinct and varietally appropriate, while the wet, short palate is hollow but edged by green apple, gooseberry and other green fruit flavors. Zesty on the finish, but a little pithy. Drink right away.
Name: Root:1 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Green aromas blend with coastal-influenced passion fruit, while the palate is driven by citrus, pineapple, passion fruit and some unfortunate canned vegetable flavors. Acidic and racy, but not much nuance or character. Shows the Leyda style of SB but not in blow-out form.
Name: Viña Leyda 2008 Garuma Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A little funky and sweaty, which is varietally correct but also pushy. The palate is mildly sharp and edgy as it runs off white nectarine and lemon flavors, while the finish is citric but also kind of pithy.
Name: Ventisquero 2009 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This Greek Sauvignon Blanc is both fruity and dry with a crisp, fresh nose and simply good lemon and spice flavors. Clean with a medium body. A good everyday white for lighter dishes.
Name: Protopapas 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Pageon)

Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Blaye, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a Sauvignon Blanc, with the addition of some Muscadelle. It is on the ripe side of fresh, giving pear and apricot flavors as well as freshness from some attractive grapefruit flavors, adding piquancy from spice.
Name: Château la Rose Bellevue 2007  Premieres Côtes de Blaye

Description: Light aromas suggest butterscotch and baked apple, and indeed this is a soft SB with creamy, plump flavors of peach, melon and sugar. Sweet on the finish, and then it falls off the cliff before winding up a little mealy and bitter.
Name: Peñalolen 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The variety's requisite citrus and green aromas are on display, but they aren't very defined or exciting. Neither is the wet, chunky palate, which may be moderately fresh but doesn't offer much besides basic pineapple, kiwi and green melon. 270,000 cases made.
Name: Santa Rita 2009 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Stalky aromas suggest corn and hayfield more than crisp fruit, and while the palate is lively and acidic, it's also kind of sour and lemony. Finishes with green apple and citrus. Jumpy and scouring.
Name: Morandé 2008 Pionero Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Chunky grapefruit aromas turn toward sweaty and nutty, while the palate is a bland mix of citrus and apple juice. Narrow in feel, scope and quality. Inexpensive but acceptable.
Name: La Playa 2009 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Yellow in color, with melon aromas that fall flat. Yet the feel is like electroshock in terms of acidity, with green apple and lime flavors running in all directions. Unfocused and super green and bouncy. Not well balanced.
Name: Morandé 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Grapefruit and green fruit aromas on the nose, then a peachy sweet palate of canned fruits and syrup. So much pineapple and mango that it hardly seems like Casablanca SB. On a short life line.
Name: Viña Mar de Casablanca 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Sweet, floral, tropical and cloying; this isn't all that varietal in style and it has a flatness that doesn't serve it well. Flavors of candied papaya and green melon seem soft due to low acidity. Won't have much lifespan.
Name: Quasar 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Waxy and cidery smelling, with unfocused stemmy aromas. Aggressive pineapple is all you get on the searingly acidic palate, yet it's sweet but still sharp on the finish. Not up to the Limited Edition moniker.
Name: Morandé 2008 Edición Limitada Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A deep yellow gold, lushly scented with orange blossom, citrus peel, ripe pear and other stone fruits, this rich, oily take on Sauvignon Blanc was done in stainless steel, but has the textural complexity of barrel fermentation. It's a grippingly delicious bottle.
Name: Merry Cellars 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Four fifths of this is stainless-steel fermented Artz vineyard (Red Mountain) fruit; the rest is from Stillwater Creek, and fermented in new French oak. It's spicy and textural, with tangy grapefruit, melon and white peach, and just a nice hint of toast in the finish.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A lush, pretty nose of tropical fruit and flowers start this elegant SB from Durbanville. A stylish white with a light touch, and flavors of gooseberry and pepper. Great minerality and food-friendly character. Pair with Thai, Indian.
Name: Durbanville Hills 2008 Rhinofields Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: The style of Te Koko makes it stand out in any gathering of Marlborough Savvies, showing its unique blend of toast, vanilla, citrus and passion fruit. Bold and creamy on the palate, it finishes soft, lush and toasty. A statement wine, if not quite as long as some previous vintages.
Name: Cloudy Bay 2006 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This spritely SB starts with fresh citrus, tropical fruit and green vegetal notes, leading into like flavors with a clean finish. Pronounced minerality keeps the bigger flavors in check. A good everyday white for various dishes—seafood, Malaysian, curries.
Name: Durbanville Hills 2008 Biesjes Craal Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: There are very few Sauvignon Blancs from Portugal, a land with its own wide variety of white grapes. But this is classic warm-climate Sauvignon Blanc, with mangos and tropical fruits lifted by green herbs, apple skin texture and pink grapefruit.
Name: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Quinta de Cidrô Sauvignon Blanc (Duriense)

Description: This moderately intense Sauvignon Blanc is actually rather restrained and well-behaved for a Marlborough offering, featuring some grassy notes alongside a preponderance of melon and fig flavors. Finishes clean and long.
Name: Ara 2007 Resolute Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Blue Cove displays traditional South African SB aromas and flavors of fig, tropical fruit and gooseberry, backed by a moderate acidity and ending with a lush, curvy finish. Pretty and likeable, it has enough complexity to hold up to dishes with extra spice and flavor.
Name: Blue Cove 2008 Limited Release Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Elim)

Description: Alluring aromas of tropical fruit and crisp citrus lead this complex Sauvignon Blanc. Balanced flavors of passionfruit, pineapple, lemon and spice are delivered in a creamy but clean package. Good for myriad dishes, from grilled seafood to more sophisticated fare.
Name: Blue Cove 2008 Winemaker's Choice Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This wine has a bright, fresh nose of apples, kiwi and gooseberry, and flavors of stone fruit, apples and spice. Slightly angular in style, the wine is straightforward but refreshing and clean. Pair with grilled seafood, salads.
Name: Ondine 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: The slightly oniony, garlicky notes emanating from the glass get this Sauvignon off to a rough start, but thankfully they quickly become less noticeable, allowing grassy, citrus and melon aromas and flavors to emerge. Try decanting to help shed the off aromas, but drink now.
Name: Mount Vernon 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This joint venture of Pascal Jolivet from the Loire and John Hancock—founder of Trinity Hill in Hawkes Bay—is a bit disappointing, being very lean and crisp. A hint of capsicum frames lemony, herbal flavors that finish overly tart.
Name: Metis 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Pungently herbal and vegetal on the nose, this Sauvignon skirts dangerously close to being overly vegetal and feline, but if you like that aggressive style, it does boast admirable concentration and intensity.
Name: Kumeu River 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This ambitious wine falls victim to some lactic, sour-milk notes. Citrus and yogurt-like flavors dominate.
Name: St. Lukes 2007 Lineage Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Winemaker Peter Rosback spends a month each year making wine in New Zealand, and captures some of the same fresh, grassy character in this Sauvignon Blanc from the Oregon slice of the Columbia Valley. Bone dry, dusty, sweetly herbal and a bit softer than the 2007, this brings similar fruit flavors, hinting at white peach, lemon rind and pineapple. Lovely finish.
Name: Sineann 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This pale gold wine starts with aromas of grass and lemon, followed by flavors of grass, herbs and citrus fruit. Lively and minerally with a touch of bitter lemon on the finish, the wine has a slightly lean character that will be balanced by food. Think seafood, salads.
Name: Macari 2008 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Super pungent and forceful, with extreme aromas of grapefruit, nettle and sweat. Aggressive and spritzy feeling, with tangy lemon-lime flavors accented by a dose of sweeter tangerine. Citric at all points. Imported by Frontier Wine Imports.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2008 Sauvignon (Rueda)

Description: Nobody ever said Yecla in southern Spain is Sauvignon Blanc country, but here is proof that the grape does exist there. The wine is generally clean and floral, with tart apple and citrus flavors heading straight to a pithy, driving, slightly bitter finish. Shows good verve but comes up a little empty. Imported by Marquee Artisan Wines.
Name: La Purísima 2007 Old Hands Sauvignon Blanc (Yecla)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This wine starts with a lively nose of grapefruit, citrus and fruit, followed by a soft, rounder spice and melon fruit character on the palate. A lush style of Sauvignon Blanc that's still fresh.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of white fruits and peach are followed by a delicate combination of peach and citrus in this friendly Sauvignon Blanc. A simple, straightforward white with everyday drinking and food-pairing appeal.
Name: White Springs 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Has some serious cleanliness issues on the nose, and while it's not entirely unpalatable, it does struggle to make many positive statements. Tastes flat, mealy and bitter, and there's even some burn to it. Imported by Scoperta Importing Co. Inc.
Name: Cesar Lucendo 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: With some wood aging, Cuvée Edmond is generally released a year later than other whites from Alphonse Mellot. The wine is beautifully rounded, a rich, complex Sauvignon Blanc that shows ripe apricots, pears, spice and sweet, luscious acidity.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2006 Cuvée Edmond  (Sancerre)

Description: A fine combination of apples and cream flavors and a powerful mineral texture, showing a generous side of Sauvignon Blanc, with apricots and peaches as well as an intense layer of citrus. The final flavors are of spice, vanilla mixed with crisp acidity.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2006 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: The current Alphonse Mellot is the 19th to bear the name, always passed in the family from father to son. Made from 80-year-old vines, aged on the lees before bottling, the wine has a fine concentration, giving generosity, a hint of yeastiness, spice, pink grapefruit and even a final burst of opulence.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2007 Génération XIX  (Sancerre)

Description: Made from selected old vines, Les Romains hints at the ancient Roman origins of the Sancerre vineyards. This 2007 vintage of Les Romains shows a strongly mineral, taut character and chalky texture, with firm acidity and waves of white currant and grapefruit flavors.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2007 Les Romains  (Sancerre)

Description: Fresh and zingy, with aromas of lemon/lime, tropical fruit and flowers. On the palate, expressive waves of fruit, minerals and herbs give the wine complexity and lift. Balanced, clean and intriguing.
Name: Neil Ellis 2008 Sauvignon (Groenekloof)

Description: Produced from certified organic grapes grown in Nelson, this wine starts off smoky and herbal, almost vegetal in character, but then settles down to offer flavors of celery stalk and nectarine. It's a bit oily in texture, finishing fresh, not overwhelmingly herbal or green.
Name: Holmes 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Lightly pungent, with pronounced notes of nettle and tomato leaf that add intensity to the tropical fruit flavors. Nicely concentrated, with a slightly creamy, oily texture and a long finish.
Name: Forefathers 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Gooseberry, citrus and green pepper lead on this full-bodied white from Morgenhof. On the palate, round flavors of gooseberry and lemon are lifted by a crisp acidity, though the wine is generally bigger than it is fresh. A serious Sauvignon Blanc that can be sipped alone or with spicy cuisine, seafood.
Name: Morgenhof 2008 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

Description: While the leafy, nettley notes provide Sauvignon's trademark herbaceousness, this wine's ample weight and slightly creamy texture provide a gentler counterpoint that should make the wine exceptionally versatile at the table. Grapefruit flavors finish long, with gentle herbal overtones.
Designation: Te Muna Road Vineyard Single Vineyard
Name: Craggy Range 2008 Te Muna Road Vineyard Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This fresh but curvy Sauvignon Blanc starts with gooseberry, tropical fruit and minerals on the nose, followed by clean, elegant flavors of citrus and fruit on the palate. Juicy but refreshing, it has a cracking, fun character. Pair with curries, grilled fish.
Name: Sauvignon Republic 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A densely grassy, almost New Zealand style of Sauvignon Blanc, packed with intense flavors. It is crisp, but the green fruits are rounded out and given greater flavor by red apple juice, a tight texture and vivid finishing acidity.
Name: Domaine Alain Assadet 2008  Menetou-Salon

Description: This zippy SB from Graham Beck starts with a nose of gooseberry and grass followed by lemon, minerals and tropical fruit. Clean and classy, it will pair well with spicy cuisine, grilled chicken, fish.
Name: Graham Beck 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: The 80-acre Domaine de la Moussière is Alphonse Mellot's principal vineyard in Sancerre. This entry-level cuvée from the vineyard is already sumptuous enough, with fine, concentrated grassy flavors, laced with green apples, kiwi and citrus.
Name: Alphonse Mellot 2007 La Moussière  (Sancerre)

Description: The 2008 Palliser Estate SB is an interesting blend of ripe fig and melon fruit with grassier notes that finish on capsicum (bell pepper) notes. It's round and weighty enough to pair with some slightly richer dishes, like herbed chicken, not just seafood.
Name: Palliser Estate 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: A Marlborough standard for many years, Wither Hills' 2008 SB reveals mainstream aromatics of fresh-cut herbs and mown grass wrapped around riper hints of melon and nectarine. Finishes grassy, fresh and long. Good value.
Name: Wither Hills 2008 Wairau Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This bright, vivacious white starts with fig, citrus, gooseberry and spice on the nose and offers flavors of fig, lemon and pepper spice on the palate. Clean but complex, it's a wine that will pair with elegant seafood and poultry dishes.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: A classic, crisp, herbaceous style of wine that shows its green fruit, grassy character well. Grapefruit and other citrus flavors dominate, spiced with almond essence and a firm, green apple skin structure.
Name: Domaine Vacheron 2007  Sancerre

Description: Shows some slightly flinty notes on the nose, while the bulk of the flavors run more toward citrus and nectarine. Round and fleshy, with a touch of honey on the finish, while remaining dry in style. This is a relatively young winery that's still getting its feet under it, but looks to have a promising future.
Name: Woollaston 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Less agressively grassy and herbal than most New Zealand Sauvignon Blancs, the 2008 from Martinborough star Ata Rangi instead delivers ripe melon and fig balanced by gentle grapefruit flavors, while a subtle gingery note adds complexity. Drink now–2010.
Name: Ata Rangi 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel fermented in neutral French oak, quite aromatic, this is restrained and refined without being wimpy or thin. Sweet grass and citrus, green berry and pink grapefruit, with a lot of lip-smacking acid.
Name: Efeste 2008 Feral Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Fresh grapefruit and textured apples and cream flavors dominate this finely made wine. The fruit is all there, very forward, crisp and herbaceous, ready to drink now with its soft finish.
Name: Château de Sancerre 2007  Sancerre

Description: From the esteemed Pinot, Pinotage and Chardonnay producer Hamilton Russell, this vibrant SB starts with gooseberry, fresh-cut herbs and spicy pepper on the nose, and on the palate, citrus. Gooseberry and lemon peel. Has a richer character than many South African SB's. Complex and unfolding.
Name: Southern Right 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

Description: Wood-aged Sauvignon Blanc is always a difficult balancing trick. This wine, the top cuvée from Château de Sancerre, doesn't quite make it, with the spicy wood dominating the lighter fruit. The hints of fruit suggest pears and pink grapefruit, but always the wood intervenes.
Name: Château de Sancerre 2006 Cuvée de Connetable  (Sancerre)

Description: This lively white starts with big aromas of flowers, gooseberry and tropical fruit, followed by citrus and pepper on the palate. Fresh and fruity with good acidity, it's a poised, food-friendly wine with character. Pair with oysters, fresh fish.
Name: Backsberg 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: Gooseberry, citrus and minerals comprise the nose and the palate of this lively, approachable white. Restrained and elegant, the wine features a crisp minerality beneath the fruit to give it poise. A refreshing warm weather choice.
Name: Indaba 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Attractive, ripely structured Sauvignon Blanc with a touch of herbaceousness and layered richness from apricot and green plum flavors. There is a good, green fruit structure to hold it all together.
Name: Domaine Cordaillat 2007 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Reuilly)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: One of a very few Sauv Blancs made from Klipsun vineyard fruit, this is a light and pleasant wine, mixing gentle flavors of melon and sweet grass, much like a fresh, young Touraine.
Name: Page Cellars 2008 Sentimental Blonde Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: This light-bodied white starts with a nose of tropical fruit and citrus, leading in to flavors of creamy pineapple and fruit lifted by a crisp acidity. The wine has a lively character with a peppery spin. Pair with grilled seafood, fresh oysters.
Name: Douglas Green 2008 Vineyard Creations Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This dry-style Sauvignon Blanc offers aromas of pepper, gooseberry and spice, with round but crisp tropical fruit, herb and pepper on the palate. Balanced and textured with a slightly puckering finish.
Name: Neil Ellis 2008 Sincerely Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Mainly melon and fig here, without the green notes or pungency that New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc has become so noted for. It's a pleasant, medium-bodied white that should prove versatile at the table for just that reason.
Name: Torlesse 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

Description: Crisply made, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc, relishing hedgerow fruits, green, crisp berries and a creamy texture. Pure fruit drives the wine, the structure coming from acidity and pear skins.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2008  Sancerre

Description: Open, tropical Sauvignon, with mango and lychee flavors, ripe, soft and very cleanly made. A pleasure to drink as an apéritif, the edge of acidity and texture holding all the ripe fruit flavors together.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2008 Touraine Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: The Xavier Flouret range includes wines from both Spain and France. This expression of French Sauvignon Blanc is maturing well, its primary grassy character softened by flavors of almond paste, the acidity tamed but still pulsating through the wine. There is a good apple skin texture to add complexity.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2007 Domaine Chatelain French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Description: A little funky and sweaty, but definitely a live-wire white with tons of lime, kiwi, citrus and grapefruit flavors. It has good mouthfeel and acidity, and then long, powerful green notes to the finish. Not run-of-the-mill; it's a bit wild and out there.
Name: Viu Manent 2008 Secreto Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A soft, relatively ripe style of Sauvignon Blanc, moving towards white fruits, even hints of lychee spice. But the wine also has an herbaceous element, showing young, green plum juiciness. It is simple,fresh and attractive to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine Joël Delaunay 2008 Le Bois Martin Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: From an area just outside Martinborough, this is a rather restrained Sauvignon Blanc, one dominated by melon and white grapefruit. It finishes a little soft, but with a quick herbal burst of flavor.
Name: Borthwick Vineyard 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Wairarapa)

Description: This shows a slightly smoky or fumé character on the nose, then melon and citrus notes. It's on the lean, zippy side of things, without any overt tropical fruit or herbaceousness yet ending on a lime-like note.
Name: Mount Grey Estate 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

Description: Mild asparagus and salinic notes are noticeable on the nose, while the palate is minerally and piercing, with green fruit, lime, herbs and citrus peel. Persistent and tight on the finish, but limited in its pleasure factor and scope of flavors.
Name: Viña Tabalí 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Citrus-driven and still fairly smooth and full, with pear, white grapefruit and pineapple flavors. There's size and body to the wine, but also citrusy acidity to keep it moving forward. Nothing out of the ordinary yet worth the price.
Name: TerraNoble 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: White fruit and floral aromas give it a pleasant but generic nose, while the fleshy palate delivers green fruit and bitter citrus flavors. There's not a lot of pleasantries or upside to the wine, but for straightforward citrus and apple cider it makes the grade.
Name: Viña La Fortuna 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Lontué Valley)

Description: Clean, basic green-melon aromas set up a scouring, lean palate that features little more than narrow green apple and citrus flavors. With scour and scallion notes on the finish, there isn't a whole lot of joy or thrill to this rudimentary SB.
Name: Root:1 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All estate-grown and barrel fermented, this ripe and delicious white wine opens with scents of sweet hay, then is quickly wrapped in flavors of lemon zest, grapefruit and candied citrus. There's a dusty note as well, and the richness keeps bringing in more nuances—of English Breakfast tea, sweet stone fruits and lightly tropical papaya. Supple, round and luscious, it has excellent length and a clean exit.
Name: Upland Estates 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Snipes Mountain)

Description: Lively nectarine and citrus aromas give it early life, and the palate is equally zesty, with tangerine and pineapple flavors. This is good Sauvignon Blanc for Argentina, with plenty of citrus but not a lot of nuance or complexity.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (San Juan)

Description: A big step up from previous failures, this vintage shows tropical fruit aromas and some sea breeze. The flavors are of pineapple and tangerine, and the acidity is nice. On the finish, the fruit holds and the feel is right. Drink soon to capture the wine's perky freshness.
Name: Carlos Basso 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Melon, peach and dusty aromas give the wine a solid but flat bouquet. With soft edges and modest citric acid, it's a little dull and disjointed as it stresses melon and apple flavors. As Argentine SBs go, this is expensive for what it offers.
Name: Familia Schroeder 2008 Saurus Patagonia Select Sauvignon Blanc (Neuquén)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of this Sauvignon Blanc carry a lot of perfume, as if dusted with talcum powder. In the mouth it is soft and tastes lightly of melon and apple, again with a rather odd impression of sweet powder. Serve it well chilled.
Name: Covey Run 2007 Quail Series Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Tropical aromas of pineapple and melon are simple but clean, while the palate is fresh yet a little plump, with pineapple, mango, apple and banana flavors. This one will wet the whistle but it turns monotone on the finish. Drink as soon as possible for maximum vitality.
Name: Bodega Norton 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Quiet aromas of peach lead to sweet, basic flavors of nectarine and white table grapes. The finish is fleshy and pithy, with some heat and bitterness settling in after initial sugary sweetness. Drink immediately.
Name: Zolo 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: A spicy, floral nose leads into flavors of peach and apple in this assertive Sauvignon Blanc. Dry, medium-bodied and full of fruit, the wine is a nice solo sip or can be paired with anything from grilled seafood to Asian cuisine.
Name: Protopapas 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Greece)

Description: Tropical on the nose, with floral, lychee aromas that seem more like Torrontés than typical Sauvignon Blanc. In the mouth, the feel is basic, with sweet flavors of lychee, mango and melon. Vacuous on the finish, but overall it's not going to turn anyone off.
Name: Mapema 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: This yellowish SB from Argentina's northern Salta region is a strange bird that has never caught our fancy. This vintage shows melon, peach, lychee and wax aromas, while the palate is both sweet and tart, with a fresh-for-now feel that doesn't inspire confidence that it will last for long. Flat on the finish, and unsusual overall.
Name: Michel Torino 2008 Ciclos Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (Cafayate)

Description: Fresh like a peach on the nose, with a bit of warm radiator dust. Flavors of lemon and green apple are narrow, and the mouthfeel is limited and indicates that the lifespan of the wine may be short. Citric on the finish, and overall there's just not a lot going on here.
Name: Árido 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Past its sell-by date, with mealy aromas and dull flavors of apple and banana. The feel is flat, the acidity is not there, and the finish is bland and a little bitter.
Name: Carlos Basso 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Heavy hayfield aromas are oxidized, and the flavors of almond peel, citrus pith and baked banana do nothing to impress. Not a fresh or healthy wine, if it ever was. Past its prime.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2007 Sauvignon Blanc

Description: One of Brancott's best Sauvignons in recent memory, the 2008 B is intensely herbal on the nose, featuring green tomatoes and bell pepper, but only mildly vegetal on the palate--well within the bounds of acceptable varietal character. It's on the full-bodied side of the spectrum, with a long, mouth-tingling finish. Try with sole Basquaise.
Name: Brancott 2008 B Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc is the leading imported wine in Australia, which has led domestic wineries to redouble their efforts at the variety. This bargain-priced example features fig and citrus notes underscored by a slight herbaceousness, even some red currant flavors. It's round in the mouth without being overly broad, ending with mouthwatering citrus flavors. Drink now.
Name: Four Sisters 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Like many top Marlborough Sauvignons, this wine has a leafy, herbal component backed by copious fruit. In this case, the wine delivers touches of nectarine and pineapple, along with a bit of chili pepper. It's medium-bodied, with a long, mouth-watering finish.
Name: Sauvignon Republic 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Leafy at first, but those greenish notes are backed by plenty of stone fruits and pineapple. It's plump and round in the mouth, with a long, clean, zesty finish. Drink now.
Name: Brancott 2008 Festival Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Babich's top Sauvignon is a big step up in quality, featuring more weight and intensity than its regular bottling. Tropical--think passion fruit--flavors are accented by grassy notes, with grapefruit notes forming the core. Drink now.
Name: Babich 2008 Black Label Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A strong effort from Vavasour's second label, the 2008 Dashwood SB features vibrant aromas of crushed tomato leaf and hints of jalapeño and flavors of green tomato and gooseberry. It's medium in body and slightly creamy in texture, with a crisp, fruit-driven finish.
Name: Dashwood 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A rather refined, restrained version of Marlborough Sauvignon, with slightly herbal overtones to the strone fruit and citrus flavors. It's round, with no rough edges, yet retains a clean, mouth-watering finish.
Name: Saint Clair 2008 Pioneer Block #3 43 Degrees Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
West Cape Howe 2008 Zeepaard Sauvignon Blanc (Western Australia)

Description: One of several Pioneer Block Sauvignons now coming out of St. Clair, the 2008 Snap Block leans toward the pungent side of Sauvignon Blanc, with aromas of crushed tomato leaf leading the way. The flavors are decidedly herbal, but, backed by a solid underpinning of citrus fruits, the results are zesty and refreshing.
Name: Saint Clair 2008 Pioneer Block #18 Snap Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
Saint Clair 2008 Pinoeer Block #1 Foundation Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is an intensely grassy, herby Sauvignon Blanc (100%) that is vividly fresh, with upfront fruit that has a New World character. Grapefruit, green berries, lime juice and white currants all come together. Delicious now.
Name: Dourthe 2007 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Shows a lot of fresh, grapefruity character, with some rounder, melony notes and a slightly herbal, grassy edge to the finish. Drink now.
Name: Starborough 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Crisp, citrusy and slightly herbal, this is a well made, mainstream Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc at a terrific price.
Name: Zeal 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Imported by Lion Nathan USA.
Name: Philip Shaw 2007 No. 19 Sauvignon Blanc (Orange)
Saint Clair 2008 Vicar's Choice Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: On the plump but balanced side, with a perfumed nose that's almost sweet for SB. In the mouth, it's fairly lively and lifted, with nectarine and melon flavors that morph into pink grapefruit on the finish. Decent quality; will get the job done.
Name: Aresti 2008 Estate Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: A definite improvement on the 2007 version of this wine, it shows some herbaceous character, along with ripe apricot and pear fruits. There's a touch of spice as well, which adds character. Screwcap.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Name: De Bortoli 2008 Deen De Bortoli Vat 2 Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Restrained aromatically, with a slight minerally-graphite note, this is a pleasantly stony wine, perhaps a bit austere. It's medium bodied, ending with a touch of grapefruit pith.
Name: Chocolate Box 2008 White Chocolate Sauvignon Blanc (Eden Valley)

Description: Citrus fruit and acidity seem to be the dominating qualities to this SB. The palate is green and citric, with green apple and grapefruit flavors. And the feel is wet and zesty as the finish sticks to the script with scour and freshness. Needs more fruit and friendliness to fill things out.
Name: Agustinos 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Green melon and kiwi on the nose, but not much else going on. The palate is inoffensive and mild, with peach and light bell pepper flavors. Acceptable bordering on decent, but just not a lot here to enjoy. Very basic white wine.
Name: Chilcas 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit and other citrus fruits are decent, while the palate shows true varietal flavors in the form of pickle, green herbs and grapefruit. There isn't a ton of depth or character here, but the finish is fresh and it washes well across the tongue.
Name: Viu Manent 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Powdery and sweet smelling, with an acidic palate propelling pedestrian green apple, lime and orange flavors. Fruity but not very refined, with a tenuous balance that indicates that it should be drunk as soon as possible.
Name: Sundance 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Pungent and oily on the nose, but things fail to progress from there. Eventually the bouquet turns peppery and nutty, while the palate is pithy, drying and tastes like barely ripe nectarine and green banana. For whatever reason this Rapel Valley SB continues as one of the few weak spots in the Casa Lapostolle portfolio.
Name: Lapostolle 2008 Casa Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Almost mute peach and melon aromas get it going, followed by racy, narrow grapefruit and tangerine flavors. It's a citric, lean and limited SB, with zest and not much else to the palate or finish. Quaffable if properly chilled.
Name: Espiritu de Chile 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: A low-voltage wine with sweet orange and pith aromas followed by simple pear, kiwi and apple flavors. There is little edge or cut to this wine, and it weighs in as fleshy. Drink right away.
Name: Grÿphus 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Weak aromas of peach pit and tropical fruit are none too exciting, while the palate is dilute and carries flavors of orange and lime. Too narrow to warrant a recommendation, with barely any concentration.
Name: Chilensis 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Not one of this brand's better wines. It smells like basic orange juice and lime, but it's thick and flat in the mouth. Flavors of mango and green bean don't thrill, and the feel is soft. Kind of mushy for SB.
Name: Calina 2008 Alcance Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is a structured, balanced white with aromas of gooseberry, flint and spice on the nose, and flavors of fresh citrus and fruit on the palate. Clean and crisp but offering complexity, this wine marries rich fruit and cracking acid very successfully. Pair with spicy Indian cuisine, grilled seafood.
Name: Brampton 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is very fresh and nicely detailed, with just 13% alcohol allowing some of the more subtle Sauvignon Blanc flavors to show. Some of the oldest vines in the state—more than 35 years old—are a prime component. Melon, green apple, lime and grapefruit flavors all mingle; acids are just right and the balance could not be better for lighter seafood and poultry.
Name: Arbor Crest 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This sophisticated Sauvignon Blanc offers aromas of green pepper, citrus and herbs and a balanced, tingling combination of pear and spice on the palate. Perfectly balanced with fresh fruit and minerally crispness. A spicy, dry finish adds to the character.
Name: Warwick 2008 Professor Black Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: An appealing nose of tropical fruit, citrus and spice, followed by a clean, dry, spicy combination of citrus and fresh fruit, give this white a summer sipping appeal. A great partner to salads, grilled seafood, Thai cuisine.
Name: Stormhoek 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has been Ste. Michelle's Sauvignon Blanc vineyard designate for many years, and deservedly so. With just 6% Sémillon in the blend, this sophisticated effort spends three months on the lees, adding texture and creaminess, and has a small percentage of barrel-fermented juice, which contributes a hint of toasty cracker. It's softer and less of an acid bomb than the regular Ste. Michelle Sauvignon Blanc, moving more in the direction of Chardonnay, without losing varietal character.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This easygoing white starts with a fresh nose of grapefruit, fig and flowers and leads into zesty but complex flavors of tropical fruit and citrus. Approachable and balanced, the wine will pair well with seafood and chicken dishes.
Name: Rietvallei Estate Wine 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Description: This delicate, elegant NLH wine starts with alluring aromas of lush honey, apricot and citrus and offers a vibrant, lively balance of fruit and acid. Pair with cheeses and fruit salads.
Name: Mulderbosch 2006 Noble Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A classy, fragrant nose of flowers and tropical fruit starts this wine off with a feminine flair. The palate offers pretty but assertive fruit shot through with a crisp minerality. Fresh but poised, it will pair extremely well with grilled whitefish, shellfish.
Name: Thelema 2008 Sutherland Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: Fresh but earthy aromas of apple, fig and pepper give this intriguing wine extra draw. On the palate, a robust herbal character backed by an appealing slatey spin and balanced acids offer elegance and personality. Ends with a clean, lingering finish.
Name: De Grendel 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another fine vintage for the widely available Columbia Valley Sauvignon Blanc from Ste. Michelle. This tangy bottle of ripe fruit has juicy, fleshy citrus, grapefruit and green apple flavors. Done in 80% stainless steel, with no discernable malolactic, gives a wine with plenty of acid and a lip-smacking finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A bright, minerally nose and clean, elegant flavors give this wine from cool-climate Elgin a sophisticated edge. Though the wine has a refined character, there's still an abundance of rich tropical fruit and citrus flavors. The finish is refreshing and subtle.
Name: Paul Cluver 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Description: This wine starts with a combination of white flowers, spice, tropical fruit and green notes, with dry, crisp flavors of citrus and mineral on the palate. A good wine for fans of more angular whites, the wine will pair well with spicy Asian cuisine, grilled spicy fish or chicken.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2008 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: Fresh, varietal, juicy with flavors of pear, lemon and grass. It's varietal with the cut and precision of the grape, plenty of acid, and good persistence.
Name: Washington Hills 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Description: A fragrant nose of grass, tropical fruit and fig entices in this pretty SB from Durbanville Hills. On the palate, there are clean, balanced flavors of robust tropical fruit and a touch of spice. Full-bodied but refreshing. Pair with fish, grilled chicken.
Name: Durbanville Hills 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: A grassy nose mingled with fresh citric fruits is followed by a unique combination of refreshing fruit, herbs and fresh green pepper in this elegant sip from Capaia. Earthy while at the same time appetizing, the wine has a crisp finish.
Name: Capaia 2007 Blue Grove Hill Sauvignon Blanc (Philadelphia)

Description: Soft aromas of gooseberry and fresh fruit are followed by lush, like flavors in this glamorous white. Integrated flavors include peach and a spicy spin. Finishes lively and crisp.
Name: Nederburg 2008 Manor House Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: A fresh citrus and delicate tropical fruit nose gives this Durbanville white a stylish start. Steely and crisp on the palate, with flavors of gooseberry and grass, the wine is balanced and soft. Pair with grilled seafood or salads.
Name: Durbanville Hills 2007 Biesjes Craal Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: Fresh aromas of gooseberry and fig are followed by a flinty, fresh combination of flavors in Cederburg's Sauvignon Blanc. Balanced and robust, the wine has a snappy, citrus finish.
Name: Cederberg 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Cederberg)

Description: This white's nose offers waves of fresh-cut grass, herbs and spices, with tropical fruit, gooseberry and citrus flavors that follow. The wine has a dense, full-flavored character, but its crisp mineral backbone keeps it aloft. The finish is lingering and rich.
Name: Spice Route 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Darling)

Description: A fresh nose of mineral and citrus gives this white a spirited start. On the palate, minerally, slightly angular flavors unfold. The wine has an assertive quality but needs some complexity to round it out. Overall though, crisp and food-friendly.
Name: Juno 2008 Cape Maidens Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This is herbal and bell-peppery but not to an extreme, balanced by citrus and pineapple fruit. It's medium- to full-bodied, with an appealing, slightly oily texture and great length. Drink now; probably would be great with ceviche.
Name: Eradus 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Winemaker Simon Waghorn has been able to maintain this brand's quality even as production has ramped up to 100,000 cases, a remarkable feat. The 2008 features ripe, tropical fruit aromas of guava and pineapple that morph easily into flavors of nectarine and fig; expect some herbal notes to emerge by the time it reaches consumers. It's plump in the mouth, yet finishes with a mouthwatering, clean, crisp finish.
Name: Whitehaven 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Smells like an ocean breeze mixed with field greens, citrus and passion fruit. Montes has been a leader in Chile's movement toward coastal SB, and this one is blasting with grapefruit, green apple, passion fruit and minerality. In the mouth, it has some weight and richness; but that's balanced by zippy acidity. Can't imagine a better match for ceviche or tuna tartare.
Name: Montes 2008 Limited Selection Leyda Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: The bold aromas are chili peppery, just hinting at riper fruit below, but the flavors are reversed, with peach and pineapple in the lead followed by peppery notes. This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc ends on notes of grapefruit and jalapeno; really good for the price.
Name: Barker's Marque 2008 3 Brooms Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A reliable source for Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Noir, The Crossings 2008 features melon and fig aromas that blend seamlessly with more citrusy, herbal flavors. It's a medium-bodied wine with a refreshing finish of grapefruit and wet stones.
Name: The Crossings 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Carves a path right down the center of Marlborough's stylistic fairway, featuring hints of bell pepper, stone fruit and wet-stone minerality. It's medium in body, with flavors of nectarine, herbal flourishes and a dry, stony finish. Drink now.
Name: Brancott 2008 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The style of Te Awa's Sauvignon Blanc has remained refreshingly true to its Hawke's Bay origins, combining ripe fruit with a proportion of barrel fermentation to yield a wine with stone-fruit flavors, a rich texture and hints of vanilla. It should hold at least 3–4 years—unusually long by NZ Savvy standards.
Name: Te Awa 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: The style of Te Awa's Sauvignon Blanc has remained refreshingly true to its Hawke's Bay origins, combining ripe fruit with a proportion of barrel fermentation to yield a wine with stone-fruit flavors, a rich texture and hints of vanilla. It should hold at least 3–4 years—unusually long by NZ Savvy standards.
Name: Te Awa 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Passion fruit and nectarine aromas are joined by hints of jalapeno, while the palate displays stone fruit flavors with tropical overtones and grassy accents. This medium-bodied wine is textbook Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc at a refreshingly affordable price.
Name: Barker's Marque 2008 Arona Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Starts off slightly pungent and sweaty, but offsets that with ripe notes of melon and fig. This is a medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc with excellent concentration and length. Drink up.
Name: Forefathers 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A lush, tropical style of Sauvignon, combining peach and guava aromas with passion fruit flavors. This is delicious right now for its immediate fruit, ample weight and slightly creamy texture.
Name: Mud House 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Starts off with aromas of grapefruit and tomato leaf, then touches of nectarine and honey on the palate add richness and depth. The result is a medium-bodied, round Sauvignon Blanc with a subtle, elegant finish.
Name: Nick Goldschmidt 2007 Boulder Bank Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Although the stars at Saint Clair are the Reserve and Pioneer Block wines, the regular SB bottling has maintained a high level of quality. The 2008 boasts exuberant passion fruit and grapefruit aromas and flavors, backed by fresh, grassy notes. It's medium in body, with a mouthwatering, fresh finish.
Name: Saint Clair 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The dryness of botrytis dominates this wine. There is a sweet undercurrent, but the main feature is of baked apple skins, tight structure and spice. It does need aging for all these features to come together.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2006 Ruster Ausbruch Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Combines leafy, nettle-y notes with a plump, rounded mouthfeel to yield a wine that's better than the sum of its parts. Aromas and flavors of green tomato, fig, melon and citrus come together nicely in the glass, finishing fresh and zesty. Drink now.
Name: Highfield Estate 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There are 100,000 cases of this bargain Sauvignon Blanc for the U.S. market, so it should be pretty easy to find. Melon and fig aromas lead into a medium-bodied palate that features a hint of creaminess and more restrained fruit, which allows some mineral character to come through. Drink now.
Name: Brancott 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From its citrus, passion fruit and peach aromas to its flavors of passion fruit sorbet and lime zest, this is obviously Sauvignon Blanc. Shows unusual richness of texture and length for the price. Imported by Five Gold Hands.
Name: Obviously 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All stainless fermented, this spiky, pungently grassy Sauvignon Blanc unabashedly showcases the grape's Loire-Valley origins, rather than hiding behind a curtain of sugar and oak. A whiff of diesel comes into play also, contributing to the complexity. It's concentrated and packed with fleshy fruit ranging from pears to peaches to papaya; a really nice combination of ripe fruit and strong herbal elements.
Name: Lone Canary 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The Stoneleigh style traditionally favors ripeness over herbaceousness, and the 2008 holds true to form, offering up grapefruit and nectarine aromas and an appealing blend of citrus and stone-fruit flavors. It's plump and round, yet finishes fresh. Good as an apéritif or with light dishes.
Name: Stoneleigh 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Despite some slightly grassy aromas, this offering displays a distinctly tropical character. Passion fruit and pineapple notes are plump and round in the mouth, ending with fresh, fruit-cocktail intensity.
Name: Domaine Georges Michel 2007 Golden Mile Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pretty nice wine, with a good aromatic mix of green fruits, grassiness and light mineral. It's nothing over-the-top, but it does seem like an honest wine with proper citrus, lettuce and peppery flavors. Finishes with arugula-like fresh bitterness, but overall it's solid and not overly pushy.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Round and soft, with gently leafy notes that accent the stone fruit and grapefruit flavors. It's a solid introduction to Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc at a fair price.
Name: Monkey Bay 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: For what should be a special bottling, this vintage of Icon SB seems a little deficient. It's still a nice wine, but gives the restrained impression of underripe fig and green tomato without being overly herbal or expressive.
Name: Nobilo 2008 Icon Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: An atypically lean, focused Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, with the emphasis on minerality and leafy components rather than tropical fruit. Citrus, wet stones and tomato leaves make for a slightly austere impression, finishing crisp and clean.
Name: Nautilus 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This wine doesn't show the ripeness of Barker's Marque's other SBs, instead offering hard nectarine and underripe melon flavors accented by a grassy, herbal finish. It's still good, probably at its best served alongside simple fish dishes.
Name: Barker's Marque 2008 ranga.ranga Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent and grassy upfront, with musky, herbal flavors buoyed by a base of pineapple and citrus. Impressively concentrated and long. Drink up.
Name: Mills Reef 2007 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This tastes a bit over-cropped; the varietal character is there, but it's a pale rendition. Lightly peppery and grassy, with hints of citrus and very green apple fruit. Straightforward and simple.
Name: Columbia Crest 2007 Grand Estates Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Fatter than any Loire Sauvignon Blanc, this has some rich fruit, flavors of currants, an oily texture and intriguing candy flavors. There is a structure of green apple skins, but the wine is essentially light, fresh and instantly pleasing.
Name: Simonnet-Febvre 2006 Sauvignon de Saint-Bris  (Saint-Bris)

Description: Relatively light in body, with pungent overtones of boxwood and asparagus. This is a bit on the green side of the spectrum, only partially balanced by citrusy fruit.
Name: Clos Marguerite 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Sweet smelling, like air freshener and powdered sugar. Dull and melony in the mouth, with a flat mouthfeel and not much pulse on the finish. Acceptable if you're not discerning.
Name: Aroma 2008 Limón Verde (lime) Sauvignon (Chile)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is an exemplary SB from the Finger Lakes, with its lively nose of lemon and minerals touched by an elegant floral note. On the palate, robust, crisp citrus and fruit flavors are balanced by firm acidity and a refreshing but lingering finish.
Name: Ravines 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Honey, flower and melon leads on this delicate Riesling from Hazlitt. Juicy, full flavors of melon and citrus are balanced with a crisp minerality that lingers in the finish. Complex and energetic.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: The Macari No 1 offers an aromatic nose of grapefruit and tropical fruit, followed by crisp citrus and mineral flavors. The wine is balanced and refreshing, but has complexity. Pair with Thai or Indian dishes.
Name: Macari 2007 No 1 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A snappy nose of grass, grapefruit and graphite leads on this fun wine from Shaw. On the palate, lemon, citrus and spice follows. Solid and food-friendly, with a lingering, racy finish.
Name: Shaw 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of citrus and apricot give this wine a lush start. The palate offers crisp lemon mingled with richer fruit flavors, and ends clean and slightly racy. It's versatile—pair with Asian cuisine or more complex poultry dishes.
Name: Damiani 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Description: Generally speaking, this a neutral wine that makes no impression. It shows pine and generic citrus on the nose, followed by equally generic apple and orange flavors. Waxy and drying on the finish, with limited scope and depth. Drink right away, if at all.
Name: Condesa de Leganza 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (La Mancha)

Description: Wax and peach-pit aromas give it a decent opening act, but the palate is dull and totally without a future. Flavors of orange and grapefruit are mealy and drying, while the finish is almost bitter. Though it's Sauvignon Blanc, it tastes like a mediocre cava with no bubbles.
Name: Bodegas Iranzo 2006 Vertus Sauvignon Blanc (Utiel-Requena)

Description: Two years in a row this has been a subpar wine. Mealy nectarine aromas are barely adequate, while the palate is sour and finishes bitter. Not a foul experience, but unexciting and not really worth a look.
Name: Analivia 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: Striking and sincere Sauvignon Blanc. One whiff, one taste and one swish across the palate and you'll know that this is elevated stuff. For starters, the bouquet delivers honest bell pepper, melon, passion fruit and apple aromas; and along with the fruit there's nuance, structure and balancing herbal notes. Full, long and regal. Drink now to capture this wine's powerful essence.
Name: Cono Sur 2008 20 Barrels Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: When O. Fournier tackles a new project, such as Sauvignon Blanc from Leyda, it doesn't mess around. This is an excellent example of Chilean SB with green fruit, citrus and a light touch of capsicum. It's a serious wine that challenges with its peppery crispness offset by grapefruit and green melon. Very nice mouthfeel; shows itself in a couple of waves.
Name: O. Fournier 2008 Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Richly fruited and tropical, this is a medium-bodied, slightly creamy-textured Marlborough Savvy. Flavors hint at pineapple, honey and stone fruit, yet remain zesty and clean, with a refreshing citrus zing to the finish. Stock up for the summer.
Name: 3 Stones 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc strums the right chords, combining notes of crushed tomato leaf with citrusy fruit to make a pretty melody. A hint of creaminesss rounds out the midpalate, and the wine finishes long, with pristine cleanliness.
Name: Kim Crawford 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The Taylors Pass Vineyard continues to shine brightly for both Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Noir. This Sauvignon features intense tropical fruit with just a touch of green. It's round and mouthfilling, with a long, lime-and-mineral finish. Drink now.
Name: Villa Maria 2007 Taylors Pass Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is what you want from Chile. The bouquet of green apple, lime, mineral, sea air and controlled sweetness is impressive while not being forceful. Flavors of citrus, pineapple and green herbs are live-wire, while the feel is stimulating and spritzy. With a juicy finish and tons of zest,this is a lovely, true wine that reflects its coastal San Antonio origins.
Name: Undurraga 2008 T.H. Lo Abarca Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Over the years, Villa Maria has been working hard on upping the quality (and the price) of its entry-level Sauvignon Blanc. No longer a Best Buy candidate, the 2008 Private Bin is still a top value, offering slightly pungent, sweaty aromas but flavors of stone fruit accented by grassy-herbal notes. There's ample weight without heaviness and a zesty, fresh finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2008 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Attractive fern and pine aromas mix with scents of green melon and cactus to create a very likable, true-to-Casablanca bouquet. The palate is agile and balanced, with lively green apple, pineapple and grapefruit flavors. With some tang and kick to the mouthfeel and finish, this sophisticated white ranks up there in terms of value for money.
Name: Carmen 2008 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Clean and fresh, and also varietally correct as it unloads full but accurate aromas of cucumber, passion fruit and lime. Casas del Bosque does very well with Sauvignon Blanc. This wine has all the citrus, tang and style you could ask for, but it shows good depth and complexity as well, which is what pushes it up to the next level. For $14, this wine delivers plenty.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2008 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Attractive and very much in the vein of what is really good Chilean Sauvignon Blanc. The bouquet is all about green herbs, cactus pad, passion fruit and citrus. The palate transitions from lemon-lime to tropical pineapple and passion fruit, while the finish is breezy and zesty. It is a lean, 100% Casablanca style of SB, and while it's a step down from the great 2007, the drop is not a big one.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2008 Los Vascos Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Novas is probably more elevated and serious than Emiliana's basic Natura SB, but in the end run it's more or less a similar, high-quality white wine. After an opening that's tight and strained, Novas spreads out to show lime, passion fruit and green melon flavors. The feel is ripe and full, and it finishes grassy and green, with acid-driven length. Drink now for maximum freshness and intensity.
Name: Emiliana 2008 Novas Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Undurraga's top Sauvignon hails from the premier terroir of Leyda. It smells clean and inviting, with an aromatic mix of talcum powder, lime, mango and scallion. The palate is very fresh and lively, with snappy citrus flavors that include grapefruit. Razor-clean on the finish.
Name: Undurraga 2008 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Pungent and teetering on the edge of herbaceousness. But then it draws back, settling on passion fruit, tropical breezes and lime. The wine has pulsing acidity and it dances on the palate. It's also sort of bracing and sharp, which some may find too razor-like for their palate. Very nice for coastal Aconcagua, an outland where few besides Errazuriz have gone.
Name: Errazuriz 2008 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Very nice on the nose, with lime, celery and semisour pickle aromas. There is plenty of character to this round, generous single-vineyard SB from Casablanca. The palate is snappy and citric, while the finish is full of ripe grapefruit and other subtle green notes. A very good wine that borders on excellence. For the money, it's a green-light special.
Name: Errazuriz 2008 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A compelling mix, with bright, vivacious fruit flavors running from apple to pear, peach to papaya. The influence of barrels is felt more than tasted, but it does add a whisper of toast to the finish. Lively and fresh, this is a great wine for richer seafood.
Name: Woodinville Wine Cellars 2007 Artz Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: A complex palate and lingering finish give this wine serious appeal. Tropical fruit aromas and a combination of minerals and lush fruit in the mouth offer elegant balance. The wine has a delicious, mouthcoating appeal but still offers a spin of fresh, clean flavors. Versatile with food—from rich to spicy.
Name: Beau Joubert 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Very nicely done for a new brand that we haven't seen before. This is Chilean SB in fine form. It's a mix of green and ripe fruits both on the nose and palate. Aromas of gooseberry and mango are alluring, and in the mouth it bounces along on a wave of bracing acidity. Elegant and easier toprocess than Quintay's more pungent, angular and demanding Reserva.
Name: Quintay 2008 Clava Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Veramonte knows how to capture the pungent, alert character inherent to Sauvignon Blanc. This is a peppy wine with spiky tropical and green-fruit aromas and flavors. It's a mash up of citrus and nettles, with a controlled, fairly long grapefruit-driven finish. Modest in price, but the realthing.
Name: Veramonte 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Convincing and individual across its aromas, flavors and nuances. Casa Marin is a leader in coastal Sauvignon Blanc, and this full-bodied, racy wine grabs your attention with its crisp, pure personality. It is zesty and alive, with apple and green-fruit flavors, while the focused finish isnarrow and committed. Drink now.
Name: Casa Marin 2008 Cipreses Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Who would have believed that one day we'd have Sauvignon Blancs paying tribute to 1980s pop groups? At least both share a New Zealand connection. The wine is a bit on the fuller side of things, but nicely balanced by mineral and grapefruit aromas and flavors, ending on notes of lime and cut grass. Drink up.
Name: Crowded House 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A rich, full-bodied nose of tropical fruit leads on this complex Sauvignon Blanc from Jardin. The wine has a crisp wave of fruit with a spicy overall character, but there is complexity and roundness as well. An elegant wine that's integrated and ageable.
Name: Jardin 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Definitely shows its Leyda roots via citric, oceanic aromas and flavors of crisp celery, bell pepper, grapefruit and mango. It's a bit softer on the palate than some coastal SBs out of Chile, but it's still full of verve and clarity. A very good wine that shows the Leyda style with Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2008 Family Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Younger is better when it comes to 1865 SB. Tasted alongside the older 2007, this wine is brighter, more focused, more balanced and ultimately more fun and flavorful to drink. It is direct and clean, with passion fruit, green pepper and freshness on the nose. The palate shows green fruit,bell pepper and grapefruit, and the finish is intense.
Name: San Pedro 2008 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Light, lucid and exactly what we're looking for from Chile. This organic wine has pure varietal aromas of nettles, tarragon and citrus, which are followed by flavors of green fruits, scallion and pepper. It's super zesty and spritzy, with a cleansing finish. About as true as they come in this price range.
Name: Emiliana 2008 Natura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Shows some pungent, aggressive Sauvignon aromas that verge on vegetal, then pulls back on the palate, where it develops flavors of melon and nectarine and a slightly creamy texture. This is nicely balanced and easy to like, with a long, nettle-y finish.
Name: Groom 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel fermented in new French oak, then pulled out and put into neutral oak. So the acids are softened, the wine gains some flesh, and there are nuances of toast and butter without overwhelming the fruit.
Name: Guardian 2007 Angel Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Quite pleasant and true to the variety. Punchbowl aromas of melon and passion fruit are friendly and not the least bit harsh. The palate is fresh and lithe, with layered, defined flavors of passion fruit and tangerine. Like a mountain stream in terms of freshness, with just enough intensity and style to draw attention.
Name: Caliterra 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Bang! One sniff of this wine and you are floating in those distinct, semisharp aromas that are Chilean Sauvignon Blanc. There's sea air, nettle and citrus galore, and then flavors of gooseberry, green fruit and grapefruit. It's fresh and forward, with angularity and strong varietal character.
Name: Errazuriz 2008 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: On the herbal-vegetal side of the Sauvignon Blanc spectrum, but manages to balance those elements with red pepper and nectarine flavors in a plump, easygoing style. Served with a cold vegetable terrine, this would be very stylish. Drink now.
Name: Blocks 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A little bulky and maybe just beginning to fade. This is a rounder and chunkier specimen than the 2008 Cipreses SB, and it shows softness at its core and hints of green bean and bell pepper. Fortunately, holdover acids and green-fruit notes bring it back to higher ground. Drink immediatelyor wait for the release of the '08 vintage.
Name: Casa Marin 2007 Laurel Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: A live-wire wine with baby powder, tropical fruit, citrus and green melon on the nose. Made in the forward, fruit-first style; it radiates with natural acidity such to the point that it's borderline aggressive. But with such power you also get strong green apple and grapefruit flavors. Edgy and citric overall, but at the same time you won't get shorted.
Name: Cono Sur 2008 Visión Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Archetypal Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, featuring pungent, herbal aromas to go alongside bold passion fruit notes. It shows ample weight in the mouth, even a slightly oily texture and pronounced green flavors that persist a good long time. Probably best with fresh tomato or strongly herbal dishes.
Name: Drylands 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pleasant and melony on the nose, without the sharp, piercing aromas that sometimes push Chilean SB over the edge. New from the north of Chile, Elki is medium-bodied and generous, but not too angular. It's a whole wine with common citrus flavors as opposed to something demanding and sharp.Drink right away.
Name: Elki 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)
