Description: Shaw and Smith's Sauvignon Blanc has become emblematic of the Adelaide Hills style, combining tropical fruit with a grassy streak, all framed by zippy citrus flavors. This would work equally as an apéritif or with various seafood dishes.
Name: Shaw and Smith 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Sweaty and pungent, loaded with overtones of crushed tomato leaf, this is an assertively herbal wine that requires careful food pairing, or a healthy preference for that style. It's not terribly weighty, but shows nice leafy complexity and a hint of curranty fruit. Try it with mussels steamed with lots of fresh herbs.
Name: Mud House 2007 Swan Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent, zesty and quite varietal in its expression. The nose is racy and intense, with nettle, sweat and passion fruit aromas. Expect a wet, almost spritzy palate with green-edged fruit flavors and light herbaceousness. There's bite and sass to this one, and the finish is quite long.
Name: Viña Mar de Casablanca 2008 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Common apple, melon and other green, zesty aromas work the nose, which is slightly more reserved than outright pungent. The palate is flashy but a touch lean, with blazing acidity pushing tart, crisp, focused flavors of green apple and citrus. Not out of the ordinary, but quite well made and cleansing.
Name: Undurraga 2008 T.H. Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Shows varietally correct grassiness and herbal notes on the nose, followed by round, honeyed fruit flavors that turn racy and grapefruity on the finish. Suitable as an apéritif or paired with slightly weighty fish dishes.
Name: Alta 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Ultra-fresh and snappy, but a little light and neutral when it comes to fruit character. The palate is totally spunky and alive, with bouncy but mild flavors of lime, white grapefruit and orange. Clean and likable, with good focus but only medium-level intensity and power. Drink now.
Name: Undurraga 2008 Sibaris Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: From cool-climate Leyda along the coastline, this SB is fairly grassy and green. The nose shows hints of green bean and peas, while the flavor profile rotates around a mix of honeydew melon and pea pod. Good mouthfeel and finishing persistence are positives; but in the final analysis it seems a little vegetal.
Name: Santa Rita 2008 Medalla Real Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Clean and composed SB, with lemon-lime aromas that settle more toward lime. The palate is clean, with basic depth that allows for nice green apple and dry green-herb flavors to show themselves. A little weak on the back end, and very “liquid” due to medium concentration.
Name: Santa Rita 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Like several other producers of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, Jackson Estate is trying to make a cuvée that offers something more than stereotypical tropical fruit and fresh herbs. This is a partially barrel-fermented effort that boasts brown sugar and cinnamon aromas, and flavors that mix coffee with lime and passion fruit. It's not entirely harmonious, but offers concentration and innovation, something that should be applauded.
Name: Jackson Estate 2007 Grey Ghost Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Crisp and sturdy at this young stage, with a lot of green on the nose: apple, onion, melon, even celery. For a Maule Valley SB, this one manages to maintain freshness and liveliness. There's give and take between the wine's acidity and body, with apple, green herb and talc for flavors. Finishes clean and chalky.
Name: Simone 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: This new brand from Santa Carolina is improving with each passing vintage. Nimbus SB is true to its Casablanca roots; it shows oily, green aromas, a spot of bell pepper and then prickly lemon-lime flavors. It's a good one for sushi and other seafoods, while the mouthfeel is racy and clean.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2008 Nimbus Estate Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A little sweet and easy up front, with aromas of air freshener and tropical fruits. The palate is round, lightly spritzy and endowed with flavors of apple, lime and kiwi. Long and quite fresh on the finish, with a hint of lasting sweetness.
Name: Cono Sur 2008 Sustainable Agriculture Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The nose on this Sauvignon ranges from tropical fruit to green grass, and on the palate, a classy balance of acid and fruit, with a minerally backbone and a dry, crisp finish. Drink now and enjoy with fresh seafood.
Name: Porcupine Ridge 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Are fans of this 1970s rock group really big Sauvignon Blanc drinkers? Regardless of the answer to that question, the wine in the bottle is pretty good, offering smoky, slightly fumé-like notes, green hay and citrus aromas, grassy, grapefruity flavors and a moderately long, easy-to-like finish. Drink now; like the group, its best days may be behind it.
Name: Steely Dan 2007 Waihopai Ridge Clayfork Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The highlight of a thin lineup, Cave B's Sauvignon Blanc brings tart fruit flavors of lemon and lime, grapefruit and melon. Thankfully, no oak was applied; this winery has a heavy hand with barrels. This new bottling is young enough to retain the crispness and liveliness of the natural fruit.
Name: Cave B 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From the cool, northerly Elqui Valley, this wine tastes like a New Zealand knock-off. It shows bright green-fruit aromas, tropical notes, minerality and salinity on the nose, while the palate is wet, fresh and full of tingly apple, lime and tangerine flavors. A bit lean and scouring on thefinish, but likable.
Name: San Pedro 2008 Castillo de Molina Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: An honest and expressive rendition of Chilean SB. There's a bit of prickle and snap to the nose, followed by a friendly, lively palate that's citric and zesty but not too sharp or angular. Classy enough, especially for a Maipo white wine.
Name: Viña Tarapacá 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Comfortable and true smelling, with prickle and snap on the nose. The palate is round but also zesty. There's apple and citrus in the lead, and then some drying white pepper on the finish. Clean and friendly, not fancy, but an honest and tasty reflection of the Leyda Valley. Drink now.
Name: Viña Tarapacá 2008 Terroir La Isla Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: More than decent; this is good SB with no bells and whistles but lots of straight-ahead competence. The nose is dusty and plump, while the palate has roundness, weight and likable citrus, green melon and other common, fresh flavors. Sometimes the basics are more than enough; this is a casein point.
Name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: This is a perfectly good and honest wine, with aromas of fresh lettuce yet not a whole lot of vivid fruit. So in that sense, it is like many SBs from cool-climate Limarí. But if the nose is shy, the palate offers nice, cheerful apple and melon flavors. Smooth enough and almost round, withno edgy acidity or overt zap.
Name: La Playa 2008 Block Selection Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Fresh and zippy, this is loaded with lime and passion fruit flavors, tinged with just enough herbal character to give it that distinctive Marlborough tang.
Name: Goldwater 2008 Wairau Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Our expectations for Maipo SB are usually tempered, but this is good and secure. The nose is light and honest, while the palate offers forward grapefruit, orange and lime flavors. The feel is full and comfortable, and it finishes and settles well and a little green. Drink right away.
Name: Nuevomundo 2008 Estate Bottled Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Nice and welcoming on the nose, with melon, citrus and other punchbowl aromas. The palate is graced with fine acidity, which amplifies the wine's standard green apple and lime flavors. Clean and showing no glaring issues. Textbook everyday Chilean SB; we could drink this stuff forever.
Name: Montes 2008 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Varietally correct, with familiar prickly aromas along with citrus and sweat. It's pretty much all you could ask for at under $10, and with honest lemon and pineapple flavors its committed and alive. Good mouthfeel with grab and body only secures its standing as a white wine Best Buy.
Name: Carmen 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: With more than a quarter of million cases of this wine coming to the U.S., Nobilo's Regional Collection SB will turn up on a lot of tables over the summer—and justifiably so. It's a very good rendition of Marlborough Sauvignon, offering grassy aromas and flavors backed by lime and grapefruit. It's plump enough to have mass appeal, with a refreshingly crisp finish. Like almost all NZ Savvies, it should be consumed over the next 6–9 months.
Name: Nobilo 2008 Regional Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a robust Sauvignon Blanc that announces itself with aromas of grass, spice and straw, leading into a combination of fresh fruit and earthy spice flavors. A great balance of acid, fruit and spice means it's assertive, but still poised. A fun wine with lots of character.
Name: MAN Vintners 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: New Zealand seems to be the model for this highly pungent and scrappy wine. To this taster, Quintay's basic Casablanca SB is easier to like and more balanced. This one is prickly to the max, with sweaty aromas and flavors of lemon-lime, tarragon and celery. It's sharp and cleansing, but not quite fruity and rewarding enough to rank as an excellent wine. Still, it has its virtues.
Name: Quintay 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Tropical fruit and a touch of lemon lead on this gentle white. Elegant and approachable, its combination of crisp lemon and citrus with rounded tropical fruit flavors gives it a balanced, complex edge. Soft spice and a lemon zing finish it off.
Name: Robertson Winery 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though not labeled as such, this 75% Sauvignon Blanc/25% Sémillon blend is moderately ripe, lightly toasty, and a well-balanced, all-purpose white wine for poultry and richer seafood.
Name: Three Rivers 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Nice throughout. It begins with fresh aromas of lime and pineapple, which are backed by flavors of generic citrus and more pineapple. It's wet, agile and shows good acidity and balance. This is no superstar SB, but for crispness and freshness it more than gets the job done.
Name: Villard 2008 Expresión Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Fresh and composed, with aromas of asparagus, mineral and citrus. The palate is mild and balanced, with green-infused flavors that hint at bell pepper, green apple and garden-fresh herbs. Slightly pithy and peppery on the tail end, but honest as Casablanca SBs go. Good for quaffing.
Name: MontGras 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Loaded with passion fruit and pineapple, this is a crisp, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc made for early consumption. It should fit the bill with shellfish or as a bracing apéritif this summer.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2008 Ti Point Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Shows a prickly side that's true to the variety. Smells and tastes slightly salinic, but also shows good verve and mouthfeel. This is a lively style of SB with citrus and green-apple flavors. It finishes with edgy gooseberry and seems committed to the crisp, lean style (even from warmer Maule Valley).
Name: Palo Alto 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: A solid, well-made Sauvignon Blanc from RockBare that combines aromas of melon rind and underripe nectarine with flavors of stone fruit and citrus, this is a nice wine, albeit not one that solves the mystery of what Austin Powers was missing in The Spy Who Shagged Me.
Name: RockBare 2008 Mojo Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: True aromas of green fruit and grapefruit send it off in the right direction. For Maule SB, this is pretty lively and refreshing. The palate features zesty green-apple flavors backed by a jumpy, agile finish. Nothing special but good while it's young and fresh.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: After several years spent in Chile's land of the lost, Santa Carolina is now refocusing its winemaking efforts with noticeable results. This SB shows mineral, melon and piquant zap. It's got grapefruit, passion fruit and citrus, and the finish is both crisp and generous. A good quaffer that's on the spot. Imported by Carolina Wine Brands USA.
Name: Santa Carolina 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Ostensibly a Central Otago producer, Rabbit Ranch sources the fruit for its Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough. The result is a lemony, grapefruity wine, with subdued herbal notes lurking in the background. It's medium in body, with a crisp, citrusy finish. Drink now.
Name: Rabbit Ranch 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Odfjell enters the world of Sauvignon Blanc with this clean, reserved wine. It has light lime and wet-stone aromas, and then a palate that's sort of plump and melony in feel, with green melon and peach pit flavors. Shows some bitterness late, but overall it delivers as much as you'd expectfor the price.
Name: Odfjell 2008 Armador Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Vavasour has done better than this in the past, and undoubtedly will do better in the future. The 2008 just lacks a bit of the jacked-up pungency that it has had in the past, instead offering relatively tame white grapefruit aromas and flavors and just a touch of grassiness. Well made, clean and refreshing.
Name: Vavasour 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: Spritzy and spunky, but already the flavors seems to be on the way out. The bouquet is salinic and narrow, with more sea water and clam shell than bright, forward fruit scents. Still, this is true Chilean SB, so there's ample melon, apple and other green flavors, including bell pepper.
Name: Errazuriz 2007 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Lean and taut in style, with aromas of lemon rind and underripe melons and flavors that are zippy and zesty. This is crisp and refreshing, ending on a lemony note.
Name: Henschke 2007 Coralinga Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Straightforward as can be, with green apple, mild citrus and other mild aromas. The palate is clean yet neutral, with a collection of white-fruit flavors and a bit of sweet melon. Finishes slightly pithy and bitter, but overall it shows no major faults or issues.
Name: Santa Ema 2008 Selected Terroir Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: We haven't seen anything labeled Trio for years, but the return of this Concha y Toro brand seems solid. Aromas of orange blossom, lime and other green fruits are good, while flavors of citrus, grapefruit and cucumber are fresh and appealing. A good but standard wine that is lifted by a touch of green herb and brine.
Name: Concha y Toro 2008 Trio Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Fresh but not overly racy, with apple and pear aromas. There's ample snap and pop to the palate, but not a whole lot of body or specificity of flavors. That said, the tastes of lemon and green apple are clean albeit shallow, and the finish is more of the same. Drink now.
Name: Undurraga 2008 Aliwen Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Whispy and lightweight on the nose, with hints of celery, sweat and passion fruit. There's not a ton to say about this pedestrian but well-made Sauvignon. It is citrusy with a touch of bell pepper, and it finishes in a comfortable way. Classic everyday SB from Casablanca is what this tastes, smells and feels like. Drink now.
Name: Casas del Bosque 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Opens with true citrus, nettle and other snappy, prickly aromas. Like many Chilean SBs, it's fresh and charging, with zesty green-fruit and citrus flavors. Lime is present on the finish, as is a touch of lasting bitterness. Good but straightforward, and slightly narrow.
Name: Viña Mar de Casablanca 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Straightforward punchbowl aromas greet you, and beyond that there's melon to the nose. The palate is decidedly softer and rounder than Cono Sur's higher-tier SBs, while the flavors run toward familiar lemon and green apple. Finishes sweet but comfortable. Perfectly good and competent.
Name: Cono Sur 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: A pleasant change of pace from the usual Marlborough recipe of tropical fruit and herbal tang, this offering instead supplies copious amounts of citrusy aromas and flavors coupled to a hint of stony minerality. It's round in the mouth, just fading away a bit quickly on the finish.
Name: Omaka Springs 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent upfront, marrying freshly cut grass with hints of sweat and backing those scents up with bright citrus fruit. Flavors are musky and complex, adding fig and melon to the mix, all carried by a plump texture and a moderately long finish.
Name: Otuwhero 2008 O:TU Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Opens with aromatics of jalapeño, fresh lettuce, green apple and white pepper. The body is lithe and dances across the palate, while flavors of tangerine, Yellow Delicious apples and passion fruit are clean, light and familiar. An easygoing, likable and honest style of Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: San Pedro 2008 35° South Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: This wine starts with an intriguing nose that is at once floral, fresh and spicy. On the palate, it's racy and fun but has an elegant, delicate edge. A combination of lemon and grass flavors with tropical melons and fruits are balanced and enjoyable. A good go-to white that will pair well with grilled seafood and salads.
Name: De Wetshof 2008 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Description: Call this a softer-style, drink-me-now type of SB. It's not complicated and the acidity is sort of tame, but get at it in its youth and the wine will deliver modest green-fruit and green-herb aromas and flavors. Finishes dry and a little bitter. Nicely packaged in a catchy frosted bottle.
Name: La Playa 2008 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Quelat is Ventisquero's highest-reaching SB, but it seems narrow and ultra tight, with match stick on the nose and not a ton of fruit. As it unwinds, more aromas and flavors come out; but always is it slightly vegetal. Alongside that dominant “green” character, look for pineapple and plenty of acidity.
Name: Ventisquero 2008 Queulat Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Round on the nose, with green-apple aromas. There's no angularity or sharpness to this SB despite full acidity, and the flavors of orange and grapefruit are alert but pithy. A good but regular effort, especially for warm-climate Colchagua.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2008 Casa La Joya Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A pretty tropical fruit nose leads on this Sauvignon Blanc from a consistently good producer. On the palate, the lush fruit falls a little flat, but the wine has a simple and dependable character that makes for good everyday sipping. Crisp and with a touch of delicate fruit, it has character and charm.
Name: Slowine 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Overberg)

Description: There's something plaguing the nose here: talcum powder? air freshener? Whatever, it seems powdery and a touch artificial. The palate features soft flavors of green bean and orange juice, and the mild vegetal character carries onto the finish. Plump, with some friendliness, but a touch green.
Name: Arboleda 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: A good effort given the price. Although the nose is a little bland, the wine is clean and shows hints of pear and sweet grapefruit. The palate is wet and not overly concentrated, so things flow easily as it delivers tepid lime and citrus flavors. A lightweight made for limited-thought quaffing, which is exactly what you should expect for eight bucks.
Name: Valdivieso 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: The bouquet delivers moderate citrus and snap, while the palate offers midlevel varietal flavors of lime and generic citrus. There's a smattering of green-herb character, while the finish is peppery, light, a touch watery but fresh. Drink soon and it should elicit more smiles than frowns.
Name: Misiones de Rengo 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Perhaps this is starting to tire? There's a slightly waxy dullness to the wine's otherwise interesting citrus aromas, while the flavors of lemon and white grapefruit are pleasant without being captivating. Drink up.
Name: Stone Paddock 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: A little soft and heavy on the nose, which conveys a sense of overripeness. In the mouth, it's not overly heavy but it is sort of chunky as flavors of apple and citrus brush up against mealy but then draw back to a fresher place. Finishes mild, with only a modicum of acidity. Drink soon for best results.
Name: Haras 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: This light- to medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc appears to aim at a minerally style, marrying hints of green (veggies?) with otherwise pleasant citrusy aromas and flavors. Grapefruit and anise make an appearance on the finish. Drink up.
Name: Cairnbrae 2007 The Stones Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Casa Silva is known more for its red wines, but this Colchagua SB is not bad. It has warmer-climate characteristics such as apple cider aromas and sweeter flavors of white grapes and sweet apples. It's round, easy and short. Your best bet is to drink it now before it flattens out.
Name: Casa Silva 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: An elegant white with a nose that combines zippy citrus, minerals and a touch of guava. The palate offers clean and spritzy character with a wave of rounding tropical fruit and a spin of spice. Pair with spicy food—think Indian or Thai.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: A bit green and ashy, with aromas of green bean, green tobacco and bell pepper. It's not over-the-top vegetal, but it does deal plenty of green bean and celery in addition to tangerine. As a whole it's wet and easy on the palate, but it doesn't have the clarity of flavor and pure fruit that we're seeking from Leyda and Chile as a whole.
Name: Terra Andina 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Slightly sweet and powdery smelling, with simple creaminess to the orange-influenced nose. The palate is solid and plump, with basic citrus flavors that shouldn't steer you wrong. Nice feel and a good but regular finish seal the deal.
Name: Viña Requingua 2008 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Easygoing on the nose, with light melon and green-fruit aromas. Yet it's crisp in the mouth, but sort of choppy and tart as well. The wine is refreshing but short and linear, as if some of the pulp and power were siphoned off. What's left is fresh and lasting, but a little weak in flavor.
Name: Yali 2008 Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Two Oceans offers a friendly, vibrant sip with this Sauvignon Blanc. Tropical fruit, gooseberry, some straw on the nose and simple, fresh citrus and fleshy tropical fruit flavors give the wine complexity. A fun white with some heft.
Name: Two Oceans 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: True bargains are hard to come by, so drop your guard for this $8 SB and you may wind up happy. Xplorador from Concha Y Toro is peachy and simple, with light grassiness and green notes. But it does have a plump, neutral palate and likable pineapple and apple flavors. Inoffensive and not flashy, but good for the money.
Name: Concha y Toro 2008 Xplorador Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Pleasant but nothing out of the ordinary. The nose is light and mildly green, while flavors of citrus are wet and fresh but devoid of character. Good for simple imbibing, but doesn't go much beyond the basics of Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Santa Alicia 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Reasonably nice peach, melon and apple flavors are nothing extraordinary, but together they make for a decent nose. The palate is soft but not what you'd call flabby, while flavors of pear, apple and banana are innocuous and shouldn't send anyone running to the door. For best results, drinknow.
Name: Carta Vieja 2008 Clásico Sauvignon Blanc (Loncomilla Valley)

Description: Can't really say there's much difference between this and Carta Vieja's Classico SB. Both are bland, with chunky apple and pear characteristics. Neither has much of a pulse, but on the plus side they aren't nasty or aggressive. This “limited release” turns out to be a basic wine for basicoccasions.
Name: Carta Vieja 2008 Single Vineyard Limited Release Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Loncomilla Valley)

Description: Plump but wholly generic, with semisweet aromas that are neither here nor there. The palate is round, with adequate to good mouthfeel. And the flavors of citrus are solid but kind of pithy and bitter. A full, chunky wine with virtues as well as some flaws. Drink right away for best results.
Name: Aresti 2007 Estate Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: This is a light- to medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc that's clean and fresh, but not particularly intense or characterful—the kind you can comfortably serve to a non-wine crowd and expect accolades for your choice. Drink now.
Name: Redcliffe 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Generic in every way, but commendable for its freshness, green-fruit aromas and body. This wine offers nothing more than mid-level fruit flavors, but it's flush and nice enough on the palate. Some bitterness to the finish re-emphasizes its basic quality.
Name: Gracia de Chile 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Seems a bit disjointed, showing some attractive ripe stone fruit character and tropical notes that then veer into an odd, banana-like part of the fruit spectrum. Warm and spicy on the finish rather than crisp and refreshing.
Name: Allan Scott 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Not sure what has changed at Isabel, but the wines seem to lack the excitement of past vintages. The 2007 is oddly neutral, with waxy overtones to the grapefruit and lemon flavors and a slightly bitter note on the finish.
Name: Isabel Estate 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A heavier, more vegetal style of Sauvignon Blanc, with aromas of alfalfa and peas. It's a struggle to find much ripe fruit in this wine, and instead it rests on flavors of melon, canned peas and bell pepper. A bit soft in texture as well.
Name: Miguel Torres 2008 Santa Digna Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: The nose is jumbled and loses you along the way. In the mouth, the wine is a bit too extreme to stay within the lines. It has big, crude lemony flavors and a jumpy, tart, extended finish. Not bad or offensive, but lacks polish and friendliness even at $9.
Name: Terra Andina 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Soft, tropical and melony on the nose, and without a whole lot of zap. The palate deals banana, pear and sweet apple flavors, while the finish is sweet and sort of chunky. Standard stuff with a short lifespan. Drink soon.
Name: San Pedro 2008 Gato Negro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Lime and grapefruit aromas are more or less clean, but the palate seems underdeveloped as it teeters toward sour. Not bad per se, but there isn't much to offset the strong acidity, and thus it tastes tart and sheering in the long run.
Name: Ku Dé Ta 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This restrained, melon-scented Sauvignon Blanc comes across as nicely balanced but lacking in concentration, falling off rapidly on the finish.
Name: Southbank Estate 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Firm but limited, with some sharpness and sweat to the nose. The wine has a round texture but not much in the way of fruit character or nuance. It tastes like grapefruit pith and green melon, with mild bitterness on the finish.
Name: Santa Rita 2008 120 Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Not sure what it is that makes this wine a “special reserve” as opposed to regular; maybe it passed through some oak, because there's thickness and a whiff of vanilla. But overall it's not that fresh and seems to be fading. There isn't much precision or forward fruit; instead it's sort of mealy and indecisive. Past its prime already?
Name: Simone 2007 Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Pickled and challenged, with a slightly skunky nose that indicates that it is already past its prime. And when tasted side-by-side with the 2008, the newer wine is definitely the way to go. This wine tastes mildly tart and green, with a spritzy mouthfeel that's not in union with the wine'sbody or flavors.
Name: San Pedro 2007 1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Even though Casillero is a respected value-based brand, this one has integration issues. The nose seems flat and fruitless, and the palate is quite acidic yet watery. Flavors of child's vitamins and orange juice are not elevated, and in the end it's simply wet and biting. 300,000 cases made, which makes it “mass” by any definition.
Name: Concha y Toro 2008 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Very intense and borderline rough. The nose is burnt/acrid, nutty and sulfuric, and ultimately it's a rough go. The palate is also aggressive and lemony, with an undercurrent of tart green apple. Then sulfur returns on the finish. Sometimes less is more, and this one just pushes too hard,with shaky results.
Name: Misiones de Rengo 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Heavy and pickled, and not exhibiting much clarity or freshness on the nose, palate or finish. Not many Chilean SBs are really lacking, but this one is. It shows sour apple and lime for fruit, and with its briny pickle flavors it just isn't very good.
Name: Casa Donoso 2008 Evolución Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: A strained wine with resiny aromas. It smells grainy, wheaty and might just be oaked. Whatever the case, this is not an appealing wine. It lacks varietal aromas, flavors and zest. Drinkable but not recommended.
Name: TerraMater 2008 Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Very lightweight in color and aromas, but that isn't the wine's number one problem. That would be scouring acidity that leaves the palate exhausted and overstimulated. Sharp almost to the point of scouring, with flavors of lime and underripe pineapple. Not a very good Chilean Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Chiway 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (San Antonio)

Description: Quite green, with aromas of canned peas, ashtray and green tobacco. We know the Elqui Valley is a northern region with a cool climate, but this wine has so little fresh or tropical fruit that it tastes too much like green beans or asparagus. A classic case of vegetal SB.
Name: Falernia 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

Description: It's not hard to spot the top wine from Domaine Thomas, given the name and the weight of the bottle. It is a wine that needs aging, its intense, concentrated mineral character needing to soften. But already it is rich, with its ripe apple flavors freshened with orange zest.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2006 Ultimus  (Sancerre)

Description: Showing both toast and ripe yellow fruits, this is a generous wine. The apricot and spice flavors go hand in hand with richness and opulence. Yes, there is Sauvignon freshness, but this is a wine that concentrates much more on its intensity of flavor.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2006 Grand'Chaile  (Sancerre)

Description: A big-hearted Sauvignon, packed with green and white fruits and a hint of tropical fruits and spice. It has a touch of yeast that gives richness to the body. Final flavors of pear and green plum dominate.
Name: Domaine Seguin 2006 Cuvée Prestige  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Intense wine, certainly herbaceous but containing a fine seam of minerality that offers structure and tightness as well as grapefruit flavors. The wine is complex, the flavors going deep down into the palate. At the moment, citrus fruits dominate. Expect these to broaden out in the next year.
Name: Domaine Thomas & Fils 2007 La Crêle  (Sancerre)

Description: A tight yet full wine with flavors of lemon and grapefruit. The palate has some yeasty character allied to ripe green fruits and a concentrated, structured profile that brings out green plum skins as well as pear spice.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2005 Grande Cuvée Fournier L'Ancienne Vigne  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Great wafts of white currants come from this delicious—but definitely too young—wine. It is full of flavor, fruity and ripe. There's a good structure from green apple skins and tight acidity. Give it another year.
Name: Domaine Seguin 2007  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: A rich wine from a ripe year. The flavors are full and open, edged with a mushroom character that suggests maturity. The fruits are going towards almonds, while the structure has softened.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2005 Grand Cuvée Fournier Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: An enticingly perfumed wine, with its white flowers and apricot blossom. The palate is soft, rich, moving towards yellow fruits, ripe pink grapefruit and just an edge of mineral chalkiness.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2006 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)

Description: A full, soft Sauvignon from close to Sancerre. There is a light, yeasty character to this young wine, but the fruit is all there—fresh pink grapefruit, lime and green berries. The finish is acidic and crisp, but still mouth-filling.
Name: Domaine Philippe Portier 2007  Quincy

Description: Concentrated, with white fruits, a strong streak of herbaceousness, green apples and a rich texture. The wine shows intensity as well as youth. It really needs another year before drinking.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2006 Les Caillottes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Description: Classic, intensely herbaceous and grassy, this is fine cool-climate Sauvignon Blanc. It keeps some restraint as the fresh grapefruit flavors soften out midpalate. The final flavor, though, is full-on asparagus and green fruits.
Name: Domaine des Corbillières 2007 Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Fruity, with delicious apricot flavors and some weight from aging on the lees, this is a ripe, full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It is full of boundless fruit and fresh acidity and finishes rich but crisp.
Name: Domaine Gibault 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: An herbal Sauvignon that is fresh and on the lean side. The flavors are of crisp green apples, very fruity, with a structure of lime zest and vivid acidity on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Menetou-Salon is a near neighbor of Sancerre. Its wines are, like this, lighter and leaner than the better-known appellation. This wine displays a soft but herbaceous, grassy character with a steely edge. Drink now.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2006 La Charnivolle  (Menetou-Salon)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A fresh, simple wine with an edge of earthiness and flavors of soft caramel and apricot skin. There is a green herbal character leading into the light, crisp finish.
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Description: With its aromas of aftershave and its flavor of lychee, this is hardly a typical Sauvignon Blanc. It does have some green highlights, but the main flavors here are sweet and rich, finishing with red currant acidity.
Name: Danielle de l'Ansée 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy, minty and sharp, this has a Sancerre-like edge, but with an extra weight to the fruit that is more reminiscent of like a South African Sauvignon Blanc. It's packed with green pea, herb, lemon and lots of citrusy flavors, all set against very sharp, bright but delicious natural acids.
Name: Rulo 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Up until now we haven't been real fond of the Oops brand from Chile. However, this Sauvignon Blanc is exactly what we like. It starts with a basic but comfortable blend of citrusy aromas before showing a complete palate consisting of apple, grapefruit, celery and white pepper flavors. A totally solid wine with no gaps. Level and delicious, with proper bite and scour.
Name: oops 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Having never been impressed by this Lurton-owned label's Sauvignon Blancs, consider this a pleasant surprise. It's nervy and citric on the nose, with hints of sweat and grapefruit. Yet the palate is very clean and fresh, with bright green apple, lime and melony flavors. Pithy but clear on the finish, with zing. It's what we hope for from Chilean SB.
Name: J. & F. Lurton 2008 Hacienda Araucano Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: The Best Buy parade for Chilean Sauvignon Blanc is bolstered by this pure, stable '07. The nose deals hints of melon, vanilla bean and lime, although it's mostly neutral. Flavors of green apple, citrus and so forth are familiar, while the feel and finish are smooth, comfortable and just deep enough. Drink now.
Name: Yali 2007 Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Juicy and tart, this estate-grown Sauvignon Blanc has a pleasing mix of light melon, lime, white peach and grapefruit flavors. Hints of sweet grass and a suggestion of sweetness, like lemonade, fill out the finish.
Name: Vin du Lac 2007 LEHM Michaela's Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Maybe a little more ripe and heady than some of its Chilean buddies, but this SB from Montes offers freshness, zip and good citrus, tarragon and other green-herb flavors. The feel is good, the character fresh, and the finish long and clean. Offers maybe a little more green-leaf character than some might like, but overall this is another fine value SB from Chile. Drink immediately.
Name: Montes 2007 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca-Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: After its rather sugary 2006 version of this wine, Maryhill has returned to a more authentic, grassy style in 2007, with the alcohol back up over 14%. It's a big improvement, showing varietal character and ripe flavors of melon and grapefruit.
Name: Maryhill 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Neutral and clean, with hints of melon, apple and cucumber. For a 2007, this is still holding its own. It offers just enough richness and body to tease, but mostly it's a textbook Chilean SB with apple, grapefruit and gooseberry flavors along with a pithy finish. Gracious and tasty, but drink now.
Name: Santa Ema 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: Quiet on the nose and 100% inoffensive. The palate hints at bell pepper and green bean while also dealing ample pineapple and citrus. Turns a little tart and lean on the back end, but that frames the wine's freshness, zest and energy. Another good Sauvignon Blanc from Chile that's made to drink now.
Name: Root:1 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc from Greece is in step with the general Greek white wine style: refreshing, clean and approachable. A nose with some tropical fruit, lemon zest and a touch of fresh grass unfolds into flavors of fresh citrus and spice. Simply good and a definite Asian food and seafood cohort.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2007 Amethystos Sauvignon Blanc (Drama)

Description: Quite “varietal” in that it hits with sweaty, nutty grapefruit aromas. Airing allows the white fruit components in the wine to show themselves, and thus lemon and tangerine work the palate. Finishes sort of thin and narrow, with more acidity than body or depth of flavor. Good but on the sharp side.
Name: Ventisquero 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Nearly colorless as well as crisp and racy, this SB from northerly Limarí starts with snappy lime, white grapefruit and orange aromas. Reflecting its cooler origin, it is sharp as far as acidity goes, with a short, flashy finish. A little scouring but still good. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
Name: Tamaya 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Hints of melon and talcum powder suggest sweetness, and the palate is ripe, a little soft and dominated by pear and even some lychee flavors. Maybe there's a hint of residual sugar, but if so, it's minor. Mild bitterness doesn't really help the finish, but overall this is a flavorful and competent value wine.
Name: Quasar 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Edgy, nervy and funky, with unfamiliar aromas and flavors. The nose is pickled and the palate is tart, linear and green. Loses itself as it opens, turning more herbal, sweaty and strange. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
Name: Tamaya 2007 Winemaker's Selection Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is every bit the equal of, if not even a bit better than, the outstanding 2005 Novelty Hill Sauvignon Blanc. Here is the same mix of racy, bracing tropical and stone fruit flavors, nicely matched to toasty flavors of almonds and biscuits. Elegant, detailed and ripe, yet clearly varietal, this is a beautiful, seductive example of barrel-fermented Washington Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Novelty Hill 2006 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This vineyard-designated Sauv Blanc is half fermented in stainless steel, 40% in concrete eggs and the rest in French oak. It is completely different from the winery's Columbia Valley bottling, with much riper and rounder fruit flavors showing off stone fruits, such as peaches and apricots, along with tropical hints of papaya. There's plenty of stuffing and spice, and a perfect mix of the grape's innate herbaceous and grassy qualities, ramped up with riper, sweeter fruit.
Name: Matthews 2007 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Two styles of Sauvignon Blanc were made in this inaugural vintage for Efesté white wines. This one uses commercial yeast and is the richer of the two, with light tropical, grapefruit and lemon peel flavors. There is a wrapping of honeycomb and a dry, persistent finish somewhat suggestive of a particularly ripe Sancerre such as Cotat.
Name: Efeste 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Two styles of Sauvignon Blanc were made in this inaugural vintage for Efesté white wines. This one uses wild/native yeast, and is the more elegant of the two, which both used the same Sagemoor vineyard grapes. There is pleasing detail, dried herb, sweet grass, even fresh mushroom, and overall a more herbaceous tone to the fruit, without the tropical flavors of the regular bottling.
Name: Efeste 2007 Feral Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From 30-year-old vines on the Oregon side of the Columbia Valley, this bone-dry Sauvignon Blanc has a dusty, sweetly herbal bouquet that gives it a European spin. Acids are sharp, tangy and natural, and the fruit flavors mix citrus and grapefruit with just a hint of pineapple. It's a fine follow-up to the winery's exceptional 2006.
Name: Sineann 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 85% Stillwater fruit and 15% Klipsun. It was fermented in three quite different ways, a mix of 25% concrete eggs, 25% new French oak barrels and 50% stainless steel. Moving toward a Pouilly Fumé style, winemaker Matthew Loso has crafted a sleek, racy, highly textural wine, loaded with refreshing flavors and scents of cut grass, citrus rind and extended lees contact.
Name: Matthews 2007 Columbia Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's a nice, juicy, lip-smacking tang to this Sauv Blanc, like biting into a not quite ripe peach or a lemon drop. It's a good mix of citrus, steel and stone. A small amount of Sémillon in the blend adds weight to the midpalate.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Honest Sauvignon aromas of citrus and grapefruit set out the welcome mat. The palate follows suit with varietally correct grapefruit and lime flavors, while the finish shows club soda and other drying aspects. Not a world-beater but a pleasing wine.
Name: Finca El Portillo 2008 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Two Vines makes an outstanding Sauvignon Blanc for the price. The 2006 release is a high-acid rendering, fruity and quite dry. Citrus and melon aromas and flavors stand out, along with characteristic and quite pleasant herbaceous notes.
Name: Columbia Crest 2006 Two Vines Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly spritzy, grassy and crisp, with melon, pineapple and grapefruit. Is there just a hint of sweetness to cut the grassiness?
Name: Snoqualmie 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a good, every day effort, much like the baseline Ste. Michelle Sauvignon Blancs. Lightly grassy, lemony and tart, it is an all-purpose quaffer.
Name: Mercer 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just a splash of Chenin Blanc has been added to the blend, adding some lift to the aromas and suggestions of citrus blossom. The natural herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc has been kept in check, but the wine is clean and varietal. The flavors seem just a bit muted, almost thin, but it's a perfectly refreshing, if simple effort.
Name: Covey Run 2006 Quail Series Fumé Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean and bright, this gold-colored wine tastes of crisp ripe apples. The finish adds lightly toasted cracker, perhaps from the fermentation in two year old barrels. It's a very pleasant bottle of white wine for sipping.
Name: Cor Cellars 2006 Milbrandt Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Light and fresh, with neutral aromas. The palate is pithy and drying, with persistent apple and lime flavors. Some bitterness works its way onto the finish, but it's more like grapefruit pith than anything offensive. Good and eminently drinkable given Argentina's spotty record with SB.
Name: Mapema 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Yellow in color, with aromatic hints of honey, pear and wax bean. The palate is acidic and lemony, with additional notes of citrus pith and green apple. Very much a clean and acidic wash, but beyond the scour and zest there isn't much to hang your hat on.
Name: Bodega Norton 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Somewhat sharp and piercing on the nose, with a blast of warm nuttiness. The palate is heavier than most, with mealy citrus and green notes. Finishes dry, mildly bitter and weighty. Doesn't really shine or stand out.
Name: Pascual Toso 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maipú)

Description: Light and searing, with citrus, lime and pickle aromas that are true to the variety but sharp. Very tangy in the mouth, with tart, limited lime-based flavors. Sour and scour sum it up. Razor city.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2008 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Description: For Chilean Sauvignon Blanc with character, style and panache, Kingston Family's Cariblanco is a perennial pace-setter. There's mineral, sea air and tropical fruit aromas to get it going. Next in line is a flush palate of passion fruit and green apple. Finishes long and stylish, with elegance.
Name: Kingston Family 2007 Cariblanco Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Typical Adelaide Hills Sauvignon Blanc (it appeared on the 2008 MW exam), with grassy aromas laid over a base of passion fruit and gooseberry. It's medium in body, finishing with hints of mineral, citrus fruit and great freshness. Drink now.
Name: Shaw and Smith 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: A refreshing, lively white with a citric nose and flavors of lemon/lime mingled with elegant acidity. Approachable but has a memorable character.
Name: Porcupine Ridge 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This crisp, focused wine may not be quite as racy as its namesake dog breed, but it is very fresh. There's a touch of green apple, but the majority of the fruit leans more toward white grapeffruit, with a long finish.
Name: Longview 2007 Whippet Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Like so many Chilean producers, Santa Ema has turned to the coastal Leyda Valley for cool-climate, green-tinted Sauvignon Blanc. And while Amplus is melony and ripe, it also shows that oceanic character via green papaya, passion fruit and other grassy flavors. Good for a first-time effort, but with room to improve.
Name: Santa Ema 2007 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: MontGras's new label from Leyda is Amaral, and when I first tasted it last summer it was so young and jumpy that it had spritz. Now it has settled, and despite having a whiff of green and ocean foam, the passion fruit, apple and citrus flavors are at their best. It's a loud wine with kick, and our bet is that it should be drunk right away. However, at 14.5% it may seem aggressive to those who prefer restrained white wines.
Name: Amaral 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc offers bang for the buck, with its dancing aromas of citrus and spice, and fuller bodied fruit flavors. Spice and minerals balance the tropical fruit flavors, and added complexity means it will pair well with dishes of character. Think chicken, seafood, Asian.
Name: Brampton 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Pretty and energetic, with aromas of gooseberry, citrus and slaty minerals. Like flavors follow and the wine offers balanced acidity and a crisp, clean character. Pair it with seafood or poultry dishes.
Name: De Wetshof 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

Description: This elegant Elgin white starts with a slightly grassy nose, flecked by aromas of cspice and lemon. The wine's flavors of citrus and spice have a light touch and fruit is balanced by good minerality and acid. A refreshing, easygoing Sauvignon Blanc that will pair well with seafood and lightly spiced ethnic cuisine.
Name: M'Hudi 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Strongly herbal, a surprise in an Australian Sauvignon Blanc, but the green notes are balanced by tropical fruit flavors, including passion fruit. It's on the lean side and nicely dry, finishing fresh, clean and zesty.
Name: Rosemount 2007 Diamond Label Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Good for Maipo Sauvignon Blanc, meaning it maintains a sense of purpose and elegance and doesn't go flat and flabby. It's a tropical express on the palate, with pineapple, passion fruit and gooseberry flavors. Finishes clean and short, but gets the job done. Drink now.
Name: Haras 2007 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: A little plumper and rounder than you might expect from a Sauvignon Blanc, but the flavors are recognizable, ranging from grapefruit through melon and fig before picking up a hint of jalapeño on the finish.
Name: Four Sisters 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: A crisp, fresh Sauvignon Blanc, with definite herbaceous character, giving grapefruit flavors over a steely core of green skin tannins. There is a final burst of green fruit juice to finish.
Name: Xavier Flouret 2006 Domaine Chatelan French Blonde  (Sancerre)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Grassy and pungent, with fruit flavors that verge on vegetal, almost into green bean. Yet it's not unpleasant, offering decent weight and a long, herbal finish that suggests pairing with simply prepared seafood dishes.
Name: Centennial 2006 Bong Bong White Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Aromas of peach, lemon and apple hint at the zippy but layered character of this white. On the palate, more lemon and apple flavors dance on a fruity, minerally wave. Easy and fun, but with added character, this wine will pair well with Thai or Indian dishes. Imported by Racke USA.
Name: Golden Kaan 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Light and mostly fresh, with shy peach and green-fruit aromas. The palate is soft and reticent, with lower-level acids and chunky melon and papaya flavors. Finishes pithy and thus mildly bitter. Drink soon or wait for the 2008.
Name: Peñalolen 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: The cheek of it, playing the New Zealanders at their own game, even down to the name. Has it worked? Light, fresh, very crisp, the wine doesn't have the intensity of a Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. But it is deliciously grassy, green, herbaceous, all the things a cool climate Sauvignon Blanc can be. Screwcap.
Name: Kiwi Cuvée 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Description: There's no mistaking this pungent number for Sauvignon Blanc. It's sweaty and sharp smelling, with flavors of citrus, green fruits and capsicum. An aggressive varietal reflection that reflects Rueda's terroir. Probably not for most tastes.
Name: Blanco Nieva 2007 Sauvignon (Rueda)

Description: Curiously dusty wine, tasting of under-ripe cranberry with a coating of sweetness. While it is identifiably Sauvignon Blanc, it does seem to have missed out on the region's signature minerality. Screwcap.
Name: Michel Picard 2007  Sancerre

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This sharp, spicy, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc showcases the flavors of the Columbia Gorge AVA. It's a pungent wine, with sweet grassy flavors and a hint of toast, despite fermentation in stainless steel. Unusual but interesting.
Name: Cor Cellars 2006 Columbia View Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: Better known for its Pinot Noir, Ata Rangi has turned in a fine performance with its 2007 Sauvignon Blanc. It's grassy, but balanced by ripe fig and stone fruit characters that weave an intricately detailed medium-weight palate. Long on the finish. Drink now–2009.
Name: Ata Rangi 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Perfectly blends passion fruit with ripe peach and nectarine notes to yield a refreshing combination that folds in just enough herbal complexity. This medium-bodied SB's appealing flavors linger on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
Name: Neudorf 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Starts off with a minerally, slightly fumé-style note, then adds herbal and leafy notes and white grapefruit flavors. From New Zealand's first carbon-neutral winery, this medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc is appealingly long, crisp and clean on the finish.
Name: Grove Mill 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Daryl Groom has turned out a reasonably bold, intense Sauvignon Blanc that weighs in under 13% alcohol yet manages to avoid tasting malnourished or underripe. Fig, melon and citrus aromas and flavors hit the right buttons, then finish on a lingering note. Drink now.
Name: Groom 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: A full, rounded nose of honeyed spice and citrus gives this wine a sexy vibe from the start, and on the palate, curvy floral notes mingle perfectly with minerals and lively acid. Clean but complex, it's an intriguing white to pair with myriad dishes—think Thai or Indian.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2007 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: A drier, more minerally style than many coming out of Marlborough, with white grapefruit flavors that come across as brisk and refreshing. There's fruit weight on the palate, with the sort of stony flavors that pair with virtually any seafood dish.
Name: Huia 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Lively and elegant, this fruit-filled wine from Kevin Arnold is perfect for a gourmet meal in the summer. Fresh tropical fruit flavors like lychee mingle with a balanced acidity and impressive mouthfeel. Long finish.
Name: Waterford 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Steve Bird, who put Thornbury on the map before selling that brand to Villa Maria's owner, is back with a fairly rich, amply endowed Sauvignon Blanc. It's grassier to smell than to taste, with stone fruit and grapefruit flavors and just a hint of herbaceousness on the palate.
Name: Bird 2007 Old Schoolhouse Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A great value in Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, Hunter's 2007 marries ripe nectarine aromas and flavors with just enough acidity and a touch of grassiness to retain focus and varietal character. The lack of overt herbal notes makes it easy to pair with food, or drink on its own.
Name: Hunter's 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A layered nose with aromas of grapefruit, lemon and flowers is the start of this poised and pretty white. Crisp acidity, great balance and fresh, approachable fruit come together to offer an elegant, reliable sip. Pair with spicy foods, grilled fish or salads.
Name: Bellingham 2007 The Steppe Buzzard Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: This is a big, broad-shouldered Sauvignon Blanc, slightly oily in texture, with pungent scents of crushed tomato leaf and plenty of gooseberry fruit. The high alcohol, moderate acidity and richly concentrated fruit give the impression of sweetness on the long finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2007 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Wairau Valley)

Description: Oriel tapped Ant MacKenzie to be winemaker for its Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, and the result is a wine that marries ripe nectarines with more grassy, herbal, tomato-leaf notes. It's medium in body, finishing crisp and refreshing.
Name: Oriel 2006 Mana Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A bold, fruit-driven style of Sauvignon Blanc, with ripe flavors of passion fruit and nectarine. Shows plenty of weight and length, yet remains dry and easy to drink.
Name: Nick Goldschmidt 2006 Boulder Bank Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is a stylistic departure from the stereotypical Aussie stainless-steel Sauvignon Blanc, being fermented and aged in old French oak barrels for eight months. The result is a citrusy wine with greater depth and richer texture, even some leesy, slightly toasty notes that complement rather than overwhelm the fruit. Drink now–2010, but it could surprise and develop even more interest over time.
Name: De Bortoli 2007 Estate Grown Sauvignon (Yarra Valley)

Description: A light, sophisticated nose of white flowers and citrus is followed by balanced fresh fruit and acid. The wine has a light touch but impresses with its elegant overall character. Pair with grilled fish or salads. A wine with poise and class.
Name: Nederburg 2007 The Winemaster's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: With 75,000 cases of this wine now coming to the U.S., it has to be one of the more ubiquitous New Zealand offerings. Thankfully, the quality is very good, with ripe nectarine aromas and flavors touched by just a slight varietally correct grassiness. Long and mouthwatering on the finish.
Name: Whitehaven 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Good varietal character, especially on the pungent nose. Passion fruit and grapefruit control the juicy palate, which is sculpted in that so-called New Zealand style. Ready to drink, with citrus all the way to the back end.
Name: Agustinos 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: A plump, medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc with just a touch of residual sugar (3.5 g/l), this wine combines tropical notes of mango with honeyed citrus. It's basically dry, finishing with lingering fruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Shottesbrooke 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Proudly displays the leafy side of Sauvignon Blanc, with aromas that veer toward tomato and even tobacco, but rounded out by ripe fig and melon flavors. Long and mouthwatering on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Otuwhero 2007 O:TU Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A decent value from this Hawke's Bay-based winery, the 2007 Destination Series melds ripe nectarine aromas with herbal notes in a medium-weight wine that delivers exactly what you expect from Marlborough Sauvignon. Drink it now and over the next few months.
Name: Crossroads 2007 Destination Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Intensely perfumed, this is herbal but ripe, too, with fig and melon fruit aromas. It's boldly flavored in the same vein, with the only quibble being that it finishes a little short. A solid effort.
Name: Seifried 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Lively spice and minerals lead on the nose of this value white, with a play of fresh lemon citrus and acid offering refreshing character. The wine has body but is light. Perfect for seafood and solo sipping.
Name: Durbanville Hills 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Durbanville)

Description: Clean and fresh, with mineral undertones to the white grapefruit and fig flavors. Grassy upfront, providing that expected herbal edge. Drink now.
Name: Piko 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc boasts a slightly oily texture to go along with decently intense aromas of stone fruit and fresh herbs. Flavors of pineapple, currant and tomato leaf provide a good introduction to Marlborough Sauvignon. Imported by Five Gold Hands.
Name: Paua Rock 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a Sauvignon Blanc with more meat and punch than the average white. The nose, crisp, clean and fresh but rounded, leads into a balanced, substantial wine with good acidity and an assertive mouthfeel. Elegant but has character. Could pair with richer dishes.
Name: Buitenverwachting 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)

Description: Pleasantly soft and round, this is a good value Sauvignon Blanc for drinking over the next few months. Hints of stone fruit offset herbal notes reminiscent of crushed tomato leaf.
Name: Starborough 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: On the leaner side, with mineral overtones to the grapefruit and cut-grass aromas and flavors. Comes out of the bottle with some smelly reductive notes that take some aeration to eliminate, so decant before serving.
Name: Mount Nelson 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is showing a bit of age, with honeyed overtones creeping in atop the peach and herb flavors, but also shows decent weight and a dry, mineral-tinged finish. Drink soon. Imported by Pelco Inc.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2005 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Light peach aromas mix with a hint of sea breeze to give this wine a subtle approach. The palate is more alive, with mild citrus and lemon-lime flavors. Almost seems like a refreshing sip of lemonade by the time it fades away.
Name: La Playa 2007 Block Selection Limari Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Limarí Valley)

Description: Grapefruit and lemon aromas entice with this mouthwatering Sauv Blanc from respected producer Simonsig. Refreshing, balanced flavors follow and a spin of minerality gives the wine a food-friendly edge. Enjoy with grilled fish or salad.
Name: Simonsig 2007 Sunbird Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Pungent grassy aromas vie with passion fruit on the nose, while the flavors lean more toward the tropical fruit side of things. This is a medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc that plays it safe, offering a comfortable drink at a reasonable price.
Name: Seven Terraces 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: No question this is a taut, crisp, mineral, smoky Sauvignon Blanc from the grape's heartland. It has plenty of herbaceous edges, but the core is ripe, tropical and juicy.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2007  Sancerre

Description: Gracia de Chile is doing some good value varietals. This SB is one of them; it's peachy and citrusy on the nose, with melon and grapefruit flavors in wait. The palate has just enough weight and zest to be called balanced, and the finish lingers. Nice wine for by-the-glass.
Name: Gracia de Chile 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Dry, lean and tight, this is a crisply mineral Sauvignon Blanc that manges to avoid any sense of grassiness or overly herbal notes, instead focusing on a narrow range of fruit flavors: green apple, lime and grapefruit. Fine as an apéritif or with light seafood dishes. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2007 The Y Series Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)

Description: This rounded, ripe SB makes the most of its peach and tropical fruit flavors. Green plums lend structure to this soft wine, but there's a full, crisp aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2007 Vallée des Jardins Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

Description: An attractive nose of gooseberry and grapefruit is followed by bright, fresh flavors of lemon, tropical fruit and minerals in this affordable SB. Slightly lean but still elegant, the wine has a refreshing citric finish.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: There's quite an explosion of crisp fruit in this wine, as it shows crisp, green flavors, green apples, tense acidity and fruit tannins. Definitely cool climate, it still could age for 5 months.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2007  Pouilly-Fumé

Description: Citrusy and perfumed, with a bit of tomato-leaf herbalness thrown into the mix, this is a light, rainwater-fresh style of Sauvignon Blanc that needs more concentration and intensity before it can be considered top-flight. It's a workmanlike effort, but nothing more.
Name: Coldstream Hills 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Yarra Valley)

Description: A lightweight Sauvignon, one that offers clean fruit and flavor without a great deal of intensity. Grassy aromas lead the way, framed by passion fruit and pineapple flavors that fall away quickly on the finish.
Name: Martin's Rake 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tropically fruity, with passion fruit and pineapple notes on the nose that persist all the way through the slightly sweet finish.
Name: Tohu 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pretty aromas of flowers and tropical fruit and substantial flavors of citrus and spice give this wine character. Simple but good, the wine offers balance and a refreshing sip.
Name: Two Oceans 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Hmmm. This has plenty of intensity, strident grapefruit flavors and crisp acids, but the aromas are marked by onion or garlic scents that make the wine perplexing to evaluate. From memory, a bottle tasted nonblind seemed much cleaner, so perhaps the sample was just off?
Name: Matariki 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: A bright, fresh, spritely nose leads on this approachable white. Clean and fruity with a lively citrus backbone, it has character and an easy-drinking style that make it good for everyday sipping.
Name: The Yellow Cellar 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: Vanilla and pear aromas strongly hint at sweetness, and the palate delivers melon and pineapple flavors but not much balance or elegance. It's a fleshy, soft, overly fruity wine that stumbles to the finish line.
Name: Porta 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Herbs, spices and green fruit aromas show the freshness of this wine. On the palate, tropical fruits, apricots and lychees also appear, fleshing out a superb Sauvignon Blanc. With its edges of apple skin tannins, it could age for 2–3 years, but it already has huge concentration and elegance. Glass stopper.
Name: Sattlerhof 2006 Kranachberg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This wine's elegant, ripe, grapefruit and tropical fruits are concentrated and suggest 2–3 years aging. Its lively acidity, layered with green apple skin tannins and richness, gives the true pungency of Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Neumeister 2006 Klausen Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Don't look for grassy or herbaceous flavors, because there is not a trace of either. This is a stand-alone style that turns the usually snarly, gooseberry-flavored Sauvignon Blanc grape into a honeyed pussycat, ripe and   tropical and slightly sweet, with a toffee candy finish.
Name: Page Cellars 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: A rich wine, with tropical fruit flavors. Initially it seems soft, but then smooth acidity jumps in, giving depth of flavor, with green plums, creamy apples and intense ripeness. A real food wine.
Name: Winkler-Hermaden 2006 Kirchleiten Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: This is beautiful, herbaceous Sauvigon Blanc, the signature grape of Styria, in a fine, ripe version, all rich fruits, green apple juice, fresh berries and lively acidity. Glass stopper.
Name: Sattlerhof 2006 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This herbaceous, grassy, grapefruit-flavored wine bursts in the mouth with intensity. This is a fruit bomb, showing New World richness and concentration, very fresh and ripe. There are some tropical fruit elements, but more of green pear and apples.
Name: Neumeister 2006 Steierische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: A fine example of Styria's signature wine style, this Sauvignon Blanc has enticing herbaceous aromas followed by rich, full green plums, white currants and a layer of sweet, full acidity. Glass stopper.
Name: Winkler-Hermaden 2007 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südoststeiermark)

Description: An intriguing nose of lemon, orange and flowers leads on this balanced white from Romania. On the palate, poised, developed flavors of spice, citrus and a touch of honey end with a clean flourish. An elegant solo sip or great with seafood and spicy dishes.
Name: VinArte 2004 Alb de Vânju Mare Sauvignon Blanc (Vânju Mare)

Description: Waxy, round aromas are soft and properly indicate that this wine is already turning south. The palate lacks that certain Sauvignon Blanc edge but it does offer true flavors of melon, mango and orange. Full but fleshy.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2007 Synthesis Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Description: Pungent with true Sauvignon character. Tangerine, green fruits and grapefruit share the flavor profile, and the finish is mild but clean. Zesty, straightforward and tasty if served chilled.
Name: Finca El Portillo 2007 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: At $8, this is a great find, and has the exotic Bulgarian label to boot. The nose is all lemon zest and spice, and on the palate there is a lively, minerally punch with soft citrus flavors layered over it. A lovely summer sipping wine, best paired with seafood and salads.
Name: Targovishte 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Bulgaria)

Description: An easygoing, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc with minimal fanfare and a solid, herbal and grassy character. Overall, good fruit flavors and a clean finish. Pair with seafood or spicy curries for an extra kick.
Name: Taking Root 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Cahul)

Description: With fresh, grassy aromas and flavors and a subtle character on the palate, this friendly white is simple but enjoyable. Pair with grilled seafood or spicy Asian cuisine.
Name: VinArte 2005 Bonvino Domaine Terase Danubiane Sauvignon Blanc (Vânju Mare)

Description: Citrusy but also salinic, with mildly tart and lean lime and orange flavors. There's a touch of canned fruit character to the feel, with grapefruit on the finish. Juicy in the middle but limited.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2007 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

Description: There's a slightly eccentric nose to this Moldovan SB, with its baked vanilla and floral notes, and on the palate, the wine is a bit overwrought and grapy. But despite these hiccups, the wine offers overall refreshing citrus flavors and a nice spin of spice.
Name: Acorex 2004 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Moldova)

Description: The spicy, floral nose on this white is enticing enough, but on the palate, the flavors are a touch watery and flat. Clean and refreshing grass and citrus elements are there, but need a touch more muscle. Overall, though, a pleasant wine.
Name: VinArte 2005 Terase Danubiane Beluga Sauvignon Blanc (Vânju Mare)

Description: A Sauvignon Blanc with a Muscat aroma? That's the curious thing about this perfumed wine. It's pleasant, very fresh, perfumed like a candy shop, but has little to do with Sauvignon Blanc flavors. Screwcap.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: The aromas are sort of mealy and flat, and frankly the palate keeps that tune. There's pulpy white fruit and then a flat-lining finish that tastes of dried peach and melon.
Name: St. Lucas 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: The regular aromas and flavors of Sauvignon Blanc are here but faint—citrus, grass—and there's a stinky egg quality that overrides the whole. Earthy but odd, this wine may be a tough one to love, but it also has an interesting charm.
Name: Krauthaker 2005 Unfiltered Sauvignon Blanc (Kutjevo)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Modest on the nose, and then very little after that. The flavors are basic lime and citrus, and the feel is tangy and lemony sharp. Generic, with little to no varietal character.
Name: Bodegas Eguren 2007 Mercedes Eguren Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Yellow straw, oxidized, with dull and flat flavors showing hints of banana and dried apple.
Name: Silver Lake 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Nearly always one of New Zealand's top Sauvignons, this wine makes a big, bold statement. Aromas are herbal and leafy, with undertones of tomato and nettles, but buffered by gooseberries and minerality. It's rich and weighty on the palate, with a creamy texture that brings ripe stone fruit flavors to the fore. Long and mouthcoating on the finish.
Name: Villa Maria 2007 Clifford Bay Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
Cloudy Bay 2005 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Imported by Kobrand.
Name: Craggy Range 2007 Te Muna Road Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)
St. Lukes 2007 Spring Creek Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Citrus and tropical fruit notes are pure, powerful and provide a fine entry to the wine, which dances with melon, green tobacco, pineapple, honeydew and lime flavors. It's big and ripe, with prickly acidity and good complexity. A nice example of Casablanca Sauvignon Blanc with all the zest and ocean influences you should expect.
Name: Valdivieso 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
Villa Maria 2007 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Viu's first Sauvignon from coastal Leyda is more neutral than desirable. But as it opens you get tangy and fresh flavors of citrus, tropical fruit and grass. It's racy and lively, but the depth and complexity seem regular and not reflective of the reserve notation. Imported by Baystate Wine Co.
Name: Viu Manent 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

Description: Imported by JL Giguiere.
Name: Chasing Venus 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: True to the blueprint for good Chilean SB, this has aromas of passion fruit, grapefruit and lime. The flavor profile is led by orange and melon, and if you dig deeply you'll find green grass to offset the sweeter honeydew characteristics. Adequately intense and focused; solid as can be.
Name: MontGras 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Citrus and passion fruit are the main aromas, and the palate is purely tropical and citric, with zesty flavors and a very good mouthfeel. This is not an expensive or serious wine; it's meant to be chilled and killed, and along the way it offers true Sauvignon Blanc characteristics and pure, tasty flavors.
Name: Valdivieso 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Lean, dusty and generic on the nose, with tropical, slightly vegetal aromas. The palate is soft and tropical, with grassy flavors and a bit of blatant Southern Hemisphere thickness. Imported by Carolina Wine Brands USA, Inc.
Name: Santa Carolina 2007 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Clean but neutral, with decent lift, zest and body. The flavors run sweet to tropical, with pithy notes and a hint of green vegetables on the finish. Very basic and worthwhile, but regular in every sense of the word.
Name: Valle Frio 2007 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)
Spring Creek Estate 2007 The Jumper Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Dusty and sweet peach and apricot aromas lead to an innocuous, dilute palate that offers touches of melon, lemon and citrus. There's a bit of zest and acidity, but not a whole lot.
Name: Melania 2007 Certified Organic Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

Description: Crisp and flinty flavors with a luscious offering of fig and juicy citrus give this white a complex kick. On the tongue, it offers a rounder, fuller experience, but the finish is clean and dry. A stylish wine with a zippy backbone.
Name: Rietvallei Estate Wine 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)
