Description: The nose is like citrus candy and applesauce, but it doesn't sing or pop like it could. The mouth is easygoing, with melon and grapefruit, but there's also a bit of unwelcome green bean. This wine fails to excite. —M.S. .
Name: Morandé 2002 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Lightly fruity in the nose, yet sharp on the palate. For a reserve wine, it's noticeably thinner and more linear than the regular Sauvignon Blanc. The flavors are of green apple and underripe citrus, while the finish, as the palate suggests, is lean and fresh, but lightweight.
Name: Viña Casas del Bosque 2002 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The nose smells a bit like corn. The wine is round, soft and without much edge. The fruit seems a little pliable and ultimately it isn't all that structured. Finishes with a bit of banana.
Name: Calama 2002 Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Lean and angular in the nose, with grapefruit and pine aromas. The palate offers some grapefruit and citrus pith, and the finish is tangy, sharp and runs toward bitter. In addition, the mouthfeel is flat.
Name: Aresti 2001 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Rio Claro)

Description: Seemingly old, with heavy herbal and field-green aromas and a thick, heavy palate. It tastes like mature apples, and there's plenty of weight to it. A bit of honey sneaks onto the thick, grippy finish, while some healthy acidity keeps it ticking.
Name: Viña Casas del Bosque 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This estate wine is light and tastes a bit like white grapefruit. The palate runs heavy, and the finish tastes like a blend of grapefruit and celery.
Name: Errazuriz 2000 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A sharp white with thistle-like aromas as well as notes of white pepper and tarragon. The mouthfeel and weight are good, but the flavor profile struggles. It's dry and forceful, but there isn't much fruit or charm. A bland finish doesn't elevate the wine.
Name: Silver Lake 2001 Fumé Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The light and easy nose is misleading. At first some pear and flower aromas stir interest, but the palate disappoints. It's dilute, with just a touch of green apple. The finish has little to it as well, and as a whole the wine is watery.
Name: Snoqualmie 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With fresh pineapple and peach, some bread dough and a note of pine, this wine has all the right things going on aromatically. The feel on the palate is also right, due to good acids, while the flavors of pear, pineapple and apricot more than do the trick. —M.S.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2002 Sauvignon Blanc

Description: The broad aromas of apple and pineapple carry just a hint of green vegetables. The palate is pure Sauvignon Blanc in the New Zealand style, with pear, grapefruit and some bell pepper. The finish is long and zesty. —M.S.
Name: Bodega Norton 2002 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: Some apple is evident on the nose prior to flavors of lemon and green beans. The finish is warm, with a good feel to it. But it's quite heavy with green-bean notes, much like the palate. –M.S.
Name: Angaro 2002 Finca la Celia Sauvignon Blanc (Uco Valley)

Description: Light and lucid in the glass, with vegetal overtones on the nose and in the mouth. What little dry-apple fruit there is isn't allowed to show itself. The cucumber quality isn't helpful. —M.S.
Name: Kumkani 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all Sauv Blanc, all stainless steel-fermented fruit from the Willard and Gordon Brothers vineyards. It offers bracing grapefruit scents and flavors that make it a perfect oyster wine as we head into winter. Crisp and steely, the emphasis is on the racy, vivid fruit. Best Buy. —P.G.
Name: Caterina 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh scents mix melon, tangerine, citrus blossom and honey. The wine is smooth and sappy, with a good backbone of fresh acid. The fruit, though slightly candied, is quite satisfying, and despite the 14.3% alcohol, there is nothing overwrought here. 1,200 cases produced. —P.G.
Name: Di Stefano 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This single-vineyard wine comes from a southeast-facing vineyard planted in clay and limestone soils. This gives the wine a mineral character with powerful, peppery fruit and a touch of new wood spice to round it off.
Name: Manfred Tement 2001 Zieregg Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: The Wohlmuths make classic Styrian Sauvignon Blanc, with a balance between ripe tropical fruit and crispness. You'll find herbs and spices, and just a touch of wood from the 25% new barriques.
Name: Wohlmuth 2001 Summus Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: A simple, tank-fermented Sauvignon Blanc with crisp, grassy fruit and herbaceous aromas. The flavor is ripe fruit, structured with a layer of tannin and grassiness. Gooseberries and tropical fruit vie for attention on the finish.
Name: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2001 Classik Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: A tangy, palate-cleansing Sauvignon Blanc if ever there was one, this wine has a grapefruit, green herb and mineral core. It's as fresh and lively as if it were bottled yesterday. 15,000 cases produced.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2002 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Aromas of quince and a palate of sweet, toffee flavors make this a rich wine, with flavors of fig jelly. But it is unbalanced due to its almost total lack of acidity.
Name: Helmut Lang 2000 Beerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Neusiedlersee)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first release from an important new boutique winery. Consulting winemaker Mike Januik was Ste. Michelle's white wine guru for many years; he now runs his own winery. The grapes, from Red Mountain's top site, are superb. A hint of sweetness makes this mouthfilling, fragrant, fruit-loaded wine immensely appealing.
Name: Novelty Hill 2000 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright, spicy fruit is handsomely underscored with sweet new oak. This is flat-out classy winemaking, with food-friendly acids and the wine's citrus/melon fruit playing well against the toasty oak.
Name: Chinook 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Waterbrook makes a  lovely, lighthearted, citrus- and melon-flavored Sauv Blanc. Crisp and elegant, it manages to be flavorful without being overpowering; it's a delightful summer sipping wine that will add zip to almost anything you serve it with.
Name: Waterbrook 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The winery's penchant for delicate, lightly balanced wines is again evident here. This has some pleasant herb flavors, gentle nuances of grass and citrus. Cleanly made and finished with a touch of spice. —P.G.
Name: Ste. Chapelle 2000 Fumé Blanc (Idaho)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sauvignon Blanc has long been the winery's calling card, but this vintage isn't quite up to past standards. Some high-toned scents add edginess to the tropical fruit, and some bitter skin flavors are borderline too much. Good, but they can do better.
Name: Arbor Crest 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: No visible vintage date on the bottle, but the winery says it's a 2001. Tart and lemony, with crisp acids, it tends toward bland, with simple, green apple fruit.
Name: Gordon Brothers 2001 Katie's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Good fruit, sourced from an excellent Red Mountain vineyard, starts things off right. The fresh nose is scented with hay, herb and sweet grass, and leads into a lovely wine with 25% barrel fermented semillon blended in for extra pizzazz. Best Buy.
Name: Camaraderie Cellars 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made in a crisp, clean style, this lovely wine mixes ripe, round fruit with firm acids. Balanced and brisk, there is a spicy elegance that carries into the lingering finish, with just the merest hint of sweetness.
Name: Caterina 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a straightforward, fruity style of sauvignon blanc, with juicy, citrus flavors dominant. Tart and refreshing, simple and clean.
Name: Washington Hills 2000 Fumé Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Some barrel fermentation (30%) has added a lightly toasty element to this bone dry wine. It shows simple flavors of melon and citrus, along with residual yeastiness.
Name: Bridgman 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: Kicks off with passion fruit and citrus aromas, later to reveal a riveting core of bright lemon, lime, melon, fig and green apple flavors. Sleek and round-textured, the wine is refreshing to the finish. —J.M.
Name: Girard 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: That the aromas are sweet and perfumed is unconventional, given that South African SBs tend to be on the sharper side. In the mouth, lime and peach flavors are solid until the finish. Detracting from the overall package, however, is a somewhat flat-feeling palate. —M.S.
Name: Morgenhof 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Here's a big, burly-full style SB (14% alcohol) that offers plenty of citrus rind, apple and lemon character as well as some starching dryness on the palate. Unfortunately, it never delivers much sweetness; it's more about dried fruits (apricots and apples). —M.S.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: Powerful and steely best describe the nose, and the palate is equally racy and intense. But sheer zest doesn't make up for the fact the fruit is lean and distant. No matter how hard you dig, there's only some lean green apple prior to a short, clean, tight finish. —M.S.
Name: Neil Ellis 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Groenekloof)

Description: Tropical fruit makes up the nose, with hints of mint and honey poking through. The body is more full than lean, with light lemon flavors mixing into the richer fig element. Apple dominates the finish. —M.S.
Name: Simonsig 2001 Estate Wine Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Light in color, almost translucent. There's just a touch of grapefruit in the otherwise mute nose. In the mouth, the weight is nice, as is the acidity. If you search hard, some grapefruit and apple flavors emerge, but also some asparagus. It finishes clean enough.  ––M.S.
Name: Hagafen 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: There's a touch of field greens on the nose, but beyond that there is little else to latch on to in this insipid white. Some citrus rind and a touch of sugar give the palate what personality it has. This will be at its most refreshing if served well chilled, because it's quite heavy on the finish. ––M.S.
Name: Baron Herzog 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Taking complexity a step further than the fruit-drivens Sauvignon Blanc, this oak-aged pretty boy conjures thoughts of Pouilly-Fumé on a good day. Pungent green apple persists from the opening sip to the finish, which offers lemon and lime and a soft closing sensation. It has much in common with Loire Valley whites. Best Buy.
Name: Montes 2001 Reserve Fumé Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: The purity and power of the grapefruit and passion fruit aromas are uncharacteristically strong for a wine of this price. Vital acids drive the pineapple and passion fruit flavors across the lively palate. The tropical blast ends in a smooth, long finish. Who knew Chile could produce inexpensive Sauvignon Blanc like this? Best Buy.
Name: Montes 2001 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: With a no-oak wine like this it's all about the expression of fruit: bright green apple, pineapple and lemon. Lip-smacking acids carry everything to a fine finale. If you like tasty, zippy Sauvignon Blanc that's full of pop, look no further.
Name: Concha y Toro 2001 Terrunyo Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This is Viu's high-production wine (15,000 cases), yet it has the qualities of something made on a smaller scale. It's very grapefruity, with passion-fruit subtleties. The palate is crisp and clean, and there's a sweetness to the finish that balances the pungency of the fruit.
Name: Viu Manent 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Peach, passion fruit and a little cream make up the ultrapleasant bouquet. Full citrus and tropical fruit flavors in the mouth make it easy to quaff. Delicious as an apéritif, and easy on the wallet. Best Buy.
Name: MontGras 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Grapefruit aromas lead the fruit parade on this exceedingly refreshing white. Easy to drink and tasty, with just enough zip to keep you on your toes. Notes of banana and papaya add sweetness to the citrus.
Name: Caliterra 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

Description: Lots of lemon and pineapple at first, and even a touch of soda-like spritz. Piercing grapefruit flavors and citrus-inspiring acids leave notes of tangerine and orange on the clean finish. Best Buy.
Name: Undurraga 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Lontué Valley)

Description: Round and full in the nose, with a heavy aromatic emphasis on grapefruit. Soft lemon and other citrus fruits show up on the palate. For Sauvignon Blanc, the mouth is rather heavy and creamy; the finish seems mildly warm.
Name: Santa Rita 2001 Medalla Real Special Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Rapel Valley)

Description: Bright gooseberry aromas are accompanied by hints of pear, melon and anise. It's pleasant and easy to drink, with a lemony tang that brings a touch of bitterness to the finish. —J.C.
Name: Erich & Walter Polz 2000 Steirische Klassik Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

Description: This white is partially barrel fermented, and that woodiness and the related round texture sit heavy on the citrus fruit. Grapefruit is most forward, with orange and lemon in the backdrop. Use it as a quaff with hors d'oeuvres.
Name: Miguel Torres 2000 Copihue Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: A piercing grapefruit aroma, the hallmark of Casablanca Sauvignon Blanc, is strong here, and there's a certain stony peachiness and some passion fruit as well. There's also a touch of green pepper and asparagus at the flavor core, and then some vanilla at the end. If that sounds like a lot to ponder, it is—probably too much, given the wine.
Name: Lapostolle 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Despite a rush of pungent herbaceousness and cat pee, the flavors are sweetly fruity and low in acid. Rich and a bit heavy. —J.C.
Name: Wohlmuth 2000 Summus Sauvignon Blanc (South Styria)

Description: Smells like Sauvignon Blanc, with characteristic pink grapefruit, gooseberry and passion fruit aromas. Just lacks a little zip on the palate, where the medium-weight, low-acid flavors don't quite carry through.
Name: La Playa 2000 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another beautiful rendering of succulent Sauvignon Blanc from this premier vineyard, offering fresh, ripe fruit, scents of grapefruit, citrus peel, melon and lemon wax. There's a nice, spicy lift to the palate, though thefinish is not quite as rich and extended as the incredible '99.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2000 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A decent stand-in for New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, this medium-weight wine has some cat-pee aromas mixed with celery and grapefruit. The passion-fruit flavors finish long and tangy.
Name: Nepenthe 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Starts off almost sweet-smelling, blending passion-fruit and strawberry or currant aromas, then it turns very green-peppery on the palate before finishing with decent acidity.
Name: Lindemans 2000 Bin 95 Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)

Description: Seems a bit dull and watery at first, then develops some fennel and green-apple aromas with airing. Simple apple and anise flavors turn peppery on the finish.
Name: Hamelin Bay 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a lovely bottle, with clean, crisp fruit providing the backbone. Complex flavors of melon, fig and sweetpea, just the right hint of grassiness, and some good, toasty vanilla make for a full-flavored, satisfying bottle.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2000 Fumé Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Gooseberry and white-pepper aromas are followed by a bold, clean palate that is so racy it's like taking a drink of cold mountain spring water.  Lime and green melon shift in and out in layers.  The finish is lean and long, driven by vital acidity.  An idal aperitif wine.
Name: Tohu 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hogue pulls together a well-balanced, zesty wine with definite herbal nuances and stainless steel styling. It's crisp and precise, sleek and tart, a perfect wine to serve chilled with fresh winter oysters.
Name: Hogue 2000 Fumé Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the last vintage that Waterbrook will bottle a Sauvignon Blanc, becasue the fruit from this Washington vineyard is in such demand that a budget-priced bottling is no longer possible.  So grab this fresh, succulentvivid and bracing wine by the case and enjoy each every sip.  you may not see its like for another millenium.
Name: Waterbrook 2000 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Light whiffs of melon with stronger hints of celery and green pepper. Sweet and tart, tasting of lemon-lime and green apples. An appetizer wine that could work with seafood. Very acidic.
Name: Bodega Norton 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Horse Heaven vineyard has been producing exceptional Sauvignon Blancs for the past decade. In this unusual vintage, which started very cool and lasted through an extended, late harvest, the grapes ripened to perfection. Ripe, lush fruit gets some added creaminess from barrel fermentation and aging sur lie. There are scents of lime, citrus peel, wet stone and spice, leading to a wonderfully full, focused panoply of flavors in the mouth. The finish goes on forever. Best Buy.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 1999 Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Future vintages of this wine will bear the new Red Mountain appellation, for that is where Klipsun is located. Waterbrook does the grapes proud: This is a juicy, ripe white wine bursting with scents and flavors of fresh fruits, cut grass, light spice and even some toasted coconut in the extended finish. Best Buy.
Name: Waterbrook 1999 Klipsun Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This attractively priced Sauvignon Blanc begins with lovely scents of fig, melon and green berry. There are some high tones too, and the sharpness of alcohol in this ultra-ripe vintage. New winemaker Kristina van Loben Sels extracts ripe, tropical fruit flavors without sacrificing complexity. The wine really delivers a lot of luscious flavor for the price. Best Buy.
Name: Arbor Crest 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: All Sauvignon Blanc, and it shows in aromas of gooseberries, passion fruit and chili peppers. This intensely sweet and honeyed wine also blends in an array of apricot-botrytis flavors. This is a wine that tastes great now and should also age gracefully.
Name: Isabel Estate 1999 Noble Sauvage Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Steer clear of this one if you like your Sauvignons done in stainless. This one is 100% barrel fermented, yielding some toasty, smoky aromas that blend well with the forceful tropical fruit flavors. There's guava and pineapple, smoke and menthol on the long finish.
Name: Sacred Hill 1998 Sauvage Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: A nice counterpoint to Selaks' Drylands bottling, this one is aged in oak, giving it a creamy texture and toast accents. The melony fruit carries through the lingering finish, accented by subtle herb notes.
Name: Selaks 1998 Founders Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This comes from older vines than Selaks' regular bottling, and it shows in the wine's greater intensity. Peach and melon flavors caress the palate, and a bright zing of jalapeño keeps the finish lively and focused.
Name: Selaks 2000 Drylands Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The wine that made Marlborough famous continues to impress, vintage after vintage. Ripe gooseberries and a hint of grapefruit flow through the broad midpalate into a long, lime-tinged finish. Rich enough to pair with sauced fish dishes, yet bright enough to go with simpler preparations as well. Editors' Choice.
Name: Cloudy Bay 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Almost seems creamy, perhaps because half of the juice was fermented in neutral barrels. Grapefruits, green plums and a pinch of black pepper lead into a long, broad finish.
Name: Vavasour 1999 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

Description: A rich, lush blend of tropical and stone fruits, partially barrel-fermented to add a creamy texture and subtle spice notes. Seductive and supple in the mouth but with a solid backbone of acidity that keeps it from turning soft or mushy.
Name: Matariki 1999 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Steer clear of this one if you like your Sauvignons done in stainless. This one is 100% barrel fermented, yielding some toasty, smoky aromas that blend well with the forceful tropical fruit flavors. There's guava and pineapple, smoke and menthol on the long finish.
Name: Coopers Creek 1999 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pungent aromas of grapefruit and gooseberries lead into a wine that shows good richness in the mouth—it's almost creamy. Finishes long, with grapefruit and mint overtones.
Name: Goldwater 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This perennial favorite is a hit again. There's all the ingredients you expect in Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc: intense green herbs, tropical fruit, and a long, crisp finish.
Name: Palliser Estate 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Shows a lot of citrusy fruit flavors—grapefruit and oranges—and passion fruit as well. Slightly creamy on the midpalate, before finishing with a faint herbal edge and strong lime-like acidity.
Name: Isabel Estate 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Whether you like this wine or not will depend largely on how oak-tolerant you are—it's 100% barrel fermented and shows plenty of smoky, nutty nuances. It's also markedly creamy, with rich fruit flavors that lean toward white peach, melon and fig. The long, layered finish has enough acidity to carry the weight and oak.
Name: Te Awa Farm 2000 Frontier Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Intense gooseberry and green-pea aromas and flavors are balanced by weighty stone fruits (white peaches and nectarines, green plums). Riper and less herbal than most Marlborough SBs.
Name: Villa Maria 2000 Clifford Bay Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The restrained nose shows little in the way of herbal or grassy aromas, instead offering up melon and passion fruit. Full-bodied and intense, with a long citric finish that would make a perfect partner for a bowl of moules.
Name: Vavasour 1999 Awatere Valley Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a full, rich bottling, with few of the green notes found in so many Kiwi Sauvignon Blancs. Grapefruit and passion-fruit flavors coat the mouth in a creamy wave.
Name: Nobilo 1999 Icon Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Young and tight, this wine needs a few months to unwind. Still, you can taste the quality, from a delicate herbal note to the green-pea flavors and long, tart, lime-and-herb-accented finish.
Name: Brancott 2000 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: From a region better known for Burgundian varieties, this Sauvignon Blanc has turned out well. Passion fruit, peaches and gooseberries flow across the palate, which features a bit of creaminess. A hint of capsicum (green pepper) intensifies on the finish.
Name: Nga Waka 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: Representative Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc: melon, grapefruit and passion fruit in abundance, followed by a finish that's marked by green herbs and bell pepper.
Name: Nobilo 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Toasty aromas mingle with vanilla and cream on the nose before giving way on the palate to melons and a strong fig component, possibly from the 15% Sémillon that's been blended in. A ripe, barrel-marked style.
Name: Matua Valley 1999 Matheson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Despite the fact that Otago isn't known as Sauvignon Blanc country, winemaker Matt Dicey has bottled a lean, racy Sauvignon that's herbaceous, not vegetal. Some melon-like fruit provides the flesh, and lime-like acidity keeps it fresh and lively.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Otago)

Description: Pungent; filled with boxwood and gooseberry aromas, this is a character-filled wine that's not for the faint-hearted. The mouthfeel is ripe and weighty, nicely balanced by a tart, bitter-grapefruit-pith finish that lingers enticingly on the tongue.
Name: Fairhall Downs 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A crisp, refreshing drink that shows typical N.Z. Sauvignon character—gooseberries, grapefruit, green pepper—without tasting aggressively green or underripe. The tart acids on the finish would make this pair nicely with steamed mussels and the like. Best Buy.
Name: Selaks 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Strong grassiness is nicely offset by flavors of peaches and tropical fruits in this offering from UC Davis-trained Alwyn Corban. Finishes with juicy grapefruit, jalapeño pepper and spicy herbs, giving it a little extra kick.
Name: Glazebrook 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Avoids the overtly herbal-vegetal aspects of Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc, instead opting for deep passion-fruit and nectarine flavors. Turns just a bit green on the finish, with a welcome hint of jalapeño.
Name: Matariki 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: The proprietor—you guessed it, Allan Scott—doesn't like herbaceousness in Sauvignon Blanc and you can tell from the ripeness and lack of green flavors in his wine. Instead, there's mild grapefruit coupled with melon and passion fruit.
Name: Allan Scott 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Hints of mint on the nose give added nuance to this unusual, almost honeyed-tasting Sauvignon Blanc. Oranges and vanilla-cream are complemented by toast notes from aging in French oak.
Name: Brancott 1998 Brancott Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: On-the-lees aging accounts for the added richness of this bottling. It's quite unyielding at first, then opens up slowly to reveal green peas and stone fruits accented by just a hint of chili pepper.
Name: Villa Maria 2000 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tight on the nose, not showing much except for aggressive jalapeño and herb. Intense and structured; winemaker David Pearce believes this wine will last up to eight years.
Name: Grove Mill 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A soft, gentle style of Sauvignon Blanc, with gooseberry and nectarine fruit that seems almost creamy across the palate. Approximately 25% went through malolactic fermentation to smooth out the edges, and the result is a plush, creamy wine quite different from most N.Z. Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Kim Crawford 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fresh and light; the grapefruit and gooseberry aromas and flavors are tinged with capsicum and green peas. The residual sugar is noticeable, at 6–7 g/L, but balanced by brisk acidity.
Name: House of Nobilo 2000 Fall Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Fresh and light; the grapefruit and gooseberry aromas and flavors are tinged with capsicum and green peas. The residual sugar is noticeable, at 6-7 g/L, but balanced by brisk acidity.
Name: Nobilo 2000 Fall Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A softer, gentler Marlborough Savvy, with warm melon and passion fruit accented by only a touch of gooseberry. Pink grapefruit flavors accent the finish.
Name: Omaka Springs 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Sweet peas and gooseberries put a subtle mark on this full, soft wine that's only mildly herbaceous. The residual sugar is just at the threshold of perceptibility, imparting greater weight without making the wine taste sweet.
Name: Villa Maria 2000 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough & Hawkes Bay)

Description: Martinborough isn't known for Sauvignon Blanc, but this is a solid example. A complex nose of melon, passion fruit, green pea and bitter green herbs turns crisp and bright in the mouth, with sweet-pea and mint flavors.
Name: Te Kairanga 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This “Savvy” boasts textbook aromas of passion fruit, gooseberries, green peas and even a touch of mint. Supple and almost soft on the palate, it doesn't quite have the zing you expect but still manages to satisfy.
Name: Cairnbrae 1999 The Stones Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Asparagus and green-herb aromas run smoothly into grapefruit, passion-fruit and sweet green-pea flavors. More citrus fruits emerge on the tart, cleansing finish.
Name: Wairau River 1998 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Asparagus and green-herb aromas run smoothly into grapefruit, passion-fruit and sweet green-pea flavors. More citrus fruits emerge on the tart, cleansing finish.
Name: Wairau River 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Provides a good jolt of pungent and aggressively green aromas (boxwood) balanced by sweet gooseberries and passion fruit. Representative of the “New Zealand” style of Sauvignon Blanc, this is a perfect introduction to the genre for new consumers.
Name: Brancott 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Tart and crisp, this is a fairly “green” version, boasting plenty of gooseberry and jalapeño-pepper aromas and flavors. Residual sugar is just below the typical detection threshold of 5g/L; there's enough to add weight without making the wine seem sweet.
Name: Coopers Creek 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: A mainstream, commercial style that blends green peppers and green peas with a sweet midpalate. Not overly aggressive or pungent, just a soft, lightly sweet sipper.
Name: Giesen 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Smells ripe, with melon and passion fruit predominating, but by the finish Marlborough's trademark green-pepper and grapefruit flavors come on strong—maybe too assertively for some tasters. Crisp and dry; a good palate refresher.
Name: Jackson Estate 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Warmer weather in Hawkes Bay means this wine shows less of the aggressively pungent grapefruit and herb aromas of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. This is a soft, creamy, very approachable wine that finishes with just a hint of grapefruit.
Name: Matua Valley 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Grapefruit and melon are the predominant aromas and flavors, with a few sprigs of minty green herbs tossed over the top. Finishes with a bitter pith note that seems a little out of place in this otherwise harmonious offering.
Name: Te Awa Farm 2000 Longlands Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: The Corbans house style seems to de-emphasizes the ultrapungent elements of Sauvignon Blanc, focusing instead on grapefruit and, in this case, white nectarine. It's a delicate wine that goes down easy.
Name: Corbans 1999 Winemaker's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Weighty and extracted, this Sauvignon Blanc is atypically rich and low-acid. Grapefruit, gooseberry and honey flavors are finished off with a hint of bitter pith.
Name: Pegasus Bay 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

Description: This wine pretty much typifies what people mean when they talk about “New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc.” There's a grassy, herbaceous and green-pea edge to the lime and tropical- fruit flavors.
Name: Sacred Hill 2000 Whitecliff Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: A distinctive wine that features prominent aromas of sweet red peppers allied to round passion-fruit flavors. Seems a bit heavy on the palate, and doesn't finish as crisply as you'd expect from an N.Z. Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Lynskeys Wairau Peaks 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Initial aromas of boxwood give way to melon, cream and grapefruit. In the mouth, this offering is mellow and a bit sweet. A soft and easy drinker for folks new to Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Forefathers 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Pleasant enough, but the lime and grapefruit flavors are a bit dilute. Lacks intensity overall; well chilled, the mild flavors would make a nice counterpoint to strongly flavored foods.
Name: Corbans 1999 Winemaker's Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: Almost too subtle and understated, this wine's faint melon and grapefruit aromas and flavors are tinged with honey, giving a sweet-sour impression on the palate.
Name: Mills Reef 2000 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: I'll fess up—I really don't like asparagus aromas in my wine, which accounts for this wine's low score. That aside, there are some decent grapefruit and gooseberry flavors in there, and the finish is crisp and clean.
Name: Nautilus 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Picked quite ripe, the resulting wine features mainly melon and fig aromas and flavors, with very little grassiness in evidence.  Crisp acidity on the finish provides the vivacity needed to pair with oysters or clams.
Name: Castello di Borghese 1999 Hargrave Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Picked quite ripe, the resulting wine features mainly melon and fig aromas and flavors, with very little grassiness in evidence. Crisp acidity on the finish provides the vivacity needed to pair with oysters or clams.
Name: Hargrave 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Only slightly grassy and with strong lemony overtones to the fruit, this near-colorless white is as crisp and refreshing as a sea breeze. Would be perfect with the local oysters or clams on the half-shell.
Name: Macari 1999 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Partial barrel-fermentation shows in this wine's hints of vanilla and cream, which marry smoothly with grapefruit and melon fruit. The grapefruit shades toward pink, particularly on the pleasantly crisp finish.
Name: Concha y Toro 1999 Terrunyo Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Bright grapefruit and gooseberry aromas flesh out admirably in the mouth, with tart apple and citrus flavors moving to the fore. Finishes clean and crisp—a perfect partner for shellfish or fresh chèvre.
Name: Miguel Torres 2000 Santa Digna Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

Description: Right away it strikes a fairly harmonious chord—it's fresh smelling, with good weight in the mouth. Nice lemon and grapefruit flavors carry a pithy edge, and there's plenty of length to the finish. The steely backpalate is where you get the acidity. As a whole, it's food-friendly and it shouldn't disappoint.
Name: La Poussie 1998  Sancerre

Description: Now this is NZ Sauvignon Blanc. Classic gooseberry and grapefruit aromas give way to zesty citrus fruit and a long grapefruity finish tinged with slightly bitter pith notes.
Name: Palliser Estate 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

Description: This one falls squarely into the white-grapefruit and lime category. Quite herbal, with an outright green streak in the midpalate. Good tropical-fruit core, and round. Easy to drink, not piercing, and a little metallic. There's a basil-oregano note to the finish.
Name: Tohu 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: The characteristic Sauvignon pungency of grapefruits and gooseberries has been smoothed over by barrel fermentation, resulting in a creamy, vanilla overlay that glides easily across the palate. Bright acidity shines through on the finish.
Name: Mills Reef 1999 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Ripe, verging on sweet, aromas of green apples and citrus show only a little of the gooseberry fragrance normally associated with Kiwi Sauvignons. Fairly round and soft in the mouth, it does have a hint of jalapeño on the finish that adds varietal spice.
Name: Riverside 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Grapefruit and peach aromas lead into orange and lemon-lime flavors. A basic café wine without much intensity or breadth, but a good mouthfeel. Herbal notes come through on the finish, which is mild and clean, if a little weak.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 1998  Sancerre

Description: Soft, herbal, melony notes on the nose. Lime flavors up front, and then it slides away in a somewhat disjointed, scattered fashion. The mouthfeel gets a jolt from bright acidity and a slate-like feel. Best as a by-the-glass bistro wine.
Name: Pascal Jolivet 1998  Pouilly-Fumé

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plenty of fruit right out of the starting gate, leaning to lime, lemon and orange blossom, with a solid core of tart, young pears. Lovely texture, with assertive, bracing acids. Perfect for a wide variety of seafood and summer salads. Best Buy.
Name: Columbia Crest 1998 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pretty green/gold. Smells of fresh hay and melon. Barrel fermentation gives a pleasing, toasty yeastiness to the wine, which packs a nice, citric punch. Finishes very dry.
Name: Hyatt 1998 Fumé Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The color is an odd, brownish gold, and the nose suggests overripe apples. A very dry, dusty style that speaks more of Sherry casks than fruit.
Name: Preston 1998 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: First things first: This is expensive Sauvignon Blanc. Having said that , it's not run-of-the-mill S.B. either. Very tight and grassy aromas., like you'd expect, but also a unique level of ripeness and weight in the mouth. Green-apple fruit an da bit of botryis character make it a connoisseur's wine as does the price.
Name: Gross 1998 Sauvignon Blanc (Styria)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Forward, fresh-scented Washington fruit. Citrus, cinnamon and spice play tag on the palate, with some extra richness imparted by barrel fermentation.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 1998 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A full, grapefruity wine that offers lots of power but not much nuance. Very forward, it presses its cause aggressively. By no means a sipper, it's still plenty  competent to wash down grilled chicken or pasta salad.
Name: Shooting Star 1998 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Sauvignon Blanc carries some tongue-puckering zip. It starts with the fruit-bowl approach: lots of melon, grapefruit and quince. Bordering on sharply acidic, but round and in fine enough shape. A cool-climate white similar to the good ones from New Zealand.
Name: Cain 1998 Ventana Vineyards Musque Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

Description: Sweet passionfruit and vaguely floral aromas give way to a medium-bodied, not overly sweet palate. A solid choice on its own or with light fruit desserts.
Name: Voss 1997 Botrytis Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This seems to be the varietal that's doing best in the El Niño vintage of 1998. With a kiss of oak, there is a lot of vibrant grapefruit flavor here. The aftertaste is oak-tinged and pleasant.
Name: Concha y Toro 1998 Casillero del Diablo Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

Description: The old-vines fruit in the blend really drives the character of this superb, stately wine. One of Napa's finest whites, and what a price for such quality. A buttery texture and overt grapefruit flavor vie for premier billing. Terrific and on a par with the Loire's best.
Name: Flora Springs 1997 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Rich, pleasant and easy to drink, there is some serious body to this barrel-fermented wine that features 20% Sémillon for additional heft. A touch sweet, this is about as chunky as S.B. gets, and it should please Chardonnay drinkers. Orange-blossom aromas lead into plump, ripe grapefruit and lychee flavors. Soft, but still sprightly.
Name: Morgan 1998 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: After a two-year sabbatical, this side of the Mondavi family is back in the Sauvignon Blanc business … and quite successfully. This is a well-defined, clean, lemony wine. Citrus flavors dominate, and there's a soft feel throughout from one-third barrel fermentation. A tasty bitter-almond flavor graces the finish.
Name: Charles Krug 1998 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Typically sauvignon in the nose. This confirms that the '99 whites will be very intense. Herbaceous and grassy as all get-out, this wine is pumped full of grapefruit and green-melon flavors, and is good enough chilled. But it lacks complexity.
Name: Canepa 1999 Sauvignon Blanc (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Textbook crisp Sancerre from an ancient Loire property. Very typically defined by lively citrus fruit and a combination of steeliness and flowers. A good bistro wine, perfect for a shellfish salad at the café. Sharp and refreshing when cold, it gets nutty and more hospitable at a warmer temperature. Overall a nice wine.
Name: Château de Sancerre 1997  Sancerre

Description: Intense coconut and lime aromas jump from the glass. Smoke, too. Full-bodied, with lots of melon and fig flavors. There's lots going on here, all wrapped up in creamy, smoky, coconutty French oak. Give it a few months to integrate and then sit back and enjoy one of the most unique U.S. renditions of Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Robert Mondavi 1997 To-Kalon Vineyard I Block Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Once again this winery scores with a flavor-packed, fun wine that could only be made in Washington. Mounds and mounds of zingy fruit distinguish this wine from other Sauvignon Blancs from around the world, which are often grassy and lean. It borders on being over-the-top, but keeps that perfect bracing acidity. All in all it is delicious and easy to drink. Best Buy.
Name: Covey Run 1997 Fumé Blanc (Washington)

Description: Grapefruit and fresh peach on a lean, acidic structure. Plenty of clean personality to match with appetizers or chèvre. Would go well with shellfish. Solid if not spectacular. Picks up focus and additional character with time in the glass.
Name: Brampton 1997 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: With 7% Sémillon, shows pretty melon, fig and grapefruit notes. Very extracted and rather on the sweet side, but crisp and stylish. Widely available and affordable.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 1997 Vintner's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Extremely dry. Strong Sauvignon Blanc character in the nose. Short on tropical fruit and pineapple and long on gooseberries. Very lean with blazing acidity. A kiss of oak. Not a sipping wine, this one calls out for food.
Name: Robert Mondavi 1997 Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)
